review: We booked to stay at this hotel via a travel agent, who told us it had a flat entrance and a lift, She failed to mention the steps (about 8) to actually get to the lift. The hotel staff were very efficient, friendly and helpful, and let Me use the phone to try to sort out the mistake. Another hotel couldn't be found nearby, so We ended up staying.It is a lovely Hotel and so convenient for the Museums etc, The room We had was a 3 bedded room, large and roomy, with comfy beds and the most comfortable pillow I have ever laid My head on, smart shower room and quality toiletries. We got a complementary welcome drink voucher for the bar.
title: Lovely Hotel *Not wheelchair accessible*

review: We stayed for 3 nights, had 2 rooms booked. Staff are friendly and helpful. Our check-in person was very very good (knowledgable, efficient, friendly) Room sizes were OK. Of the 2 rooms, one had a very small (short) shower. If over 5'2'' you would have a problem. Other room's air conditioning not working well (had an odor and thus we had to open up the windows. Thankfully it was cool during our stay). Location is close to 'center Amsterdam', but away enough to be quiet and more residential. Close by bakery was great for breakfast (Simon something). Albert Heijn market close by as well for snacks etc.We found a wonderful laundrymat nearby (Powders Laundrette). They have self service machines and will also do your laundry for a very reasonable price. First time I have ever had my laundry done by someone else while traveling, and it was marvelous and well worth it!
title: Quiet, near trams

review: Very nice quite hotel located close enough to dam and various other sights very clean definately will be back again the staff very helpful definately will recommend this nice tidy hotel for travellers for a quite stay
title: Very nice quite clean hotel

review: We stayed here for 4 nights and weren't disappointed. There was nothing we could fault about this hotel.We arrived right in the middle of the Gay Pride parade (unaware it was on) and I was a little worried, however the mercure is tucked away and was very safe and quiet. Breakfast was included which was awesome. Normally free breakfast is just continental however was pleasantly surprised to see eggs, bacon and sausage too!! You won't be disappointed as there was plenty of breakfast options.We hired bikes here which cost about 18€ a day, was convienent for us.Decent sized rooms and bathroom, plenty of space for our luggage too. Beds are comfy. Good location - 5min walk to the Heineken experience and maybe 10mins to mussuems. 20mins to the centre. Staff were really friendly and all spoke English, which was very helpful for us.Would definitely stay here again :)
title: Great Hotel

review: This hotel is not on a main road. It is located in what appears to be a residential area close to schools and cafes. It is also close to the tram heading into central station (though the tram stops were a bit of a walk when we were were there due to road works on the main road).While this is called a "Mercure" to me it was more like an "Ibis" in Australia including the size and layout of rooms and casual reception. Unfortunately the price we paid was not an Ibis price....While the room was clean, the rooms and bathrooms were very small. The free internet was very slow (much slower than standard Accor free wifi)I am Gold Accor Plus member however the receptionist was not interested in my card. I assume that I will have to follow up and make sure my points are allocated.The reception was also very little help when I asked for a boarding pass to be printed (I often just email the boarding pass to hotel reception and have never had a hotel say no - until now). I was told that I had to come down and print it myself, which meant that it took 15 minutes rather than 1 (it seems the computer in the lobby is purely for data collection purposes as you need to enter names and emails etc. just to print out a boarding pass). The hotel restaurant also tried to charge my son €5 for a small cup of ice (about 8 cubes) that fortunately when we checked out the receptionist said we didn't have to pay).NOTE re mobility: There is no lift accessible on entrance level (it is either about 8 stairs stairs up or 8 stairs down to access the lift).Environmental watch: Despite environmental cards in the bathroom alerting you to save water, our towels that were hung up each day as requested, were replaced two of the three days of our stay. There also did not appear to be any means of recycling paper and plastic. The snap off / screw on lids in the toiletries did not work very well meaning that the bottles were hard to reseal. p.s. The Accor Map was appreciated however at least 6 of the marked tram stops were in different locations than what was marked.
title: Well located hotel if you plan to explore central Amsterdam but want to avoid the red light and central station areas.

hotelLocation: Raadhuis Straat 51, 1016 DD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location, quaint bedroom with nice relaxing breakfast. Friendly staff through the stay. Rooms very clean. The room did not have air conditioning but with the windows open and room stayed comfortable. Would recommend this place to stay.
title: Great place to stay

hotelLocation: Raadhuis Straat 51, 1016 DD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel Nadia is in an excellent location very close to all the history and sites of Amsterdam. The room was clean and plain with an incredible view of the canal and Westkirk. The staff was so nice, even helping with our laundry for a small extra fee--and after two weeks traveling Europe I was so grateful. Don't miss the charming breakfast room and great breakfast. One note: Very steep stairs up to the lobby and rooms are not for everyone, but they did bring our luggage up and down the stairs for us, which was very nice. We would stay there again in a heartbeat.https://www.tripadvisor.com/ShowUserReviews-g188590-d232493-r35505380-Hotel_Nadia-Amsterdam_North_Holland_Province.html#
title: Lovely stay in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Raadhuis Straat 51, 1016 DD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here July 2017. We paid for a standard room and were upgraded to one with a view over the canal. The room was very clean and small (which we expected) but had plenty of well designed storage and shelves etc. The windows opened but the location is quite noisy at night. There was no air conditioning but a good sized fan was provided as standard.The hotel oozes a local character.The staff were always very helpful, knowledgeable and friendly. As many point out the stairs on entering from the street up to the reception and rooms are a sight to behold (steep, curved and narrow with short steps - oxygen is not provided). The staff at the hotel ALWAYS offer to carry everyone's bags from street level to room and back out if you want them to - so the stairs are not really a major issue. The only problem would be if you can't physically cope with difficult stairs.Breakfast was 'basic continental' but always kept well stocked as people came and went.The location is perfect for a city centre stay. It is within easy walking distance (20-30 minutes max) of all the city centre attractions. There are many very nice bars and restaurants within a short walk.If you want a basic reasonably priced city centre hotel with 'oodles' of local character and can climb steep stairs this should be on your list! We have no hesitation in recommending it.
title: Perfect location for city centre stay

hotelLocation: Raadhuis Straat 51, 1016 DD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here 7/17/17. My wife and I booked a standard room for 1 night. It was the middle of the week and they upgraded us to a balcony room. We probably would have booked this room had we been there more than one night. It was amazing, if a little small. The balcony was nice, had a great view of the canal, and allowed us a nice cool place to people watch. There were a few quirks here. When you leave, you leave your key with the front desk and pick it up when you get back. I assume this is so you don't lose the physical key while visiting the city (smart). The stairs to the rooms are a bit steep and narrow. I'm a big guy (6'4) and still made it just fine, even loaded with bags. The bed was comfortable, but not overly lavish.Overall, we loved it. The staff were nice and friendly and spoke perfect English (as do many many people here). The location was close enough to everything we wanted to see so we could walk everywhere. I would highly recommend this hotel and would love to return if we ever make it back to Amsterdam.
title: Amazing location, lovely room

hotelLocation: Raadhuis Straat 51, 1016 DD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is a very small hotel. Staff are very friendly.But you have to be quite fit to go up all the stairs with your luggage. I also missed breakfast as I was 5 mins too late.The room was small but clean and the balcony was nice.The hotel is in a very good location.
title: Overnight stay.

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel has it all. It is historic yet modern. It is beautiful in design and has artwork worthy of a museum. The staff is friendly and attentive but not intrusive. We discovered no major flaws in the hotel operation. The front desk and the rest of the staff were great. The restaurants and lounge were wonderful, with superb food and great service WE would not hesitate to stay at The Grand on future visits to Amsterdam.
title: Magnificent hotel

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Our expected view of the canal was more a glimpse but as the staff had been so helpful in getting us into our suite really early I did not mind. The room was beautifully appointed and furnished. We found ourselves sleeping much longer than usual due to a combination of the peace and quiet of the hotel, the blackout curtains and the superbly comfortable bed. Service was exceptional from all staff members, particularly Paul, Thomas and Margeurite. Breakfast offers a wide selection.This is an historic hotel and its location is superb, as we could walk to most attractions. Amsterdam in summer is very crowded and busy but all this disappears as you turn off the street to the haven of the courtyard and the hotel buildings.
title: Calm refuge in the midst of busyness.

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: 25 minutes for checking !!!No respect of Platinum member profit !!Room dirty and old Bathroom of 2 SM2 !!!!!And all of that for 400 eur !!! But the most terrible part is this hotel are not clean !!Will not come back
title: Terrible

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The location is close to everything. The service was excellent. Everyone was friendly and extremely helpful. The breakfast was great, full breakfast with a huge selection, they'll make anything you request. Our room was five stars, amazing. One of the best rooms we've ever stayed in, and we travel a lot. I would highly recommend this hotel.We also took the tour of the hotel and learned a lot about the history of the hotel.
title: Amazing Hotel in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We loved our large room with wonderfully comfortable bed with 100% cotton sheets and a nice canal view. The Front staff, bellmen, concierge, desk, at this hotel is wonderful and very well trained. The Restaurant staff needs a lot of work and training, there seemed to be no training or supervision at all when we were there, and it seemed the food was sent out of the kitchen without a chef checking it out. For example, three people at our table ordered the same dish and the inconsistency was remarkable but not in a good way. The location of this hotel is fantastic right in the heart of everything and so much fun walking or biking around any time of day or night. The pool and steam room were a nice treat during all our travels as well, it would have been even nicer had there been a spray bottle of eucalyptus in the steam room. Maybe next time. Hope to stay here again!
title: Love the location, the history, the rooms, the front staff, the pool & steam!

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Love this hotel! Staff is TOP NOTCH - professional and warm. Our room was amazing- love the big tub with a t.v. to watch (although t.v. didn't work great- who cares, the tub was divine). Great service, delicious European breakfast. My one complaint is the (less formal) dining room has so-so food. The waiters and waitresses are GREAT - but the food was so-so..... Although they are kind and accommodate special requests which I appreciated (special dietary needs and they have a low calorie option menu).
title: FANTASTIC!!!!

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is truly located almost dead center in Old Amsterdam. A 20 minute walk to the Anne Frank Museum, 30 minute walk to the Rijksmuseum. The breakfast buffet is one of the best I have dined in; the omelettes superb. The staff was the best it could be. The concierges were very friendly and quite helpful. The receptionists were also very friendly, pleasant and smiles. Smiles from all the staff really help. My thanks to the morning staff in the Bridges Restaurant for starting my day off right!
title: Great Hotel, Great Location

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I have never stayed at a hotel with friendlier staff, who were more eager to help. Especially the concierge staff - they were very patient, always with good advise. Very beautiful facility in walking distance from many destinations in central Amsterdam. We upgraded to have buffet/menu breakfast included, which was one of the best I can remember anywhere. Our bedroom had too many different lights - and light switches - to figure out, and my in-room coffee maker didn't seem to work right. But overall, because of the staff I give this place 5 stars without hesitation.
title: The wonderful staff earns this place 5 stars!

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Had a great stay at the Sofitel The Grand in Amsterdam. It's well located, a stone throw from Dam Square that is the heart of the city. Not far away from the central train station, Amsterdam Central, but if you're carrying a mid size piece of luggage it's advisable to take the tram or bus. The service is impeccable and the breakfast is the best I ever had. This hotel is highly recommended!
title: Great stay at Sofitel The Grand in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Reception: professional staff, warm welcome, welcome drink, accompaniment to the room.Room: clean, so confortable bed!!, huge tv, wifi in the room, turn down serviceBest breakfast ever! I barely saw such a variety and quality and healthy food on a hotel buffet breakfast. You also have a lot of choice a-la-carte included in the breakfast. Service is OK.
title: Luxury

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Best 5 Star hotel I have staid in many many years. The rooms are nice and modern. The ambience was welcoming, warm and professional. The biggest asset however is the staff. Starting from the night shift to the breakfast crew all the way to the bar tender. Everybody is extremely down to earth friendly, helpful and competent. The location is very central. Rent a bike from the hotel and explore the City. I can highly recommend this hotel.
title: Fantastic!!!

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Grand Sofitel is truly regal, very nicely maintained in that era that many of us cannot find anywhere other than in these preserved hotel buildings.The Classic Rooms are too tiny and do cause discomfort if used for double occupancy.Must mention the excellent service of Mr LUCA at the Bridges fine dinning restaurant.Very efficient Front Desk and Concierge.The tarnish is a public open defecating loo right outside the grand entrance of the hotel. The Council should remove it. It sends a stink all around that area and the excreta is sometimes visible from the street. It is a shame on the Amsterdam council for having left is unattended and open. It looks so very ugly.
title: Truly Grand with a bit tarnish on its elegant location

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I just returned home from an absolutely sensational stay. The staff were lovely, efficient, welcoming, and gracious. We were upgraded to a phenomenal suite, with butler service, plenty of space, and creative daily snacks. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the location was perfect. It was extremely close to the most well-known sites and within a very short walking distance from just about anywhere worth going in Amsterdam. The courtyard at the front entrance provides an area of tranquility, comfort, and security. I could not possibly recommend this hotel with greater enthusiasm and it is the only hotel that I would consider staying in at my next visit to Amsterdam.
title: The Only Hotel to Stay in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Well located, charming entrance, up scale service, canal view room well appointed but noisey Saturday night canal traffic. Terrific breakfast buffet. Customer service and front desk were very polite and attentive.
title: Hotel Comments

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Sofitel Grand is very well located. It is 5 minutes walk to the Dam square. The staff was very polite and courteous. I was given an early check in at 9 Am which was a great gesture. The room itself was quite big and clean.Special mention to the concierge for helping me out with all my requests. Highly recommended for a stay in Amsterdam.
title: Superb Hotel

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Brought my family for a second trip to Amsterdam and to stay at the Sofitel Grand. I love the staff, the amenities, and the location. Great breakfast, best Michelin restaurant and terrific rooms. You will love it.
title: Second Time is Still a Charm

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is a stunningly beautiful property with well appointed and spacious rooms. We stayed in a one bedroom suite that was very spacious, fully renovated, overlooked the canal, and was very quiet. The bathrooms even had towel warmers. It is in a large historic building where Queen Beatrix was actually married. It is an absolute must stay in if you are in Amsterdam and looking for luxury and superior service. We had the pleasure of being greeted and accommodated by a well trained guest services manager, Roel Backus, who extended himself graciously to my family and especially to my daughter to ensure that our stay was perfect, which is was. The buffet breakfast is a must try, even if you are not staying at the hotel. The variety is plentiful and quality is very high. There is even a nicely sized swimming pool, steam room, and sauna which is unusual in European hotels but added an extra level of privilege and relaxation. Yes, it is expensive, but it is well worth the price you will pay from top to bottom and I highly recommmend a stay here. A special thank you for Roel for taking care of us and making us feel welcome at his property. We hope to have the privilege of returning here some day.
title: Amazing Property, A Must Stay

hotelLocation: Oudezijds Voorburgwal 197, 1012 EX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: A great restaurant, a great bar, great concierge, wonderful staffhad booked a double room with my wife, when we got there, the mamanger gave us a jr. suite at no extra cost.it was incredible. felt really special.Very central, in the midst of the city, with bars , cafes and the special coffee shops.
title: If you go to Amsterdam , it has to be the Sofitel Legend

review: Chic lobby and lovely outdoor space in back of hotel. Staff was outstanding. Brought me a complimentary coffee as I waited for my room to be ready and provided a range of restaurant recommendations. Outstanding location on the Prinsengracht canal, just a 10 minute walk to the Anne Frank House.
title: Fabulous contemporary hotel in heart of Amsterdam

review: My husband and I drove to Amsterdam from Germany for a day trip but decided to stay the night so we booked a room at the Andaz on short notice and was very pleased. We've also stayed at the Andaz in San Diego but the Amsterdam location is much more magical with the beautiful lights and an enchanting garden! The bed was extremely comfy and the staff was very accommodating! We will definitely stay there again!
title: A night in Amsterdam at the Andaz Hotel

review: We have just completed 3 nights at the Andaz and found it to be spectacular on every level. The interior design, comfort of the rooms, and buffet breakfasts were all outstanding, but what truly put the experience over the top was the incredible customer service. Every Andaz employee we encountered went out of their way to be polite and helpful and meet our every need. Sera was the first person to greet us when we arrived and continued to serve us impeccably throughout our visit. Patricio, Calvin, and Patrick were all friendly and gracious as well, as was everyone else at the Andaz whose names we didn't learn. We loved our stay in Amsterdam and look forward to another stay at the Andaz next time we visit!
title: Amsterdam

review: Loved this Hotel! Boutique feel with great service and beautiful decor. They have a wonderful restaurant and bikes you can borrow to cruise around. The rooms are well laid out with everything you need. Would definitely visit again!
title: Amazing Hotel!!!

review: Andaz is beautiful modern hotel by the Prinsengracht. Service here was exceptionally warm and you can only love the staff. Complimentary bikes are quite close to Russian tanks (heavy and can take small nuclear bomb) but they work well and unless you are planning to have Tour de France they are good enough. Sauna is also decent.We had a room with a canal view and it was simply fantastic. Mini bar could have been bit colder (just my personal preferences).
title: Fantastic hotel by the canal

review: Staff are so warm and caring. Place is a work of art and in the absolute best location. So happy I discovered it. Vibe they have created is elegant but so comfortable and cozy. I wouldn't ever want to stay somewhere else.
title: Special place

review: Never seen a Hyatt run hotel like this one. Alice in Wonderland with a sexy dark edge. Very artsy, with glamorous chandeliers, stylized chairs and sofas and eclectic art. I loved it but it won't be everyone's "cup of tea." Not my parents sort of Hotel. The staff are great, and the cookies and coffee at reception were welcomed. The gym is adequate - a couple treadmills, a stationary bike, an elliptical machine, dumbells, and a multi-function weight machine. It's clean and nice with stylishly painted walls, but pretty cramped. Free bottles of flat and sparkling water, and apples at the entrance, add to a spa ambiance. Hotel has free bikes but they were gone when we wanted to use them.
title: If Alice lived in a hotel; fitness score 8/10

review: A really lovely, quirky place with great service and a lovely breakfast. Quite pricey, but they often do deals. Well designed, quite eccentric, and the rooms are perfect - very cleverly laid out. It's in a great position. Hard to fault and genuine value for money considering the quality.
title: Fab Hotel

review: This is a very comfortable, ultra modern, buzzy hotel. We were greeted by very friendly, professional staff upon arrival and this continued during our stay. Soft drinks and snacks are available, free of charge and wine is served in the Library from 5-7 pm every day. Very pretty garden. Spacious bedroom, comfortable bed and pillows but the design of the bathroom did not do it for us. Robes and slippers supplied. Excellent buffet breakfast. Could not better the central location being within walking distance of most attractions. Very pleasant sitting in the bar at dusk watching the boats go by on the canal.
title: Short break

review: As soon as you walk in this hotel you are treated like you are supposed to. Excellent service, rooms are comfy and hotel has a great location. Room was good size (for 2), Yes bathroom is not separated from bed with a door or wall but that's called creativity, different, modern. This hotel is elegant yet hipster fancy. I found it to have great location, went walking everywhere even at night. Breakfast is worth it, great service too. Never seen a complete team to be able to work together and provide excellent customer service, you dont see this in any other hotel. I do recommend this hotel.
title: Great hotel and service

review: Outstanding, really this is one of the best hotels we have ever been too. Since the check in we both felt really welcomed, Manuel and all the staff were very kind, our room with canal view was more than we expected, plus the garden and bar were also one of a kind, the hotel is a complete experience. I just hope I can be back again soon.
title: Best hotel / concept ever!

review: We stayed at the Andaz Hotel as we wanted to be in central Amsterdam. The location is fantastic!. People were very helpful. Rooms are small, but so well designed they don't seem small. Everything is modern and clean. Definitely would stay here again when visiting Amsterdam
title: Great Location in Amsterdam!

review: Our first time at Andaz in Amsterdam. Great hotel..love the room and the location. Had dinner in the hotel and it was actually really good. The service overall really need to improve though, especially during breakfast and at the bar. Breakfast was chaotic and just the basics like tea and coffee took a really long time. Service at the bar was just terrible. We were told " to have some patience" by the staff when we asked to order, and we waited...But when another couple walked in and sat down they got the menu right away. Funny that he had time to do that, but no time to take our order?! And when the bar staff took their order and still ignored us we decided to get up and leave . After all, there are plenty of good places to have a drink outside of the hotel...It's a shame! Nice bar area but not a good service to back it up. 4 stars for the room and the location of the hotel, but only worth 2 stars for the service... so I can only give the hotel 3 stars this time around.
title: Good hotel but need to improve on service.

review: Modern hotel and very beautiful. Stylish decor. Very good restaurant. Open kitchen with excellent quality. Modern rooms, but not very practical for those who travel with children. Only negative is the reception that counts on the official to check in / check out / help with the bags. Need officials for these functions
title: Moderm

review: If you want a fabulous Amsterdam hotel on a beautiful canal with excellent service and accommodation, you will be very pleased with the Andaz! We have been to Amsterdam a number of times and have enjoyed each visit, but the location and ambience of this hotel are very special. Between the atmosphere of the Jordaan district, the Nine Shopping streets and with a short walk to the old center of the city, you could not ask for a better location. Wonderful buffet breakfast, free wine and/cookies in the library, an incredible open concept bar lounge serving carefully made cocktails and comfortable, although somewhat quirky rooms (not a problem!) and a very helpful group of young staffers should put this property on the top of your list!
title: Look No Further!

review: Amazing design. Former public library which has been transformed into a 5 star hotel in the heart of Amsterdam. Overlooking the canal. I love the creativity of the design which defines this hotel. On the practical side - staff are 5 stars in the helpfulness and friendliness ranking. Rooms are not very large, but large enough to accommodate my yoga mat and swinging hands around. Shower is amazing! Toiletries are all luxurious Balenciaga.
title: Historic and modern

review: This is an average of two stays, once in December (5/5) and one recently in July (3/5). In December everything was perfect. We were truly impressed for a great Christmas stay (when the hotel was fairly empty). The design, location, perks (mini-bar and happy hour), comfort, and service were top-notch. Exploring the garden is a must!The above were true this month, except for service, as this visit had a few issues. We requested early check-in based on an early flight but it ended up being late day. The other things were anything to do with room service took extraordinarily long, and housekeeping could have done a better job of cleaning under the bed from a previous guest. All of these might be explained by the hotel being fully booked and especially busy, and the front desk was appropriately apologetic when notified upon checkout. We would stay again, but would hope it is more consistent for a five star hotel.
title: Unique design and great location

review: Great hotel. Beautiful surroundings, comfortable beds, extremely friendly staff. Free happy hour, free mini bar for snacks in the room, free bottled water. No other hotel offers these. Great location.Would recommend this highly.
title: Fantastic

review: Great hotel. Hip Hyatt. We stay here when in Amstrdam. Have connecting rooms with kids. Breakfast is fantastic (buffet; but a classy and serious buffet) although the wait is sometimes too long for the coffee order. Think housekeeping can also be more proactive in putting new soap (we stay at least a week when we are in Amsterdam), shampoo, and cleaning up empty bottles etc. If the hotel sends up for example a piece of apple-cake and you take one bite, they will leave it in your room for days. So housekeeping needs a bit more attention. And please, please, please, don't turn off my air conditioning (by taking out the room key from the electrical trigger thingie. I hate coming back to my room and having to wait two hours before the temperature is back to where I want it.
title: Summer stay....

review: We were guests at the Andaz the first week in July. The first thing we noticed is that there is no obvious Front Desk. You instead find a comfortable couch and are greeted by one of the hosts and are checked in from where you are seated. The property is very well taken care of and the rooms are spacious and modern. The staff is most helpful, friendly, and do go out of their way to be sure your stay is as perfect as possible. I recommend this lovely hotel.
title: Very Impressive Experience

review: A cross between Allison Wonderland and some famous dutch architect and artist turned into one of the coolest hotels we've ever stayed in From the moment we walked in we were greeted extremely kind leave by the front desk team and as our rooms weren't quite ready we walked over to the bar and the bar will likely become one of the top 50 in the world next year in my opinion. All members of the staff go out of their way to do anything they can to make your stay more enjoyable, more comfortable, and more fun. Without question this will be the only place we stay in Amsterdam going forward.
title: Spectacular location, amazing staff, and spectacular, quirky rooms and common areas

review: Very nice hotel! Fell in love at first sight! Such a great atmosphere and amazing design, inspired by alice the wonderland. Food was very good too! Would recommend staying in the hotel as well as coming for aperitivo! Very cool!
title: Totally best interior design! Good food too!

review: I recently stayed at The Hoxton during a celebratory trip to Amsterdam with my boyfriend. From the very beginning of our stay, the staff made everything special. We arrived at the hotel waayyy before check-in, and the man at the desk offered us bottles of water and a friendly conversation. Considering this was our first real contact with someone in this country, he made us optimistic about what we were to experience. They were able to watch our bags as we set out for the day. When we checked in later on, they made the process smooth and quick. Our room was INCREDIBLE (a roomy canal view on the third floor), and they even left us balloons for our celebration! Our view was wonderful and made our vacation really meaningful. One thing I might suggest planning ahead for is the breakfast bag. My boyfriend couldn't eat the yogurt, so all he had for breakfast was orange juice and a small banana. For some, it would be perfect, but we needed to find some other options. Overall, a wonderful experience - would absolutely stay again!
title: Stylish and Friendly

review: The hotel is tucked away from the busy central sites but is close enough to walk. In fact, the Anne Frank house is only a few minutes away. The hotel is very chic and retro & with all facilities especially tea making. You can opt for a small breakfast of granola, banana and juice. Air con was working well and some of the staff were very friendly. However, there were a couple of incidents. We ran out of milk and specifically asked reception the night before. It wasn't delivered in the morning and we had to call again for it. To get to the Hoxton, we took the Connexxion Hotel Shuttle return. The shuttle people said we should talk to reception to arrange the return trip. But the lady at reception had no idea what I was talking about and seemed irritated about the whole matter. She did call up Connexxion and spoke in Dutch to them before handing the phone to me to arrange the pick up. Clearly, there is a break in communication somewhere.As a previous reviewer mentioned, the style is present in spades but more substance is needed.
title: Mixed bag

review: We loved it, super friendly people. Location is 10-15 min walking to everywhere, they provide to-go snacks fresh orange juice , 60 min free international calls each day, and free bottled water. We took two rooms, one was ok size the other one was small 512. Our room 502 seemed to be beside the room house keeping, which was noisy.
title: great experience

review: When we return to Amsterdam, we will certainly book a room in the Hoxton again. Thanks for the service, all the tips and tricks and above all thanks for your kind help with the wheelchair! This was a rocking Amsterdam on wheels!Truus & Hannah - Belgium
title: We come back!

review: I love the London Hoxton to meet up with friends. This time we met in Amsterdam, in the lobby. With great interior déco, the atmosphere is good. The staff is very attentive, but I miss the extra excellence of the London branch. For Dutch standards it's above par.
title: The meeting place

review: I don't think we've ever had a better check in before at any hotel... even at "fancier" hotels. At check in, the attendant offered tips on his favorite restaurants in town, the cool spots to visit/eat/shop. He marked a map for us that we used all weekend, even though we've been to Amsterdam many times before, but the leads gave us great intel into the city as it is now.Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful and friendly throughout the entire weekend. And to top it off, they left a note and Dutch cookies in our son's room, welcoming him back to his birth city. I must have mentioned it over the phone, because I was trying to get a specific set of rooms and online they were sold out.The vibe of the hotel is very cool and reminds us of The Ace hotel, from our home town. Style and amenities are on point (24 hour "mini" bar at the front desk, free calls overseas, WIFI, bagged breakfast to go hanging outside your room in the morning). They had a DJ both nights we were there and the bar was a great place to be. However, the sound didn't carry at all, so sleeping was good.We would absolutely recommend staying at The Hoxton and will plan to stay there when we fly through Amsterdam again in a few months.
title: The best customer service ever

review: We stayed for 3 nights in early July. Overall the hotel has a hip vibe and is clean and very convenient.We had breakfast in the restaurant and it was fine. The front desk staff was attentive and helpful.But.................Be careful what you ask for. My wife wanted a tub so we requested the "tubbie" room, one of the only rooms with a tub. It is on the top floor in the back building and requires a 1/2 flight of stairs to get to once you are out of the elevator. Inside the room, there is a very small entry that is dark and the light switch is hard to find and another very narrow, spiral staircase up to the attic where the room is. So no matter what, you have 1 1/2 flights of stairs to get to this room. In the room, there are several beams going across it at a height of less than 6'. If you are that tall, you will have to duck several times when walking across the room. The TV is obstructed by those beams.There is no closet or dresser. Only an open structure with 2' of pole space and a couple of hangers. There is no place to put suitcases. The lighting in the room is dim.The door to the bathroom is translucent and unfortunately the toilet is right beside the door so anyone in the room has a full, if cloudy, view of whoever is on the toilet and what they are doing. The bathtub is a claw foot type and is out in the room about 5' from the bed. There is no privacy for whoever is taking a bath.The windows in the room start at eye level when standing and only about 18" high. The view is of the canal in back, but you have to be standing right at the window to see it. Overall it is a very quirky room and definitely not for everyone.
title: Convenient hotel with a very quirky room

review: I've stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam and nothing come close to The Hoxton! The staff are amazing, the rooms are amazing and the location is just perfect. the last time I stayed the food was good but nothing to write home about. I decided to eat there for lunch and was pleasantly surprised to discover that they had upped their culinary game, ten-fold! I went for the baby octopus which was incredible and recommended to me by Mindy, who was rad and made sure I wasn't left feeling like a billy whilst eating on my own. The Stroopwaffles left on my desk in my room was a real touch! can't wait to go back.
title: The best service in town!

review: It was our first time staying at the Hoxton hotel and what a fantastic hotel nothing was too much for them - staff were all very helpful and efficient - especially Stephanie on reception! We can't wait to return.
title: Amazing Hotel

review: We chose The Hoxton mainly for the location, which meant we could walk everywhere we wanted.We had a top floor ‘Roomy’ room for 3 nights with fantastic canal views with a very nice shower and a comfortable bed, but I suppose overall the room was quite basic. The interior style was very much along the lines of Soho House (a basic room) and The Pig chains (with fewer frills) and nothing wrong with that. Our only real negative was that our ‘Roomy’ room wasn’t particularly roomy. As we were in the eaves we had restricted head height on one side of the bed, which became a bit annoying after a while. Overall though, this hotel has a very happy and relaxed vibe, with a sense of fun. You can’t fail to have a nice time in Amsterdam using this as a base and we’d definitely be very happy to return.
title: Great location

review: we had a nice room that looked over the canal. spacious. could use a dresser but it didn't really matter. the staff was excellent especially Dominique at the front desk. She steered us in the right direction for food and local colour.Gina who took care of a lot of the dining room service was also stellar. The food was very good, especially the bitterballen. The bar stayed open late and had a very nice vibe, the clientele were very cool and well mannered to. you could walk anywhere within 5-10 minutes time.
title: Almost a week in Amsterdam

review: Stayed here for three nights with family of four and absolutely loved The Hoxton. We had a 'cosy' canal view room and our teenagers had a 'shoebox' twin. Both rooms seemed positively huge compared to similar priced places we had stayed in Rome and Paris and the fittings, fixtures and decor were more five star than many actual five star hotels I have stayed in. The attention to detail is amazing with beautiful linen and towels, excellent roomy bathrooms and very stylish decor. Location is great, just an easy walk from Central Station and right in amongst great places to eat and shop. Saving the best til last, the staff were amazing, genuinely friendly and helpful - Stephanie who checked us in was so welcoming and helpful.Many of the top end hotel operators need to come and stay here and learn about real hospitality - I cannot recommend The Hoxton highly enough, one of if not THE best hotels I have stayed anywhere in the world.
title: An Absolute Gem!

review: We loved everything about this hotel, but have to give a special shout out to Evelien, who took so much time and care preparing a list of wonderful suggestions for us (we were the couple heading to Iceland). I have never experienced better service in a hotel. Our canal-view room was perfect, and the location of the hotel could not have been better. Little touches, like the complementary bottled water, were much appreciated.
title: The best front desk staff!

review: Oh, The Hoxton, how I will miss you... This was a wonderful hotel experience - how you might ask? Maybe it all began with check-in, which was quick and efficient (we had an early check-in and the room was ready). And then lovely room 214, a large and tastefully decorated room, with massive floor to ceiling windows overlooking the Herengracht canal and romantic 17th century burghers homes across the way. This has to be the best room in the hotel, with both the bedroom and gloriously large bathroom overlooking the canal and with a small Juliet balcony off of the bedroom. The king bed was firmly comfortable and covered in luxurious white cotton sheets. The room has a/c, which is important in the humid summertime, and a flat screen tv (if you like that sort of thing). Bag breakfasts arrive at your door with yogurt and bananas in the morning and there is coffee in the room, but the part that makes it special - a pint of fresh milk for your coffee (why doesn't every hotel do this?). There is also unlimited bottled flat and sparkling water (again, every hotel should do this). Downstairs there is a fun and lively bar and restaurant, with reasonable prices, that seemed to be a hot spot for hanging out. The hotel location is also fantastic not far from the trams and shopping. Oh, I almost forgot, they have four free bicycles available for their guests to use! #IloveTheHoxton Minor complaints, to get to room 214 you get off of the elevator walk down the hallway and then have to go up 4 stairs, a bit cumbersome with luggage. There are also a few stairs from the street entrance to check in. Other than that, no complaints.
title: Contemporary, comfortable and exquisite!

review: We stayed here for my graduation trip, and Dominique, who helped us check in, not only spent time giving us suggestions and information about Amsterdam, she also left me a mug and a sweet hand written postcard in my room to congratulate me. The entire staff was very friendly, the atmosphere in the hotel was great, and it is located in a great location (right on one of the canals). We would definitely stay here again!!!
title: Great hotel and a great staff

review: Imagine you are on a stag-do, destination Amsterdam, consisting of only the groom & best man for 4 days... We did, and chose the Hoxton as our hotel (recommended by the groom himself who had stayed there before).Since this is a hotel review, I'll just keep it at that...A few days before we arrived, I sent an email to the hotel requesting 1) the groom be given special outstanding service, and 2) a few bits and bobs for the groom (including a plate of curry and chips) which I felt were symbols of some of the unique & quirky aspects that reflected our 16 year friendship. Evelien was the first to respond and did so with such genuine enthusiasm, that I got an immediate insight to the warm & hospitable culture there. The email correspondences from the various rostered staff afterwards carried on the attitude from Evelien. So when we arrived and the groom sauntered into his hotel room, there waiting for him were the curry & chips - sitting on a tray and piping hot, with the other items which had been arranged between the Hoxton and I. We were blown away, and needless-to-say, the groom WAS treated like a king for the duration of our stay.Bravo to the Hoxton team (Evelien, Micha, Yorinda, Karim, Lennart & Diego), you are a credit to your hotel. We will remember our stay with you for decades to come...So if you are looking for a hotel with a fantastic central location, with a cool buzzy vibe, funky decor with quirky detailing, friendly and hospitable service from younger modern staff who are prepared to go the extra mile for you - and all from a hotel with heart.... then I recommend experiencing it for yourself.A truly amazing experience...CURRY AND CHIPS!
title: Perhaps one of the best hotel experiences of my life...

review: We arrived to the hotel very early and the receptionist still tried to get us a room. Although she couldn't they were very helpful in taking our bags and recommending places for us to visit. She really went out of her way to help which was a great start to our trip. We had the smaller of the rooms but found that there was plenty of room for us. It was very clean and put together excellently. The hotel bar and restaurant were also very nice. Not the cheapest but good value for the quality you get.
title: We couldn't fault it...

review: The Hoxton has just the right blend of Shoreditch cool mixed with friendly, knowledgable staff. I would definitely stay here again.The rooms are a little bit eclectic, but brilliantly thought out. The only negative, if I had one, is that I find the Hoxton brand's menus a little bit short, and controversial. But overall, I love this joint.
title: Contemporary, cool, but very friendly and accessible

review: On first arriving, you can't miss the general and continuous buzz of hotel guests, lounging, eating, drinking, talking and generally enjoying the public areas of the hotel. Artsy and funky, this gem is right in the canal district, centrally located. They are very concerned about your comfort, and offer extras like a breakfast "bag"...you put your bag on your door, and in the morning, they've provided basics like a banana, oj, yogurt and granola. We had a canal view room, and really enjoyed our stay. It definitely has a "shabby chic" and super hip vibe.
title: Hip and Trendy...

review: Loved the Hoxton and was very much looking forward to our stay there. Very hip with all the amenities, great staff and service and in a great part of town. Would highly recommend based on this.Had issues regarding check in though that wasted about 45 mins on arrival trying to find our reservation and was only compensated with drink. It was extremely stressful to go through that process and repeat ourselves to 3 levels of management.On top of that we came back to our room one day to find it open...major concerns regarding security as anyone could've walked in and stolen something.
title: Perfect hotel in the perfect location...letdown by the small details

review: Everything about this hotel is just lovely. Great staff, great location, food, and the room. Defiantly worth upgrading to a canal view - it really sets the Amsterdam mood :) Love the breakfast bags in the mornings, and the bar makes the best cocktails (especially their old fashion). It's our second stay and definitely not our last.
title: Always comes back to this amazing hotel

review: I met a girlfriend and her daughter here for a birthday weekend for the 14 year old and we all enjoyed our stay immensely. The Hoxton was recommended by some friends of theirs and with no expectations I was thoroughly impressed by this hotel and had a wonderful stay. We had 2 room between the 3 of us and both were completely happy with the rooms we had. The staff was helpful and friendly. they were very knowledgeable as well, they helped up book a few things and ensured we knew how to get to the places we were going. The staff in the bar was friendly as well. The rooms were clean and both my friend and I had canal views that were just gorgeous. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was big enough to maneuver in and the room was spacious enough to manage in even though listed as cozy, it felt spacious. I need to mention the view again, totally worth ensuring you get a canal view! The breakfast options and delivery to the door as well as the water and mils sticked in the fridge are nice touches that we really appreciated. We are still talking about our stay weeks later and how much we loved this hotel and if/when I/we get back to Amsterdam, I will be staying here.
title: An exquisite property with a fantastic staff!

review: Enjoyed the location and helpful staff! The hotel was within walking distance to everything and very trendy. Restaurant food was delicious and the bar was a popular area to hang out. Front desk staff shared many helpful tips and recommendations.
title: Great Hotel

review: Recommended by a friend, we spent four nights at the Hoxton. The staff is superb. Everyone is friendly and helpful and full of great recommendations for restaurants and things to do around town. The location is in the canal section of town and second to none in terms of centrality and the ability to walk wherever you choose.We had breakfast at the hotel restaurant our first morning and like most other meals in Amsterdam, it was perfectly cooked, plated and presented by a great wait staff. The room we had faces the canal and though small has everything you need as well as an incredibly comfortable bed. I'm having a hard time thinking of a negative aspect to this hotel, but if there is, I'd say the AC in the room could be more consistent. Some nights it was great, other nights not so good. Aside from that, this is a terrific place to stay when in Amsterdam and we would definitely stay here again if we return.
title: Great little hotel in a great part of Amsterdam!

review: We loved this hotel. It had a cool vibe with an artistic edge. The staff was helpful. Our room was very nice. They have a very nice bar area and good food. It was in a great location. Walking distance from most attractions like Ann Frank Museum
title: Artsy hotel with stle

review: Pros: boutique and stylish room. free breakfast bag every morning which had youghurt, granola, banana and an orange juice. Free bottled water and milk provided. Tea and coffee making facilities available in the room. free wifi provided. short walking distance to shops and tramsCons: small room. We were right above the restaurant/bar, hence the noise of the music could be heard in the room at night. The reception desk is was slightly difficult to locate. The first thing you see when you walk into the hotel is a restaurant/bar and the reception desk is tucked into the right hand side of the restaurant. PS: i suggest taking a shuttle to the hotel which costs 27 euros return. this can be bought at the airport. Otherwise, you would be changing public transport twice and then still having to walk for 5 mins to the hotel which is technically not far, but with a 20kg luggage can be a little annoying.
title: Reasonable stay

review: My husband and I stayed here for four nights and will definitely be returning on our next trip to Amsterdam. Aside from the fabulous location (on a beautiful canal within walking distance of all the major sights), the Hoxton anticipates all a traveler's needs - comfort, good cheer, cleanliness, strong wifi, quiet rooms and a quick breakfast delivered to your door to jumpstart your morning. Free cold water botttles as you're going out the door for the day and an hour/day's worth of free phone usage (international as well!) are the frosting on the cake. Although there's a lot going on downstairs in the evenings, we never were disturbed by noise upstairs. A special shoutout to Michaela (sp?) at the front desk who was so helpful and friendly. We're already looking forward to our next stay at the Hox!
title: Great base for touring Amsterdam!

review: A really lovely hotel in central Amsterdam just fat enough from red light area. Easy walk to all museums and loads of bars and restaurants.The staff are all helpful and enthusiastic. The rooms are modern clean and very comfortable. The novel breakfast bag was a really nice idea and allowed a relaxed start to the day. We did decide to have the cooked breakfast in the restaurant one morning and the food was excellent. The only reason I haven't given top marks is that they forgot my croissant but I don't hold it against them they are human!We went to the beach on our last day - a short train trip and we'll worth it. The bars on the beach are fabulous makes UK Seaside's look very inferior.Went with grown up kids and partners to celebrate husband's 60th birthday and had a top weekend.
title: Friendly yet sophisticated

review: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel!The staff is very helpful and friendly.The food served at the restaurant is very nice and I had the chance to taste cocktails made at the bar ( the frosé is delicious) !!I highly recommend this place!
title: Great hotel!

review: What a great find in the heart of downtown Amsterdam! This hotel is quite old but has been done up marvellously into a chic and hip building. We stayed in the cheapest twin room, which was affectionately called the "shoebox room" by the lady who checked us in. Yes it is small, but we never felt cramped or like we needed more space. The bathroom is actually really big, with a good shower. The beds were comfy and the TV was a good size with a range of channels to pick from. The walk to the Dam and Red Light District is about 10 mins, while a walk to Centraal Station is 15 mins. A cute little breakfast bag was delivered to our door each morning with a delicious granola, yoghurt, banana and orange juice. The staff are super friendly and spoke perfect English. We loved our stay here and would highly recommend!
title: Fantastic Hotel in Close to the Action!

review: Very nice, cute hotel with great location. Guys from reception desk Karim and Valentina are amazing, so nice and friendly. Room is not big, but stylish and pleasant. Service is good, so very nice choice to stay here.
title: Nice hotel

review: We stayed in the Hoxton Amsterdam from July 6 thru July 11, 2017. The hotel is clean, modern, and comfortable, the one caveat being that the "cozy" rooms are very small indeed. We had requested a quiet room and early check in and got both. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. A special thank you to William, who was at the front desk early on a Sunday morning when my wife became very ill and we needed advice on medical care. He told us our options, then, at our request, called a cab, told the cabby where to take us, and we were whisked off to a wonderful, modern hospital where my wife received excellent care at a reasonable price. Later that evening, 14 hours later to be precise, William was still on duty and noticed us dining in the hotel dining room. He sent over complimentary after-dinner drinks since, as the waiter put it, we had had "a rough day." Then he came over to chat and asked us how we were doing. Service with a warm, human touch! Thank you, William! (The hotel restaurant and bar are great, by the way, with the bar known locally for its innovative cocktails.) The one thing to be aware of is that the "cozy" rooms are a tight fit for two people. Still, this is central Amsterdam, right on one of the main canals, within easy walking distance of Dam square, so you have to expect some trade-offs. All in all, a wonderful hotel with outstanding staff. With a very comfortable bed and a quiet room in the back, we slept very well.
title: Clean, modern, hip, centrally located, great staff

review: This fantastic hotel is an excellent spot to stay in Amsterdam! The staff is very friendly and went above and beyond to be helpful and welcoming. Our room was very trendy and they even provide a little breakfast (yogurt, banana, fresh juice) to your room each morning. The attached restaurant was bustling in the evening and had a great vibe. We would return in a heartbeat!
title: Superb stay and perfect location

review: I've stayed at this hotel several times over the years. It's a fun hotel with a perfect location for tourists: close to the action, but without being directly in the madness that is Central... if you want that, only walk a few blocks. The 9 Streets area where it's located is quiet, but has many shops and dining opportunities, and the location on a canal is picture-perfect. I return to this hotel because of all this, the friendly staff, and, frankly, it's a pretty-good bargain compared to the high prices in Amsterdam. Thanks for another nice stay!
title: Another Fine Stay

review: I paid a lot for my room. I was happy to do this because I value quality.I soon discovered that this hotel lacked finish.Average service, average rooms, poor breakfasts. I cringe when I think about wasting £250 a night on a bad nights sleep. The staff, the service, the attitude ... all that of a lower priced hotel.If you get a good deal go for it, if you're paying over £100 you can do better.
title: Distinctly average

review: Really, The Hoxton is like the person I want to marry...thoughtful, beautiful, smart, anticipating of my needs, fun to be around! We only have known each other for four nights, but I think it could work out!Seriously, It's like someone interviewed me and designed a space around my preferences. Retro, energetic and staffed with thoughtful, fresh-faced staff, I'd recommend The Hoxton to any adult traveller (seems less ideal for families). Valentina was an enthusiastic and informative front desk attendant. A stand-out among stand-out of hip, attentive staff. The bar area has a bit of a night-time buzz and well-presented and prepared cocktails. It kind of reminded me of a trendy NYC boutique hotel without all the attitude that often comes with that in NYC.Exploring Amsterdam over a four night stay, The Hoxton was located in an ideal location that felt intimate and was a close 15-20 walk to all the large tourist areas. The streets around it are like postcards for Amsterdam. Recommended without reservation...until I make my next one!
title: Can I marry a boutique hotel?

review: This hotel has a very cool vibe even though it is located within extremely old buildings. We stayed for just one night between the cruise ship and flying home. Our room was a "Shoebox" room which turned out to be very spacious, especially after being two weeks in a stateroom. The bathroom was huge. We had two meals in the restaurant downstairs and both were very good. Very friendly, helpful staff. Being able to call the US free of charge from the room phone was an unexpected delight. Free continental breakfast, and bottled water also an unexpected extra.
title: Great Experience at the Hoxton

review: Hotel has a really nice atmosphere when you enter, the lobby / bar area is bustling with people having a good time,the rooms are decorated in a unique sort of vintage style.The hotel is really well run,some good ideas,excellent service and rooms are very clean.If you can, book a room with a canel view, have the lovely reasonably priced breakfast in the restaurant and on one evening enjoy the jazz in the lobby with a cocktail !
title: Trendy,friendly and in a great location!

review: Cafe, bar and restaurant seems quite trendy place to hang out. It is always bustling with internationals and Amsterdammers. Amazing location right on the canal. Artsy magazines in the rooms, and the complementary breakfast bag are the cherry on top.
title: Excellen Location, Great Vibe.

review: Friendly staff and a very warm welcome, this hotel was gorgeous! Had a room on the fifth floor and they had also allocated our friends a room on the same floor which was thoughtful. Loved the little touches in the room, from the "crap" drawer to the fantastic hairdryer. The bar upstairs was a perfect spot to unwind after a busy day and the spicy chicken wings were amazing. Super, comfy beds with massive pillows and all this in a wonderful location which is close to everything. Thank you x
title: Birthday Bliss

review: What a great hotel and great people. The rooms, lobby and restaurant added to the overall feel. Get the pancakes if you eat breakfast in the restaurant. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.This was an enjoyable visit.
title: Great vibe

review: The lobby has a great vibe - trendy and inviting. We enjoyed a fabulous breakfast upon arrival and later that night had tasty treats in the lounge. We stayed in a "cozy room" and it was perfect...had everything we needed. Staff was friendly and helpful. Brought us up some complimentary champagne as it was our anniversary. Would stay there again in a heartbeat!
title: A gem in the heart of Amsterdam.

review: Walking distance everywhere. Dam square, red light are very close. Also close to transport for example tram, bus, train. The last stop of the train from the airport is within walking distance. In my opinion one of the rare quality and friendly hotels in the center.
title: Both central and quality

review: My wife and I had the most wonderful experience at the Hoxton. Had a "cozy" room which was plenty big for the two of us and our huge suitcases. Had just come from Paris and the Hoxton room was much bigger in comparison. The hotel itself was also very cool. Great music and drink scene at the bar downstairs, and the breakfast and lunch offerings were some of the best food we had in Amsterdam! Everyone at the front desk, bar and restaurant were very helpful offering recommendations and were generally incredibly friendly. Location is also a huge plus. Right on the canals and plenty quiet at night, but walking distance from all the restaurants and the city center. The breakfast goodie bags they deliver to you each morning is a really nice touch! Will be returning to Amsterdam in large part to our amazing experience at this hotel -- and we couldn't imagine staying anywhere else.Thanks for such a great weekend!
title: Can't imagine staying anywhere else

review: A group of 15 visited for 3 nights with 2-3 of us per room. The rooms varied in size, and though some were perhaps on the small side; my friend and I were fortunate enough to share a larger room which included a large bathroom, plenty wardrobe space and a nespresso machine. All of the rooms were very tasteful and clean and tidy. Being a large group of Scottish girls, we were rather noisy when getting ready for our nights out so we were advised on a few occasions to be quieter but staff were very pleasant about it, which makes all of the difference. The majority of time we got taxi's into the centre, though the Heineken experience and some lovely bars and bakeries were close by! Would highly recommend this hotel and would consider returning again, providing it was only 2 to a room!
title: They tolerated a noisy hen party immensely!

review: My mum and I recently stayed in this hotel as a belated 30th birthday celebration for 2 nights. On arrival I was greeted with Amsterdam cookies and a souvenir mug as a birthday gift which I thought was very sweet. We stayed in a ground floor room near reception; the room was very small but I liked the modern decor and the bed was very comfortable. The hotel is situated in a beautiful part of town. I liked that the street was residential as I enjoy seeing how locals live. It is a bit of a walk up to the top end of the town (red light area), especially for us as we got lost a LOT! The 'hop on hop off' boat is good to use during the day but both nights we struggled to find our way back to this hotel as the streets look very similar at night. We should maybe have looked into using the trams. All in all this is a great hotel that met our needs. I would stay here again as the part of town is picturesque and a lot nicer than the top end of the city. We didn't eat in the hotel so I can't comment on that but all staff we encountered were extremely friendly and helpful.
title: Lovely stay

review: Standard Mercure hotel, nothing special. The location is good, tucked away in the Center of Amsterdam near the canals. The room is quite small but that is not unusual for typical hotels in Amsterdam. Worth a visit.
title: Good location, room is small

review: We stayed for 2 nights in this hotel prior to a river cruise and found it comfortable but with limited service. It is in a converted building with nicely furnished secure rooms with comfortable beds, en-suite, TV and safe. The reception was small and up a few steps but the staff were very friendly and helpful. The restaurant served only breakfast with limited cooked items but a selection of local fare, cereals, fruit, etc. Other meals had to be sourced externally but there were many options within a 10-15 minute walk.It is situated on narrow streets but features it's own courtyard at the back where the main entrance was located. We took the train to Leyden to see both the Archeological and Folk museums as the former has a good selection of Ancient Egyptian artifacts. We found Leyden more attractive than Amsterdam and with fewer bicycle hazards.
title: Conveniently located hotel close to museum district

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: this is such a stunning hotel! Stayed there for 3 nights in July and loved it! The style, the architecture, the location and the service! Everything was up to the highest standards. I didn't have the chance to try the food or the breakfast here but based on the hotel grounds and room I will definitely recommend it.
title: stunning hotel

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: For those interested in architecture, the Conservatorium is a feast for the eyes. The blend of old and new is masterful, even unique for a hotel. It was exciting to walk through the portal and anticipate a luxurious experience. Didn't happen that way. The room was extremely uncomfortable and inconvenient, The corridors are gorgeous san AC...that omission was a mistake. Maybe the AC was on the blink. Watch your step as you leave the room as a step-down is not marked or illuminated. I had a deluxe, two floor suite (514) with a view of the street...a bit noisy but tolerable. After climbing the steep, Amsterdam-style stairs to the bedroom and having my luggage carried upstairs, I went to unpack. Surprise -- the closets are on the first floor. Back down the steep staircase with my luggage in tow. But how do you open the closets or turn the lights on/off or even the TV? My remote didn't work. Even the bedside lamp required "instructions." When using the desk, it was inevitable that you hit your head -- every single time -- on the light fixture that hangs over the chair. And, my knee got a bruisin' from hitting the desk drawer when trying to avoid the pendant light. The furniture is low to the floor -- a trip factor vs. comfortable. To net the experience, the designer thought about clever, unusual, or even tech-forward and NOT guest convenience. Yeah -- there is a user manual to explain it all but who wants to read a manual for normally very predictable operations. Service was abysmal, especially in the bar and dining areas. One morning I ordered an omelette but the server told me "It will be a long time. The kitchen is backed up." Seriously? That was discouraging and even funny given other service issues. Got the wrong check in the bar, used dishes and glasses weren't removed after guests, sheets were not changed daily (my requirement when away from home) crumbs everywhere, chipped furniture and it goes from there. On a positive note, the Van Gogh Museum is literally across the street and the boat tour through the canals was memorable...neither had much to do with the hotel experience. While it was expensive, we hired a private and luxurious boat service to tour the canals with lunch and wine...worth every penny. It's sad when the potential of this incredible structure is diminished by design and service. I won't return.
title: It could be so much more...

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Located near most of the Museums. Amazing architecture and lovely way of integrating multiple buildings into one hotel. My room had a living room down and the bedroom was via a staircase. Rooms were large and the layout made it seem bigger. I would definitely recommend this hotel. A unique design and worth the spend
title: Out of this world - amazing design

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Rooms are absolutely gorgeous. Had a deluxe room on the fifth floor with soaking tub and it was ultra modern and roomy. Front desk service was excellent, as was breakfast. Location near museums was perfect for us. Highly recommend. Everything about this hotel was luxurious.
title: Fantastic Hotel

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is stunning architecturally inside and out, and the service was great. As we walked into the atrium upon arrival, I was in amazed by the modern atmosphere. While checking in, we were all offered a glass of either water or apple juice, and to have our luggage taken up to our room.The building apparently used to be a music school, so there are some nice heritage elements of the hotel, such as the dimmer lit hallways with concrete pillars and mosaic floors, and a violin chandelier just past the main lobby.Similarly to the lobby area, the hotel room was very bright and modern. We were four people in a suite, which had two levels: a lower level and a mezzanine. I've heard many rooms have steps, so it'd be a good idea to ask the hotel for a room with no stairs if you have trouble climbing them. The lower level had a bathroom, television, closet, kitchen table, bench, mini bar (and nespresso machine), and couch which converts to a bed. Since we were four people, we asked for an additional cot. The mezzanine had a couch chair, television, king bed, closet, and a bathroom.Despite the aesthetically pleasing decor, the advanced technology caused much frustration among all of us, including millennials! The day and night curtains are operated by a switch on the wall, which didn't make sense to me when you can open the curtains manually twice as fast and decide how far open you want them. The lights were also very confusing. Firstly, the closet lights and some of the bathroom lights are operated by a motion sensor. For the closet, it's okay, but it's quite a shock to walk in to the bathroom at night only to have a light suddenly turn on. The other lights were also difficult to use. Some lights had their own switch. Unfortunately even after I've left the hotel I still don't know how to use the lights, so I can't really explain it in this review. But there was an "all lights off" switch, a "daylights on" switch, and some other switches. Some lights wouldn't go on unless some other switches were on, and some lights couldn't be turned off without making the whole place go dark! I'd much prefer to have each light on it's own switch.In addition to the lights, the garbage cans were very small with ridiculous lids that just get in the way. The doors were also very big and heavy.During our stay, we made use of the hotel's amenities. They have a spa, gym, and pool. The gym was very nice–many machines and for the most part quite empty. I'm not sure what it's like at other times of the year, but when I went there were only two people in the gym.Breakfast was very good. We ate in the restaurant for breakfast for two days, and the other days we went to a bread place a couple hundred meters away and had croissants. The hotel breakfast offers either cold breakfast for I think €30, or hot and cold for around €40. Although the price is quite high, they offer a wide variety of food both cold and hot. The cold buffet had some fresh juices, smoothies, yoghurt, avocado chocolate pudding, cheese, fruit, salads (pumpkin salad, cucumber salad, and quinoa salad to name a a few), avocado, and smoked salmon. Perpendicular to the cold buffet was a table with a selection of cereals and breads. The pain au chocolate was so good I ate two, and had to resist a third!Overall we were pleased with the hotel. I recommend staying in this conveniently located hotel (visit the museums close by!), despite the very confusing light switches.
title: Beautiful Hotel

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Advised by my Dutch Chairman I decided to try this relatively new hotel in Amsterdam. Located in the museum district, near Vodelpark, it is an amazing place worth a visit to the lobby even if you are not a guest. The lobby restaurant is amazing for light dinners and breakfast but the real gem is the gym, incredibly equipped (from Technogym Unica to TRX and roller). Bring your swimming costume as the amazing deserted pool is worth it
title: New fav hotel in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed here whilst on a business trip and glad I selected this hotel! I was lucky to be upgraded to a two floor suite which was very comfortable. Hotel has a range of different features which you'd expect and was well positioned from what I know of Amsterdam. Highly recommended if the price is in your range
title: Excellent hotel!

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Everting was great. The hotel is wonderful, moderm and very well located. Very calm location, near from museum and parks. They have a very nice Japanese restaurant inside the hotel. Breakfast is nice.
title: Fantastic

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: i am a regular on business here and was very disappointed this tripWhen I arrived in the room the fridge was making such a noise it had to be unplugged and switched off, the bedside reading lamp would not switch off, the bathroom TV would not work and when you used the shower the water ran under the door and flooded the bathroom floor as there was no seal and the gradient was the wrong wayJust after I arrived and before the fridge was unplugged I took a chocolate bar out that was found to be moldy on openingThe brasserie food is adequate for a quick dinner and the breakfast buffet is reasonableThe hotel really needs to get its maintenance act together for the prices they charge
title: Amazing design that is let down by poor maintenance

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very happy with my choice. Excellent location, excelente rooms. The hotel is very beautiful. Love the architecture. Everybody is helpful. The gym and wellness center are perfect. The room is impeccable!!!! Love it!!! Recommend for everyone.
title: Family vacation

hotelLocation: Van Baerlestraat 27, 1071 AN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Recently stayed for two nights in a 8th floor junior suite. We were very pleased with our choice in terms of hotel facilities, location and service.The location is a good 10-15min walk to the 3 main canals and 20-25 mins to the old city centre. Several meseums are within a 2-4min walk and there are several med-hi end shops nearby. The lobby and atrium areas are great, the pool and spa equally so and not overcrowded despite a nearly full hotel (as we were told)Our flight was early in the morning and we arrived at around 9.00am at the hotel where we were pleasently suprised that our early check-in request had been acommodated and we were checked-in immediately. Note that we booked through the hotel's website.Our room was excellent, great sound proofing, quite hi-tech with a flawless bathroom. Our loft-level junior suite had high ceilings and an exposed wooden beam frame. Plenty of room (around 55m2), excellent seating choices, writing desk and lovely closets.Breakfast was good but we were not as enthusiastic with the choices or tastes as in other similar properties around the world.Service was impeccable throughout in stark contrast to some earlier comments here. The staff went out of their way to assist in any way the could, doing so with a genuine desire to please, not tip oriented.Will definitely by back and have already recommended the Conservatorium to friends visiting this great city in the future.
title: Excellent museum district oasis

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Nested in the angle of a canal in the heart of the old town, the Hotel de L'Europe is pure class. You really feel that this hotel is special - not part of a chain or franchise - privately owned by the Heineken family and indeed originally used as the special venue to accommodate the founder's guests. The service is exceptionally charming, the concierges really knowledgeable and willing to go the extra mile, the food is superb and the waterside venue stunning, the rooms are individual and stylish. After years in different places in the city, I have now unquestionably found my home-from-home in Amsterdam - I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else.
title: Old world charm in an unparalleled location

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Wonderful location, Dinner on the patio overlooking on of the canals was nice. Room was quite and comfortable. Morning breakfast was also very nice - great selection. The staff was top notch. My wife forgot one of her prescriptions and the concierge arrange for her to see a physician who was able to prescribe what she needed (we do keep pictures of our prescriptions on our phones).
title: Pre-Cruise stay

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel was in City Center of Amsterdam. Great to explore the city.It was attractive, and seemed like they wanted it to be a luxury hotel, but fell short. I think in its hey day it was, but over the years went down. As one reviewer said, "The fizz left the bottle."We were a group of 13 that stayed here for 5 days. We dropped some serious cash and were not treated that well and there were mistakes with our reservations and rooms. Additionally, the service was not up to par for a luxury resort. Slow check in, service spotty. It took 90 minutes to check us in. The bar and restaurant were terrible service as well. No one seemed to really love their job nor the visitors.If you want to stay in a luxury hotel, I suggest looking for something else.
title: Great location--Heart of Amsterdam--Not Luxury

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
