review: This hotel has everything! Great Spa, Great Food, Great Service. So very comfortable which was great after 3 days in Warzburg!! We walked in and although our room was not ready, we had a drink at the bar and were taken on a tour of the hotel. Tom was our go to guy! He is phenomenal and can help with anything! The room was beautiful and comfortable! We never waited for anything. Loretta gives a fantastic facial in the spa!! The staff at this hotel makes everything easy. I wish I could give this hotel 10 stars.
title: My favorite hotel thus far!!!!

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We spent 3 nights in this delightful hotel. For us, it combined the best of "Old Europe" with modern conveniencies; ie: a stunning water view, and a state of the art bathroom.The staff was professional, yet friendly, and always achieved results.
title: An oasis in a vibrabt city

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Michelin starred restaurant closed for vacation not mentioned when booking... Concierge did not follow up when promised on a reservation... WE had to follow up on status... they (l'europe) were unable to obtain a reservation... day lost along with any chance to obtain a restaurant booking.... a street restaurant for us.... turn down service hit and miss, omg the basics.... had to ask for that also.... in fact had to ask twice each time for the simplest of requests.... this hotel is living on a reputation and most certainly do not understand that a 5 star reputation has to be earned every day... that is why we pay so much!!!! who knows it may be your turn next to have our experience!!!!!
title: Mediocrity is strong

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel De L'Europe has established a unique identity, together offer a compelling-adventurous array of contemporary arts and classical collections.I had a pleasant stay at the Penthouse. The classic design and the modern design were mixed together and the result was the European modern classic interior design. The furniture was not very modern but still comfy. It was simple and has less carving on it. The amenities were fantastic and so the bed was very comfortable. Throughout the penthouse, carpeted flooring and a big painting on the wall help warm up the interior and white painted-woods emphasize the clean lines of furnishings. A warm, earthier color set the tone on the walls of the living room area, serving as an upbeat yet interesting background for furnishings in accent colors inspired by the outdoors. A Rooftop-large balcony with breathtaking the canal views illustrated a historic view of Amsterdam. Sunsetting from this balcony was so relaxing, this is what it is like imagining of living 'A classical way in urban society'. My dinning experience at Bord'Eau was perfect and spotless. I highly recommend a business lunch at a romantic dinner at Hofdstaad Brasserie, an all-day dining experience offers a wide selection of chef's specialities. I would suggest to experience an authentic afternoon tea at Hèt Terrace and to chill out at Freddy's Bar with friends or family.I truly enjoyed everything that the city has to offer benefiting from the hotel's perfect location, touristic attractions like Rijksmuseum and Heineken Experience are on walking distance. I suggest to go for biking in the city and discovering hidden places, Most of biking tours are located close to to Madame Tussauds Amsterdam located in the centre of the city on Dam Square, near the Royal Palace of Amsterdam. This was very interesting activity.The staffs at this hotel were very helpful, polite and kind. The only missing was 'flashing the smile'! Overall, I had a wonderful stay! Many Thanks..
title: Charm and History! The contemporary art hidden in Amsterdam's historic architecture!

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Me and my husband booked for 2 nights in may this year.From the moment we arrived we felt relaxed and looked after.The staff were amazing and polite,our room was beautiful and had amazing views.Breakfast was lovely.From start to finish we loved every second,so much so i couldnt wait to come back and bring my daughter too.We are booked in for 26th july,and im really hopeful we will have the same experience.
title: amazing

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I was fortunate to stay here for one night this week and I was very impressed. It I a beautiful hotel, old but well maintained and very comfortable. a great breakfast and the views of the canal from the Terrace are fabulous.
title: lovely hotel centrally located

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for 3 nights ,great location,terrace bar and restaurant lovely,in the heart of the city with plenty of things to see and do. Would recommend boat trip from hotel 36 Euros each worth every penny,hired bikes from hotel good rates overall lovely , only small moan room service not the best dirty glasses not picked ,up some items not replaced or restocked .
title: Great location

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel rocked! If you are looking for rooms with tremendous size, then you are not being realistic as that type of space doesn't exist in Amsterdam. On the other hand, the staff was very nice and accommodating. We enjoyed the pool.We enjoyed the location. We were able to walk everywhere. Would love to stay there again...
title: World class in the middle of Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 2 - 14, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This ranks as one of the biggest travel disappointments of my travel experiences. I travel extensively and know what grand, elegant, white-glove service is like. L'EUROPE may have been a destination hotel in the nineteenth century, but now it is tired, stuffy, dark, dreary, and flat. From the poor food on the outdoor terrace to the roaches in our bathroom nothing about this is experience has a silver lining. The woman server/bartender at the bar acted like this was the last place she wanted to be. Even the housekeeping staff dropped the ball as towels were not refreshed and soaps not replenished. When you add on top of this nose bleed prices it is time to retire this property. The Heineken family should know there is no fizz left in the bottle. Run, don't walk, away for L'EUROPE- Amsterdam has much better alternatives.
title: 5 stars out of a thousand

review: Not only did the hotel wow us with their amenities and comfortable accommodations, but they really saved me. I'll tell you how they went above and beyond what any hotel would do anywhere in the world... I left my phone/wallet including my license, work badge, and debit card in a restaurant on our last night in Amsterdam. We were leaving the next morning before the restaurant opened. At 1 in the morning, Niels packaged up instructions for the morning staff to call the restaurant, retrieve my belongings, and then ship it back to our home. They did all of it within 8 hours or so, and I safely received my package 7 days later. I will always stay at Hotel Estherea when I am in Amsterdam. Customer for life!!!
title: Beautiful hotel, awesome location, AMAZING STAFF

review: Wow, we were so impressed with our stay at Hotel Estherea. The location is great. The staff is lovely. The rooms are clean and beautiful. They offer complimentary tea and coffee. The hotel is lavishly decorated. The staff will help you book tours and they will hold your luggage if need be. I plan to stay here again when I return to Amsterdam!
title: Wonderful hotel!!!

review: Hotel Estherea is a Great hotel. the location is perfect, right on the Singel canal and close to all the attractions, markets & museums.Love the old fashion room keys with tassel, classy! The Breakfast buffet was delicious. we had it every morning . The staff was so courteous and helpful with information about Amsterdam. I highly recommend Hotel Estherea for the perfect classic hotel!!
title: WOW!!

review: A small family run hotel (92 rooms) overlooking the Singel canal at the front was the base for two nights in Amsterdam for my daughter and self. We chose a canal view room, quite a good size, beautifully decorated, each room is, I understand, a different colour scheme - nothing bland or neutral here. The foyer, lounge and library (yes!) are just gorgeous, with constant access to coffee, hot chocolate, and treats as well as options with water, all self serve. The best thing about Hotel Estherea is their attention to detail and willingness to accommodate their visitors needs. Nothing was too much trouble, even though we arrived hours before check-in time we were invited to enjoy coffee and treats while our room was made ready.
title: Location, great ambience, and welcoming staff

review: We just spent 4 nights at the elegant Hotel Estherea and were positively overwhelmed by everything! This small hotel is lovely, rooms are wonderfully appointed and uniquely decorated, staff is quick, knowledgeable and delightfully helpful. The value for the price is awesome. The tea room has all kinds of tea, coffee, fresh juices, and gourmet light snacks -- available 24/7, as is their beautiful bar. The drinks and bar food were delicious and affordable, too. I recommend their Mojito! We found we liked their bar better than any other bar around and this hotel's location is primo - close to everything - but on a quiet canal in a lovely neighborhood - just one block away from restaurants, shopping, public transportation, and two blocks from the Amsterdam Museum; 3 blocks to the Flower Market. Please don't stay there -- we don't want it to be booked solid the next time we try to make a reservation! Just kidding, but we will always stay at Hotel Estherea in the future!
title: Best kept secret!

review: I've never written a review before, but this Hotel deserves it! We have just returned from 4 wonderful nights at the Estherea having found the hotel after research on Trip Advisor.From the moment you walk through the door, you realise this hotel is something special. All the staff are friendly and attentive and simply can't do enough for you. There is a real sense of opulence and luxury about the hotel and attention to detail in both the lobby and rooms is fantastic! Nothing was too much trouble and the room (we travelled as a family of 3, 2 adults and a child) was amazing! The beds and pillows are so comfortable and greatly appreciated after a tiring day exploring the city. Everything you'll ever need is in the room from hairdryer to nespresso machine. Others have commented on the size of the bathroom, but ours was very large with double sinks and mirrors and a large bath and shower. Our room faced the orange courtyard but was quiet and very clean.The hotel is superbly situated and although we planned to use the trans to get to places, this wasn't necessary as everything was within walking distance. Even Central station is only fifteen minutes walk with cases! We took breakfast every morning and again this was superb. Wonderfully fresh squeezed orange juice, hot food buffet, selection of breads and amazing fresh fruit and chilled cheese and meat selection - yummy! Something fir everyone. The restaurant staff were so polite and extremely helpful. We loved our stay and can't wait to return!!
title: The best experience with attentive staff!

review: Stayed 4 nights with two rooms. Canal view room with small sitting area. Second room looked into what in NYC is called an air shaft. The canal that the hotel is sitting on is not the prettiest of the central canals so the view is so so. The canal view room has a tiny TV whereas the interior room has a large TV. I suppose the idea was if you can't look out the window you can at least watch TV. Limited cable by the way. Good spot. Near the old city and the fashionable western canal rings. You can walk to museums and central train (without bags). Breakfast full on buffet was great. Nice staff (they had to put up with so many complaints usually about nothing). Very nice canal ride from right in front (better than "Love" boats - that's a dutch name and the big tourist boat operator). Many good restaurants in area.
title: Elegant

review: We stayed in a junior suite as our daughter was travelling with us.The hotel is on the canal and central for all the main city attractions.The interior is sophisticated and well light with exotic plants and wallpaper.There is a small koi pond by the elevator.The bar is inviting and well designed.There is a free coffee facility in reception and there is always cakes and treats on the coffee area.The reception staff are very friendly.Our room was excellent with a small balcony overlooking the city.We would definitely recommend the hotel for a city break.Not cheap but worth it.
title: Beautiful oasis

review: My friend and I were put up by Airbnb at the last minute in the Orange Suite due to trouble with our original host and we literally could not have been happier to be here. I'll spare you the details, and suffice to say that from the moment the hotel staff member opened the door to our room we could not keep our cool. The hotel is within a five minute walk to Dam Square, and a short twenty minute walk to the Rijksmuseum. The breakfast was well worth it, with fresh squeezed orange juice and prosciutto. Staff was friendly and always willing to help us out. It's also right on the canal and very tastefully decorated. Our only complaint was that the suite was located on the ground floor and the foot traffic can be a little loud, but we were so exhausted we barely noticed.
title: Beautiful and well-located

review: 4 couples stayed here for 2 nights after finding on booking.com What a beautiful hotel. Decor is stunning. Rooms are typically narrow but lovely. 24/7 tea/coffee and treats. Staff are brilliant and will help with maps, tickets, tours, restaurant bookings and airport transfers.is a little on the pricey side but well worth it.Easy to walk to from centraal station and very close to Dam square.Would definitely stay again.
title: Wonderful stay

review: This is a wonderful small boutique hotel in a great location in Amsterdam. We stayed here 2 years ago and found it to be warm friendly and comfortable. The have enlarged the bar area for evening enjoyment now and added a coffee/tea bar and goodies 24/7. It only made the hotel better. This is a great location. We took the train from the airport, where we stored our big bags and walked to the hotel with backpacks.
title: Second time around and even better!

review: Due to the reviews from TripAdvisor we booked this hotel for three days . Definitely well worth it. The staff was amazing and went out of their way to help book museums, restaurants, and give us directions . The staff spoke fluent English. The hotel bar was magnificent plus beautiful and well decorated in a very unique and elegant way . The hotel is located in a perfect part of town where you you can walk to all the attractions, museums and restaurants.
title: Accommodating and quaint

review: Elegantly decorated, friendly service, good bed, good breakfast. Because of construction under my apartment I stayed a night in this hotel near my place. I was pleasantly surprised how nice this hotel was. Also good value. I booked direct with the hotel, which saved a lot of money compared to the booking sites.
title: Good value, friendly service

review: We had a deluxe room overlooking the canal. The room was luxuriously appointed with a small chandelier over the bed and a nice sitting area. The bath was compact but nice. The lobby is very inviting and always had pastries, cookies or sweets out. Great breakfast and service.
title: Classic Hotel on the Inner Canal Ring

review: Stayed in August 2016 - a very well located hotel with beautiful rooms and helpful staff. The free cakes and tea are that little touch that makes the stay even more memorable. It was also great value for money. Would recommend.
title: Weekend break

review: After disembarking our Celebrity Silhouette cruise ship, we checked into the Hotel Estherea. I thought we must be in the wrong place. It was so beautiful, elegant and luxurious! It's very small, being three townhouses combined, but it is gorgeous, warm and friendly. The staff was wonderful and we loved every minute. Thank you for a great stay!
title: Baltic Sea Cruise

review: We had a wonderful four nights at Hotel Estherea and I would highly recommend this hotel. The cleaning staff kept the rooms wonderfully clean. The check-in / concierge staff were all super helpful and couldn't do enough to make sure the stay was excellent. The coffee and afternoon snacks is a wonderful treat. The morning breakfast was of great quality and enjoyable each day. The rooms and common areas are all beautifully decorated. A truly wonderful hotel.
title: Wonderful hotel with great facilities and staff

review: We booked into the Hotel Estherea in Amsterdam at the start of a long European adventure. It was pricey, but so worth it. First of all, on checking in, we were informed we were being upgraded to a Superior room, which turned out to be a canal-view room. What a pleasure to open the curtains in the morning to look out on the Singel canal with its canal boats tied up below. One abiding memory of this hotel is the decor - completely over the top, but it works. Our room was like a tropical pleasure garden, all yellow, green and orange. The bathroom was tiny but functional. The staff were pleasant and helpful.The best thing was the hotel's proximity to the entertainment, shopping and restaurant area, as well as easy access to the main attractions and the railway station.We heartily recommend Hotel Estherea for an enjoyable stay in Amsterdam.
title: A jewel of a hotel

review: Highly recommend. I spent 6 nights here touring Amsterdam and other areas. The hotel is on a quiet street within walking distance to most attractions. Tons of shops and restaurants nearby. Yes the first day I was annoyed to leave my key at the desk when you leave but that subsided. What a treat to walk and tour all day and come back to a beautiful lobby with coffee/ hot chocolate etc and treats to eat. As others have said, lobby has chocolates and treats (cake, cookies) out for the taking. Breakfast was lovely and delicious. Bathrooms are very small but completely updated. We had a canal view room. It was quiet and bed so comfortable. Frankly this was the perfect hotel for Amsterdam and I highly recommend.
title: Lovely hotel in great location

review: This is a beautiful and elegant hotel in a great location in Amsterdam. The interior of the common areas is stunning with its old world elegance. The bedrooms are nicely appointed. There is a great bar with pleasant service people.
title: Elegant and traditional hotel

review: I was in Amsterdam alone for a week and split my stay here and at a more modern hotel. This hotel was gorgeous! One of the best beds ever and gorgeous bathroom products, opening windows, cakes and coffee complimentary throughout the day...Just gorgeous. I recommended it to my friend 3 months later in peak season and it was 4 x what I paid. Just goes to show what it is worth.Would stay again!
title: Really loved my time here!

review: We stopped in Amsterdam after a 12 day cruise. I had found hotel estherea by doing research and would highly recommend to anyone traveling to beautiful Amsterdam.Hotel is centrally located, tastefully decorated, has beautifully appointed rooms with comfy beds and extremely courteous staff.Breakfast and bar are a plus and lobby area is spacious, with 3 to 4 rooms with everything in ur living room ( computer printer and books) they always had water, refreshments and snacks on hand during the day.I will definitely be back. Book directly with hotel when you reserve rooms..that way you get later checkout (2 vs 12) and cheaper breakfast rates.
title: Best hotel of our two week tour

review: Hotel was fantastic, we started in a patio room, which was over looking a light well view was very poor. Had to keep the curtains closed at all times. The room was change at no additional cost to one one the fifth floor. A room with fantastic decor light and airy. The whole hotel is decorated to a very high standard.Breakfast, the range of food was excellent.The hotel staff were very helpful would recommend this hote; if we return to Amsterdam we will re-book.
title: Short Break

review: Beautiful hotel with decorations worth a stop to appreciate, courteous staff that is always there with a smile, comfortable rooms including the bed with nice view of canal, they offer an airport pickup that we were unaware of, but will try next time
title: Fantastic

review: Stayed two nights at the end of a long river cruise and loved it. Centrally located and within easy walking distance to great restaurants. The Spui tram stop is a 1-2 min. walk depending on how many time you must stop to dodge bicycles making the Museumplein a cinch to reach. Our room on Floor 3 (level 4) was beautifully appointed and faced the canal. The bed and linens were first rate and the bathroom was extraordinary. Lots of nice touches like candies and cookies available all day in the lobby. The staff was uniformly charming and helpful. Staying here is the perfect antidote to mediocre tourist hotels. Do yourself a favor and give it a try.
title: Beautiful and comfortable small hotel

review: Stayed here as our daughter was working in Amsterdam and we were visiting for a long weekend and had things to see before we met up with her.Super location walkable to where we needed to go and well known enough to ensure the uber drivers could pick us up and drop us back.Well appointed room but due to the age of the building a slightly unusual layout but the bed was superb.They had just refurbished the bar area which is very nice when we were there and husband and daughters boyfriend watch the rugby in my iPad while my daughter and I sampled the cocktail menu which was very good. Unfortunately due to the layout the nice big comfy table couldn't be seen from the bar but once you got their attention they were friendly and helpful.Good hotel would go back.
title: Good hotel good location

review: This is a beautiful hotel on a lovely canal.The elegant charm is mixed with modern convenience most travelers would expect. My husband and I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights before boarding our Viking River Cruise. Check-in was quick and easy. All hotel staff we encountered during our stay spoke English and were quite helpful. The huge brass room key is accompanied by a key card that unlocks you room's door. If you leave the hotel, you drop your key by the front desk, and retrieve it upon returning to the hotel. We had no issues or long waits with this. We had a room on the second floor overlooking the canal. I would recommend a canal view room. It was quiet and one of the expansive windows opened to allow for fresh air to come in. The A/C system is a mini machine by US standards, but the temperatures do not call for a turbo A/C. There was a large duvet and a rather rough bed spread on the double bed in our room. I would have enjoyed if a flat sheet was included in the bedding. Otherwise, the bed was not only beautiful, but also quite comfortable despite its diminutive size. Two water bottles are replenished daily in a rather large wall beverage fridge. It seems like a rather large system to fill with two measly bottles of water. The bathroom in our room was extremely small but well equipped and it appeared to have been recently renovated. The tub/shower combo was tight, as was the small sink, toilet and vanity. Louvered, full length swinging double doors served as the bathroom door. There is no bathroom fan. L'Occitane soaps, shampoo, conditioner and shower wash are available. A small bath salt cube was also included one of the two nights. The towels in the bathroom were somewhat of a disappointment compared to the overall quality of the hotel. The were rough, and did not scream 'luxury'. The blow dryer had a plate that slid from side to side to expose either a European two pronged or a standard American corded plug. Upon registration, you are lead to your room by a staff member. There is a small elevator and steep stairs in the hotel. You will be left with a hotel IPad and I recommend you read the hotel information included on it, and look at the nearby tourist attractions explained on the device, too. The hotel refreshments are delightful! Flavored water or a slightly sweetened tea or lemonade were elegantly displayed in the hotel lobby with an array of cookies, chocolates, tea biscuits & surprises for the guests to grab and enjoy in the nearby bar or in one of the many chairs or sofas nearby. Additionally, there is an automated coffee, tea, espresso, hot chocolate, latte, etc. machine in the lobby area. To-Go cups are supplied, so you may grab a cup of Joe before heading out for the day or you may whip up a cup of camomile tea as I did to enjoy during a good, long soak in the bath tub.You must have drink in the hotel bar! It is over the top beautiful, and I had a fabulous bowl of asparagus soup there. The prices for the bar food were reasonable for better than average bar food. The complimentary nuts & olives also helped to make the visit extra special. The television in the room was minuscule and quite far from the bed. We were so busy and there were a only a couple of American channels provided, so we did not bother turning it on. The biggest negative we experienced was the spotty 'free wifi'. There were periods of time where we were dropped 4-5 times in an hour! We intended on having the breakfast buffet at the hotel, but we slept in too late. We did have the desk store our luggage and then call us a taxi to our Viking Boat which cost us 20Euros. The hotel strives to create a very positive experience for its guests.
title: Location, Luxury, & Lagging Wifi

review: We loved everything about the hotel - there was nothing to be faulted.It's a bit unfair to name two of the staff members - they were all so good - but Martin and Eric on arrival and check in stood out.We had a fantastic room on the 4th floor. The room was larger than we expected and it was really great to have a separate bathroom ( shower and bath ) and toilet.The breakfast was superb and well priced for the buffet ( full selection of hot and cold breakfasts), at 13 euro.The bar is so eclectic and very beautifully done.The 24 hour access to the coffee / hot chocolate machines in the lobby ( with biscuits and other snacks ) is a bonus - we didn't use the Nespresso machine in the room once.The hotel is perfectly positioned, within easy walking distance to any of the major sites. It's about 400 m from Dam. There are numerous, good restaurants within 50 to 100 m from the hotel.This is one of the best hotels we have stayed in. We prefer smaller boutique hotels to the larger chains and Estherea fits the bill perfectly.
title: What a spectacular hotel

review: Singel Canal is an amazing location, with Flower Market at one end and Central Station the other. Has red light brothels, cafes and restaurants, churches and arts - eclectic like all of The Netherlands. Our Delux rooms were a decent size, some with spa! Ordinary rooms, you would struggle to have two suitcases open at the same time. Staff are brilliant! Decor is extravagant. OLD WORLD CHARM. Elevators, 2 minute taxi service. Can't fault the place.
title: Location PLUS

review: My wife and I booked three nights at the hotel.We love boutique hotels but Hotel Estherea was perfect !!It starts with the service and attitude of all the staff, always welcoming, pleasant and at a high level of service.The room was beautiful and decorated and the bed was very comfortable.The coffee and cookies area in the lobby is really pleasant, and the breakfast is very tasty.If you want to enjoy Amsterdam and not just the city then this is the hotel for you ..
title: perfect!!

review: Right on the singel canal and right opposite the 9 sts shopping precinct this hotel is in a great spot The decor is exceptional and every room is beautifully appointedIt is actually a treat to hang out in the lounge or bar where you can have very nice cocktails Breakfast is excellent but the coffee pod machine makes horrible coffee which is such a pity for an Australian visitor .You can buy good coffee around the corner though!!
title: A lovely hotel

review: We stayed two night at the Hotel Estherea. It is located in the heart of Amsterdam, and we walked everywhere. The hotel lobby was gorgeous and the bar and restaurant were very good. They have a free coffe/expression machine in the lobby that was great and made really good coffees and lattes, etc. The room was quaint and beautifully decorated. The bathroom was large and updated. The only negatives were the free wifi and the noise outside on the street. The wifi dropped constantly and very frustrating to use.. Our room was on the backside of the hotel, ant the street was quiet when we checked in. That changed dramatically in the evening and was very noisy late into the night. I recommend a room on the front or interior of the hotel.
title: Beautiful hotel

review: My friends and I stayed at Hotel Estherea for three nights as a stopover prior to visiting Africa. The hotel was lovely. They serve coffee, lattes and tea in the foyer along with delicious biscuits! The hotel is centrally located and we were able to walk everywhere. On my first night a group of people decided to have a party on the street below my window so my first night was not restful (although the room was lovely) The following day I requested a room change and the desk staff could not have been more accommodating. The hotel also provided me with an electrical adaptor as none of the three I had with me were compatible. I would certainly return to this hotel in the future. Highly recommend.
title: Beautiful, centrally located hotel

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: A fantastic 5 star hotel in the 'business hub' of Amsterdam. Above the usual Crowne Plaza standard with spacious, comfy, quiet and clean bedrooms. Bar and restaurant were friendly, nice atmosphere and varied menu and drink list.WARNING (!) - Car park is €60 for the night. As I was on a family trip (couldn't put on business expenses!) this was a real shock when checking out. So moral of the story is FANTASTIC hotel - don't take your car!
title: One of the best hotels I have stayed in.

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: very nice approach of the hotel staff, nice, clean and quiet hotel. even if not in centre, easily to get there by metro (15 minutes ride, direct line Zuit station). you can buy tickets at the hotel reception (3days ticket for €17). RAI exhibition centre is about 13 minutes by metro (3 min walk to metro, 2 min in the metro, 8 minutes walk to RAI), by taxi it is about 5 min (€10). There are offices area nearby the hotel (quick snacks, restaurants, food shop). Schiphol airport is about 25 minutes drive (taxi €40)
title: going for an exhibition to Amsterdam RAI? good place to stay in

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My husband and I wanted a quiet getaway but unfortunately on Saturday the construction started at 7 am. I had asked for a quiet room and indeed inside the hotel it was, but the construction noise is very loud. The bedroom was comfortable and the only downside was the safe that did not work and we found the towels not up to a 4 star standard. Staff around the hotel very friendly!
title: Friendly staff and Noisy construction across the street

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It's vey good hotel and our room was suite it's very nice and comfortable... some help desk staff was very bad and they don't have customer service skills ... Hotel managers should look for this pointe ..
title: Bad staff

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here in May for two nights, Saturday and Sunday. Check in was quick and efficient and the staff could not be nicer. The room on the 9th floor was large with a very deep tub and excellent bathroom. Nice touch of aromotherapy sprays for the pillows. We went for my birthday and was given a small treat of waffles and some chocolates which was very thoughtful. Left bags in the afternoon until the flight home. Not in the centre put the train from the aiprort took ten minutes, ten mintue walk to the hotel from the Zuid station. From Zuid the number 5 metro took you all the way to the centre. Excellent option if the centre is too busy or expensive. Breakfast was shocking at 27euros per person per day so we didn't try this out. Would recommend.
title: Beautiful hotel

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Really good hotel. Staff very helpful. Room and facilities excellent. Lunch buffet could offer more varied options. But overall excellent hotel. Good location, but taxi needed. Bar exclellent - facilities for gym, although I did not partake !!!!
title: Business conference

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights with my family ,it was very clean and big hotel ,the room was big and clean enough ,the breakfast was very good but the worst point about this hotel was the location ,it is out of city and you should use train to get to city center which is difficult
title: Bad Location

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We were so glad we chose this hotel, just out of town and in a business district that had plenty of good restaurants and bars and was very handy to the station. It also gave us easy access to Schipol Airport and the Keukenhof Garden.
title: Very comfortable hotel just out of town

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Crowne plaza is located in a quiet neighborhood in Amsterdam Zuid. Good place for sleeping, and decent breakfast. Easy to get around the city by public transport, and convenient location for getting to and from the airport. Good service.
title: Nice hotel in the business district of Amsterdam

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel and the staff exceeded our expectations during a 3 night stay in the area. The rooms are spotlessly clean and well appointed. Located in the business district just minutes from the local train & metro stations, ideal for travel both to the city and airport. The breakfast was amazing and evening dinner was exceptional. Highly recommend.
title: Excellent hotel

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel and very helpful staff. Room 204 was clean and we were well taken care of. I had issues to get the in room coffee machine to work. Breakfast was nice and the restaurant had a nice view over the channel. I would only hope they kept the food preparation area cleaner, that was not hygienic at all.
title: Long weekend

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: As a IHG Elite member we have been lucky enough to stay at a number of Crowne Plaza hotels and I really have to say Amsterdam South is our number one following our family weeks stay from the 23rd July until the 30th July 2017.Our rooms on the 8th and 9th floors were perfect, had everything we needed, were quiet and were impeccably cleaned and made up every day. When the hairdryer broke just one call to reception and a replacement was in the room within minutes... a crisis diverted. The meal choices were all you could ask for with breakfast and dinner within the hotel providing excellent choice and quality of food presentations. It surpassed even our high expectations. Congratulations to all concerned.All of us would very much like to thank everyone on the Front Desk and Housekeeping for providing great customer service and those little touches that mean so much to a guest. We would like to highly recommend Angela, Cindy and Annelieve (Hovenor) for exceptional client/guest service at every breakfast time and Michael behind the hot plates..... they deserve individual recognition Miss Turnhout-Ammerlaan.I'm not certain why other contributors have criticised the hotels location. Yes its outside of the City centre, but you know this before you make a reservation. It is perfect for the peace and quiet it brings and its location within the business district gives one a great insight into the modern architectural building designs being brought into the area.A five minute stroll from the hotel in one direction and you can catch the very regular number 5 tram into the centre in about 20 minutes and in the other direction for another 5 minute stroll places you into Amsterdam South rail station which gives you choices to reach many other parts of Amsterdam and regular buses. It also has a direct link right into Schiphol Airport... perfect!!All in all I cant believe anyone would be unhappy or unsettled here. The hotel is great, the staff superb, ambience relaxing and it is an excellent hub to explore this beautiful City. If you don't know or don't have, then ask... they will sort for you.Now you know Miss Turnhout - Ammerlaan, our many congratulations on your success with the CP Amsterdam South!Thank you.
title: .... Nicole Turnhout - Ammerlaan, you need to know.........

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We were visiting Amsterdam to celebrate some special birthdays and chose a this hotel to treat ourselves...we weren't disappointed! The rooms were very comfortable, with everything you could need to enhance your stay. What made it for us though was the attitude of the staff. All were friendly, efficient and very helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
title: Brilliant!

hotelLocation: George Gershwinlaan 101, 1082 MT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: A lovely hotel, outside the main tourist area but connections are really easy. We had access to the lounge too which was nice. A lovely breakfast too. We hired bikes which was great fun and easy to use
title: Stunning.

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here on a weekend break, absolutely loved the location and our view overlooking a canal. Our room was spacious and nicely furnished, the bathroom the same. The public areas were very nice, Serre restaurant was great for a light lunch and the breakfast was one of the best I've ever had at a hotel. A visit to Twenty Third Bar is recommended if you get the chance.
title: Great hotel in a great location

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Our tour company's choice, this is a sleek luxury hotel but further from central city than we'd choose (though there's a tram stop almost opposite and we used taxis to save time). Our room was as stylish and tastefully decorated as you'd expect, and windows (with electric blinds) onto the bathroom gave the impression of even greater space. The bed was perfect and the large picture window gave us a lovely view of a small canal. Staff were very helpful and the buffet breakfast was excellent.
title: A luxury hotel but not central

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This was our second year we stayed at the Okura and we were not disappointed! The hotel is impeccable! The lobby is beautifully decorated in a subtle Asian influence. We stayed in the executive level and had the most amazing canal view room and had no problem drinking the good wines and Japanese beers from the lounge after our long walks through the city and my crazy fun shopping escapades. The hotel is located in a great location that has a lot of ex-pats along with amazing bars and restaurants. They have a really nice and modern gym along with very knowledgeable trainers. We really enjoyed Adinia, this gal was beyond fit and great to chat with! We cannot wait to go back...one to stay at the Okura and of course to visit my Dutch family :) the highlight of our return trip was meeting up with Michael who works in guest service....this man is the absolute best! He has the best restaurant recommendations and knowledge of the area, we will miss him!
title: The Gem in De Pijps!

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here one night as our main hotel we were spending a few days in was booked out for the first night. This hotel was really a great surprise. We thought it would just be a corporate business hotel feel but the service was warm and welcoming, rooms spacious, and the japanese restaurant a must try.
title: wonderful hotel

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Lovely hotel Will definitely come back. Staff very helpful and knowledgeable about local transport and attractions.  The room was exceptionally well equipt. The bed was turned down and slippers provided along with a bookmark. The room had a great city view.
title: One night stay

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: i arrived in Amsterdam on my first trip to Europe and stayed for three nights in this wonderful hotel. It's conveniently located close to major tourist attractions. I like to have a healthy breakfast and my needs were met with a buffet selection of an extensive variety of cereals, seeds, fruits and vegetables.
title: Highly recommended hotel.

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here for two nights before we joined our river boat vacation, and it was wonderful. Attentive staff, well appointed rooms, with very comfortable beds. Huge breakfast buffet, two other restaurants. Close enough to the old city to walk, and an interesting area. Ask for a room that faces the canal, and you'll really feel like you're in Amsterdam!
title: Fabulous place, great breakfast options!

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at the Okura for the second time in July for our 7th wedding anniversary this year. We first visited three years ago and had such find memories that we thought we'd try it again-we're so pleased we did! It's such a beautiful and stylish hotel and in the best location. The surrounding area has numerous bars, restaurants and coffee shops and a tram line almost right outside, so you don't have to go right into the Centre if you don't want to. We emailed the hotel to tell them it was our anniversary prior to going and they couldn't have done more to make it special for us. They upgraded our room to a suite which was absolutely beautiful- very large with living room area and fabulous bathroom with tv, huge shower and bath. They also left a cake and fresh rose in our room which was a lovely welcome. Having an upgraded room allows you access to the 'Executive Lounge' which is completely worth upgrading for! Lovely lounge room with great views, complimentary alcohol, soft drinks, snacks, tea, coffee, papers and Internet - very welcome after a long day or sightseeing!!The concierge were absolutely brilliant and recommended the perfect restaurants, attractions and provided us with tram tickets.Nothing bad to say about the Okura at all. Really lovely hotel, brilliant location, amazing staff and a very special place! Can't wait to go back!
title: Perfect anniversary stay ❤️ Okura impresses again!

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel is average with decent sushi restaurant but reception has no manners. When I was checking in, the reception worker was chatting with someone not working in the hotel and mentioned my nationality to the friend in Dutch. I don't know what else they were talking about but I felt they were mocking me for some reason.
title: Unpleasant reception

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel has everything from three restaurants with together 4 Michelin stars to excellent service. We had booked two rooms at the executive level with access to the lounge, and everything was nearly perfect. So why not 5 dots? The two rooms were very different. One had a big bright bathroom overlooking the city and the other a dark small one. The two rooms had everything you need including the latest technology. But to be picky. The curtains didn't shut out the light and I wish for a more soundproof room. Would I stay here again? Yes on business or with kids, but not as a couple. Next time in Amsterdam as a couple I will be closer to the old town in a old charming hotel.
title: Present stay

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: although it was a bit further away from the center we were extremely pleased with the hotel , the room was comfortable ,clean and they checked us in early in the day . we used the pool a couple of times and found lots of great local places to eat nearby. The breakfast buffett was out standing with so many items both hot and cold to choose from we would definatly stay here again if we returned to Amsterdam
title: 2 day stay before River Cruise

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: De luxe room on 18th floor very spacious with view across city and a beautiful bathroom. Breakfast was excellent and service was also top notch. Staff all friendly and very helpful with directions and trams etc.. Stayed 2 nights and would recommend this hotel.
title: Oriental Luxury

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My husband and I spent three nights at this hotel in July of 2017. Everything about this hotel was wonderful. We arrived early from the United States - around 9am - and we were given a large corner room with a king size bed, two large picture windows, a huge bathroom with a shower and bathtub and there was a small table with two chairs in our room. The bed was comfortable. The room was cleaned every day. There was a coffee maker in the room. The front desk staff was very helpful - showing me on a map how to get to certain locations and what bus to use to get to specific locations. This hotel has an indoor pool and gym which are both great. There are restaurants in the hotel. One of the restaurants overlooks a canal and it was enjoyable to have dinner there and watch all the boats on the canal. This hotel is within walking distance of the museum distance and some nearby parks. We had an early airplane flight and the front desk staff arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport. When in Amsterdam again, my husband and I would stay again at this hotel.
title: Three Night Stay - great location and great staff

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is one hotel that definitely deserves its rating. The facility is beautiful. My room was so comfortable, and the extra amenities, like a bathrobe and slippers, were great. I loved the turndown service. They definitely made me feel like royalty. It's not the most exciting part of Amsterdam, but it's beautiful. I really enjoyed going for a walk in the late afternoon along the quiet canals that front their property. And you can get to some more bustling areas with a decent walk, or a short tram or bus ride. Not hard to get to the airport either. I was only there one night, so I only got to experience one of their dining facilities. I couldn't afford the two Michelin star rated restaurant on the top floor, but I could get some of their appetizers at the bar next-door. Some of the best food I have eaten in my life! Take advantage of that option if you can't go to the restaurant itself. And there are three other restaurants there that certainly seemed like they were the best choices in the area. So if you have a long stay, take advantage of this fantastic hotel.
title: Great hotel, great staff

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We booked an executive room for a couples trip to explore Amsterdam. Check in at the hotel was great and most of the staff were friendly throughout our stay. Facilities at the hotel are ok, but not great. It tries too hard with gimmicks - such as in the gym - but lacks substance. The Executive Lounge was a big disappointment and brought no real benefit. Room service was lacklustre and expensive. The room had nice views but decor and facilities were dated. Overall it was an ok stay, but not great value for money and we wouldn't return.
title: Really helpful staff but disappointing hotel

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I just had one night in this lovely hotel. With my lhw membership I got a really nice room on 16th floor. Fantastic view of the city. Nice top floor bar and two highly recommended restaurants. Fantastic service. 感謝
title: Supergreat

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: While the amenities & rooms at this hotel are all very good, especially the pool and sauna area of the Spa, the real winner for this hotel is the staff.We arrived after a 24hr ordeal from Sydney where both my Son & wife had suffered some level of flight sickness etc, so we were pretty shattered.It was also 6:30am but the reception staff were so polite & helpful in sorting out our needs that we felt like we had come home.While there was no room ready they took care of our luggage & checked us in so all we had to do was wander back in at midday when they promised they would have a room ready. And that is exactly what happened.The hotel staff throughout our stay continued this level of good humoured helpfulness & made this one of the most pleasant hotels we have ever stayed in.Thanks guys, you were great.
title: Jet Lag Doctors

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed here and I was surprised how the staff treated us. They were outstanding and very welcoming. It's by one of the cleanest hotels i have been to. The rooms where spacious and very cosy. I stayed for two nights and loved every minute while I was here. Thanks to all the staffs.
title: One of the best in Amsterdam!

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My Sister and I enjoyed a very pleasant whilst visting Amsterdam, We found it easy access in to the city centre and tram services. Room was clean, light and comfortable, staff very helpful and hotel facilities make it extra special
title: Really lovely Stay

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Okura Amsterdam is well, though not totally centrally located in Amsterdam. This is not necessarily a bad thing, because you are a bit away from the tourist crowds that 'take' the city and get the chance to explore quieter streets around the hotel. In any event, there are various small restaurants and stores within a 5' walk.The hotel is modern, well kept and clean. It stands out a bit, as it's the tallest building in its neighborhood, but that can also mean good views for you.Rooms are sized right - certainly not too big, but I did not feel constrained in any way either. The Nespresso machine with six daily capsules are a nice touch.The front desk was a bit slow for my taste, but that may have to do with my checking in and out at peak times and receptionists taking their time to make detailed explanations to other guests. Maybe an automated checkin/-out process would be a good idea for those just wanting no further information.
title: Well-located modern high end hotel

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It's what you expect from a5 star hotel. Nice and quiet very close to the Pijp area which we enjoy. For the center it's a bit of a walk. The Michelin star restaurant is nice but for me a bit over the top. We had a super somoliere and waiter. He really made our evening, thank you
title: Indoor pool and gym are very nice

hotelLocation: Ferdinand Bolstraat 333, 1072 LH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: What a great hotel. Staff was top notch, location perfect and the hotel restaunts are Michelin rated for a reason.The Hotel is a nice walk along the canal to the museums and shopping. There a whole bunch of local cafes and such around the hotel. Spa was booked but the pool was nice.Will be back !!
title: Only place to stay in Amsterdam

review: Our hotel recommended the lobby restaurant at the Nesplein hotel. It was a delicious way to start the day in a lovely and comfy "living room" style space. As always, the service in Amsterdam is top notch.
title: Wonderful breakfast!

review: Love the boutique feel of this hotel, great location and room was great (stayed 305). I stay 1-2 nights per week in Amsterdam and the staff here far outweigh all the other hotels I've stayed in. Attentive, friendly and very efficient. Breakfast was outstanding, really enjoyed the change from the usual buffet style, the eggs benedict I can highly recommend!
title: Stunning boutique hotel, will return

review: The hotel is very well located just off the busy Dam square but down the quiet and more refined Nes plein so best of both worlds. The staff are young and trendy but friendly and very knowledgeable and happy to siggest places to visit, restaurants or lend you a brolly. We had a Designer Suite that was a good size, quirkily designed (though slightly inconvenient shape) but proved comfortable and quiet for a 3 day stay. The bathroom was very smart, a very powerful shower and unusual black toilet. The restaurant food was superb and again staff here and in the bar were fab. My only criticism was that it was a shame more seats werent available outside and were often marked reserved so everyone was too crammed together and one evening we went to the bar next door instead.Overall a very stylish, comfortable and luxurious stay
title: Retro, designer luxury & lovely staff

review: I stayed here on a family Europe trip from July 17th, 2017-July 22nd, 2017. I found this hotel to be great and it exceeded my expectations. We picked this hotel because we heard boutique hotels are great here and this one had really good reviews. This hotel is very small and I love that. It only has about 43 rooms and only 4 floors including the lobby. This hotel is also within walking distance to just about all of Amsterdam's attractions. There is also not to much foot or bike traffic where the hotel is since it is a little off of the beaten path, it is good to come back here and have a break from all of that. Our room was clean and very nice. The staff was also great. This hotel also has a good on site restaurant. I have no complaints on this hotel. Keep it up Hotel V! I would totally recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to or through the Amsterdam area.
title: Nice Tucked Away Hotel

review: Location: Excellent. A ten minute walk away from the heart of the RLD, but secluded street the hotel exists in, shields you from the more rowdy party-goers.Appearance: Quaint little hotel with glitzy little touches. The decor will not be to everyone's taste ( I personallyprefer a more traditional approach to interior decoration)- but that is a minor quibble.Cleanliness: My experience is that the hotel was extremely clean when i visited. Both the common areas as well as the rooms, including the bathroom.Facilities: As expected- coffee available in the room- iron and ironing board upon request.Service: Fantastic! Highly evident that judgement of the staff's attitude has played its part during the recruitment process. Elena in particular requires a special mention. Her extremely pleasant attitude and readiness to help with minor queries and requests impressed me quite a bit. Both the morning staff did their bits as well.Value for money: i am not exactly sure, in terms of bang for your buck. Just a shade too expensive, is my opinion.Would i return: Gladly. The overall experience ensures it is worth it.Would i recommend the place: based on everything but the price- of course!
title: Very close to five star service

review: This welcoming boutique hotel is located in a quiet side street just off Dam Square, combining tranquility with a truly central location. The hotel team was friendly and efficient and the food in the "Lobby" restaurant truly delicious.
title: Beautifully quirky decor and friendly staff

review: We had a wonderful time, the design of the hotel and the location in the center of Dam, was great .The hotel staff are very courteous and welcoming.We ordered breakfast in advance, breakfast is from the menu, and it was superior.The hotel restaurant is wonderful ,we loved the atmosphere and the food. Everything was extraordinary.
title: ”amazig hotel”

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Awesome.Breakfast was amazing. They even rmoved crusts from my toast! Very attentive staff, couldn't do enough for,you.Shame it was a. It noises outside during the. Night, But that's not the hotels fault
title: One. Night stay

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Right at the heart of Amsterdam, 2min walk from Rembrandt square and 5min from Dam square, you have it all. Boutique hotel, centrally located but very away from the noise.Very stylish. Good amenities. The Bonus: ask a room at the fifth floor (preferably a corner room) - you get your own balcony with amazing view of the city!
title: You gotta live this one

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My friend and I had stayed there for 8 days. Definitely will come again.The room is clean and comfortable. Their staff are nice and friendly, they tried every effort to help us to solve the travelling problems and give us advise. The hotel is just beside the canal and you can enjoy a good view from the view but please note it may be a little bit noisy at night at there are bars nearby. Overall, this is a good place to stay in AMS.
title: Good place to stay in AMS.

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I visited NH Collection Amsterdam Doelen, the hotel was a lot better than other hotels I had stayed at in Amsterdam. The hotel is very stylish. It's central and close to all major attractions. The breakfasts were ok. Concierge was not very attentive and not always available when you were looking for them. Book a superior room with a view. Without a view they face the street and are a bit noisy.
title: Overall a nice hotwl

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is really beautiful, and the breakfast, which was part of my rate, was really amazing, and the staff have been really helpful.The only downside was their air-condition or rather lack of it.Rather than standard air-condition they have "climate control" which brings cool air naturally.I was on the top floor, in the attic.The weather was not extremely hot (high 27 C / 80 F) but the room got very hot.They did give me an air ventilator, which somewhat helped.I have no idea what would have been the condition if it really got hot.
title: perfect, except for the air-condition!

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed at the NH Collection Amsterdam Doelen from July 3 - July 5. It was centrally located in a nice part of Amsterdam. The staff was helpfully and friendly and the Hotel was extremely clean and well taken care of. Apparently renovations to the hotel were recently done. The only drawback was the room which was small even by European standards. There was no place to put my suitcase very little around the bed. The wash basin and bathroom were in separate places. I'd stay there again if the room was more like what was in the trip advisor pictures.
title: Central, unusually small room

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Holiday trip with kids. I ordered 2 rooms for 6 nights. Reading all the reviews I was certain I had a great place to stay.First night. Aircondition did not work. The staff are well trained to apologize coz all they said was we could get you a fan for tonight. Is that why I am paying full price?We moved rooms the next day.Now it's the fifth night and yet again the airconditioner is not working.What a nightmare this hotel is and as nice as the staff is, it is completely NOT what is expected.If your time,holiday and money is dear to you do NOT approach this hotel.
title: Always technical problem

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Charming hotel. Great location, friendly staff and lovely view. Got off on a bit of a bad start as we took 3 rooms and although our kids individual rooms were fine, our room that was bigger had everything fine except that it was very very hot. Trouble with the air conditioning/ climate control.However the next day we were moved into a much bigger and better room ( a suite i think) with a beautiful view and a perfectly cool and crisp atmosphere. No more complains from there on. The staff were nice and friendly. Breakfast was served in a beautiful restaurant with a lovely view again. Downside maybe was the noise at night from the young holiday makers over the bridge.Personally it didn't bother me much. I loved the view and the ambience.
title: Nice hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Beautiful hotel, modern rooms with air conditioning, clean but cosy room with lovely canal view. Excellent position near the flower market.Would definitely stay there again.Very helpful and friendly staff.
title: Lovely hotel n excellent location

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It's an okay hotel, room size was decent and the bed was very comfy. Friendly and welcoming staff with professional concierge.Entered the room and found 3-4 bugs on the bed with another 2-3 around the windows - we didn't find this pleasant either.AC was okay during the day but always hot at night, no one bothered to fix it?Breakfast selection is very limited and takes them ages to deliver your omelet and/or pancakes from the kitchen (although it was almost empty! i must admit that the pancakes are worth the wait though).The capacity at the breakfast area is limited so expect to be welcomed with a 'you can wait a while for a table' which was the first time i experience such a thing at any hotel i have ever visited; they normally seat you immediately and they should have at least offered us to sit in the bar seating area which is right next to the breakfast area.All in all, found the hotel decent but over priced for sure and i'm not sure what's the hype in the reviews about the location as we didn't see anything special about it.Would we stay here again? Nop!
title: Over priced. Wouldn't stay there again

hotelLocation: Nieuwe Doelenstraat 26, 1012 CP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I can’t even start to express the most beautiful experience we had this short 4 day trip. Thanks to Gillian and Sven, I have no words possible to express my gratitude towards them. The hotel so gorgeous, the employees so sweet making you feel part of the family, helping us out with site seeing tours, tickets to museums, anything we needed during our stay. Making my 50th birthday the most memorable one. The room with gorgeous sites of Amstel canal and their typical houses making our window room into it a magnificent postcard. The bed was delicious to get into and not wanting to leave. Clean, clean over clean. The hotel surprised us with a birthday cake that was absolutely delicious. My fiancée asked Gillian and Seven, fully trusting them, to reserve a romantic dinner to celebrate and end our escape birthday trip to surprise me. We found the reservation in our room, on top of our bed surrounded by silk rose petals. Daadler Restaurant Oh my! Oh my! Oh my!!! Delicious, 9! Yes 9-plate course!!!! I literally cried of happiness of this surprise trip. Thank you so so much Gillian, Sven, for making and being part of my 50th birthday I will cherish forever. We are already planning our return trip here.
title: HOTEL FULL OF HEART

review: Chose this hotel because of its location, price and previous reviews. I wasn't disappointed. We walked all over the downtown area. The canals were amazing. Lots of shopping, sights and restaurants nearby. The hotel was clean and really decorated nicely. Breakfast was great and plentiful. The staff were all helpful. They gave us directions to sights, restaurants and even offered us breakfast when we checked in early. They were a huge help carrying our luggage up the stairs whenever we needed. Yes the stairs are steep, but the staff was always there to help. I would definitely stay there again.
title: Great place to stay in Amsterdam

review: We stayed in Clemens hotel for 3 days in July, the location was awesome near all sites, the staff was friendly and very helpful, they are available all the day for any enquiry.The stairs were many and very tiny,but the staff take our luggages upstairs.The room was narrow but we enjoyed the weather in the small balcony.Highly recommended
title: Great location,lovely staff

review: No regrets with booking this one - great location, great staff, great bed & room, great breakfast! Definitely very happy. The staff insisted I had breakfast before I even checked in for that night (as I dropped my bags off in the morning) - I've experienced some 5 star hotels not let you have breakfast except for the morning after you stay! Fantastic service :)
title: Nicest & most hospitable staff!

review: Staff amazing, very very very clean, great breakfast, lovely atmosphere, perfect location. Nothing to fault. The staff clearly have great pride in their hotel. Just a note re. the stairs. They are steep and if on the 3rd floor its a great free workout, probably not for the elderly. BUT DO NOT let the stairs put you off as this hotal is absolutely PERFECT. There was one lady who ran around doing breakfast and cleaning rooms, she was fantastic. I would 100% go back if I revisit Amsterdam. In fact I wouldn't go anywhere else now! LOVED IT!
title: A lovely perfect stay & very very high standards

review: We really enjoyed our 4 day stay at the Clemens Hotel. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the location was amazing. We loved the balcony connected to the lobby and the breakfast was quite filling. The long stair case leading to the lobby and the street noise on Saturday took some getting used to, but overall we were very pleased and would stay at this inn again.
title: Friendly Staff, Great Location

review: I was dismayed to see the huge set of stairs when I walked through the front door, with my bad knee. But the receptionists immediately rushed down to take my bags. And they remained just as helpful for my whole stay. The single room was tiny, but clean and comfortable. The house is well maintained. The room on the back side was quiet. I like the balcony just off the lobby: a nice place to hang out! And the location in the canal neighborhood is just perfect.
title: Very helpful staff, great location

review: Excellent location, 5 min from the Nieuw Kerk, about a 20 min walk from the station. As others note, rooms are small and stairs are steep, but staff is very helpful (including carrying luggage up the stairs). My single room had shower only (no bath) and fixtures in the room and bathroom (mirror, towel racks) were designed for people taller than my 5'1"! Small fridge in room was very nice.
title: Comfortable and convenient

review: The hotel is located in a good position to get around Amsterdam. It is about a 300 metre walk to Anne Frank House museum and the canal hop on off boats.The hotel has a steep set of stairs to get the reception. If you have a bad knee or back then I dont think this would be for you.The staff were helpful with cases.The reception area is where breakfast is. The selection for breakfast was good, scrambled eggs, fruit, cereals, pastries, bread, youghurt, fruit juice and coffee. Coffee is available all the we found it nice to grab a cup of coffee and sit out on the balconies and watch the street.The rooms and shower was small but thats what you expect from hotels in Amsterdam.Bed was comfortable.
title: Friendly with stairs

review: I came here as a student looking for a place to live when I go and study my MSc. The hotel was very nice. The rooms were very clean and well decorated. The location was amazing and the staff were very helpful. I would 100% stay here again and probably will in the future.
title: Lovely hotel with very friendly staff

review: This hotel is in a great location to get to the main attractions around Amsterdam. The rooms are sufficient for your stay and the breakfast and terraced area are lovely.The stairs are steep but the staff are more then happy to help you with your bags. The staff were very friendly and always asking what they could do to help.We thoroughly enjoyed our 3 night stay and would return here again without hesitation!
title: Great Hotel, Great Location

review: This was possibly the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in, smaller even than inside cabins on cruise ships. That said, the room had everything one would need including air conditioning a comfortable bed, TV and a central location. We might have been less happy but for the consistently friendly service we experienced from the entire staff. This place is not handicap accessible. There is a long and steep flight of steps leading up to the hotel which is on the second level of the building, one of a series of small hotels within the same antique structure. There is a nice reception and breakfast area. The included breakfast offers breads, cheeses, cold cuts and scrambled eggs. Definitely sufficient to get you moving in the morning. Overall a reasonable value in an expensive city.
title: Tiny but friendly

review: The Hotel was simply amazing! The stuff very friendly with Great City tips!!! Through them we found Great Locations such as The best Gin bar in Town as well as delicious restaurants and cool stores.We will always catch this Hotel when going back to Amsterdam!Thanks Sir Adam and Amsterdam Form The Great trip!!! :)
title: Amazing

review: I knew the was told the hotel Is so hip and the concept is young and fresh and it is so much so ! however, it's not that kind of a place that leave you feeling old like some trendy young type of hotels elsewhere.The lobby is amazing , the layout is so cool . it's calm yet hip ...if you can have both .which they managed to find the balance . We had a fabulous guy serving us a great drinks , here he is Ellissio from Italy in the hotel bar and he was friendly and knew how to care for guests .The ride to center station is a minute free ride with a fast ferry .We loved it . Will come back
title: Wow is the only word I have to transfer the feel

review: Friendly, welcoming staff at reception, helpful in explaining different areas of Amsterdam, enjoyed every minute of our stay here. Easy to find from Airport to train to ferry across the river to the hotel. Comfy rooms, especially enjoyed the view across the river watching the people go about their daily business. Each lift up to the room had a different theme. Full size complimentary toiletries so you have no need to bring your own, and a good, powerful hairdryer. Also the cafe Nelson Mandela just by the river, short walk from hotel, nice to sit and enjoy the quiet whilst watching the boats. Only disappointment was that there was not enough umbrellas on the day it rained hard, so go early if you need to borrow one.
title: View over the river

review: This place is fab. I have been in 5 star and 6 star hospitality in Australia, and the Guest Arrival Experience at Sir Adam is exceptional. Friendly, enthusiastic, efficient - room was ready even though we arrived early. Thank you Erwin (sp?) The room is v cool - concrete, glass, leather and fur. Gibson Les Paul on the wall, Crosley record player on the bar. RECORDS on the bar. So we turned up Patti Smith and checked out the Art and Music and Dance tomes in the room. Then went exploring. Having been taken down stairs by the Saturday Night Fever lift (C, from memory.) Bed is v comfortable and room is dark at night, so we had a good sleep. Shower is great - overall a lot to recommend at Sir Adam.
title: Rock'n'roll with a smile

review: This hotel is one of the best I have stayed at in amsterdam. Easy to get to using the shuttle ferry at the back of centraal station. Didn't know this at the time of booking at took a taxi the long way round. Very easy check in and shown to our rooms by a knowledgeable guy. The rooms are great, I had a lovely view out the window with complimentary binoculars. Good selection of records for the record player as well. The lifts were a fun experience as well. 4 different themed ones. My favourite was the disco. Can't comment on the food but it looked good. Bar prices we reasonable for the location. Look forward to staying here again.
title: Cool hotel

review: Definitely would stay here again; exceptionally great location, quiet, close to ALL transportation, removed from noise/crowds of tourist areas. Staff was extremely helpful in all aspects of our stay, always seeking to provide great advice and direction with every question presented. Fun atmosphere, bar area below lobby was crowded every evening and full of activity. Hotel was peaceful, heard no noise at all during our stay despite a relatively full hotel. Rooms are comfortable, but not spacious. Clean, crisp and and well maintained.
title: Great Location & excellent service

review: I was in the Sir Adam Hotel to visit a friend. We enjoyed the time at the bar and different music rooms and also the view. The room is so good in design, enough space in the bathroom and once again, the view is a cherry on the cake.
title: I was there to visit a friend!

review: Wow! This place is brilliant! We stayed here for the weekend as we were meeting friends who had flown in from America. The room is on the smaller side, but perfectly fine for 2 people (plus how much time do you spend in there anyway?!) the record players in each room were a nice touch. Decor was great. Shower nice and strong! Slept SO well! I've looked online and I know I can buy the bed, but I want to know where to get the duvet and pillows from?! Totally divine and felt like a princess! Would definitely return and have already recommended it to friends! Might try the one in Ibiza next!!
title: Amazing Hotel!

review: The hotel location is very nearby from Amsterdam Centraal just took the crosing/bridge boat and walk a bit then there you go! And whenever you reach the main station you can continue going to city area. Great room with music/rock&roll theme and best view to the Ams Centraal. Staffs are friendly and very helpful. Breakfast is great and can also hang out in the Resto call The Butcher play pool/games. Overall very recommended, this hotel will be our choice next time we're back to Amsterdam
title: Excellent location and great atmosphere

review: The staff were amazingly helpful - especially Nok and Sandjay - always ready with some recommendations, happy to check dinner bookings and full of smiles! The room was stunning with full panoramic views of the water front. Lots of nice touches including a glass of prosecco on arrival, a funky disco lift and I especially like the addition of a record player in the room. Location wise I was a bit concerned about this when booking, but I shouldn't have been. Adam is just five minutes away from Centraal Station by a ferry that runs all night long (but make sure you get on the right ferry, we made that mistake and ended up extending our 5 minute trip back to 40 minutes!)We did have a couple of gripes - which they did their best to sort out and which I was satisfied were taken seriously. The first was a weird low pitched buzzing noise on two nights, which seemed to come from the central air cooling system (we turned off the air con in the room and it was still there). When a staff member came up he checked out other free rooms and said the noise was also bad in those and so there was little point in changing. They did provide us with ear plugs though which did the trick! They did seem aware of the problem, but unable to do anything about it. Other gripe was that our room wasn't cleaned on one day. We asked reception to sort it out and were assured it would be done by the time we came back that night, but it wasn't. Unfortunately that was also the same day as my husband's birthday and so I felt especially disappointed. I was given a reduction in the room rate, but still very disappointing as this isn't a cheap hotel and we were there for a special occasion.I'd certainly recommend this place if you want quirky and funky and good service. Just take your ear plugs just in case...
title: Funky funky hotel

review: Super levels of service. Very helpful and polite staff. We asked for the Gibson and they very kindly gifted the hire cost. Food good, fantastic all in breakfast but otherwise fairly costly. Very relaxed atmosphere, quite loud at times and would overwhelm some who like peace and quiet. My son and I had fun. There is a special upstairs part which you can get discount tickets for at the hotel. The lift ride up is truly spectacular. Really great stay and I'd deffo go again. Ferry across to main city is every five mins, free, and runs all night. Brilliant stay , only gripe, room was a bit small and the AC was poor.
title: Cool place to stay

review: Very classy, quirky venue that has so much to recommend it;Wonderful rooms, stylish and comfortable. A shower to die for! Extremely helpful and friendly staff. We would recommend it without hesitation.
title: Family holiday

review: Just take a quick ferry across to center of everything. Great hotel. Very cool vibes. Beautiful views. Wonderful people. Clean, friendly and easy access to center. I've stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam. This is one of my favorites.
title: Great hotel near center

review: We visited Amsterdam for a weekend in June.We were a little lost on arrival (which ferry to take, how to enter the hotel and then finding the actual reception desk...). Once we'd sussed that, it was a wonderful experience. We were welcomed by friendly, cheerful staff, given a glass of bubbly and then shown to our room.We had a corner, city view room, looking straight over the water. I loved the decor, the original quirks, though I didn't use the record player or try out the guitar, and my husband loved the concrete walls and ceiling. The bed was perhaps the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the rain shower was a delight. Some people have commented on the window in the shower stall, but it's not a problem at all.It was also fascinating to think that not so many years ago, our comfortable hotel used to be someone's office!Someone people have commented that the rooms are small.
