There were two of us, staying two nights, and it was perfect for our needs. The bathroom wasn't enormous, but you just have to take it in turns to use it. It really wasn't an issue for us.We ate breakfast and dinner in the restaurant downstairs. It was delicious: I highly recommend the breakfast pancakes. Finding out how things worked (where to order) was not immediately clear straight away but it all went fine. Our first meal there was actually dinner on a busy Saturday night so perhaps that would explain our initial difficulties.This hotel is not your typical Amsterdam hotel but we loved the originality and comfort. I also think that had we not stayed there, we might not have crossed the water and would have missed out on a part of Amsterdam. I would definitely recommend this hotel. In fact, my husband already has!
title: Wonderful hotel, quirky and well-situated

review: We stayed at the Sir Adam during our trip to Amsterdam. The staff there is so friendly and helpful, everyone treated us like they really cared about us having a great experience. As a previous reviewer mentioned, our cab driver also could not find the hotel, and in retrospect, we would have just taken the train from the airport and then the ferry right across the river to the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel for the fun and funky atmosphere and the excellent staff. The rooms are small, but the views are excellent.
title: Beautiful, Fun and Friendly Hotel

review: Sir Adam is so new (opened in December) that the cab driver didn’t know how to find it. Of course I shouldn't have taken a cab; I should have just taken the ferry from the train station right across the harbor which runs constantly. I’ve stayed in lots of boutique hotels, but this was among the best in terms of design. Also during the checkin process I experienced something new, the person who checked me in offered me a drink and then when we were done with the registration process they personally escorted me to the room with plenty of explanations along the way. My room overlooked the harbor with big picture windows, and the view even from the 5th floor was great. The was room was overflowing with storage so even two people shouldn’t have a problem finding places to store their luggage and clothes. I loved that the shower and toilet were in two separate spaces, and the bed was super comfortable. On the weekend it can get to be a bit of a scene down in the lobby but it gives you lots to look at. My experience with the restaurant there was mixed so my advice is not to stray too far from the burgers and chicken wings. One weird thing is that all the seats at the bar have their backs to the beautiful harbor views and instead look into the kitchen - weird. My only criticism is that the hotel service didn't always match the surroundings - more than a couple of things got screwed up in the 3 days that I stayed there, but that didn't take away from the great surroundings and the my favorite elevator ever with a rotating disco ball. One downside is that the hotel isn’t particularly near any of the attractions (except for the stunning film museum next door). Hopefully the level of service will improve and maybe they will even get some discos LPs in the bins downstairs.
title: Beautiful Hotel, Service Level Still Catching Up

review: One of the most amazing hotels I've ever stayed in.This place oozes class from start to finish... The ferry over the water from the station showed the lookout which has everything you could ever need and the hotel was part of the complex. Two bars, three restaurants, Europe's highest swing and a brilliant lookout point. Then there was the hotel;The check in was stylish, the rooms were uber stylish, the bed was so comfy I fell asleep for 12 hours one night! The shower was lovely and the little things in the room really made it feel like home. Worth the upgrade to the rooms overlooking the river and back towards the centre of Dam.The Butcher food is top class and breakfast, lunch and dinner here are recommended. I actually have NO complaints about anything. Little touches of class everywhere and the record player was brilliant, belting out old school hits on records whilst getting showered. The staff were friendly and helpful, the bar area was buzzing and bright and the outdoor bar was great also. I want to stay here EVERY weekend.
title: If Carlsberg did hotels... Best hotel EVER.

review: So close to central station. Free ferry over river. Cool lifts and decor in rooms. Vinyl player and nice artwork. So close to city center. Will be back. Great views onto city. Very friendly staff. 5 stars
title: Great location, cool hotel

review: We had an amazing but tiring time in Amsterdam, and we were glad to have the Sir Adam to come back to. The room was perfect. The bed and pillows were among the most comfortable I've ever slept in, cosy with a faux fur blanket that was beyond soft. It had all the extras you'd need, cold drinks and climate control. The black out blinds meant I got a great nights sleep. The air con is a tad noisy, but we quickly got used to it.The view from the room was beautiful, and we could watch the cruise liners come in and out. It was just a sort walk and a free ferry ride to Amsterdam Centraal. There are a number of nice bars nearby. The Sir Adams own restaurant, the Butcher, provides tasty burgers and a nice outdoor seating area to eat them in whilst watching the world go by. We would definitely go again.
title: Luxurious and Comfortable

review: Ideally located in the new A'DAM Toren tower, 10min across the IJ river from Centraal Station (thanks to the 24/7, free-of-charge ferry service).The hotel's theme is MUSIC: each elevator in a different style and music (one even has a disco ball in the ceiling and checkered, in different colors flickering floor), rooms styled in leather and Pop poster-like walls, jam sessions at the groundfloor open space area and best of all a Gibson guitar and Crosley turntable in the rooms to use at your discretion! You can even browse through the record collection at reception and exchange whatever you're up to - YES, it's vinyl records!!Also, the view from the room is just amazing, wonderful... and that's true for the view from the bathroom / shower as well... ;DVery friendly and forthcoming service included!
title: The Amsterdam Music Get-Away

review: There is a lot to unpack here, and I don't have much time to cover every single thing, but I will say that this new and one of a kind hotel has a lot to offer and it has many luxuries you may have never thought of before, the architecture, decor, lighting, music, restaurants, and rooftop scenery is definitely worth a visit even if you wish to stay at another hotel.  If you care about money, looks, being cool then this hotel is perfect for the vapid and self absorbed millennial generation that shops at urban outfitters.  Opinionated hipsters and oblivious iPhone zombies plagued the entire area and you could tell how annoyed most of the staff were and even the locals by the run of the mill basic white Americans that argue about their own privilege stayed at sir ADAM hotel for five days,I arrived in Amsterdam after a week of traveling through Germany and needed my clothes washed but their website stated they had a laundromat to self service our needs. Once we arrived (before check in) the front desk was busy helping other guests and explaining how the hotel works (which is confusing to most people visiting for the first time), once we were able to ask about doing our laundry before checking in they told us there was no way to do so unless we walked/taxi to the closest town laundromat. We walked for about twenty minutes from the hotel to get to des roos laundromat which was very busy (sir ADAM hotel drops off their guests clothes here to get washed too but for 5x the price) but the woman who was running the place was very welcoming and kind. After 2 hours we walked back to the hotel to check in. Our room was spacious and had high ceilings. It was clean but always dusty. The butcher is a casual place on the ground floor where anyone can eat, and has decent burgers, but the breakfast was disappointing. The servers were rude and it seemed like the setup of the building and seating were not thought out enough to execute properly. Madam restaurant is almost at the top of the building with a nice view, you need a reservation for Moon (their nicest restaurant inside which is four star quality/five star price) and madam to eat or drink. Neither place made a great impression being that we found so many great places to eat in the city. I thought the turntable and selection of vinyl records in our room were a nice touch, but sadly they chose to use Crosley turntables (which are the worst and destroy vinyl faster than anything) and most of the Lp's were in too poor of condition to listen to. It wasn't a horrible experience in any way, but I expected the service standards to be higher based on appearances. This hotel has a lot going on all the time and also has plenty of hidden gems most people overlook due to how busy it gets.It's a unique place with plenty of things to do to pass the time, and a short walk to the ferry which is free to use and takes you to the other side of the river to get to the city. I would come back if I got a better deal on the room but I wouldn't stay more than a day or two.
title: Great concept, Poor execution!

review: Stayed here while at a conference. Hotels which try to be different can often end up just being odd, and lose sight of what matters (nice stay) but not here. On the other side of the main canal from Centraal Station, getting here involves using the foot ferry - a great way to start! The hotel itself is in an old office block but brilliantly converted. The bar area is a 'social club' with DJ, relaxed atmosphere and amazing burgers and beer. Reception staff very friendly.The lifts are all themed, including a disco lift complete with light up floor and glitter ball on the ceiling. The rooms are a little small, but packed with everything you need. Mine had a guitar hanging from the wall and a turntable next to the minibar ... plus a choice of vinyl! Very comfy beds, powerful shower and dark curtains so once you wanted to sleep, you could block the world out.One of the best hotels I've stayed in.
title: Great hotel in all ways!

review: What a hotel this was and its truly the best hotel i have ever stayed in. The style of the hotel as a speakeasy feel from the outside because if you weren't aware you wouldn't know this was a hotel. From the very beginning the hotel staff were amazing so friendly and did little touches for my husbands birthday which we weren't expecting. They also showed us to our room which is the first time any hotel as done this which was really nice touch from them.The rooms were so amazing I've never stayed in a room like it before very urban, industrial and rock n roll with little touches like a Crosley record player and a fur bed throw, and don't get me started on the lifts they are so unique and quirky, i don't want to really give too much away but you will love a certain one. If i could live in a hotel this would be the one i would choose and i will definitely be staying here again when i revist Amsterdam.Well done Sir Adam on a fantastic hotel with super friendly staff.
title: Urban and Hip

review: Sir Albert was definitely by far one, if not, the finest hotels I have ever stayed in. The hotel decor itself in the reception, corridors, bedroom are very modern and chic with a touch of class. We were offered complementary prosecco on arrival. The staff were more than helpful when we were checking in. Another day we asked for directions to the Van Gogh Museum and the man at reception went out of his way to help and assist us with directions and offered umbrellas to each of us as it was a rather dreary day. The room itself was very edgy and modernly decorated and felt very personal and welcoming with complimentary messages on the mirror and my name on the TV to welcome me. It took maybe 20-25mins walk to get to Dam Square but there are lots of lovely bars, restaurants, shops and markets on the way which was nice to experience. There was also a tram about a 30sec walk away that can take you to Dam Square. I would recommend this hotel to every type of passenger and hope to return to it once again in the near future.
title: Fabulous Hotel

review: Price for this hotel is not low, but you get what you will never get in other hotels. Beautifull view from room to small harbour, and the hotel is very near city center - only few minutes of walking. Rooms are very clean and modern and look more expensive than you will pay. People are very friendly. Breakfast is not for 5 stars, but everything else is for more than 5 stars.
title: Modern, clean, near center

review: The first thing you notice when you enter this hotel is that they really trying to make a warm and welcoming - yet modern and different - atmosphere. I didnt book a room, but I went to the lounge to get some coctails. First thing I noticed was a very handsome bartender, and since I was going by myself I decided to sit there. I didnt know what I wanted so instead I gave him three questions that he would answer with his drink. The bartender was charming and took the challenge. Making me one of the best drinks I have ever drank. (I highly recommend Tiago's whiskey sour). Both of the bartendes were very charming and took the time to talk to me when there weren't any customers. Friendliest bartender I have ever met. 5/5 stars!
title: Review of the lounge

review: My sister and I stayed here for two nights and could not have been happier with the hotel. The reception staff were so professional and pleasant (especially Jacqueline who is fantastic), the room was very spacious and absolutely spotless. There is a very good rainfall shower and some lovely products in the bathroom including shampoo, conditioner, showergel and body lotion. The hairdryer is very poor with an extremely short lead so I would advise you to bring your own. There is also a secure safe located in one of the presses. In regards location - it's fantastic. You take the train from Schipol to Centraal Station. It costs €5 for a one way adult ticket and it takes about 20 minutes. Once you get to Centraal Station take the exit towards the river. Turn and keep the water on your right hand side. The hotel is no more than a 5 to 7 minute walk. From Centraal Station you can get the hop on/hop off bus so from a tourist/sightseeing point of view the hotel is ideal. If you don't get breakfast in the hotel there are 2 or 3 small eateries directly across the road (no more than 20 steps away from the hotel exit). All in all a super hotel that I would highly recommend for your visit to Amsterdam. Thank you to all @ Room Mate Aitana.
title: Excellent

review: This hotel was perfect for me and by boyfriend, we hired bikes and it was only a 1 min bike ride down the river to get to the hotel from the station so easy! its located in a new complex with a lovely bagel shop opposite that we went for breakfast a few times. The hotel was very clean and had great decor, and staff were very friendly and helpful.
title: Great Hotel!

review: This hotel was an easy walk from Central Station and to city sights. Very quiet, clean, and modern. Staff was friendly and very helpful. Comfortable bed and nice view of the city from my upper floor room.
title: First visit to Amsterdam

review: Currently staying here room 306, lovely room, very clean, however the noise from the road at all hours is bad. The room overlooks a main road which is very busy, and railway. Had a sleepless night last night because of it. Great hotel though shame about the location.
title: Noisy Hotel

review: We loved our stay in Room Mate Aitana. The room had a wonderful view of the river, the bed was very comfortable, the bathroom was very good. The breakfast buffet was complete. The hotel is a short walk from the center of town and the tram system. Would stay here again if our journeys bring us back to Amsterdam.
title: Superb hotel

review: The best thing about this hotel is how modern it looks, both from the outside and inside. The rooms were large with lots of natural light. Everything was extremely clean, and the amenities provided were more than adequate. The wifi was fast.In terms of location, it's not the best. The hotel is located away from the old city on the "other" side of the Centraal station. You can either walk 1 km from Centraal, or take bus # 48 (1 stop). However, this means that you are far away from the charm of the city on a modern and artificial island. Eating options around the hotel are rather limited. The restaurant in the hotel offers limited options, and is rather expensive. Also, everytime we dined at the restaurant, or ordered room service, we were asked to settle the bill immediately instead of charging it to our room. Not the most convenient option.Also, another issue that is specific to our stay - we tried checking in at around 2:30 pm, and we were told that since we wanted 1 double bed instead of 2 single beds, none of those rooms were ready. We could either wait, take a room with 2 single beds, or upgrade (not free - for EUR 12.50 a night). We ended up upgrading with additional charge, just so that we did not have to wait. Hardly an ideal experience. The hotel should have offered a free upgrade since the rooms not being ready were really their fault. We had booked months in advance, and had very clearly specified that we wanted a room with 1 double bed.Will definitely not be my first choice for a place to stay in Amsterdam in the future.
title: Good hotel, not so great location, average experience

review: The Room Mate Aitana was a very nice place to stay. The staff was very welcoming when we arrived, and also very helpful when we asked questions about the local area. The hotel is located close to a river. The Central station is a short 10 minute walk away, and easy to find with it's many shops and restaurants. Ultra modern in style, the hotel also features good security. Be prepared to use your room key card to activate the elevator when going up to your room. Our room had a window the full size of the wall, so there was lots of light coming in that made the room seem so much larger. The bed was very comfortable and the room was well appointed. Breakfast the next morning was included with the room and was excellent with many tasty dishes including a whole table of various kinds of breads. We arrived a day early for a cruise, and this really helped us to acclimate to the time change.
title: The Room Mate Aitana was a very nice place to stay.

review: The location may seem a little far away, but this comes with a reward: this place is absolutely quiet and you can get the best rest after a long day of walking Amsterdam streets. The beds are over-comfortable and the rooms don't catch any external noise.Breakfast was good, though not sure it was worth the (unusual) expensive price. It has the advantage of being open until noon, so one can fully recover after a wild night :)All in all, I fully recommend this place.
title: best place to get an excellent sleep after a long hard day in amsterdam

review: The Mate Aitana hotel is right in the entrance of Amsterdam, super close to the train station and to the Centrum of the city. We walked there everyday and getting an Uber to go to the attractions a bit farther, like the Heineken experience, was super easy. Rooms are clean, modern, with a great view and staff is super nice. The big plus is if you are driving to Amsterdam you don't need to go thru the chaotic city channels and parking is available right under the hotel, for a 25 euro daily fee. Could have been for free or at a lower rate for hotel guests, but all things considered it was great. Would definitely stay again!
title: Excellent location if driving

review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Room Mate Aitana. Check in was smooth and staff were friendly. The room was large and spacious with good storage for all of our things. The king size bed was huge and very comfortable and the bathroom was clean, modern and spacious. The hotel is located on IJDock and is a short walk (about 10-15 minutes) to either Central Station or the Jordaan area. There are nice views of the harbour from the hotel and also a couple of cafes beside it. Overall we were happy with everything and would definitely stay again.
title: Modern and spacious design hotel

review: Fantastic hotel at a fantastic location. Very close to the central train station on foot. According to me ideally located. Excellent service, spacious rooms, wonderful view and lovely breakfast. Strongly recommended.
title: Excellent hotel ideally located

review: Great and modern hotel with good service and in the center of Amsterdam. The view of some rooms could be better, but the staff and also the rooms are amazing and modern. Really liked the concept and the ambiance!
title: Great hotel

review: We arrived early to the hotel after a long flight from the U.S. to be warmly greeted by the staff. Because we arrived so early, our room was not available yet and we were told it would be ready by 2:00 p.m. The hotel kindly kept our luggage for us while we toured the city. Although when we returned at 3:30 p.m., our room was still not ready yet. Unfortunately, our room was not ready until 4:30 p.m. because the previous occupants had smoked in the room and they had to prepare a different room for us. The hotel staff was gracious and pleasant throughout the process, understanding that we were very tired from our long trip.The room itself was a good size by European standards. We were in a family room, which included a large, king-sized bed and a small single sofa-type bed which was fine for my teenage daughter. I appreciate the small details, like plenty of electrical outlets, a variety of English speaking channels on the t.v., and extra pillows. The air conditioning worked adequately and is controlled directly in the room. Our room faced the front of the hotel and therefore we heard some early morning vehicle noise, but because the hotel is somewhat isolated, it was overall very quiet. Noise from inside the hotel or from adjoining rooms was non-existent. The beds and pillows were more on the firm side for those of us from America, but standard for what I have experienced in Europe.The hotel is located along the water with scenic views from several locations in the hotel. While it is a reasonable walk from the hotel to the central train station, there was quite a bit of construction that impeded the availability of a pedestrian walkway on a very busy street. I was glad that we chose not to try to walk this with our luggage to the Central Station; it was a very quick and inexpensive taxi ride instead. Otherwise, I appreciated that while we could walk to a variety of places, it was a quiet hotel stay away from the main action of the city.
title: Well-appointed, quiet hotel

review: This hotel is fabulous! We were in room 901 for 3 nights. The views are spectacular in 3 directions! The hotel is spotless with a 5 star staff. We were stunned by our room when we entered and saw how spacious it was! The only negative we felt was that the restaurant menu is lacking so we ate out at nearby places. Everything is in walking distance.. central station, the Ann Frank House included. We would definitely stay here again!
title: Amazing Amsterdam

review: I prefer not to be in a cramped noisy hotel in centre of tow. I prefer my comforts in a peaceful setting which is a short walk from where I want to go. We could walk into any of the interesting areas in 15-20 minutes. Lovely clean hotel with great friendly staff. Tiago in the bar is the man for serving the gin of your choice. Whilst the rooms are not large they are big enough with great views over the boats in the dock. A quiet refuge after a lengthy day touring Amsterdam.
title: Quser and Near Town

review: Hotel is at prompt place near the central station walk around 7-10 minutes across the bridge .We arrived and room was ready , well trained staff and smiling and very warm welcoming . Staff are assisting for those who came first time and providing all the info to new travellers .Breakfast was good too . RoomAre clean and bathroom too . Only missing part to go beyond the current level is to add 2 water bottles of compliments for tea coffee. Thank you for the service .
title: Lovely stay

review: The room was great and the front end service people were courteous, friendly and helpful. We found the lobby music to be repetitive and at times loud but the staff turned it down on request. We tried the restaurant late on a Saturday and that was a disaster. No service at all. We ended up leaving without ordering.
title: Nicely furnished with friendly helpful staff

review: We'll located just 5 minutes away from Centraal Station or 10 from Dam, Room Mate give us very good conditions to stay in the city. Modern with good and large rooms in "the middle of the water" : ) Simpatic team!!!
title: Beautiful...

review: I have been staying at the Room Mate Aitana for four days last week and really enjoyed my stay there.The rooms are very spacious, as well as the room's bathroom and nicely designed. The bed was very comfy, too. breakfast is absolutely great. One finds everything one could desire having for breakfast in a very good quality and it was never too crowded.Hotel staff were very friendly, one felt welcomed there.Overall i would say the Room Mate Aitana is an excellent hotel for a city-trip to Amsterdam if you want to be close to the city centre but away from those huge tourist crowds.
title: Wonderful hotel on the Ijdock

review: The hotel was clean and comfortable. The rooms nicely furnished. The bathroom had a nice large shower. The gym had great treadmills, ellipticals, and bikes. Also weights, balls, and water and towels. The gym also has a nice view of the water.The staff was not competent at the front desk and did not know the answers to the questions we had as we arrived.Breakfast was delicious along with dinner. The lighting system was terrible. You have to use a key card and it makes going to the bathroom in the night a challenge. We had a beautiful view. This hotel is close but away from City Centre.
title: High Quality Hotel

review: We stayed at this greatly located hotel twice while doing 2 Viking River Cruises in a 30 day period. The first stay we had really bad connections and arrived at Amsterdam airport at 11:45 PM without a hotel to stay! Our Viking ship was due in the next day so got taxi to the Aitana and was presently surprised the service desk found us room for the night (just before my wife was ready to throw me in the harbor!)! The Hotel was a 5 minute walk from where our Viking Ship docked. The 2nd stay was when we returned on the Viking ship and had a day to do downtown Amsterdam (10 min walk). Really nice rooms and amenities. Nice view of the city from our 2nd room on the 11th floor! This is a 4 star hotel with 5 star service. Second visit we got to hotel at 10 AM and just new we could probably not get a room until late that afternoon so what a fabulous surprise when their customer service desk got us a room right away so we could walk to the city! They even have a wireless hot spot available to use as you do the city! Room Mate Hotels has now become my European choice!
title: "LOCATION SERVICE LOCATION !!"

review: Hotel was clean and modern, staff were friendly, 15 minute walk to train station, less than a 20 minute walk to Dam Square and to great restaurants in the Jordaan area.We loved the location...quiet, new, a little bit away from the hustle and bustle, but not too far away. Good coffee place across the street. We really enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again.
title: Nice hotel near train station

review: The property is nice and it's in a great neighborhood. The rooms are exceptionally clean and the bed very comfortable. Unfortunately, the hotel does not have parking so you need to park the car in the parking garage next door (additional 27euros a day). The staff did not really pay attention when we walked in or out the hotel, even at check-in we had to wait a while until someone noticed us. Overall I think this hotel is a little overpriced!
title: Value vs Money

review: This hotel is located on the West Dock behind the Central Station - about a 10 minute walk. Reception staff were friendly and helpful. I was given a choice of rooms and opted for a view away from the dock but bigger and higher up. The bed was comfortable with a good duvet. The room had a digital safe, iron, hairdryer, minibar and tea and coffee facilities. The shower was powerful and large. A good range of toiletries was supplied in the room. Everything was very clean. The hotel bar does good cocktails and has an outside area on the dock. Breakfast was a very high quality buffet. Really liked this hotel and would stay again.
title: Excellent central modern hotel

review: This place is fantastic. We booked a junior sweet as a little treat and we're not disappointed. From the exceptional welcome from two young ladies on reception (one in training) to the fantastic views you'll not beat this hotel. It's central location is fantastic. Just far enough out of all the city noise but five minutes walk and you're in the thick of all the action. Top tip? Book the breakfast - we did it on arrival and was worth every penny. A massive selection from cooked breakfast to fruit and everything in between (don't miss the pancakes)Amsterdam has so much to offer and this hotel is the perfect base to explore.
title: Wonderful

review: A lovely warm welcome awaited us on our arrival in this beautiful glassed reception area overlooking the canal and the river. Spacious, bright interior with a modern décor gave us a feeling of being somewhere special and different. The rooms were bright with lovely views overlooking the river. Location is excellent for touring Amsterdam. Unfortunately our trip to Amsterdam was too short for us to enjoy many of the great sights or enjoy the cuisine of the hotel and surrounding areas. However we got to savour a lovely breakfast in a little café across the road and enjoyed tea and cakes in a quaint little cake shop until our lift to the airport arrived.You wont be sorry to choose this hotel for location and ambience.
title: Classy Modern hotel in great location

review: Very nice hotel with great deco, nice views and nice rooms, , large and clean with all the necessary equipment (whatch out with the boilers though). The quality of service of the staff at the desk is fluctuant from great (Adel) to average.
title: Very nice hotel but 10' walk far from anything

review: I stayed at the Room Mate Aitana for 4 nights in July this year and it was perfect!.Starting with the location-.Aitana is located at the beautiful IJ Dock, It's in the heart of Amsterdam but it gives you the solace and peace you need to wind down after a night about town.It's a 5 minute walk to the Centraal station, and a Max 10 minute walk to everything else! If you don't feel like walking, there is a bike rental across the street! Amsterdam is one of the most bike friendly places in the world.There are nice places for breakfast if you wish to skip the hotel breakfast, A couple of other cafes and a fresh food store as well. just across the street.Moving on to the property - The Rooms are airy and spacious, a large window with plenty of sunlight coming in which is a huge plus point for me, Bathroom is well equipped and well lit.I must mention that the cleanliness is top notch. Now last but not the least - The staff! they were excellent, from the reception desk to the housekeeping. They were so warm and friendly. They have a WhatsApp number, that you can text them on while you are out for any suggestions and/ or directions. I thought that was nice personal touch they added to the hotel experience.Overall a perfect hotel,I would definitely stay here if I visit Amsterdam again.
title: Loved my stay here!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: We stayed in a junior suite - definitely worth the extra money. One of our favourite hotels - very much our type of hotel modern, perfectly clean and stylish. Hard to believe it is an Accor hotel as it is so distinctive. Staff were friendly and the restaurant downstairs was very good for dinner. Also, the deal of a latte and a croissant for a few euros for a light breakfast was perfect for us. We wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel and will be back next time we are in Amsterdam.
title: Outstanding

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: This is a hip, modern and minimalist hotel- do not expect Ritz-type features. However, it is very well decorated and furnished. The position is also fantastic. Great for tourists who need a home base.
title: Hip, modern hotel centrally located

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Just come back from a 2 night stay at INK hotel Amsterdam. Absolutely amazing interior from the minute you step in to the hotel and check in was quick and helpful. Our room, 211, was spacious and had views to a side street. Despite the central location, we did not hear any noise from the roads which was good. We loved the wallpaper on the feature wall which was a light-hearted map of parts of Amsterdam and the interior of the room which has a separate waterfall shower and toilet. The room was clean and the king size bed was amazing - not just two singles pushed together! The room has air con or heating as well. The hotel is in an amazing location and everything is walkable. Roughly 6 min walk to Dam square, 8 min walk to the red light district and about a 10/12 min walk from the train station. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes right near the hotel too. During our stay, the hotel became "P INK" for Amsterdam's gay pride week - they were hosting a lot of "pink" events over the week which looked great! Overall, we would undoubtably stay here again when visiting Amsterdam. Thank you for making our stay so great!
title: Amazing city break in a central location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: We decided to try a different hotel post cruise.... we were very happy with the location- tram stops literally right outside!We were NOT happy with much else!Our superior room was smaller than the balcony cabin on our cruise!!!No safe in the room. No privacy between bathroom and bedroom and in order to move around our suitcases on the far side of the room you had to climb over the bed!!!Our view was of an apartment building maybe 15 feet from us and a gentleman in his apartment smoking??!!Asked for extra towels at 2:30pmAt 10:30pm still no towels.Then we really needed them since the entire shower flooded the whole bathroom and bedroom as it leaked from underneath the shower!!!!!!The management was NOT at all surprised it leaked and said that happens all the time??!!!Accor and Sofitel are you not able to repair plumbing issues????? Better that guests should sleep with a wet rug and fear of falling from the leaking????Sink barely drained and toilet required 3 times to flush-- obviously the hotel has MAJOR plumbing issues!!!!Bed was comfortable but quality of linens was below what I would expect from a 4 star hotel!Liked the cool wallpaper/maps! The rolling blackout for the window was a novel idea too....The plywood "sofa" was a bust but at least we could put some of the suitcases there at night so we did not kill ourselves on the wet floor!!!The overall building and idea that the hotel was previously a newspaper press was inviting but the execution of their concept falls flat and shows that they do not use quality products or offer the services that one would expect. This is not a 4 star hotel. It is a 3 star property in a good location with fun funky vibe. They lack a professional concierge or experienced staff.There are so many other places to stay.... next time I would go back to the art'otel or try Kimpton Dewitt which is literally down the block and both are 4/5 star properties that offer and deliver much better service and experience for the same prices and location!!!!
title: Not so great

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: We absolutely love loved our stay. The service was excellent and very helpful. The room was comfortable and very stylish. Not a lot of natural light but what there was served ok. Loved the murals with sights of the city. Very clever. The only drawback was the musty smell in the halls. It was a little intense but the rooms smelled perfect. Breakfast was delicious if a little pricey but that's to be expected in a high end hotel. I'd definitely stay here again and probably will as I love Amsterdam.
title: Stylish and classy

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: I've been visiting Amsterdam regularly for over 25 years, and have always stayed along the NZ Voorburgwal in various hotels. After a disastrous experience at my last place, I was searching for a new hotel for this summer and was intrigued by the design, amenities, and location of INK. What a perfect choice! The room was spacious and pleasant, with high ceilings, stained glass windows, and great hand-drawn city art on the walls. Staff accommodating and welcoming. The hotel bar/restaurant (Pressroom) was a great place to have a glass of wine and a nibble before heading out for the evening. The little disappointing quirks (no iron or hair dryer in the room, poorly maintained fitness equipment in the tiny gym) were more than outweighed by the overall experience. I think I've found my "forever hotel" and look forward to staying there again next summer. I will even request the same room!
title: Great addition to Amsterdam Center

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: INK is in the central tourist area, yet if you walk a few blocks away, you are in a wonderful neighborhood that is more residential and filled with shops and restaurants. Lots of fun design touches throughout the hotel, the lobby bar and restaurant, as well as lounge areas that are comfy and a nice place to hang out with a drink or check your email. Our room was a superior room, and it reminded me of the cabin on a nice cruise ship--it is very small, but filled with thoughtful design touches to help with storage and comfort. Room was quiet and bed very comfy--we slept well. But it's small, so if that is a concern, upgrade to a larger room. Staff is young and caring--they responded to requests and even went out and purchased a mat for us to use in the stall shower when I expressed a concern about safety. They were not as knowledgeable about local restaurants, think that is something to address, but we did follow a recommendation for a canal cruise. All in all, our three nights in Amsterdam were a little more special because we stayed at the INK.
title: Fun hotel, consider the room size however

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Really love this place! Located in the city centre, close to main tourism points. It look a new hotel; the room is big, clean and provided with very nice toilets products.Definitely recommend, special for solo travel.
title: Amazing Hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Naturally, INK Hotel Amsterdam appealed to me as a retired journalist. And the venue delivered in many ways, largely focused around the theme of communication (but in the old-fashioned sense of paper, ink, linotype, typewriters and words). INK is centrally located, just a 10-minute walk from the big train station. Its public spaces feel unique and intimate, from the sloping entryway that brings you down a tad below street level, where it is cool and quiet, to a very casual check-in desk (employees stand behind a wooden table to work; it feels like they could have been printsetters in another time). The bar and restaurant, with their attentive help, are inviting and casual, so much so you might not want to leave even though the action-packed city beckons. Rooms upstairs carry on the word and story themes: In each an artist has sketched a black-and-white map of the city on the bedroom wall and written her/his favorite spots to visit. It's actually a big help. Rooms are small -- tight, even. But nicely appointed, and the bed comfy. And after all, the point in Amsterdam is to get out and explore. Staff were extremely helpful in suggesting trips, especially an excellent canal boat ride I loved for the evening hour and the champagne served. I think the company is called Friendship. A good name!
title: Printers' INK gets in your veins

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Fantastically thought out and appointed hotel for Amsterdam's tiny architecture and interior spaces. The room was small but cleverly designed making it functional while cozy and comfortable. Reception, bar and dining areas are well laid out connecting spaces and style successfully. Hotel staff are friendly, lively and eager to please. Located close to central train station it's an easy walk to hotel and central to everywhere else.
title: Genuinely compact and bijou

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: The hotel is in a good area to stay within the Canal Ring. The street isn't too busy compared to other areas of the Canal Ring but it's still so close to everything. The service was good and the rooms were clean but very small. We enjoyed the breakfast, it was a good selection but I would suggest that the waiters start writing down the tea/coffee orders. We were there 3 days for breakfast and on 2 days, the order was wrong and on 1 day, we had to order 3 times for 1 tea and 1 coffee and waited about an hour. I would recommend this hotel if you're going to Amsterdam, it's a really good choice.
title: Great location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Spent four nights at Ink Hotel in July 2017. This boutique hotel is really very good, charming staff, comfortable room, good restaurant and bar. Also the location is first class. Would definitely stay there again on next Amsterdam trip.
title: Excellent Hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Stayed here at the start of our honeymoon for 1 night.Immediately from check in you can tell this hotel is a nice one. Very professional, wish i got the name of the staff who helped as they were very good.The room was excellent. The map of Amsterdam on the wall was brilliant, great wee bonus.I wish i could say the same for amsterdam itself, wasn't in long only stayed one night after getting the ferry over but it was not for me.
title: Great Hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Stayed here just one night on business. Smooth check in, large room, great restaurant downstairs and good service.The bed was comfortable, with a nice coffee machine, shower, and TV.I also loved the "ink" theme throughout. The old prints on the walls added a nice touch.I'll be back!
title: Chic, good value, great location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: The writing is on the wall – literally! Loved the maps and history found by looking at the walls in my room – informative and interesting. Hotel was very nice, modern, spacious and in a good location – close to central train station. Lobby was nice, as was lobby bar.
title: LOVE the wallpaper - Close to train station

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: My husband and I absolutely loved INK Hotel Amsterdam. The rooms are a bit small, but this is standard in Europe. Once you step into the hotel the interior is absolutely amazing. Each room was decorated with a comic map of the city. I had a blast reading the commentary the artist had on the walls. My one pet peeve was how cramped the shower area was and how water would leak out of the door on the floor.We had to be careful to make sure the shower door was always fully closed.We arrived to Amsterdam quite late, but the train dropped us off from the airport straight to the front of the hotel. Just around the corner, there were various late night restaurants. Location is always key and this hotel was perfect. We were away from the noisiness of the city yet just around the corner from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam.I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely be back.
title: Artistic and Modern

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Second time visiting this hotel and it will certainly not be our last. We will continue to stay in this hotel when we visit Amsterdam. It truly is remarkable. The staff, the food, the rooms - five star. Great location also. Highly recommend
title: Lovely hotel.

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Great location (easy walk from Amsterdam central) and lovely quirky hotel in old town. Plenty of staff around to help if needed. Rooms are a generous size, clean and have everything you need. Breakfast was nice each morning. Ours was included in our booking but don't think it would be worth the 20/25 euro price tag though. Usual breakfast fare both hot and cold. The front desk sell tram tickets for one/two/three days and are very helpful with ideas of places to go and also orientating you with the area. Coin operated laundry just around the corner. Had a great stay here.
title: Quirky, central and relaxing

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Staff were very friendly & helpful from our arrival to checking out, great customer service during breakfast, dinner or just having a relaxing drink by the bar. Recommend having dinner at the INK Hotel, the food & wine was fantastic
title: Friendly Staff,

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Stayed at the Ink hotel in Amsterdam for 3 nights. The best hotel I have stayed at. The room was awesome. The staff were exceptional, especially the bar staff. Breakfast and restaurant is fabulous. Great central location Would highly recommend
title: Absolute Bliss

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Ink was the last hotel stop on our Europe trip definitely lived up to the saying 'save the best till last.'Most comfortable bed of our trip and it's not one of those two single beds pushed together, fluffy pillows in a modern quirky room. The rain shower head and the size of the shower was pure luxury. The room literally has everything you could ask for completely water, sewing kit, shoe polished, vanity pack, shampoo, conditioner, hair dryer, fluffy towels, robes and magnifying mirror. Not one but 2 full length mirrors!! We had breakfast at the hotel every morning and it's very well stocked freshly cooked pastry, fresh bread, fruit, cereal, yogurt, eggs, bacon, mushrooms and sausages the list goes on. The coffee was also quite nice.We also had dinner here one of our nights and it was fantastic. We had the tar tare, ravioli and chesses couldn't fault anything. Wines and drinks were also spot on. Staff also added to our experience extremely helpful and so lovely. Our waitress for dinner was wonderful so friendly and up for a chat. It's also refreshing as someone who works in the industry to receive spot on high quality service.Couldn't rave enough about this place. Definitely would recommend to anyone staying in Amsterdam. Position is also perfect coming from the train station and to get to everything.
title: Save the best till last

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Well kempt, trendy spot. Great, but expensive, breakfast. Room was a little smaller than I would have liked, but was very clean. Staff was friendly and check-in/out was easy. Good location, which justified the price. Would book again.
title: Good stay.

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Great stay in an excellent location near to shops and main sights. Breakfast good with choice of a few cooked items and lots of cold choices. Nice bar with reasonable price drinks that all come with nibbles. Our room was a superior room and was nice with great comfy bed.
title: Good trendy hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: We loved this hotel! The staff was helpful and friendly.The hotel is located in the middle of the city and right in front of the tram. It was easy to get anywhere. The restaurant in the hotel is four star and that includes the breakfast. i would recommend this hotel! Watch out for the leaking shower though. We used a towel against the bottom of the door to prevent it leaking out into the the entire bathroom area.Parking is in a public lot and the hotel gives a slight discount.
title: Friendly staff and great location!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Interesting hotel of very contemporary design, with a theme which continues into the bedrooms. The staff were very nice and happy to help, and the location is excellent for transport links or for walking into the centre. We did not have breakfast at the hotel as it seemed overpriced, but enjoyed the bar area and was pleasantly surprised by the variety of drinks on offer including non-alcoholic cocktails.
title: Great location for exploring Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: I spent last weekend at the INK hotel with my partner and 7 other couples.When we arrived I was impressed with the contemporary design of the hotel. Check in was relatively quick and as 4 of the rooms were not ready then some of the party were given upgrades. We decided not to pay for breakfast in the hotel because at €20 per person per day we thought it expensive. There are plenty of places nearby to get food in the morning. The hotel is in an ideal location and is one of the main reasons we decided to book here.I would say the rooms at the INK are on the small side, but they have everything we needed and the bed was one of the comfiest I've experienced in any hotel I've stayed in.When we went to check out on the Sunday, the hotel tried to charge the couples that were given an upgrade. This was just a misunderstanding and was cleared up without any extra money being taken. The 12 o'clock check out time was another big plus.All of the staff were friendly and helpful and if I was to return to Amsterdam then I would definitely consider staying here again.
title: Good base for a couple of days in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: We had no reservations and asked at the Hotel Information booth at the airport and got the name of the INK. Very close to Central Station (6 mins walking) and surrounding activities. Room was well appointed and serviced. Staff was fantastic. Jasper at the front desk was most helpful with directions, dining recommendations and just a fabulous positive attitude. If you are looking for a very comfortable place that is up to date you will find it at the INK in central Amsterdam. Thanks for a great stay. We will be back.
title: What a surprise!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: I travel weekly for work and there is no other hotel which compares to the high standards, friendly service, great atmosphere, stellar drinks and luxury beds and room as the INK HOTEL Amsterdam. The staff are so welcoming -- a really great experience. And the location just can't be beat, at INK, you are in the center of Amsterdam with all attractions and amenities at your finger tips. If in Amsterdam, there is only 1 hotel for me.
title: 5 Stars All-Round for INK Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Hands down the worst value for money ever. I paid 450 euros for a 2 night stay and the room couldn't have been worth more than £50 a night. I stayed in a travelodge in London 2 weeks ago that knocked spots off this place. Absolutely tiny room. When we got the ironing board out, we couldn't get round the room. We literally had to climb across the bed. Queen sized bed was more like a normal double. Toilet right next to the head of the bed. Not pleasant for the Mrs the following morning after a night on the Guinness. Staff unhelpful. One in particular very rude.
title: Weekend break

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: I was visiting Amsterdam for a 3 days during the Open Gardens weekend. Booked this hotel using some of my Accor Hotels points - the INK hotel is connected to Sofitel who are part of that loyalty program. With the discount that brings I reserved a Junior Suite. It was really lovely, quietly tucked away at the back of the hotel overlooking an inner courtyard. The INK hotel is in a historical old building which used to be the home of a Dutch newspaper so enjoys a nice stylish quirky design with typewriters and interesting typeface on the walls etc. The suite was a really good size, large luxurious shower / bathroom, corner sofa and lots of storage and a nice big comfy bed. I didn't get much chance to hang out in the room but when i was there it was a joy to be in.The staff were super helpful and friendly. The buffet breakfast was around 20 Euro extra a day I think but well worth it, really good choice of fresh fruit, cheeses, meat, cereals, bread and bakery goods as well as lots of hot food. The lady who seated and helped me there deserved a special mention - didn't catch her name but she was really friendly and smiley too. The hotel is in a good location, around 5 minutes from DAM Square. Amsterdam is a really beautiful walkable city and all the canals where I was visiting gardens was around a 15 minute walk.Would definitely stay here again if I'm ever back in Amsterdam.
title: Great location, quirky rooms and fab buffet breakfast.

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Showers are elevated which often results in water leaking onto concrete floors. So it's a high skip hazard. My wife slipped and almost sprained a knee. They could be sued for that if we were locals.The room designs are poor. The shower basin was in middle of room, so everyone in room watches younger ready. Never seen that before. Wasn't helpful.Good location, central to tourist spots, fine for a day or two. Overpriced for what you get and better value elsewhere.Breakfast at 20 euro is fine but cheaper cafes al around.Don't bother eating too close to hotel as it's surrounded by reaLly dodgy tourist Trash cafes. Seems the so called "cafes" exist to sell dope and not really sell food except to stoned tourists who don't know any better. Recommended that you get Away from hotel area to eat. TripAdvisor has many recommendations on good places. Use that. I am unlikely to stay here again given the safety issues and pricing and tourist trash food in the area.
title: Poor room design creates health risks

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Spent two nights at the Ink. Firstly the negatives:I had had an email to say of we checked in online in advance the key to the room would be ready. We arrived mid morning to be told it wouldn't be ready until 3pm. I queried it and the girl on reception said there was an extra (quite high) charge for early access. I was not told that. So pointless checking in in advance. As I had expected to be able to freshen up and change my clothes before going out I then had to spend the afternoon in boiling hot weather in unsuitable clothes. Not a good start.The other thing I had done in advance was to ask if they had a private bathroom as I did not like the look of the clear glass in the pictures on the website. I think they had tried to accommodate this as the glass in our bathroom was opaque but you could still see through it and I was not comfortable with this.Also the room we had was very dark and we had to have the lights on constantly as it looked out onto a solid wall!The service in the restaurant was not great-very slow considering there was only one other couple in there!Also they could do with more staff and a bigger check in desk as there were always long queues.But on the positive side-all the staff were lovely and friendly. The room although dark was very clean and modern and quirky with the writing on the walls.It was really central for everything.I would stay there again if ever in Amsterdam.
title: Quirky hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Friendly, clean, neat, trendy - great location to stroll through the city and only just over 5 mins from Amsterdam Central station, where you can go direct to the airport in 15 minutes.Enjoyed the breakfast too.
title: Great location

review: using ex-tram trains warehouse. convenient location, good dining, unique interior. attached with De Hallen annex with library, shops, movie theater, food court. nearest tram station three minutes walking distance. watch out is no windows to open in the room
title: fun hotel to be in

review: We stayed at this hotel on our last night in Amsterdam and it was the perfect ending to the trip! Hotel de Hallen is truly unique, a transformed space with creative decor and design! So fun for young couples and families! I have stayed at a number of hotels, but this one is truly unforgettable. I loved every piece of detail, the vibrant colors, trendy atmosphere, and convenient amenities. I wish we could have stayed longer! The staff is very helpful and friendly, the hotel is 20-30 minute walking distance to central Amsterdam, and the hotel rooms are perfectly designed, modern amenities, clean, comfortable, and upscale. The pricing is perfectly affordable - I actually couldn't believe how wonderful the hotel was for how much we paid! I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam and I cannot wait to return one day! A wonderful stay!
title: Lovely Hotel, Trendy Atmosphere!

review: Trendy and modern design. The rooms are clean and have a spacious bathroom with a tub and shower. The toiletries were also of nice quality. The ho.tel is right by a restaurant type of market with many vendors of different types of food. The food is great. The hotel is also off of a trolley route easy to get to from the airport on public transportation.
title: Great Value

review: Pretty disappointing, my partner and I have stayed a few times and even though previously there were a couple of things that we considered not up to scratch we'd had relatively pleasant experiences. After the last stay we won't be returning. The first issue is the staff, not true of all the staff members but most were generally rude. Entering and leaving the hotel was uncomfortable as some of the staff at reception did not make us feel welcome, I don't really appreciate being silently stared down as I walk to my room. Another issue was the relentless mini bar check while we occupied the room, not a practice I expect from a four star hotel. The problem with attitude among the staff became really evident when someone who came to check the mini bar while we were busy, entered our room without making himself known (there were a few times where someone entered our room without permission which was real invasion of privacy) and then proceeded to move our belongings with his foot to gain access to the fridge, all without saying much to either of us. We made this incident known at the end of check out and they were obviously apologetic, but during check out we were not asked how our stay was or if there were any issues, and we were told we'd used an item of the mini bar when we had not - which you'd think they'd know we didn't seeing as they checked so much. The bedsheets weren't changed for 5 nights and other areas of the room hadn't been cleaned, I'd expect more in the hygiene and upkeep of a busy hotel. Dodgy loud air conditioning and being able to hear noise from other rooms did not make for a decent rest. Issues with fees and unnecessary "holding" of money were a bother during a couple of our stays as well. They held £500 without any mention after we had already returned from our trip which is really underhand. I mean, aside from all that the stay was fine, but for the hotel element the priority should be the comfort of the guests. De Hallen seems to be more focused on becoming an institution. Reading through some of the comments it's clear we are not the only people to have experienced these things during time there and De Hallen seem to be vigilant at replying and apologising to poor reviews, however apologies are not going to mean much if nothing is done about the issues.
title: 3rd stay, last stay

review: There was so much we loved about this hotel. We found the rooms pleasantly quirky and were not bothered by the lack of windows - we were there just to sleep after all! Although the ground floor rooms line the main foyer, they seemed at least as quiet if not better than other rooms we have stayed in. The décor throughout the reception area and foyer is really funky and we enjoyed just sitting there and having a drink.The reception was very helpful at check-in and they have nice cool water on offer all day (which we helped ourselves to regularly). With one exception detailed below, the service standards were high.Although the location is a tram trip from the main tourist spots, it is a picturesque tram route and they run regularly. The added bonus of the location is the adjacent food hall which we ate at on both nights.On the last night of our stay, we spotted a used coke can lying under the bed. We could have just disposed of it but felt the reception would want to know their cleaners had missed it. They told us they would come down and remove it straight away but nobody showed up. We had to contact reception again 45 minutes later at which stage a different person said he knew nothing about it. He did come down and remove the can but by then it had turned into a larger issue for us then it should ever have been.Overall, we were happy with Hotel De Hallen and it was just a pity they handled our one complaint a little clumsily.
title: Wish we could give it full marks!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: Small rooms, but to be expected at a hotel in Europe. Very nice staff and great dinner at Pressroom. Pressroom's breakfast buffet is not worth the €20/person at all. Go to a nice restaurant down the street like Greenwoods instead for breakfast. Nice, boutique hotel in the middle of everything in Centrum but a little pricey.
title: Great Staff and okay rooms

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: We stayed at the INK for the first time recently. It was pre-cruise and therefore short but we were impressed with the Front Desk service and attitudes. Our room was modern, comfortable and well laid out with enough room for too much luggage!! The hotel is in close walking distance to the train station, shopping, restaurants, and the Main Square. The Museum Square is a quick tram ride and the tram stop is steps from the hotel door. We had an issue (not related to the hotel) and needed the hotel's assistance after we left. The staff was extremely cordial and helpful responding to our telephone calls and emails. We cannot thank them enough for this courtesy. We look forward to staying with them again on our next trip to Amsterdam.
title: Enjoyed our stay

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: We stayed at the INK for a short stay in Amsterdam. The location is excellent and practical being a 5 minute walk from Centraal Station or a 1 stop tram ride.Although it is not on one of the prettiest streets in Amsterdam it is within easy walking distance of the main sights and has a tram stop directly outside for a trip to the main museums.Check in was easy and no fuss and we were given rooms on the ground floor. The rooms didn't have a view but were not overlooked and were quiet.Room size was OK (what you would expect from a standard hotel room) but the only quibble was that there was limit space to store our cases once unpacked. We only had 2 carry on cases but they were too big to put under the bed or under the sofa. I guess the hotel would store larger bags if needed.Bathroom was semi-open plan to the bedroom which may put some off but no problem for us.Room was very clean and well equipped (coffee maker, kettle, hair dryer, robes and slippers) and loads of soaps, gels, shampoos in the bathroom. Bathroom has plenty of space for his and hers toiletries. The room was decorated in a large scale, querky map of Amsterdam so you could easily get a idea of where everything was. Breakfast buffet (included in our deal) was very good - loads of choice for all tastes and very pleasant staff.Bar was excellent for after dinner drinks with friendly and helpful bar staff.
title: Great Short Stay Location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: INK Amsterdam is trying to live up to the new definition of cool in the fierce competition of modern boutique hotels and is successful in being so.Stumbling in with too much luggage, the ambiance of the hotel once we were inside was an immediate calmer on a so far stressful journey.Check-in was personable, kind - and the room was great value for it's price, a notch ahead of similar concepts I've experienced in other parts of Europe. From bed to bathroom to power outlets we felt that a lot of smart design and well-thought through interiors had gone into the process. Take for instance the wallpaper, which actually gives a pretty good and fun guide to Amsterdam and what to expect and experience during the stay. Moreover, the room offered well airconditioned, quiet and uninterrupted sleep and the room felt as private as should be expected from a high-class hotel.Similarly, the hotel is built in a way which values its secluded though transparent spaces and we registered that both a birthday was celebrated and business meetings were being held without anyone distrubing one another.We came back several times to the hotel rather than staying out late simply because of the bar and lounge area, which added on to the experience - the signature INK drink (picture) as well as the artichokes are recommended!Breakfast was a bit busy, but still worth the additional price.
title: Lived up to every expectation and more

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 67, 1012 RE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
hotelName: INK Hotel Amsterdam - MGallery by Sofitel
review: been there this week for the second time (first time was August 2015). Hotel is perfectly situated in the heart of the city. 5 to 10 min walk from the station.Rooms are nicely decorated with handmade maps of the city and funny descriptions on it. Rooms are not very big, but there's enough space to feel comfortable. WC and shower are in the same room (no separated bathroom), which can be disturbing at first, but it's a concept...Breakfast is expensive, but worth the price. Impressive buffet of warm & cold dishes, English breakfast, different sorts of bread, salmon, cheeses, ham, salami, fresh fruits, jams, yoghurt, viennoiseries... fresh fruit juices and warm beverages. and the restaurant is very comfortable.We'll definitely will come back on our next visit
title: high standard hotel - Wonderful breakfast

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very friendly staff welcomed us. We enjoyed the executive rooms with jacuzzi bath. Location was great as we wanted to visit Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. High end shopping street PC Hooftstraat is paralell street. Plenty of restaurants at walking distance. We parked our car at the Byzantium parking at 5 min walking. Great location for a city trip as you can walk to all city highlights.
title: Lovely Boutique hotel very close to museum district

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We loved our stay. Thomas at the front desk went out of his way to make us feel comfortable and welcome. Loved the honor bar in the lobby and the eclectic decor. The lobby cafe was trendy and the food was delicious. The rooms were modern, beds were super comfortable and the long jetted tub was a welcome site after a full day of sightseeing. Located just a few blocks from the major museums and canal cruises as well. Highly recommend it!
title: Perfect boutique hotel near museums

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: From the moment of our arrival which was a bit late around 11pm to be exact my daughter and I felt welcomed by the staff at Hotel JL 76 the entry is quite bright and charming. The desk representative was quite lovely and gave me all the information I could possibly need for my stay. The room was beyond my expectations with a full jet stream tub and steam shower and tv! The bed was plush and comfy and the robes were quite the plus. The daily breakfast was delicious and plentiful! The staff was amazing I honestly have not stayed at a better hotel. Their service and accommodations exceeded my expectations and I am a travel blogger I travel quite often. Please do yourself a favor and stay here!
title: The Perfect Amsterdam Gem!

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The room was lovely! The location perfect! Everyone who works there is exceptional in their customer service & friendly attitudes. I have already recommended your hotel to friends & will continue to do so.
title: perfect place to stay in Amsterdam

review: One of the best hotels we stayed in all of Europe..the most comforting factor is the location. It is bang in the centre..about 2 min walk to tram stop..and a 5 min walk to the canal. The square its located in never sleeps.. great comfortable stay!
title: Great stay..!!

review: Summarized: when we told the young lady at the front desk we didn't enjoy our stay as we found the hotel outdated with old carpets & beds, small and dirty rooms, we simply got the reply "it's an old building"... Definately not worth 4**** status.Note for tourists: this hotel is not the Dutch 4**** standard!!!Not a recommendation
title: Great disappointment: hotel outdated & overpriced

review: This was our fourth stay here and our best. We had a room on the fifth floor facing the square - we loved it as we could watch everything. The hotel provided earplugs if you found it too noisy. Room was clean extremely comfy had a fridge and coffee machine. Lovely toiletries. Extremely friendly staff who couldn't do enough to help. We loved the style of the hotel, the Art Deco style, paintings, lift etc. It was exciting to see the TV show being filmed each evening. A fantastic hotel - in fact our favourite NH hotel in the area.
title: Fantastic stay

review: We arrived for a 2 night short break for my 30th birthday, upon arriving in Room 201 there was a very thoughtful gesture left by the hotel manager which was much appreciated. Thanks again!! The room itself was a fair size and nicely presented, this room overlooked the vibrant Rembrandtplein square and it was good to open the bay windows to soak up some of the atmosphere. You could argue that later in the evening this position could be a bit noisy but this is to be expected and the hotel do kindly provide earplugs if required, this wasnt an issue for us however. The hotel generally is clean and tidy and we found the staff to be polite and helpful. We agreed that we would both come back without hesitation.
title: Lovely hotel and staff

review: The staff were very accommodating. Breakfasts were great and the location was in a fun spot with easy access to trams and canals. We enjoyed our stay very much. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. We would definitely recommend staying here.
title: Amsterdam fun

review: Positives - Good location. Close to tram lines and the museum district and lots of restaurants across the canals.Beds are comfy as are the pillows. Thought we would be cold with just 1 blankets but the rooms stay quite warm.Friendly staff.Downside - The smokers are right outside the main entrance so the stairway leading up to the foyer smells of cigarettes.The steps leading into the foyer are quite step and there doesn't seem to be any other access so keep that in mind.It's a little noisy if you are toward the front of the hotel but overall not an issue if you don't plan on being in your room much.When we arrived after an 18hr flight knowing we couldn't check in we thought we would get some breakfast. The gentleman behind the desk directed us around the corner for a restaurant so we took his advice however if we had been directed across the canal we would have about 100 options for restaurants. The way we were directed had very little to offer.There are no toiletries offered by the hotel so make sure you bring your own.
title: Good location

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We came to the Netherlands for the North Sea Jazz Festival which was fabulous and we hope to come again next year! Don't know if we would come back to this hotel unfortunately and yet I feel that it has great potential as the building and location is great!
title: 3 night Amsterdam stay

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is in a good location but they have charged my credit card even if the hotel accommodation was paid in full months before the actual hotel stay. I had to wait and contact few people before they even refund the money. Also, they did not refund the full amount and I have been sending follow up emails with no response at all. DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL!
title: DO NOT STAY HERE

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We enjoyed staying here. Our room was small but modern. The bar was great for getting a beer before heading out. They looked after our bags all day before we flew home. The only problem is the painfully slow check in and out.
title: Very nice hotel

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I am not joking. When me and my wife put our two cases down after entering the room we could not get out of the room. This room and bathroom are made for midgets. The matrass of the bed was hanging over on both sides, and we would have fallen off if it wasn't for our luggage that kept us on the bed.The towels are white, thick and luxorious. The staff are very helpful and booking in was seamless. The position is fantastic and the rooms are clean. (Because of size won't take long to clean.) I like the fact that the manager responds to Tripadvisor advice.
title: The smallest room I have ever stayed in.

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: All other rooms were good. We had total 5 rooms, and we were promised a triple for the same price just added for an extra bed. The staff was excelent, and the breakfast was very good. Of course, we will come back another time.
title: I was not satisfied with the trible room. It was at the same standart as all the other, but we were three persons in it.

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Awesome location just walking distance to Museumplein & Ledseplein and Vondelpark. We wanted to stay a decent distance away from city center and this was the perfect place. Much closer to Schiphol airport than Amsterdam centraal. The hotel offers transportation to the airport but it's a fraction of the price if you take an Uber. Staff was very friendly. Room could've been a lot cleaner but it had the essentials like coffee pot and water kettle. Semen (well what else could it be? Lol) stains on the curtains...
title: Great location & friendly staff

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: There are very few hotels that can compete with the Apollo's location and price - but make no mistake you will pay a higher price to stay in the centre of Amsterdam. Check in was thankfully quick, however, make sure you enquiry exactly what security deposits you put on your credit card, we were slapped with a huge deposit. The rooms are very tiny, and when I say tiny I am not over exaggerating. The room pictures they use on Booking.com look deceptively big - but once you check in you quickly realise why don't publish pictures of their standard rooms. But after all you are here to explore the city, not sit in your hotel room all day. The location is what makes this hotel so fantastic, we could stroll around the corner and be at the Van Gogh Museum, Rijks Museum and the "I AMsterdam" sign. The Heineken Experience building is also down the road and really a MUST do. The beds in our room are incredibly soft - but not in a good way.
