More like when you sit down on your bed, you almost sink to the floor. So not the most comfortable sleep. The towels also need to be replaced, they have been bleached so many times they are already showing signs of tearing apart.Our air conditioner was making a horrendous noise when we checked in - we enquired with reception if they could send someone from maintenance to have it checked. But we were advised that maintenance would only be able to do it the next day??! Knowing we would not get any sleep, we asked to be moved to a different room, and thankfully they had another standard room available.The breakfast buffet is the usual European selection of bread, yoghurts, cereal, cheese and meats. The coffee tasted weak and the juice diluted - so rather opt for a cappuccino - which is available for an additional 1 Euro. The dining tables and chairs are in serious need of a revamp. The seating chairs were worn out and torn and not very comfy to sit on. Overall, we enjoyed the convenience of being in the centre of Amsterdam, but next time will rather opt for a hotel with better beds to sleep on.
title: Great Location, but hotel in need of some TLC

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Small rooms and bathroom,confused service at the reception,only good thing is location.Unconfourtable bed,bathroom smells bad.Always noise from hall in the morning,breakfast was also poor for this money
title: Small rooms and wc,confused service at the reception,only good thing is location.Unconfourtable bed,bathroom smells bad.

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Incredibly small room! But if you want to live like Harry Potter - in a cupbard, this is the place. Be ready to stay in or on the bed - or in the shower - when in the room! If you are claustrophobic or don't like double duvets, then go somewhere else!
title: Do you want to live like Harry Potter before Hogswarts?

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is in a good central location and I'd say it's a budget hotel.. guessing that as I didn't book it, work did.. Rooms are clean but small, en suite too small I'd say.. breakfasts decent enough.. Wouldn't rule out staying here again, you get what you pay for.. good staff, decent hotel..
title: Half decent

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: In parts the hotel looks tired but I have to say we quite like it and it is clean. As a base in the museum district it is ideal and you don't need to use public transport as just about anywhere in town is a walk (some longer than others).Our room, which is a standard twin on the third floor with a rear view, is I suppose bijou. The two beds probably cover 50% of the floor space. Other furniture includes a wardrobe, two bedroom cabinets and a desk (with chair) with shelf above.The beds themselves are extremly comfortable and the only issue we have is the squeeze to get into the one nearest the window. However you are not doing it all the time so why worry.The corner bathroom contains one of those modern round basins that is difficult to wash your face in but the shower is excellent.Linen has to date been lovely and clean and the towels feel nice and fluffy.Breakfast is good with a nice variety of rolls with all the usual continental breakfast standards.As for the staff well they are probably the highlight of the hotel. They could not be nicer and it has been a pleasure to interact with them. From getting cups of ice from behind the bar to getting extra pillows to just getting good responses to the random questions we have asked them we have yet to encounter a problem.We can really recommend the hotel if you want a decent stay in Amsterdam.
title: Good base

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very good location of the hotel is great, trams and busses near by in case needed. The breakfast was amazing and plenty, museums and city center are close by. Everything you need is within reach. Thanks
title: Nice hotel close to everything important!

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Loved every bit of my stay at Apollo! The staff remembered my name and my birthday throughout the weekend. I was very pleased with the location: very close to Vondelpark and the shopping center of Amsterdam.
title: Great Location and Awesome Staff!

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for 2 nights in July The location is next to museums and across from the canal which I could see from my room. I was able to,pick up a canal cruise across the street. It is also on the same block that holds the most expensive strip of shops in Amsterdam - good for window shopping. Even though the street is a bit busy, the hotel is quiet. The rooms are a pretty good size for Europe. The bar is open all day for snacks and drinks. Breakfast is just OK but plenty if you are not looking for fancy and want to just get your day started. The staff was friendly and check in/check out easy.
title: Best Location

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is in a great location but they have a lot of problems connecting online payments and paying at the hotel. I paid double, at the hotel and online and nobody wants to refund me, even after they promised they would. I am really disappointed.
title: Be careful...

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is really close to the museums as well as the Paradiso venue. Canal Cruises are also right behind the corner. We stayed only one night in June, but even though the room was not so big, it was modern and comfortable and clean. The shower was nice, however be careful so the water doesn't run down to the room ;)We arrived earlier in the day and it was a relief that we could do early check-in to leave our luggage in the room and refresh before going out again.I can recommend this hotel for its convenient location, modern and compact rooms and very good breakfast.
title: Great location for the museums and for the Paradiso venue as well

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Excellent location and easy to reach by tram or bus as one of the great advantages. Tramlines and buslines with numbers should be mentioned prominently on the hotel homepage or booking sites. Great breakfast. Room 309 very small and should also be redone. Very friendly staff.
title: A place to recommend

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had prebooked a taxi from the airport online before we travelled. This was a little trickier than first thought as the airport is vast and we found ourselves wandering around for a while looking for the WTC (world trade centre - pick up point). The WTC is located behind the Sheraton (which you can see when leaving the airport) and not really visible from the airport, also no signs. However this was not arranged by the hotel but thought its worth mentioning for anyone else who pre books a taxi and are given the same instructions.When we arrived at the hotel, check in was quick and easy and off we went to our room. I enjoyed the fact there were fresh apples on reception for you to have whenever you liked. Yes the rooms are small but when in a city knowing we weren't going to spend much time in the room itself it did not bother us at all. Nice bathroom/wet room. Coffee making facilities. Hairdryer. Aircon.... perfect. My only gripe is that the bed was a little hard and it did need a lick of paint in places but it was clean.We didn't drink or have breakfast in the hotel so cannot comment on prices. There are so many nearby shops to pick up a breakfast.The hotel is situated on the outskirts of the 'centre' which is where we always prefer to be as we always discover lots of things on the walk into the centre (Dam Square). It is right next door to the Van Gogh Museum and the Heineken factory. Sorry, didn't go to either so can't comment on these attractions.We came to Amsterdam for the U2 gig at Amsterdam Arena. The arena is located in the middle of nowhere really and not within walking distance. A taxi cost us €30 from the hotel to the arena - about a 15-20 min drive. It cost the same on the way home from the main taxi queue outside of the arena.We also visited the Anne Frank Museum which is located in the centre, about 15-20 min walk from the hotel. I highly recommend booking online before you travel. We booked 2 months in advance and there weren't many tickets left. My partner thought this would be pretty boring but he was quite surprised at how interesting this was... make sure you you pick up an audio pack at the entrance as most of the info is given through this.We found drink prices to be approx €6 a pint. We didn't even entertain the pubs that advertised the price the food but not the beer as we were warned that these places around Dam Square would be very expensive.In between our hotel and the walk to the centre there are a few streets of restaurants which are cheaper than the ones bang in the centre. You have the choice of Italian, Greek, Mexican food etc. We visited the 'El Vino' Mexican restaurant and loved the food and the friendliness of the staff. Sorry, can't remember the names of the other restaurants but we all looked to serve nice food.The streets of Amsterdam are like a spiders web, you will get lost, its a given. Make sure you pick up a map out of the magazine in the hotel room. This came in very handy.
title: Nice hotel in a great location

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: If you want to have a good stay, do not forget your CB (30 Euros/night/parking; taxes not included in the Booking Price, 1 Euro for a Cappuccino even if you have paid for a full breakfast...).The location is rather great and you can visit many things just walking a few minutes.In spite of this , i will not book again in this Hotel and will prefer a less expensive one for my next trip at Amsterdam.
title: Have your CB with you for this Hotel !

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Excellent location to walk to lots attractions or take the tram and the price is reasonable. People working there all are very friendly and helpful!Our group had 6 rooms, most of them were small and the beds were not that comfortable.
title: convenient hotel for museum lovers

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This accommodation had everything I needed for a the short stay in Amsterdam. Centrally located to shops and a short walking distance to most of the world famous Museums - with public transport and taxi services so close at hand. The service and information from staff was excellent and helpful. Airport shuttle bus costs five euro and located close to the hotel. I had no problem getting there with my heavy suitcases.
title: A lot to see in a 48 hour stay.

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Perfect location,friendly staff,rooms just need a bit of TLC,we were very close to museum square,and a multitude of bars and restaurants were a short walk away.The transport system in Amsterdam was first class,just watch out for the bicycles.
title: Our stay in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel is ok. Room is very small. Breakfast is good. But they put me and my friend um in a 2nd floor room and no stairs. We had a 20kg+ luggage each. I have back problems and it got worse and we are just starting our trip.
title: Ok

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location and very helpful staff. I return because the management and quality of the staff is consistent over the past 3 years. I don't eat at the hotel but observe that other guests enjoy their breakfasts and drinks at the bar
title: i keep coming back

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The location is perfect (very close to Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum), tram stop is nearby. The room was rather small but quite adequate - and clean. Tea & coffee making facilities in the room. Comfortable beds. You can have a good & copious breakfast (though with several days' stay you find the food range a bit narrow). This was our third stay at the hotel and if we visit Amsterdam again we will definitely choose this place once more.
title: Good value for money

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Staff are rude! They charge you twice, my account was debited without being told and then I was charged on arrival! Not helpful. Check in was 2 hours late after requesting early check in we didn't get our room until 5.
title: Shocking stay/ staff/ service

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is in an amazing location, it's away from all the tourist shops and is real Amsterdam. I only have one negative and it's a bit of a pet peeve - rooms listed as "two beds" don't really have two beds; it's two singles pushed so close together you're basically sharing a double. Everything else was fantastic! Staff is superb.
title: True Amsterdam

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Good hotel with friendly personnel. Close to Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum.Public transport nearby. Good shopping facilities for high end clothes.Easy access to central Amsterdam, Rooms a bit on the small size, but good for a few days stay.
title: Friendly people close to the museums

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: no elevator to my room (2nd floor) and the carpet was disgusting, bathroom not well designed with water everywhere.you want 200 characters and there's nothing I can say more so I'll just put words like that.
title: poor stay

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We travelled as two couples for a long weekend.ROOMLovely simple and spacious Deluxe rooms. Shower was a bit strange so got quite wet in the bathroom on the floor.Hotel provided coffee/tea in the bedroom however no milk! When we asked reception for milk, they said no! Bed was huge and really comfortable so happy with our room.STAFFI must admit, we were all extremely disappointed with the service from the staff here. Didn't seem very happy to help.As we arrived to the hotel, we were advised we had to pay €60 per room (€120 all together), we knew to be aware of this after looking at previous reviews. However, we still find it shocking this is not made known to you at the point of booking. LOCATIONWell after looking at some reviews and the name of the hotel, I thought this was pretty much central, but it's about 35-40 minute walk to Dam Square. Around 10 minutes on a tram. We had to get a tram travel ticket for the duration of our trip because the walking was too much for us.We will not be staying here again and wouldn't really recommend this place to anyone booking to go Amsterdam.
title: Wouldn't stay again

hotelLocation: P.C. Hooftstraat 2, 1071 BX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here for 5 days and it was a great choice. Wonderful location - we could walk everywhere. Rented bikes from the hotel one day and it was a great value. Room was small but all that we needed since we didn't spend much time in it. Staff was friendly. Would recommend this hotel to others and would stay here again.
title: Great location near museums and canelsSt

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 53, 1012 AC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Despite being reassured that a previous bed bug problem had been resolved we arrived to find bed bugs, which were large!. We booked through Booking.com and they refused to help us find a new location because it was 2 in the morning! There was no manager on duty to refund our money. Thank god we were not a family with young children. The whole place is dated and needs to be renovated.
title: bedbugs!!!

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 53, 1012 AC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for 4 nights with 3 family members for my nieces 18th birthday, reception staff were friendly and helpful,location was brilliant.Bedrooms very dated and bedding ripped? Completely different to what is advertised on the website? We had a mouse in our room on the first night,spoke to reception and was moved to a room on the second floor, the bedding in that room was more ripped than the first?? Also found the following morning that also had MICE and BEDBUGS!!!!! I have taken photos of the bugs in the Beds and the state of the room as we all ended up with bites and one of the girls in our group has ended up with very painful and infected bite I would defiantly not recommend this hotel and think the owners need to improve the standards. I would not stay here again!!!
title: Great location

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 53, 1012 AC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We did not recommend this hotel at all. Even the staff was friendly and it is in front of Amsterdam Central, the hotel is poor; for us, breakfast was bad, beds are uncomfortable and i think my husband and big daughter were bitten by bedbugs...It was not that clean. No air conditioner, no fan with like 34 grades, hot, hot
title: Just good location

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 145, 1011 AT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It was our first visit to amsterdam and we picked hotel library, i spoke with the hotel before booking and they were very nice, we let them know that it was our wedding anniversary and our first visit to amsterdam. When we arrived at airport it was so easy to get the train and we arrived in central station and we walked to our hotel took us ten mins to walk there. on arrival the hotel looked lovely outside and inside was very welcoming. We were on the top floor which was very steep at the top i ended up crawling up the stairs! as the steps where so tiny! but it didn't put us off , the room was lovely, clean and the bathroom was amazing, there were chocolates and wine out for us because they new it was our wedding anniversary which was a lovely touch! We stayed for three nights and liked that there was free coffee and fresh fruit downstairs , it was only few minutes away from all the sites and we walked everywhere there were plenty of trams as well , we are looking forward to going again in a few months as we enjoyed it so much.
title: hotel library amsterdam lovely!

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 145, 1011 AT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: In general the room is clean and the beds are good. We had to climb up some very steep stairs to get to our room on the third floor. The room is pretty spartan and utilitarian. It does the job, but the place is pretty expensive for what you get. The location is quite good, being a 10 min walk from the train station.
title: Clean but spartan and expensive. Good location

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 145, 1011 AT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The location was a selling point as it is right across from the Central Station. It is walking distance to many of the top sites. Admittedly not much from the outside, the room was larger than expected, modern, clean and just right for me, my wife and our grandson. (He especially liked the lift as did I.) The breakfast room is pretty and the breakfast was a good variety. The staff were all pleasant although mostly all-business. There were a real variety of people. Many singles and people looking for a secure environment. A good European hotel.
title: Cosmopolitan Sleeper

review: Room was not to a 4 star standard but okay for a weekend away. The river is beautiful and you can sit out there during the day and it is in close proximity to a train station. There is a woods nearby which is lovely to walk through. Overall nice stay and would probably go again.
title: Nice stay

review: I am staying in Amsterdam for 2 nights, so i booked the Tulip Inn Amsterdam Riverside. The location was not great, but at least it have a river view and the street view. The room was clean, good lighting, great presentation and bed work. This is a bit too good for a 4-star hotel. The restaurant's breakfast was superb, lots of variety and good quality. The check-in and check-out was clear, no confusion there! Overall, good rooms, worth the money and you can easily visit there. Good job, hotel. Keep it up!
title: First-rate Stay, worth the money, easy to book, good at everything

review: Terrible customer service. My family stayed there as part of our tour, when checking in, they misplaced a batch of our tour group room key and blamed someone in the tour group took the key! However, the keys were found behind the counter and they didn't even apologize! Rude customer service as well when asked questions.Ps: Please be aware that some rooms does not have A/C.
title: Horrible Stay

review: I travel the world staying in many hotels but this one takes the cake. 1 first arrived room smelt mouldy one tiny bar of soap size of a tea bag for myself and wife had to ask for more coffee set up had only one cup when there was meant to be two so we shared a cup. Called for room service they said they were short staff so come pick up yourself. Hotel must be next to a night club as constant dj music all day and nite it's a Saturday or festival.When cabin cleaner came this morning I told him don't clean my room just give us extra towels seems simple so I gave him my room service tray from night before that was all he had too do was take it away and didn't have to clean my room so what does he do places by my door and just leaves there it's now 11 pm and it's still there disgraceful.There's no sense of hospitality at all , will never stay here again and I don't recommend it to any one. A shocker.
title: Worst Ever

hotelLocation: 139 Prins Hendrikkade, 1011 AS Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Booked to stay here without knowing that it was just opening this week. Friendly staff could not be more helpful. The hotel is really well designed and to a very high spec. Close to the centre and train station but quiet compared to being right in the centre. The room was lovely. Well designed, large and very comfortable. Breakfast was great also. I will be using it again. Much nicer than a big chain.
title: Great new hotel

hotelLocation: 139 Prins Hendrikkade, 1011 AS Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Nothing more exciting then staying in a brand new hotel. Everything was extra clean and new. The location is great close to central station which was very helpful since this was my first time visiting from another country. I was able to uber in a short distance. The hotel was also walking distance to main points of the city , the staff is very helpful and kind and helped me with plans and transportation and the breakfast was fresh. The design is unique and tasteful. I look forward to staying here again soon!
title: Great location & new!

review: The hotel is close to everything Amsterdam as to offer. Most attractions are within walking distance and if prefer it is also close to trams as well. The staff is friendly and the rooms are nice and quiet too
title: Great stay

review: I was so amazed with this place, after a last minute booking and at a great price I wasn't sure what to expect. I came here with my best friend and with two large suitcases and a lot of stairs facing us we panicked, but the staff were amazing and as soon as they saw us attempt to go up they rushed over and helped us, even took the suitcases down for our departure. The rooms are small, but cozy and you don't really notice, we requested a room with a canal view and we got it, it was so worth asking for it, so beautiful to wake up and go to sleep, seeing the view!! The breakfast was above average, plenty of options and lots of stroop waffles!!! And if we ever brought food back they let us take cups and cutlery up to our room!! When we rented a bike from the hotel, but I soon learnt I in fact could no longer ride a bike they let us be refunded. I am currently in Amsterdam at the moment, and am heart broken that this place was booked out, although I understand why. If you're looking for location, staff, value 100% book here!!!
title: AMAZING!!!!!

review: Stayed here for two nights from 26-28th July as a surprise trip my partner booked for my birthday. Our room was absolutely beautiful and quiet with lovely views of the city and of a garden below. We went out on the first night (got engaged ) and when returned to the room the staff had left a meat and cheese board and a bottle of wine. The staff were so helpful and friendly and nothing was too much. They also allowed us to store our luggage after we checked out so we could explore the city some more as our flight was at night. Would definitely return to this hotel. Thankyou for making our trip so special!
title: Perfect trip

review: We found this hotel on last-minute.com and booked a 2 night stay. Check in is at 3pm but we arrived at 12 pm, very early, we we're very fortunate to be checked in by the lovely Dana ( front desk manager) who upgraded us to a room with a balcony and proceeded to get our room ready asap even though we were very early. We then were able to leave our luggage and go explore and get lunch while this was happening. We got to our room at 2pm and walked through the door to find some bubbly and balloons for my husband's birthday. It was a lovely touch, as well as the call Dana made to see if we had everything we needed and to wish us a lovely stay. All the staff we encountered we're friendly and helpful. The only negative I would add is the room was slightly dated and a bit tired décor wise, but clean and tidy. Would definitely stay there again!
title: Birthday break

review: We booked this hotel last minute (literally the day before) and were very happy with our one nights stay, as it was our anniversary I requested a double bed as opposed to a twin but because they were all taken we were upgraded which was lovely. The lady who checked us in was very friendly and helpful and as we arrived a little early we were able to leave our luggage in a locked room so we could explore Amsterdam before our room was ready. The hotel is in a great location to explore and was very clean and tidy. The room was a good size and the bed very comfy. We had breakfast included and there was so much choice from hot to cold food, a big choice of juices & drinks, good coffee and the breads available were beautiful and fresh. We loved all the art work in the hotel too. We would have no hesitation staying in your hotel and recommending it.
title: Great staff, great location, very happy with our stay

review: Staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. Room was comfortable but a little tired. Breakfast was buffet style but the choices were amazing so a really good start to the day. Arrived at 10am and checked in but staff were happy to store luggage until 3pm.
title: Lovely stay on a short break

review: First of all the hotel from the airport is around 15-20 minutes this will cost you between €50-€52 in a taxi. If you want to get cheaper transport you can get the train to Central Station and the tram which then stops right outside the hotel, like literally drops you at the front door. First impressions of this hotel were good, the reception is well decorated. The location is great, you are 30 second walk from the flower market, and a 10 minute walk from the Royal Palace and the Red Light District. The hotel is also located with Bars, Pubs and Restaurants in a 5 minute walking distance, just across the tram track, where you will find coffee shops, Wagamamas, McDonald's, local cafes and lots more. The Ice Bar is also located in this area. Back to the hotel, the hotel has great first impressions but the room we stayed in was on the 7th floor and was very small, and an extremely small bathroom. Definitely not worth the €200 a night price (approx). The staff can be a little rude and stand offish. Sort of this you are a burden to talk to. The house keeping is poor, the sheets are not changed, ours were not changed in 3 days. The bathroom again is SMALL, and dated. It also needs some serious maintenance. Over all, I was a little disappointed with the hotel, for the amount of money I paid.
title: Expensive but good location

review: I am not expecting anything in this Hotel, as I'm in party mode all I need was a clean room and comfortable bed. When I checked in I asked the receptionist if possible to have a room with a nice view(hoping that he will give me the view of hotel l'europe) He respond yes the room is ready sir and its with a nice view. he handed me the keycard of room 532, So when I entered its a fabulous surprise.. I got what I want.. a room with a view which usually not available with a standard room and I know Amsterdam very well and stayed in many hotels and In my opinion my room has the best view in Amsterdam . Its very comfortable bed, friendly staff, beautiful breakfast area the corridor is quiet old but they have nice lift so I think they are renovating. its super accessible to everywhere as tram stops just infront of the entrance of the hotel. So if I will be in party mode again I will definitely stay again, hoping in the same room :)
title: Room with Best view

review: Great hotel, clean rooms and in a great location in the heart of Amsterdam. The breakfast was great with plenty of choice! Furniture in rooms was slightly dated but our room was very big and clean. Well worth the money.
title: Great location

review: Our new room was spacious and better than our original room, due to some hick up upon check in, we were allocated a better room, thanks to the efficient solution to us. The hotel looks tired and it seems like it has never been renovated or refurnished at all but I will say, the location is really very good.P/S; you must book the half day tour to see the windmills, cheese factory and the wooden shoes.. never regret!!! even we experienced heavy rain in the morning when we were in the tour.
title: Excellent location

review: The Hotel is renovating its rooms, I think by the end of the year most rooms should be done. We were very lucky to get one of the few already renovated rooms and it was very nice: modern and clean, no old carpets, beatiful design (see photos). We really liked this room a lot, but felt a bit bad for those who had old rooms, these are absolutely not compareable!Stuff was very nice and helpfull and breakfast extremely good! Large choice of different stuff and its possible ask for an individually prepared omlette.
title: Get a renovated room and be happy!

review: Good location.. good breakfast.. very good staff named morani... very average hotel for the price. We took the 6th floor rooms with balony. Small rooms.. Worne out hotel. Needs a renovation desperately..
title: Good location..

review: Me and my girlfriend went to Amsterdam for a weekend getaway, our first time there so were both excited. we were met by a long wait to check into the the room, before entering it to find it was tiny. There was so little light in the bathroom that we had to have the door open to let light in when having a shower and there was no extractor fan so it just steamed everything up. And to top everything off the later that evening we happened to notice some red marks on the carpet, to our disgust when we looked closer it was BLOOD, YES BLOOD! and when we told the staff they tried to tell us it was red wine but it was obviously blood there was no doubting it. They did then send someone up to clean it who just stunk the room out with chemicals, which after the carpet had dried the stains were still there, so they tried again and it still didn't help.
title: Not a 4 star hotel by any stretch of the imagination

review: 1st they gave me old room wasn't used for a years , after complain they gave me bigger but still was't used for long time and very dirty one ..you can smell the dust before u enter the room...when I checked out , I asked them to bring my 4 big bags.. receptionist said sorry bring them by your self coz we dont have some one 2 help u in this and i had to bring down 4 big bags!..rooms are very small.
title: bad rooms and staff...nice location

review: We are rarely disappointed by the NH chain. It always lives up to expectations. We were treated exceptionally well, even though we arrived early on a busy weekend. Our luggage was safely stowed allowing us to enjoy Amsterdam right away. The room was clean, well appointed and roomy. Thanks for another great stay!
title: Another awesome stay

review: I booked this hotel as an early birthday present for my boyfriend and was really worried because of the reviews. We arrived at the hotel early and was able to keep our luggage there until our room was ready. The staff were very lovely and helpful. We was amazed with the room we got. It was very clean and was a lovely spacious room. We was on the top floor and had two balconies. Couldn't fault the hotel at all. We had the best trip and the hotel and room we had made it even better.
title: Early birthday present

review: what would you expect from a hotel room for euro 315 per night? 11 qm room with a view to the wall of next very close building? bad smoky smell? a filthy old carpet? a tiny bathroom with not working air vent? that was not what i expected, but that was what we found. but the breakfast was nice and the location very central ... :)
title: Citytrip

review: I am sorry I was unable to write a proper review on this Hotel as I was ill when I was due to travel. After advising reception staff I sent several e mails apologising for the disruption I had caused and suggested re booking later in the year. However I never received any reply or response. My booking organiser advised me that the Hotel stated that my payment was non refundable and that was that.I had not asked for a refund instead a rescheduling, however the Hotel has felt that it is perfectly acceptable to collect over 400 euros and provide no service whatsoever instead.I feel hotels are supposed to be hospitable and friendly. I feel this one has shown neither and I would strongly recommend that you check all terms and conditions if considering a visit.
title: Abide by the terms and conditions and don't fall ill

review: The NH chain in Amsterdam has some excellent locations, this hotel's location is one of them. It is near everything and mid range price for your stay. The rooms are good but forget the view. The breakfast is excellent with super service but a little bit hard to access. Free WiFi in the lobby area and good airport shuttle service. I rented a car with a driver from the hotel and it was excellent ride. the driver was very resourceful and helpful. One of the things I like is that the elevator generates electricity when moving between floors. So an hotel with a sense of responsibility. Great.
title: Location should make you happy

hotelLocation: Verlengde Van Marwijk Kooystraat 30, 1114 AC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Easily reachable by car. Free underground parking. Nice and efficient personnel. Metro to Center at 10 or 15 mn on foot. Breakfast is ok. But poor aera (business park with no restaurants around ) good security. some dust on the fridge and on the Bible ☺
title: Bastion hotel

review: It was a very fast reservation (1 min last minute), the price was good for the location but the room was very dusty, the tv did not work properly and the door of the shower was broken (not that bad). for a single night it was very ok. the personal/staff was extremly friendly and helpful, thx guys.
title: The attic

review: Terrible place. No wifi, drug taking on doorstep, curtains falling off, building site for reception, terrace door not locking. Totally overpriced and to be avoided. TV not correctly tuned, dirty communal areas.
title: Don't stay here

hotelLocation: Sarphatipark 106 b, 1073 EC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Me and my boyfriend making our trip to Amsterdam and been looking forward to stay at The Arcade Hotel cause their pictures on the website look so good. Turn out when we get here we couldn't find the hotel cause there is no sign or the name anywhere so we guess from some random paper on the window said "Ar_ade" with no C. This place still under construction, dusty everywhere in the air and smell very bad. The stairs to the upper floor as small as hamsters house. When we open the door to our room we kicked the bed cause the bed just stand right there you have to move very slowly and super careful cause the hallway in the room is very small (check my picture)Bathroom was the worst cause the water couldnt go down the well so it's flooding. The front desk say "Its our "DESIGN"" of the place .... I'm speechless cause if you can call this "Design" I would never send anyone to study with you.Pretty much not worth your time and money to come to stay here and tell your friend family neighbors and some strangers you walk pass never come here!!!!!
title: The worst hotel experience and over advertising picture on the website

hotelLocation: Sarphatipark 106 b, 1073 EC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The room was well sized and so was the bathroom. The fan and light however we complex to operate, ask reception. The highlight however was the games room and the many, many consoles to play on. Such a brilliant idea. Bike hire is simple and bikes are well maintained. Breakfast is good, thanks for the barista coffee! Staff are super chilled and lovely. Only criticism is that I couldn't find my favourite ps1 games. :D
title: Really, really cool Hotel

hotelLocation: Sarphatipark 106 b, 1073 EC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Honestly, the stairs are mountains. My kneecaps gave in on day 2/4. Had to get on my friends back and have him hoist me up and dump me into my bed that I assume was low budget as I almost snapped my spine in half as my back collided with what was supposed to be comfort. On the bright side, Vincenzo was a friendly guy
title: Ow My legs

hotelLocation: Sarphatipark 106 b, 1073 EC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Excellent room and facilities, way better than any of us were expecting. Only fault of this place is the cleaners. Extremely clean but a few of our possessions were chucked out whilst we were out sightseeing. Such as water bottles we used on a night time that we kept next to our beds and 2 sets of eyelashes which were left out neatly in the bathroom on tissue (costing me just under £20). Hide anything you don't want to part with! The cleaners don't think before chucking things out.
title: Excellent place but cleaners chucked out oir belongings.

hotelLocation: Sarphatipark 106 b, 1073 EC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Worst stay ever. They are renovating the whole place, you could not even find the enterance it looked like no one was living there. Should not be up an running. Could not sleep through the night due to extreme noise from the builders. Try to compensate with breakfast but it does not make up for it. We were super excited to go here and could not have been more disappointed. The room did not look anything like they show you in photos and it was extremely dirty!! Our bedsheets had holes in them and the bedside table was so gross i didnt want to touch it. But what was true is that you get a big TV- it's just not possible to use it... Worst stay ever. Don't go her, staff is not very helpfull or welcoming. Not going back.
title: Don't go here!!

hotelLocation: Sarphatipark 106 b, 1073 EC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My company booked me small double room and I got a hostel type accommodation, no mirror in the room for 115€/night! I understand the place is under construction, but that isn't acceptable. Don't get cheated as well.
title: Avoid!

review: What can I say. I intend to lay out this review in the form of the meal I ordered but never received from the hotel (in case you didn't notice, that was the first negative point).For starters, upon entering the 'hotel' (more like a hostel because of the 5:00 AM raves and appalling hygiene) I found myself the room as the staff were 'too busy' to show me to my room. The first thing I noticed about my room was the carpet which had mould around the edges which when I informed a member of staff about, I was greeted with the message that "all our carpets are like that". For the 'main course' of my review, I received dirty towels in my bathroom. And of course, by 'my bathroom' I mean the bathroom which was communal for around 6 family size rooms. Over my three night stay. But of course it was my personal error as I should have known replacement towels are not complementary and would set me back €25. To top it all off comes the dessert. On the other half of the queen size bed I 'slept' on was a yellowish stain which was later identified as urine by a member of staff who I caught the attention of whilst she walked down a corridor doing nothing instead of cleaning the people whos bookings keep them employed. I can see I am not the first to leave such a disgruntled review of Travel 'hotel' and I'm sure I will not be the last.
title: Well...

review: I'm never usually one to write a review and very easily pleased however found this hotel awful. We paid a fair amount of money for a hostel type accommodation, a 7ft but 7ft box room with no window! It was very dirty and we didn't want to sleep in the sheets. We did pay for a shared bathroom but we didn't realise this would mean a tiny bathroom being used by 5 other rooms. Would never stay here again.
title: Worst hotel I have stayed in

review: The hotel a very nice and central location in the city.BUT the rooms are very small and are not in the best shape. Also it's quite smelly in the hole place. So this is not a 3-star standard and not worth the money.
title: Not really a nice place.

review: Stayed here for 2 nights and as it was a birthday paid for a deluxe room with a canal view. Very disappointing as the bedroom was quite small, there was a small area through an alcove with a sofa wardrobe and a shelf with the kettle. The tv was in the bedroom therefore the only use for this was to put our suitcases on the sofa. A big issue was the mirror was too far from an electrical socket to use the hairdryer. A small mirror above the shelf with the kettle would resolve this. The bathroom is small and the bath mat was more the size of a bar towel, it was removed the 2nd day and not replaced. The bathroom floor was a bit slippery without it. The lighting in the bedroom was poor with the wall lights above the bed not working. The curtains were coming down and the space on the right of the bed too small for any bedside cupboard. I believe there need to be more checks on the standard of the rooms to avoid some of these issues. If you want a basic hotel then this is ok, it is a noisy place too so may as well had a budget hotel right in the centre.
title: Birthday weekend

review: Stayed here with a friend to begin interrailing. Room was very hot and no air con, and the staff were generally unhelpful. The location was also poor - to get to the city centre of Amsterdam you need to take a bus or tram which takes at least 30 minutes.That said, our room was very clean and the bathroom was actually surprisingly luxurious for a hostel dorm.Although Amsterdam is a notoriously expensive city, you can do better for the money.
title: Avoid!

review: The floor boards in the room were broken. There was a bit of a funny smell. There was free wifi. It is located by public transport so getting in to the main part of town is easy. The breakfast was not like you would get in Canada or the USA (ie it's not like a continental breakfast). I stayed here as part of a tour. If I go back to Amsterdam, I will not stay here.
title: Sketchy

review: The hotel was terrible. There was a hole in the shower and an unknown stain in the tent. The only positive things were the really kind staff and the position. However, I'm pretty sure that you could find a better place to stay at the same price. Avoid Marnix.
title: Dirty and scary

review: The floor is broke. The toilet and shower room are together, and there is only one for 30 people! This means if one is taking shower, then nobody can use toilet. What's the worse, the shower room is useless. The water can not flow out, so when you are taking shower, you will sink in your dirty water. How can people do that? They call us to use the toilet in the reception.
title: So bad

review: Average hostel to spend just some nights. the best was the staff at the reception!!! really friendly!! but the rest, nothing to say...it was the cheapest hotel I found for the dates I had to be in Amsterdam.
title: Average hostel

review: Decent location, poor room facilities ie no air conditioning and the windows wouldn't open properly. Still the cheapest accommodation we could find, but regrettably I wouldn't use the hotel again or recommend staying there
title: Disappointing

review: I spent 3 nights in Marnix Hotel. Since I traveled alone, the accommodation was enough but I'd have been happier if they would have had a kitchen to use. The staff is friendly and although they don't have lockers, they could store your valuables and they will be totally safe.
title: An Average experience

review: Room is ok - but restroom is worst no words to describe total nasty and no shower head and water in every place-worst experiance and not worthy at all for what we pay-avoid at any cost -better to check single rooms somewhere
title: Terrible room maintainance

review: The room , bath and bed sheets were so dirty , they had blood on it .....they charged €.30 plus to my credit card than they suppost to charge and they didnt gave me any billI want a refund for my €30
title: POOR HOSTEL

review: The hotel required a credit card as part of the room reservation process. I provided my card details however was notified by the hotel that my card had been declined. I then provided another card however this again was apparently declined. When I explained that I had no other credit cards to offer them and requested they please reserve the room under a debit card I was told no - a credit card was needed and their machine stated that none of mine worked. They told me that it was tough and that they would not keep the room reservation. As one would expect I booked a room at a different hotel. This was done with no issues. I then note per my bank statement that the hotel, Quentin Arrive, had charged me for a one night stay. On speaking to booking.com (who I booked through) it appears that the credit card authorisation had worked "a few days later". Quentin Arrive did not notify me of this and as I am not psychic I had no idea that I had a reserved room. Quentin Arrive has refused to speak to me about this directly and only through booking.com have I received the message that they will not refund the amount.DO NOT BOOK A ROOM AT THIS HOTEL - AWFUL PLACE, POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE, CONS TRAVELLERSI have no idea whether my credit card worked all along and the hotel withheld this information. I will never stay at the place or recommend nobody else do so.
title: AWFUL PLACE - DO NOT BOOK

review: Our room was just next to the front desk. So it was quite noisy during opening hours. But it was ok at night. Beds are ok. The hotel is ascetic and everything is not brand new, but it is clean. The breakfast is ok too.
title: Ok despite noisy room

review: Excellent location, very friendly staff. Very good breakfast compare to other hotels in the area.Paper thin walls (hear everyone talking all night) very small rooms, creepy stairs for children. Garden closes after 8:00pm.
title: Decent place

review: Room was noisy - can barely sleep and to make matters worse, the receptionists have no sense of privacy. The smoke alarm went off briefly and she just opened the door to our room while we were still inside, naked. When she realised what she did she closed the door, then knocked. WTF!! All the manager wanted to offer us to make up for it was a discounted rate on the next visit. Which is NEVER happening.
title: Awful! No privacy

review: Where do I start. We booked a 14ms room and got a 9ms room which included an ensuite. Felt like a jail cell. Me and my fiancé were dreading going back to the hotel at night. Staff didn't try to help us, just told us the manager is away and to email him. We did and never heard back. Rooms were dirty. Stained sheets blood stains on the walls. No aircon there fore have to leave window open and the road noise was unbearable. We had to sleep with earplugs in. Stair case is so narrow and treads are tiny. Very unsafe. Would not be leagal in Aus.
title: Would not recommend this place at all

review: We arrived in the room to dirty sheets and also bugs that looked like possible bed bugs! Wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, was absolutely filthy as far as I'm concerned. Could not use the toilet as it's sideways between 2 walls. Pictures on booking .com don't show true pictures.
title: Disgusting!!

review: This is a perfect hotel for 1 night. Small rooms but we knew this ahead.We got an incredible friendly welcome from the girl at the reception and she assisted us always with a smile. We were very pleased!
title: Very good contact with staff

review: Our room on top floor was small but very clean. Good bathroom and shower. Good choice of food at breakfast. Staff were lovely, explained how to get to places. Brought drinks when sitting in garden. Very near to tram, bus and Metro. Stairs extremely steep, but they are in most buildings in Amsterdam.
title: Very friendly, helpful staff. Convenient location.

review: The hotel is situated in a stunning and quiet neighborhood, it is not exactly near the centre but it is very easy to achieve it with means of transport!!staff kind and available.Rooms are clean and comfortable
title: Very nice hotel

review: Hotels location is excellent if you are interest of museum visits. Also the Leidseplein is just two blocks away.Room was quite small and air conditioning does not have power enough for cooling the room enough in summer time (at least not in 3rd floor under the roof). During nights we keep window opened, so we have tolerable temperature at nights.Working empty minibar was handy for cooling water for the next day.
title: Decent hotel with excellent location

review: This was an absolutely fantastic experience. The staff were friendly and helpful, and gave me the attention I wanted when trying to pick from the rooms they had available upon check-in. They were also responsive to emails and phones prior to my visit.Upon arrival, I was able to choose a spectacular room with two full-size windows and full renovations. The huge bed was extremely comfortable, while the large, well-lit bathroom provided ample room to get ready. There was space for a big screen TV, mini-fridge and desk. The spaciousness even allowed for the room to accommodate a entry foyer with a shoe-bench and full-length mirror. Coming home to cool Air Conditioning was a welcome surprise for a European Hotel.I would recommend this location and hotel to anyone visiting the city and I look forward to returning. While not necessarily the most economical hotel, it was only marginally more expensive than the others in the area, and paying the small difference to stay here will see you experiencing a very comfortable worry-free stay.
title: Don't think about it, just book it!

review: I can't review the property because we ended up cancelling our stay, but I can review the customer service.I booked this hotel for a trip with my partner to visit my 90 year old grandmother. We booked it quite last minute, and paid £723 for our 5 night stay, and due to booking so late we booked non-refundable as didn't expect there to be any reason to cancel. Less than one week after booking and a week before we were due to stay we were advised that my partner's father has terminal cancer with only a few months left to live, which was completely unexpected, and therefore I contacted the hotel immediately to see if we could receive a refund as we could understandably no longer travel.The service I had received from our flights provider and car rental had been exceptional as they fully understood our predicament and offered great support. As we had booked a non-refundable room I received a blunt response saying in no circumstances would they need to provide a refund. I asked the hotel is we could potentially keep 'nights' to use at a quiet time for the hotel later in the year, but they said I had to confirm the dates we'd be travelling immediately to do so. I explained that we do not know exactly when we will be able to travel given that we do not know how many more months we will have with my partner's father and need to be available are caregivers for him, so I cannot confirm dates. They told me in that case they won't offer anything.The money would have been a small amount for the hotel to absorb and I would have definitely stayed with them in the future if they had been lenient and understanding about my reason to cancel, but the 'not my problem' attitude I received was not appreciated in an already exceptionally difficult time.I do appreciate that they don't have to do anything in this situation and it's my fault for booking non-refundable, but most providers would have shown some compassion and humanity to our situation.My advice: book the hotel and stay there as it's a reasonable price, but do not expect them to do anything they don't contractually have to do. This hotel is purely focused on making money, not providing customer experience.
title: Disappointing customer service

review: The reception staff were very laid back throughout our stay. Talking to each other and on their phones. Didn't give much attention to us but didn't bother our stay. They were helpful if we had questions.Our room was lovely. The beds were comfy and most importantly the room was clean. The air con was good. View was nothing special.The toilet continually flushed it sounded like the tap was left on full. We didn't know if this was an Amsterdam thing so we didn't speak to anyone about it. Very annoying though.Location is great. Don't get a taxi from the airport!! Get the bus it's €5. We paid €5 for the train to Amsterdam then €20 for a taxi on the way! Hard Rock and the Irish pub across the street were both great.
title: Good location

hotelLocation: Cornelis Schuytstraat 58-60, 1071 JL Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had two rooms at The Alfred for 3 nights. Rooms were clean, staff friendly and helpful, and the location was good. Located a few blocks from the museums it was an easy walk to transportation. The Alfred rented bikes, which we tried. Warning: Be careful riding bikes! The people of Amsterdam are proficient bike riders and they have it down to an art. Mopeds, bikes, cars, and pedestrians share the road and for novice bike riders it can be dangerous. If we could have stayed longer and got the hang of the rules of the road, it would have been better. Anyway, would stay here again. There was construction on the road to the side of the hotel, but it really didn't effect us.
title: Comfortable, Clean, and Good Location

hotelLocation: Cornelis Schuytstraat 58-60, 1071 JL Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We are a family of 4 and rooms are difficult to find. I booked this hotel due to it's close proximity to the museums. The hotel was difficult to reach as the adjacent road was under construction. Not a huge problem but... The room was clean but dated. The bed had a giant dip in it and a queen was positions abutting 2 twins so the room was one giant mattress. Again, not a big deal. The overall experience was fine, a place to sleep, nothing to write home about for the price.
title: Close to the Museums

hotelLocation: Cornelis Schuytstraat 58-60, 1071 JL Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I would like to firmly voice my disappointment and frustration with this establishment.My sons were traveling alone to Amsterdam for the first time.We booked a reservation on July 11th (a week before their travel date) directly from the website and received an email guaranteeing our reservation.Apparently my credit card company flagged it as fraud activity and put a hold on the funds.I contacted my credit card immediately and assumed that the charge would be accepted.Instead of sending us an email to inform us of the denial,the establishment cancelled our reservation. Once again without informing us of this event. This left them stranded in Amsterdam on the 18th scrambling to find a hotel where there was availability for 10 days. As you know that is not an easy feat and the reason that we booked a week in advance!They eventually had to take a lesser hotel with a higher price.What a sad first experience for two novice travelers!!!
title: Cancelled reservation without notice

hotelLocation: Cornelis Schuytstraat 58-60, 1071 JL Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Was at the hotel for five days. The front of house are all very polite and helpful.The location is great I needed to be at the RAI centre and for me it was perfect. As was also near the centre. The room was clean had everything I needed. The room was a good size. The cleaning team come each day and the hotel also offers breakfast. The only bad point is there is currently a tram line being built outside and if you are looking for a lie its not possible with all the noise. Overall its a good value hotel in a great location with really great staff. The next time I am here on business I would lool at booking again.
title: Very Good

hotelLocation: Cornelis Schuytstraat 58-60, 1071 JL Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The staff were nice and knowledgable, and the room was clean. The shower was the nicest part of the room, but the air conditioning was not working unfortunately. The hotel was just a bit further than we expected from the city center, so we would recommend staying closer. However, make sure to take some of the coupons in the hotel and get discounts around Amsterdam.
title: Nice Hotel, Far from City Center

hotelLocation: van Ostadestraat 97, 1072 ST Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We went there for the inexpensive rate without knowing a lot about the hotel's concept. Indeed it is not the most comfortable hotel, but you have a good bed, hot water and a quiet room. As we were three sharing a room, we were lucky enough to have quite a big room. The hotel offers a lot of additional services for a price, sometimes quite expensive I believe. But they have also negotiated discounts in the restaurants around for breakfast, lunch and dinner. Definitely a good value hotel if you plan to enjoy the city to the maximum.
title: Cheap and ok hotel

hotelLocation: van Ostadestraat 97, 1072 ST Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here in February 2017. Really enjoyed our stay. Things that could have been improved were just having like a mini fridge in the rooms as no food is included. Also the layout of the rooms were very strange. Water always got out of the shower when showering purely because of the layout. Other than those few pointers, our stay was lovely and they accommodated us well.
title: Small, but cheap and clean

hotelLocation: van Ostadestraat 97, 1072 ST Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It's a little bit cheaper than other places, but then you don the get any fee wifi or TV, the room only gets cleaned every few days, and the rooms are barely larger than the bed. Seeing as they've clearly tried to cut costs in every way they can, you'd think it would be cheaper, even in Amsterdam.
title: Should be cheaper for what you get

review: Me and 2 friend stayed here for 2 nights in June. Location is great and it was really easy to find coming from the train station only around a 10-15 minute walk depending on how fast or slow you walk taking in the sights of Amsterdam. Hotel was clean we had a room with 3 single beds and it was lovely. The hotel is next door to an amazing bakery that serves the best churros so make sure you grab a free sample off the counter because you will be guarantee to be lured in after tasting them for more churros :) I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again.
title: 5* for location

review: Stayed for 3 nights in the beginning of July. Quite charming place to stay, and indeed very central. It is walking distance to almost everything, and the tram is also nearby. This is very close to the Dam square. We had a window towards the busy street but it was surprisingly quiet still. It was a bit "damp" atmosphere in the small room, especially after showering, but no big deal. No aircon though, but a fan is provided. The receptionists were very kind and helpful, smiling everytime we entered the hotel.Charming hotel with steep stairs.Breakfast was average, but ok. Will definitely stay here once more if we ever visit again!:)
title: Central hotel.

review: Great hotel for a cheap stay. Cosy beds and plenty of space. No smoking in rooms. In a great location. We stayed on the top floor which was quiet. Stairs very steep. Wouldn't recommend with children or elderly
title: Great location

review: Stayed here for 3 nights at beginning of July. Check was quick and efficient and staff were lovely. You get handed a 50% discount voucher for tea and coffee at the bar as there isn't the facilities in the room. The garden is lovely and very calm, we found it nice to just sit down in the garden and relax after a day of exploring. Hotel is in a great location! Walked everywhere from the hotel and is definitely reasonable distance to everything. However if you struggle to walk for periods of time then the tram is outside the hotel which is great for getting back to central and then the aiport. Rooms were a decent size, all it's needed for is sleep as we were out all day so was perfect for us. Would definitely recommend and stay again in the future.
title: Lovely and convenient

review: We have just spent four nights at this hotel and throughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is perfectly located with easy tram access to Central station from where most sights,tours etc are.Our room was spacious, very comfy bed and a hot shower,crisp sheets and soft towels. This is a family run business they are friendly,efficient and very helpful with directions,suggestions for restaurants etc. There is a very relaxed garden area which is a nice place to sit while enjoying a drink or two. Highly recommend this hotel especially for international travellers like ourselves.
title: Perfect

review: Had two nights at this hotel with my teen daughter to give her a taste of Amsterdam..... it's a okay value for money and 5 minutes walk from the Van Gogh museum.... and 20 minutes from most places of interest... but no parking for the car
title: Central place

review: We booked this hotel through the Stena Line Hotel and Ferry and so were not sure what to expect. The hotel was situated in a good location, not far from many shops and attractions and proved a good ranging point for our trip. The interior of the hotel was pleasant and seemed very relaxed. The staff were polite and always helpful.The room itself was good, but basic, but then for us this was not a problem. Our room was situated at the front of the hotel so did suffer from the noise of the traffic which did last a fair portion of the night. We also had some guests (I assume) staying upstairs which at some points seemed to be trying hard to smash through the floor and into our room.We paid in advance for a breakfast which was a very basic continental breakfast. It was decent quality but very basic and I think by the end we were becoming a little fed-up. Altogether, this was a decent hotel for the brief city break and did for what we wanted. However, I think if we had stayed longer it might not have been quite so good.
title: Good for our short visit

review: Stayed here with my husband for 3 nights. Hotel is lovely and has the best hard working and friendly staff. Our room was no. 310 and was really too small for my liking. Nowhere in shower room to hang towel etc and not enough shelf space however it was only for 3 nights. Room was cleaned every day. Hotel has such a beautiful garden where we sat every night for a drink when returning back from discovering Amsterdam. It's in a really good location. About 25mins walk from Dam Square but you can take the no. 1 or 5 tram. Beware of the bikes. Thousands of them. Would return to this hotel if ever back in Amsterdam but will request a bigger room lol. Thanks to all lovely staff
title: Room too small

review: We arrived around 11am and were accommodated. Some hotels not allowed it. Hotel location is very convenient. We were walking only and can reach any points of interest in minutes. Breakfast in hotel worth each penny - high quality and many choices . Very friendly staff.
title: Excellent location

review: Great location. Beside tram stop and canal stop. Excellent breakfast with plenty of choice. Concierge was always helpful. Staff very friendly. Welcome drink on arrival. Access to hotel from two streets. Will be back.
title: Excellent all round. Great location.

review: We spent 1 night on 23rd July, we arrived about 12pm but couldn't gain access to our room until 3pm, reception staff offered to store our luggage so we could go straight out to sightsee, so perfect start.We arrived back later in the afternoon and were given room 24 on the ground floor which overlooked the Amstel canal. Room was'nt the biggest room but nicely decorated and modern, lovely bathroom with plenty of towels, toiletries and a good hairdryer and always plenty of hot water, only 2 down sides, 1 was the door between bedroom and bathroom was frosted glass so bit unusual but suppose that's modern and there was a slight smell of dampness in the bathroom. Slept ok, lot of noise from the street and people coming in/out hotel at all hours. Biggest letdown was the breakfast, we went along at 10am, no pastries, croissants, scrambled eggs left, I asked the waiter if these would be replenished, he shook his head and moved on. We settled for some toast and a boiled egg, there was some bacon left but it really didn't look appealing. Check out was at 11am but again they stored our luggage till we left.All in all a nice hotel, staff were friendly and helpful and I would return again, would just make sure I went earlier for breakfast.
title: Enjoyed our stay!!

review: A great location to Know Amsterdam. Very nice staff, always willing to help. Proper cleaning. The breakfast good, although too expensive. The only negative thing was the bed, too soft. Even si we would repeat.
title: Nice hotel with nice staff

review: The room had everything you need. It was very clean and the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast was included and was very tasteful and a there was a huge choice. The toiletries provided in the room were very nice and vegan. The hotel is very vegan friendly. The location is perfect. It is in the center of Amsterdam and you can reach everything within a few minutes by foot. I would definitly recommend it!
title: Recommended

review: As the headline says. Unpleasant personal, a dirty feeling in the room. A damp and moldy odor were constant in the room.No privacy in the bathroom as the door is like the ones that used in showers And beware of a ridiculous breakfast price that you wont be informed ofThe location is ok though.
title: Not Good att all

review: I loved Hampshire Hotel - Eden Amsterdam. I stayed in one of the apartments on the side street. It was spacious and comfortable. The hotel took care of everything I needed. The location was perfect. I was able to easily walk to so many areas of Amsterdam. It made my first visit to Amsterdam an amazing one. I hope to be back soon.
title: Great location

review: We stayed here one night in a single room and a double room.The rooms are large, clean and the walls/windows are thick so I couldn't hear anything from outside. Right outside the hotel you got the canals, and tons of bars and nice restaurants and cafes. Very close to Rembrandt square.The reception staff is friendly, responsive and very professional. I feel safe in this hotel.I would definitely stay here again.
title: quiet, clean, convenient location and great staff

review: A group of us stayed here for three nights on a City break and I cannot fault this hotel at all. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly and the consierge was very accomodating on advising on excursions and booking tickets, and arranging our airport taxi shuttle. The hotel was very clean and in an excellent location to the main canals, a 5 minute walk to the bars and restaurants and a 15 minute walk to Anne Frank House. Would highly recomend staying here to anyone visiting Amsterdam.
title: Perfect location.

review: Hotel staff were welcoming and enthusiastic, room was as expected albeit roasting, which would not have been a problem had we noticed the aircon unit slung on the wall, but no, we had better things to think about! No problems anything here. Good location, quiet but only a few minutes from the action on foot. Would be more than happy to stay here again.
title: Weekend Stay

review: I stayed in the hotel for 4 days and 3 nights. The location of the hotel is great. Very close to the canals and a host eating joints are next to the hotel. The staff was generally helpful and friendly.The breakfast menu doesnt exactly has a lot of variety and options and the food tastes ok. There arent much options for vegan/vegetarians.They charge ~12 euros for a simple power adapter so that your mobile/laptop chargers fit into European power points. Thats expensive and unreasonable!
title: Good Budget Hotel. Not so good for International Travelers

review: Very nice hotel. I ordered a meal by room service so I tried a fish and creme brulle and all was excellent. Room was very clean. The staff was helpfull. I recomend this hotel. That was my second time and I know I will stay here again.
title: Very good hotel

review: We stayed at the Hotel for six nights. The hotel has excellent location both when travelling with a var or public transport. The staff was friendly and helpful. We loved the services provided by the consierge at no extra cost. The late french breakfast at the coffee lounge was cheap and the service was great. We bought breakfast one morning and found it ok but a bit expencive. The only problems we had was with the key system, our keys never worked. The internet was not so great either. But overall we liked it a lot, slept well and enjoyed our stay
title: Wonderful Hotel

review: This was my second stay at the Eden, we enjoyed it so much last time we decided to return. This time we just stayed in a standard room but to be honest there didn't seem to be much difference between that an the executive room. The staff were all welcoming and helpful. Did not have breakfast this time as it was not included in the deal. This was not a problem as due to the excellent location there was loads of cheap places near by to grab breakfast from. Only downside was that I did leave my top there and do hope they manage to find it. Planning on returning next month to the same hotel. Think I will be a lifetime customer from now on.
title: Great hotel, lovely staff and excellent location

review: Overall my stay was very good. Due to the hotel being extremely busy, we were upgraded to an Executive Room which had a bath and overlooked the canal. WIFI was great, streamed video from bed. The room was satisfactory in terms of décor. Bed was not a true double but two twin pushed together with a hole in the middle. Location was very good. I would avoid the hotel food as there are many places to eat nearby for cheaper and better quality. The manager was not very kind on one evening when we went to reception with a noise complaint, but thankfully we resolved the issue.
title: Ups and downs

review: The hotel was stunning everyone was helpful and the concierge was the most nicest helpful man I have ever met in my life. The beds were amazing too, and I'm the sort of person that would take my bed away with me if I could.Would definitely recommend.
title: Mint stay.

review: There isn't. No water, no snacs at the room.Good bed. A litle expensive. I antecipate my return in one day and they didn't facilitate my money back.I recommed this hotel, but I think it could be better.
title: Mini bar

review: Amazing stay, staff were so friendly and happy to help. Room was very clean and bathroom was lovely.Room was quite small and so was bathroom but as we weren't in room much didn't matter, overall was great and would definitely stay here again
title: Fantastic

review: We stayed for six days. It is in the middle of the city, but quiet. It is a short walk to everything. The room was nice. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was delicate. We are really satisfied.
title: Great location, clean and friendly!

review: My boyfriend and I had a lovely stay at Hotel Eden. Staff were really friendly, welcoming and helpful. The room we stayed in was very clean and comfortable, the facilities were great and we had everything we needed in the room. Would definitely stay here again!
title: Amsterdam Trip 2017

review: This hotel is a nice hotel near the town centre. Rooms are quite OK, not the biggest although but clean and tidy. Breakfast a little bit expensive ( you need to book the evening before) but well sorted. A minus that nothing for people that needs lactose free. Would still recommend it, friendly staff.
title: Nice hotel near the town centre

review: Paid considerable upcharge for delux room, can NOT qualify as such... second time visitor.Avoid taking room 502 which was oblong and had NO view.Staff mostly accomodating - cleaning personnel missed replenishing soap, coffee etcAir conditioner made considerable noise - kept us awake dripping all night. Pool on rug in mornings.Hotel with superb location off Rembrant Square right on the Amstel Canal, but NOT likely to rebook considering hefty price for non-existant upgrade.
title: Eden Hampshire Amstel, Amsterdam

review: Hi We stayed at this property for 5 nights Check inn 28 June Check out 6 July Merits 1. Location of the hotel is perfect. It has two entrance . Just outside of its main there is a canal and the view is very beautiful and if we use the other entrance which open from its premium hotel , we enter into street area . The street has lots of bars and pubs . Also tram stop is nearby . 2. It offers lots of breakfast options. Everything could be found 3. Staff of the hotel is good 4. It has a beautiful bar and music is good De merits 1. Rooms are small 2. Refrigerator is missing I think travellers can book this hotel , its value for money .
title: Perfect loaction

review: The location of the hotel is great - it's just a short walk to the metro and to tram stops. We had a room overlooking the canal which was lovely. The breakfast had a good selection which was a great start to the day. The staff were all friendly and helpful. We really enjoyed our stay.
title: Excellent stay, great location

review: Great staff. Joey is a great guy. Location is also very good. Everything was walkable. We got a room with an view on the Amstel. My friend was celebrating his birthday and they put a birthday card and muffins in our room as a gift. Really sweet of them!
title: Great location and service

review: We have been here before and as our son and daughter in law were visiting, we decided to go back. Rooms were great, overlooking the Amstel Canal and had recently been refurbished. Bathroom modernised and really lovely. The Bar 36 was closed on our first night due to illness, but was then open for the rest of our stay. Barman was really good and could make anything we asked for. On waking on our first morning, we thought we were in a building site! Drilling, banging etc. When we complained to the supervisor on duty he was pretty blasé saying he didn't know the works were to start but soon had a notice up telling other guests about possible noise following our complaint. To be fair they did refund us €50 for the inconvenience. The remainder of our stay was without incident and we all enjoyed ourselves.
title: Return visit to Eden Hotel, Amsterdam

review: Fantastic location for this hotel, such a central hotel for all attractions and everything within a walkable distance. Staff were very friendly and helpful. We arrived very early morning and although we could not get access to our room until 3pm they were happy to take our luggage for us so we could go out and explore the city. They are also happy to store your luggage on check out day until it's time for you to leave the city. Rooms are spacious enough, very clean and modern. We did not have a canal view but at the end of the day how long are you actually in your room for.......we were certainly not bothered by it. Would recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip in this city.
title: CITY BREAK

review: Unless you like the hustle and bustle of the canal quarter and the impossibly small rooms near the red light district (areas I stayed in my early twenties in Amsterdam as a novice traveler) then you stay close near Central Station and tolerate the yahoo-ing of the potheads and party revelers all night long. Fast forward 10 years on, a seasoned and more discerning traveler in my thirties has preferred to be away from the smoke, so to speak, literally. And it was such a delight to discover this quiet hotel just off the main drag. Trams 24 and 2 from Central have stops on both sides of the hotel, and literally up the road are bars and restaurants. The hotel itself has small if adequate en suite rooms but you do see a canal when you peer out of your window (I was placed in a canal room which I didn't book but eventually got thankful for) so I had no reason to complain. Though the lifts were apparently not working @ various points of my stay, luckily they were working every time I WAS in and didn't experience the inconvenience of climbing up those narrow steep stairs to the 5th floor carrying luggages. If I did, staff were obliging enough to do it for you according to the other guests. Breakfast selection in this hotel is superb and the courtyard dining was just divine, especially with the presence of @ least 3 house cats which gave you that homely feel and sense of tranquility to balance your chaotic day and night time Amsterdam activities. Reasonably priced too so you're winning - or have won already, if you stay here.
title: Ideal Quiet Location

review: We had a long weekend holiday to Amsterdam 29/6/17 to 3/7/17. We had booked "Inner Amsterdam Hotel" after days of research and it was located in the Museum Quarter, in Amsterdam city. I emailed them the night before our arrival to check the 2 rooms I'd booked were together and to confirm our time of arrival. To my horror they cancelled allegiance g the hotel was closed due to fire regulations. They had relocated us to the Blue Tower hotel 5 miles outside Amsterdam! Apparently, according to the cab driver who took us to our hotel,this happens a lot ! Hotels get late requests for parties willing to pay s premium and move people to other hotels.I had not been happy about being relocated to a hotel I didn't book but Blue Tower turned out to be a great stay.
