The staff were very helpful and the rooms had a panoramic view of the city. It's just been refurbished and the work is ongoing. The European breakfast was also great and runs later in a Sunday! The location was a down side and tram needed into the city but on s positive the tram stops are a couple of minutes away on foot. Definitely consider buying tram tickets from the hotel for the days you're staying rather than in s daily basis and you'll save money! The only criticism of the hotel was the wifi in our room was terrible!Loads to do in Amsterdam galleries, canal trips to appreciate the beautiful architecture shipping and culture all around. Look out for those tram and bicycle paths! If you're interested in visiting the Anne Frank House you'll need to book a month in advance of your trip! Enjoy ...
title: Picture postcard beautiful Amsterdam

review: Just got home from 5 nights in Amsterdam with 2 of my friends, we all stayed in room 704 which had three beds. (7th Floor with lovely view and balcony) Very modern and stylish hotel with very comfy beds and modern bathrooms/furnishings! The staff were friendly and were happy to help with any requests or queries. The location was great too, there's a tram stop outside the hotel (no noise from our room though) and a 2 minute walk in either direction takes you to restaurants and bars/cafes and more tram stops. Breakfast was nice, there was quite a lot of choice compared to other hotel breakfasts I've had and overall good food standard. We didn't get a chance to book any trips through the hotel or eat at the restaurant as we had plans but were nice to have there in case.We'll definitely be back in the future for our next trip! Amy
title: Great hotel, friendly staff and great location!

review: I'm sorry Albus, I had agreed with your manager that I would not leave a review, but since you prompted me, I am now telling my true experience. This is my experience and there are no allegations in this. I had booked about a month or so ago, through my travel agent AAA who went through Travel Bound. When I arrived, the part time front desk receptionist did not have rooms. Then she found me a super small room, where I had to go to the thrid floor and then climb some steps to go to it. It had views of pipes and roof tops. I think the rooms with views that Amy J refers to are reserved for people considered "special" (?). When I asked to change to a room with a window that was being cleaned, I was told "no" that that room was reserved for someone else. After enduring one night in a super small room, where the shower leaked all night leaving water and mosquitos, I asked to change in the morning, and only upon the importunate request of the plumber, was I given a slightly larger room in a dark and dingy basement, under a pavement grate that gave me night mares all night. Was absolutely no slice of heaven for me. The pictures in the hallways were not to my taste and the neighborhood was full of "weed" smoke! I came back hopelessly sick. On the one hot day there was no air conditioning and when it was freezing cold, there was No heat! But the lower level staff, the housekeepers, the kitchen staff, the plumber and handyman, were all VERY helpful, sympathetic and caring. It is not a 4 Star hotel. Even the vinyl corners of the beds are beat up. The review process is manipulated by cards in the rooms offering discounts for good reviews, as also this e mail that came saying they were giving to charity, if we reviewed favorably. The front desk staff are snooty and exclude people they consider unworthy!
title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in

review: Really cool boutique hotel located in a centralized area for touring the city. Very nice front desk. The bar down the street was noisy at night, but who's going to bed early in this town? Would easily stay there again.
title: Cool

review: I loved my room - Apartment 1 - it was so helpful with working with my coworkers when we could just come to my place and have meetings there. Everything had a wonderful design to it and I had to love the fact that the hotel uses the same plates as my husband and I picked for our wedding registry years ago! Staff is super sweet and helpful too.
title: Pleasant surprise!

review: Central loation with access to train and bus. Tons of options around the hotel for restaurants and ten minute walk to popular attractions/locations. Front desk was excellent, pleasant, polite and helpful. We were walked up to the room by front desk staff...coffee, tea, champagne and light snack available in reception area when you walk in. Room was clean and cozy with everything you need.
title: Great Service and stay

review: Reception staff is just perfect. Nice polite and efficient, we arrived early, we're offered coffee and could check in earlier than 15h. The room was clean, big enough all good. We also could check out late . I ahd a very n7ce surprise for my birthday and was pleased by the attention. Will be back at Albus for sure
title: Very good very nice very positive

review: The albus hotel is conveniently located next to the flower market. Its location is very enjoyable as it allows to reach in few minutes several interesting places in Amsterdam. The staff is willing to help and genuinely kind. The room is not bad but nothing really impressive. Only issue I has has been the noise coming from the street for almost whole night (it was a Saturday).
title: Average hotel in excellent location

review: The design of the hotel is very nice and modern, I have really liked the floor in the room (nice to walk barefoot), and little touches like coffee machine, bath robe and slippers. What I didn't like was the shower (really messy - water splashing all over the place, they have even provided special tool for self cleaning the floor from water) and the person who handled my check-in. She was VERY fake in being nice - it just has made me very uncomfortable. Good wi-fi, nice breakfast.
title: Good design, convenient location

review: Stayed for one night and this is definitely the go to-hotel if you want a fresh, central hotel. The staff was really friendly and helpful and it was really clean. Was a pleasure to stay and I will definitely book the same one when I visit Amsterdam next time =)!
title: Very fresh and close to everything!

review: all (room, staff, check-in, breakfast) was good and enjoyable. Rooms are very nice, clean and bright.The location was great too, there's a tram stop outside the hotel and a 2 minute walk in either direction takes you to restaurants and bars/cafes and more tram stops.I highly recommend this beautiful little hotel for business or pleasure.
title: great hotel and location

review: Good, centralized location between the center of Amsterdam and the museums. Made for easy walking around the city. Very clean room, with nice bathroom and plenty of space. Also, the staff was very pleasant!
title: Great Hotel

review: Service was excellent, room comfortable and location was perfect. The staff was welcoming and engaging with our children, and upon check in we received a voucher for a Heinekin mini keg to be delivered to the room.
title: Lovely hotel, exceptional service, great location!

review: Excellent hotel in the perfect spot of Amsterdam.We will stay there again in the next stop at one of our favourite cities in Europe.Very close to the tram/bus stop, city center, shopping and must see points.
title: Great location and best service!

review: The hotel is quite small but modern, rooms was clean, bathroom was spacious and well equiped, WiFi was reasonable as far as hotel WiFi goes, staff is friendly. We didn't use the hotel's bar or restaurant, so cannot comment on it. View from the window was pretty bad - some internal courtyard.Overall - pleasant stay.
title: Good modern hotel in a convenient location

review: I had two very different experiences; half my week at a gorgeous European hotel and half here. This hotel is good and had everything you'd expect from a design focused hotel but I found it lacking being built to a good standard. Everything seemed chipped and unmaintained. I did like the earplugs they supply.
title: After a traditional hotel I noticed what this hotel lacked.

review: I spent three nights at the Albus hotel. My overall experience was quite good. What I didn't like was the fact that the wifi on my floor (6th) was terrible (I couldn't stay online for more than a minute). It was better in the lobby and the restaurant but not as good as it should be. Rooms are quite nice although could be better for that price (thin walls, laminat flooring etc.). On the other hand, the location is perfect, staff nice and breakfast rich...
title: Great location!

review: Very comfortable bed, in a nicely decorated room with a great coffee machine. Nice big bathroom. The room was cleaned very well and restocked daily.Fantastic location to see the sights in a very freindly city where everyone wants to have a chat with you.The reception staff were really helpful and knowledgeable in how to get aboutand what to see.In house restaurant looked good, but we had a reservation already booked elsewhere so didn't try.Breakfast was included in our package, and was OK.Would we return here? Yes without a doubt, and have recommended it to friends looking to travel to Amsterdam.
title: Great location.

review: Nice little hotel in central Amsterdam, right next to the flower market and walking distance from all the central sights.Reception area is small and was regularly very busy, no doubt because the hotel was fully booked while we were there.Didn't try the restaurant which was also very busy but it looked interesting.
title: Nice hotel, good location

review: No surprises here - exactly as advertised.Cool, comfortable, hip rooms, and a location right in th heart of the action.Great front desk staff that went out of their way to explain everything and welcome our daughters.
title: would stay again for sure

review: When we arrived at The Albus I was really, really disappointed to be told that our booking had been mixed up on the system and they didn't have a room for us until the next day. This was really inconvenient for us and very disappointing as I had spoken to the hotel on many occasions prior to our arrival, and had our booking confirmation in black and white. I had, had a confirmation email from booking.com and The Albus themselves so I was very shocked to be told this. The member of staff that dealt with us was a trainee and she was very polite about the situation and paid for us to get a taxi to a hotel that they were booking us into instead for the night, and when we arrived at the new hotel everything was organised as promised. The situation was very inconvenient for us as it also made us run late for our booking for Anne Frank's House but the hotel had arranged for the taxi to wait for us whilst we checked into our new hotel and then took us; luckily we were just in time for our booked tickets. Thank you for sorting out the mix up, everything did work out ok in the end. I do think it was a little unfair that a trainee was made to explain the situation to us. She gave us a free drink in the bar, either a beer, house wine of soft drink; a nice offer but I don't think it really justifies the inconvenience. The next day we missed a booking due to checking in and out of the 2 hotels as The Eden (new hotel) was very slow at calling us a taxi, in the end I frantically chased the concierge around the reception as he was dealing with so many people and the rude receptionist wouldn't call us a taxi she just kept saying ask the concierge who was clearly very busy, and she clearly was not. The Albus hotel itself was very clean, however the shower wasn't great, wasn't that warm and was very slow. The hotel is in a great location to explore Amsterdam, there is a tram stop right outside that will get you to and from the central train station and around Amsterdam.
title: Very Disappointed!

review: Service was very good and fast but first night they put us in a disgusting room with an awful smell. We got a new one next day(woman at the reception didn't even asked for details like she already knew what kinda room this is) so at least that was good but this first room (1105)- unacceptable for a 4 star hotel,never experienced that before.
title: Good service but disgusting room

review: The hotel is in a good location. It was very handy for us as we used the trams/buses to get around the City. A huge plus! The hotel itself is limited in its facilities. The bar area at the reception doesn't seem to be used and is full of boxes at the moment. Within the room, there was no fridge and the hairdryer was awful! Also, we woke up on Wednesday which was also my 30th Birthday to find there was no hot water for a few hours. This meant we didn't go out until after midday! This was unfortunate.
title: Decent location

review: Remodeled but dirty and one plug for coffee maker and refrigerator so refrigerator couldn't be plugged in. Curtains falling off rod and they gave us room anyway. Doesn't seem like they care about quality of rooms. Beds comfortable.
title: Okay hotel, easy access to rail system. Two grocery stores and parking right next to hotel.

review: Fresh and clean hotel. Behind the dull facade of this hotel hides a modern and new hotel. The rooms are modern and offer great views. The room was equipped with a Nespresso machine water boiler. Refill of tea coffee, coffee pods and toiletries everyday. The breakfast was disappointing and poor. Dry bread and the warm "buffet " was more of two things on a table. Sonot worth 15 euros. This hotel is 3 star hotel and costs as much as a 4 star hotel next door. We were a company of 4 ppl and due to reservations we booked in two different hotels, we paid as much as our friends for a 4 star hotel.
title: Fresh and clean hotel

review: On a recent visit to Amsterdam, my husband and i booked a room for 3 nights here, and we were so happy with our stay. The staff were so friendly to us; we had booked a very early flight from Cork and arrived before our room was available, I know it's common practice for a hotel to store their guests' bags prior to check in if needed, but i felt the staff were super friendly about it.We must have visited Amsterdam on some of the hottest days of the year (as i near Amsterdam is not too unlike Ireland, weather-wise), and the day after we checked in portable fans were delivered to the rooms to combat the heat - nice touch!The surrounding area is gorgeous also, so eateries and a park right next door, ideal for children or if you want to get a bit of exercise in on your holiday.The hotel is very near the 7 and 9 trams to take you to the city centre areas, and i would recommend the 48 hour (depending on your length of stay) for the trams and this will save you a small fortune in the long run.I was really impressed with this hotel! I believe it's a 3 star rating but it should be more!
title: Lovely Hotel, Should be More than 3 Stars!

review: We booked the hotel through a Secret Escapes deal and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The hotel does a look a little tired on the outside but it's definitely very modern inside. The rooms were clean and tidy with a great view over the city. The rooms are a little compact but we didn't find that to be an issue when we stayed. We also had breaktfast there for the duration of the stay which we really enjoyed. Everything is self serve and looked great. The hotel overlooks the nearby park, which makes for a great breakfast view. The hotel is also conveniently located near a few tram stops, which makes it super convenient for those using it as a base to explore the city. I'd definitely stay there again if given the choice!
title: Small but Practical

review: We were at this hotel for 2 nights. The outside is clean and tidy but may put you off seeing the building like an office block or an old block of flats, but inside this hotel was very modern. Lovely place to stay. The beds were very comfy. If you don't want to be anywhere noisy this is a great location. Right outside the hotel is a tram stop and you can go all the way to Central Station passing a lot of good places. If you want to go another direction there is another tram just the other side of the Tropen Museum (next door to the hotel) and that takes you to all of the other good places. Buying a travel pass is definatly a must to save money on travel.
title: Stag night

review: Hotel room wasn't throughly cleaned prior to our arrival. Tea and coffee facilities weren't replenished. Maids entered the room even when do not disturb was on. The hotel was having extensive work done which we weren't informed of.
title: Unclean hotel room

review: No complaints, staff and hotel were wonderful. Construction prevented entering through the main door but not an issue, the staff was both helpful and knowledgeable! Many attractions are 5 minutes away.
title: Great location, great stay!

review: Strategic Place to stay. The hotel is in Amsterdam City, near to station, shopping center, clubbing etc. Just walk a step you'll find everything you need. The services is excellence but unfortunately there is no lobby are for parking a car.
title: Strategic Place

review: What an awesome place to stay! if you are arriving by train - it is a VERY short walk across the street to this hotel. Centrally located - it just doesn't get any better. A quick Tram ride to any part of Amsterdam, walking distance to shopping, restaurants and canal tours. The hotel concierge was very knowledgable and helpful. Clean!!! (I am a germaphobe) It passed my inspection.
title: Park Plaza Victorian

review: Dirty hotel our never the room got cleaned the hotel is under constrution and they just push everybody in an ugly next door block that is in a small alley ..it is all improvised .. the rooms have nothing to do with the pictures they show in the web page or booking.com
title: Hotel under constrution

review: My wife and i have stayed at this hotel on many occassions and every single time as been a very pleasant and happy stay.All staff are very friendly and will do anything they can to make you very welcome.
title: Birthday celebration at Park Plaza Victoria Amsterdam

review: Even though under construction the hotel is lovely. It is located literally in the cent from everything so you can just walk somewhere if you want to. The staff were really friendly and the rooms were getting clean often and quickly. The staff deal with your queries immediately. I loved my stay there.
title: Excellent place

review: I visited this hotel having made a quick booking at the last minute through the Club Carlson app and opted for a prepaid non refundable rate which included breakfast.  I chose the hotel because I had noticed it on previous visits to Amsterdam (when I had stayed at the Krasnapolsky which is relatively nearby). I wanted to be near the train station on this occasion and hence my decision. Untypically I began to read Tripadvisor reviews after I had completed my booking and as quite a number were unfavourable I felt a degree of trepidation and foreboding that I had made a terrible mistake.I am happy and relieved to be able to report that I had a thoroughly pleasant stay notwithstanding that the hotel is undergoing massive refurbishment. The temporary entrance to the hotel was, for example, down a narrow alley which would be daunting for the fainthearted if they arrived in darkness. There seems nothing to fear, however, because I walked freely and in safety around the area in the evenings.I stayed in what is called the Urban Wing. My room was modern, clean, well equipped and of a reasonable size. The decor is perhaps a little dark but this is to some people's taste and not to others. I quite liked it. The staff were coping remarkably well with the works that were ongoing and while the works are obviously very extensive with dozens of various tradesmen in hard hats coming and going and my experience was that the works were minimally intrusive and did not disturb my stay (or indeed my sleep and I am a light sleeper).The bed was extremely comfortable and the bedwear of obviously high quality.The bathroom was small and well equipped with nice quality toiletries. There was a handbasin, toilet, and a shower with waterfall shower head. Housekeeping was faultless during my short stay.The buffet breakfast was excellent with a extensive choice of cold cut meats, cheeses, fruit, fruit juices, breads, pastries, hot cooked food such as eggs, bacon, sausages (chicken sausages which I had never tried before and which proved surprisingly tasty) and soforth. The waiting staff were efficient and very friendly and engaged in chat whenever a reduced pressure of numbers gave them an idle moment or two.Reception was extremely efficient - check in and checkout without any hitches which can often commence a stay with a degree of irritation. The accommodation booked and the rate quoted were adhered to with accuracy.My stay was so thoroughly pleasant and enjoyable that I can only imagine how perfect it is likely to be when the major refurbishments are completed and the configuration of the hotel is back to normal. I will definitely stay here again should I ever have occasion to revisit this charming city of Amsterdam.For those who may have misgivings because of negative reviews I would suggest that they perhaps specifically book a room in the Urban Wing because I found my room there to be faultless, comfortable and quiet.Incidentally wifi is free in the hotel (including bedroom) - quality connection and good speed.
title: Convenient location, great staff

review: Dear All,Hotel is located just opposite of Amsterdam Central railway station, busy place in the city. hotel is very good to stay and for tourist the best place to stay, easy to access hop-on hop-off (Amsterdam city tour bus)
title: Good Stay

review: A great hotel in a perfect location. The hotel was a two minute walk to the main central station ideal for our travelling to Schiphol Airport and return 3 hour trip to German. Travel was made easy with online booking via trainline. Our room was a reasonable size, very clean with a view to the station and canals. The room was very quite, all with double glazed windows. The staff was very friendly and spoke good English. We did not eat at the hotel but rather experienced the many restaurants within walking distance. Shopping, museums, canal boat tours are all minutes walking distance from the hotel. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.
title: Darryl and Vannice

review: I was lucky enough to book a couple of months before leaving on trip, meaning I got a nice deal on the price of the room. The hotel was in renovation, but everything was still accessible and working correctly. The room was super clean and huge, plus you have a nespresso which is a great addition. Finally, it's right across the street to go to Amsterdam Centraal, so location is A1! I would book again!
title: Amazing hotel

review: The location is perfect to visit the city without using the city's transport!The hotel is great with the pool, the room was nice but there was some noice because of the construction/ reparation in the hotel. The staff (concierge) was really nice and helpful ! but I think the people at the reception could be nicer they are the first impression of the hotel and it's disappointing.
title: Location +++

review: All very good, but parking is horrible expensive ( 60 EURO for 2 Days, even as it is valet parking and I also think the breakfast is too expensive. the rest is a good package in a perfect location . Would recommend
title: Alles gut

review: Very clean and staff polite Our room was a good size and comfortable.Well equipped little gym and lovely pool and surrounding area.Best of all great location which is very important for us whilst visiting Amsterdam!One down side useless iron and ironing board The rest of the hotel gets a thumbs up Would recommend and would return.
title: Great location

review: I staid at Park Plaza during an holiday trip in the Netherlands with my wife and our 2 kids. The hotel is downtown in front of the Centraal Station and very close to the main city turistic spot. Nice room, good service, very good breakfast.
title: Very nice hotel and good value for money

review: We arrived here at 0800 after an 18 hr flight - did not expect to be able to have a room until later in the day. The lady on the front desk was lovely - warm & friendly welcome, and she gave us a room to use immediately.The location is fantastic. We caught a train from Schipol Airport to Amsterdam Central, the hotel is immediately across the road. It is situated by the Damrak and it was a great place to base ourselves, everything was within walking distance or an easy tram/train ride.I was surprised by our room, I had been reading that the hotel rooms in Europe were very small. Not the case here, it was a good size, very clean and well laid out. Beds were very comfortable.I had to attend to some urgent business whilst here and the front desk staff were so helpful with printing up documents and then scanning and emailing them on for it, they were so happy to help. It was much appreciated.Every staff member we came across were smiling and friendly - this absolutely makes the stay more enjoyable.If I ever have the opportunity to return to Amsterdam I would definitely stay here again.
title: Great start to our Europe trip

review: Chose this hotel principally because of its location - it is literally just across the road from the central station in Amsterdam. From the minute we checked in, the staff couldn't have been more helpful, friendly and accommodating. Our room was on the 4th floor and was very large, with an enormous bed, beautiful bathroom, Elemis toiletries, safe, minibar, air conditioning and everything else you could possibly need! You would never know you were in the thick of Amsterdam at night, because the windows blocked out everything and black out curtains added to the feeling of peace. The breakfast in the hotel is superb with a very wide choice of food and drink. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend this wonderful, comfortable and friendly hotel. Left luggage service meant we didn't have to drag our cases around on our last day and midday check out meant we weren't rushing either. Can't really say anything bad about the place - highly recommended in every way!!!!!!!!
title: What a super hotel!

review: الفندق ممتاز و ايضا الموقع رائع و الموظفين ودودين و الغرف ممتازة و نظيفة انا اتكلم عن executive room كبيرة .احلى ما في الفندق انا مقابل مخرج محطة القطار الرئيسية 300 متر و انت في الفندق ولا تحتاج الى تكسي في المنطقة كل شي قريب جدا المطاعم و المقاهي و محلات تجارية و مراكز و القنوات المائية الخ...... Fantastic hotel unbearable location nice rooms and services with pool Opposite central station 300 m or 400 m to the hotel . Very nice staff Clean rooms
title: Fantastic hotel unbearable location فندق ممتاز

review: A compact hotel in a quiet area with connection to all modes of transport. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The nearness to gardens and museums is a definite plus.The hotel offers breakfast only. However, a number of good restaurants are in the vicinity and offer good food.
title: cozy hotel with friendly staff

review: The Muse Amsterdam is well located. It is on a quiet street but close to many museums and the rest of Amsterdam is easily accessible via the nearby tram routes. We had two rooms during our five night stay and the comfort double was quite adequate in terms of size if you plan to be out and about most of the day. The hotel service was outstanding. They helped with many questions regarding museum tickets and arranged a rental car for us. We also enjoyed the availability of coffee, tea and cold drinks at no charge 24 hours per day. We would stay there again.
title: Lovely Hotel

review: The service was excellent with pleasant staff. Nice, clean, updated rooms and a great breakfast. Beautiful courtyard out back to relax and take a break during a long day exploring this wonderful city. Near transit stops, dining, attractions, and shopping. Would definitely go back.
title: Great hotel

review: Although the rooms are small it was a great location with a wonderful staff. The hotel was in a great location. It was close to the museums and the tram. The breakfast that they offered I the morning was very nice. You can order off of a menu or eat from the brunch area. They had a wonderful assortment of beverages. Our room was on the third floor and was very quiet. The halls and elevator were small, but manageable.
title: Excellent Choice

review: We had a nice stay at the hotel. We had one of the bigger rooms, but they are quite small. But we had everything we need in the room including a comfy bed. The walls are quite thin and it can get noisy at times. There were no one to help us with the luggage when we arrived or departed. It is not easy to manage through the small hallways and steep stairs with baggage. The staff were friendly and the breakfast good. The hotel is situated in a good location for a visit to Amsterdam near all important sites and close to transport. We could get to everything we wanted to do without a hassle.
title: Nice with good location

review: Stayed here on my first trip to Amsterdam - Hotel Vondel was a great choice: clean and comfortable room (not the largest, and only a shower, no bath - if that concerns you)The receptionist was super friendly and chatty: checking me in quickly and showing me to my room.I ate in the hotel, as was too tired to venture far, and again the waiter was friendly, chatty and attentive. There isn't loads of menu choice but the pork I had was tasty and not too badly priced.Close to the main road and tram network.I'd stay again
title: Very friendly and comfortable

review: Loved my room and the fact that they read my comments on Expedia so that I didn't have to deal with any stairs except the entrance. That said, the entrance is not Friendly for those who struggle to walk, especially with luggage.There is a tram stop close by, actually at either end of the block. Museums and great walks to enjoy.
title: Location and comfy

review: I was expecting much more based on the site photos.The room is ok and the restroom is too small.The location is great!The wi-fi is terrible!I stayed on the fist floor, very noise, we could listened people walking on the floor.
title: Regular

review: 1.the rooms that we got are tiny. there is no space to open the suitcase. and you can't walk around. the shower are tiny. there is no hand shower only top shower. and there is no pressure of water in the shower.2.we had dinner in there restaurant the food is good but the attitude from the servers and the cook are not to the north american standard. they will argue with you. that mean that despite that you are the costumer doesn't mean you always right. and you will forced to pay the bill even if you upset.3.the reception are very friendly4.the breakfast are very good but it's not include in the room price. and the stuff in the restaurant for the breakfast are very friendly.
title: rooms, restaurant service

review: Second stay here for me and I must say I'm surprised by some of the other less than positive reviews about Hotel Vondel. My room was a comfortable size, modern yet had a really homely feel about it. Bed was comfortable and good powerful shower. Enjoyable breakfast and friendly, efficient staff. Hotel is very centrally located without being in the noisy, crazy streets. Will definitely return.
title: Great boutique hotel

review: We enjoyed our one night stay at this hotel. The room was clean, small, but was totally do-able for the 3 of us (me, wife and 20 year old son). Receptionists were quite friendly and helpful. Wi-Fi worked fine. Location is convenient to pubic transportation. There is a decent grocery market nearby. We arrived from Paris via train later in the afternoon and didn't want to venture too far from the hotel to eat (because we were a bit tired and I had to work early int he morning) so we ate at the hotel. The server was very nice and our food was very tasty and fairly priced. Decent wine list too. All in all, I would recommend this hotel.
title: Typical Good European Hotel = Small Rooms, Good Location

review: After reading reviews on here I rather cheekily asked for a room with a balcony when I booked a large deluxe double room - at this point I didn't realise there was only 1 room in the hotel with a balcony. Room 111. What can I say! What a room, what a view! There are far cheaper hotels in Amsterdam but this view was worth every penny of the price. We didn't eat breakfast, so I can't comment on that but the hotel was clean and we were more than happy with it's central location. My only tip would be not to forget the mosquitoes - we slept with the balcony doors open every night and were covered in bites by the time we went home but this was definitely down to mosquitoes rather than anything else!Will definitely be staying here again!
title: Amazing!

review: On arrival we were told where our room is. Up the lift and round the corner. What wasn't said is up the lift, up half a set of stairs, down half a set of stairs then up another set of stairs. Wouldn't like to be disabled in this hotel. Then when we did get to our room there was one set of stairs to the reception. Going that way would be much easier.Now the room itself was standard, double bed, air con, en suite. However the bathroom stank, as in like sewage. It was as if the u-bend in the toilet/shower was not fitted. The room had a window, but outside that window about 1.5m away was a window to another room. The room also had a sharp rise randomly in the floor right where the bed was, meaning it sloped.The location of the hotel is right at the start of the red light district. So good for stag groups etc but not families.Overall glad i only stayed 1 night. But would rather next time spend extra money to go else where
title: Didn't expect much and still dissapointed

review: After an initial problem finding the Hotel, we were warmly greeted at reception and after details completed provided with room keys. To access room area you have to pass through a secure door which is activated by your room key.Our room was quite small however was very clean and supplied with plenty of towels and tea and coffee making facilities. My daughters room was quite spacious for her and her daughter and problem with TV was quickly rectified. All rooms have Air-Conditioning and our room which was a ground level had double glazing to reduce the sound from the street, which was very busy.The hotel does not offer breakfast but you can obtain vouchers for a restaurant only yards away from the CC.The hotel is well placed and within a short distance from the Train Station and Dam Square as well as one of the main canals and boat trips.The Hotel is kept clean and tidy and the staff are very quick to assist regarding any questions about travel or dining. Not the cheapest but a good standard and one to consider if visiting Amsterdam.
title: Well Situated

review: Not long back from this hotel. Pleasantly surprised as it was very central. Right in the heart of the bars and restaurants. The hotel room was really small, but receptionist said we had booked a small room. Ive fortunately been in cabins bigger. But to be fair it was clean and well maintained. Breakfast can be purchased on the streets close by. I would go back.
title: Central and clean

review: Stayed here with another couple in July.. good central location.. very small room. Bathroom was stinky like stale water, sink was also blocked, Tolite could b doin with a bottle of bleach also..! its modern tho. It's fine for a night or 2.
title: Decent hotel for location

review: Got to the hotel a few hours before check in time and was allowed to leave our luggage. We were also told we could book in a few hours earlier than the agreed check-in time as our room would be ready. We were given room 100!!!Room 100 is directly over the reception area, has windows that don't open and are directly over the foyer, making it really dark. There is also hardly any storage space and nowhere to store your empty case. The air conditioning unit is really noisy as well so couldn't be left on. I went straight down to the reception to complain as there was no way I could stay in that room. The very helpful receptionist found us another room straight away (room 106) which was so much better. It isn't the Ritz but it had a window that opened and more storage space and a comfy bed.The hotel is in a great location. It is literally 5 minutes walk from the central station, is probably the same to Dam Square, has loads of bars and restaurants near by and just seems to have everything close to hand. It is on the very edge of the red light district but I think you need to go to Amsterdam with an open mind.The complimentary toiletries are really nice, which is always a bonus, and there is a decent hairdryer and tea and coffee making facilities.I would recommend this hotel as long as you get the right room. I would stay here again as well but I think I might go for the superior rooms which they offer just to make sure I had a decent room.
title: Great hotel - apart from room 100.

review: went 1st july to 4th.paid aprox £550.for just room.it is just off dam square so in good location.now im 65 yrs old & the stairs were terrible.very narrow & steep without lift access to floor where my room was.it had a lovely juliet balcony.BUT the windows would not open because the bed was inches away from them.to get out of bed i had to lift my leg to put it over the end of bed as bed nearly touched the wall & i was sleeping by the wall.my back started aching on the sunday morning,i couldnt get out of bed.i just thought bed must be very soft & continued with my day.well on the monday i could not move at all.i noticed that my sheet was never tucked in under the mattress...mattress was soooooooooooo thin.aprox 4" thick.......so i pulled the other side out from under bed only to find it reached the floor!!! i then noticed the duvet that was on the bed was disgusting.so badly stained.i went on to take sheet off bed to see a filthy stained thin mattress.took this off bed to find blood stains on the bottom bit of bed.the pillows were also badly stained.i went to complain but housekeeping were on my floor & told him.he proceeded to renew pillows & duvet but he brought in a rolled up old mattress to replace my one.this was also badly stained.the room was a nightmare.would not recommend
title: nightmare

review: I chose this hotel as it was recommended to me by a friend, had a look on the website and the pictures also looked good. Booked via Booking.com, in total paid around £270 - the room we were given was NOT worth it. It was tiny, dark and opposite the hotels main toilet - you could hear every flush! A few times when we came back to our room, people would be standing outside as they were waiting to use the main toilet, was quite annoying. Could also hear every conversation by reception. We were also the only room in this little section. I would go to this hotel again if I was given a different room as the photos my friends sent me were lovely.The good thing is this hotel is so close to all the main coffee shops,bars, restaurants and about 5 mins from Amsterdam Centraal Station, so they were huge positives. Staff were friendly, although we had a slight mix up with payment on arrival, and one member of staff wasn't too helpful about that (a fault of theirs not ours) but once sorted everything was fine. If you are going to book, please take a look at pics first!! The room we had was 001 and we were highly disappointed!!
title: Ask for a canal view room! Don't book Room 001! Great location

review: Do not book this place if travelling with young children because sex shops are *everywhere* but the location is quite good, close to Madame Tussaud's and Ripley's museum and canal tours are very close by as well. The eateries around the area are simple and great places to grab a bite. Rooms have AC, free and fast wifi, clean amenities, shower was nice (has handheld/removable shower head) however the walls of the interior were not as soundproof as you could hear people talking in the hallway and their footsteps thumping down the hallMornings are quite noisy around this area because garbage trucks are around.
title: Cute rooms, awkward location

review: My husband and myself visited Amsterdam last week ( for the eighth time ) I had booked a room via booking.com When we arrived we were given the Tiniest room imaginable 009 - it was atrocious, I couldn't walk past the safe without banging my legs and we could not get dressed at the same time, no room at all, I requested a room change and was told that nothing could be done until the next day. Fair enough, we enjoyed our day stayed packed and the next day was moved to a lovely basement room overlooking the canal with loads of space. The hotel is modern and quirky at the same time, they are generous with teas and coffees in the room and the majority of the reception staff are great ( one in particular was awful and grumpy !!) great location and not noisy at all - highly recommend breakfast in the café directly opposite, cant remember what its called :)
title: Good with some initial issues !

review: This Hotel is perfectly located within the heart of Amsterdam and close to all of the attractions.Lift is very slow and the whole Hotel is showing its age but is still good value for money in an expensive city. A general facelift would benefit the place.Continental breakfast was all you could ask for.Counter staff very helpful and went out of their way to make you feel welcome.
title: Could not fault the location

review: Great location within walking distance of just about every place we were interested in visiting in Amsterdam's city center. Transportation was near by (trams, buses, train). Grocery store, fast food, bars, and restaurants were within an easy walk. Tour office was at end of the pedestrian only street the hotel was located on. Staff members were helpful with every request I had starting with me sending an email asking for 2 rooms near each other in a quiet location. Unfortunately, my room had a stench that did not go away. (At first I thought it was food from the previous guest, but I was there for 6 nights. In retrospect, I think it was the sewer/plumbing.) When I checked in, there was a dirty Q-tip on the floor, thick dust on the TV, and no shower cap in the box left in the bathroom (the reasons for my 3 rating for cleanliness). My sister's room was fine. Lighting was odd in my bathroom as the ceiling light shined downward behind you as you stood at the mirror which made it difficult to see what you were doing as you put your make up on (particularly since I wear glasses). Breakfast was adequate; choice of cereals, yogurts, meats, breads, beverages. Bonus: pop machine served cans of Heineken. All in all, a pleasant stay.
title: Right in the Middle of Everything

review: The primary reason for my booking this hotel was its location. It was right at Dam Square. The other reason was that this was the only hotel offering a double bed for single occupancy as well. The room was small, like the kind of rooms you would find in Manhattan but what else would one expect at the city center. Being a no-frills restaurant, the only staff available was at the reception, so don't expect any room service/housekeeping support. If you need something, you need to go and collect it from the reception yourself. Breakfast was nothing to boast of but it was decent. The receptionist who also set up breakfast served hot coffee and hot milk on request which was a delight. The receptionists were very helpful with any directions or queries we had. They also arranged a cab for airport drop. If you are looking for a clean room and only bed and breakfast, this is one of the best to go to. The shopping area, the trams, the RLD, the Central Station everything was just a few minutes walk from the hotel. The only thing to be cognizant of is that it is on a pedestrian only street. You will have to drag your luggage a bit to get to the hotel.
title: Best location that makes up for everything else

review: A disappointment. We have stayed in many Best Western hotels after flying to Europe. Usually you know that there will be a certain standard of excellence. Not this time. It is true that the hotel was spotless but our room was small and pokey, but it was quiet. There were lots of places to eat in the neighbourhood and the food was good. This was in contrast to the breakfast offered at the hotel. Meagre choice. I am sure you could find a better hotel for the night between flights.
title: A place to lay your head after a long flight

review: Stayed four nights in late June with two other couples.Off the net we were looking for an inexpensive hotel in the heart of the city, off a main road. And this is what we found. It fitted our criteria perfectly. Sure there were some issues. I understand it has the slowest lift in Europe, the beds are so spongy you can roll off them and my toilet bowl was difficult to access (refer photograph). While dated, the our room was a good size, however one of our group's was quite small. The staff were extremely helpful and the breakfast room was adequate. It's beautifully located in a quirky pedestrian laneway right next door to a wonderful beer hall, is directly opposite a cute cafe which serves a great lunch and couldn't be closer to highly recommended restaurants. Within walking distance of Central Station, even with luggage. Well, we managed it!
title: Can't beat the location

review: Arrived around 19.00 for a 6 night stay. Allocated room had a view of station platform. Receptionist suggested we request a room change the following morning. Room was ready at 11.00 am. We had slept in and had late brekkie which is offered from 04.30 to noon!!! Clean room. Amazing breakfast selections. Very friendly staff. Fantastic location.
title: 6 nights in wonderful Amsterdam

review: Stayed in this hotel just for a night as I was over visiting a friend. I usually stay in Ibis hotels & have always had a pleasant stay. Very clean, staff very friendly & attentive! Great location for the city centre & various excursions & transportation links.Booking up for a 4 night stay at the end of October!
title: Great, convenient hotel

review: Very convenient for city and station and for river cruise terminal. Able to walk to latter with heavy bags downhill. Room basic with non working plug in bathroom basin and light beside bed not working. Ground floor room looked straight into bike park with glimpses of canal. Breakfast included and varied but always scrambled egg, beans and sausages. Wifi free and reliable
title: Felt like budget hotel

review: Great spot if you are coming and going by train from Amsterdam Central. Staff are super friendly and room very clean. Not a big room or bathroom bud adequate if you are not going to spend a lot of time in the room.
title: Good location

review: My husband and I booked this hotel as it was well located.The only annoying thing was that we needed to catch two lifts to get to our room as it was located in a separated building. Clean room but very small. You pay for what you get.
title: Good location

review: The only good thing about this hotel, while using the term hotel very loosely, is it's close to everything and exactly where you want to beStayed for 3 days and they did not clean our room, change our sheets or change our towels once even after asking them every day and again assuring us it would be done. It never got done.
title: Great location, terrible hotel

review: You cannot deny the location of this hotel is excellent as it is right beside the station and a short walk to the centre of the city however the rooms are very small and very basic, make no mistake the room was comfortable, however the bathroom was not much bigger than a cupboard and the room lacked storage space. Strangely the bed also had, 3 pillows instead of either 2 or 4. The hotel also offers a luggage room however what concerns me is that any guest can access the room and has access to the luggage
title: Paying for the location not the quality

review: The room was very clean and overall I was happy enough with the accomodation, however the room was small, particularly the bathroom which was a real struggle to manoeuvre around. I felt the room was expensive for the size of accommodation compared to other hotels in the area, but when major events are on the prices reflect the demand, so it is just one of those things.I would at this hotel again as it was clean and staff were very pleasant, but only if other hotels which I feel provide better value for money were unavailable
title: Compact

review: Hotel was in a great location. Very central to everything. Staff were great to deal with. Wifi was accessible from rooms which is a bonus.Only downside was rooms were very small. By the time we put our luggage on the floor there was no where to stand except sit on the bed.
title: Great location and hotel

review: Very conveniently located, roughly 150 m from Amsterdam Central Station. Close to points of interest such as A'DAM Tower, City Center, and canal cruises. The room we stayed in was rather small, but comfortable with a great view facing the EYE Movie Museum building across the waters from the Amsterdam Central station. The staff were very friendly, warm and welcoming. It was a pleasant short stay.
title: Comfortable Hotel with Strategic Location

review: I have stayed here twice now and it really is a perfect spot for visitors. The hotel is right next to Centraal Station and Amsterdam city centre. The staff were really helpful when I stayed last. The rooms are clean and have all the basics. If you are looking somewhere central this is perfect. Nothing luxurious but as a place to sleep and rest it's great value.
title: Perfect location

review: Not easy to rate. Location wise this is perfect. Possible to get train from airport for 5E if you wanted or about 30E in Uber. Walking distance to all the centre attractions, Red Light District etc... The hotel itself was fine, but the beds were awful. We had twin room and the beds were extremely narrow and the mattress was a roll out one and moved off the base at night! Not sure if it is an extremely expensive time of year but this cost $350 AU a night!
title: Hard to rate

review: My husband and I stayed at Ibis in August 2017 for 3 nights. The primary reason We had booked this hotel was for its location, and we were not disappointed!! The hotel is less than a minute from the Amsterdam central train station and is less than 2-4 minutes walk into Dam Square. The room size, however, is really small and the bathroom is even smaller. At first, when you open the bathroom, you almost miss the shower area because the shower cubicle is that small. Also, please note that there is no "Air-conditioning" in the rooms. I'll quote the receptionist, "we do not have air conditioning, but we have air cooling, and there is a fine line between them". This was a new concept for us to grasp. These "air coolers" would go off every hour or so at night, and the reception told us that they control them centrally and turn them off if they feel it's too cold. Our room became very stuffy without any cooling system. The room has a small device to control this cooling, but I think that's a dummy device and the hotel controls it. We didn't buy the breakfast because 17€ per person for breakfast was expensive for Ibis. Overall, if you just need a bed to crash in, I guess this works- but it's too expensive for just a bed at night.
title: Tiny room, no air conditioning, but location is unbeatable

review: As many say, this hotels location is it's number one plus. Close to central station, links around the city, would use again. Basic room, as expected not changed in the two nights I used it. Priced at it's correct level considering how central it is. For what it's worth, not a bad place to have as a base.
title: Location wise it's great

review: We booked this hotel for ease of travel from the train station- and found it to be a good hotel in a great location. Friendly and attentive front desk staff, good food & drinks in the lounge area, and a great breakfast buffet! We would definitely book here again!
title: Great location- Great staff!

review: Have visited Amsterdam a few times with work , this is probably the best hotel for price and location. The rooms are very clean and the staff only to happy to helpYou are less than 2 min walk from the ferry and the central station. Dam square is about 10 mins walk so you are right in the middle of it all. If you explore the streets there are some great places to eat or you can take advantage of the hotels restaurant the food is really good. I will defiantly use this hotel again for both future business and personal trip.
title: Perfect location

review: Ibis has a very friendly and helpful staff. They went the extra mile giving our small group excellent services. The location is right at the Central Train Station and in the heart of the town center. The train from the airport comes directly hear. You can walk to the cruise terminal in about 10 minutes across a promenade that is virtually traffic free. Luggage storage if you come in too early to check-in or want to do the town before a late flight.
title: Best. Location in Amsterdam and reasonable prices

review: We stayed here for 2 nights and the location is perfect. We got the train direct from the airport to central station for £5 and the hotel is right by its side. You are then close to everything within walking distance. Nice bar and food. The rooms are very clean and nice hot shower. I would stay here again without a doubt.
title: Excellent location

review: The hotel is conveniently located next to the Amsterdam Central station which is a transportation hub. There is a tourist office, tram stops and ferry terminal in front of the station and a bus station a short distance across the canal. It is walking distance to the Dam square and other attractions like DeWallen, National Monument, Royal Palace, Nemo Science museum, Madam Tussauds and the historical city center.The hotel features an excellent breakfast buffet with the restaurant overlooking the train tracks. You can watch trains coming and going as you are having breakfast. A separate restaurant serves dinner and drinks in the evening and offers a wide choice of dishes.The hotel has two wings - the city side rooms and rooms with a view overlooking the IJ river. The rooms with a view are over the train tracks and offer better views although you need to change elevators to reach them.Room size is reasonable and rooms feature free wifi. Staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is an excellent base to explore the city.Definitely worth a stay.
title: Excellent centrally located hotel with good dining options

review: The rooms were clean but small. Location is great for airport train in and short walk to hotel. Lots of attractions in close walking distance.The breakfast was good included with room. Many restaurants close by for eating out.
title: Great Location

review: The hotel is well located in Amsterdam central from walking distance of Amsterdam central station and tourist area. Small rooms but good for short stay. Reception staff is very friendly and helpful. Left luggage area will be great option to store your bags if you got to leave late. Very small bathroom and it seems designing issue from the beginning.
title: Well located in Amsterdam central

review: This was the first time going to Amsterdam I was taking my daughter age 31 for her birthday.I asked the advice of a friend since he had been to Amsterdam quite a few time where he would suggest we stay.He told us of this hotel as it was very central and true to his word it was. It was right next to the train from the airport and across the round from lots of the main shops.The hotel looks grubby from the outside but inside it's very different.Reception area is bright and clean staff are friendly.The room itself is small just about enough room for a double bed and a chair, we didn't find this a problem as we only slept here.I found the bathroom more of a problem it was really small. Overall they were both very clean.We ate breakfast in the hotel even thought we thought it was over priced it saved us looking for something outside.The breakfast was good but not 17 euros good per person.All in all I enjoyed our stay and if I was ever going back again I would use this hotel.
title: Birthday treat

review: Arrived from Paris by Thaly's train service. This hotel was perfect as it was just a 5 minute right-turn walk out of the station. Staying two nights, we were on the 7th floor facing the front, giving us great views. Took City Sightseeing tours both bus and boat. As for the bus, we were seated on the top deck. The configuration of the bus with its obstructed view made it next to impossible to take photos. In addition, the glass ceiling produced a greenhouse effect making the bus extremely uncomfortable even though the "air conditioning" was on. The canal cruise (you have your pick of 3 different routes) was a better experience. Check out the Ruks museum and a good photo opp of the " I lOVE AMSTERDAM" sign behind the museum! Also, the diamond cutting store is also on the canal/bus tour. We purchased a nice watch there and the staff filled out the VAT form for us. The hotel has an extremely tasty buffet breakfast service. It also had a nice bar/restaurant serving decent food at a good cost. We found that getting meals outside was problematic due to the extreme numbers of people. The train station itself does have some restaurants and co-op stores. All-in-all, a pleasant experience at IBIS Amsterdam Central.
title: Convenient, pleasant, affordable

review: The Ibis was in a Perfect location, close to everything, trains, canal ferries, eateries and Red light district! And busy with bike and tourists everywhere.Great hotel, we had a view of the canals on the amsterdam side and bikes, bikes everywhere, which was gorgeous, gave the room a really amsterdam feel. The room was a good size, the bathroom was a little small but clean, so that's all that mattered to me.Would recommend this hotel, easy to get anyway.
title: Amsterdam.. What an experience!

review: Stayed for one night on business.WiFi: GoodBreakfast: OKShower: OKBed and Linen: OKPower Plugs: OKOverall a average OK hotel - would not stay again if something else was available in price range.
title: Average hotel, nice location

review: Great and friendly check-in. Breakfast was delicious and plenty of room. We had a room on the 7th floor at the back (near the tracks) but had no issue with noise. The location is great to avoid lugging suitcases through the city. Right next to the station so easy to catch a bus, tram, etc. Beds were comfortable and room very clean. We felt the space was decent. They have fast check-out which was nice. Would stay again and recommend.
title: Wonderful stay

review: We chose this hotel online and were delighted with the location. Close to everything and easy to walk to some attractions, i.e. Anne Frank house. The HOHO bus/boat tours are everywhere and great to finding things. Trams are right there if this is your choice. Walking distance to the cruise port. Be prepared that this is NOT an American hotel. Price-wise about like a Holiday Inn-Europe style. Stayed 2 night pre-cruise and 1 night post-cruise. The first room was rather small. No facial tissue or wash cloths provided. No clock in the room. The buffet was expensive @ 17 euros per and rather skimpy on the food. Check in quick and easy with wonderful desk staff. Healthy snacks available for purchase 24/7 in the lobby. Free computer use for guests. We are not smart phone people so this was great for sending a quick message home. Rooms very clean and our second room was more the size of a small American hotel room with a larger bathroom and shower. Still no wash cloths or tissue. I would stay here again for price and location.
title: Great Location for Amsterdam Experience.

review: The location of this hotel is perfect, specially if you have an early morning flight and still want to live close to centre. Public transport is 2 mins walk away and dam square is about 10-15 minutes walk. The rooms are small, but that's not unusual with ibis. We were given interconnected rooms, so we kept getting startled by voices of our neighbours. The water in the vending machines is super expensive, it was like 3 Euros for small bottle.
title: Good location and super courteous staff.

review: After professor bubbleworks didn't let us stay in hotel Alfa, we booked last minute here. Very nice indeed, only issue is if you're over 5'5" you cannot sit on the toilet as very small. Hotel is clean and tidy, beds are good.
title: Pleasant stay

review: Ibis Amsterdam Centre is just beside Amsterdam Centraal Station and the perfect place to start exploring this amazing city. City sight seeing Bus and canal cruise is just in front of the hotel. Hotel is in a walking distance to explore Red Light Area & famous Dam Square. The hotel is in a lively place with tourist coming from Centraal Station every moment. Hotel room is very tiny however it has all the modern amenities. This hotel is pretty big. Breakfast is served in the 1st floor of the hotel with lots of delicious items. Check in and check out was pretty quick and the behaviour of the staffs are excellent. Truly professional and helpful staff. Stayed here for 2 nights in July 2017.
title: The best place to stay in Amsterdam !!!

review: Me and my partner stayed here in March for 3 nights! This hotel was a perfect location for exploring the city! Also being right next door to the train station it was very easy to find! We payed a little extra for a river view room, this was well worth it as the view from the room was beautiful. The room was small and compact but the perfect for a base to sleep and explore the amazing city! Had an problem with the booking but the staff were very helpful and prompt to email back to resolve the issue. Location was the biggest plus for this hotel and therefore would definitely recommend!! Would stay here if we return to Amsterdam!
title: City break in March!

review: Staying in centre of Amsterdam make me and family save time of journey and expenses. From here we can travel by trains, trams, boats, buses go around city and urban or airport. Also, walking along canal or shopping are easy ways to do. Hotel have arrangements of services, excellent staff with the best bilingual gave fell safe and relax in the meanwhile rooms are no noisy because of its double proofing wall. We stayed here one week. We will come back here for sure.
title: Central Amsterdam

review: We stepped of a plane after 30 hours travelling from New Zealand. A warm welcome greeted us, whilst a clean, quiet room with plnty of hot water awaited us. We slept like doormice before quickly wandering into the streets of Amsterdam. It is a good location for sightseeing. A good selection of food was available in the breakfast room which set us up for another day's travelling.
title: Great place to stay for travellers passing through

review: There are two Ibis in Amsterdam, Google maps & the very helpful well meaning locals were trying to direct us to the wrong one, we can laugh about it now but when you've been traveling for 24 hrs from Australia & hauling two suitcases around Amsterdam I didn't see the funny side at the time.The annoying thing is ( with hindsight) all we had to do was to come out of Amsterdam Central , turn right & it was only 100 meters ! you live & learn.The Hotel is fine only negative is the rooms are a bit on the small side , but great view of the center, we requested a high room as it is a bit noisy below due to traffic etc.We stayed there twice & have no regrets & ate in the restaurant every night, the staff in the restaurant were some of the nicest people I have ever met ( & I work in hospitality) the food was good , recommend the lasagna & nachos.Would stay there again.
title: Great hotel very handy to Amsterdam Central, friendly staff.

review: Not a good place to stay if ur over 6ft tall bathroom is way to small can't even dry yourself after a shower without opening the bathroom door. Rooms very small as well no bar fridge or aircon very disappointing
title: Not good

review: Hotel is just beside Amsterdam Central Station. Walking distance to St Nicholas Cathedral, lots of restaurants and souvenir shop. Hotel staff at the reception and restaurant were very friendly and helpful. Great selection for the buffet breakfast.
title: Good Customer Service and Perfect Location

review: Lovely hotel great location right by the Heineken experience as well has Lidl only few doors up breakfast lovely had everything u could think off rooms but small but we weren't there much so was ok as was exploring Amsterdam city staff very friendly there and coffee and tea was available all day in hotel which was great to
title: Lovely hotel

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I cannot fault this hotel in any way. This was my first ever stay at a Holiday Inn and it was very pleasurable. I spent 3 nights here with my brother who was invited to the RAI conference, which is within close proximity - also not too far from the city centre. All the staff were pleasant, the hotel had great facilities, it was modern and clean. Breakfast was also great with plenty of choice. Although a bit on the pricier side (around 600 euros), I would definitely stay here again if visiting Amsterdam.
title: A great experience, highly recommended!

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I was dissapointed with the service,we was stay four people.Room wasnt redy for us.There wasnt enough towel and bath producs even caps.Cleaning service was verry poor.I am never dissapointed with any hotel ike this before.
title: Anna

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I Can recommend staying at this hotel. Fair prices, good service and nice breakfast. Not far from City center - take tram No.4 and your there. Pls remember to book tickets in advance online to f.ex. Anne Frank house.
title: Nice hotel

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My wife and I traveled from the states to Amsterdam. She is a platinum IHG member. For our part, we were very pleased with the room and the service provided. We were not able to fly out the day we had expected and they made room for us when they were booked solid. Very close to train, tram and bus. This made our stay fabulous! The only thing it needs is upgraded wi-fi. Not very strong at all.
title: 8 Night stay

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Room good. Aircon and wifi both excellent. Very reasonable tariff. Not 5 star but all the better for it- relaxed and friendly.Staff so pleasant and accomodating. Breakfast is very good - omelette chef, nice room.Next to no. 4 tram which goes every 10 mins. You can buy a ticket on the tram.Also near to RAI train station.
title: Great hotel and lovely staff

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at this hotel & could roam entire Amsterdam thru' tram. Fair price, excellent service & wholesome breakfast. As tram station is at walkable distance & being first stop, its very convenient. The dinner is really excellent.
title: Excellent hotel with fabious connectivity thru' Tram

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Our initial thoughts were that this hotel was very far away from the central Amsterdam city and tourist attractions but after a big day touring we were happy to come home to the peace and tranquility of this hotel. Situated at the Rai Metro rail station 15 mins from Centraal) or Rai Tram station (30 odd mins from Centraal) it was a peaceful 4 minute walk to this hotel. It is close to the World Trade centre Amsterdam, Stadium Parnassus, Rai corporate exhibition onvention complex. About 10 mins walk away was a street full of different restaurants serving various cuisines and a supermarket Albert Heijn open till 10pm. There is ice machines located on each level outside the lifts. The mini bar has limited space to store drinks and all drinks supplied are electronically programmed to be charged to yr room if removed from the fridge.
title: Close to the Rai train station

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Arriving to hotel with requested early check in (which hotels pretty much always provide for platinum members) just to be told "check in at 15:00". On my polite hint that I requested early check in it's still "no - 3 o'clock". Suggesting that maybe saying "will try to get you room as early as we can" - instead of "3 o'clock" - which would be 3 hours later - did not make any impression on front office clerk. Upon talking to the manager - "all rooms booked". Pointing out that during this silly argument at least 10 people checked out - out of sudden a few clicks in computer and "oh I think I have a room for you". Really!!!???First impression counts and it was a very bad impression! It will be one night only affair! Never again Holiday Inn Amsterdam!
title: Welcome with a slap in the face!

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Clean tidy, fabulous service, excellent help yourself breakfast. Easy acces to Amsterdam RAI train station, 3 mins (Schipol Airport 15 mins), even closer tram stop, 2 mins serving all of Amsterdam (centre 7 or 8 mins) 7.5 euro all day (24 hour) travel. Ideal for business or pleasure.We stayed on the executive floor, neither of us liked the strong brown and white horizontal decor in the bedroom. But it was quiet and the shower was very good.
title: Very pleasant and convenient hotel

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed for 3 nights as part of a coach tour to Amsterdam.Found the hotel to be large,modern and very clean.Our room was of a very good size with a powerful shower.Air con was not too effective and a little noisy.We found all of the staff to be cheerful and most helpful at all times.Breakfast was a little hectic but a good choice was on offer but the hot food was only tepid at best.Evening meals were good but again the hot food was not hot enough.Overall would revisit and recommend.
title: AMSTERDAM VISIT

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Spent two night at Holiday Inn. Front desk staff is friendly and helped us with all the requests. Rooms are very small for a family. Breakfast is good. Parking is not for free. There's also a bar at the same area as the breakfast is served.
title: Small rooms

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This was a good hotel for my business needs. I was here for business in June and needed to get to the RAI center for a 5 day conference. The hotel was conveniently located - within waling distance to RAI, the train station and 2 -3 stops from Schiphol airport. Even access into the city center was easy - just a quick bus ride into town (10 - 15 minutes). I did have dinner one night at the on-site restaurant and it was a long wait. The service staff didn't seem to have a sense of urgency. Granted, the restaurant was probably busier than expected, but the wait was incredibly long even to get our drink order taken. There was a server in the morning that was fantastic though - she really made up for the evening debacle. She was friendly, efficient and was able to multitask to ensure all guests were being taken care of. Overall, the stay was fine - no frills and convenient. However, when I return to Amsterdam for leisure, I might look elsewhere.
title: A Fine Stay - Nothing Fancy

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel is located close the ring, which is nice is you come by car but far from the centrum if you get to Amsterdam by train. Rooms and breakfast are OK. Bar looks like a canteen.(bar - breakfast - dinner .... same place). As already specified the hotel is far away from the center but public transports are very good in Amsterdam.
title: Hotel: OK.

hotelLocation: De Boelelaan 2, 1083 HJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It's not at all in the city centre as mentioned on all the sites ..we had to catch the tramp and its 30 mins in the tramp ..I was really irritated wen they mentioned the city centre part ..as the staff was really friendly otherwise
title: Review on the location

review: The best thing about this hotel is their breakfast buffet. Lot of variety. Even vegetarians have food option which is great and the hotel staff was very active in taking cold stuff out and replacing it with hot food. Loved it.
title: One of the best stays

review: Stayed in late June for one night. The room was modern, clean and not cramped at all. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The lobby has lemon and cucumber water available at all times free of charge and a small relaxing lounge and bar. As far as the location if you are going to the Van Gogh museum, it’s just down the street. There are tram/trolley stops close as well to get to other parts of town. Vondle park is right across the street, treat yourself and stroll through the park. plud walking up trough the park is a great start of finish to walking into the main part of town. My wife and I cannot wait for our next trip to Amsterdam and stay at hotel Piet Hein.
title: Great hotel, wonderful location.

review: Room was not ready on arrival even though it was after checkin time. Was nearly 2 hour wait for room. We were given room 106 - avoid this room! It was terrible. It was located on its own past a staff locker room and hotel laundry, had no air conditioning, was 1/2 below street level, had push bikes and motor bikes parked outside of Windows. Room smelt very musty. We raised our concerns immediately and were advised that there was no alternative for that night but we would be upgraded the following day. We were upgraded to room 250 and were told this was 2 levels above our booking. Although this room was behind reception and bar it was extremely quiet and had a lot more room. Breakfast did not start till 7.30 and was a little hit and miss. Sometimes seemed a bit of an effort to have eggs cooked. Location was great.
title: Some good some bad

review: We stayed here for 3 nights on a hen weekend, the location was good close to hard rock square and tram stops, the hotels is situated opposite a beautiful park. The hotels location was the highlight, breakfast wasn't included in the price but could be added on, there are better value places for breakfast near by. Our room was ok, I expected more for the price we paid and no tea/coffee facilities in the room.
title: Good location

review: Nice pleasant hotel staff very warm and welcoming Prices v competitive Clean tidy and in a nice part of the cityHighly recommend this place.Bar is nice and good selection of beer/shorts,hotel staff very helpful will definitely stay here again.
title: Nice pleasant hotel

review: My wife and I loved our five days at this lovely hotel. All of the staff seemed happy to work there and happy to help their guests. The breakfast was great. This location is relatively quiet, which suited us well. We were in easy walking distance from the major art museums and the Vogelpark, and there were plenty of good restaurants nearby. Once we caught on to how to use the trams, we could get anywhere in the city with ease.
title: Great little hotel

review: Myself and 3 friends stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. On arrival, the hotel looked to be very lovely, clean, cool water and glasses in reception for use of guests, a lovely looking little bar and comfy seating. Staff were polite and welcoming and check in was very speedy. On going to our rooms we were very disappointed with the standard as they were nowhere near the standard shown on the website (131 & 106). I would say avoid room 106 as it is in the basement, with a very small window facing onto the street, it was next to the lift shaft, toilets and offices. Not pleasant at all and my 2 friends didn't sleep at all in there the first night as it was very stuffy and very noisy. Staff changed their room the next day to a much nicer room, still not really like the ones in the pictures but pleasant enough. Staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome. We had breakfast in the hotel on our first morning and it was good value 12 Euros. There were hot drinks, juice, water, cereals, full English, pastries, and more - Very nice. Having cool water available in reception at all times was a very nice touch. Location was perfect. We purchased a 3 day travel card which was useful but we walked so much as lots to see. We would definitely stay here again but would not accept room 106.
title: Lovely 2 day Break with friends

review: We stayed at Hotel Piet Hein for 3 nights and probably 3 nights too long. My partner surprised me with the trip to Amsterdam for my birthday and I was really looking forward to it on the day as I had not known up until the night before. When we arrived to the hotel I was happy with the lobby area as it was quite modern and nice. The man on the desk gave us poor directions to our room. He wasn't very clear on exactly which way we must go when we get to the stairs. Once we found our room, we was a little shocked at actually how small it was. We knew it would be a snug double but it was very snug. There was barely any room for our luggage and we struggled to get down the sides of the bed. Also the room was quite dated. Not all of it but the carpet was horrid. It looked like they updated the rest of the hotel and then got the carpet out of the loft. Once I opened the door to the bathroom a wall of Sewage stench hit our noses and we rushed to open the window in the bedroom where I found bird poo on the inside of the window and someone's used plaster on the floor next to my side of the bed. Also in the bathroom the towel rack was above the toilet so over the course of our stay the towels kept falling off the rack and into the toilet. It was also very dark in the bathroom probably because of the black shower curtain. There was no hair dryer in the room which was an annoyance as it states on the booking details that there is one in every room. It took 3 days to get one in our room. Every night I asked the man on the desk which rushed round the hotel looking for one. And every night he said he'd get the day staff to get us one. On the 3rd day my partner went up in the morning to ask again which is when they finally said they'll bring one down shortly. The man who brought it down wanted to come in the bathroom and fix it to the wall whilst I was showering. The maids were rude. They came into the room one morning whilst we were still in bed. Later they returned at 11:30 and we were still getting ready. My partner had just got out the shower so I said to the maid we'd be out in 15 minutes. She said that's too late. So she just gave me towels. We walked out the room 15 minutes later and she had just entered a room down the hall to clean. So how is that too late? We hadn't had our room cleaned for 2 days.
