Still had bird poo on the window and dust on the window sill. The pillows were like bags of potatoes. Really lumpy and there was only 2 per bed. I personally sleep with 2 for myself at home and most hotels provide 2 per side of the bed. Found it very strange that this hotel was different in that regard. Our room was one right at the bottom of the stairs. Our view was a brick wall. Wasn't too bothered about the view, it was more annoying the fact that the smoking area seemed to be right outside the window and seeing as there was no Air Con I'd have to have the window open at night. So at 2am we had people, right outside our room walking on the gravel. How is one supposed to sleep during that racket? One night the man at the desk told us our room was one of the new ones. Me and my partner looked at each other both wanting to burst out laughing. So for your own sakes after reading my review I hope some of you book a room elsewhere. This stay has really made me appreciate my own home.
title: Would not recommend

review: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights/4 days with my boyfriend in mid June. The hotel was gorgeous, very clean and had comfortable beds. Location was good, there was a bus stop less than 2 mins from the hotel that went straight from the hotel to the airport. The hotel wasn't massively central but the walk into the city centre was lovely! On top of the hotel being excellent the staff couldn't do enough for myself and my boyfriend during our stay. They gave great suggestions for activities, restaurants and sights to see within Amsterdam.I would highly recommend to this hotel for a short stay in Amsterdam.
title: Gorgeous hotel, good location

review: Small and basic rooms but we were out all day so all we needed was sleep and a shower. Between 3 of us it was pretty tight. Staff were lovely and the hotel is in a great location, close to the park and walking distance to many attractions. We had a good 3 night stay to start off our Europe holiday :)
title: Good location and hotel

review: Stayed here for five nights on vacation with a friend. The room was simple without frills, but was clean and comfortable. The staff was very helpful with assisting in directions and advice. There was always delicious cold lemon and mint water in the lobby which we enjoyed on every trip into the hotel after days out touring the town. The location is awesome. Across from the Vondelpark makes it easy to find with a beautiful park to enjoy. A five minute or less walk from the major art museums makes the location ideal. Close to the sights, but far enough away to be out of the extreme touristy zones. The hotel is also close to several tram and bus lines, including a bus for 5€ direct to the airport. There are several places to eat and drink very walkable as well. We didn't have breakfast included with our room rate, and didn't take advantage because we didn't want to spend 12.50€ on breakfast, but when I inquired I saw they were making eggs to order and had a variety of offerings.
title: Simple room, great location

review: We booked via booking dot com and so this hotel was an unknown both in terms of its location and the quality of the hotel.First it is in a superb location if you are visiting the museums not only that its very handy for the hop on hop off bus and blue line of their river boats. It is also very close to the 197 airport bus service. It is next to the Vondelpark. Catch the tour bus and the 197 bus at the ENTRANCE of Vondel park on stadhouderskade (stop 10) almost opposite the hard rock cafel To get to this bus stop you walk out of the hotel turn left and walk down the street or through the park. TIP buy a really good street map of Amsterdam before you come as most of the free tourist maps are not good enough.The hotel is smart and modern and a great bar. WIFI was excellent .Our room was a budget room and so was small but adequate we did NOT know that when booking - suggest you make sure you get a better room if you are here for more that a day or so. In our room you could not walk around the double bed. However Air Con worked well and was quiet, Bathroom small apart from a floppy shower head all other services worked fine, the bed was very comfortable - lots of english speaking TV channels delightful garden.The staff are delightful nothing was too much trouble. It was worth staying here just for that.
title: Superb location and the staff were so helpful

review: I stayed at the Hotel Piet Hein for a week in June. The hotel is right next to Vondelpark where you can take a walk or go for a run, grab a bite to eat and enjoy people-watching at your leisure. You will be at a comfortable walking distance from the Museumplein and from the shopping area on Leidestraat and the window-shopping Hoofstraat. The tram lines are nearby and the front desk will help you with getting around.The rooms, as mentioned in other reviews, are very small but well-designed and comfortable. Most are air-conditioned but some are not which does matter in the summer months. The staff is friendly and very helpful, directing me to several excellent restaurants. They also warned me against using the hotel laundry and gave me several options to get some jeans washed before I moved on. There is an excellent breakfast with all the standards including cook-to-order eggs. Beer and mixed drinks are available at the bar. There is also a quiet, shady outdoor seating area for relaxing.I would definitely recommend the Hotel Piet Hein as a home base while visiting Amsterdam.
title: Convenient, friendly hotel

review: I booked to stay at Hotel Piet Hein for two nights, for my boyfriends 30th birthday. Whilst the hotel lobby area was beautiful, every other aspect of our stay was a let down.I'd ordered for a bottle of prosecco to arrive in our room at 6pm, a surprise for my partner, which they discussed when we checked in at 2pm - surprise ruined! The staff were also careless, failed to deliver on information on tourist activities as they'd emailed me saying they would, declined to help when our room STANK of sewage for some unknown reason, and were horrendously rude upon check out.We're not pedantic travellers - we didn't care that our room was small, dated, that we didn't have any kind of view. Nor did we care that the hotel isn't sound proof at all, or that the cleaner came into our room at 9:30am whilst we were getting dressed. We just felt we could have picked a much better hotel for the price we paid.On a positive, the location is perfect - although as other reviews state you there are lots of hotels in the area so they would be my first choice next time.
title: Disappointing

review: Stayed 3 nights. Location was good easy access to the centre by tram. Hotel lobby very inviting despite the mouse running around. Did complain but staff not that bothered. Room though clean was tired and dated shabby curtains. No tea and coffee facilities. Pillow was lumpy and small and hotel wouldn't provide extra ones. Bed uncomfortable and soft. Wouldn't stay again even for one night.
title: Not a boutique hotel

review: My wife and I stayed at the hotel for the weekend, the location is great and is very quiet, being next to vondel park its easy to get on the right tram, the hotel is quite modern and well maintained, the continental breakfast was good, the beds in our room were brilliant we slept really well, there is a safe in the room which is easy to use. we stayed in room 333 which overlooks the park.
title: great location

review: I loved the location and the cleanliness but our room was tired and very small and dark and the double bed was sagging completely at the only side not against a wall. the toilet was very dark. On a plus most of the staff were very friendly and helpful bar maybe one who could only be described as quite rude.
title: Great Location

review: There were several good points during our stay, including the free water, nice bar/lounge area, free wifi, good location. Unfortunately, the room was incredibly hot, even with the window open (which allowed us to hear loud conversations from the park). The room was also very small and we had little room for luggage. Our friends faired worse and had an even smaller room with a tiny window and a very tiny shower.
title: Small, warm room

review: We are not picky traveller's by any means, but we were very disappointed by our stay at Hotel Piet Hein. This was our last hotel stay after three weeks of traveling through Germany, Czech Republic and the Netherlands, and it was not what was advertised on their website. Our positives are that the hotel offered free water in the lobby and that they successfully scheduled a taxi for our early morning trip to the airport.The air conditioner was broken during the entire duration of our stay even though multiple staff members told us it would be fixed when we inquired about it on different days. We were told that the hotel had been struck by lightning, and that someone was coming to fix the AC, but this never happened during our five day stay. After reading recent reviews on Tripadvisor, it is clear that this is just a standard lie that they tell hotel guests upon arrival. The ventilation in the room was horrible, especially on the two warm days we had during our stay, even with the window wide open. We slept with the window open each night and the security arm on the window was broken, which allowed the window to swing completely open. Due to this, we could hear late night conversations in the garden area while we were trying to sleep, and cigarette and marijuana smoke would blow into our room. When it rained, it allowed water to come onto the windowsill on the side of our bed. The size of the room we booked was misrepresented on the hotel website compared to the room we received during our stay. The bed fit the entire width of the room and the area in which to move around the room was extremely small. The "mattress" was a mattress topper - less than five inches thick - which constantly slid off what you would consider a futon base. There was no room to put our two large pieces of luggage so we constantly had to step over them or move them in order to simply move throughout the room. In the bathroom the toilet paper is dispensed like napkins at a fast food restaurant, which is unpleasant and unlike any other hotel we stayed at throughout our three weeks of travel. The wake up call we were to receive on the day of our departure did not happen. When the gentleman at the front desk was asked about why we did not receive our call, he told us that he did call and that we did not pick-up. Thankfully we were up before our requested call time, but the fact that this person did not think to even knock on our room door leads us to believe that he did not call or that the phone was broken, just like most other things in our room. Look elsewhere when planning your stay in Amsterdam. It is so easy to get around everywhere on the trams that it is not worth it to stay here even though the hotel is close to some of the nicer museums in the city.
title: Don't Bother

hotelName: Best Western Plus Hotel Blue Square
review: We stayed here on our first night of our contiki trip. I was very happy to see such a nice room and I was sleeping like a baby, and I wanted to stay in the bed longer, but we had to get up rather early. We had breakfast and dinner the night before here, and both meals were great. I would definitely come back here again if I got the chance.
title: One Perfect Night

hotelName: Best Western Plus Hotel Blue Square
review: We have enjoyed the stay.The rooms were a a little smaller, but enogh for our one night stay.The was possible to park our car near hotel for free. The route to city centre via tram took about 25 minutes without a need to chnge lines of the tram.
title: Standard hotel

hotelName: Best Western Plus Hotel Blue Square
review: Situated in the middle of nowhere. It's kind of like the place airlines put you when your flight is delayed. If you are looking for a cute coffee shop or shop then best stay somewhere else. If you're happy to get straight on the tram and commute to Amsterdam city first thing in the morning, then fine. No disrespect to the staff, but I was a bit disappointed because the hotel had a lot of stars, and I didn't understand why.
title: Unusual location for a best western.

hotelName: Best Western Plus Hotel Blue Square
review: Stayed here twice in 2016. Good size rooms, equipped with all of the essentials. Good value for money & friendly staff. Located in a nice neighbourhood, closely located to public transport for easy access into Amsterdam central.
title: Reliable Budget Hotel

hotelName: Best Western Plus Hotel Blue Square
review: I was attending breakfast already had my food on my plate when a hotel memeber came up to me and told me I had to leave as I was not in the correct footwear. I thought this was completely ridiculous as I was never informed there was a dress code and no signs where displayed to enforce this, but rules are rules and made my way back to the room to change my shoes. Upon my arrival back at breakfast I noticed there was a lot of middle aged and up guests wearing flip flops also. I then approached the same staff member to inform him that I had changed my foorwear but if he was going to make me change mine it should be enforced for all guests. This staff member then started to abuse me at the top of his lunges in front of the whole restaurant saying its not only his job to check that everyone is wearing the correct footing and that I need to behave. I responded to him simply stating that I felt personally attacked and victimised. I then became so embarrassed and upset I had to leave breakfast in tears without eating my meal. I pay for my stay like every other guest and I can not believe I was treated in such a way. I really regret not getting this abusive mans name!!
title: **VICTOMISING HOTEL DO NOT STAY HERE **

review: We came for 3 nights to visit Amsterdam's attractions and the U2 concert. Breakfast was good and varied as well as staff friendly and helpful. Close to Tram 2 stop, which makes it easy to move to the center. Also nearby are good affordable restaurants. We'll be back at this hotel again.
title: Nice and peaceful hotel

review: This is a nice hotel some may say small room but not for Amsterdam. The location is great for Museums (Van Gogh and RIjks) and is right beside Vondel Park. The tram travels right in from of the hotel. Parking is available on the street for the city fee. This is a very safe and upscale neighborhood.
title: Good location great staff

review: Set on Koninginneweg St. in Amsterdam, this hotel is on the #2 tram line, making it easy to travel around the city. It's very clean, the rooms are spacious and comfortable and the staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. My only complaint is not having a luggage rack in the room. I was faced with either putting my suitcase on the floor, on the desk or on the bed. Otherwise, it exceeded my needs and was a very good hotel solution for the one night I was in Amsterdam on this trip.
title: A quiet small hotel

review: First impression of the room was cool, but the you start finding how dis functional the room really is. There is no privacy from the bathroom to the rest of the room, glass see through door and wall. It was good for watching tv from the shower.Only a very small mirror in cupboard to check your self.The bathroom sink isn't in the bathroom, it's in main room, but no mirror and no power point for hair straightener or electric shaver etc. The power point is at the desk bellow the tv with a very small makeup mirror.Very poor lighting in the room which made doing makeup frustrating.Sore back and neck from bed and pillows.Positive things were the staff were very friend helpful, Nespresso coffee in the room was a very nice touch.Location to tram was great, but next trip I will stay closer to city, it was a little bit far out if you need to drop shopping off or get changed before going out for the night.The area of vondelpark is beautiful in every way, but more suitable for relaxing people rather than party people.
title: Disappointed

review: Hotel could benefit from staff going the extra mile when they find out something such as that you are on honeymoon as other hotels in Europe have done for special birthdays, and there needs to be privacy in the bathrooms as opposed to a glass box in the corner where the door doesn't fully close! The bed was nice and comfy but there was rubbish under it. However, the location was good near to the tram and beautiful Vondelpark.
title: Nice Hotel but no privacy in bathroom

review: I cannot fault this hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and my room was immaculate. The only down side was it was a bit of a hike to get into the centre of Amsterdam (I should say it was a bit of a hike to get back to the hotel, as we had late nights and the trams stop operating at around midnight)
title: Park Plaza Hotel, Vondelpark.

review: Good location for a city trip to Groningen close to and not in the centre. Further a good starting point for a bike tour.Reception and staff very helpful in providing information, making arrangements and assisting in parking our cars.Rooms are relativeley small but OK and with a perfect view on the city. Breakfast is very good and further is coffee and tea the whole day avaliable for free.
title: Weekend stay with friends

review: The hotel does not look like much from the outside and also the lobby feels quite bland. However, the rooms were comfy (even if not huge) and the bed a dream (I love them cozy). The modern modular build-in transparent bath room worked well for us (though a bit small). Great breakfast buffet (loved the fresh berries) that is constantly refilled. Very curteous service throughout. Even though it is a non-smoking hotel we initially were given a (former) smoking room that smelled terrible, but were traded into a propoer non-smoking room no problem. Good location off Rembrandt Square. Get a room to the rear, which have no view but are very quiet!
title: Better than expected

review: First room I was given #107 was a room from hell.Fronting the street which is close to Rembrandt Square is very noisy.The tram is tolerable, but the noisy and drunk revelers, till around 3ammade sleep impossible.The hotel was full, so no room change was available until the 3rd day, when reliefarrived in the form of a room on the 5th floor in the back. It was QUIET.
title: Location is good. Noise is bad.

review: I was disappointed of the hotel, exept of the breakfast, which was great.The Junior Suite we book looked and smelled like it has not been used and cleaned for months. Quite dirty overall (waterstains on the toilet and surfaces, dusty cabin), and very (!) bad sink smell from the bathroom which did not go away for three days. The drain plug was on the bathtub shelf and looked like it smelled in the whole room. No possibility to open windows, only AC.The interior looks like nothing has been updated since 1990 - which would be okay if clean, but not for the price. The old flat TV had a speaker/sound problem. On the pictures everything really looks nicer.First I wanted to give three points rating here, but I stayed in many many 4 stars Hotels, and this is definetly not the "average" of them. The location is great, yes, but thats not what should be rated here. There are tons of hotels in the center area.As mentioned the breakfast was surprisingly very good. fresh fruits, different breads and rolls, cereal and so on. Nowadays it would be suitable to add gluten-free and soy alternatives, but overall it was very good.The service is friendly and nice. But it all does not make up for the room, where you do not feel comfortable in. Like not wanting to take your shoes off and not feeling good using the dirty bathroom where you actually want to get clean. Where you as a paying guest need to buy hygiene wipes to clean the toilet before using. Also the glass doors of the bathrom (also dirty) do not close properly, so good-bye privacy.We could peek in a standard room which looked exactly like our junior suite. Since the dusty nespresso machine (still containing water) did not appeal so much, there is probably no difference besides the extra 4-5 m².All in all: do not trust the pictures, it is "okay" to stay there but I would never book it again. There are too many alternatives in Amsterdam (which is probably the problem after all)
title: Don't trust the pictures, not worth the price

review: This is supposed to be a 4 star hotel and priced accordingly. Room standard, maintenance below expectations on various counts, lighting in the room so poor I could not read, only in a certain spot. No restaurant in the hotel, only a so called French Bistro where one can DINE, not EAT a straight forward dinner. There is a joining 3 star hotel same ownership, same location but a different postal address that gives same service for lower price. My mistake, for which I payed.
title: I would rate it 3*

review: The room was a good size and the bed very comfy. The location was fabulous. I found the room we had on the street side extremely noisy from the party goers on the street below. Staff were friendly and the bar was a lovely place to have an evening drink. The only downside for me was the noise. I would go back to this hotel but would request a room on the quiet side.
title: Great location but found it noisy on the street side

review: Been all over the world and this is a beautiful hotel to make your base whilst in Amsterdam. Great rooms, very helpful staff, amazing ambience. Near to all the canals, 15 min walk from the attractions, and Rembrandt Square is 2min walk away where all the bars and restaurants are. Enjoyed so much we are going back asap.
title: Must stay here

review: We arrived at around 23:00 and the taxi driver left us at the "backdoor" where no one was there to open for about 15minutes. We did not know how to reach the main entrance so inevitably waited until someone who had a card to enter opend for us as well...The Hotel is overstaffed but with very young "chiildren wise" students that do not know how to behave or to help you in hotelia way...The room was not clean at all. We have torn sheets and the table wnear the bed (telephone) was full of dust! My wife said not to complain because we would be speaking with students (so like speaking to deaf people) so i did not !Location : perfect near to everything even by foot!Rent a bike from the Turkish under the Hotel (green bikes) to ride around the beautiful town.Take a train for a trip to hague (Den Haag). What a great experiece this was....All in all the Hotel is good only for the location.
title: Overstaffed with students

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 33, 1012 RD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The rooms are really small, but the hotel is on really good location. You are in city center and you can walk form hotel to city center, which is really nice. The breakfast was ok, but it is everything very small in this hotel so when you eat breakfast, you sit less than 0,5m away from other guest.
title: Small rooms,ok breakfast, not value for money

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 33, 1012 RD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel met our needs, it located close to the dam square, the red light district and the central station.The breakfast was very good.The reception staff was helpful.We took a room in the fifth floor, it was basic room and very small, but it didn't bother us because we spent all our time outside, but if you plan to stay more time in the hotel room you should ask for bigger room.
title: Excellent location and good breakfast

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 33, 1012 RD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We needed to make one last-minute reservation near the central station and this venue had vacancies so we took it for a night. It's a bit overpriced overall: It is on a non-scenic busy street, the wifi in our 3rd floor room only worked if you sat right by the door, and our room didn't cool evenly, with the two loft beds being a bit warm, and the bathroom smelled of pea. It had a full breakfast, but the quality was only so-so. So I wouldn't recommend it unless it's all that's left. Go to Hotel Aalders, where we stayed for the rest of our trip, instead.
title: OK in a pinch

hotelLocation: 3 MT Ondinaweg, 1033 RG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: What I expected - no nasty surprises and good price as compared to other stays in Amsterdam .I was disappointed that we could not upgrade to the letter rooms - especially when myself and my husband went up on the deck to look at them and they were not occupied ! Would have been a nice experience ! Also there should be more than one member of staff at reception - when you arrive at a hotel after a long plane ,train and boat journey the last thing you want is to stand in a queue for 20 minutes to check in. All in all - a pleasant stay if you plan to just have somewhere to lay your head down - which for us was perfect !
title: What it says on the tin !

hotelLocation: 3 MT Ondinaweg, 1033 RG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I spent three nights here with my boyfriend last week. The staff are very helpful but the rooms had a damp smell to them and were cramped. Being on a city exploring holiday this was not an issue for us as we only used it for sleeping. Only thing I wish we had been aware of prior to having been booked here (we booked through wowcher and so the hotel was chosen for us) is the accessibility. It is placed on the other side of the river to the main section of the city and so a ferry is needed to get there. This is not a problem on the whole as they come every 10 minutes and are free. However it is unreliable in the evening and early hours of the morning. This means it does not come or does not stick to the times stating it will come meaning another ferry had to be taken with a 20 euro taxi at the other end. This is nothing against the hotel just a factor I would have liked to be aware of before staying myself. The area surrounding the hotel seems to be an industrial estate type place but does have a couple of bars and is always popular in the day, with lots of people ferrying over to explore it. Satisfied overall given our budget and needs.
title: What you expect from a three star hotel

hotelLocation: 3 MT Ondinaweg, 1033 RG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Unique hotel as its a boat but thats were the excitement stops. We're given a twin room rather than a double room that was requested. But didn't mind as the room were so hot that sleeping separately was an advantage. You have to request a fan for a refundable €20 that is not powerful enough but helps to make the room bearable in the heat - luckily when we went it was 23 degrees C and not any hotter. The rooms are extremely basic, no modern amenities at all - the TV is small, with poor reception. The bathroom is what you expect from a boat. The shower provides good hot water but is not a traditional shower head and you have to adapt - its more of a tap up high. Reception stuff need customer service training as they are not friendly, lack empathy and have a general poor attitude.The maids were good, smiled and cleaned to a good standard. Wifi was good and had fast speeds. The catering staff were always smiling and quick to assist. The breakfast was good - except they need to replace the toasters. Took 5mins to get slightly brown bread. Getting to the hotel via the Fery shuttle is a highlight and unique experience.
title: Unique but very basic

review: A very nice hotel located right in the middle of the canal district. We got a room on the 5th floor, overlooking Rembrandtplein and the surrounding area. Nice and clean rooms, with comfortable beds. The hotel staff was very polite and helpful.
title: Great hotel with a friendly staff

review: Rooms are very small, definitely need an upgrade to actually enjoy it.I also moved because my room was facing Rembrandt Square which was quite noisy. Breakfast is very basic and definitely doesn't justify the extra cost, for what you get it should be free. Location is really good but that's about it.No gym or special facilities.
title: Business stay

review: Stayed for business in June 2017. The pros: The location! The location is phenomenal. It's in a square with restaurants and "coffee shops," and a Starbucks. Public transit is easily accessible and we could walk to dinner or drinks with more than enough selections. It was about a EUR 50 cab ride from Schipol.I'd also list the bar/lounge as a pro because it was a nice place to relax and work while we were waiting to check-in to our rooms. Final pro was the staff that was very friendly and accommodating. The cons: No climate control... When I was there this was okay because it was cool enough outside that you could open the window. They do leave a fan in the closet if you need additional cooling...Cleanliness: Not good. When I got into my room after check-in there was a giant wet spot on the floor next to the bed. I do not know what that was; but, it was unnerving.Breakfast: It wasnt bad; but, it wasnt good. I got it included with my room in a promo deal; however, I would not pay additional for this breakfast. There is a Starbucks (BTW the coolest Starbucks interior I've ever seen!) literally 100 yards when you walk to the right out of the hotel. You would get a better value going to that Starbucks than doing the hotel breakfast. Value: You are paying for the location. With other hotels in the same square I would research those hotels for a better value.All in all, the hotel was just okay. I probably wouldnt come back unless the rooms were renovated to include climate control.
title: No climate control and wet spot on floor....

review: My boyfriend and I came to stay for 4 nights on a sightseeing trip, our first time in Amsterdam. NH Schiller is a beautiful art-deco hotel located in the centre of Rembrandt Square, a bustling area full of hotels, restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Rembrandt Square is only a ten minute walk from Dam Square and the Damrak, and 15 minutes from Central Station, so ideally situated for the sightseeing we were doing. It's also close to the beautiful Herengracht area and to Rembrandt House Museum. The hotel reception area was stunning and the bar/restaurant too, though we didn't actually use it. We were on the 3rd floor and front facing. The room was clean and large enough for our requirements. My only (minor) complaint would be that the room got very warm at night (it was hot weather) and as it is an old building there is no air conditioning. With the room being front facing of course, with the windows opened, it was very noisy at night, due to the nightlife. There is a fan in the room however, so we left the fan on all night and also during the evening when we were out for dinner, so that the room had a chance to cool in advance. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful, and printed out tickets for us for a tour for which we required a paper copy. We were also able to leave our luggage at reception after checking out for the few hours prior to our flight, and we were not charged for this, which we were in the last hotel we stayed in. All in all I would recommend the Schiller Hotel.
title: Enjoyable Stay

review: hotel was terrible, the staff very rude and not attentive at all! shoes were stolen out of our hotel room and the hotel did not do anything!! furthermore hotel staff entered our room and opened all our luggages and inspected them for some reasons... when complaining about these not acceptable incidents they seemed not to care and we did not get a clear answer to what happened or anything!!! Besides all that they also gave us a hotel room where puke was in front of our bed and the smell in the room was horrible!!!! NOT RECOMMENDABLE PROPERTY!!!
title: HORRIBLE SERVICE AND STAFF IS VERY RUDE!!

review: it is a very cute hotel that makes full use of the space available. perfect location if you have to be around the train station. room is on the smallish side . bathroom is good and quiet spacious.bed was good. sleep quality was good. i was welcomed with chocolates and a bottle of wine (maybe because i am a gold member). breakfast was okay - quite a bit of choice. i was always in a rush and always ended up with a coffee on the go.the staff in the breakfast room were very kind and polite. at the reception, they try to go for friendly but they are not the friendliest. i had an incident where my international adapter stopped working and the reception told me that they had none available with them as they had given them all to existing customers, which is okay... but that leads u to think that they must be having just a couple of them. those are basic things that most hotels have, even the most basic ones. there was no willingness to help, just blank faces and a total lack of care till i probed where i could get one. they showed me an area and i went there and got one. luckily there was a shop open at that hour.other than that incident, everything was okay.
title: short stay

review: This Ibis is all about location, location. Located very close to Central Station and the tram hub. Contemporary feel with a very helpful staff. Decent breakfast included. Room configuration varies from room to room. Our room was larger than the first room assigned but the staff were very accommodating in switching room. Our room had two steps up to the sleeping area and one step down into the bathroom which had an open shower and a very narrow potty space. Could be a problem for large and plus size people. Luggage could be stored in a secure area. Negative : no tissues or washcloths. Complimentary cold water and coffee in the lobby. Elevator. Recommend and would stay again. Hope this helps.
title: LOCATION & RELATIVE GOOD VALUE

review: The was room small but clean. The front desk was helpful. The locations is great and there plenty small restaurants within walking distance. The breakfast bar is fine and included in the price of the room.
title: Located Near Train Station

review: A very nice and cozy hotel situated one tram (17) ride away from city center. Situated right in the middle of the west shopping center, which means close access to budget shopping, decent restaurants, Albertine XL and a nice open area with fountain for some kid’s fun. There is a lake a few minutes’ walk away. The staff is very friendly, reception is open 24 hours and you feel very welcome. They run a nice small café in the ground floor. Since the reception is open 24 hours, you get access to stuff in this café 24/7. Rooms are named after cities of the world with a full wall view of that city in the room.The hotel is entirely in first floor with lift from reception at one end of the hotel. From there it is basically a loooong corridor with rooms on both sides. If your room is at the other end, you would have walked half way back to Amsterdam by the time you reach your room. Rooms are extremely small. Actually, our room was as wide as the cot (6 or 7 ft). When you enter, the room, you have toilet on one side with a ground glass partition. There is no way to lock the toilet door. There is a shower room also in there. After the toilet you have a nice washbasin behind the shower room. The bed is next, and as I said, it takes 50% of the room space. The bed is extra comfy. My room had a full width window after the bed. You will not feel boxed in at all. The city view printed on one wall make it seem like you have space. You can stove your luggage under the cot. Both sides of the cot, you have a little bit space to keep your camera, purse, hand bag etc. Above the washbasin, you have a big mirror. The lighting design is nice as well. The design is highly space saving. To be honest, this feels like you are in a luxury boat cabin rather than a hotel. This was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in my life. However, let me tell you it is comfortable and cozy. One suggestion to management, please provide additional coat hangers opposite the bathroom, so that we can hang more cloths, small bags etc.
title: Very small but cozy and comfortable hotel

review: What an absolutley brilliant Hotel. I stayed in this 2 nights from the 7th to 9th July. Was a simple trip from right outside the airport to the hotel by bus...buses do not accept cash so buy a travel card!!! I had to pay on card but when I got to the hotel there was a tobacco shop that sold 3 day travel tickets for 17 euros. The hotel is in a lovley little town called Osdorplein it's a good 20 minute tram ride from Dam centre but I much preferred being away as the town was lovley. Your right in the middle of a shopping centre , lake and transport links to one side and shops everywhere you look the hotel has water fountains outside which everyone seems to go in what a friendly bunch of people too. There's loads of places to eat near the hotel and a supermarket called Hema which is extremely cheap and sells brilliant things. The hotel it's sell is modern and clean, we arrived early and they got the room ready for us and let us check in which was nice of them, we had a room for 3 people which was big, beds are super comfy. The maids are always about cleaning rooms and restocking supplies. Breakfast was included in our room which was continental style and really yummy. I plan to come back here every year it truly is one of the best breaks I've ever had. Everyday I was there I went to Amsterdam centre, it's a different way of life over there everybody walks or rides it's a lovley laid back place to be. My tip is to explore while in the centre I come across some of the most amazing restaurants, coffee shops and people too. I would highly recommend the ice bar and pub crawl we had an amazing second night there. Amsterdam is the place to be chilled by day and crazy at night and this hotel is a fantastic base to do this from.
title: Citiez Hotel Amsterdam

review: Citiez Hotel Amsterdam! Great choice with best price,awesome staff and beautiful,modern concept&design. My wife and I love traveling and exploring new destinations. Our next stop was Amsterdam. Choosing the best accommodation type (cleanliness,price range,location etc.) is very important for us while planning a vacation with the right budget.After searching for quite some time,we definitely picked the best hotel in town by far. Citiez Hotel Amsterdam.Citiez Hotel is located about 20 minutes away from downtown in a shopping center(we could find anything we need in the shopping center)which was perfect for us. In case of transportation,we purchased public transportation 3 days pass tickets (includes all tram and buses)from Amsterdam Central Station for 26€ each person,which was very helpful. There is a lot to see around like beautiful beaches and beautiful little villages around.We have stayed 3 nights between 27th-30th June 2017 with my wife and we absolutely enjoyed our stay to the fullest. The hotel itself and the rooms were extremely nice and clean,smoke free with free wifi. The breakfast buffet was amazing (10€ per person). As far as the hotel rooms are concerned there are different types of rooms fits different budgets. Over all 10/10. We loved the hotel,the atmosphere,the staff and the location! Special thanks to Jean Paul&Femke,the creators and the owners of this beautiful hotel. A lot of hard work and such a great job you have done so far with your amazing team. Your team makes the difference (especially Cennet @ front desk and Joyce @ food&beverage) We will definitely recommend this beautiful hotel to all our friends. Can't wait till next time to come back!!Overall;WE❤️CITIEZHOTELAMSTERDAM Niler&Nellie Suer
title: We love Citiez Hotel Amsterdam

review: I arrived in Amz after driving for 3 days from Spain with my Cat in the car. Originally booked into another hotel only to arrive and be told that they are not pet friendly. Booked into the Ibis round the corner and they were fabulous from the offset. They couldn't do enough to help me, and they could see how tired and stressed I was from driving with the cat in the car. I was there for 4 nights and they really were so helpful and friendly. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. I can't thank them enough.
title: Brillilant Hotel, fabulous staff

review: As always Ibis is quite alright. Rooms are basic but suits everything you need after a long day of Amsterdam. Clean rooms, good airco, free safe, nice shower cabin and comfortable beds. Nice view from 8th floor. Location is perfect:- Bus stop in front of hotel. Line 22 brings you in 15 minutes to Amsterdam Central Station.- Train station Sloterdijk is a ten minute walk. From there you can take train to Amsterdam Central Station in 5 minutes;- Or you take a 30-minute walk through the park in front of the hotel (Westerpark) to the bus stop on the other side of the park. Luxury service of the hotel is the free use (in weekends) of the parking garage. Free parking space is quite unique in Amsterdam!
title: Perfect location and good hotel

review: Rooms are modern, spotlessly clean and bed was very comfy. Breakfast selection is adequate, with a cooked selection, yoghurts, bread and jams etc. Staff are really friendly. There is a mini shop with crisps, sweets, juices, nuts, sandwiches, smoothies plus vending machines with toiletries and snacks/drinks. Some guests must be blind to have missed this as a recent review stated no ability to get snacks. The hotel offers snacks at the bar also and this Ibis bar had great ambience which is quite unusual in this style of hotel. Overall excellent!
title: Just brilliant!

review: Great hotel, centrally located. Most tourists sites within 10 minutes walk. Good access to transport for anything further afield. Brilliant staff, can't do enough for you and a good breakfast. Not expensive for location.
title: Lovely Stay

review: Stayed here some 10 years ago so it was the obvious choice for our recent visit. Found things were better than ever, with a lovely quiet room to give us a good night's sleep and a fantastic buffet breakfast to feed the inner person.
title: Great central position for a couple of days' sightseeing.

review: Standard room is very simple,but good in size, 2 beds ( instead of double bed, as we ordered), view to next wall (((, either no curtain in shower. Very thin walls - you can hear all going on 2 floors down and 2 floors up... breakfast is ok. staff is friendly. LOCATION - THIS IS THE MAIN ADVANTAGE - DAM Square!!!
title: good located, friendly staff, very simple room

review: Just returned from a two night stay at the Rho Hotel. The location is excellent. Just off Dam Square and easy to get to from the Central Station. You can walk to all the attractions from here and it's close to the many restaurants Amsterdam has to offer. The staff were very helpful and breakfast was good too. Room was clean and quiet. Would definitely go back.
title: Highly recommend

review: Very good location in the center of Amsterdam just a few minutes walk from the central train station. Good quality for a 3star, our room was quite spacious, the personnel was very courteous and the buffet breakfast was very rich.
title: Good position

review: We stayed in a triple room in late July. The hotel is virtually on Dam Square and you can walk to most places. We walked - pulling luggage - from Central Station in 10 minutes. Entrance lobby is large and a bit dramatic. We were at side of hotel and had very little street noise. Room was a good size. Fan provided - not quite powerful enough for the room. Bathroom nice with range of toiletries. Reasonable breakfast with a few hot choices such as bacon and scrambled and boiled eggs plus the usual cold meats, cheeses, cereals etc. So good choice although fairly expensive (internet searches kept saying that Amsterdam was virtually full for our travel dates) at 189 euros a night booked directly on hotel website. Safe and fridge in room too!
title: Great location

review: Look up when you get near Dam Square - the Hotel name is up on the roof.Straight walk from Central Station - location is everything to me.Breakfast was first class.If you want a good place to sleep and a great breakfast - look no further.
title: Cheap central wonderful hotel

review: I have stayed at this hotel 3 times now over the space of 2 years. It's location is amazing, it's the cheapest hotel on dam square. The staff are helpful and polite, although when you call to reception they do take a while to deal with requests. The staff always keep a record of you so they appreciate repeat custom and it goes a long way to be greeted as a returning customer, something you don't expect them to do. They store your luggage and let you check in earlier than advertised when they can. It's always clean, basic but above satisfactory cleanliness.
title: Third stay, lovely and great price.

review: Nice friendly welcome on arrival, walked through nice air conditioned corridors to get to our room but on opening the door the room itself was boiling! This meant we had to sleep with the fan (provided) on and the windows open which wasn't idea. Small room and, as it was in the roof, sloped on one side which was a bit awkward. Not a lot of storage space. Good vending machine including cans of Heineken! Lovely breakfast. Good location just off Dam Square so easy to get to from the station. Would have been improved by having air con in the actual rooms.
title: Small room but adequate, good location

review: the hotel is just in front of the Centraal station, very central, receptionist very friendly, the room and bathroom are clean, but just a small bed for 1 person, this kind of room is more like an Ibis or Ibis Budget, but no like an Ibis Styles.
title: Room like a Ibis, not like Ibis Styles

review: Hi everyone I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, very sub standard to what I'm used to in Ireland and all over. Room is clean but basic, reception and food here is disaster. The only thing good is the location don't know how they got 3 stars and how it has 8 rating in Booking.com.Definitely wouldn't return and only because I had it paid for in advance I would leave, and wasn't cheap either.
title: 3 Day Trip

hotelLocation: Plantage Middenlaan 48, 1018 DH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel was in good location, walking distance to many eateries. Breakfast was good, but could vary the selections every couple days, perhaps. There were constructions next door, so it was a bit messy and noisy sometimes.
title: A cozy hotel

hotelLocation: Plantage Middenlaan 48, 1018 DH Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Location and reaching there: The hotel is situated opposite the Artis zoo and near the Amsterdam Business School. There are tram stops near the hotel, but I used the Connexxion airport shuttle (takes around 60 minutes and 28 euros for return trip). Hotel: It is essentially an old building (it would have been interesting to have an insight into its history- for e.g. the Hampshire Hotel-the Manor is a converted hospital). Accessibility: The hotel does have two elevators, but none for reaching the reception desk from the street (there are several steps and, as a small individual, I do tend to struggle with cases). My room was on the same level as the reception, but I had to negotiate another flight of steps. Room: Comfortable and exactly as in the photos. I am not necessarily a fan of dark decor, but it's better than the Manor's red theme! It overlooked a construction site, which also meant that I had to leave the blinds closed when I was in the room. The bed was twin (not double), but it was comfy. You do tend to hear noises- especially people talking on the corridor and noises from other bathrooms (I could hear someone using an electric razor).Amenities in the room: Tea and coffee facilities, an electric fan, heater under the window, and a safe (do note that the instructions in opening/closing it may be different from those in the US). There is free WiFi - but it is not particularly strong enough, for example, to make calls via WhatsApp. The room lacks a fridge, ironing facilities, and air conditioning. Bathroom: Very clean. I do not know if it was malfunctioning, but the exhaust was constantly on (even when the lights were switched off). The shower was also temperamental (fluctuating between hot and cold water), but this is something I would expect in an old building where the plumbing is likely to be old too.Breakfast: It is open until 10:30 on weekdays (and they do close it on time). The lady in charge was very friendly and welcoming. There is a good selection of food (cereals, salads, sausages/bacon, eggs, pastries) and hot drinks (and an excellent selection of teas). Check-in: This was fast and efficient, but when I tried to pay upfront for the room, the card terminal did not accept both my cards (my bank later confirmed that there was nothing wrong with my cards). Check-out: I finally paid for my rooms the day before (the card worked), but my request for the return shuttle went strangely unregistered. I realised this only after waiting 30 minutes for my shuttle (which never came) and the receptionist found a solution by calling a taxi and paying for the difference in fare. Although I am still poorer as I had paid for the return fare, I appreciate her quick thinking as it ensured I reached the airport on time.On the whole, I am giving the hotel a rating of 4, although there are some negative aspects. When I asked myself, "Would I stay here again?", I realised that I would- although, I may have to bring a lighter case so that I don't struggle with the steps!
title: Will stay here again- but, will bring a lighter suitcase!

hotelLocation: Roelof Hartstraat 1, 1071 VE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Spent one night in the College Hotel as part of a small business conference in May. The hotel is clean and is very smart in all the public areas and is what you would expect from a city hotel. Its In a good location for exploring Amsterdam with tram stops outside etc.The rooms were not ready for the group until quite late, which meant people coming in from flights couldn't check in or freshen up.What also was disappointing was that the rooms were quite stuffy, and the air con didn't work in a number of rooms and some people requested a move but there were no rooms available so they moved to another hotel.The room we had the event in also suffered from the lack of air con.We ate in the hotel and the food was very good. Staff were very helpfulAll in all, for a premium hotel, I don't expect these sort of issues thence the slightly negative review.
title: Smart appearance didn't live up to the expectation

hotelLocation: Roelof Hartstraat 1, 1071 VE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Four of us, two rooms , were welcomed by a delightful receptionist who warmly greeted us & then sorted out our tours, she was wonderful ! BUT that is where it ended ! There is no air conditioning, the rooms were incredibly hot & it was not mentioned. Each room has a portable unit that has a long hose pumping out very hot air through the door but of course you have to leave your day open to use it ! The first night we went to the garden for a drink, there was four staff who all looked at us but no one came over. Eventually we left & went to a lovely pub for a drink for a third of the price. It is a very expensive hotel for one in such disrepair. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone ! This is my first ever negative review !!!
title: Extremely disappointing !

hotelLocation: Roelof Hartstraat 1, 1071 VE Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: we just spend 4 days at the College Hotel in Amsterdam and were shocked by the poor quality of the building.we were not notified at check in that all aircos on the first floor have been broken since June 9th and as per the repair crew wont be fixed for at least another 3 weeks (end July 17) in the middle of the hot summer. No management is present in this education hotel and thus all staff is left on their own. No suitable solution was available and we left in a mess. many small details were broken (we stayed in a junior suite) like light buttons missing, power plugs broken etc.for stays with kids in the summer this hotel is totally unsuitable due to the state of the rooms
title: Warning all airco's on the first floor have been broken for more than a month

hotelLocation: Oude Haagseweg 20, 1066 BW Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Not a good start, the check in process took 25mins, one person doing all the stuff at the reception desk. Something was messed up with the previous customer in the line and it delayed our checkin even more.The room and bathroom were clean, TV had a problem and had to call the reception thrice for the house man. Next day morning the housekeeping guy knocked our door at 6am asking if he needs to clean the room, i dont understand the logic here, we asked him to come after we check out at 12pm, but he still knocked twice after this and we had to tell him the same thing twice.Overall, not a pleasant stay
title: Good for a flight layover

hotelLocation: Oude Haagseweg 20, 1066 BW Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This place is far enough from the airport that you are not annoyed by airplane noises all night long, and in an area with walking and biking paths. The food is much better than typical hotel restaurant faire! And the price is right!
title: Great Value

hotelLocation: Oude Haagseweg 20, 1066 BW Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: With the 3 days transit pass and hotel transfer to the airport we could travel to and from the attractions easily. The hotel grounds was park like. It had nice paths and even a duck pond. There was also a large lake side park across the road.
title: headquarters for 3 days visit to Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Oude Haagseweg 20, 1066 BW Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel room was very clean, we had three single beds so it was a bit cramped, that was no problem since we only came back to sleep. Did not hear any airplanes. The only issue is the hotel did not have air conditioner in the rooms or lobby. It was quite hot. The small window in the room did not let in enough air. The breakfast was very good with a lot of variety, there was air in the breakfast area.
title: A bit warm

hotelLocation: Oude Haagseweg 20, 1066 BW Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Whilst the hotel facilities were acceptable standard in general, on the day of checking out we discovered 2 unauthorised charges on our card amounting to EUR100 +. Despite assurances from the reception staff that money would be refunded the same day 4 days later we are still waiting for a refund, even though we also spoke to Accor, who also assured us of a refund.Other issue- supposed free shuttle was refused from the airport as apparently fully booked and had to pay 10 Euros to get to the hotel, which is in a middle of nowhere, next to a petrol station. You have to cross a busy main road to get to the hotel with no pedestrian crossing - beware if travelling at night and via public transport.
title: Beware of handing over your credit card

review: Great venue. Near centre. Booking.com messed our reservation up by cancelling and only informed us the day before. Hotel sorted everything for us. Staff excellent and room clean and comfortable.2nd time we've stayed here and always very good.
title: Excellent and helpful.

review: This hotel is a great option for a short stay in Amsterdam. We were there 2 nights and were impressed by price, hotel staff and easy acres to Central Amsterdam either by short walk to #1 tram or complimentary airport shuttle for Schiopol train. Very clean and well priced.
title: Good stay

review: All very good. Nice breakfast in the morning (a little pricey but good selection and quality food). quiet, great staff who want to serve and ensure my satisfaction. Love the ease getting to and from the airport and close to tram line for trips into Amsterdam.
title: awesome stay at Park Plaza Amsterdam

review: The hotel has excellent facilities and links to the airport to make it the ideal place for those on a layover flight or short stay. Some of the features are a little over-advertised via the website but this can be overlooked when considering the great staff and cleanliness of the rooms. I would not recommend this hotel for families or couples who are looking to see Amsterdam city, pay the extra price for somewhere in the city centre.
title: Great for a one or two night stay.

review: My sister and I just got back home from 6 days in Amsterdam, and we couldn't have been happier with our stay at HE. The hotel staff were really helpful and friendly; the rooms have really comfortable beds, good bathrooms, and air con; and the hotel is in a superb location (near the center, with three supermarkets in walking distance).
title: Would recommend 100%!

review: We spent a couple of days at this lovely hotel in a beautiful area of Amsterdam. The area is just outside the busiest part the centre of Amsterdam which is full of wonderful restaurants and bars. It's only a few minutes walk from the main areas and was very quiet during the night, which was great for being so close to all the nightlife. Staff were very pleasant and friendly.
title: Weekend break

review: This is a great hotel for both business and holiday makers. Though they claim that this is an airport hotel, it is not really close to the airport and the shuttle service can take up to 15 minutes each way to and from the airport. The airport is well connected to the city center by train and the train ride into the city center is only 15 mins, so all in all it is possible to get to the center of the city from the hotel within 40 -45 mins.The rooms are very comfortable with all amenities that you will expect from a good hotel. The gym is small but well equipped and while I was there there were hardly any gym users so it is was quiet and comfortable. This hotel does not have a swimming pool and this was a downside for me.Restaurants in the hotel are again a bit small but the food is reasonable priced and quite tasty. So if you decide the stay in, eating at the restaurant is a good option.The highlight for me were the surroundings of this hotel which make for great walks each morning and evening. Be sure to swing left and you can reach the dyke in less than 10 mins making for a great walk along the dyke with lots of birds in the water. There is good restaurant (Bij Quins) which is housed in a old pumping station along the dyke. The food is great but you will need to reserve seating for dinner.There are no shops near the hotel, so if you need anything you need to head to the airport by the shuttle.
title: Reasonably priced hotel, though a little far from the city

review: We stayed for 5 nights and really enjoyed the stay. The location was great ,5 minutes walk from Leightsplain and Vondel park.The service was very friendly and helpful.The breakfast was very good and there is free coffee in the lobby at all times. The rooms are a bit small but clean and comfortable.Will come again.
title: Really nice hotel!

review: The Hotel is excellent and the stuff is really good and patient. They helped us with all our needs and gave us a great room. We especially would like to mention Teije from the breakfast room, whom kindly helped us to plan a fun trip, with his excellent recommendations. Thank you for a great time in Amsterdam!
title: Excellent Hotel and stuff

review: Me and my girlfriend have stayed for the weekend at Caransa Hotel.The hotel have great location, walking distance to every main square and a tram station right outside of the hotel.The stuff was super nice, everyone from reception to to room service guys, especially Teije and Shirin who helped us in everything little thing that we needed.Recommend warmly to stay here!
title: Excellent hotel!

review: Clean, modern and tidy hotel in a good location with bars next door if you wanted to eat and drink. A good sized double room. Only a 15 min walk from the must see red light district. When I was there the main lift was out of order so had to use the service lift, which didn't bother me. Friendly staff.
title: Clean, good location

review: We came to Amsterdam to explore the city and enjoy an authentic experience, and that we did. The hotel was within walking distance to all the sites we wanted to see and the room was spacious with modern decor and a lovely large bathroom. Staff were always on hand to help with anything we needed and the cleaners were amazing ensuring it was spotless everyday.
title: Great Hotel

review: The nh Caransa is a very centrally located hotel with excellent transport links to get pretty much anywhere in Amsterdam. The rooms were a good size and very clean. Being on Rembrandtplein there are a large selection of bars and restaurants very close by. A short walk when exploring the city. Would definitely stay again
title: Excellent central location

review: Teije was very helpful at breakfastThe staff and facilities were in general very good. The location of the hotel is unbeatable and is in the middle of the busy Rembrandt square. The staff was more than helpful in every way.
title: Good service

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 23, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: A glance at the map will tell you that this hotel is in an excellent location right by the main transport hub of Amsterdam. The railway theme is different and interesting without being some kind of railway theme park. The service is excellent and friendly. My room was clean and comfortable. The only thing that spoilt it a little was the window being very high up, but this is an old Amsterdam building so it wasn't a surprise. The breakfast was very good. Check in and out was quick and simple.I shall certainly stay again.
title: Right on Track

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 23, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: What a little gem! Right across from central station, central for everything, lots of bars and restaurants nearby. Hotel itself was lovely, we had the Dutch suite which is located on the ground floor and has its own little courtyard with a couple of chairs and a table, there is no air conditioning but a very good fan which we made good use of. There's kettle tea coffee etc and a fridge. Staff were great and very helpful if needed. Breakfast was ok, boiled eggs, cereal, bread, cold meat and cheese, also a toaster, jams honey etc. All in all a very enjoyable stay, will definitely return
title: Anniversary

review: Lovely rooms. Unusal as the shower is glass and in the middle of the room! Lovely bar with good selection of gins . Food very good too. Shuttle bus to station or 10 minute walk. From there you can get into the centre. Taxi is about €60 each way to town. €20 for the shuttle to the airport.
title: Great Hotel

review: Really did not enjoy my stay at this hotel. The first hiccup was seeing £150 leave my account 4 days before our check-in (even though I was still inside my cancellation terms and could cancel up to 24hrs before), I had no communication from the hotel about the charge and so rang them up to confirm what this was, placed on hold for 30 minutes. I had to ring up another 2 times. The hotel then confirmed with me that this was a authorisation charge and no money would leave my account, no problem, I put this experience down to me just missing something in the small print and the hotel being busy that day. Our check-in experience was really REALLY poor. Not told anything about the hotel, about the shuttle service, when check out was, how to use the phone, if we wanted breakfast, did not acknowledge our anniversary I emailed ahead about, nothing about the city and how to get there. Literally no information was given to us. She handed us our key and said here you go. I wonder if it was her first day on the job? No personality at all. The location of this hotel is not great, it's in the middle of nowhere and I had massively underestimated how expensive Uber is out here. It cost us about €30 to get into the city with Uber each way each time. It soon became very expensive. We did not use the shuttle as we expected it would take a long time, that and no information was given to us about it.I question the hygiene in this hotel too. The maid did a really poor job of our room, not changing towels, making the bed with the TV remote still inside it. She would give us new bottles of water and leave the empty bottles from the day before on the side. Rubbish that was left on the floor wasn't moved at all during our stay. The toilet floor wasn't moped once. When we did get up to the Sky Bar we had lovely views however noticed that this hotel is actually situated right next to a prison! Lovely. Oh and there is also no lock on the bedroom doors to secure your room that bit extra when you go to sleep at night. We ate in the lounge one lunchtime, my partner ordered a €14 Turkey club sandwich, the sandwich arrived with turkey out of the packet. Food was very average. And service SO bad. I give this hotel 2*'s as the overall look of the hotel is very contemporary, which I like. However location and service were big factors for me that let this place down. Had I of not paid in full when I arrived I would've checked out early. Some staff members were better than others, and this hotel does have real potential, but ultimately I feel this hotel had a "don't care" attitude, I will not be returning.
title: Poor

review: A pretty good hotel with kind employees.The prices are pretty reasonable and the room is beautiful and well furnished.The breakfast is various and delicious.It's highly recommended weather the trip was for leisure or business.The only disadvantage is that the hotel is about half an hour from the center
title: One of the best

review: The hotel is situated a short rail ride from the airport and a short walk to the tram stop into Amsterdam centre. It is very convenient. Around the hotel is a business area, very leafy, in the summertime but not much else around. Maybe a 15 minute walk past RAI is a nice residential area with lots of dining options. The hotel is functional but lacks atmosphere. It is an old building. My room had been recently modernised but not to the usual Novotel standard. It is clean with a small bathroom.I didn't feel any warmth from this hotel and didn't use the restaurant or bar. The Priority Desk, as in most Accor properties, wasn't staffed. One staff member on duty and no acknowledgement that I was waiting .My first impression wasn't a good one.For me, as a frequent traveller and a frequent guest at Novotel, this wasn't up to standard.
title: Functional and convenient

review: I booked a double room with a sofa bed to accomodate my family of three persons. When I checked in, i was told i have to make up the sofa bed myself because they were having a busy day as their reservation system was down. they assured me an extra set of towels were placed in the closet. When I went to my room, i made up the bed as told, but i found no quilt, and no extra set of towels. I called the reception and was shortly given a very hard, tired looking blue blanket. They said the blanket was a standard for the sofa bed. I insisted to have a proper quilt and got it five minutes later. And of course i needed to ask for towels. This was the service i received from this four star hotel.The room’s carpet was tired, the wall mounted light was flashing. there was a bad smell when first entering the room. these were the facilities provided by this four star hotel. By the way, wifi is only free for 24hours.
title: is it really a 4 star hotel??

review: The hotel though a bit far from teh city centre is very well connected by tram which starts from very near to the hotel. Its a 2 min walk and the staff is very helpful to guide you for the same.If you have less luggage, then getting to and fro from teh airport is also cheap and just a direct train with 2 stops.The rooms are small as per novotel standards and bit uncomfortable.The staff was very helpful and gave us one room to freshen up as we reached pretty early in teh morning. This was of great help as we could go out sight seeing else we would have been waiting till 1 pm after a 10 hour flight.Overall pretty nice stay
title: Good hotel at a noce location

review: Convenient hotel for access to the Rai. A nice 5-minute stroll to the expo centre or the train station.The hotel has a business hotel vibe to it, clean, professional, not too fussy. The room was small by International standards, what you would typically find in London. Clean and comfortable bedroom and bathroom with all the usual amenities, including an iron and ironing board. The lobby area was large, which was useful as I arrived with a crowd of other people. I never managed to eat at the restaurant but it looked nice, with modern décor and a large selection on the menu.
title: Convenient for the Rai

review: We recently stayed at the Novotel Amsterdam city. The carpet in both our rooms were threadbare and badly stained. We had to climb into the bathtub to use the shower and when you have 80 year old parents with you this can be both very difficult and very dangerous There is no fresh milk in the rooms only whitener. There are no coffee mugs in the room only paper cups. You receive only one bottle of water for two people. The most disappointing part was we were charged 70€ per night per room as a safety deposit when there is no mini bar or snacks in the room to purchase in the first place We have stayed in other Novotel motels around the globe and we have never encountered these issues. We will definitely not recommend this hotel
title: Lisa. Australia

review: Stayed here at the start of July, when we arrived( after 3pm) we payed and asked for a receipt but we were told we would recieve the receipt as we checked out at the end of the week. We were then told our room wasn't ready and we couldn't check in until 5pm, when it states on the website that we should be able to check in from 3pm onwards. When we checked out they tried to charge us again and we had to show that they had taken the money on our banking app. Otherwise the stay was pleasant and the hotel is in a good location.
title: Late check in

review: Dried toothpaste in the sink. Previous occupant or cleaners hair by the sink. A dirty bath. Not acceptable. Worn out carpet and peeling paint is fine but you have got to keep it clean. V disappointing. Breakfast was good and staff at reception friendly but sadly that doesn't make up for basics.
title: Old is fine but poor cleanliness is inexcusable

review: When I got to the hotel, I was amazed by the beautiful, modern and clean smell of the lobby. That image was destroyed when I got into the room. The carpet was FILTHY, full of stains and the humidity smell was awful. The AC didn't work, which made the humidity worst. I was changed twice to different rooms, but the problems were the same. At midnight one of the front desk guys came and advised me they didn't have any AC. I finally quit, and tried to enjoy the stay. Peter from the front desk was very helpful and nice to us.He even gave us good recommendations to enjoy the city, which we loved despite the hotel rooms. Breakfast is varied and good, restaurant food is delicious, expensive though.
title: Beautiful Lobby, Horrible Rooms

review: Novotel is very close to Tram station which is 10 minutes away from city center .They offered very good service and a big and good variety at breakfast and the staff are very friendly and helpful .I recommend this hotel for tourists who would like to visit this lovely city of amesterdam and enjoy its beautiful nature and weather and art
title: Very good location and service

review: Has all the amenities in the room including English language TV. Not much happening in the area but easy transport to the centre via tram, Metro or train. The lifts were a bit flaky. Friendly helpful staff
title: Big, modern, comfortable room

review: Lovely hotel but didn't get the low floor room I requested and when checking in, they couldn't do it for ages and then they forgot about us. Food and drink is expensive, 15€ for 2 drinks. Breakfast is really good but I go back to my treatment as this was really bad. On checkout I was given the managers business card, so I emailed him once back home, no reply a week later
title: Visiting a Friend

review: I stayed with a friend for two nights. At check-in I had to leave a £50 deposit on my credit card and was promised this would be returned upon checkout. This hasn't happened and the security deposit is still showing on my account some seven days later! I have tried calling the hotel without success and to be honest I shouldn't be having to call them at my expense in the first place. The other issue was the cleanliness was poor. The carpet was dirty as was the bathroom. The last issue was the fact on our last day one of the clean towels left in the bathroom had a brown stain.Overall this hotel is not recommended unless there is nowhere else to stay.
title: Not the best!

review: We stayed 2 nights. Very helpfull staff. Amacing breakfast with so many options. The hotel is right be the Tram, so it is easy to get to the City center. We will defenetly come back - also for the breakfast !!!
title: Super stay and breakfast

review: Efficient check in. Staff at reception extremely helpful and obliging. Beautiful rooms being clean, spacious and with all working amenities. Breakfast extensive. Tram to city 100 metres from hotel with easy 20 minute ride to City Centre. Would recommend this hotel.
title: Functional

review: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was OK. Rail station in easy reach and always taxis on hand. Staff were generally pleasant and helpful. My only real issue is that I was there for work and my room did not have a desk to work at. I was told this was true of all the 'renovated' rooms. So I had to balance my lap top on my lap to work. Not good!
title: Adequate - if large - hotel.

review: Wonderful breakfast, amazing staff, very helpful with recomending restaurants and placec to visit. The only downside is that the rooms was a little small when staying 3 persons in one room. The hotel was close to the tram and metero station taking you directly to central station in centrum.
title: Had a great experience!

review: I've stayed at this hotel before, but last time it didn't stick out and I hardly remember my stay. This time however, it truly amazed me. The rooms are very comfortable with soft carpets, enough electricity outlets, a large safe which will fit your laptop, and a giant (GIANT) flat screen TV! What surprised me however, was their call for reusing the towels and promising to plant a tree for every 5 towels reused. Also if you put a notice on your door that your room doesn't need to be cleaned, you receive a bar voucher of 5 euro. Win-win I would say. For dinner there are plenty of nice places in a 2 km range, so if the weather is good and you fancy a walk, go in the direction of "Scheldestraat". Breakfast blew my socks off. I felt like I was in a 5-star all inclusive! There's an omelet service, a incredible wide choice of meats and cheeses, yoghurts and cereals. The omelet was better than I've ever had, with exactly the right amount of cheese (and salt). The jam is served in eatable cups! Orange juice is freshly pressed and, very important to me, coffee cups are real mugs, so that you can get a decent cup in one go! The restaurant is devised in compartments and therefore does not feel as big as it is. And, a plus, staff is no-nonsense friendly! Great job Novotel, I'll be back!
title: Really great hotel, well connected by public transport

review: stayed in renovated room as booked in this hotel for 5 nights.room was cleaned every day but bottle water was not replaced - they sold it at lobby for 5eur each.location was ok. in the middle between airport and town where either metro, tram, train will take you there.
title: 5 nights, was ok

review: BEWARE of this hotel! They have at least one THIEF at the main desk – and they’re LYING to cover it up. Don't pay in cash -- or, if you do, be sure to get a written receipt!!!!!At check-in June 2nd we gave a 50-euro cash hold deposit that they demanded. The check-out gal at 11:15am on June 3rd refused to give us our 50-euro cash refund -- said it would be credited to our Visa card. That didn't happen! It's now over 5 weeks later!!NOW they deny we ever gave them a 50-euro deposit. In essence they're claiming they let us stay without a temporary hold deposit of 50 euros!!!! Obviously, one or both of the clerks pocketed our 50 euros.We should have used our Visa card instead of cash. We should have DEMANDED a receipt! Actually, maybe WE SHOULD HAVE NEVER STAYED AT NH AMSTERDAM!! So, don't trust NH Amsterdam!! We'll certainly NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!!!!!!!
title: BEWARE!!! Get receipt or they'll pocket your $!!

review: The location is perfect, breakfast buffet is very good.The hotel could do with some upgrades.WIFI was not working in the room, very unresponsive service.In my view this hotel is overpriced and should pay more attention to their guests
title: NH city hotel

review: Well located hotel, close to the museums area and numerous restaurants, bars and shops are just a short walk away. Friendly, helpful staff and the rooms were comfortable and clean. You'd probably need to take some form of transport to get there if arriving by train but the tram stops are nearby.
title: Great location

review: Good location. Very busy hotel. Took ages to check in. Then, first two rooms I was given had air-con panels missing - I am not sure if they are in the middle of renovations but looked careless. Then third room was bigger and had air-con cover. General housekeeping needs improving, though. It LOOKED clean at first glance, but there were strands of hair on chair, rubbish on the floor and half drunk drink bottle in the fridge. I ended up cleaning cups and kettle (started with dusty kettle then found a dirty cup and...). Maybe I was unlucky. Staffs were courteous. When I asked for an (hotel's) email address for a feedback I was directed to TripAdvisor.
title: First impressions

review: Great location. Note that as of July 2017, there was road construction in front of the hotel so there's no curbappeal there. There was no staff at check-in (around 3pm) and we've had to call them out from behind the walls several times till someone reappeared. Front desk staff could certainly do a bit of polishing up - little things like disheveled hair, sullen looks and no warmth at all. Next door Marriott is miles away with their smiling attentive front desk staff.Breakfast was ok. Personally love their American style crispy bacon rather than soggy pink British bacon. The rooms could do a bit of touch up but it didn't affect my stay anyway so I can put up with it. Bottom line: it's a decent, clean place to stay just don't expect great service at front desk.
title: Bottom line: decent place to stay

review: good location, close to several museums (but far from the train station) friendly staff, big rooms but not used to the best. A bit of moisture in the bathroom, so the tiles were not spotless clean. Excellent breakfast. Good room service.
title: good location

review: It's my first trip to Amsterdam and I have my family with me too.
