First of all, the room was very small for family but thank God I had the chance to upgrade to a bigger room.Hotel location and hotel entrance are great.Rooms style is very nice.My thanks for everybody help me and specially Mr. Stefan MOD how where so helpful and so friendly.If you need any help Mr. Stefan will help you with his big smile.Mohammad Abbas
title: Traveling with Family

review: Great hotel perfect location. Had disappointing experience with bar staff wanting to leave early and rushing our meals and not making what we ordered. after a long day of travelling and work this was definitely not needed. Simon introduced himself the following evening and a chance to redeem themselves with food and drinks and a surprise bottle of wine in my room. Simon was a great and will be back to this hotel only because of Simon. I travel to Amsterdam 8 times a year and will be checking in again on Monday.
title: Poor bar and food service rectified by a very friendly manager

review: NH really needs to change the names of their hotels in Amsterdam. We started at this one, the NH Amsterdam Centre, but after seeing how beat up the rooms were, we moved to the NH Amsterdam City Centre. Do not make the same mistake we did. There is no comparison of the hotels as the Centre is a really old hotel that needs a good deal of renovation.
title: Happiness is Just One Word Away

review: This was our first visit to Amsterdam and the NH was our best pick and we are very pleased that we made the pick. We arrived late due to a very late flight - staff went out their way to ensure that we got dinner. As it was our first stay in this chain of hotels we received a room upgrade - we enjoyed it. From our perspective, with the activities we had planned the hotel was in an ideal position. Close a Hop-on-Hop-off pick points for both the bus and the canal boat. The Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh Museum and others were within easy walking distance; as was the Heineken Experience. We walked from the Central Railway Square through Dam Square and back to Vondel Park and the hotel with ease - paying close attention to hundreds of cyclists who have no regard for anyone. The road construction in front of the hotel was a bit of a pain but we got round it. There are numerous tourist restaurants close by. One advantage we did not access was the Airport Bus which had a stop nearby we could have saved ourselves 40 Euro.
title: Ideal Position

review: The front desk personnel are excellent. I would especially like to compliment Sara, who has gone out of her way on many occasions to help me with bookings, reservations, etc..........and remembers my name every time!! So unusual in this day and age, and so appreciated! Thank you, Sara!!
title: Exceptional service!

review: Hotel is centrally located without being too far from the hub of the city. Literally have to walk out of hotel, cross the road, walk across a tiny bridge and you are in the shopping, café, restaurant precinct. Spectacular park nearby. As is a supermarket. No more than a 3 – 5 minute walk.Room was very large but fairly basic. Bed was 2 big singles pushed together. Unfortunately had to get the bedding changed as the beds were made up with single linens and quilts. Wooden floor so think it could be cold in winter. Large lounge and a single lounge chair. Tea and coffee making facilities along with a fridge. Bathroom was adequate. No bath. Just a shower.Huge buffet breakfast. Would have to say this hotel does one of the best buffets I've ever had. You name it, they had it, including a whole gluten free section. Catered for many nationalities - lots of Asian items, so many different cold meats, more cheeses than I could count - and so much more. Divine pastries. Not just 2 or 3 different plates but a whole table full of varying types.Near the foyer is a bar and there are 2 sitting areas where you can sit and relax or eat and drink. There is a bar menu and a main menu. Ate there twice. First was a club sandwich and a glass of bubbles. Very nice. Second time ordered from the main menu - a glass of bubbles along with Bittergarnituur warm - bitterballen, kaasstengels, krokante gamba and viammetjes. Sounds very exotic. Reality - cheese sticks, crispy prawns, spicy dumplings, deep fried meatballs all with a Dutch twist. Very yummy but not cheap.During our stay, partner received a lovely birthday surprise – a birthday card, balloons and a small package of goodies. How nice.On arrival, amazingly the room was ready at 8.30 a.m. On departure presented with 2 bags of gifts on checkout - bottles of juice and water as well as 2 different snack bars. That's a first. Pity the bottles couldn't be taken through security. But the snack bars will come in handy. Thank you. Much appreciated.Wholeheartedly recommend this hotel.
title: Nice NH

hotelLocation: Van Leijenberghlaan 221, 1082 GG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The king sized bed is really comfortable. The room is big and clean. After took long flight, I found it's super comfort to stay here and relax at the first night. The location is really good, not far from the airport and you find there as soon as you arrived Kastelstraat station.
title: impressive!

hotelLocation: Van Leijenberghlaan 221, 1082 GG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We liked the spacious and modernly decorated room and the small terrace in front of the hotel. I very much appreciated the fact that in the mini-bar in the room we also found gluten-free products. The subway is a 10-minute walk and in 20-25 minutes you reach the central station.
title: Excellent

hotelLocation: Van Leijenberghlaan 221, 1082 GG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Check in was very quick, and even if we arrive in the morning the room was ready. Room was nice and clean. Staff was very helpful. We had breakfast at the hotel which was lovely, mixed selection of breads, cereal, croissants, coffees, juices and hot and cold food including bacon and sausage.It is relative very easy to reach city center with public transportation
title: Pleasant

hotelLocation: Van Leijenberghlaan 221, 1082 GG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is located well outside the city center of Amsterdam so that was a big draw back. Additionally, the staff was incredibly unhelpful. We accidentally booked this location and contacted the hotel immediately after booking to indicate our booking was a mistake. They refused to issue us a refund or even allow us to transfer to one of the other NH hotels closer to the city center (we offered to pay the difference in cost - we just really didn't want to stay out there). Once we arrived and got in to our room, there were peanut shells all over the floor and dark hairs on the chair and floor - so the room had been poorly cleaned. Again, the hotel staff at this point refused to help us by issuing a refund or allowing us to switch locations. Pretty awful experience. The only good thing was the bike rental which we could have done at almost any hotel in Amsterdam.
title: Bad location and terrible service.

hotelLocation: Van Leijenberghlaan 221, 1082 GG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Really my room was not clean and the towels was dirty as well. The tables and chairs as dirty as well, I had to do my own cleaning before to put any food or my personal things. I can say the staff was very friendly and did the best that they could do.
title: High price

review: I was in the hotel as a part of Europamundo tour and this is one of the best hotels they use. I had dinner at the restaurant and the food was incredible and very affordable.The room is comfortable and clean. The biggest disadvantage is tha It's far from the city and there is no transport to downtown.
title: Nice hotel. Excellent restaurant.

review: Well located hotel,very friendly and helpful staff,clean rooms but could do with slick of paint and a new carpet.the food in the restaurant was nice.we did not hear any noise from outside.it was easy to find from central station just a tram ride away.would definitely stay there again
title: Short break

review: The location was fantastic.. an easy 15 min walk to Anne Franks house. There was a hop on hop off canal stop right outside the hotel. Tons of coffee and food shops. Beautiful room overlooking the canal with excellent amenities. I would definitely book here again .
title: Excellent location

review: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of June. The hotel is right by the Prinsengracht Canal. It is about a 20 minute or so walk from the Centraal Station past shops, bars and restaurants or you can easily catch the tram to and from Centraal Station (numbers 1, 2 and 5) as the tram stop is right outside the Hotel.We had a nice big room which overlooked the canal. Didn't use any of the other hotel facilities although the bar/restaurant area did look quite nice.The hotel is in a good position for exploring Amsterdam and there is a nice square called Leidesplein with restaurants and bars just round the corner from the hotel.Reception staff were always friendly and helpful.Would definitely stay here again.
title: Good Hotel in Good Location

review: We stayed for three nights, from check in to check out nothing to objet, we were greeted by a person named gustavo, the room is in excellent condition, spacious and very equipped plus a very comfortable and large bed.The location is preferential, to fifty meters is the tram stop, the area is one of the highest level of amsterdam.All close, park, central zone, area of ​​museums, supermarkets.Breakfast very complete and varied, and the place is set to enjoy both at the time of breakfast and to read a book, use the imac available. 100% remomendable.
title: Unique experience...

review: We stayed here in July, in the room no, 9. The whole quarter is quiet and noble, full of beautiful villas and gardens. Amsterdam itself is like a botanical garden in summer and also the backyard of the hotel. We hade a view to the garden with a huge magnolia trea, which was amazing. The reception people were very nice and helpful, you can rent a bike here (for 14 euro or so). Breakfast definitely worth ordering, great choice of fresh sliced fruits, lovely croissants, crispy bread and many many more. It is very nice that you can rest in the cozy reception after you return tired from the centre, charge yourself with a cup of tea or coffee (free of charge) and than move off to explore more of the city. The only think I would change - there is no hair shampoo in the bathroom (and I definitly do not wish to wash my hair with the liquid soap) and also the hairdryer dries your hair out. It's noting dramatic, but if you have any "hair issues", take your own stuff. The location is great, near the galleries and just besides the Vondelpark. We loved our stay and definitely will come back!
title: Tranquil haven in the busy city

review: Where to start? It was my first time in Amsterdam and my partners' 2nd so I had no idea what to expect but from the airport to the hotel was a pretty seamless experience.Got an express train from the airport to Amsterdam Centraal which took about 10-15 mins then a metro three stops to Weesperplein, which was another 5-10 mins then a short walk to the hotel - another 5 mins and we're there.Warmly greeted by the lady at the front desk and swiftly checked in, our room was only a standard King size room but it was pretty spacious with lots of closet space. Bathroom with a rainforest shower and a also a normal shower head with different pressures, lovely smelling citrus amenities.We were so tired the first night that we decided to just order room service and as it was not too pricey it was the best decision we made on the holiday as we hadn't the most delicious burger (order it medium-rare and you'll see what I mean) and really really good chips. Also try the sticky rice dessert with mango and coconut cream as it's delectable. Cocktails also very good and strong- I had the Pineapple. Worth mentioning also is that room service comes on the normal table but within the table there's a hot box to keep your food hot if you want to eat it later. Brilliant, so brilliant in fact that we ordered steak frites the next night too. The guy on room service is the best, didn't get his name unfortunately as he really deserves a mention but wonderful polite guy with the best attitude.Now as you know the hotel is a bit of a distance from the city centre which was exactly what we wanted as it was quiet and we liked the walk. In fact not once did we take public transport apart from back to the airport nor did we rent a bike. We walked to the Heineken brewery which took us about a 25 mins and then approx 35 mins to Van Gogh museum, Anne Frank house was also about half an hour all quite easy to walk and navigate as the roads are flat. I would say though to pack a pair of very comfy shoes to do so as there is a lot of stopping and starting due to cyclists so this prolongs your journey a tad.Breakfast is from half 6 to half 10 weekdays not sure about weekends as we were there during the week and we could pick from either the buffet or a la carte as per our booking, the buffet was the normal stuff which tbh I wasn't that impressed with as I'd usually be able to at least pick something up but nothing really took my fancy. So off the a la carte menu I ordered the smoked salmon, avocado on toast and then for the last few days just ordered poached eggs with smoked salmon and toast all very tasty. I would say definitely order the hot chocolate. My partner had the waffle each day as it was very light and fluffy.Worth mentioning is that there is a 24 hr gym and sauna- all brand new state of the art equipment in the gym and mostly empty.Just to touch on the free wifi, this was mainly unstable if you want to load anything other than a webpage during most hours. Late at night became faster as people went to bed but don't be relying on this for anything strenuous.So to sum this all up, we had a delight of a time at this hotel where we were treated to the best of service throughout our stay and the most tasty food. We loved it and will definitely continue staying with Hyatt going forward.P.s there is a very handy supermarket opposite the hotel- what more could you ask?
title: Hyatt at it's best

review: This hotel was opened in April 2017. It is a very nice hotel, close to the tram and across from a supermarket. It's about a 20 minute walk to town. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are spotless. I would visit Amsterdam again and I would definitely stay at this hotel. The room had a canal view and it was very comfortable. Great customer service.
title: New wonderful hotel

review: Perfectly located near old city center. Check-in was fast, easy and friendly. Room midsize, with a large bathroom and a wonderful rain shower. Breakfast on sunday was a mess : we waited more than 30 minutes for a coffee and an omelette, which was dry as wall paper. When coming back to the room after about 8 hours, the waste bin was still full. This is defenitely no the Hyatt style, more over if you pay more than 300 euros for a room per night.My complaint was heard, but not even a word of apologies. Going back there ? I don't think so.
title: Could be excellent but some details are missing

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We came here for New Years and it was amazing. My fiance wanted to propose to me and they made everything so beautiful and perfect. We had the best room and service was also brilliant. Very close to the city centre, it is a bus ride away. Very clean hotel and friendly service too.
title: Such a great hotel!

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed here in March 2017 when I visited Amsterdam for the PT expo. It is close to the exhibition venue and has a shuttle taxi every morning to the closest metro station. The rooms are decent and the breakfast is chargeable and quite decent. Staying here is ideal if you prefer to be close to the venue though it is not walking distance from RAI exhibition venue.
title: Decent Business Hotel

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Mercure hotel is near Overamstel metro station in Amsterdam, Holland. Fairly Close to metro station, and if you have no or light luggage, then it is comfortable to walk to (about 800m). Decent sized clean rooms. Upper floors have wonderful views. Have spa (steam and sauna) for guest use. We had a triple sharing room, and the room was of a fair size, so did not feel too cramped.
title: Good location / clean rooms

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Clean and modern hotel with very easy public transport access. Rooms are good sizes with a safe and mini fridge. Showers only, no bath which was abit of a downside, especially after long days of walking. Big comfy beds though! Staff all speak fluent English, very helpful and friendly.Breakfast is €16 euro, which is slightly over priced, however no other places to eat locally.Don't fall into the trap of getting a taxi from the airport (approx 45-50 euro). We got the train to Amsterdam zuid straight from the airport, then the metro to overamstel. Metro was €12.50 for two days unlimited usage and train was €3.50 for a single travel. Very easy and simple, hotel was approx 5mins from station.Only downside is that it's a isolated hotel with no nearby shops or restaurants. Hotel and hotel shop are very expensive
title: City break

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It is a bit further from the city but this is reflected in the price. It was a good, clean 4* and the beds were perfect. It is easy enough to get to from town; the metro (no51) and a little walk. As it's such a tall building it's easy to spot. The room was spacious but to be honest we spent very little time at the hotel as we were too busy enjoying this amazing city.
title: Space

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Came back from a weekend stay in Amsterdam in a standard double room. The hotel is easy to get to from the airport via train and metro and easy to get into central Amsterdam via metro system. We purchased at the airport a 3 day GVB card for 26 euros each that allowed unlimited travel on the trains, trams, metro and buses. The hotel is also only a few stops by metro from Ajax stadium so would be perfect to stay in if in Holland to watch a match. The staff on check in were polite and a map was provided of the city which myself and hubby found very useful. The bar area is lovely. We didn't eat in the hotel.The room was plenty big enough, large comfy bed, fridge,tv, hairdryer etc. It was pretty quiet. We were on level 5 of the tower block. We would definitely stay here again if we visit Amsterdam.
title: Nice hotel,easily accessible

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed in the Mecure Hotel Amsterdam City as a couple July 2017 for 3 nights. I have no negative things to say about this hotel, it's modern, clean and stylish. Our room had a beautiful view over looking the canal and we had the perfect nights sleep in a cosy king sized bed. Our room had a large flat screen TV with English channels, an espresso machine and a kettle with a selection of teas, a mini fridge with FREE soft drinks and bottles of water which was refilled everyday again, for free. The staff were excellent and very informative. Check-in was quick and easy and the staff gave as very detailed information about trams and buses which was great. The reception staff even ordered our takeaway for us and booked a taxi back to the airport for a good price. Over all, great customer service. The hotel isn't near Amsterdam city centre but we were aware of that when we booked. The hotel is only a 5 minute walk to the Metro and then a 10 minute ride on the tram to the city centre, quick and easy! We bought a 3 day tram pass at the hotel for 17€, it runs every 10 minutes until half past 12 at night and so the location of the hotel really wasn't a problem. Over all I would recommend this hotel and really enjoyed our stay in Amsterdam.
title: No negative things to say about this hotel, it's brilliant

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Rooms are small but clean, breakfast selection is ok - you can find all basic staff. What I didn't like i super slow lifts. You can wait for minutes for lift to arrive in the mornings. Hotel should consider replacing them with something more fast
title: Ok for business stay

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel was very clean and stf was very helpful. Perfect location just 7mins away from the metro station. Breathtaking views! Might be a bit expensive (€16pp for breakfast). They offer parking as well at a reasonable price considering that parking in the city is expensive and impossible!
title: Great accommodation

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: A bit out of the way takes about a 15minute tram ride to Central Amsterdam, they do a canal ride into the city centre in the mornings for 6euros which was really nice, room was very dusty all needed a very good clean, service was good some of the staff are very helpful!
title: Ms

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Beautiful hotel, lovely room and staff. The only downside was it is out of the way of everything, a train ride into Amsterdam and a 5 minute walk to the hotel, otherwise it is a beautiful hotel and recommend it
title: Beautiful hotel a bit out of the way

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Pictures are so much better than the reality. Carpet was very tiered.there was marks and dirt on the side of the bed that I had to clean.the bed sheets, towels were good and bathroom was clean.they charged us 30€ for early check in which the good hotels don't do.if you don't wish your room to be cleaned they will give you 5€ voucher for the bar which I never received and after I asked the reception guy said me to go down and take it or he will send it but he didn't. I will stay there again only if it's necessary.location is not far from airport and the city.3 stars for all.
title: It's ok but not as should be

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Been there for 4 nights. As mentioned in few reviews, the hotel looks way better and fresher on pictures. The carpet is almost everywhere, and unfortunately, would need to be refreshed. Same as, we didn't have the possibility to open our windows in our room... found that sad in a 4 stars hotel. Breakfast was great for the price, fresh juices, choices for every type of breakfast you're looking for. About the staff, I found the behavior of few people really cold for the "standing" they're looking to reach. Moreover, the manager (lady latina type) was really mean by the way she was talking to people. We were really disappointed by her lack of professional behavior.
title: Casual hotel

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Mercure Hotel Amsterdam City is not in the city center. You have to walk to the Train Station to go to the center. Bed sheets were dirty covered with hair. We had to request it to be changed. They didn't put a stamp on the city tax sheet paper, so I couldn't get my refund & they didn't mention about it. I couldn't open the windows so, the room was so hot & air condition was not working well. The only good thing I can say was the breakfast.
title: Could be better

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Not far from nearest Metro line (overamstel). Arrived Early evening, very informal check in straight forward and given info of area (maps and recommended restaurants and activities etc) Asked for a water view which is on the back of the hotel and this was sorted. The room was on the end of the 4th Floor very nice comfortable bed no bath but that didn't bother us. Nicely laid out. Room was lovely and quiet at night with cold air blower which was welcome. Breakfast was good and varied I thought at the time it was a little on the expensive side but after travelling into the city was competitive with town centre price. All staff very pleasant.
title: Long weekend break

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We arrived early & our 2 rooms weren't ready. There were quite a lot of people hanging around in the lobby waiting. We stood for quite a while & when it got to the time that our rooms should've been ready (2pm), I asked one of the ladies on reception who called housekeeping to check, still not ready!Stood waiting again & a male member of staff who I think was called Jorgis asked if he could help. We explained what was happening & immediately he sorted rooms for us. One triple & one double. He upgraded our double room to business floor too! Great rooms, fabulous interior of the hotel & bar. Lovely shop selling ready to eat foods & meals that you can pop into a microwave. Coffee etc can also be purchased there. Lovely bar & restaurant area & outside patio. Everywhere smelt fresh & clean. Metro into city is just a 7 minute walk away & very easy. Nice quiet location too. Lovely stay.
title: Interior designers dream!

hotelLocation: Joan Muyskenweg 10, 1096 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I found the hotel just 2 days before arrival. After arriving, we checked in by a young men named Xadir, who was friendly and smart. He tried to speak German a lot since we come from Germany.The lobby has modern intereor, just as the rooms have. We had a 'Priviledge Room'. The bed room and the bathroom are very clean since they got tidied and cleaned every day. The view is great as well, because a canal lays right behind the terrace of the hotel. The next station is pretty near the hotel, as well as the next highway and the airport. The rooms and the whole hotel is very quiet though, so you won't wake up in the middle of the night because of noise from the city.I enjoyed my stay a lot and I really want to return to Amsterdam and to that hotel in my next vacation.
title: beautiful & luxurious

review: Apollo Hotel. Location A1 on 3 canals with a beautiful view.Best price/quality relationship, therefore we did come back again.Rooms and interior renovated. Super restaurant with disc-jockey.Friendly staff.No porter.
title: Best price/quality relationship

review: - Staffs are friendly and helpful. - Location: if you want to be away from all the tourists crowds, the noises and have a good night of sleep, this could be an option. It is only 2 or 3 tram stops to the city center for various attractions. This is basically a residential area but lots of restaurants and even an outdoor market on the weekend, 10-15min walking.- The bad, this hotel is under constructions, does not have a lounge, just one restaurant/bar. During our stay, lots of noise during daytime, even seeing painters putting décor and wall paper along the hallway of the hotel. Rooms are small and so is the elevator, fit maybe 4 or 5 ppl max w/out any luggage.- Nice view of the canal if you get that view, which we did for both rooms.- It is also near the convention so depending on the time, you might get that crowds too. Other than that, not much else at this hotel. It is nice to sit at the restaurant or bar for dinner or a drink in the evening, relaxing.
title: Friendly staffs, quiet location, underconstruction and reasonable price

review: We stayed here this weekend, the hotel room was clean and comfortable. On our first night a fire alarm sounded at about 11pm and then a person spoke on a tannoy to tell us to remain in our room.Most of the hotel ground floor was under construction- only the restaurant was open, lobby seating areas and a bar area were closed for renovation. There was a nice Japanese koi pond outside but it had lots of rubbish in it. Apparently the hotel offers free transfers from and to the airport- however we did not know this prior to arrival- and did not find out until we asked about taxis, and the free transfers on a Sunday start at 10:30 which was after our flight. We also found out half way through our stay that they can also provide discount museum tickets and loan you phone chargers- however we found this out too late also, there was very little information whatsoever about the hotel and what it provided. We are in the restaurant; the harbour club, I have reviewed this separately.
title: Good hotel but being renovated and not central, and little information

review: A great hotel full of classic style and it adjoins a theatre! The room was spacious and lots of storage- roomy bathroom and tea making facilities. The black and ornate deco gave a good impression of this boutique hotel. The staff were excellent too!
title: Love Amsterdam

review: The hotel had our booking for a triple room share, but we had to wait a considerable time to get our extra bed. Just a word of warning about booking an extra bed in the room as the rooms are fine for a double ( or 2 singles pushed together as we have for a double) but quite cramped for a triple. The rooms have 3 chairs but you can only actually use 1 as the extra bed takes up the room where the chairs should be. The chairs have to be stacked in the window space. The room housekeeping is very slow and we had to call for fresh towels at 3pm as the rooms had not been visited by anyone all day. Our family had 3 rooms here and we all had trouble with the showers overflowing into the bathrooms so new towels were needed. The rooms are modern and well presented. The location is close to the Museum area but not very close to transport - 10min walk away. The breakfast was very nice but most food has been placed on a high bar area which is quite difficult to access.
title: Nice Hotel but service not very good

review: Hotel - Was still under construction when we arrived (July 26) and departed (July 30). It looks like the updates on the first floor are going to be nice and modern. The construction did not bother our stay. Staff - This is the area which could be improved from my perspective. We had to wait to check in and out. Two of the front desk reps were engaged in a conversation while we were waiting. While it may have been work related, we were not acknowledged to say someone would be with us shortly. Also had issues with making a gym access card for me. Location - For us it was good. The hotel is close several parks. It is also close to De Pijp which has an outdoor market and tons of restaurants/bars to visit. We used the tram most days to get around the city and that was easy! I liked that this hotel wasn't in a touristy part of the city but has easy access so you can visit those areas if you so choose. Room - I paid for an upgrade and canal view and for me it was not worth the extra money. We were on the side of the building which had a somewhat restricted view of the canal. The room had A/C, iron, hair dryer, tub and windows that open. Room was clean. Gym - The gym is pretty small and only had a few machines and free weights. Other random items - You can rent bikes on site. We were provided a free map of the city upon check in. There weren't too many snacks/drinks in the lobby, but I recommend the chocolate bars if you need something!
title: Good stay

review: Being an SPG member I loved the flexibility this hotel offered me. It was one of the ones available for the dates I was traveling but I must say I was impressed by the rooms. Had both the standard and deluxe rooms and they were pretty comfy and offered ample space for 2 groups to get dressed and sleep. One thing I must point out is that this hotel went above and beyond for my birthday. Waiting for me in my room was a handwritten card and some pastries to congratulate me on my birthday which was the same day I checked in. So shout out to them for that gesture. Would stay here again nice view of the river but restaurant is a little expensive
title: Good hotel Overall

review: This is the "Almost" hotel.The hotel is "almost" finished with renovations, the staff are "almost" trained and competent, the laundry is "almost" returned on time, the breakfast is "almost" good. The location is good though.Many better options in Amsterdam. Not really up to the standard of a SPG property in general. Yes, the potential is there, but the Apollo seems to fall just short at every turn.It is the "Almost" hotel........
title: The "Almost" Hotel

review: Stayed for a 30th birthday celebration in January. Hotel very nice rooms of a high standard, staff very helpful and friendly and even left a surprise birthday dessert in the room. Did not eat dinner at hotel but breakfast very good with lots of choice.
title: Great hotel, good location

review: My husband and I stayed here for two nights prior to our Grand European Tour on Viking, with arrangements being made by Viking. I communicated with the hotel prior to our visit informing them that we would be celebrating our 38th wedding anniversary while at the hotel. Upon arrival, they did not disappoint and as we checked in, we were wished a "Happy Anniversary" and told we were upgraded to a King bed and a room with a beautiful canal view. The Lobby was under chaotic construction which made for a less than desirable condition but the room was lovely with a delightfully fluffy, comfortable bed. The bathtub is very dangerous and slippery with no mats provided (even when we requested them, they did not arrive) causing us to not use the facility at all while we were there. The complimentary breakfast buffet was one of the best I have ever seen in a lovely, light and airy room overlooking the canal. The food was simply delicious and a great way to start the day. The hotel is far from the center of town but accessible with a tram or taxi. Robert, the Concierge, was the nicest, friendliest and most helpful person to us and perfect for his job. He is a great asset to the Apollo since from 3:00pm to 11:00pm, he is the first person to greet you as you step into the lobby. His towering figure and huge smile make you feel right at home. We are now proud to call you our friend. When our bus arrived to transport us and our luggage to the Viking ship, he personally saw to it that our luggage went on the bus and waved to us as we pulled out of the Apollolaan Circle.Thank you, Robert, for all your help in making our experience in Amsterdam a wonderful one.
title: Love Amsterdam!

review: Its on the water. Breakfast is among the best I had and you are having breakfast right on the side of a canal. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. The staff is superfriendly. I would visit again.
title: Relatively expensive but a good hot

review: Stayed here for 10 days on business. Selected it because of how it looked online, and some customer reviews. They are currently doing a major renovation, and things are quite disorganized and rather chaotic. The restaurant apparently has been moved, and it was hard to find. They had my researvation all wrong, I was with my wife but when I checked in they had it a single person. They at first did not believe that I had made the reservation for two people and it was only after I showed them the reservation on my laptop that they grudgingly corrected it. They also had that I had not paid for breakfast but we had and again it was only after I showed them the reservation on my laptop that they corrected it. A number of other similar problems. Overall, a fairly unpleasant experience, particuarly given it is not cheap. We would definitely not stay here again, given how many nice hotels there are in Amsterdam.
title: Some nice staff, rather disorganized and over-priced

review: Especially by the staff...it always amazesme to find hotels which would not be bad...but the staff ruins the stay! Is management too busy to see what is going on? So the room was clean and nicely decorated...even though I am in the Netherlands and I am sure they could have found pictures of their country instead of hanging two pics of New York City in our room...(just me...noticing)...breakfast area as everyone else said...best part in the hotel...front desk personal...not theFriendliest bunch to say the least and some waiters and waitresses busy talking amongst themselves instead of noticing paying customers....hotel is in walking distance within museums and restaurants and such and located in a very quiet neighborhood...
title: Room for improvement

review: Good aspect: clean and quiet roomPoor aspect: not so friendly receptionist, under construction during the stay, so quite noisy in the public area, a bit far from public transportation, the lake? view room is very disappointed
title: not value for money

review: The hotel lobby is currently undergoing extensive renovations. The air conditioning in lobby is very weak. Rooms are on the small side. There was hair in bathroom from previous guest. Beds were comfortable enough. They put two twin beds together. Although I had made reservation a few months before visit and requested a crib at that time, I didn't get one the first night despite being assured at check in that I was getting one. Hotel was adequate but probably wouldn't stay here again
title: Convenient location

review: The hotel belonged to several different chains over the last couple of years. At the beginning of this year, it has changed to Starwood properties and is classified as “design”hotel. I admit, that I would have expected something different for a “design” hotel. Of course, every hotel has a certain design, but the denomination as well as the branding Starwood uses for “design” makes guests consider this type of hotels is very modern and stylish. The interior of the newly renovated rooms is nice and the rooms are comfortable, especially the beds allow for a good night sleep. However, I would not have necessarily thought of design hotel when seeing the interior. Please don’t be shocked when approaching the hotel. The exterior looks not very accommodating but inside you have very nice areas. You could read already from other reviews that the lobby area is currently undergoing some change, so there is construction going on. I have, however not been disturbed by this in my room. I had a very pleasant harbour view, which I enjoyed very much. The breakfast buffet is nice and the breakfast area is arranged nicely, different from other hotels in a more winter garden style.Obvious from the other reviews, staff has received differing ratings. I was accommodated very nicely and very pleasantly by all staff members who passed my way. I needed to buy flowers for a certain occasion one morning at a fairly early hour and I was helped tremendously by the staff at the reception. I would come back, however, the way to the office was a little longer and therefore more burdensome for me in the morning then I had envisaged. Also, the hotel should be careful not to overdue the price to allow for the right cost-reward ratio.
title: Not quite the design I expected but nice and welcoming

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam - NDSM Wharf
review: So, to be fair I didn't intentionally book this place, the company booking system flagged it up as ok and I saw double tree, 1.4 miles from city centre, and thought, it'll be fine.First impressions of the place was rough! It's on the wharf and really not an appealing part of town at all. Kind of in the middle of nowhere and a pretty awful looking area.The hotel however was really well appointed and the staff were lovely, the breakfast was good and the coffee ok. The gym was not really as exciting as it sounded on the website, it's basically a runner, cross trainer, bike and a few dumbbells. All n all nice rooms and hotel, just not the location!
title: Nice hotel, awful location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam - NDSM Wharf
review: It's very hard to book a hotel when you don't know the city. We thought it's a Hilton so they usually are located in good areas. This Hotel was definitely not where a tourist wants to be. If you stay in Amsterdam rather book a hotel near the central railway station. The Hotel was OK - the first time we stayed in a room with windows near the ceiling...no view whatsoever...anyhow you would not have wanted to look out the window as it was surrounded by sheds.The ferry was an inconvenience to us especially on the day we departed. We had a very early flight and the ferry was not operational that early so we had to take a taxi which cost Euro65....had we been near the station we could have taken the train to the Airport for a LOT less. Rather pay a little more and stay central. Hope this helps you in planning your stay in Amsterdam.
title: Not what we expected

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam - NDSM Wharf
review: In May and July this year I stayed at this hotel with a friend. The hotel was overall good and clean. The breakfast was excellent and design + useful usage of space noteworthy. The view of the water view rooms was impressive, even at the floors not at the top. Little things were missing. E.g. no chocolate chip cookies received upon check-in in July. In May the hotel mistaked my Gold status in a Silver status. The note that my friend Alina became 30 in May and the stay was part of the birthday gift was ignored. Nevertheless a very good hotel when visiting Amsterdam.
title: Two very good stays

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam - NDSM Wharf
review: Service was excellent at the hotel the stampers wonderful help yourself in a lot of different problems that we had also was a nice place to be was on the water. I would recommend this hotel to anyone of those traveling single family business because it's away from the hustle and bustle from Amsterdam. You have to take a free 15 minute boat ride to get to Amsterdam which is very relaxing.
title: Hotel stay

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam - NDSM Wharf
review: The hotel is located a 10min ferry ride from CentralStation which we took several times during our stay. We loved it.The breakfast buffet is well sorted and our room was in a modern industrial style which we loved too.A bonus was the huge flee market on the weekend which is surrounding the hotel area.
title: Nice weekend in Amsterdam

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam - NDSM Wharf
review: Amsterdam is cripplingly expensive when it comes to hotels and if you still want to be close to the city centre but avoid the cost (and bustle) this hotel wins. 2 minutes walk from the free ferry to Centraal and on the trendy North Side this hotel is very handily located.Always stayed here on business but wouldn't hesitate to use its services as a tourist. Staff are super friendly, bar and restaurant are good (cosy during the winter).Only downside is in the summer the rooms can be quite stuffy with no way of letting fresh air in.
title: Good location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam - NDSM Wharf
review: Having visited Amsterdam many times, and visiting this area previously, we opted to stay here and were not disappointed.The hotel was clean, our Queen Superior room spacious and the bathroom modern and well appointed. We encountered no disturbance from our neighbours or nearby venues (we stayed Monday to Friday). The view of the river was stunning and were were able to watch the river traffic going to and fro. It was very relaxing.Breakfasts were excellent with a wide variety of hot and cold choices. Eggs, bacon, etc; meats, cheeses and breads; cereals and fresh fruits; daily fresh pastries. The coffee was also very good.All the staff we encountered were courteous and friendly.The hotel is relatively small and has a good vibe.Though we aren't spring chickens, we took advantage of the nearby venues such as Pllek, Noorderlicht and 't Loetje and enjoyed them all. We felt that we had a "true Amsterdam" experience in that we were away from the main tourist areas. The NDSM Wharf is being regenerated and the hotel is right next to the old slipway. The nearby NDSM boat works is now home to many local businesses. There's even a hotel in one of the old dockyard cranes.Getting to the hotel isn't a problem. The free ferries run every half hour (every 15 minutes at peak times) and the journey takes ten minutes. This gives you an opportunity to watch the yachts and boats sailing up and down the Ij and see the landmarks as you pass by. The hotel will give you a timetable.We would definitely stay here again.
title: Spot on!

review: We were made very welcome in this hotel ,the staff were lovely and made our stay very enjoyable.The hotel was very clean and tidy and we had no problems at all when we stayed . Location wise the hotel was about a 15minute Walk to dams square and was in a nice area which was quiet and the area had a few pubs . There was a big street market outside the hotel on the weekend this was really nice and sold a huge amount . We would stay her again .
title: Lovely hotel friendly staff

review: I had a fabulous two night trip to the Linden Hotel. Amazing hotel, fabulous staff and sweets on reception (what more could you want!)Seriously this is a great location, nice and quiet but very close to the centre and tram/bus stop with lovely room decoration and accessories.
title: Fabulous Hotel

review: My family of 4 stayed here while visiting Amsterdam. It is in a quiet and charming area of the city with great cafes and bars within walking distance. The touristy spots are about 30 minutes walk but you'll be glad to be away from that circus. The staff is super friendly and the Wifi was fast. It is an older hotel so getting your luggage upstairs is a little tricky. They have a small elevator. The rooms are simple and the bathroom is tiny (especially the shower). But the beds were comfortable. Just remember that you don't have AC if you visit in the warm summer months. It was a little stuffy even with the windows open.
title: Great boutique hotel in Jordann district

review: A boutique hotel which was pricey for the location. 20-25 minute walk from train station. 15 minutes from Anne Frank House. Room was clean and comfortable, nothing exceptional. Had a family room with 4 single beds which were comfortable and plenty big, even for my 6'4" frame. Bathroom was strange as shower drain not inside shower door, so whole floor gets wet if someone showers. Free coffee and espresso was a nice touch. Nothing wrong and nice, but again location was a bit far from center and pricey for a family room.
title: Boutique Hotel best for Couples not Families

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I love the hotel, It is in a great location, the staff is very friendly and helpful and breakfast is included. The rooms are small, but I think that is expected in Amsterdam. The beds are comfortable, the room was clean, and the hotel has an elevator--this is a bid help for people with lug gages. I say a lot of families there so it is a great place for kids.
title: Amsterdam Stay

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Everything was perfect from arrival to our leave. Only place for improvements is the breakfast menu. A little bit of shuffling the offer would not hurt. We stay for a week and had the same breakfast every morning:-/
title: Perfect

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location, hotel room very small but clean with nice white towels supplied daily. Very quirky decor which made us smile. Hotel recommendations for eating were excellent including The Seafood Bar and The Uptown Meat Club both on Van Baerlestraa which was about 5 mins walk from the hotel.
title: Max Brown Hotel, Museum District

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had a great stay at the hotel. We came to Amsterdam for an extended weekend and could´n find better place - very good location, quiet, with walking distance to all interesting sights. We loved stylish design of interior, friendly staff, small but very clean and comfortable room, breakfast included. I will recommend this hotel to my friends.
title: Cozy atmosphere

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The rooms were lovely and fun with a basketball hoop. Breakfast disappointing and unorganised and some staff weren't as helpful but for location it was perfect to get to everywhere you need a tram stop just round the corner.
title: Wonderful room

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great Hotel, great area, right outside the iconic iamsterdam sign. Short walk to the action. Lovely service from the staff too. Was a great place to spend my birthday, only problem was the walls were a bit thin so got a noise complaint from next door...
title: Great Hotel

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We love Amsterdam. Have visited several times now. On a previous visit we stayed in this hotel (when it was the Poet). The feel of the hotel having changed with the Max Brown makeover. My boys liked the basketball. The rooms were of a good size for a family of four with two doubles and one fold out sofa-bed (no bedding was supplied !)It was warm when we visited and Air conditioning was missed, the static fan wasn't much help, but never the less is only a small issue.The Museum district gives great access to a number of parks and access to shops, my eldest loved having a whole street of branded goods to look at. Breakfast was self serve, Continental. You know this before you go. It was ample, and enough room to sit and have as much as you liked.Disappointed with the in room refreshments (i.e. no Coffee, or milk and two tea bags for a two night stay). Although our room was visited by the hotel cleaners, these were not refreshed or replenished. The ladies on reception who met us to book in were very friendly. Lovely Hotel. Not quite 5 stars, but a good 4.
title: Little break in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The good thing: The beds were really comfy. Otherwise, I was very disappointed. I had high hopes for this hotel. It was recommended by secretplaces.com, where I always check before going on a trip, because their recommendations have never disappointed - so far. I scored a 4-people room (2 queen beds) for 369€ for 1 night in July. The design of the hotel is ... nice, modern, ... but nothing special. The carpet on the stairs is disgusting and old. And the handrailing is sticky in sóme parts and could use a good clean.The room was also not completely clean. I mean it was cleaned, but quickly and without care. Could see dust everywhere, on shelves, lightplugs, lamps, the ventilator was full of it, and in the bathroom you could see that the cleaning cloth did not make it into the corners and not to the rim where surface meets wall. The day blankets had spots and there were crumbs underneath the sittee. Well, I thought, maybe the breakfast is amazing. But wasn't. Just average Dutch hotel breakfast, not even scrambled eggs. Additionnally, the breakfast room was really busy, and a lot of food was always empty, or we needed to wait for plates, or for cups, or for milk, etc. There were 2 girls that tried to do their best, cleaning up and refilling. This would have all been quite okay if the room would not have cost more than 220 for 4 people. But for over 300 I have a certain expectation for the value for money. We are going to AMSterdam 2x every year for 4 weeks each and I haven't found a nice hotel yet. Max Brown is also not making it on my list.
title: Disappointing

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Max Brown Hotel near the Museum Square is very well located, transportation and activities. The hotel is very clean and the staff is friendly and always ready to help. The breakfast is nice and served on a buffet. We enjoyed our two nights. Very quiet but the room and bathroom were little small for three.
title: Nice Hotel with a vibe

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is in museum square, easy walking distance to all sightseeing. Restaurants and shopping also in walking distance. The staff are friendly and helpful. We arrived early and after asking we got our room an hour earlier. Also booked taxi for us back to the airport and even had cable ties for baggage! I liked the decor of the rooms - fun and different. The rooms however (family room - 4 people) are very small. I would suggest if you are a family of 4 to rather book 2 rooms. It is cramped. The bathroom is the smallest I have every come across, but that said, it was clean and there was enough toiletries. Enough and clean towels provided as well. Also be prepared to drag your luggage to your room yourself. Could not adjust room temperature, at night it was very hot. Beds are comfortable. The breakfast was just sufficient, nothing special. Only boiled eggs, not scrambled. No bacon. Only a few cold meats. Fruit and yoghurt and bread. No pancakes. Nice coffee machine. Girls at breakfast are friendly and efficient.
title: Walking distance to old town

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: When we first got to Max Browns and saw the stairs I groaned inside thinking here we go again. We had been travelling for the last 7 weeks n I was over stairs. But not to worry there is a lift for you n your luggage. We arrived early expecting to just drop our luggage and come back later. The staff where fabulous, we where able to check in and go to our room. The rooms are small but very comfortable. Clean and bright. Loved the basketball ring above the bed. My only complained and it was NOT the hotels fault but one of the apartments opposite our room left their outside light on all night for 3 nights. Most annoying. Would recommend Max Browns to travellers who want everything on your doorstep, friendly extremely helpful staff, clean comfy rooms and a decent breakfast. Thanks people for a great stay
title: Great Stay

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 40 - 46, 1071 CR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: If you're looking for the large lobby, 3 elevators, cookie cutter chain hotel, this is not for you, but if you like to stay in a quirky place with a lot of local charm this place is awesome! We had a large room, with sufficient space for our family of 4. Clean, lovely decorated, small but functional bathroom. Very friendly staff, check in was a breeze we were given a small package with maps, discounts and happenings in the area. Breakfast had a good selection of cold meats, cheese and pastries. Location was great! just one block from the Reijks museum, bus and tram, and even a boat tour company to get a sense of the architecture of Amsterdam. Would definitely come back next time we are in Amsterdam! Just be aware that although there is a tiny elevator, there are steep steps everywhere so it might not be suitable for persons with restricted mobility.
title: Great location with true Amsterdam flavor!

review: This is a modern hotel. We love the open reception concept. Service at the reception is great and very helpful and accommodating. Provided a free map and suggestions on how to go around the area. They also sell tram/bus tickets. The location is 17 to 20 minutes walk into the old town. Restaurants and groceries nearby The area is in a quieter area. The room is clean and quite big for a European hotel. We were given a room with a view of the canal which was awesome. Bed is very comfortable and Wifi is strong.
title: Great 3 night Stay

review: A nice hotel, quite well situated in walking distance of station and city although even easier using the trams (tickets available at hotel. Excellent welcome on arrival (Kevin) nice rooms, quite spacious good bathroom. Breakfast was ok, had better, had worse. Both hot and cold available although hot was a bit limited. Overal a pleasant stay.
title: Pleasant city break

review: Just come back after a lovely break in a lovely hotel. The hotel is very clean and staff are very friendly and helpful! The room was cleaned everyday and fresh towels were provided. The bed was really comfy for a hotel room!!! There was free wifi and a free safe in the room along with English tv channels on the tv (BBC 1 and 2) and toiletries in the bathroom free of charge. One thing that would have been nice was if there were tea and coffee facilities in the room. We ate in the hotel a few times at night as the food was lovely and wasn't badly priced compared all the restaurants in the centre. There is a tram stop a few min's walk away from the hotel where you can get the number 9 and 14 in to dam square- this was only a 10 minute tram ride. You can buy your tram tickets from the hotel reception; we bought a 72 hour ticket which was around 17/18 euros each-bargain!!!!!. All in all I8 would defiantly stay at this hotel again!
title: Brilliant!

review: Had a few hiccups regarding reservations weeks before our stay here. Got to the hotel on 13/07/17 and had absolutely no issues:) Very nice, clean and well presented hotel in walking distance to Dam Square, Amsterdam Centraal train station, A'dam and other shops and emenities. My only issue was that it was extremely expensive costing us €560 for 3 nights for room only. In the end it was worth it its a fabulous hotel:) will definitely be returning here (thats if the prices of the rooms were to go down).
title: Fabulous Hotel

review: I was really delightedly surprised at the warm welcome. My first visit to this hotel, yet their staff could not have tried harder to be as helpful as possible with the smallest things and the hotel was quiet and clean and cheerful.On arrival I was met by smiling, happy staff who welcomed me as if I was a regular. I had a good sized room on the 6th floor with a canal view, a window that opened enough to let in some air but wasn’t really necessary as the air conditioning worked very well. The maid had done a spotless clean with plenty of towels and I want to give a special mention for the young lady who came to put the water bottles in the room and asked if I needed anything else. Her smiling happy face lit up the room.I slept soundly on a comfortable bed and also because the room doors did not crash each time a guest came in or out of their room which is the normal disturbing factor in most hotels. The elevators were speedy and operated by a room key - hence secure.Breakfast was good. Items included 2 kinds of eggs, cheeses & hams, breads, jams, cereals and croissants etc. and a variety of fresh fruit and the coffee was better than expected. A trifle expensive but if you like a hearty breakfast, not so.Location was very handy for both trams at one end of the street and buses at the other which took one into the town and to the Central Station. A 6-10 minute walk to either would get you to transport of your choice and round the corner of the street were many cafes and stores and a flea market if you like to browse. All in all, the hotel was really very good and I particularly commend their Staff who were always happy and friendly and this makes a hotel what it is. Far nicer than hotels with loads more stars whose staff are often surly and unhelpful. I’d stay at the Ibis Amsterdam Centre STOPERA again in a heartbeat and will definitely do so when I’m again in Amsterdam. Thank you everyone
title: The Happiest, Most Helpful and Smiling Staff with a warm welcome

review: No complaints about Ibis Stopera. We got a hotel shuttle minibus from the airport (not prebooked but still easy to find and sort). Got to Ibis too early but they stored baggage. Got checked in about 12 when a room became available. The room was clean, basic and no frills but absolutely spot on for a weekend visit. The staff were great, plenty to choose from at breakfast and only a minute or two to shops (maybe 10 minutes to more central areas). The bathroom was a bit tiny but other than that everything was great.
title: Clean, easy and good location

review: We checked in with no problems at all and the staff were very helpful. They gave us maps and lots of information about places to visit, told us about the tram and bus services (which were only a few minutes away), the tram service was very easy to use. The room we stayed in was basic but adequate and was overlooking a canal. The facilities in the room included a large TV, safe, free Wi Fi, and a very large shower. The bed was large, clean and comfortable. Breakfast is available in the hotel although we did not have one. There is also a bar with a variety of drinks, plenty of seating areas and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. We would recommend this hotel.
title: Good Location

review: We got to the hotel in the middle of the night after we got lost in Amsterdam ()The night shift worker welcomed us in a very delightful way, explained about the city and answer a lot of our questionsThe hotel is very close to Rembrant square and about 15 minutes walk to Dam square, Supermarked nearby, And a marketplace, And there is public tranportation 3 minutes walkThe classic boutique hotel
title: Very pleasant and and warm staff

review: Stayed here for two nights 23rd-25th July with my husband for our wedding anniversary, and can't fault it.We got the sprinter train from Airport to Dam Centraal and then walked to the hotel (around 20 mins, with bags, nice walk, no bother).From then on we didn't have to get any public transport as we walked everywhere, the longest walk (to by Vondelpark) is still just under 30 mins with lots to see on the way.We do enjoy walking on city breaks, but it's a really nice location, and trams everywhere if you don't fancy the walk. Only a 5/10 minute walk from the Icebar and also the skinny bridge which is lovely at night... another 5/10 minutes gets you right into the city centre.Check-in/out couldn't be simpler, very friendly staff and no complaints about the room, basic but clean with comfy bed, nice and quiet at night.Overall a great weekend and highly recommend this hotel :)
title: Great hotel in great location

review: Very modern and clean hotel. Breakfast very good and is available until 12.00. Rooms clean and compact. Bathroom a bit strange at first as it is like the bathroom on a cruise ship. It was like it was moulded from on piece of material. No complaints other than it was a good 20 minute walk from the Central Train station. Staff very friendly and helpful.Overall good value for money if you dont mind not being in a cental location.
title: Very modern and clean hotel

review: Fantastic hotel, clean, online checkin and checkout, friendly staff and above all great location. Very close to the central train station and metro and to the city center. Located in a very quiet area but in 10 minutes you could be in the busiest touristic spots. Wifi really works and ... I can't wait to come back. Book a room with canal view. Foto is the view from the room. Go, Explore and Enjoy
title: Beat value for money

review: Very few complaints, did exactly what I expected. Reasonably sized comfortable rooms with great friendly staff and all at a good price. It's not exactly centrally located, being around a 5 minute walk from the nearest Metro (Waterlooplein) and 15 minutes from Rembrandtplein but still very accessible. Also a mention to the free wifi (no problems at all with connection) and good complimentary breakfast. The only issues I had was no bin in the room, only a small one in the the bathroom, very little storage and only one pillow on the bed. Minor issues perhaps but all make a difference.Bearing all of this in mind I would happily stay here again and recommend to others at the price. Thanks.
title: Well priced modern hotel

review: stayed at this hotel for two nights very goo d hotel close to central railway station if you are arriving at schipol airport, a short walk to the city centre and all the tourist attractions friendly people most speak english tourist boats for canal cruises nearby great bar and bar food and exceptional staff would stay here again.
title: quick trip

review: Nice modern hotel close to Dam Square (1 km approx) and Central Station. If you are taking metro then get down at Waterlooplein station and walk for 5 minutes. If you are walking from Central Station it would take around 15-20 minutes depending on the route you take.Tip: the metro cost me and my wife around 6 Euros ( 1 hour pass) On the way back we took taxi, a Merc and it cost us only 7 Euros! So I suggest taking taxi unless you decide to walk.Staff were exceptional!! May be the best in all the Accor hotels I have been to. Very helpful , professional and cheerful.We had checked in online and we had the room ready. They were kind enough to accommodate our request to change to a canal view room.Breakfast had a great spread: Eggs, Sausages, Croissants, Hot Chocolate, Cheese, Cold cuts etc. and they serve breakfast from 6 Am to 12 Pm ( yes 12 in the afternoon!)Decent Ibis sized rooms. Nice lounge next to reception. 10 minutes walk to red light district.There is a bike rental shop and super market near the hotel.
title: Good Location, Canal View Rooms and Very Friendly Well Mannered Cheerful Staff!

review: Spent 4 days is JulyThe hotel is located a bit of center but it was nice and quite for us. We got a nice room with a view to the canal. I like the ability to open a window and have some fresh air. Room was bigger than rooms in IBIS hotels in Paris and Madrid we've been at. We also walked to and from the center by foot and there are also good public transportation nearby. Rembrandt house is nearby – must see attraction for art lovers.The Staff are very welcoming – at the front desk and at the bar. Pizza at the bar was nice. We also had one breakfast which was various , fresh and good.Can't wait to come back!
title: Great Stay!

review: Lovely hotel for a business trip. It was clean and had all the facilities that I required.The breakfast was also very nice, if not quite simple though.It was perfectly positioned for walking into the main tourist areas.Quite a shame though about the canal building site right outside. I thought there would be a canal there with a nice view.
title: Perfect for business trip

review: I stayed with my wife 6 nights in this hotel.It has great survice and convinent location! Public transportation, musiums and supermarket "Coop" in 5 minute walk from the hotel. Perfect breakfast and fast clean room service.
title: Great survice and convinent location.

review: Just had a long weekend stay and would certainly return. Easy walk to local restaurants, bars etc and to Vondel park and Museums. Room well appointed and Staff couldn't have been more helpful. Excellent breakfasts.One minor criticism is that web site directions on how to find from Tram Stop.could be much clearer. Yes I got lost in heavy rain!!
title: Excellent Location and Staff

review: My wife and I stayed here a month ago during a trip to Amsterdam and Rome. The staff were excellent. Verena, in particular, was extremely helpful in recommending local food restaurants, grocery stores, and tips on going to the Anne Frank House. Anything we needed, was always graciously provided in a very friendly manner. It was out first stay at a NH hotel and it gave us a great first impression.
title: Great Location and Extremely Helpful Staff

review: I stayed 5 nights here as a tourist. The hotel is located a bit further from the hustle and bustle. However, within 5 min walk, there is a tram stop, McDonald, bakery, grocery store and restaurants.It is also 5-10 min walk to Albert Cuyp Market and museums. It is quite far from Central Station, Anne Frank. In fact, I did a 40 min walk to Anne Frank Museum.I took bus #197 from Schipol airport to Museumplein stop (€5 fare one way) and walked to hotel.The hotel provide free bottle water and cookies at the corner of front desk. It is a nkce touch.The standard room is quite spacious. I find the interior is decent and acceptable. No worn out carpet or dated room as it was mentioned in previous reviews. They provide a kettle, tea & coffee sachets, powder creamer and a mini fridge.The room is quiet. I do not remember any contruction work noise. The construction work will stop after working hour.Unfotunately,the room is very hot. It is hard to sleep with such high temperature. The staff gave me a table fan. Their website is misleading as it mention there is air conditioning in the room.Wifi in the room works well. Tv channels in English is limited to 2-3 choice, including BBC.The bathroom is spacious with a bath tub and a shower head. They provide hair dryer, tissue roll & box, shampoo, shower gel, soap and lotion. You will need to call to request other items such as toothbrush, slipper, bathrobe, etc.The front desk staffs are mixed with experienced and very inexperienced. I informed at the front desk to let housekeeping know that they do not need to clean my room. I did put on Do Not Disturb sign at my door. I came back to my room and it was clean. I asked what happenned and was told that she thought I want housekeeping to clean my room.Next, I was given wrong information. It was Saturday 8.30am when I asked if the Noordermarket is open. The front desk staff said it is closed. Luckily, I checked on Tripadvisor website and it say open 9am-4pm. I decided to have a look for myself and Noordermarket is indeed open at 9am. I returned to hotel to ask the staff why he told me it is closed. He say it say so in the website that he looked at. I think he should check properly. I did not expect such mistakes happenned in a 4 star hotel.As for return to Schipol airport, I use hotel shuttle van at €17 each way. The shuttle arrived 5-10 min earlier. I was the first passenger and it stop at another1 location to pick up passengers before going straight to airport.
title: Hotel At Quiet Location

review: Everything about the hotel was perfect - convenient location, beautiful large room, very helpful and friendly front desk staff. I would recommend it to anyone visiting Amsterdam. We splurged on one of the glass walled rooms and it was really worth it.
title: Wonderful visit.

review: My wife and I and two friends enjoyed 3 days here last week. Mara and Jennifer made us feel very welcome at reception. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was a lovely buffet with lots of choices. Other reception staff, whose names I can't remember, were helpful in making reservations at 2 museums and in storing our luggage for a few hours after checking out. The construction of a car park under the canal outside our room caused no noise or disturbance.
title: Really helpful reception staff

review: The NH Amsterdam was a great place to stay for our first time there. Within quick walking distance to the major attractions (10 minutes or less), on a quiet and beautiful corner of the city right next to the canal, you can't go wrong. The staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable, all for a very reasonable price. Highly recommended.
title: Clean and Comfortable

review: We stayed in Amsterdam for 4 nights and had the best time at this hotel. Very clean, well looked after hotel. Service at the desk and the bar/restaurant was fantastic. Rooms were perfect, and close to the Van Gogh museum.
title: Short Amsterdam stay

review: Had an amazing few nights at this hotel, rooms were clean and tidy, staff were very helpful and accomodating especially Vincent in reception. Close to supermarkets/restaurants. Would recommend to anyone coming to Amsterdam!!
title: Amazing!!

review: This hotel sits between the museum quarter and de Pijp area. The former has Van Gogh and other treasures, the latter has some fine restaurants. The hotel's amenities are limited (the gym is serviceable, there is no restaurant, we didn't have breakfast), but rooms are comfortable and clean and everything works. The staff are fantastic, and very helpful. Highly recommended.
title: Short stay perfect

review: The hotel is in a brilliant spot to visit many of the museums which are 5 mins away. Thou the Anne Frank house is about 25mins walk away. The airport transfer was only 15mins by cab away (book a mini-cab and it only cost 22euros where it was 48euros from the taxi rank). Walking about the city is as easy as public transport. The hotel is clean and the staff helpful (let us check in 3hrs early for free). it is a bit dated and needs updating as wear and tare is starting to take hold
title: great spot

review: Clean, safe, charming walkable city! Highly recommend all aspects! Be sure to preplan Your visit at least two months in advance if you want access to cultural aspects such as Anne Frank home. Canal cruise was wonderful, flowers, colors vivid and abundant. Food fresh and delicious!
title: Magnificent city of genuinely happy, pleasant citizens: Amsterdam!

review: The hotel was a little difficult to find as we arrived by train and had to take two trams to reach our it. Also we had to pull our cases up a street to find the hotel entrance; not noticeable from the end of the street. The canal opposite had been drained and an underground car park was being constructed before putting back the water over the car park: a very interesting piece of engineering. We were not troubled by any noise but the crane movement provided interesting sight before breakfast. Very comfortable room. The buffet breakfast provided a vast choice to accommodate every diet and quite the best I'd ever experienced. Hotel staff very helpful and suggested time bookings for those museums with long queues for entry: they were right. We would recommend this chain of hotels as the one in Utrecht was just a good.
title: Very comfortable base for visiting Amsterdam

review: A very clean and comfortable hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in walking distance to the museums and one tram ride (the 24) away to Dam Square and you can stay on that same tram all the way up to Central Station. We enjoyed being a little bit away from the madness of Dam Square so if you want some quiet that is easily accessible, this is the place for you!
title: Nice, clean, and quiet

review: Just stayed here for 3 nights, found the staff extremely friendly, the room we had booked didn't have a double bed so they upgraded us with no fuss to a superior room with queen size bed. The breakfast was quite expensive, and you can eat round the corner in the museum quarter. I would stay again, although was very business like and not usually the sort of hotel I would visit with a girlfriend.
title: Great location for museum area, business like but clean and good staff

review: We stayed on the top floor but one and had beautiful panoramic views of the city roof tops. Persuaded to upgrade by the charismatic and friendly welcome, I'm glad of having done so!The breakfasts are excellent, a good range of hot and cold food that's constantly updated by the kitchen. The bar is good and carries a wide selection of drinks.The hotel location is out of the centre but only a 30-40 minute walk from the Central Station and therefore within 30 minutes of all the attractions of the city. The trams stop just around the corner from the hotel and are cheap enough should you not wish to walk - located by the iAmsterdam sign and the Rijksmuseum. There are good restaurants and bars in the vicinity of the hotel and we found some lovely ones thanks to the amazingly helpful hotel staff and the map the hotel gave us.The room we had was lovely - clean, modern and spacious and the bed was comfortable. Given the hotel's location, it meant that there wasn't a lot of noise outside at night.
title: Great stay on the outskirts of town

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorbrugwal 100, 1012 SG Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for three nights, the hotel staff are friendly and welcoming. Amazing central location with a tram stop right outside.The rooms are small but have everything you need in and probably the softest and most comfortable bed I have ever slept in! Other reviews mention traffic noise but our room was very quiet. It was at the back which probably helped. I felt the breakfast could have done with more choice, although the scrambled egg was really good. I definitely recommend this Amsterdam hotel.
title: Friendly hotel in a great location

review: We booked the 5-star-room and enjoyed a luxury stay in a beautifully designed room. As the reviews on TripAdvisor and various other rating platforms show, the New Rembrandt Suite is one of the most popular rooms at the Exchange. And it is indeed spectacular-especially when you've seen the normal size of a (reasonably priced) double-room in Amsterdam. Moreover it was amazingly quiet and peaceful at nights!! We stayed at Warmoestraat before (which is only a 3-minute walk away) where the noise was horrible!There were really friendly and always helpful people at the reception desk. Considering the prices I would've liked a nice breakfast being included, but one can not have it all... ;-)
title: Lovely Hotel in the heart of Amsterdam

review: It is located in the heart of the tourist district and the door for the entry looks like you are walking into something not so great. Actually all the rooms are designed by fashion students and are very comfortable and kind of cute. Breakfast is ok a bit noisy and you have to walk outside of the hotel to the building next door to enter. If you have any troubles walking , avoid this hotel because the steps are very steep. There are elevators of course but they leave you somewhere where you have to climb stairs which are steep and narrow. Aside from that nice views and welcoming person at the desk.
title: Strange entrance but nice rooms

review: Price point and the hope of a super unique room drew us here. We ended up with the ultra modern completely white room, which was less than impressive. There are wooden covers over everything, making electric plugs inconvenient and the clothes rack a hazard for hitting your head on. The elevator is unique/fun.I do love that our room was clean and fresh towels were delivered for the 2nd day. Also, for being on a busy street, it was not too noisy. Watch out for the shower-it makes the entire bathroom floor drenched. So overall a fine place to stay, but don't expect to be blown away.
title: Unique centrally located hotel

review: Tried this hotel when i Amsterdam for a conference. It happened to be my birthday when I checked in so they gave me a complimentary dinner which I though was a really nice gesture and nothing that I expected. Comfortable rooms, the lounge is a bit small and breakfast in the lounge is basic, not like in German Hyatt's where you can order hot food. Still quality was good despite not much choice. Evening hors d'oeuvres were good. Restaurant was dutch/Indonesian fusion. Location was is a quiet area, not right in the centre but definitely walking distance. Would stay here again.
title: Brand new, top service

review: We paid for a room with a view - all we've got was a view of a one big tree and a parking lot. When you pay extra for a view, you usually expect something that is worth the money. Room 328 , check that view please!
