When i tried to change the room, a woman from the reception told me that they don't have another and said that i actually have a "deacent view" Does that mean that the room without a view have not a window at all? Only because the hotel wants to get more money for the rooms, doesn't mean they have to lie about the rooms! A tree and a parking lot in Amsterdam is not a view at all!!!! The hotel is 25 min from the center which is not so convenient! If you park your car in the hotel parking, they take your keys and every time you need to reach your car, you have to wait the looong queue at the reception. A staff member escorts you to the car because you are NOT allowed to reach your car alone and asks a silly questions like- what do you need to take from your car? No privacy at all!!!
title: You can find a better hotel for that price!

review: Hyatt is a new and great hotell. Free WiFi, good food, great gym and good service. The staff was "fresh" and need some time to be perfect. The computer system in the reseption seemed to have some issues. But a great hotell.
title: Lovely hotell.

review: Very disappointed to have had such an experience when you pay around 300 euros/room.1- The rooms are new and spacious..with a confortable bed and big shower.2- The room service is very good level and people very kind. The plates could be more elaborated for a 5-star hotel..still they remain very delicious.3- The breakfast is various..but the service must be ameliorated. You must run to have your coffee and your bill to pay.. In this category of hotels..they are supposed to serve you the orange juice too...well..4- The room cleaning service is a real disaster, due to which I would never suggest this hotel or come back: pillows which smell, floor not cleaned, coffee which is absent, laundery/toilette paper absent, people who enter to the room despite the "privacy laber" put outside...TOO MANY MISTAKES for a hotel of such a category...very disappointed.
title: Not a 5-star hotel at all...it can be difficulty rated a 4 stars one

review: I really loved staying at this Hyatt. The vibe coming in was very up beat and inviting. I do not typically go to hotel bars but the music and ambiance was enticing. The rooms were fantastic with a living space dressing room/closet, two TV's and very comfortable bed. The view was nice but a little obstructed by the trees. It was somewhat removed from the center of town but easily accessible via metro or tram. Its even fine to walk to everything if you want to and have the time. it was within walking distance to the zoo and to the Windmill and Brewery. Breakfast was full of many food choices from the buffet and nice selections from the menu.
title: Beautiful Rooms

review: I ate at Mama Makan, I was too hungry to complain. They serve chicken that has still blood on bones. I just ate the cooked part and never got an apology. Service was bad had to wait 20-25 minutes for that chicken and had to remind them to serve my wine.
title: Almost perfect except Restaurant experience

review: Great front desk staff,good location near Tram, walking distance to excellent restaurant, Regency Club really well managed,excellent food and free drinks.In house restaurant is well run and food above average especially breakfast.
title: Excellent new hotel, great location with an outstanding staff

review: I am a fan of Hyatt hotels as I travel often for work. I was originally concerned that this hotel wasn't quite in the city center but it is in the canal belt. Having said that, I think the location of the hotel was ideal! The city center turned out to be way too crowded and busy. I enjoyed the side canal streets of this city more. The hotel is within a 5 minute walk to the metro and was very easy to get from and to the airport. It was a nice and easy walk to the canal belt which I enjoyed. There is also a nice delicious bakery cafe nearby next to the metro station called Bakhuys. Hotel staff themselves were nice and most helpful. They were all very knowledgeable if you're looking for plan ideas. The only two thing that made my hotel stay not as ideal was 1. housekeeping who made my room didn't make my bed the first night I was there. she cleaned the trash and the towels but the bed was left unattended it which was a bit strange. 2. the 2nd and 3rd nights of my stay, ALL the lights came on in the room (#402) while I was sleeping for a total of 3x in the middle of the night. It was a bit creepy but I was too tired the first night that it happened where I just fell back asleep (maybe it was a glitch). When I brought it up to the front desk at checkout, they were quite confused (as was I) and apologetic. Had it not happened at the wee hours of the night/dawn, I would have packed up my stuff and ask for another room.
title: Great stay, awesome location but my room may have had a glitch.

review: We stayed here with two teens for 4 nights. This hotel is brand new, cool stylish interior, very comfortable and spacious rooms. Not a given in Europe so this was a delight. We updated to a suite which was even bigger. Modern and spacious bathrooms, separate toilet, shower and bathtub. Rooms were quiet and elegant. Hotels is a great location if you prefer a little quiet and want to walk to the sites. Having been to Amsterdam before we really enjoyed having the close proximity to everything yet ebbing able to retreat the hustle and bustle of the city. It can get a little much so we really liked this location a lot. easy walk to quality restaurant. But we loved our in house restaurant so much that we opted to eat there twice for dinner. An indonesian fusion restaurant with authentic indonesian cooks. My son loved the fried rice dish so much he asked the chef to give away her secret tips and showed how how to cook it. That was at the end of her long shift, we were impressed that she had the patience to teach him. Breakfast buffet was varied and typical European spread with fresh breads, cheese, meats, fruit, cereals and many other yummy treats. We could have stayed all morning just for that. We loved this hotel so much that we are considering going back there on our way through other European stops. Great find. Did I mention the staff? Super helpful, friendly, multi-lingual and fun.
title: Cool, chic and great location

review: Initially wanting a city centre hotel we ended up choosing one just outside the main city centre and it was seriously worth it! no noise, no crowds easy access in and out of the city and great help staff, well worth a little walk.
title: Worth a short walk to the city centre

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: What is annoying about this property is their lack of vision.I was a part of the acquisition of NYLO a USA based chain w the same design concept. We made the customer feel special w music happy hours fireplaces cool drinks and ton of activities and staffHere you might as well be s tree and staff passing by youI stayed a lot and then moved downtownManagement do a better job staffing and include events For such a cool looking hotel it's like a piece of ice
title: Great big room friendly but few staff cool decor

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for a night due to close by business. Modern hotel will clean design suits my preferred style. Restaurant had good meal. Great quiet hotel if you need a place away from the city center (35 mins by tram).
title: Nice quick stay

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We ended up here as our first hotel let us down. But everything happens for a reason. As soon as we entered, the staff were friendly and welcoming, speaking perfect English. Our room was spacious with a lovely bathroom and decent fridge to squirrel away snacks and nibbles. Downstairs in the foyer and restaurant were art installations and exhibitions which was interesting for us. The hotel is about 10 mins walk from the nearest tram, which can be reached by crossing the road at the side of the hotel and taking the path through the houses and woodland opposite.
title: Wonderful staff, big room.

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Our room was awesome. Very comfortable! 5 out of 5 for the room for sure! The hotel is modern, light and airy. We only stayed here 2 nights but both nights the restaurant messed up on our orders. The first night they forgot to give us our salad which went with our pasta. The second night I rang down to find out their soup of the day because the night before we had their Broccoli soup which was very tasty. I was in bed when we rang down because we were exhausted, but we were told it was the Broccoli again so we got dressed and went down to eat. They served us some other soup which I did not even eat because it was not good, and the waiter told me it had pork in it. I had told him I was a vegetarian so I was upset to say the least. He then went away to check and came back with a different answer in that it did not have pork in it. Regardless, I could not eat it but they still charged us for it. So, both nights they screwed up and both nights we paid full price!! Around $100. The front desk were not that helpful either who sent us on a mile trek to a store when we could of easily got a tram which ran the exact route we walked. In addition, there was a soccer team staying at the hotel who were playing football in the hallways at midnight, as well as in the lobby. The hotel staff didn't seem to mind. Overall our stay was great apart from the Restaurant screwing up our food.
title: Nice room and hotel but be careful in the restaurant

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I have spent a great time there with my family. But I have one complaint about the room service. I asked for a iced coffee twice in the day, but i didn't get anything. The rest of the hotel was pretty fantastic.
title: Comfortable place

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stay here for 4 days on the 28th June and had the best time ever. The hotel isn't in the centre but I liked that seeing the quite side of Amsterdam to.. got to the hotel by bus took less than half an hour and literally from the bus stop about 10 minute walk to the hotel.. we travelled into the city using the tram and bought a 72 hour tram,bus and metro card for €17 we bought this from the hotel. The rooms were cleaned every day of our visit. The only thing that I thought needed improving was the ice machine on level 7 every day of our visit didn't have cups or ice had to go down levels for ice.. the mini bar in the room was none existent just an old mini bar fridge that hadn't been filled.. but apart from that loved our stay here and would defiantly visit again has a Lidl about 20 minute walk away with a takeaway and other shops near buy for snacks etc so we never bought from hotel.
title: Partners birthday week away

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Came here for 4 days in July. Hotel isn't central but is a 5 minute walk away from tram. You can buy a gvb ticket for all transport was €22 for 96 hours. Does all buses, trams, metro and train. Which is great because taxis are not an option. So expensive. There is a night bus aswell if you stay out late. 1 an hour. We got a deal with the hotel that was 25% off all food and drink in the hotel. It's brand new and it felt like no one in the hotel knew about it. So that was a hassle. Apart from that hotel was great, cleaned daily. Has fridge, safe, kettle, ironing broad, TV hair dryer ect. Massive beds that were really comfortable. Would definitely go back. Amsterdam has so much to offer for everyone.
title: City break

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed in the hotel for Christmas and New Year 2017. Had a great time in Amsterdam, the hotel was very very nice, it was a little bit further from the city centre than anticipated, but the tram lines were right by the hotel and run every couple of minutes so it was good to see other parts of the area on the commute, the hotel was excellent, very fancy, lovely room and facilities. And I LOVE Amsterdam
title: Very Impressed

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here in mid June with my daughter for four nights. Originally she had booked with a friend however plans changed and I decided to go in their place. We had done a bit of research so we knew which bus we wanted to be on to get to the hotel (number 69) once we arrived at the airport. Once we got on the bus the incredibly helpful driver looked at her phone and worked out what stop we needed to get off at for us to get the tram to our hotel. She shouted to us when we reached the stop - this was our first experience of Amsterdam friendliness and it didn't stop there. After a short tram journey we got off and we felt at a bit of a loss as our hotel was nowhere to be seen. We stopped a passer by and he was able to direct us. The walk from the tram stop is around 5-8 minutes and takes you through houses however once you know where you're going it's easy.The check in was efficient and you must pay a city tax on arrival which was around 20 euros. The hotel itself is stunning inside with lots of quirky artwork and the rooms are quite stylish done out in dark wood. Mini toiletries are provided in the bathroom and there is a kettle with tea/coffee and a free safe which you choose a digital code to use. There is a TV however we never used it. Our break was during the heatwave so we were really glad of the air con in the room. Ice is available from a dispenser in the hall outside the lift.We went into the city centre every day, again using the tram. We bought passes from the hotel reception and the cost was only around £25 each for the four days. The trams are really efficient and reliable however these passes can be used for buses and trains in the city.At night we sat outside as the weather was so warm, there is a terrace beside a waterway at the back of the hotel. The drinks in the bar weren't cheap however drinks are strong as they don't seem to measure anything and the bar staff are all lovely. We never ate in the hotel however the menu looked good.This was a lovely hotel to stay in, very clean with friendly, helpful staff however it is a bit far out of the centre. There were a lot of business people but plenty tourists too. I think if I were to go back to Amsterdam, which I would love to do as it's an amazing city with lots to do and helpful, kind, friendly people, I would want to stay somewhere less off the beaten track. On saying that if someone asked me if I wanted to stay there again I would say yes!
title: Fab stay

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is in the suburbs of Amsterdam. It is 8 mins walk to Tram Line 2, from where it takes 30mins to get to the city centre.The rooms and bathroom are very average. My issue with the hotel is with the quality of housekeeping. They did not remove left dirty cups and coffee, or replenish the coffee. The area is also very secluded, no cafe or supermarket within 10mins of the hotel!
title: Mediocre Hotel

hotelLocation: John M Keynesplein 2, 1066 EP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is a little bit far, but you go there very easily by the tram, just 30 min from the Dam square. It's a modern and clean hotel, big rooms, and friendly staff. The location is in a quite zone of the city. It's also very near from the airportThey offer a overprice breakfast for 15-19 euros.The only thing I didnt like about the room was the bathroom, which I found very little private
title: Nice hotel

review: Every thing was perfect and excellent. Staff , rooms cleanness , and services all fine. location also was very good. near public transportation. There was lots of restaurants nearby the hotel as well as coffee shops and supermarkets with in 5 min walking.
title: Very Satisfied

review: A fabulous hotel, a little out of the city but within easy reach of the tram services. Lovely comfortable room with a great bathroom and complimentary luxury toiletries. Staff were very friendly and helpful and even provided fresh milk for our morning tea. Garden terrace was very pleasant for a glass of wine
title: Birthday in Amsterdam

review: Just staid for one night and did not use the restaurant for dinner (only breakfast). Rooms are ok but with little attention to detail. Breakfast buffet is nice with good variety incl. some healthy options. Location is very convenient and relatively close to the centre. The lobby and restaurant look nice but the hallways and rooms clearly are one level below. Room was also a bit noisy (towards the hall, not the street)
title: Solid but not sure it deserves 5 stars

review: Nice hotel for businnes meetings etc. Not very close to city center.Staff was friendly and helpful. Price was a bit expensive - some extra charges annoyed me. Cleaniness was above the average but there were some minor issues.Rooms a bit noisy
title: Overall OK but nothing special

review: Got this hotel through a secret escape deal (we were hoping for the Hilton! lol), very helpful staff who gave us some info on buses/trams and restaurants etc. yes it is a little out of the way of the center, but it is also close to some good attractions so I suggest you read up on the map! We like to walk so this worked out quite well for us. Room was OK but nothing special, clean and comfy bed/towels, free toiletries, expensive water/mini bar (as expected), free tea/coffee. Felt more like business hotel rather than a tourist hotel.
title: Fine but not 5star!

review: As somebody mentioned, there is a shocking deposit of 50 euros per day per room, other than that the rest is quite satisfying. Quite attentive staff can cater for everything from museum tickets to umbrellas. The rooms are nice with lovely l'occitane products and well replenished daily. Superior rooms get free minibar. Breakfast is good quality but small in size, maybe a bit overpriced. The hotel is in a quiet posh residential area 15 min away walking from the museums and with plenty of restaurants nearby.
title: Quite nice overall

review: In what world is this 5 star. First impression in the lobby very good but that's where it ends. The rooms are maybe 3 star at best bathroom a 2 star max. Serious my grandmas bathroom is more luxurious and that hasn't been updated in my lifetime. Appliances in the room are terrible. The hairdryer looks like something George Lucas casted when making The Empire Strikes Back. No iron/board, coffee machine and the kettles barely big enough to make one coffee at a time. It's 2017!!! Get some sort of device that make a decent coffee and not that freeze dried cheap stuff. For the prices you charge this isn't asking for much. Also where do you get of charging an €3 for the desk phoning a taxi!! Absolute scandalous if I knew this at the time I would have phoned it myself would have cost less even with the overseas charges on my own phone. But I wasn't told this and was unable to dispute it because you already taken it out of my holding deposit which you take on arrival in case of any damage done durning the stay. There's no need for this. Unless you see things in the room as some sort of antiques which could be the case as it does look like they haven't been updated since ww2 Overall cheap, dated, and deceiving sums this hotel up.
title: 5 star??

review: We picked this hotel because of its location adjacent to a railway station between the city and the airport. The hotel is metres from the station. Unfortunately those metres were covered in litter. The rooms were clean and adequate, but check-in is after 3pm. There is storage for luggage, but after travelling from Australia you need a shower and rest not to wait hours until your room is ready. Our bathroom had partially frosted glass with clear glass stripes (no blinds or curtains) with an office block directly in front. The train station has trains to the airport every ten minutes.
title: Hotel mid way between city and airport

review: This hotel is lovely, it's very modern. We arrived early due to our flight coming in at 10am, but they were helpful and let us fill out all our details to make check in easier when we returned at 3pm, and also let us store our bags in a locker room which was controlled securely. We stayed in a triple room, which was quite small and basic, but suited our needs as we were out all day in the centre of Amsterdam. It's very easy to get the train from Sloterdijk station into the Central station, it takes 5 minutes and a return ticket for the day costs €5.60. We also used it as our transportation back to the airport (a taxi costs about €45) and the train only cost €4.50 each. Therefore this hotel is in a perfect location with many transport options around you. We chose not to get the breakfast from the hotel, but instead go to the Spar store which is right next to the station, and does fresh pastries, fruit, freshly squeezed orange juice and fruit smoothies, and was all a lot cheaper than paying for breakfast at the hotel! We also found the staff very helpful in regards to buying attraction tickets, you can buy many different tickets for popular attractions at the desk, which was better for us as we got ourselves organised on our first night. Overall, although this hotel is basic, it definitely provided for our needs, was clean and modern and would be worth staying in again.
title: Great hotel, perfect for staying as a tourist!

review: Snazzy hotel out in the suburbs right next to a park - great for a morning run. It's a good 4K walk into the centre but expect to be out for the day on this basis and wear good walking footwear - no returning to the hotel to dress up for dinner. Amsterdam is a very casual city. The walk into the centre however is enchanting and you will cross many canals and bridges. And we clocked up 12k average each day. Of course you can take the tram or bike but you get a different view of life on foot. There is a multitude of cafes and bars en route for coffees beers or breakfasts. The roof terrace looked lovely but it rained heavily whilst we were there and we weren't able to take advantage. We didn't take breakfast -e18 per day single but e15 if booked in advance . We thought this a little steep and chose to eat out. To be fair once you added in coffees and juices etc unless you're just a croissant in the morning type person. A breakfast in a cafe will come in near enough 15e. So for convenience you may consider getting brekky at the hotel an advantageFree shuttle from the airport is great - just outside and to the left of the main airport entrance. Keep an eye on the minibuses coming in as it can be quite a scramble. Would recommend booking the return shuttle which is not free as we were a party of 6 and they couldn't accommodate us on the day of departure and an uber cost over 50 quid to the airport. Love Amsterdam such a cool and picturesque city. This hotel very comfortable but not necessarily that convenient but expect to pay double for a more central location.
title: Great hotel if you don't mind walking - a lot

review: Great value. Comfortable room. Great location with easy access to transportation, city centre and airport. Park nearby. Good breakfast especially for the morning leaving to airport. Coming back.Love Amsterdam.
title: American in Amsterdam

review: This hotel is fantastic...... a great location with a beautiful park in its surroundings and a rooftop bar with stunning views of Amsterdam Rooms were clean and in great condition with very comfy beds.... bar was quite expensive but where isn't in Amsterdam Tram stops outside hotel and is a 12 minute trip into dam square....Amsterdam is a fantastic place....this hotel is the perfect base
title: Perfect hotel for a weekend stay

review: If you book this place because you're trying to stay at a name brand and avoid the uncertainties that come with obscure boutique hotels, you may be quite disappointed.Upon check-in were sent to someone else's room, apparently housekeeping had not updated who had left and who hadn't. The room key was highly problematic throughout, the room phone is tricky to use, housekeeping is very very poor. There is a mention about green choice and not changing your sheets or towels, but there's no way to opt out. So if you prefer clean bedsheets, you won't get them. There was no change of linen for 3 nights. Bathroom amenities are not replenished so if you're staying 10 days you need to make do with the amenities you received the first day. Repeated calls to front desk for toiletries went unanswered. Laundry was undelivered after 2 days. Room incorrectly mentions complimentary tea service on the top floor when what they mean is there's tea bags in your room that you can use. Housekeeping does not vacuum or clean the bathroom - to test, placed the shower gel cap in the middle of the bathroom floor, found it right there upon return:( Overall, this place feels like a motel. Definitely not at par with other Ramadas.There's a beautiful rooftop restaurant though with great views of Amsterdam and breakfast buffet has a wide spread with waffles, breads, cereals, salads, yoghurts, hot foods and fruits.The location is also a plus point because it's away from the hustle and bustle of downtown but very conveniently next to the tram so downtown is just 10 minutes away. There's also a beautiful park right next door with walking trails. The best part about the hotel is the beautiful, furry, bushy tailed brown cat that was rubbing it's back on the grass when we checked in.
title: Lots to improve

review: This hotel was a great stay. We were welcomed on arrival at reception and asked if there was anything we needed to know and given all the local information we needed and directed to the soverigner shop for a tram pass. The tram is directly outside the hotel which takes you into the centre in just 12 minutes, I don't know where people are getting the 20 minutes ect from on these reviews, it really is not that far and I made an effort to check if this was correct. This service really made the difference between being able to get to the centre. One night we stayed out after 12:30 and was surprise that a taxi cost just about 20 euro so between 4 that wasn't bad at all. The hotel was clean, well maintained, tastefully decorated and the rooms were likewise. The staff were great, they were friendly and helpful when needed and at the right times and would give you enough space and privacy to enjoy your holiday.I particularly loved the rooftop bar, spectacular views over Amsterdam and so nice to relax and chill with a drink and music.I would definitely return and recommend this hotel to others.Thank you Ramada we had a great time and I can honestly say I most of the time can find one small complaint but not in this case it was all fantastic! We will hopefully see you in the future.
title: Perfect Stay

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I've seen many mixed reviews on this hotel but I have to say I've quite enjoyed my stay. I leave tomorrow and I honestly don't want to.I booked this hotel/trip back in January as a surprise for my Fiancé due to it being his Birthday this weekend. The staff wished him a Happy Birthday upon giving us our room keys and even left a note in our room along with some wine and balloons (picture below) which was a brilliant touch. The staff are friendly and are happy to help whenever and if needed. Our room is spacious and the bathroom doors are frosted, so if you stay in this hotel and share a room, I hope you're comfortable with that person. We were pleasantly surprised to be able to watch English channels on the tv while getting ready to go out and the bed/pillows are sooo comfortable too. We'd definitely stay at this hotel again. We've throughly enjoyed our stay for the past 2 nights.
title: Birthday surprise!!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: 99% of staff who I encountered were very friendly. Everything was explained fully regarding room keys, breakfast times etc. The room was extremely clean though not the largest I have ever stayed in. I am dairy intolerant so there are often foods that I cant have. On the morning I stayed for breakfast I encountered Anushka, a wonderful chef. A very young lady who couldnt be more helpful. She baked me an alternative to the usual sweet pastries which make up part of a european breakfast. Nothing was too much trouble.I would highly recommend this hotel.
title: Great position, great staff

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel was great! The staff were all friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and the beds were really comfy- perfect after a tiring day exploring Amsterdam! They held on to our luggage when we arrived as we could not check in for a few hours, thus allowing us to walk around without having to drag suitcases around with us. The wifi was also brilliant and fast, which was very mych appreciated. We'd most definitley stay here again!
title: Would definitely come again!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel central to all the major tourist destinations. We were here for 2 days and the room was clean with enough room for my husband and I. The hotel staff were very friendly and were very helpful with all the questions we had. The train station is steps away and there were great little restaurants all around. We would stay here again.
title: Perfect location!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I'll start with the staff - so friendly and so kind!!!The hotel is well located in the center of the city, 10 minutes walk from the train station.Rooms are so small!And the beds are not so comfortable, but all is very clean.Bathroom is strange, made out of glass and you can see all from the room...Breakfast is very good.Ask for the back rooms and not the street facing as the street is noisy 24/7
title: Nice hotel in the center of the city

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is in a great central location with railway station and Dam Square all within easy walking distance and with friendly helpful staff. Our room was very comfortable and we overlooked the street below.
title: Great location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: First: Breakfast was excellent, but certanly also had to pay for it. Rooms are small and the room we were in had a rumbeling noise during the night (sounded like some kind of motor, that at times turned on and off) It was quite desturbing. Bed vere hard and pillows unconfortable. Electric installations appears to be cheap and has cables under the beds, which is not safe - if you shoud dare to more the bed. Cleaning standart was below average and the cleaning staff just enters when they please. Floors has carpets which obviously collects a lot of dust and unpleasent things for allergic people. Toilet is just seperated from the room with a glass door. Not too comfotable as travel partner can hear and see what is going on in the bathroom and toilet. I would classify this hotel as "Ryanair Standard". You pay for what you get.
title: Resonable for the price, but not a great experience.

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Perfect location near train station. Within easy walking distance to many of the main sites. Also plenty of restaurants/ bars nearby. Rooms were tiny- basically a bed & bathroom. Bathroom had glass walls so privacy somewhat of an issue. There's not much room to store your bags or clothes either. We were only here 1 night so it wasn't a big deal but might get weary after a week. Rooms were clean & staff was very friendly & helpful. Breakfast available for a surcharge. There is a parking lot across the street if needed & hotel offered discounted voucher as parking is $$.
title: Great Location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed 2 nights. Staff were lovely and helpful. Breakfast was nice. Hotel was in a great location. Rooms were unusual but clean and comfortable. Bathroom sectioned off by a glass partition was not great and room light switches positioned behind your bed pillows was a pain with the lights accidentally being switched on in the night. Overall a lovely friendly hotel and would stay here again definitely. Thank you for a great stay.
title: Very good

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here for a week and we loved it.The staff are all friendly and greeted us every time we went past.Our room was spacious which was a bonus and loved the bathroom - no complaints.Highly recommend this place to anyone visiting Amsterdam- the best spot as it's close to central station and walking distance to almost everything
title: Excellent

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I like this hotel , first of all is everybody friendly the hotell are very clean , the receptionist are very respectly people , also the people are working in breakfast are verry good person , i am really satisfied and when i come back i come in same hotell i love amsterdam also WEST CORD HOTELL.
title: fantastic i like and i do again

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here for 5 nights and couldn't have asked for a better time. Upon arrival, staff were eager to help and even asked us what our goals for our trip were so they could point things out on the map for us. Breakfast was great, with different hot choices every day. Literally everything is within walking distance from this hotel (the furthest "tourist attraction" being a 35-40 minute walk) and the central station was only less than a 5 minute walk away. The rooms are quite small, but nothing out of the ordinary for Europe. I would highly recommend staying here and would certainly stay myself again.
title: Great Location, wonderful staff!

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: With less than a block to walk to catch the tram, you are in the city in 5 minutes and can easily navigate the city. Rooms are clean, good beds, and the front desk is excessively helpful. Don't get a room on the front if you are in the three lowest floors because street lights shine in and the noise from the restaurant across the street is loud. The other room was on the 5th floor, not on the front, and had no street lights, and no traffic or pub noise.
title: Easy access

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed at this hotel and we was so impressed. The bedroom was lovely and the bathroom was nice and clean. The history of the hotel was impressive and we loved the history of it all.Tram station to Central is a 5 min walk. There are local shops across the road and a fabulous cafe for breakfast. The staff were really friendly. We would stay here again.
title: Adventures

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Really love the hotel and the room we had. They were really nice giving us an upgrade from a three stars room to a five stars one . The room was huge . Unfortunately the bed were far too soft. I wouldn't go back in this hotel for that reason. The restaurant is quite expensive for the quality of the food . I took a paela and a soup . Soup was ok but the paela disgusting . The choice of wine is ok.
title: Nice hotel but

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Lloyd is a perfect location, not to close, just a short tram to the Centrum. The Staff is OUTSTANDING!!! Robin and the front desk team went out of their way to accommodate an early check in for my sick wife and Flora in the cafe took special care of her with a great Ginger Tea and constant checking till the room was ready. The Facility is marvelous, historic and quaint with a rustic charm. when in A'dam again, we will be sure to Check In at the LLoyd.
title: Perfect wouldn't change a thing

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: So it seems that there is a lot of variability in the rooms... we were perhaps lucky but our room was incredible!! We were told we were staying in a one star room and then got brought to the biggest hotel room I've been in, amazing art decor style and most comfy beds!! We stayed in room 422 so if you're looking for a cheap but incredible place to stay request this! There is a shared bathroom which is just across the hall which was beautiful clean and I never saw anyone else using it. Location wise the hotel is right beside the tram line and it took about 5-10 minutes to get to the train station. Trams were every 10minutes. Taxi from centre of Amsterdam was €20.We only had lunch here but top marks! Great fresh food cooked perfectly and average price.Staff were very enthusiastic and everything went smoothly.Can't recommend this hotel enough!!!
title: Wow!!!!!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Good hotel in excellent location, but bedroom too small for two people, virtually tripping over each other. Beds right up to the far wall with the television. Did not like the layout and the glass partition to the bathroom. Room nice and quiet.
title: Overnight stay

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Really liked this hotel. Check in and out was quick, the room and washroom were very clean and the location was excellent. Yes the rooms are small and washroom is separated by a frosted glass door. There is also carpet on the walls lol Staff was very helpful. Our friends stayed at a fancier hotel down the street which at the time of booking 3 months prior was a lot more expensive but when in Amsterdam was the same price as we paid for this hotel.
title: Would Recommend

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I couldn't fault my stay at this hotel. The best thing about it is the location; you can walk to royal palace, dam square, red light district and lots of great cafes, bars and places to eat and shop nearby. There's a tram stop right outside too, which is easy to get to all the other sights. The hotel itself is modern and very clean. The room and en suite bathroom was great and bed was very comfy. I'm a light sleeper, but didn't get disturbed at all despite the location being so central. Couldn't fault this hotel! Would highly recommend.
title: Excellent!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The title is exactly that.. nice clean hotel in ideal location for everything amsterdam :-) small basic rooms but perfectly adaquete.. didnt bother with the over priced breakfast plenty of lovely restaraunts near by
title: Nice location small rooms

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 50, 1012 SC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had such fine memories from this hotel with its location and lovely staffs with their excellent helps for sightseeing. Easy access for many sightseein like red light, maddam tousu museum , royal palace RABRANT SQUARE with a short walk and bus stop is next to the hotel. Racheal is one of the staff in reception who accepts guest with her nice smile. It is really more than a 4 star hotel for its safety because we should use key card and just residents of the hotel can enter the hotel . The hotel is very clean. U can drink complimentary tasty water in lobby which refresh u after coming back to hotel. A full breakfast in its restaurant makes ur day . The view of our room was perfect . The glassy chairs coordinate the room and u feel a bigger room. The wash room was very clean and suitable. About 3 months ago we had reserved DE ROODE AMSTERDAM HOTEL for this trip but 2 weeks before the trip i checked trip advisor about this hotel and i read the views of guests who were dissatisfied of DE ROODE HOTEL because of its renovation without information to their guests and they had too many trouble with their stay in DE ROODE HOTEL as we were walking in the street suddenly we saw this hotel which was in rebuild and just 2 lamp were lights on and they had opened a small door for their probable guests. I think the views of guests in each hotel can help tourists for a nice choice . If we travel to AMSTERDAM again i will reserve this hotel again because of many good options which this hotel has. Tnx alot for its excellent management.
title: The best hotel

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel and its history is amazing, and I love the way you see and feel it in the rooms coupled with the modern bar/restaurant area. The atmosphere is perfect and it's enhanced by the fabulous approach of all staff.
title: Steeped in history and culture in a nice location

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Most visitors probably leave Lloyd with mixed feelings but the positive ones prevailed in our case! Take your time to walk around the building and discover its rich history. I appreciated the fresh flowers and funky design elements on every corner. We had a 4-star room with a bathroom.. right in the hallway.. and bedroom... with 3-meter floors and windows, which was quirky but really amazing. The breakfast has a great selection of fresh breads, crazy croissants covered with thick layer of chocolate, champagne and bloody marry plus everything most people need. We also got a bottle of campaign for free using the promotion code from the website.Finally, the hotel is located in a modern Amsterdam neighborhood right on water. The canals and most attractions are walkable on foot but you also easily get around with tram or taxi.All in all, the place may not be as suitable for families with small kids or elderly but youngsters and adventure lovers like us should absolutely love their stay!
title: unique experience

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great building, inspirational areas,..love the restaurant, lounge and library. Liked the staircase exhibition telling stories,...the plants area in the basement are a pleasant surprise ! Overall great place. Staff is helpful and friendly. Great to have (sparkling) water at the reception..! Free internet throughout the hotel.Very near 2 tram lines: line 26 straight to central station and line 10 to Rozengracht and Leidse plein. Could not be better. For Jogging enthusiast the quay along the waterfront provides great opportunity to get some fresh air and to jog over the newly developed ex shipping company islands, giving great view to the city. Near 2 supermarkets to stock up on drinks and snacks etc before exploring the city
title: Pure inspiration ! Great base to explore Amsterdam. Great base to get some work done

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We loved this hotel. The location is perfect. There are trams every few minutes (we never waited more than 4) and you're in the centre within about 8 minutes. So easy to use. Tickets are very cheap and you can use them all around Amsterdam, we got much more than our moneys worth. The hotel itself is stunning. The rooms are basic (we stayed 2 star) but clean and comfortable. The bed was wonderful! So big and comfy and the duvet was the best I've ever had in a hotel. We slept like babies. It is like a little museum. So quirky. The restaurant was really nice. Very decorative but a little pricey for our kind of stay. We mainly ate out. The coffee was lovely. I cannot fault the place at all. We will definitely stay here any time we are in Amsterdam.
title: Lovely place. Will book again.

hotelLocation: Oostelijke Handelskade 34, 1019 BN Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The nice big 1 star room. It was impressive.The hotel was at walking distance to our ship !!Very easy to walk along the boardwalk, even with the luggage.The employees at the desk were very courteous, and helpfull.They helped us a lot for roaming around the area.Cooooool stay !!
title: Lloyd Hotel, Amsterdam

review: It is good to see that after one year, the quality remains the same. It's a clean and confortable hotel, very easy to come and go wherever you want. White linen and towels are essential, always. They can wait for me next year.
title: Still the best value for my money!

review: Great location during visit at Amsterdam RAI, walking distance, 15 mins. However, due to how the rooms are made, not for longer stays. I was there for 4 nights, and there is not enough space to hang your clothes, no closet, no shelves. The room is very spartan, no door to"bathroom" (which is actually a box). Strange smell in room, windows there, but no to open, no way to regulate the temperature. And most important, not exactly "squeaky clean" as QBIC say on their website. On the other hand, a cool place, super friendly staff in "reception" and a good breakfast. Parking at WTC parking for €29,50 per 24 hours is okay for Amsterdam.
title: Okay for a short stay

review: The hotel is in a perfect spot. 6min from the airport with a train that cost around 3 euros. 15min with metro to the city centre of Amsterdam which is cheap as well... hotel is one of the cheapest in the city in a 3 star range. It is CLEAN and I know something about it because I work on housekeeping in a hotel my self. I am defenenetly going to stay there if I come back to Amsterdam. Highly recommend. No more no less... :) one of the receptionist looks like Mammed Khalidow by the way xD
title: Perfect

review: Beautiful ultra modern hotel. Very close access to all public transport / tram / metro/ bus and bikes.The friendly reception staff are excellent and very quick to deal with requests and provide information on places to visit . Rooms are open plan with super comfortable beds.
title: Modern Jewel

review: Been staying here about 6 or 7 times now, the staff are fantastic so polite and will help you with anything from your room to what you are planning on doing for the day in Amsterdam. The rooms are modern open plan with no door to the bathroom area. The beds are the best I have ever slept in.
title: Helpful staff

review: I stayed in the Qbic for four nights with my partner and 4 other couples. Upon arrival the staff were really friendly and accommodating, and this continued throughout our stay. Our room was spotless with interesting, trendy decor, a comfortable spacious bed, and extras like a wardrobe and a safe which came in handy. The staff also gave us suggestions for local restaurants and bars, things to do and places to visit, and arranged a trip to the Van Gogh museum for us!Every morning there was a variety of pastries available for all guests free of charge, also with unlimited hot drinks which was perfect! The staff also put out platters of local food including cheese and pickles some days!! The location was ideal- a five minute walk from Amsterdam Zuid train station, tram and bus station, and a local bike hire was less than a five minute walk away too. It then took at least 15 minutes to get into the central, which was perfect! Overall, this hotel is perfect for couples, students and anyone with a low budget looking for good quality and a comfortable stay! Brilliant value for money :)
title: Bloody brilliant!!

review: We arrived on a quiet Wednesday to be greeted by a smiley and happy receptionist, who was very helpful and informative. There is free coffee and tea available all day and a lovely "common room" to sit in an enjoy your drinks. The hotel is directly on top of a metro and tram station with easy access to central Amsterdam.
title: Short stay

review: Qbic Hotel offers a good service and ambience. It also offers a good location, close to the Zuid Station and line 5 of the tram.The staff in Qbic Hotel are very recepitve and attentive.Summarizing, it was a great time!I highly reccomend!
title: Good experience

review: Hotel is well situated, ideal for using the bus/tram/metro going downtown,personnel is kind and efficientBUT !!!!rooms are totally unacceptable with bathroom (including WC directly open on the bedroom with no door to close !!!You'd better not be sick or comer for the first time with your new girlfriend... A real romantic night ... killer !!+ another inconvenience: the bed is close to the wall so impossible for one of the sleepers to get out other than by jumping over the other one, incredible.this hotel maybe ok if you are alone but forget it if you're a couple.Really disappointing, run away.
title: Awful comfort: WC in the sleeping room with no door !!!! )-:

review: A very nice place to stay More than content Very well decorated , a very comfortable bed , a lovely bathroom , although it's located a little out of the city, it's next to a train station , so you may reach the center very easy , it's pretty close to the Olympic stadium and me , as a Greek , was really impressed that all the surrounding streets had Ancient Greek names , a quite area , though there were enough sites to enjoy cafe or dinner A simple but interesting breakfast , lovely stuff Nice and international , mainly young guests I d certainly come back on my next visit to Amsterdam
title: Lovely

review: We stayed here on our last night in Amsterdam because we had a very early train to catch and wanted to be close to the station. The check in process was easy (no time slot or curfew) and the room was clean and modern. The staff was friendly and the building was secure. They also provided free and very fast wifi. The only note - in our room there was no bathroom door. Which we didn't mind, but I know some people might prefer a bit more privacy.
title: Perfect for train travelers

review: Room wasn't really spacious, but it was well maintained, modern and clean. The view from the room over the city was amazing. Located in the west it's a little out of the city centre, but very close to the airport. Will stay here again if I have to.
title: Very nice hotel

review: We stayed here for a wedding, we cannot recommend the hotel enough. Clean and modern with helpful staff.Initially we were worried the hotel was too far from the centre but we could not be more wrong. The number 13 goes from across the road and you are at Dam square within 15 minutes. Figuring out the tram routes was easy and actually we opted to walk a lot of the time as things are closer than they seem on the map.The roof top bar is amazing with stunning views.Thank you for a wonderful weekend
title: Wedding in Amsterdam...

review: We have stayed in hundreds of hotels over the last few years. This ranks with the best of them. The positives: clean property and room, friendly and accommodating staff, 2 minute walk to tram to center city, walking distance to restaurants(about 1 mile), large rooms, great water pressure in sink and shower, good linens, the best wifi you'll ever find in a hotel, quick elevators, great breakfast on 17th floor with fantastic views of Amsterdam, on site restaurants on 17th floor though we only ate at the bistro and not the pricey restaurant. Only negative: room lighting is cave like which you won't discover until the sun goes down. They really need to add some significant room lighting-natural light is no good at night. Bottom line- you'll have a great night's sleep and avoid the masses in center center.
title: Great Hotel And Staff

review: My boyfriend and I stayed here on July the 23rd for 4 nights. We arrived at the hotel around 11am after getting a taxi from the airport as the shuttle bus wasn't available for another hour or so. It was only a 15 minute drive from Schipol and only a 15 minute tram ride into the centre so the location was ideal.We were aware that check in time was 3pm so we weren't expecting a room straight away, however, when we arrived the receptionist offered us a change of room to one that was already ready but it was a twin instead of a double. We thought this was the best option so we took her advice. The room was very spacious and modern and the beds were very big and so comfortable (they were also pushed together) and it was a lovely room to come back to after a long day of walking around the centre of Amsterdam.The staff were very friendly and keen to meet the needs of their customers. They also offer bikes to their customers to rent which was a fantastic idea and cheap for what it was therefore I would definitely recommend to anyone staying to spend the day in Rembrandt Park (just outside of the hotel) on these easy-to-ride bikes.They also offer a 5.00 euro drink voucher to spend in the skybar in exchange for having your room tidied, we were interested in having a drink on Floor 17 so we were definitely for this offer. The bar was very relaxing and they had lots of drinks to offer, however, be prepared to spend quite a lot of money up there. (Just like the rest of Amsterdam)Overall, the stay was wonderful and my boyfriend and I will definitely be coming back for a longer stay hopefully within the next year. The trip we had wouldn't have been the same if we weren't staying at this amazing hotel.Thank you to all the staff.
title: The perfect hotel to come back to after a busy day in Amsterdam

review: Stayed for 3 nights in July for my partners birthday, lovely hotel! Service not so great! Rooms were clean and lovely but we're mis lead to it having a bath, and also they take an additional £150 on top off room price, incase off damage, I left on the 27th July, still haven't yet received that refund, also they charge city tax is well, which is fine but didn't inform us off this till the end.
title: Nice stay with a few things that ruined the end for me

review: Stayed here for three nights last weekend in order to see U2 at the Amsterdam Arena. Thousands of fans in the city had pushed the price of hotels up but I’d booked this trip back in January so had managed to get a decent rate.The hotel provide a shuttle service from the airport. You just come out of the arrival hall and find shuttle bus stop A9. The service runs every 40 mins and takes about 15 mins to the hotel.Check in was quick and staff efficient and friendly. Had brought the wrong plug adaptor with me but the souvenir shop sells them so was able to buy one easily.Breakfast is in the restaurant on the 17th floor. Fantastic views and superb choice of food. We were offered a discounted rate of 15 euro per person at check-in but didn’t think we be eating there so didn’t take it up. As it was, we ended up eating breakfast there on two mornings and enjoyed it. Full price was 18.50 euro p/p.Had a couple of taxis on the first night to get into the centre and back – they were around 20 euros each time. It makes much more sense to buy a travel card (again from the souvenir shop) and use the trams which run every 10 mins past the end of the road the hotel is on. For 12.50 euro each we got 2 days free travel on trams, buses and metro around Amsterdam. The woman in the shop explained exactly how to use the tickets, gave us maps and we had hassle free travel for the whole weekend.Had a late night drink in the bar on one of the nights. Good service and nice atmosphere.Hotel arranged a shuttle bus back to the airport – I would advise booking this when you arrive as it only has 7 seats on the bus and gets full.Nice hotel – would definitely stay here again.
title: Good stay and shuttle service too

review: Hotel is lovely. Nice quiet location and beautiful views. After a delayed flight we were keen to get on the shuttle ( one of the key points for booking this hotel) we arrived 20 minutes before it was due and it was a no show. Called hotel and they advised traffic issues ( this was correct and assured the next one would be Within 40 mins) again a no show. The other hotel shuttles even recognised us from how long we had been sat there! Eventually came. Checked into hotel no problems. Tram 13 straight into central. Even walked too and from central. Bar and terrace lovely - pricey however. Be careful of the showers, low trays mean towels used to stop floods. The lockers in the luggage storage don't work so ensure luggage padlocked. Biggest let down was the shuttle back. Advised no space back when enquirer so an uber booked. While waiting for the booked über - shuttle driver asked if we were going to airport- strange question for a full minibus being already booked with uber waiter we ended up 50euros down due to highway shut. I would stay again. But make use of the trams instead of relying on the shuttle
title: Good if you've been to Amsterdam before

review: Stayed here whilst having a weekend in Amsterdam celebrating a 50th birthday.Check in was smooth and efficient and the six of us,3 couples,were given rooms next to each other.The rooms were clean,comfortable and well equipped.Hotel staff were pleasant and helpful.Rooftop bar with fantastic views is worth a visit.Initially I feared we would be too far out of the centre but it proved to be the perfect location.Ten minutes on the tram from the stop outside the hotel and you're in the thick of things but when you're done you can leave the madness behind!
title: Perfect location.

review: Couldn't fault this hotel. Do not listen to the bad reviews. Roof top bar and restaurant was amazing. Rooms were decorated lovely and staff were very pleasant. Tram goes straight into the centre and the stop is right outside- would definitely return. All in all it was a great trip.
title: Great stay

review: Good hotel in the perfect location, with tram stop taking you into Amsterdam centre. Room was very basic and on the small side but wasn't really a problem as we spent the majority of our time exploring Amsterdam. Breakfast is good with a nice selection but the toasters are the worst I've ever used! Staff are mostly good and friendly but some spend way too much time faffing. Floor 17 bar is very relaxing with some beautiful views over Amsterdam both day and night however the staff in this area of the hotel are too slow with their service, drinks seem to take forever even in the quietest times. But overall pleasant stay, very convenient.
title: Great Stay

review: Very presentable hotel with nice staff.I would suggest that the word 'Centre' in the name is misleading as the hotel is a 20 minute tram ride away.All in all, a nice clean hotel. We booked a couple of breakfasts when we first arrived but after the first, we decided we'd be better off just grabbing a coffee from the 'cart' in the reception area. To be fair it was the first week of the school holidays which made breakfasting a tad manic.
title: Nice hotel but misleading name.

review: For us this hotel was great, lovely location overlooking the park, city centre tram stop just 2mins walk away, big quiet rooms, great restaurant with views!Hotel staff made a birthday stay very special.
title: Birthday celebrations

review: The hotel is not close to the center but has a very good connection with Dam Square using tram 13. The hotel is located in a green area near Rembrandt Park; the services are ok, breakfast is fresh and various at the 17th floor with a very nice view over the city. I can't say that is a 4 stars hotel but could be a good choose for a crowded city like Amsterdam. Another plus is that the hotel has its own bus to and from the airport taking only 15 min one way road.
title: Nice and friendly

review: This is an excellent hotel,quiet in a good position with a great tram service outside of the front door. An excellent shuttle service to and from the airport. A good Wi-Fi reception. Braeakfast was very good with plenty of choice
title: Hotel Ramada Apollo

review: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in June 2017. From check-in the staff were friendly and helpful. When I requested a change of floors just after we checked in, it was no trouble at all, and was done immediately. We used the airport shuttle, a free service from the airport to the hotel. The hotel is very quiet, and the room was comfortable. The 2 beds pushed together made enough space to accommodate a child as well. We did not eat at he hotel, however there is a place in the lobby to buy coffee and a few other things. The little shop has tram tickets, I spoke to 2 different people there, and they were very helpful and friendly. The tram stops very close to the hotel. A short walk away is Mercatorplein, a square where you will find restaurants, a supermarket, bakery and a fruit shop. There is also a lovely park right by the hotel, where you can walk or cycle. Altogether, a pleasant stay, only 15 minutes from the middle of Amsterdam.
title: Family visit to Amsterdam

review: A very good hotel- the room had great standard, was clean and had a wonderful view. Sadly not too friendly staff on the rooftop bar/terrace. Also its not very far from Dam square- by taxi, tram or one of their rental bikes. Other than that: I would def recommend Ramada!
title: Terrific!

review: The room was clean. steday wifi, freat 17 th floor and secent breakfast. Pretty far from the city center, but all pales compare to the bed! we ordered a double bed and got teo twin beds pushed togeter, with a flat twin mattress on each' which didnt even fit the bed. I dont know how a hotel which respects itself can call this a decent bed. I understood that all beds were like this. very disappointing.
title: overpriced. Terrible beds!

review: Ramada Apollo is a hotel with nice rooms, situated in a quiet aera not far from the city center. The rooms are nicely decorated, and modern. Could have been cleaned a bit better. The staff has a way to go to make me call this hotel a home away from home...
title: Not a home away from home

review: Visited this hotel on a motorcycle as par of a European tour with friends from the US, booked for the parking facilities, (we normally stay closer to the centre,) and this hotel was perfect, tram stop right outside, night bus stop outside too if you plan to get back after midnight!Rooms were spacious and clean, Floor 17 drinking and dining with far reaching views is spectacular, comfy bed, great shower, nothing not to like about this hotel. We didn't get breakfast here, but the stall in the lobby was useful and very reasonably priced for coffee and light breakfast snacks
title: Bad Tad tour 2017

review: Location in the heart of Amstetdam not to far from Dam square. At the back of htl theres a tram station. Only 3 station goes to city cebtre. Beautiful lobby. Variety brrakfast menu on 17th floors. Big room. New furnished. Recommended
title: Nice modern hotel

review: The good:Hotel is modern, with new decoration.Rooms are large.Good access to Rembrandt Park.The man in the gift shop is very helpful.The bad:Despite the 'central' name, this hotel is not at all central. It's a 5 min walk to the tram, then a 20 minute journey to Amsterdam. When you include waiting time the centre is 30 minutes away.The area near the hotel feels a bit unsafe. I wouldn't want to be a lone female near the hotel late at night.The price is too high for the location. I could have paid the same and stayed in the centre.The breakfast is much too expensive, and was much too busy. There were always queues for the coffee machines, and we had to wait 15 minutes for somewhere to sit down.Staff can be rude, especially the night staff.There is no way to have a shower without flooding the bathroom floor.The building is ugly. It has to be the tallest building in Amsterdam, and stands out as an eyesore.
title: Overpriced - Poor Location

review: The hotel is huge but lacking substance, no room space to really move around!....The shower room very small with no curtain or door to prevent water from splashing all over floorPricey restaurant on the 17th floor we bought a 24 hour day pass and took Tram 13 which took us to the City Central where we found good food!.....It says it's a 4 star hotel but really it should have been a 3.... Another problem was with the shuttle bus which isn't really very big to accommodate 5 people with lots of luggages....The driver saw us and rudely said he could not take us and also one of the staff told me I had to pay to take the shuttle bus which I have never heard off!....The staff at the front desk was very friendly and was willing to help....And the gift shop workers was also very nice.
title: Big hotel with very little excitement....

review: This review comes along side my partners and I cannot fault this hotel in anyway. We are reluctant to visit Amsterdam if the ramada has no vacancies available during the time we want to visit. It is honestly one of the best hotels me and my partner have visited and cannot fault the staff. We are hoping to revisit Amsterdam in august and are looking to book here again, and will only ever stay in this hotel when we visit. Everyone that visits Amsterdam and asks where to stay the ramada is always the first place I suggest. The facilities the hotel offers are fantastic, and tram 13 which takes you right to the centre in less than 15 minutes is right outside. The hotel offers free airport shuttle from airport to hotel and is only €5 Euro if you book to take you back at the end of your visit. Overall this is a hotel you will not regret!!! :)
title: 4th time visting

review: Arrived early this morning and we was able to check in early and the staff are excellent... very accommodating! Got are room early which was great but we booked a deluxe room but they are very small. Clean and high standard just very small. Sky bar is boss:) lovely little vibe up there. Going back up tonight so looking forward to it. The room issue is probably me being a snob ha but I like what I like.. Hope this helps :)✌️‍❤️
title: Hernan Woodstock

review: My husband and I made one booking, and my friends made a separate booking. Both for the same type of room, at the same time, arriving and leaving on the same days. We had completely different experiences. CHECKING IN: all 4 of us arrived together as a group. My friends did a pre-check in at the desk, took about 10minutes. My husband were unable to do a pre check in, because they could not find our booking. When they did eventually find it, they did not pre check us in, and we had to come back and wait again later. Complete waste of time. Also, the other couples bags were taken by staff for holding, where as my husband and I had to walk down to the basement and do it ourselves. Why the other couple had service and we didn't I don't know.ROOMS: On arrival the other couple had water, robes, chocolate and slippers. We had none of these. Our towels were also not replaced on the second day, and when I phoned down for replacements they didn't answer their phone, twice, but did tell me it was a 24/7 service. They also had a better view and a bath. We had a crack which was glued back into our room door, and a separate shower/ toilet area within the room. We also had a cupboard area tucked into a corner with no light above it. Our desk light didn't work and bathroom doors needed you to push your body weight against them as they stuck so much. The room was clean but poorly designed and I was furious that my friend and I paid the same price when their room was so much nicer.BAR: A joke. A complete joke from the start. The staff were rude, overwhelmed and had no idea what they were doing. We came up to the roof for some food and drinks, we were not approached for a very long time. We ended up going to the bar to get service, despite people around us being served at the table. We asked if they had a menu in English (there was one on the wall, but not on the table), we were told 'no'. When we asked for some help translating (it wasn't offered) the gentleman proceeded to tell us that the portobello mushroom was a fish. We then asked for a wine list (we run our own restaurant at home- so I admit, we like to know our wine options to match our food), we were told there wasn't one- so we ordered beer, as we didn't know the options. Then we saw people being served several wines around us. Also, there is a huge bar/ fine dining restaurant on the floor below, with a two page list of options. Why a staff member could not access this, or at least tell us about it I don't know- but they lost out on a huge amount of custom from us by doing this. The food itself was good, but then again, we didn't know what else was really on the menu. On another night we went to the lower bar, I had a mojito which was cheaply put together and very basic and they brought us the wrong drinks- 3 times. They had no idea what we ordered and only admitted on this on the last occasion. It was embarrassing when we had to point out we ordered a sherry, not a wine. Normally, I would not hasten to point these issues out- but if you are going to sell yourself on being a high end bar- live up to it. It's basic with some pretty lights at best.And if you want to get to the 17th floor- good luck. The 17 button was broken in our lift, so we got out at 16 and walked up.CHECKING OUT: Again I have no idea why my experience seemed to take a complex amount of time. I stood in line at one desk, then was asked to move around- whilst carrying all my luggage. I complained about a few of the more prevalent above issues and was given a limited drink voucher. Poor effort as far as I'm concerned. The other couple we came with don't drink wine, had a room full of extras and quick/ helpful service- but we didn't. I am so angry we made the same booking for the same price, arrived and left the same day but left feeling completely deflated.
title: Inconsistent from start to finish

review: My mum and I visited Amsterdam late June 2017 and this hotel was perfect for us. The hotel is in an old Amsterdam style canal house, tall and narrow. We were on the top floor and we were warned about the steep stairs, so we didn't mind it, but if you do have health problems, I wouldn't recommend a room above the ground floor. The view from our room was lovely, we could see out over the canal. The bed was comfy, shower lovely and the décor was fabulously odd and quirky. The location was great, a short walk from everything it seemed. I didn't overly like the breakfast, but then I am not a fan of continental breakfasts personally! My mum enjoyed it. The staff were very nice as well.
title: Lovely stay, excellent choice for hotel!

review: The location first of all, was perfect, a stone's throw from all the local tourist attractions. The rooms were very quirky, but in a good way, for example our room had a basketball hoop, which meant for an easy pastime, whilst the girlfriend was in the shower! Only one real problem, which was the bed, found to be a bit too big. Often found that the bed was swallowing me up on a couple of nights. This flaw really is me being very picky though, as overall my experience of Max Brown was excellent.
title: Quirky and Slick

review: We walked into the bar and were warmly greeted by the bartender/desk clerk. It's the first time I ever checked into the hotel at the bar! We were taken to our room up two steep flights of stairs, and were pleasantly surprised with the cute decor and deck area outside our room. We loved this location--close to the train station and within walking distance to many of the places we planned to visit. The breakfast was great, with many options, but it was quite busy and a challenge to not bump into others. We would definitely stay here again!
title: Comfy, unique hotel.

review: There was no space for luggage, but we were travelling light so ok. Our room 404 was tiny, the double bed had one side up agains the wall and the pillows were against the Velux window cill (excellent views!) It was hot and we kept the window open resulting in people/traffic noise from the street. I would have felt rather hemmed in if the window was shut. The ensuite was functional and the water pressure in the shower was good. Considerable noise from corridors and adjacent roomsWifi was excellent throughout the building.Upon checkout, our luggage was secured in open shelves accessible at the back of reception via a door at the side of reception. Our bags were not labelled and i just walked in and retrieved my bag when I wanted it. Would have preferred a secure system. They offered to put our laptop in the safe which we did. The corridors felt grubby, the thread bare rug in the reception and the floor boards nailed on the walls in the bedrooms and that make up the 'desk' are all very 'shabby chic' apparently. there was a small stool in the room - but otherwise no where to sit except on the bed. The contintenal breakfast was ok, the breakfast room is small and down a typical narrow tread stair case.The hotel is 2 mins down the road from tram stops which are outside the Reich museum/Diamond museum for tram 2 from Amsterdam Central station, (plus other trams) and the bus stop for the Airport Express 197 bus ($5 per person each way) So from a location point of view it is excellently place.
title: Shoe box room, but excellent base location

review: We booked two nights at this place which is located within Amsterdam city centre. Room was small but cute and clean. Staff was very friendly. No air condition but a fan was provided. Parking in the area is EUR 5 per hour.
title: Authentic, clean and cute

review: Excellent location, a few minutes walk from the main railway station and the town center, in a very pretty canal area. Staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel design is cool. On the downside, we booked a twin and a double room, but were given two doubles. The receptionist explained that they only allocate the rooms on the day and are not bound to honour the booking, as they had no twin rooms left. Since we booked 6 months in advance, they could have let us know. Our rooms were so small that it was not possible to open the main door or shower room door fully without hitting the bed. The noise insulation was so poor that we could hear every word of our neighbours, even though they were talking normally.
title: Mixed Experience

review: Typical Amsterdam canal house, much bigger than it looks from the outside.Staff are helpful.Rates vary considerably so better value if you can be flexible with dates. It was quite expensive when we stayed (>200€ per night)We had a room at the front, lovely view but quite hot (no aircon) and very noisy. Sons at the side was better in both ways.Limited breakfast gets very busyFree wifi
title: Nice location by the canal

review: I honestly can not fault this amazing B&B, the room that we stayed it was amazing! We did upgrade to a bigger room and was 100% worth it! The staff are so helpful and polite and couldn't ask for a better place to stay, location is also great. The breakfast is lovely, really can't fault the max brown hotel!
title: Amazing!

review: I was very excited when a i booked this hotel and understood it would be small rooms considering it was in an 200 plus old house right on the canal. The hotel had great reviews and great photos on Booking.com.We arrived late at approx 2 am and given our rooms. Unfortunately our twin 17 year boys where given a double bed to share when we had requested two singles. However we were so tied and hoped this would be rectified in the morning. It also did not assist the check in process failed as there was a computer issue and the night staff came to our room at 2.30 am to say the system is now working and could I pay for the room. I would have thought this could have occurred in the morning!.In the morning a spoke to the duty manager and stated i was disappointed about our twin 17 year old boys sharing a small double bed when we requested 2 singles. I also stated the rooms were not big enough as the door to the room and bathroom could not even fully open and you had to step over your bags in the room to get in and out of bed. Basically it is the smallest room I've stayed in. And I've stayed in plenty of small rooms in Europe before. The photos supplied by the hotel of a small room is misleading. If a knew it was so small, I would not have booked this hotel. The staff member basically stated i could find elsewhere to stay if i was not happy with their hotel, however he will attempt to find a twin bed room for my boys. His attitude was poor, dismissive and not addressing the issue in a pleasant manner. He also gave me a lecture of how old the hotel was and that is why the rooms were so small. I did not realise 300 odd years ago every bedroom in these old houses had an ensuite bathroom!!!! I get that the Dutch can come across as arrogant, but i expected a little more empathy at $300 AUD plus per night room rate. Thankfully our twin boys did get two single beds and a room that you could move around slightly more than ours. There bags were also placed in the new room by staff as we were out sight seeing. Thank you for that assistance.Just to assist others considering staying at this hotel. There are very step stairs and numerous levels you might need to go up to your room. The rooms are very stuffy even with a window open. But now the good bits. The location is fantastic and easy walking to some of the beautiful sights in this beautiful city. Main train station is only a 10 minute walk away. The design of the hotel is funky and very cool. The breakfast was usual European foods and tasty. The younger staff were friendly at least , however no good bye as we left the hotel after 4 nights.This is the only the second time I've given a hotel a poor review. I've stayed at a lot off hotels all over the world, so slightly qualified to give some input. I'm only doing it so the hotel can improve and maybe assist a traveller when choosing this hotel. I was very surprised I did not like this hotel considering other reviews had been great. I'm a great believer in making my bookings on reviews by other guests.
title: Very small room, poor senior staff customer service

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 176 /180, 1012 SJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: we found all the staff very helpful and approachable, they made a big effort to engage with guests which gave a friendly feel to our stay. the breakfast was plentiful and good quality. our room was not big but adequate for a 4 night stay. very little storage in the room for clothes so only hung up what would crease otherwise.the hotel bar is full of character helped along by the bar man who has a dry sense of humour. the central position of the hotel meant we could get to most places easily.
title: friendly staff and understated classy surroundings

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 176 /180, 1012 SJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Our room was out the back, so away from the two way traffic and tram stops outside the front of the hotel, but with only single pane glazing it was very noisy from the local late night cafes there. The room was small (just able to get around the bed), a bit tired in places and if you are staying for more than 1 or 2 nights (so have a larger case) this had to go on the desk. However, all the staff were friendly, check in quick, breakfast plentiful and a good range.
title: Noisy, small room but very good service
