hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 176 /180, 1012 SJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My husband and I took a weekend trip and enjoyed our accommodations very much. The room overlooked the hustle and bustle of the street. We were able to enjoy the city noise and some fresh air. Walking distance to all of the attractions, 10 min walk to the train station.
title: Fantastic View

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 176 /180, 1012 SJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel was very well situated. It was about a 15 min walk from the train station and close to the canals as well as market square. The rooms were comfortable and beautifully decorated. Every staff member made us feel welcome. The breakfast was substantial and delicious. The pub restaurant was great for dinner.
title: Summer visit was great!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 176 /180, 1012 SJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at Die Port Van Cleve for 4 nights in one of their superior rooms (307) with beams in the oldest part of the hotel. Our room was refurbished to a good quality, large king size bed, excellent linen, very modern bathroom with good shower and bath. All very clean and well maintained. The room was noisy as it looks onto a road at the back of the hotel which is part of the busy canal area with lots of pubs & cafes. We understand that a central city hotel is likely to be more noisy but suggest that you think about secondary double glazing which would not affect the great character of the original windows.The hotel staff are very friendly, well trained and nothing was too much trouble. The food in the restaurant was delicious on both occasions we dined there and breakfast was a substantial buffet. The Blauwe Bar is a great place for a drink in old Amsterdam surroundings and we would definitely recommend the Jenever tasting.Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and we will look forward to returning......might bring ear plugs to combat the noisy revellers outside at night...ha ha. Would have been a definite 5 star but for that. Thank you to all at Die Port Van Cleve.
title: Excellent Location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 176 /180, 1012 SJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel was clean, but tired. We had a very large room by European standards. The second bed was a pullout sofa, but it was not very comfortable. We could still smell the faint smell of cigarettes though this was a non-smoking room. I'm sure that the scent went back years, but if you are sensitive to that, you will find it a bit nerve wracking. The staff was very friendly and helpful in answering questions we had. Breakfast was included with our stay, but even the scrambled eggs left much to be desired. This hotel was within walking distance to many things, so the location was very convenient.
title: Two days in Amsterdam...

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 176 /180, 1012 SJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Excellent location with tram stops right outside. The staff were very friendly, the rooms a good size & clean, the breakfasts plentiful and good quality and a great bar on site - what more do you need?
title: Great Location

review: We stayed at this hotel with our teenagers in the suites on the top floor with balconies and canal views. This was the perfect location situated right on the canal with easy access to the Utrechtsestraat where there were many shops and restaurants. The location was quiet compared to other parts of the center of the city. The beds were very comfy, the staff was always helpful, the breakfast had a large variety and was fresh each morning, the hotel was clean and very well equipped for all of needs. We will stay there agin for sure.
title: Wonderful location, clean and comfy!

review: We had a big corner room with a nice view over the Single canlA bit small bath roomThe air condition worked, but it was also nice to be able to open the windows.Brekfast was great with very nice staffSome may think that the design of the room was a bit sterile, bit I don't care about that.
title: Central quality hotel

review: Used this hotel for a week while attending a conference. Good location, close to centre and main railway station, but far enough away to avoid traffic and noise. Friendly and helpful staff, nice bright rooms, with free wifi and tea making facilities. Breakfast is as good as one would expect for a tourist hotel of this quality, good without being exceptional.Only draw-back may be access: to guard against flooding, the entrance is raised above street level and accessible only via a set of fairly steep steps. Not sure about wheel-chair access.
title: Nice and quet

review: Check in was quite slow, a poor new intern trying to learn the job. He was properly assisted and things move fast. Room very small and not interesting at all. Breakfast room as well small and crowded but with good variety of food. Service minimal but OK. The best is clearly the location; otherwise i have been in better NH hotels around the world.
title: Good location and practical

review: As soon as we arrived we got a big friendly welcome from Sri. The other staff helped accommodate our early arrival and set us up in a clean modern room. Sri convinced us to try the breakfast buffet and we liked it so much we came back 3 times. She also helped with giving directions to places not in the tour guides and was a big help. The central location was good for our site seeing and we would not hesitate to stay there again.
title: Good hotel in good location

review: I just returned from my trip, the best thing my husband did was book this property. It's a two minute walk from dam square (basically you're in city Center)The staff is very friendly and efficient. We got to the hotel by 12pm, check in is 3pm.I requested the kind lady at the reception to try and please early check us in and she was soo cordial and nice. We got a decent room (though they a not too spacious, they fit the need)I was there for four days and not a single day did I need taxi. It's very comfortable to walk around to all museums, markets, shopping and eateries.I enjoyed my walks up and about, in and around my hotel.The ref light district was a walk away too.Amsterdam is a lovely city and nh hotel is amazing. From a tourists point of view I can say with confidence that this property is the best and a very sensible option.Thank you NH.
title: My European home is NH Hotel

review: As with all NH Collection hotels I've stayed at it is beautifully appointed with well decorated rooms, good bed, nespresso machine and a great bathroom.It's right on the canal and the view I had was great.The bar was being renovated when I stayed and the foyer was a real mess trying to cater for the renovations, so hopefully that will be a bonus in future.Check in was also very clunky but again probably due to the renovations.
title: Great location

review: excelent localization, very kind and efficent staff but there is no easy acess for disable people in stairs front door. The superior room is very small and the chair is very big for that space. In general, it was great!
title: vacancies

review: When I came back to the room I found that my jean and t-shirts got stolen. They were all brand cloth. I informed the front desk but they didn't do anything and told me to call the police even though they know I had to check out and leave. Very rude service! Never again back to this place
title: Cloths got stolen

review: hotel near a spui tram station can reach from amsterdam central about 8 min by tram line 2 sure or 5 mybe, then walk about 5 min from behind spui, the hotel is comfortable with spacious room for bed and bath is quite large and the view room canal or city, the breakfast is good, the hotel surrounding by cafe and shop, n just a steps from hotel there is kantjil indonesian resto. .. or from back door hotel u can access to amsterdam canal ...
title: spacious room

review: Though it's a four star but there was no sign of welcome rather no doorman to open the door or porter to help u with the luggage and the outside stairs are too broad to pick ur luggage n take it till reception.and the standard room category is considered to b the lowest n they treat u as if u they r obligating u to let u stay.the rooms r very small and bathroom small too.stayed in nh collection milan and straight from there came to this nhcity Centre hotel which was a terrible feeling after seeing the rooms n the view.they don't have any view.though the room was neat n clean the bedsheets ver super white n so were the towels in the bathroom.but honestly I m waiting to go to my next destination asap.feeling a little claustrophobic.
title: Bad very bad

review: Stayed overnight.Room was tiny but well equipped with complimentary Nspresso machine.West side rooms like 115, 117 overlooks the water channel.Location is great in heart of Amsterdam.Tons of restaurants and hangout places around the hotel.
title: Tiny rooms with excellent location

review: Booked 3 nights in a superior room. We were told at check in that the room was not big but had wonderful canal views. Not big was a gross understatement, no bedside tables as there was no room on either side, I could not see the tv from my side of the bed as it was tucked away on the only available wall space. The bathroom was no better though apparently the bathrobes and slippers (that we never use) were part of the "superior " deal. On the first day we went out early and came back at 6.15pm to find our room had not been made up, we were due out at a restaurant at 7 so it left no time for us to shower and get ready.Search carefully and don't believe the photos shown on the website!
title: Tiny room for exorbitant price

review: Stayed for 3 nights with friends for a city break. The hotel is in an excellent location, very central with plenty of nice bars and restaurants around. The staff were very friendly and efficient . Breakfast was extremely good, buffet style with freshly cooked omelette of your choice, even a glass of Cava if wanted. The downside was the size of our bedroom. Very small , but clean ,and manageable for a short break. No view at all. ( the room our friends occupied next door was bigger with a view!) I would certainly recommend this hotel for a short break.We thoroughly enjoyed Amsterdam. The city bus tour and canal trip were excellent( although we did enjoy beautiful weather which made a lovely change!!) All in all a really enjoyable stay.
title: Nice hotel in an excellent location.

review: The location of this property is very good. We love staying at NH group hotels but our experience here was not up to expectation. The buffet breakfast was excellent, served in a large breakfast area with live counter. Wifi was good. The front desk staff was not very welcoming and so was the house-keeping. We stayed here for three nights and our room was not cleaned properly which was very annoying.Ask for a room on top floor with city view.
title: Location is just Wow

review: We had to book at NH hotel group after our accommodation cancelled on us at the last minute. The hotel was a great choice, it is well located with ALL local attractions an easy walk away. It is close to dozens of yummy restaurants and cool bars. Our room was a little on the small side but bed was comfortable and room was quiet despite the busy street below. We would stay here again, but would request a bigger room.
title: Last minute booking- did not dissapoint

review: Great location. On canal (I had canal side room), about 15 minutes from Central Station. So close to station if want to take train or bus to attractive Dutch towns like Gouda but away from seedier area close to main train station. Lots of restaurants on Spuistraat side of hotel. Also a fancy take-out food place. Pretty walk along Singel and cafes on Singel canal on Singel side. Can walk to a supermarket (Alfred Heijn) north to just south of Dam Square on Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal or walk south to Koningsplein area. Amsterdam takes farther to walk than you might think because of the canals and while I could walk to some areas, personally, I found too far to walk to museums but can take a tram easily. But I think no where in Amsterdam can you walk to everything. In walking distance of the Leidseplein which is one of the "party" areas of Amsterdam but not so close the noise bothers you.I had been worried because heard so much about noise in Amsterdam but not a problem. I was on third floor (fourth in North American terms) on canal side. Aside from Friday and Saturday nights between 11 pm and 12 when some noise from canal boats going by, quiet both inside and outside the hotel. Firm bed.I had a superior room and fine for one person but would be small for 2 persons. Desk, TV, refrigerator but only one desk chair and one sitting footstool. Had twin beds so obviously for two people. I used the second bed for my suitcases. Modern clean bathroom; modern light décor. Very nice toiletries including hand cream. Lots of light through window and nice to look down on canal from window.What is interesting is when I contacted NH hotels Central Reservations directly, they insisted could not guarantee a canal view. But when I inquired through Tripadvisor, a City Centre hotel representative said could have a canal view if booked a superior room with a view. So I booked superior room with a view and contacted hotel directly to confirm. The hotel did have signs saying "pay extra to get canal view" in lobby so you could wait to got to hotel if you wanted but I wanted to make sure I had a canal view. I don't understand why Central Reservations and the hotel have different policies but if you want to be sure to get a canal view ask for superior room with view, put in comments you want canal view and contact hotel to confirm canal view. I also contacted hotel to make sure could put own food in refrigerator and they confirmed I could.Hotel about 15 minutes from self-service Laundromat (Happy Inn 30 Warmoesstraat). Walk north on Spuistraat until it turns into Prins Henrikkade (opposite Central Station), then turn right (east) and walk one street past the Damrak to Warmoesstraat and turn right (south) on Warmoesstraat. Walk about 1 block south.Can walk in about 15 to 20 minutes to Central Station by walking north along Spuistraat. Walking from Central station to hotel slightly more complicated because Spuistraat does not go under that name all the way to Central station so with back to Central station have to go down a small street called Martelaarsgracht which becomes Hekelsveld and then Spuistraat.Great breakfast, better cappuccino than I had in Paris. Six kinds of cheese, croissants, meat for those who want it in morning, hot foods (at end of buffet breakfast room). Very good Dutch style breakfast.Their maps are very helpful. Had a problem which they corrected which is what one expects of a very good hotel.
title: Great Hotel in Great Location

review: Superior room you could hardly swing a cat in. Could not see tv from my side of the bed as it was tucked away on the only bit of wall space. No bedside tales. Very expensive for a cupboard though we did have canal views!
title: Overpriced, tiny room

review: We decided to take a last minute weekend away to Amsterdam and booked a suite here. The staff was super friendly and the suite was great. The room was clean with a view on the canal behind the hotel. The bed was super comfortable and we had a great night’s rest there. Would book again!
title: Great hotel

review: Lovely tragic irony.. i decided stay at this hotel, because i saw it on tripadvisor, this hotel nicely in front of the river. And i booked with my travel agent. Planning for staying 3nights. When i got there, they said i couldnt get the river view room cos it's fully booked. And theres no view for the street view either. So really disappointed!!Okay let's start from the entrance. There's a stair at the entrance. Quite high..You have to pass the stairs if you want to go to the hotel. You have to think twice if you're alone and bring so many luggage. You'll get the trouble. And theres no staff to help you bring the luggage either.At first got room number 030And i really would not recommend you to stay at this room.The same floor with the receptionist. Theres a stair in the middle of hallway!!are u kidding me?!! no way! If you bring big luggage, you'll be in trouble. Especially if you're old. No view at all. The room exactly the end of the corner. Kind of spooky. Theres a noise like a wind blows or the blower of air conditioner i dont know sure. But kind of annoying. Something trouble with the parquette in the front of the bathroom. Becareful for the door stopper. Often bumped to it. Not really safe.It's not worth it for the price, if u stay in this room. Really disappointed!The next day, we move to room number 243 . More better but still No VIEW. Only view for another room. So frustrated here.If you want to iron your clothes, you need to go on 3rd floor. Sleepers dont get in standard room. Or you could buy for 5euros 20euros Breakfast charges if it's not includes with your room.Overall..you guys have to MAKE SURE if you want to stay here, if you want the river view or street view. Cos i got no view AT ALL. Only back corner like barn not good at all. And this hotel more expensive than another NH cos it's quite strategic. But beside that, if you got no view?better find the another one..
title: Bad experience no view at all

review: Hotel is nice location is great breakfast buffet is nice and diverse. sri ( yes as the iPhone lady) is super nice and helpful she works at the restaurant. Staff is generally nice and cooperative and friendly but the single room is really small narrow and rectangular. The bathroom is really small and in a corner so if u open its door; it blocks the TV(this is how the room is narrow).it also has a shallow bath tub so the room doesn't match the rest of the hotel.Hotel has good security measures the elevator doesn't work unless u have your room card
title: Good hotel but Single room is a disappointment

review: Great location, rooms overlook Singel Canal, modern, great location just off the busy central town. Many restaurants and bakeries close by, easy walk to Flower Market and Museums. try the pancakes, they make an excellent lunch.
title: Amsterdam old town

review: Three sisters shared a triple room in this hotel. The hotel is in a fantastic location. It is in the Canal Ring and on a street with many restaurants, cafes and near everything. All sites are within walking distance.The rooms, in NH style, are sparsely decorated but very clean and very comfortable.The breakfast is excellent. And the staff at the front desk are very friendly and very helpful. This is a really great choice for a hotel in the city.
title: Great choice for hotel in Amsterdam

review: I would strongly recommend the hotel nh city center amsterdam. The receptionists are very kind and welcoming and answer every question with a broad smile. The rooms are spacious, comfortable, and extremely clean. Great breakfast !!! There is a wide range of food and options and everything is fresh. The price is good. But the most important thing is amazing location. Very close to Dam Square. Walking distance to any site and we did not need any public transport.
title: Highly recommended hotel

review: A nice hotel located within walking distance to shops, bars, local sights. The room was clean, a reasonable size and the bed comfortable. Staff were helpful with advice, maps etc. The only downside was a flight of stairs up to the lobby which is difficult with luggage and no porters to assist.
title: Good Hotel, Good location

review: My mum and I spent a few nights in the Inntel when we were in Amsterdam, and we were very pleased with the location and the quality of the rooms. I was disappointed that there were no biscuits or treats in the rooms except ones to be purchased at extortionate prices, but I think this tradition may be more UK than European. We chose to just have our room and got our breakfast each morning at a lovely little cafe on the corner. It was a cheaper and healthier option.
title: Comfy rooms and great location

review: this hotel has a good locationif you come with your own car - do not put the hoteladress in your gpsbut the the intersection road : NIEUWEZIJDS VOORBURGWAL200m from thehotel is a parking garageour room was with modern furniture, small but clean bathroom, quietvery good AC, coffeemakerhelpful staffgood pricethe restaurant La Colina in the same street and the italian restaurant belong togethergood wine by the glass € 3, spagetti alio & olio (perfect) € 7
title: all in walking distance

review: I can under stand when hotels get busy that you need to wait. But when people who are booked in advance (at least 5 groups by my count) are told to wait (some over an hour) while 'walk-ins' off the street are checked in, well, that is appalling.And clearly all their rooms became available at once so clearly there is no coordination between house-keeping and front desk. They could have avoided the problem by having housekeeping release the rooms for check in one by one.Clearly their systems are more important than the customers.Not a pleasant stay.
title: Absolutely appalling staff service and horribly slow check in.

review: The location is great, the staff is very helpfull, they lack a restaurant for dinner or room service order, its also quit noisy at night from the outside, also they didnt have toothbrush in the bathroom.
title: Good

review: Spent 5 nights here in August. Most aspects were good, the room and bathroom were clean and tidy, the staff were welcoming, the breakfast we ordered to our room was fantastic. Couple of things could have been better, the room was not ready until 3.30 despite check in being at 3, and after a very early start this was frustrating. The shower in the room couldn't maintain its temperature and kept giving flashes of hot and cold - this was at all times of the day as well. On the plus side, I'd asked the front desk for flowers for my fiancée's birthday. When I let them know they had not arrived, they were good enough to bring them up straight away with complimentary champagne. All in all, good quality and a lovely stay.
title: Good Quality

review: First time staying in this hotel and I couldn't fault it. Room was excellent maid service was great room always kept tidy cups washed towels changed as I have stayed in a few hotels in Amsterdam and sometimes this is not done. Staff were always friendly and helpful wished us good morning or evening whenever we passed reception. Room was a good size don't know what some people were looking for when they say rooms were small. Excellent location for everything hopefully we will get the chance to stay here again.
title: Excellent

review: Just spent 4 nights here.Within easy walking distance of the train station, this is like a tardis in that they have many more rooms than you expect - even extending into the next building. The room was clean and well maintained though this bathroom only had a water pipe to the waterfall shower. It did have a normal shower head but you had to re-attach that pipe. Most hotels allow you to have both without resorting to messing with any pipes. I don't know whether this is a new policy to save some money or somehow that pipe got damaged.Still would recommend the hotel. :)
title: Great situation

review: This hotel is so convenient for bus and tram stops, restaurants and shops. It is possible to walk to many attractions. The room we had booked,a premier double, had a blocked sink, was too small for the class of room booked, was noisy and had steps to get from bedroom to bathroom, not very satisfactory at night for seniors.After discussion with reception we changed rooms the next morning. Breakfast is extra, a good choice but expensive compared to meal in restaurants nearby. The concierge was on duty for most needs and helped us find a fish restaurant, helped with maps and was really clear and helpful. Security is good with card swipe to use the lift and safes in room. We booked out very early on the 4th day and it was trouble free and quick. There is a restaurant next door which allows bill to be paid in the hotel. It was very nice and good menu and happy staff. There is kettle and drink provision in the room and mini fridge. I would have liked a non slip mat in the bath/shower. The room was very clean and staff polite and spoke perfect English. A mostly good stay.
title: So central

review: Service was great, buffet was great, room was spacious and the staff extremely helpful. Highly recommend staying here, the location is fantastic with numerous restaurants at the front door and a tram stop mere meters from the front door also, all for a reasonable price. The only slight on the place is the lack of air conditioning but the air conditioning that spills in from the hallways is enough to keep the rooms at a comfortable temperature. Highly recommend, you won't regret it.
title: Great stay in better location

review: I have been staying at Inntel constantly for a few years now. Other than the location, which is absolutely ideal for Amsterdam, everything else has been constantly going down in this hotel. The quality of rooms and cleanliness thereof is on the decline. The hotel had tied up with a gym next door, which doesn't exist anymore. I doubt if in my next trip to Amsterdam, I will be staying at Inntel anymore.
title: Experience has been deteriorating over time

review: Please save yourself the heartache we endured. Avoid this hotel and hotel chain.Ruined our sons 18th birthday holiday.Took large amount of money our account before visiting amd did not return to us until a week AFTER our visit.No help, no apology, simply did not care.
title: Terrible the way they treated us

review: The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room was clean but small. The walls were thin because we could hear the night life easily. The view is of another building. The location is in the center of town. Lots to do all on foot. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel. Instead we grabbed a quick bite at a cafe a couple doors down. They served the most amazing ham and cheese crosant in my life. I think I paid 6 euros.
title: Nothing special besides location

review: I brought by boyfriend to Amsterdam to ask him to marry me. This brilliant hotel, after hearing what I was visiting Amsterdam for, upgraded our room free of charge. All of the staff were polite and attentive. The room was clean and smart, the bed was gloriously comfortable and even though we were on the 2nd floor facing the street it wasn't noisy at all. This hotel helped make my special occasion extraordinary. For the location the price is perfectly reasonable. I will be staying here again
title: Brilliant hotel made a special occasion magical

review: The hotel’s location is the best point of the property, very short walk to train station, nearby Dam Square and city centre. The lobby area was nothing too special in design. Room certainly on the small size however, quiet, clean and good attempt to decorate in a modern flair, however not luxe standard. Wall air conditioner irked out some cool air. Would rate as a high end 3-star hotel, not quite standard of a 4-star, needs refreshing. Hotels consist of 2 buildings with access to the rear building via an internal bridge walkway. The hotel offers no views with exception of rooms overlooking small plaza in front of hotel. Front desk efficient and helpful.
title: STANDARD ACCOMMODATION WITH SUPERB LOCATION

review: We found the location excellent. Staff very pleasant and always helpful. Facilities very good. Beds comfortable. Air conditioning good. Pleasant sounds from the clock tower on Dam Square. Breakfast varied and plentiful. Staff very helpful when there was a need to Photocopy boarding pass for Airport Assistance. Overall a pleasant stay at Inntel hotel Amsterdam Central.
title: Excellent location

review: We visit Inntel back in March when we visited Amsterdam to celebrate our engagement. Having visited Amsterdam a few times and always being less than impressed with our accommodation we thought we would give Inntel a try. We were blown away by the excellent level of customer service we received from all the staff. Checking in and out was painless, and they couldn't be more helpful when we had to leave our bags there for a short while. The room is a very good size, like i said i have visited a few different hotels and the rooms have been tiny, but at Inntel there is plenty of space around the bed and the desk and seating area is a nice touch. I also love that they have baths! after a day walking round Amsterdam my legs are always in a sorry state so love having a relaxing bath. We did not eat at the hotel but the food looked and smelt amazing!We enjoyed our visit so much that we are returning next weekend for my birthday and have convinced my dad to take my mum away to Amsterdam and stay with you in September. I am looking forward to returning!
title: Truly outstanding

review: This hotel was really comfortable located in the centre of Amsterdam, just 7 minutes walk from the train station. The room was comfortable and provided with kettle , tea and coffee making facilities, hairdryer, fridge with mini bar and a small snacks basket. It was a good area for restaurants and bars and was close to the red light district! The staff were also very helpful. There is a breakfast service available in the morning room but it is just as nice to eat elsewhere.
title: Inntel Incentre Amsterdam

review: The hotel is well located for transport, attractions & shops. You can either walk or use the trams to get to most of Amsterdam. The rooms are clean and the staff are friendly and extremely helpful. The hotel offers the opportunity to purchase tickets to local attractions/trams from the reception desk which can be added too your hotel bill.
title: Friendly hotel

review: Excellent location, 7 mins walk from Amsterdam Centraal station. Had a really comfy, big bed and very clean. Well stocked (expensive!) minibar. Don't bother with breakfast though, very expensive and you can eat anywhere nearby for a fraction of the price.Reception very helpful when we needed to check in for our flight and print our boarding passes, tourist information guy we found wasn't that helpful as his English wasn't great.
title: Fantastic location

review: The best of this hotel is two thing is clean, comfortable and at the train station, if visiting the place on summer time r vacation is great you can easily rent a bike, is much cheaper and nicer than others like clink nord which is well located but much worse rooms
title: Nice rooms, well organized for groups

review: The location of this hostel is really convenient, right next to a major train station. There is also a large common area for lounging. The rooms can be a bit difficult to handle with so many people assigned to one bathroom, but it's manageable.
title: Good hostel

review: We stayed here for 2 nights whilst visiting the city for a concert. There are lots of reviews mentioning that it has a great location... The location was ok but you do have to get a train there which is fine unless you want to go out at night and you miss the last train, then it will cost you roughly €20 in a taxi to get back.The room was clean and as you would expect, the bathroom was modern and had a hairdryer which was handy. Breakfast was quite pricey for what was on offer and after paying for your breakfast you also have to clear your own plate. A normal value hostel which provides a free breakfast I would understand this for but here it seemed a bit cheeky. All in all the hotel was good for what we needed, there is a kitchen that you can use if you would like and a laundry room which would be handy if you were staying for a longer period of time. The bar was open late and there were plenty of tables available. I think you could find as good hotels for the same price closer to the centre but in need this is an ok hostel style hotel.
title: 2 nights in Amsterdam

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: Wasn't expecting a holiday inn to be so nice! Really clean and great for the money, we got a standard double for £109 with free breakfast (although the breakfast was a bit disappointing!) room was big and bathroom really posh, great shower which was also really clean. Taxi back from the local red light district and coffee shops was 40 euros though so get a bus or tram instead (it's only 3 miles)
title: Nicer than expected

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: The room was ok, with the basics that you need. The breakfast was very average and it seems like no effort was put in to make it better. You get the exact same breakfast every day with no variety and options to choose from.
title: Could have been better!

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: We’d give the hotel 3 ½ stars. It’s quite similar to other HIE hotels we have been to over the world, so living up to their standards. A half star is deducted for not having an eye for detail when presented my ID at the check in. We were not looking for a small gift, but at least wishing me a happy birthday on my birthday (day of check in) would be nice. Location: close to A2 high way, P+R Arena, Bijlmer Arena train/metro station (20 min to CS)Room: clean, modern, not that big, clean bathroomWifi: goodStaff: friendlyBreakfast: standard dishes, sufficient choices Overall, not bad hotel and quite conveniently located.
title: H floorplan for HIE..

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: Excellant hotel, close to metro and main line station 5 mins away, breakfast good, only point is that their is no safe in the room, but can use one down at reception which is free of charge. Breakfast is continental style. Lida
title: holiday inn

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: Stayed for 2 nights. Bed was comfortable and room was very clean. There is nowhere to store clothes, just a few coat hangers. Breakfast was fine however choice was limited with no hot choices. In summary the hotel is fine for a short stay.
title: Basic but clean

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: 17 Floor hotel with 4 lifts, our room was on the 10th floor and huge very nice and comfortable, the room was surrounded with windows on two sides, with blackout curtains. TV was 32 inch Samsung with satellite tv with 4 english language channels including BBC1 BBC 2 sadly no ITV or channel 4, but plenty of music channels. Room had air conditioning which was very easy to use.Bathroom had a large shower ,sink and toilet , very nice towels but no complimentary toiletries here .Housekeeping visited our room daily and made the bed ,cleaned up etc.Travel kettle and a few teabags , coffee and creamer and sugar provided,replenished daily.On the whole , a hotel worthy of its 3 stars ,although we had to dine in the Restaurant of the sister hotel Holiday Inn for our evening meal (reasonably priced, 2 dine for 39 Euros) (and we had steak , ha ha ).Breakfasts were provided in the breakfast room on the 2nd floor ,alongside reception. On initial entry to the building via the erratic revolving doors, You will be in the main hotel with the reception (for Holiday Inn only in front of you), The reception for Holiday Inn Express can be found by going through the doors to the immediate left of the foyer , and taking one of the 4 lifts to the 2nd Floor where you wil find Holiday Inn Express reception.l
title: Wonderful greeting on arrival, very friendly staff.Room was a pleasant surprise after an exhausting trip.

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: This is a great place to stay, clean, clear, comfy. Unfortunately meals cannot be charge to room invoice as the most of the hotels of this category, and the front-desk personnel couldn't send the invoice by email, probably more training be required or the system has the features. Always details matters.
title: Nice place, but missing little details.

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: We stayed at this hotel while on business trip coupled with pleasure. We found excellent facilities at this hotel. Staff was very cordial & friendly. Rooms are quite spacious with good quality beds. Liked the breakfast which was quite wholesome.
title: Excellent hotel in the heart of Amsterdam

hotelName: Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam - Arena Towers
review: Great hotel with a very nice restaurant. The breakfast had an excellent range of cereals, bread buns, fruit, and pastries. The meals in the restaurant were well priced and the servings were quite generous. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to the station and the city centre is a 15 minute ride away. The staff members couldn't have been more helpful and always eager to help with tourist information.
title: Great Hotel

review: We stayed for one night our last night in The Netherlands. We were very satisfied with everything, the hotel and the room (family room). Very friendly staff and nice breakfast. The hotel is near a train station and very short from the airport and central by train.
title: Nice hotel

review: I stayed here for four nights over the July/August period. The hotel was very accessible from the airport via train. On my arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful- just what I needed after my 34 hour flight. The room is small, however I didn't spend much time in there anyway. Great shower pressure and temperature, and the wifi was excellent. There are not a lot of eateries in the immediate area, however they are just a train, tram or bus away! Would stay here again! :)
title: Great introduction to the Netherlands

review: The location of the hotel Is one train away from Amsterdam central, which is essential! I paid €26 for a 3 day transport pass to get to central Amsterdam and surrounding areas (i brought this from reception). The hotel is clean, friendly and has positive vibes. I'm yet to see the place quiet... which is surely a good thing, right? Would definitely recommend!
title: Easy

review: I really enjoy the time in meininger hostel/hotel. It's very well organized, rooms are very good, clean, comfortable. I always try to find a meininger hostel when I travel. I really recommend it, it's very good one.
title: Best of the best

review: Clean hotel near Amsterdam Sloterdijk train station but room we had (triple) was basic accommodation. You can easily reach Amsterdam Centraal and Schipol Airport by train. No hope for early check-in (the receptionist didn't even check) so we had to walk around until 3 pm after a 14h overnight flight. The breakfast is good (for 8 EUR p.p. only).
title: What you can get for 100 EUR

review: Stayed here for a base to tour Amsterdam. Just three stops in the train from Schipol.m airport and Hotel right beside the Sloterdjik station. Then it's one stop to Amsterdam Central.There is a guest kitchen and you can have the self catering option if travelling on a budget.A very busy hotel with a lot of groups of young people.There are toys in the foyer and the staff very helpful, one helped us order a taxi bus to travel to our next destination and was able to translate.
title: Very convenient for train station

review: We have just returned from our 3 day trip to Amsterdam and have to say i'd recommend anyone visiting in a group to stay here. It's located in the business district of Amsterdam in Sloterdijk so not in the center. However it's a 1 stop train ride from Amsterdam Centrum and 1 stop from the airport so extremely convenient. They have very flexible room options, we were a group of 16 so had 4 x 4 bed rooms which didn't feel cramp at all. We stayed on a B&B deal and although the breakfast wasn't the best it's was perfectly adequate for our requirements. Definitely a great option if you want slightly more affordable accommodation than in the city center.
title: Stag Do Trip - July 2017

review: Upon coming to this hotel, i was pleased with the location being right next to a station, the people seemed nice and the decorum was pleasant.Then when going to the floor we noticed a very long long hallway with lots and lots of rooms. When we arrived at our room we then knew why...The room is a shoe!A three person room gets you bunk light beds in a narrow small room.The air con and the bathroom is ok, but other than that verrry small.Think the advertising should lean more towards 'hostel' but otherwise the amnesties were fine.
title: Pretty nice hotel for a shoe.

review: My wife chose this place for a one nighter as it allows dogs. Clean and modern it is but the bulk of the patrons here are either stoner students or drunks on stag parties. (They have bouncers on duty at night for this very reason).Rooms are tight for space but comfortable enough.Secure parking is a necessity for us and this is available at 10 Euros a day. NB If arriving by car you pitch up at the rear, walk round to the front, check in, get your carpark key (50 Euros deposit) then you can park up and enter the hotel from inside the building.Sleep quality 6/10 - Return probability 0/10
title: More of a hostel on steroids than a hotel

review: Such a good place, with very good location very near to station, and suprisingly this hotel have an open kitchen that we can cook by ourself, and there is a refrigerator to put our food, but beware, i put my breakfast (2boxes of chicken and 1 box of friedrice and the next day my chicken is dissapear)And hey....they have coin laundry too!!
title: Good place, very crowded hotel but nice

review: This is good hotel, out of town but near the very impressive public transport. The hotel has great staff, always helpful. Tonight the meal was served by two exceptional members of staff. Mayra and Giulia. Just brilliant. The restaurant has good food and good service.
title: Short break in Amsterdam

review: Rooms are great, even cooled before arrival on warm days.Service in the restaurant is fast, correct and friendly. Special thanks to MayraMenu is ok, but for regular visitors a bit more variation would be welcome.
title: Weekly for business

review: Usual Holiday Inn 'standards' = clean, quiet rooms and good customer service. Large car park and very close to the Metro (6 stops away from Amsterdam Central Station which takes about 15 minutes). Restaurant has ambience and the Dutch beer was cold! I cannot fault this hotel in anyway.
title: Great hotel right next door to the Amsterdam Arena.

review: Absolutely recommend this place. Very comfortable beds and so very quiet! Staff are great and very helpful. Great location and really nothing to fault! Please try their burger - my husband is a chef and makes a great burger himself but this was one great burger!
title: Great hotel and staff!

review: Spent 3 nights on vacation. Arrived early at 7AM and got a room, with upgrade at 10AM, were lucky. Front desk was excellent at getting cabs- within minutes. Room was very clean, reasonable size. Safe was too small for our laptop. Breakfast was great, but had to wait most days for the omellete/egg chef to either show up or get started making egg based dishes. We were shocked to see so much litter and graffiti on the streets of AMS early Sunday morning- it was everywhere within half mile radius of the hotel- and probably all AMS. Small groups of loud voiced apparent African immigrants were on some street corners. We did not see very many Muslim women in their tent like costumes, however. The litter had been all cleaned up by Noon. Found a great breakfast place next to the flower market about a 5 min walk from the hotel, sunday at 8AM. Overall the area was great.
title: On quiet street near canals

review: We are three sisters who stayed at the Raddison Blu for a few days following a tour of Spain and Portugal. We could not have chosen a more convenient location, within walking distance of museums, attractions, marvellous restaurants and a fantastic deli. Location, location and location. We had a suite which allowed the three of us to stay in comfort with lots of space. Had wonderful meals in both the restaurant and bar. And have to give a shout out to their staff who, in all departments, were so pleasant to deal with. Totally recommend this hotel to all.
title: Sisters in Amsterdam

review: Trip to the Netherlands for business, stayed here for two nights.Best thing about this hotel is the location - you really are in central Amsterdam, within walking distance of the main train station and lots of other local attractions. Hotel itself was a exactly what you'd expect from a Radisson that is slightly tired. Staff were friendly and helpful, although queues to get noticed took a while. Room was clean but pretty poky. And the wifi was - to be polite - intermittent at best. When I asked reception, they ended up giving me a number for a helpline that didn't really do much to sort it out.So fine; but not great.
title: Absolutely fine; but not really anything special

review: A wonderful hotel, with the best location, close to Dam square,spacious rooms and a very kind staff. Breakfast consists of a generous buffet including: variety of breads, vegetables, fruit, cheese, sausage, cereal and more. omelettes cooked to perfection.
title: An excellent hotel for a family of 5

review: Very good hotel close to the center of Amsterdam with larger than normal room size for Europe. Bar and Breakfast service were great! We also had dinner at the Bar and that was also great. People were very friendly. We also use the Concierge who was a great help for directions and a taxi to the airport.
title: Great Hotel in Amsterdam

review: Good location and very friendly staff! They have a restaurant and a bar. The lobby was inviting and nice to sit in. The price was good and the room was very nice. We were able to store our luggage since we arrived very early from a cruise. The room was ready when promised.
title: A stay in Amsterdam

review: Nice comfortable hotel. We had rooms facing the street, but it was still quiet. Note that some rooms do not have exterior windows but are located within the building. The bar is the best part of the hotel. Great drinks and service. Good breakfast selection. Easy walking distance to shops etc.
title: Fabulous location

review: Very well located hotel near the center. When we arrived we were offered an upgrade we accepted and the hotel room was outstanding. One of the best hotels I have stayed in. Very good breakfast buffet. Friendly and helpful staff both at the reception and at the breakfast buffet.
title: One of the best hotel I have stay in.

review: Location - Great proximity to the airport/train station as advertised. We used the shuttle multiple times to commute to the hotel and to the city. It was easy, but about a 30 minute ride just as others said. Staff - Very nice upon check in. We received an upgrade to business class! :) Bar staff exceeded our expectations. Room - Our room was spacious and the AC worked nicely (especially compared to other European hotels. We received one free water in our room upon check in. Iron, blow drier and mini bar. I have two complaints with the room though. There were hairs that were not mine on both the coffee mugs which made me question the cleanliness of our room. (The bathroom seemed clean though). Also, the pillows and bed were not to my liking. I guess you'll have that from time to time so I didn't dock them for that. Hotel - Nice property with updated decor. Hotel is surrounded by some businesses but not too much else around. Gym - The gym was AMAZING! In my opinion one of the best gyms that I have seen when traveling. They have just about anything you could want there - spin bikes, punching bag, yoga classes...etc. They also have a sauna which was nice and appeared to be clean. Other items - You can rent bikes on site. If you want to go into the city after check in, I recommend asking for another shuttle voucher. Take the shuttle back to the train station and then take the Sprinter to the city. It probably takes about an hour in total to get to the Central Station in Amsterdam with the shuttle ride included.
title: Wonderful gym and nice property

review: Really nice, clean, close to the center, but little old. I expected more. It was a very expensive hotel. it could have given more things to the guest.WE are supposed to pay 2 euros to use the gym... so sad.
title: NIce

review: very nice hotel great service but slightly uncomfortable mattress. would have preferred a room with a view. the lobby area was very nice and well designed. rooms were spacious. would have preferred a gym or swimming pool.
title: great hotel in prime amsterdam location

review: We stayed for a long weekend in June/July in a junior suite which was well appointed. Our only complaint is that the air con would not go below 23c. Our room overlooked the atrium so if we opened the windows, it was very noisy for any voices echo in the space. A man came to try to fix the air con but failed. The weather was not hot when we were staying 4 weeks ago, but due to he air con problem, we were too hot and uncomfortable at night. I note this has been a complaint of others guests and management need to sort this out.I have given a 5 star recommendation as the location is great, the room was otherwise good and above all, all the staff were most helpful.I particularly want to highlight that upon our departure, I left a purse containing UK sterling in our room. When I got home, I realised my loss and rang the hotel. The room attendant had found the purse and it was returned to me [intact] free of charge. I have written to the room attendant to thank her for her honesty. Apart from the air-conditioning problems, I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.
title: poor air con but excellent service

review: Very nice hotel! Great location to access many places in a 15 minute walk. Very friendly staff who provided us a city map to help us find where we were going, and stored our bags for free before check in. They also left a special note in our room, as we were celebrating our honeymoon. The breakfast also had a delicious variety of food!
title: Great location, friendly staff!

review: I cannot say enough good things about the superior service we received at this fine hotel in Amsterdam. Conveniently located to major attractions and well-appointed in both the public areas and the rooms, I highly recommend this hotel. And, the staff go out of their way to accommodate all your needs and wishes. As I said in my title, Superior Service with a Smile.
title: Superior Service with a Smile

review: The hotel is very well situated, the room was nice and simple with a big smart tv and The staff was great. However, I was disappointed with my poor late night dinner, ordered some pasta with tomato sauce but they tasted really bad.
title: Well placed and simple

review: This a really clean hotel ideally situated in the centre of the city. It is in a quiet area but you can be in the buzz of the city in a few minutes. All mayor attractions can be reached by walking or public transport close.Check-in is very efficient but be aware a deposit of €50 per room per night is taken for "incidentals" This is returned to your account at check-out.Rooms are very clean and of a good size. Beds are comfortable and the air con works well without being too noisy. The showers are powerful and consistent.Avoid the mini-bar which charges typically exorbitant prices.The bar area is quirky and cosy. There seems a lack of general seating areas so look out for the tables up the stairs above reception. It's a very pleasant area to watch the world go by.Wi-Fi is very efficient with good download speeds. As with all Amsterdam buildings, watch out for the step when entering different rooms! Overall we had a very pleasant stay at Radisson Blu. It's an ideal location for a short break and we would definitely visit again
title: Lovely Hotel

review: Lovely clean room , we upgraded as arrived early paid an extra 120 euro which included breakfast which was mainly continental with bit of bacon and chicken sausage , not worth paying for in my view but was nice and the restaurant was lovely and waitresses were too , in my view almost 500€ for two nights wasn't great value but my partner picked and all in all was nice stay. Anyone going Amsterdam seriously watch out for bikes keep your wits about you ‍♀️
title: Lovely hotel

review: We were 4 of us taking 2 rooms visiting for a holidayOfcourse the location is great with all bars , coffee shops just round the corner and the ref light district Then check in was smooth , rooms are ok size nothing great but comfortable. We don't take the breakfast as there are various options around the hotel much cheaper The gym doesn't have all the equipment but decent enough to start your day with a workout. The only service we used was the front desk for some advise on Resturant and they were courteous. Be careful to carry your room cards when you come late at night back to hotel as they shut the access inside the front door and at time no one is at reception to let you in at wee hours which was a big negative for me as it's good to have security but not good to have manpower and leave the door locked for guests .Overall a nice hotel but nothing wow
title: Business hotel in heart of RLD

review: We spent one night at the Radisson before boarding our cruise ship. Nice hotel and very friendly staff. I'm not wild about the location, it's a pretty dirty neighborhood. The hotel is fairly quiet, although we were there on a Friday night and there was lots going on. I would recommend it.
title: Nice Hotel

review: I initially just booked a day room here, but ended up extending my stay over night just because I was so happy here. There were some great deals for room service (see the 'grill special'). Staff were kind and very helpful. TV in the room supports Apple airplay and steaming from windows laptops, which I found very useful. Will come again!
title: Excellent service, comfortable hotel, great room service

review: Our room was an excellent size with a comfortable bed and clean bathroom. Wifi worked well the whole time.We also had the breakfast package, which was worth it. They provide excellent selections from yogurt/toppings to meats/cheese/bread selections. You can have made to order eggs or waffles as well. Definitely have to fresh squeezed orange juice to top it off! The gym was clean and provided enough equipment. The location was an easy walk to some main neighborhoods and attractions --for example, the Rembrandt house. If you need to park, be sure to reserve a spot ahead of time.
title: Gorgeous with a good location

review: Very nice hotel, well located, clean, serious with a very good breakfast. No negative point. I saw that Amsterdam is quite expensive in terms of hotels during summer....The radisson Blu is a good compromise Quality / price. You can go for it,,,,you will not regret it.
title: 2 Weeks in amsterdam

review: The Radisson Blu Hotel is a great place to stay, centrally located and close to everything. The room was very clean and a good size. Room to move. The bed very comfortable and a good sized bathroom. The hotel has fast internet, it is in a quiet location and public transport is only a 5 to 10 minute walk. The location is perfect, 20 min walk to the museums, 15 minute walk to the central train station with shops, cafes and bars everywhere. Hotel bike hire or a 5 minute walk to Damstraat Bike Hire. Hotel Staff were happy and very helpful. Recommended.
title: Stay here

review: Great hotel perfect location close to everything , rooms are great and clean the beds are very comfy ,hotel staff are very helpful and always go out of their way to help you , I highly recommend staying here
title: Amsterdam

review: You can now stop looking for a hotel in Amsterdam. This property was clean, the staff was wonderful, the internet was reliable, the food was excellent, the location is fantastic, the air conditioning was perfect, the entire experience was lovely.
title: Look no further ~ say here!!!

review: A good 15 minute walk from train station. Good location for sightseeing. Room was clean and reasonable size. Nice bathroom and well equipped. Would have benefited from full size mirror in the room. Was slightly annoyed that the mini bar was not fully stocked on arrival and there was a charge against the room for missing refreshments, reception were happy to resolve once reported. Room service was friendly and food was good.
title: Good location for exploring

review: We stayed for three nights in a standard room on a room-only basis. On check-in, the Receptionist said "I can offer you an upgrade which would include free breakfasts and a canal view". My first thought was that this "offer" was a free upgrade, but it transpired that this was not the case at all and we would have to pay a not inconsiderable supplement for the privilege. Needless to say, we declined her "offer". The room itself was excellent, quite modern furnishings, spotlessly clean, with all necessary amenities. There was no outside view, but we did have a window overlooking the main atrium. The hotel itself is very central and within easy walking distance of the Central Station, shopping areas, and museum quarter. We only had one main meal, in the hotel bar, and this was also of excellent quality. The staff were all unfailingly pleasant and eager to help.Other than the cost of breakfasts, (which we had to avoid as even a continental breakfast would have cost us almost Euros 20) we would thoroughly recommend this hotel as an ideal base in Amsterdam.
title: An Ideal Hotel In Amsterdam

review: First the location. Can't beat it. Just seconds from Red Light District and a short stroll to Damstraat and all the restaurants and shops. Second the hotel itself is a nice, quirky assembly of various buildings straddling across a street with connection underground. Given the structural limitations there's an unusual amount of twists and turns before I could reach my room. But it does lend some character to the property. Third my room and the bathroom were surprisingly large for Amsterdam, though it faced just a back wall/courtyard with no view to speak of. But it was nicely appointed so no complaints. Fourth the breakfast was alright. Decent spread, though not cheap, certainly enough to set me off for the day of meetings and travels. All in all, good value for money, with quick efficient service. Will book this place again on my next trip, business or personal.
title: Wish I stayed for more than one night

review: We loved staying at this Radisson Blu, and would do so again.Although our room was not ready when we arrived (0900 hours, completely understandable), our luggage was safely stored, and we took the time to walk to the Jordaan district, where we paused at a pub for a coffee and a bite to eat (apple pie was awesome).We wandered back through the "Nine Streets", admiring the local shops.When we returned to the hotel (about 1300 hours), our room was ready--and we had been upgraded to a fabulous business class room.Over the next few days, we found it quite convenient to walk from the hotel to all major attractions, including major museums, the train station, canal tour boats--the list goes on and on.The staff was friendly, helpful, and professional. The restaurant and bar were good. The breakfast buffet is excellent. Our advice: Skip pancakes; go for the local smoked fish.We did not use the fitness facilities because we did not want to pay the small extra fee.
title: Excellent hotel in great location

review: Great hotel in a great location, friendly helpful staff. Delicious breakfast. Good sized room with modern amenities, single sink. Terrible beds, they need to replace them asap, other than that, it's good value for the money.
title: No title

review: The first thing I noticed was that the actual hotel building we were staying in is not the one shown on the website. The hotel reception is in a separate building, down the sidestreet and across the road. Once inside the hotel it has a crowded feeling, mainly because it is used by so many tour groups and there always seem to be people milling around. Having said that, we were quickly checked in. There is a mezanine level above reception which is airy as it is like a central courtyard. We had a free upgrade to a business class room that was comfortable and in the corner of the hotel, We only had breakfast in the hotel but that offered a wide selection of food and was always busy.The hotel is located in a good position, centrally between the old town, red light district and the National Monument/Royal Palace.
title: A Comfortable Hotel

review: This hotel has what I would call average rooms. No accessibility. Nice restaurant. Good location. Odd bathroom with a step up. Very strange. Friendly staff. I was expecting more. Beds were comfortable but no top sheet.
title: Average Rooms but good location

review: Radisson Bue Amsterdam is all about location location location. The hotel itself might not be anything special, however if you wanna stay in the center of the city - this is the hotel you should choose! You can easily walk to most places in the center in just 10. Rooms are large and well equipped with bathtub, nespresso maschine and so on. A nice feature is the minibar, which actually has a dedicated shelf to your own cans and bottles. I really like this, since the minibar prices are quite expensive and there and there is a kiosk right opposite the hotel. Our stay included breakfast, which was nice but nothing to write home about. Orange juice was served in small shots glasses, which I reallly dont like. Why not just serve it in a normal glass?Would I stay here again? I depends on the price to be honest - we booked through amoma who had a good offer, but otherwise the hotel seems quite expensive.
title: Perfect location right in the center oom Amsterdam

review: This is a traveler airport hotel Shuttle bus to airport is availableNice breakfast but small roomsHotel reception staff is only one by the evening time so if you need somthing you should pick it yourself
title: One night hotel

review: Stayed here during Gay Pride weekend and although other places in town were partying pretty hard, the location was just perfect in a quiet side street. Location is a huge plus, with the red light district, tram access, restaurants less than 10 minutes walk. Canals are right there with even a 1 star Michelin restaurant "Bridges" just behind the hotel maybe a five minute or so walk. The Pastorie bar has great ambiance, and the De Palmboom restaurant was not bad at all. Heck, even the Rusland CoffeeShop which I think is the first coffeeshop to become legal in the Netherlands is smack right across the street. I had an upper floor room with a view of the street in the main building. Now, I saw the reviews of the inner rooms with atrium views in the main building and I guess it's a preference at the end of the day. I mean in the winter time, the sun doesn't shine much, so it is what it is. The staff was very kind and helpful aiding us to the best vantage points to watch the canal parade; thanks Peter-Paul for that. I spent a special day in the hotel and I thank the management for acknowledging that. Thanks, Marjo for making check-in so pleasant. Will definitely be back...
title: Just what I was looking for

review: Great hotel for a trip to Amsterdam. It is located on the tram route with a stop right outside the door (number 12). The room was large, clean and comfortable and the bed really comfy. Breakfast is the usual buffet style but had just about everything you could want including freshly made pancakes and waffles. The best aspect of this hotel was the staff, very friendly, helpful and a real credit to the hotel. I would heartily recommend The Golden Tulip to anyone and would definitely go again.
title: Great stay at Golden Tulip

review: Being greeted by a computer rather than a person was something new for me, and I have to say that I didn't really like it. Particularly when I came to check-out and I found that computer had charged me for four breakfasts instead of two (something to do with single occupancy of a double room I gather - or at least that was what I was told by a friendly human, who had to sort out the muddle the computer had caused!).The other thing was the Wi-Fi. This was not working when I arrived at the hotel, which was pretty irritating as I had work to do. I called down to Reception - no answer after calling twice and allowing to ring for in excess of 5 minutes each time. I went down to Reception to find one poor member of staff trying to deal with check-in/check-out/computer issues/complaints about no Wi-Fi etc. Feeling it was a bit unfair to burden her with more issues, I asked to speak to the manager and was told that there was no manager available. Furthermore, the hotel had no idea when the Wi-Fi would be working again, and apparently the service was nothing to do with the hotel anyway, as it was provided by a third-party - and was a service that the hotel could choose whether to provide or not (which I disputed, as the hotel advertises free Wi-Fi, and I wouldn't have stayed there if it didn't have it!).The above rather marred my visit, which was a shame, as otherwise the hotel and staff appeared perfectly pleasant and I might have considered staying there again.NB. The Wi-Fi did eventually reappear late in the evening, more than 4h after my arrival.
title: Hello Computer......

review: We had a lovely time at the hotel and in the city. The hotel is finished to a very good modern standard and the staff were very accommodating and professional. Only downsides were the lack of a alcohol licence (not a deal breaker) and the fact it was either 2 trams or a taxi to the centre.
title: Lovely hotel, great staff, great food, alcohol free

review: Having booked a one week for a bike/boat tour, we decided to start and finish our holiday with three extra days in Amsterdam. The six days enabled us to visit the many places of interest.The location was one tram stop from Sloterdijk station, which made our journey to a and from the airport easy. The tram stop outside the hotel also made our visits into the city easy. We were so pleased with our room that we asked for the same room for our second stay. The breakfast was the best we have ever experienced in all our travels. It had all choices imaginable and such friendly helpful staff. We also found the staff on the reception desk could not have been more helpful and forthcoming with useful information.
title: Out of Town and Outstanding!

review: The hotel is a couple of miles out of town but very easily accessible with the tram located just outside (download the Tram app for really clear directions based on where you are wanting to go).Very modern hotel, very friendly and helpful staff, comfortable beds, plenty of information and discounts in the lobby for use in and around Amsterdam, and a very quiet and peaceful stay.Tram tickets are sold in the vending machine in the lobby which was very useful.TV selection was one of the best in house and free ones I've used.Bathroom was clean, stylish and modern. Air conditioned rooms. We were able to check in early at no extra cost. I really liked the self-service style check in, very simple to use but staff on hand to help! Though we didn't make use of it I love the tiered approach to checking out at €10 an hour up to 1700. Although a little further out of the centre of Amsterdam I would recommend this hotel, and would happily return!
title: Excellent Stay

review: Stayed here earlier this year with my wife and the room and facilities were wonderful. The location wasn't the best but the price made up for it and my wife loved the bathroom. Everything was clean and comfortable. What more could you ask for?
title: Great hotel

review: Staff on reception were so friendly, room was beautiful and clean and modern. We didn't spend much time in the room but no complaints atall. Bed was comfy, amazing shower, fab decor, tram stopped right outside. Staff at reception advised which tram number to get to certain places and had a slip of paper with details on. Would definitely stay again.
title: Lovely place

review: I stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 nights in July. It is a beautiful hotel with very friendly staff willing to help you with anything. The tram to the main city stops right outside the hotel also. The restaurant service is slow however we were told they were "very busy" even though they had 8 tables. The hotel doesn't sell alcohol which wasn't a problem for us but might be to other people. I would strongly recommend this hotel for couples and people looking for a quiet break.
title: Beautiful and Historic

review: Contrary to some of the reviews, the desk had someone ready to assist 24 hours a day. The hotel is partially automated but anyone can get help if stuck. The room was big with lots of toiletries. I found the desk extremely friendly. The breakfast was big but at 18 euro, not sure. The hotel had parking which was a huge bonus. The tram stops at the door, taking you close to the centrum. The only drawback: you can't walk to the centrum, it's a bit far.
title: Good service big rooms

review: The staff were extremely helpful and professional. We arrived early in the morning after a long flight (many hours before normal check-in time) with small children. The front of house staff immediately found us a family room, for which we were very appreciative .
title: Extremely helpful staff

review: The room is spacious, the mattress comfortable, there are cabinets to store clothes and a coffee machineBut the hotel is not attractive for touristsIt takes two trams to reach the center.It is a 10-minute walk from Sloterdijk Train StationAnd it is unpleasant to walk this distance in the darkThe hotel is not on the night line of public transport to the airportThe hotel's breakfast is not cheap and there is no coffee shop or restaurants or a supermarket nearby.
title: Nice but more possible

review: Stayed in this hotel a couple of times. Amazing value for money! Rooms are spacious and bright. We had breakfast in the hotel daily and the amount of selection was unreal highly recommend to stay for breakfast best you will get in Amsterdam. We also had dinner on one occasion which was also fantastic. Staff are very attentive and helpful. The hotel is 2 tram stops away from city centre really easy to get to though from outside of the hotel. You save a lot of money staying in this hotel than you would in the city centre. Even though you have to travel it is definitely worth it.
title: Amsterdam

review: The hotel was very nice and convenient, we had a room for three people and it was large and with two double beds in its 2 sides.Very nice bath, coffee machine and its location was super- only one tram to the attractions of Amsterdam.
title: Excellent

review: very clean, excellent and helpful staff, assisted with tram info. helped in securing cab at the right time and the right size to transport 4 persons with large luggage requirements, were able to change room requirements at the last minute.
title: mike lamson

review: The only negative I have is that the room smelt slightly dusty/musty on arrival but opened window and was OK after an hour. The staff were friendly and helpful on arrival and checking in and out was easy and left luggage there when checked out as we had late flight home.Room was nice size and bathroom was clean and big. Location is good. Tram 12 was immediately outside. We got off at overtoon and walked to the centre. We found from the centre it was easier to train to sloterdikt then tram was just 1 stop from there to hotel on way back. We bought a 3 day pass which allowed travel on all buses trams and trams for 26 euro each. Everything was easy to reach from hotel we had no problems with any of the transport. Would go back to this hotel. When I first was trying to book I wanted something more central but now I've been there I'm not sure I would want to stay any nearer the mayhem lol
title: Overall very good and good location

review: Great hotel and their employees were AWESOME!!! Very reasonable and breakfast buffet was delicious!!! Quite a decent location, #12 Tram was right in front. It was clean and what a snap to check in...very high-tech for check in.
title: AWESOME HOTEL AND GREAT EMPLOYEES

review: Speedy and helpful check iin. Underground parking facility. Ease of getting into the centre of Amsterdam by tram. I was woken up several times by other room doors banging.Good sized room and bathroom.
title: Great place to stay in Amsterdam.

review: we visit this hotel for 3 nights in July ,we book room for 4 people (4 beds ) the room was big and very clean , breakfast was rich and the transportation to the city center is very easy ,out side of the hotel there is tram station witch take you to city centerwe arrive very late at night 15 minutes by taxi from the air port cost about 35 Euro.Check in was fast and easy altheas it was very late at night 03:00 amAlthough its locate out side of city center - its very good value for mony .
title: excellent hotel

review: The cleanliness and service of this hotel is awesome. We stayed at room 117, the room beside the elevators. You could hear some noice but not that much. The curtains could have closed the window much more better. Perhaps an idea to use some rollerblinds in between the curtains and the window
title: Stay during milkshake festival

review: Loved our stay. Last visit 2 years ago was great so stayed there again. The hotel has been massively upgraded from checkin, rooms and concierge services. Plainly written, stay there if you want a great hotel that is convenient to downtown and the airport. The buffet was extra but for $ 13 Euros, I skipped lunch. For any return visit, definite hotel. Book early since it was close to full
title: Fantastic

review: We stayed here are a couple in November 2016. The location is not the best but the tramstop right outside the hotel makes it very easy to get in and out of the city. we stayed in a double room but did not have a double bed, instead it was 2 singles pushed together. the facilities in the room were very good, bathroom was excellent. overall very good hotel
title: Convenient and well priced

review: I can't complain about the location of the hotel and the size of the room, but the cleaning service is very poor and our bed - we were staying in a non-smoking room - smelled strongly like cigarettes. It took 2 days to have the issue resolved but the bathroom and the main room were never cleaned properly during our 5-day stay. Furthermore, the price for breakfast is 17.50 euros (per person) which is quite expensive especially if you're traveling with your family.
title: Lack of Cleanliness

review: Even though this hotel isn't in the center of the city, it is conveniently located across from a tram stop and has professional and friendly staff. The rooms were very comfortable and the food (including delivery to our room) was great. I'd definitely stay here again - well worth it!
title: Staff and location make it special!

review: Stayed here with a group of friends and the first time in west Amsterdam near sloterdijk , the rooms were nice and clean and beds were comfortable, there is tea/coffee making facilities in the room itself which was ok, The room has a safe which is free to use.The staff were friendly and welcoming and there were no issues during my stay.There is a nice cafe which is situated just over the road from the hotel where you can buy a beer or have some hot food , staff are very friendly and the prices are reasonable.The transport links from the hotel are good and go to most places as long as you know the route you need to take to get to wherever you're going, Google maps is a good app to have as you can enter where you want to go and it will help you with which type of transport would be better for you to take.I had the breakfast on the last day in the morning and you pay a set price the food is good and you will find something to your liking there is no limit to how much you can eat in the one sitting so an endless supply of coffee and tea was a plus for me.I would definitely stay at this hotel again in the future.
title: Amsterdam west golden tulip

review: Excellent service and position in the city. Amazing room and people who are always on fire for us. My girlfiend and me had appreciated this trip in your hotel, and I recommend it for everyone who wants to do a citytrip in Amsterdam !
title: Excellent

review: Very helpful and friendly reception staff. Vey convenient for travelling into centre (tram stops outside the hotel). Underground car park is very convenient and well priced. Hotel was very clean and well organised.
title: A very convenient, clean and well run hotel.

review: NON SMOKING HOTEL, but allowed to smoke outside lobby. Greeted by very friendly staff, clean, lift, non-alcoholic bar unfortunately but that's a good thing in a way, about 15 minutes cab ride away from Dam square also. Excellent bedroom and even more so showers!!!
title: Friendly staff, clean about 15mins taxi ride away from Dam square.

review: Our stay was really confortable and pleasant .Really tasteful the breakfast and rooms qiet clean nice.We appreciate too the nearness of the tram station.So all perfect and with nespresso machine I enjoyed so much !
title: fantastic

review: Polite, friendly and helpful staff, good computer facilities, mostly everything really. Could have done better regarding fixing room problems (The safe in the room didn't work, didn't get fixed, despite us reporting it within an hour of getti9ng there. Would have given 5 stars otherwise.
title: Recommended

review: The hotel is well kept and staff are very friendly and helpful. It's close enough to the airport like most things it's just a tram ride away. It's 2 tram rides away from central amsterdam and there is a tram stop outside the hotel. The hotel has a strict no 'smoking' and no alcohol policy. I was disapointed that I could not buy an alcoholic drink after 12 hours of travel. The mini bar in the bedroom is switched off so you can only drink the tea or coffee left in your room. However there is room service and non alcoholic drinks can be bought from vending machines in reception or the bar. The room was a nice standard and the bathroom is very nice. You get a nice little selection of shampoo etc so don't worry about bringing your own. A good place to stay if you want to be away from the city centre.
title: Not a bad place to stay

review: When we arrived (on both occasions), staff were friendly and helpful. We appreciated being able to check in slightly early due to our room being ready.Could catch tram at front of hotel.Rooms welled attired, spacious and clean.Would definitely stay there again.
title: Convenient, affordable and quite family friendly accommodation

review: Spent three nights at hotel which had very clean and generous sized rooms. Location is 15 minute train ride from attractions but the train is right out front. One great hotel amenity is on premise parking which is rare and even rarer is the nightly rate of 15 euros. On the downside, hotel has a bar but no alcohol and only offered breakfast.Would stay if had small children but if older that 13 would look to stay closer to all the action.
title: Standard Hotel
