review: Nice-sized and clean rooms, with espresso machine. Away from the chaos of Dam Square, but a convenient 20-minute tram #12 (stop in front of hotel) ride to the Museumplein.VERY helpful and friendly staff, thank you!
title: I would happy stay here again!

review: This hotel is fantastic! If your going to Amsterdam it's a must. It's a bit far out of the centre it takes about 15 minutes on the tram but the tram stop is outside the door. Really can't complain. Staff are also really nice!
title: A fabulous hotel!!

review: Stayed here one night for business purpose. The hotel is quite big with a nice entrance. The room was big, situated on the ground floor. Very clean also the bathroom. I did not have time to have breakfast, but the staff was friendly enough to offer silverware in the middle of the night. I ordered late night kebab. It is a 7 min walk from Sloterdijk train station, where you can be in 5 min in Amsterdam central station. The hotel has a tram stop right in front of the entrance, so very easy to reach by public transport. Even though it was a very brief visit, I can recommended this hotel to anyone for a comfortable sleep.
title: Comfortable and spacious room

review: We specifically requested a "quiet room" and were place on the 1st story in the back with a lovely view of a green courtyard. Our concierge told us the building was originally a hospital. There rooms are not huge but have plenty of room and are well organized with shelves/ledges which made it easy to unpack. We enjoyed not being in the center of the city and being near a lovely park. The tram stops are only 1/2 block away and so it was super easy to travel any place within the city. The staff ar very friendly and helpful. They seem to genuinely want you to enjoy your stay.
title: Would stay here again

review: The receptionist was nice and friendly. My room was on the ground floor and facing the street so we can hear footsteps and pedestrians talking outside. It didn't bother me much because I'm a heavy sleeper. The area around the hotel is pretty convenient to find places to eat, drink and smoke. There's also some convenience shop and a laundry right across the hotel.I got the room for 3 pax and the size of the room was huge. I love the decor. The bed was comfortable. There was no bathtub though, only shower. There's a mini fridge which I like, although was not stocked with beverages, only one mineral water.Overall, I enjoyed my stay. The location is slightly out of the central part of the city. But I kinda like that as the atmosphere is more laid-back. It's not too far away though, and you can easily get around from here because the tram stops just in front of the hotel!
title: a comfortable stay

review: In my opinion, if a hotel is clean and has the amenities I need... I am happy. After that it comes down to the staff. I cant say enough positive things about the staff. They went out of their way to make sure all of my questions were answered whether it was about area attractions or how to get from place to place..they were wonderful.
title: Nice hotel. Staff very helpful.

review: Hop in the balcony for a good joint even if the rooms are smokers free the balcony allowed fresh air and a good view. Requested flowers for my fiancee on the bed and it was like I imagined. I wanted the best for her and Hampshire manor proved me right we had an amazing stay with help at 24h service. Just excellent. The front office was quite polite with meno the tall guy who is indeed very nice and the chinese guy who always smile that's how a reception should be but I feel sad that the ladies at the reception weren't at the hotel level. Else, everything was just right.
title: Feel like being at home.

review: Checked in July 11th checked out July 16- hotel is nice and staff are very friendly and helpful, tram is right outside to take to city centre very easy and fast, bathroom shower was a bit annoying as water leaked everywhere on the floor with the set up they have so that was inconvenient, bed was comfortable. Now - we checked out July 16th at noon and did not have a flight until late so we left our luggage there and picked it up later in he evening to head out for our flight. Upon arriving at our next destination we realized that my boyfriend had left his perfume in the hotel room on the bed, please note the price of this was $1000 euros and the bottle was quite flashy. I called the hotel right away to ask if they have recovered this lost item and the lady informed us to call in the next morning as it takes housekeeping 24 hours to register it in the system. I was confident they would inform us the next day that yes they had it- but when I called they said they had nothing I was a little stunned but thought maybe they still had not registered it. I then proceeded to call them for the next few days and when I told them yes we did indeed forget it there and maybe housekeeping must have taken it because there is no where else it could be we looked through all our luggage and everything. They insisted that the housekeeping supervisor inspects the rooms prior to anyone cleaning it - If that is true or not - a member of their staff have taken the item as it was a very high priced item and did look expensive. It's unbelievable that someone in housekeeping did such a thing and I called them for 3-4 days in a row with no help. We will never know which staff took it as it seems like there is no accountability - what if the supervisor took it? Or no supervisor checked and a regular housekeeper took it? What's to say they would never do such a thing in general? Very disappointed and will never stay at this hotel or this brand of hotel
title: housekeeping stole an item we forgot after we checked out

review: The Hotel was very comfortable and the staff was nice.The breakfast was good and enough to select.Sadly the bathroom was not totally clean, there were some hairs and dirt on the floor and in the sink.Overall rating 3,5 out of 5.
title: Nice city hotel for an average price

review: The hotel staff was really nice So no complaints there but the room we were given was extremely dusty and the floor wasn't vacuumed. If you sat down on the mattress dust would shoot up visibly in the light. We called for a maid to ask for cleaning but she just came in and made the bed. The next day, after going to reception twice, they did change our room. The second room was better, but our throats and heads were irritated so much from the coughing and sneezing already. Location isn't bad, but does require a 15-20 tram ride to get into the main area of the city but the stops are right outside the hotel which is nice. Overall it was okay. If you have any sort of health problems or breathing issues I would not recommend staying here. A bit overpriced for what it's worth and the food in the vicinity of the hotel is pretty minimal. Soap and shampoo are considered the same thing there and no lotion is provided so I'd recommend bringing your own toiletries. I swear I'm not an unreasonable person. I just expect my room to be clean if I am paying that much for it. I am happy they reaccomdated us, but for someone with a breathing problem, i was unable to enjoy the rest of my stay in Amsterdam.
title: Okay stay- not the cleanest rooms

review: Pluses:- Room well appointed (comfy bed, good sized desk, minibar, aircon, decent number of mirrors). - Quiet (we stayed in a room overlooking the garden).- Day staff helpful with city / transport info. - Good transport links (trams to city centre, Rijksmuseum etc right outside).Plus/Minus:- Not right in the city centre (cheaper and quieter, but not on the pretty canals if that's what you're after).Minuses:- Strange decor (e.g. red corridors with xxx design, no carpet in rooms).- Night staff lacklustre (see below).We had a particular minus. We arrived late at night to find our double room had two singles pushed together. After some lengthy discussions, the night staff offered a topper for the mattress to turn it into a double bed (no idea why this wasn't done earlier). They then turned up with a topper and a sheet and *left us to make the bed*. We were left sleeping on a double bed with two singles. Needless to say, we were really unimpressed with the night staff!!
title: Pluses and minuses

review: The Manor Amsterdam is a very good hotel in the eastern section of Amsterdam. The rooms were decent, and the hotel provided a very good buffet breakfast. There are also multiple tram lines virtually in front of the hotel to take you to any part of the city. If you like to stay in a quiet neighborhood, this hotel would be a good choice..
title: Nice hotel in the eastern section of Amsterdam

review: This hotel was very clean and comfortable, there is a tram stop right outside the hotel with around 4 small stops into the heart of it all. Plenty of shops and restaraunts outside the hotel. Would highly recommend
title: Beautiful comfortable hotel

review: Decent sized room. Very clean. Comfortable large bed. Had a room on the side of the hotel which was quiet. Had to wait a while to check in with no acknowledgement that we were waiting. Classy bar with outside seating area. Ate in Enoteca, interesting menu plus pizzas - unfortunately they had run out of pizza dough one night. Waiting staff are lovely. Drinks are pricey, but no more than other large hotels. Nice to sit on the front terrace and watch the world go by. Right near the tram stop so great access to all the sites. You can buy tram tickets at the hotel. We've stayed in hotels recently with frosted glass doors into the bathroom that have gap round them - bad idea - turn the bathroom light on at night and is very bright into the bedroom - poor trend that hotels should stop, otherwise good bathroom. Decent free internet.
title: Comfortable, very clean and handy location

review: I stayed at this hotel on my own for a long weekend. Born and raised in Amsterdam I try to stay in or near my old neighbourhood in Amsterdam East (Oost). I recall when I lived there The Manor was an old hospital and always admired the building when cycling into town. When my usual hotels were fully booked I decided to give The Manor a go and I wasn't disappointed. The staff upon arrival were lovely and the checkin extremely quick. The hotel has a fantastic Amsterdam theme and the three crosses are everywhere, bit too much for some but I loved it. The room was great, very spacious, huge bed, lovely bathroom. Everything I needed and even a tv attached to the bed that could swivel round, fab. My room was at the back of the hotel and there was no noise what so ever had a great night sleep all weekend. The hotel's location is great, the area has improved so much since I lived there and there's so much to do. Fantastic restaurants and pubs, a little shopping centre and you're a five minutes walk from the Tropenmuseum and a few tram stops from the zoo. Speaking of trams, the tram 9 practically stops outside the hotel and that will take you into the city centre within 10minutes. But if you're a real Amsterdammer like me you like to cycle. This hotel cater for that, you can rent bikes at the hotel for I think €12.50 for 12 hours. Perfect! If you're looking for a good hotel close to the city centre and a nice area this is definitely one I would recommend.
title: Great location, full on Amsterdam theme

review: The hotel is located in the East of Amsterdam, only 12 minutes by public transport from Downtown. It is a pleasant area next to a large park and with lots of attractive places nearby for eating and having a good drink.The service was friendly and diligent - we always felt very well attended with our needs and questions. The room was well equipped and offered a pleasant atmosphere, we felt absolutely comfortable.On our next trips to Amsterdam (and we will sure come back to this great city) we will choose this hotel again and we will recommend it to our friends.
title: Good rooms and friendly service in a pleasant area of Amsterdam - just 12 minutes from downton

review: Excellent, clean, attentive friendly staff, A little far from city center but with tram link 50meters from front door and only a 10 minute journey to Dam square. Local amenities are good. Traditional build but modern furnishings. Room we had was one floor over the bar facing the main road but was still quite with Windows closed.
title: Manor hotel Amsterdam

review: Literally just returned from my stay here. It was a lovely experience with polite staff, good service, stunning food and a decent room (the wet rooms were lovely). I genuinely enjoyed my stay. A few minor issues which took away the 5 star rating for me. Cleaning was certainly a bit of an issue, there was a great deal of dust on the floors and behind the beds. Furthermore, the room was cleaned at various times of day, all very inconsistently, which meant that the room wasn't ready when necessarily wanted. My last niggle comes from the prices, the rooms are certainly a little over priced and the spirit prices were extortionate. NEVERTHELESS, it was a thoroughly enjoyed stay! 4/5
title: Almost perfect

review: The hotel is a little out of the centre, but walkable into town and there is a tram stop outside the door. The rooms were OK. Not brilliant, but clean and mostly functional. (TV had its moments) The staff were personable, helpful and multi-lingual. All in all, unremarkable. We arrived early in the morning, so having left our bags with reception, headed off into town to see the sights. We returned in the evening, planning to have dinner in the hotel's Italian inspired restaurant. Wow! Both the food and the wine were superb. The service was great and the cost reasonable.
title: Good, but unremarkable hotel with astonishing restaurant

review: Stayed here for a few nights in July and had a pleasant stay. The hotel was in a good location with a tram stop straight out the front that took you into central Amsterdam- only taking 10 minutes or so. Our room was clean and a decent size. Staff were very friendly and very helpful. The restaurant was lovely too. Very pleased overall and would go back again.
title: Good Stay

review: My partner and I booked this hotel with another couple for 1 night with a deal. Our room was on the second floor and was a food sized room, The room was lovely and clean )other then 1 hair in the bath) with a lovely view of a green area behind the hotel. The bed was very comfortable but as we are a couple 2 beds pushed together isn't really what I have in mind for a double bed. The temperature of the water in the shower wasn't consistent either and was going hot and cold throughout showers; the shower also leaked. The hotel has free wifi. We did not have breakfast in the hotel is it was very basic. It was very easy to get arrange once we had bought tram tickets for the hotel reception. After going out for the evening we came home to our room keys not working. We went down to reception to get new key cards. We was back up to the room and it still wasn't working. We was then told the lock on the door was broken and could we wait at the bar until it was fixed. We got given a complementary drink while we waited. They were unable to fix it so the receptionist opened the door for us. Once we had left the room was then had to keep on going back to reception to be let back into our room until we checked out. The staff was all very helpful and friendly and did all they could to assist in the very inconvenient situation.
title: Almost perfect

review: We stayed at the Hampshire for 6 nights, last week of July. 1- The soundproof room was on the third floor, spacious, very clean and had a window with street view (which I like). The room was cleaned well daily and the bathroom had shampoo and hairdryer (no toothpaste/brush)The bed and pillows were very comfortable.2- Staff are very friendly and helpful. 3- The location is very convenient. it is 1 minute away from tram stop (#9) to and it is like 15min away from the central station. The hotel is locates near a coffeeshop and some nice restaurants, a laundry, a metro station, a shopping street just 5 min away from the hotel. Great Value for the money It is highly recommended!
title: Great Stay!

review: I wish I had booked something closer to Amsterdam's major attractions. This hotel is in a nice neighborhood, but out of the way. It's a hefty walk to the main tourist spots. However, you can rent bikes from the hotel and several tram lines stop nearby. So, getting around is easy.Personally, I was not pleased with the sleep quality. I felt our mattress was too soft and our pillows too high.Overall service was good, but we had a room snafu when we arrived. I had booked two rooms for two adults and two children. As we would be arriving late, I called ahead to make sure we'd get two rooms together. I was assured we would. However, we got there to find our rooms two floors apart. They did switch us the next day. No compensation was offered, but the person on the desk quickly agreed when I suggested they give us all a free breakfast.
title: Nice hotel, but Out of the Way

review: Four nights at The Manor in Amsterdam during peak summer season. This 4* hotel is well appointed, very clean and a good sized room with excellent bathroom. Staff were very welcoming and friendly. Booked through a well known consolidator and was a little disappointed that it was not made clear during online reservation that breakfast was extra so had to find another £92 (for two people) on arrival.The hotel is right next to two tram lines, one of which goes to the centre and the other to the museum district, and there are plentiful shops and cafes within 200 metres. However with hindsight we would have paid extra to stay nearer the centre and would happily use another of the many hotels within the Hampshire Group in Amsterdam.The tram journey is 15-20 minutes each way and even with multi-journey tickets the cost adds up. In the summer heat it is not practical to walk back each time to the hotel and for those of us who are of 'mature' age the bicycle hire was not a welcoming alternative.In summary this is a great hotel but visitors need to balance the savings available by being away from the centre against the time and inconvenience of not being able to 'pop' back for a rest.We regularly visit European cities and rank Amsterdam as one of the safest and customer-friendly. We never felt intimidated or unwelcome and loved being able to meander the compact centre. However it is not a particularly cheap city and the budget does not stretch as far as it does in other capitals further south
title: Very high quality, great staff but a little too far out of the centre

review: Stayed 3 nights as a couple and had a lovely stay. We were originally given a room that had 2 singles pushed together when we first arrived but a quick trip back to reception and this was quickly sorted. Had a great room with a massive bed! Good size bathroom with shower only (as stated when we booked so no problem). Tea/coffee making facilities ( only earl grey tea though). A great addition is the mini fridge in the room. There are a couple of small ( think Tesco local) stores about 5 minutes walk away so we got drinks, snacks and stocked the fridge. The climate control was a bit poor and I think in really hot weather it would not be very good, we had it on full and had to open the window in the night as it was very stuffy. Staff very friendly & helpful. Take the number 9 tram from Central station. Very easy to get to hotel and travel around. Turn right out of the hotel for some lovely restaurants.
title: Great base for visiting Amsterdam

review: This is the worst four-star hotel I stayed at and I stay in many four-star hotels throughout the year. The sirens of ambulances all night long were non-stop. One night, a drunken man screamed below our window and the sound of loud non-stop traffic was not a pleasant sound to listen to while trying to sleep. The room was claustrophobic and nothing like a room as seen on their website.The breakfast offered at the hotel was pretty meager for a four-star hotel.I stayed in a three-star hotel that was a lot better than this hotel.I never understood why I was charged for the breakfast and for the rental bike I rented. In all hotels I stay at they always render one bill at the end of the stay.The hotel staff was friendly.
title: Very noise room

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Very comfortable rooms with views overlooking the city. If you arrive by train in Centraal it's an easy drag of your bags to the hotel. Metro, trams, boats, tour buses all stop at Centraal so it is easy to get wherever you're going, and most transportation heads to your hotel at night! Breakfast buffet is above average, excellent rooftop bar. Starbucks on ground floor.
title: Drop your bags and see the city

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Stayed in various types of rooms in the doubletree. If you can book an executive room, they are the best and you have access to the executive lounge which is free breakfast and free snacks later on in the evening. Free unlimited alcohol wines and champagne. So obviously that's a great perk. You can take up to room or just relax in the lounge. The breakfast isn't like the main breakfast served outside the lounge but it was good enough for me. The hotel is lovely and the service is great, you receive a cookie when checking in and if there are any delays with your room they will leave something in the room for you (usually a bottle of Prosecco) Courtyard access room is good in the summer (better than a balcony) Rooms are clean and maintained well. Sky lounge is the best place to relax (during the day) Amazing view of Amsterdam. Very chilled environment and good customer service. Bike hire is super cheap and it's great to get around and explore. Apple Mac's in each room and in lobby, free wifi throughout the hotel. I recommend this hotel it's suited for everyone families and couples. There's a wonderful restaurant and Starbucks within the hotel. I've been so many times because it's so good I'm going back in two weeks =)
title: One of the best

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We stayed here for 4 nights after a river cruise. This was a very good place to stay. The breakfast buffet has a very large selection of foods and is fresh and very good. The rooms are on the larger size for Europe and had washcloths, which is not common in Europe. Staff in reception, the restaurant and customer service are very helpful and friendly. There is bottled water available to take each day when touring out in the city. Excellent location and close to centraal station. The only drawback we found was that on Saturday night it was very loud outside with a party, or a bar close by and the noise echoed into our room until the early hours of the night. Saying this, it was something the hotel has no control over. We would stay here again on another visit.
title: Excellent service and location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: This hotel is quite pricey, but everything in Amsterdam is, so it was not that far out of range. We stayed in a suite and had so much room - very spacious living room with a couch that works as a bed and then a separate bedroom also. Beds are quite comfortable and the bathroom was quite roomy with both a shower and a tub. It was all very clean and the view was amazing - we just sat and watched out the window quite a bit! We could see much of Amsterdam from our window and took advantage of the "white nights" to stay up and watch the world go by! We also took were able to use the executive level privileges - breakfast and afternoon snacks and drinks - very helpful at saving money and also very good food and service. The hotel is very centrally located - easy to get to from Central station - which is right next door. It is also close to hop on/hop off boat and bus routes, so that is easy is you use that option while sightseeing. Good restaurants are nearby and everything is very convenient. It is a "cruise stop" hotel, so it can get quite busy at times, but we did not mind as it did not really affect us much.  they also have bikes to rent, so that's a fun way to get around. And they have waters in the lobby to grab on your way out for the day (and those cookies!). And, there's always the HUGE Starbucks right on sight if you need your coffee fix. I highly recommend this hotel - its pricey, but so convenient and definitely worth it.
title: Loved this hotel

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Second time staying here. Service, location - top place to stay in Amsterdam. Easy walk to station, buses, boats. CV Chipcard is worth buying for use in Netherlands for ALL transport. Would certainly stay at this Hilton Centraal should I visit Amsterdam again.
title: Amsterdam

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: I have stayed at a few Double trees and this follows the similar high standards. The location in the city is perfect for exploring the city and transport links. The room was a decent size which offered a nice view. We also loved the restaurant downstairs.
title: Great location, room and service

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Great location so close to centraal station & transport. Room clean & roomy, staff very helpful. Would stay here again. Bit disappointed our room rate didn't include breakfast but certainly would recommend.
title: My experience

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We were really happy with the location of this hotel. Very convenient. Check in was easy and pleasant. Staff seemed very nice and friendly. Our room was comfortable - we booked on of the Executive Suites. With the Executive Suites you are provided access to the Executive Lounge (I'm Diamond as well with Hilton). I will say that the one downside with this hotel is that the Executive Lounge is simply too small for all of the guests they're trying to accommodate. We stayed here 4 nights and went into the Executive Lounge each evening and were unable to find any seats. It was just too packed with people. It's a shame when you book a room so that you receive that perk and can not even take advantage of it. I would tell people to stay at this hotel, the location really is very convenient. However, the "perk" of the Executive room booking really isn't a perk and thus reduces the value for the money you might expect to receive.
title: Great Location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Stayed for 4 days in July. Checked in late in the afternoon and room was ready for check in. Check in was very quick and my husband is diamond so we stayed on the 4th floor. We overlooked the train tracks so the view wasn't great but the location is excellent. And I never heard any train noisesI never found a concierge but the front desk was some of the most helpful front desk that I have ever had. They all gave directions and great information on what train to get and when they left. They were great. Located next to central station which is a very easy walk. When we arrived I felt odd carrying luggage across train tracks but don't worry you will see lots of people doing it all week. Its close to trains and buses and the Amsterdam information which I didn't find until the last day and I wish I would have found it on the first day. They were also very helpfulBed was comfortable but the queen bed was really just 2 twins next to each other but comfortable. I always felt that the room was clean but we were without towels one day and toilet paper the next even when the guy knocked on the door to see if room was okay we said we needed towels he left and we never saw him again. We got free breakfast daily and drinks at night but it was very crowded but a nice perkI loved Amsterdam and I would totally suggest the hotel to anyone for any reason. It was excellent.
title: Amsterdam Double Tree

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Last minute book with the family due to a horrible bunch of flight mishaps. As a Hilton Diamond (Top level), i was not upgraded and no accommodations were made for the family so needed to pay for a second room. Will never stay here again as i was simply another number with $$ signs to them as it felt. I travel through Amsterdam a bunch for business as it is a delta major flight route and i will never stay here again nor advise any clients to stay. I love Hilton properties but the decisions this property made was not a decision based on good customer service.
title: Very sad service

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The sheer size of this Hilton (it is HUGE) makes it difficult for the staff to lift it above 'average', but to be fair they do their best. In fact, the service is excellent and they try hard to give a personal service despite the high number of people just 'milling' around the hotel. Reception staff were friendly and the warm 'welcome' cookies were a nice touch. The breakfast buffet restaurant is large but finding a table was a challenge on both days, although staff quickly cleared a table for us and were very attentive and helpful. The buffet was kept refreshed and offered a good choice (although it wasn't cheap at e25 for my 15 year old, under 12s are free). The room was fine, although the view was of the railway lines not the canals (which are on both sides of the hotel). It was a disabled room (not required) which meant some of the aesthetics were given over to practicalities with a shower seat, extra handles, safety cords etc (I'm assuming not every room had this). Towels were large and fluffy (I do hate tiny threadbare towels in hotels so extra points for that!) It was just a little 'tired' in places (the door chain was loose and hanging off) but the hotel is easily accessible for the main station, trams and other transport so was very convenient. The sky lounge was a nice feature, although pricey. All in all, a convenient place to flop with top marks for the staff who added much to the stay.
title: Decent base for a short break

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We had an executive balcony and it was amazing. The views of the city from the 9th floor were astonishing. We had sunset views every night that were breathtaking. All the boats in front going back and forth were a real treat. The location was great and the executive lounge was a bonus. We really enjoyed the hotel. The sky lounge is a must. A short walk from the train station.
title: Great hotel and staff

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Good location and very good breakfast buffet. Spacious corner room. Breakfast buffet has many selections of the usual breakfast items including eggs made to order and champagne. Restaurant and Starbucks on the ground floor. Several other restaurants very close by.
title: Amsterdam DoubleTree

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: What I like about the Hilton brands is that you always know that you will have a pleasant stay in a comfortable room. This hotel is no exception. The staff is friendly and the rooms are nice and spacious. And, a great bonus for Hilton in Europe is that you get washcloths and an iron in the room, which is not common in Europe.
title: A nice place to stay in central Amsterdam

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We arrived late in the morning and even though the lobby was full we were checked in quickly. Our room wasn't ready but our bags were whisked away into storage and we set off to explore Amsterdam. A short walk in the direction of Centraal Station and we had our two day tram pass. Coming back at 5:00 our bags were delivered promptly to our suite which was on the executive floor. Our travel agent suggested a suite for us since we were traveling with our grand daughter and were considering booking two rooms. Booking a suite turned out to be less expensive then two rooms and having the Island suite gave us a spectacular view of the city. The hotel provided a roll cot which proved to be uncomfortable for my grand daughter, but she simply moved to the couch which served her needs very well. Being in an executive room we had access to the executive lounge which provided free light snacks, wine, beer and soft drinks from 6:00 to 8:00 pm. This was a lovely treat. Our breakfast was included in the price of the room and it was delightful. The buffet was varied and well stocked. When my grand daughter voiced a desire for a crepe, the kitchen was pleased to provide her with it. The number of gluten free options for my wife was outstanding and at the end of the meal you could take a few items from the buffet for a later snack or light lunch in a provided brown paper bag.After a busy day in the centre of the city the tram left us off a short walk back to our room and this wonderful hotel. The hotel includes a car rental agency, another is just a block away and a Starbucks.We had a glorious four days in Amsterdam, helped greatly by our hotel. I highly recommend it.
title: A perfect location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We are fans of the Hilton double tree train so this was an obvious choice for us when staying in Amsterdam. Check in said 2pm online- we arrived from our flight by 9.30am and were given a room immediately . The room was clean, modern and of a decent size. The location is brilliant: right next to the station and a walking distance from all the main attractions and key areas. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Great location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The hotel is ideally located for arriving in the city from Schipol Airport being adjacent to the station. However it is a 'stark' building veering towards 'ugly' showing the worst aspects of 60's/70's architecture. It is contrasted by the beautiful adjacent Amsterdam Ceentral Station building.For a short break the hotel is near the tram terminus, canal cruises and the hop on/off bus tours.It is a large hotel with long austere corridors, if like us, your room is far from the lifts. They appear more like a budget Travelodge than a 4 star hotel. The room and bathroom were on the small side with basic furnishing although a computer was supplied sharing the monitor with the television. However the rooms were spotlessly clean and housekeeping very efficient with toiletries renewed daily. On the positive side the breakfasts were excellent with a really comprehensive choice of buffet. On our first morning service was great both offering juices and coffee to the table and immediately clearing dishes. However next morning (Saturday) hotel was extremely busy and service became a bit chaotic. Complementary newspapers are supplied as is champagne at breakfast.We had dinner on first evening in the Rosewood restaurant, which has very limited menu and on the expensive side. The other evening we dined out in city restaurants which were easily accessible by buying tram passes, the trams starting a short walk from hotel. At 7.50 / 12.50 and 16.50 Euros for 24 / 48/ 72 hours for the frequent and comprehensive network were great value. Could also be used on Metro and buses.It is unlikely we would visit Amsterdam again but would look for a more traditional 4 star hotel. Hint - We found the hop on/off bus one of the poorest we have encountered and all the limited sites they visit could easily be done with the tram pass.
title: Great Location but 4 Star ??

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Very comfortable hotel. We had Hilton honors as my family use the hotel brand frequently but even if you discount those perks (free breakfast, afternoon tea, free water, coffee machines etc) the hotel is incredibly well positioned next to centraal station, with a lovely view of the canal. Easy access to the city and a safe and short walk to trams or closer attractions.
title: Well located and comfortable.

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Arrived in Amsterdam direct off the plane from Australia at 6am on a Sunday morning. Staff at the hotel could not have been more accommodating and found us a room to check into as soon as we arrived. We didn't expect this but we're most grateful.Very easy location to find and a good base to see the best of Amsterdam and beyond. Room was small but comfortable, restaurant at the hotel was very good and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
title: Great location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We stayed here recently for 5 days and totally enjoyed this Hotel. Normally you would not expect a hotel located next to a major railway station to be so good, but the Double tree Hilton is very good. Our room is not overly large but it has everything we need, and to be honest, you only end up sleeping in your room. The best thing about this hotel is the top floor with the amazing outdoor bar and eating area. It has fantastic views toward the main part of the city, with nothing better than enjoying that view at sunset with a nice drink in hand. Its location is also excellent for exploring Amsterdam easily and there is a good restaurant district very close to the hotel.
title: Perfect location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Very nice, clean and comfortable rooms. We stayed for 3 nights and has easy access to the trams/trains/buses but also a short 10 minute walk to the old kerk and red light district.As this is a very popular and large hotel, check in and check out does take a little while so be prepared for some crowds.
title: Good hotel right next to Centraal Station

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: I never write reviews but thought after the service I received tonight by a waiter called Gijs in the Skye Lounge bar was beyond excellenceThis guy is a credit to the Hilton.Such a gentleman and is an expert at his job.We will def return and ask for him again as he showed not only a talent for his job but an amazing persona which made our night special especially since we got engaged and he took it upon himself to make us feel so welcome and gave us some complimentary cocktails. Got a big hug from him and feel that he is now my friend.what a lovely lovely man!Alan and LesleyAnne
title: Sky lounge (Gijs)

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The hotel was in a perfect location. He is walkable from central rail station. Took the train from airport and was in the hotel within 35 minutes.. Great location for everything. Skybar on top floor had amazing views of city.. Great vibe.. Timothy at Guest services made our trip. He set us up for our two day visit. He organized everything and made every dinner reservations for us. He was patience, kind and had a great sense of humor.. You will love the hotel and location.. We took Uber and it came right to the door of hotel Great 2 days.
title: Family vacation

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Just come back from my 4th trip to Amsterdam but first stay at the DoubleTree. We used to stay at the Crown Plaza but after that shut were looking for somewhere similar in terms of standard and location. Our stay was excellent from start to finish. All staff were friendly and helpful. Wouldn't stay anywhere else. Nice modern and clean rooms. Bathroom wasn't huge but more than manageable. Brilliant location for the Centraal station and the city itself. No issues with noise whatsoever. We were on the 7th floor overlooking the train tracks. Couldn't hear a thing from either the Sky Bar or the trains outside. So no complaints from us. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but visited the Starbucks underneath a couple of times which was just right for what we were looking for at breakfast time. Also paid a visit to the Sky Bar on the 11th floor. Nice atmosphere and views of the city but the cocktails were very expensive. But we wrote it off as part of the experience!
title: Perfect stay

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We stayed for 3 nights. The cookies at check-in did not disappoint! We had an executive room on the 3rd floor with views of the canals. The room was clean and functional. It had a small refrigerator and a desk area. The bathroom was small but set up well. It was a shower only. The Executive Lounge had an outstanding breakfast with cooked to order omelettes and pancakes. The evening reception had Heineken on tap and red & white wine. The staff friendly and helpful throughout the hotel.The location was perfect next to Central Station. There were direct trains to and from the airport. It was an easy walk to the main areas of the city.
title: Nice Stay at Doubletree!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We stayed one night during a quick visit to Amsterdam. The location was perfect for a brief itinerary. We wasted no time between the train station and finding our hotel. Plus, you can rent bikes in the lobby of the hotel - so convenient. The room was entirely adequate - nothing fancy, but comfortable. I'd stay here again under similar circumstances.
title: Perfect Location for a Quick Stay

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: I had a great stay at the Doubletree. The location was perfect as it was in the center of the city- very short work to lots of landmarks. The staff was friendly and the breakfast was great with lots of choices.
title: Great stay

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: What's good about this hotel?It's pretty much centrally located. Walking distance to Central Train Station, shopping areas, the notorious Red Light District, and most attractions in Amsterdam. The Hilton badge will assure you the quality of stay in the hotel. I had a 3 good nights stay at the hotel.However, this is a busy hotel. So don't expect to get an early check in. But the warm cookies may cheer you up a little bit. The rooms are very spacious. Choose the rooms facing the city. The view is worth the extra cost. The Apple TV is interesting at first but the small screen is a little turn off. There is also Starbucks, co-located at the hotel. It may be redundant as the hotel cafe also serves good coffee but I think it's worth pointing it out. Overall, I enjoyed the stay in this hotel. If I'm travelling back to Amsterdam, DoubleTree by Hilton Amsterdam Central, will definitely be my choice of stay.
title: I'll come back here again...

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Place is ideally located close to city center, tram lines, and all the shops and restaurants. The rooms are nice and everything is clean. The bar at the top of the hotel has a great lookout over the city but drinks are a bit expensive- still worth it for the view. Have had a few meals and snacks and can't say the food is that good. Staff in the hotel are very helpful and courteous.
title: Good location nice hotel

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Stayed here for 4 nights in August and it was the most beautiful hot weather. The location of this hotel is perfect for a first trip to dam as it centrally located so your within walking distance of most tourist spots. Couldn't have picked a better hotel for my birthday, I had requested a smoking room before hand and they delivered, had a beautiful view of the canal also. Was greeted with warm cookies on arrival. The sky lounge really must be appreciated. All in all I would return 100%
title: Perfect location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: I had been stayed here for two nights. Location is perfect which located walking distance from central station. Cleanliness in the room is also perfect. Regarding quality of service, sky lounge, F&B, housekeeping, room service and reception staffs goes above and beyond. Only few staff at reception ... i am still feeling uncomfortable one female staff. By chance I wanted to asking something. Due to my sickness plus long flight from Asia, I was difficult to speak loud. She told me " speak louder" As for me if I wish I can speak louder with throats pain. Overall quality of service was excellent. Only few staff like this female staff please management watch out and take action accordingly. What a waste entirely teams are doing great job besides high occupancy like this most busiest summer season.
title: Fantastic location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The DoubleTree is part of the Hilton chain of hotels.This one located near the Central Station, with a great view of the city.This stay was somewhat unpleasant, as we needed to make request and insist of keep the room, due to a mistake by the front desk.Also, the room wasn't clean and arranged properly to our stay.Somewhat disappointing considering the name of Hilton and price payed.
title: Hilton next to Central Station

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: This hotel offers wonderful service in a great location, perfectly located close to city center as well as 5 minutes to cruise ship location and 10 minutes to train station. Would highly recommend this hotel while visiting Amsterdam.
title: Great location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: If you would like to see the whole of Amsterdam from a treetop view, this will be a nice place. They have outdoor seats and you can enjoy a very nice view. But be aware of the weather before you decide to go there. They serve food as well, and price is on the higher end. Take note, it is not for budget travelers. You can walk in and no reservation is required. Overall, I enjoyed my time there.
title: Nice view and hangout place

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Good location to explore Amsterdam. Rooms were clean and modern. What you would expect from a double tree Hilton. There is a sky lounge however we did not use it as it was very busy. Bonus free warm chocolate cookie on arrival!
title: Good location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Great location near the train station. Such a clean and friendly hotel. Received a nice upgrade and the service was great. Awesome bar at the top of the hotel to end the night. Would definitely stay here again if we ever come back.
title: EXCELLENT

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Loved the hotel. Great location. Easy to get to everything. Staff was very friendly. Breakfast was a bit pricey but we didn't opt to get that. Beds are very comfortable. I was very happy with the hotel and would gladly stay there again.
title: Great hotel

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: It's literally 5mins walk from Amsterdam Central station... 5 mins walk from the tour both that you can buy all your attraction tickets at and 5 mins walk to the start of where the streets of Amsterdam come alive. My room had an awesome view of the river and the city. Truely stunning. If that isn't enough there is a sky lounge located in the roof that serves amazing cocktails to enjoy with the stunning views of the city as the sun sets. Great place to relax after a hard day out.With regards to service.. it was great.. but expected given it's a Hilton hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. Attentive to me every need. The only gripe i had was that I wanted a king bed and I thought I got one. But they had pushed 2 singles together and out a king sheet on it. I was there for business so slept in the center, exactly where the gap was and woke up the next day with a sore back. In summary, if you can afford it, a great place for a couple to use as a base to explore the city, that is equipped with a relaxing bar to chill out in if you want to relax at the end of a tiring day if seeing attractions. (My room had door access to an adorning room, so defiantely an option for families too).
title: Great location.. great views.. great service

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: I was hesitant of this hotels location but was happily pleased. Only a 15 minute free ferrry ride to the center of Amsterdam and beautiful view of the canal made this a perfect location. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Staff was excellent and helpful. Many places to eat within a few minutes of walking and restaurant in hotel was good also. Breakfast was fantastic. Would stay here again 100%.
title: Sweet location and view!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The hotel as a great location, at the water at 5 min from the city center. The hotel is very busy, manly visited tourists. That is also the drawback, no real focus on/ service for business travelers. The roof top bar offers a great view over Amsterdam, the rooms are OK. Special is the nice Apple TV system, although it would have been comfortable if the screen would have been bigger. The pasta ordered from the room service was not very tasteful and nearly cold when served. The restaurant with view over the water offers a mediocre quality of food. The staff is not very friendly.
title: Location is good

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: After an overnight trans-Atlantic fight, we arrived before noon and were allowed to check in early. This was greatly appreciated as we needed to get some sleep. Unfortunately the room we were given was across the hall from the linen supply room, and there was a constant banging as the door closed. Not being very happy about this, I went to the front desk and asked for another room. The manager on duty was very kind and upgraded our room both in type and location, which was greatly appreciated.The included breakfast was extraordinary, lots of options, great tasting foods and even fresh strawberries. I had trouble with the Wi-Fi in the hotel after the first day. I went back to the front desk to request help. "Oh your problem is that you are in airplane mode." I explained that airplane mode did not affect Wi-Fi and that it has worked elsewhere for years. She turned off my Airplane mode, even though I said not to do so, and said it was working.Yes it worked, but on cellular and when I got home I got a $24 bill for the five minutes it was not in airplane mode. That really annoyed me.The location is close to the Centraal Station and not too far from where many of the river cruise ships dock, which was convenient. But to get to most of the other parts of downtown Amsterdam it generally means going back past Centraal Station and then to the interesting parts of the city. We stayed at another hotel previously that gave better access to the city.But the breakfast is amazing!
title: A nice hotel but a little frustrating.

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Loved our room, amazing floor to ceiling windows, accommodated all four of us in our family.centrally located and easy to get everywhere. honors lounge is good, but WAY TO CROWDED!!!Lobby was also too crowded, the small spaces to accommodate our stay, causing a very very scrunched feeling, was the only reason I took off one star.great concierge service, worth it to boom your stuff with them instead of trying to do everything on your own. they were very helpful and got us in all the attractions we wanted to see.
title: great hotel, location, and views

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: All is really awesome about this place includes the staff in all areas of work, location of the hotel, room size, toiletries etc. The only bad experience was no bell desk services at checkout hence had to drag multiple bags thru the carpeted corridor (carpet makes bag wheels difficult to drag) as they were very busy and bad courtesy by the receptionist that checked me out. Minus the checkout experience this hotel is fantastic!!!
title: Fantastic place!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: *A Crowded Mess in lobby and Club!!*No bellmen at all!! Front desk staff had to come after one hour to help with arrival and a month of Europe travel and CRUISE luggage! Complete Error that this hotel is r ated a five star hotel by anyone!*Front desk acted like a THREE STAR Hotel at best!*SMALL ROOMS, but clean.*FANTASTIC ROOF TOP BAR!!!*THE HIGHEST DEMAD LOCATION, but MILLIONS of Tourists EVERYWHERE!!!!!
title: CROWDED KAOS!!!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: So .. I picked this place because of the location and I have to say it was fantastic ! Close to everything! Staff are great we had a mini suite which was also more than enough for 2 adults and 2 kids - breakfast choice was good There is free water in the reception which is a nice bonus The executive lounge is tiny though and always busy it's not somewhere I ever wanted to go due to it being overcrowded however I would stay here again in a heartbeat .. it's clean it's central it has a starbucks !!!
title: Excellent location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Lovely staff. Delicious much appreciated warm cookie on check in.Rooms spotless and comfortable. Breakfast fab.We were here for a big b'day and the front desk gave us complimentary drinks in the Sky bar. We weren't expecting it to be 'the place'. It was rammed, great vibe, great music, great people watching, great cocktails. What can I say it was great!Every tram comes back to Centraal so easy to get home. Being so near the station it is constant crowds once you step out of the hotel.
title: Great location near Centraal

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We traveled to Amsterdam to go on a Viking River Cruise Rhine Getaway and arrived a day early to try to recover from travel fatigue and to have a chance to explore a little of Amsterdam before embarking on the cruise. We chose the DoubleTree because of the proximity to the piers where the Viking ships usually dock, as well as being in a central location. The location was ideal - it was so close we were able to walk with our luggage to the ship. If you're arriving by train, the hotel is ideally situated, as Centraal Station is a short walk as well. We arrived in the late morning and had requested an early check-in. We knew it was unlikely and we were right, as the hotel seemed very busy, as I believe it is most of the time. We were given a warm cookie and found a place to sit and wait. Fearful of falling asleep sitting up, we set out in the rain to explore to stay awake and find some lunch. We highly recommend an Argentine Steakhouse called LaGouch, which is close to the hotel - we had memorably wonderful burgers and fries there. The hotel had many eating areas and places, with a very large Starbucks among them. When we went on a walking tour on the first day of our cruise, the guide told us the Starbucks is owned by the DoubleTree. There is bottled water and green apples in the lobby for the taking. The hotel is close to restaurants and shops, as well as the Red Light District, and there are some nice shops in Centraal Station itself. I have to say the exterior of the hotel is one of the ugliest I've ever seen, but it's also one of the most bustling and clean hotels I've ever stayed. Given that the hotel is next to the many train tracks, you heard no noise inside the hotel - the trains actually make little noise. We had a King room and it was a small room that is modern - maybe Spartan - in appearance. A ledge running on either side of the wall serves as the night tables. In addition to a phone, there is an Apple Mac TV in the room. They use iconic symbols to mark what is in the drawers - with a coffee pot on the drawer of the desk and a blow dryer in a drawer in the wardrobe. There was only one picture in the room - above the bed. There was also a mini-fridge that came in handy. The bathroom was all gleaming white and chrome and extremely clean. The sink was square - again, very modern and attractive. There was no tub - just the shower with a shower head providing various settings. Overall, this is a wonderfully convenient hotel that seems to be well run and very clean. The staff at the front desk all seemed to speak excellent English and were very professional. If we were ever to have the pleasure of returning to Amsterdam, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
title: Great Location for Proximity to Viking River Cruise Docking Pier

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We were in an executive suite for a family of 4. We had a bedroom with a king bed and they brought in a roll away and made up the couch for the two teens. Very nice hotel very close to the center of Amsterdam. We flew into AMS and took the train to the central station. It was a short walk with luggage to the DoubleTree. The staff were amazing. All very friendly and welcoming. The room was a perfect place to recover from "jet leg" and to walk around Amsterdam.It's a busy tourist hotel, but the Executive Lounge on the 1st floor has a lovely breakfast and evening appetizers and drinks. We stayed on the top floor, where there was also a popular sky lounge with a roof top deck to look out over a the old town of Amsterdam. There was also a Starbucks in the lobby of the hotel as well as a few restaurants that seemed popular. The cruise port was also a short walk away and we were able to walk with our rolling luggage (or a short cab ride if you have large luggage). I thought all the hotel prices in Amsterdam were very expensive, but felt I received the value from the DoubleTree and would stay there again if I'm back in Amsterdam on business or vacation.
title: Great Option for central Amsterdam

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Very clean and well maintained. Helpful and welcoming staff. Great variety of food at breakfast bar well suited for children. Amazing views from tower executive suite. Great location in the vicinity of Dam Square and close to tram and metro stations.
title: Excellent location, helpful staff

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: This hotel is located directly across the street from the Centraal Station. We walked to most sites in the city, but took the direct train for 7 Euro to the airport. The staff is super friendly, and the Sky Lounge was a popular place in the evenings.We had a harbor view, and could watch cruise ships coming in and out of the harbor.
title: Great location, good cookies!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Only stayed one night, but is definitely the place to make your base when visiting Amsterdam. Easy reach of central station and good cheap parking under the hotel. The bar is perfect, great in the sun and maybe even better after sun set
title: Great views

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: " God is in the details " This hotel has a GREAT location and very nice amentities . Best top floor bar for no charge viewing. Check in was in need of help with customer service. Get fixed quote for trip to/from airport ( taxi) about $60 one way for 4. Trip on railroad is cheap but step lively and be prepare for long walks and lots of time to clear airport ( huge ) Otherwise a good value .
title: A hotel/.resort Architect operator

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Very nice hotel. Balcony room was great for watching boat traffic and nice view of the city. Executive Queen room with balcony was nice but small. Really enjoyed the executive lounge for breakfast and evening snacks and drinks.
title: July 2017 visit

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Superb hotel. Next to train station. Would recommend balcony room with executive lounge access. Free food and drink for two hours. Great breakfast and very good friendly staff. Will be back. Would highly recommend this to all if it is within your budget.
title: Great Hotel

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Had 2 nights here before embarking on a river cruise. The hotel was great. Very central, walking distance to town centre, canal cruise stops, railway station and river cruise boat port. The staff were friendly, spoke English, helped organise tours and recommended great sight seeing spots. Free water, cookies and apples at front desk, which was an added bonus. Rooms were roomy, clean and modern. Hotel restaurant great. Bar upstairs with city views beautiful. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough! Was a great place to recoup after 24 hours travel from Australia.
title: Double Tree by Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The location was great very close to Centraal station. All the major route trams, buses, boats and tours start from near by places.. The room was spacious. I wish they could have added some area from room to bathroom because shower cubicle was too small. The view from room was great facing canal. Though the room was facing main street but there was zero noise in the room. Executive rooms are highly recommended for good view and access to executive lounge.The reception staff was very helpful. During my 2 time stay we got an early check-in. The concierge was again very helpful and knowledgeable. In spite of being very busy they were doing a great job. The breakfast was excellent. When it used to be very crowded in the morning they used to open executive lounge. The water bottles and apples were always kept near reception for guest's convenience. The best place of the hotel was their Sky Lounge on top floor which was a very lively and full of life almost everyday. No doubt a hotel worth staying again.
title: Excellent location and service !!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Location is perfect, right next to train station. The entire hotel, and rooms, are clean. Easy check-in and friendly staff/ Knowledgeable concierge willing to help - sells tram and museum tickets! Great restaurant and rooftop bar. Even a Starbucks! If you are lucky enough to get into the executive lounge, the breakfast is fantastic. Not cheap during peak but worth it.
title: Doubletree Amsterdam is fabulous

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Great place to stay - rooms were spotless. Fabulous hotel and great views. Food was good. Restaurant staff were lovely but I must say the reception staff were very poorly mannered and unhelpful. Very sharp and simple not nice. Quite disappointing as the rest of the stay was faultless.
title: Hen weekend in Amsterdam!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We were on a girls 3 day trip in Amsterdam. This hotel is very close to the Main Centraal Station where you can get a train direct from the Airport in 15 minutes. Hugely convenient if you don't have long in the city. This is also one of the main Tram stops so you can access the tram and Metro network in 2 mins walk from the hotel.The Hilton is a chain corporate so don't expect boutique charm . But do expect great buffet breakfast, clean relatively spacious rooms . Modern bathroom good quality toiletries and efficient fast service in all areas. Plenty of staff on hand to help with concierge type queries , buying tram day tickets at the hotel etc. All in all a perfect place if you want to explore this city and have a comfortable efficient hotel to return to. Oh and yes one hidden gem it has one of the best roof top bars in the whole city on the 11th floor. Excellent cocktails for a late night.
title: Great location for City Break in Amsterdam

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Stay elsewhere - the service was abysmal and staff was rude and unknowledgeable, the rooms are incredibly small, and there are so many other hotels in Amsterdam that it's not worth spending 200+ euros staying here.
title: Bad Service and Small Rooms

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: I was so pleased with my interactions with Guest Services prior to my arrival. They assisted me with reservation of a driver to meet at the airport and transport to the hotel. The driver could not have been better to us, assisting with finding a wheelchair for my husband's comfort. They quickly found us a taxi/car for transfer to the nearby Passenger Cruise Terminal the following morning. The service level was so evident throughout our short one night stay at this hotel--- I will return!
title: Excellent service

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Very stylish and modern hotel perfectly located next to the central station. Comfortable if not slightly smallish rooms but very nicely furnished with an Apple Mac TV. The lobby bar was good for a cold beer (good selection) or snack. The Skylounge was superb with great views over the city especially as the sun sets.
title: Perfect location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We stayed here in May for just one night at the end of a cruise and had not ourselves chosen the hotel. This time we came for a couple of nights having had a positive experience last time. We were given an upgrade to an executive room which was a nice touch. We can find nothing to criticise -check in staff and the waiters are all friendly and efficient. The executive lounge is small but during our stay it was never over-crowded though we can see how it could become so. The snacks served at 6 pm were really good. As before we very much liked the Sky Lounge with its great views over the city and a nice food menu. This time we also tried the Eastwood Grill for dinner and were not disappointed. All in all another very pleasant stay. The location is also excellent for sightseeing and is of course only five minutes away from the train station too.
title: Our second visit to the DoubleTree-still pleased with it !

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Stayed last month for two nights prior to our Viking Cruise.Very convenient to Centaal Station and cruise port, both a short walk of less than 10 minutes.We had a "garden view" room. This meant we could look down to a green area and directly into the Windows of the other wing. Avoid this and demand an outside room.The room was small and lacked storage space for our 2 suitcases. It was clean though and the beds were comfortable.We looked in the "executive" lounge and it was jammed. We're glad we didn't pay for entry.
title: Average Stay

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Was in Amsterdam to see U2 last weekend, stayed at the Doubletree Centraal Station. Excellent location, access to shopping, old town, museums and 20 mins trains ride to the Amsterdam Arena. Super friendly staff .. early checkin after a 12 hour flight was appreciated.. breakfast was super.. dinner at the steakhouse was entertaining..we had a good time,
title: Great stay at the Doubletree Amsterdam....

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: I would have to say excellent even though one thing needs addressing. Start with all the positives. Great Location, 5 mins from train station and everything is in walking distance, we nearly got a 3 day transport ticket, so glad we didn't. Hotel check in faultless. We arrived to drop our bags off 4 hours early , to be told our room was ready, 10th floor overlooking Amsterdam. Great start. Room perfect in both appearance and practicality .There had been some mixed reviews over the executive lounge, we found this on the first night, we got back at 5.15 ish only to find no food or drinks until 6. (only tea and coffee) never booked a ex lounge with these constraints before.This then created a stampede at 6. Family's also saw this as an opportunity to feed the kids for the evening .The did bring out meals rather than smaller canopies/sandwiches/cheese etc.Also the drinks were very limited red/white wine and beer.Also on the ground floor. Everywhere previous have been high up with views. Not a relaxing pre evening drink by any means. However two things to add, did complain and had a hand written letter in room with drink vouchers to main lovely bar area and also the breakfast on both occasions was nothing like evening. Great food selection and quiet atmosphere, we went around 7.30 ish. Roof top bar was worth a visit , drinks not cheap but would you really expect two drinks for 10 euros in that location,that is what you are paying for. Our two drinks a cocktail and red wine 26 euros. So in summary hotel apart from ex lounge evenings we would recommend to anyone staying in Amsterdam. All staff very friendly and helpful. Thanks Doubletree
title: Great Location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Stayed here before and after a Holland America cruise. It was an easy walk into the city, just a block from the train station and less than a mile from the pier. Rooms were available early in the day, a great plus. The space was adequate and included everything we needed. The ground floor restaurant had a good burger and relaxed atmosphere. The Check in and out processes were efficient and fast. All desk staff spoke excellent English and were very knowledgeable about the city and how to get around.
title: Convenient location and comfortable stay

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Staff trip for circa 40 people, DT at Ams Centraal was the perfect choice, booking process excellent for group, staff in hotel professional and very helpful. Plenty of options at breakfast, fantastic hotel.
title: Group trip - Service is excellent

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Pros: -Service level from all employees Experienced that they did the "little extra" to make our stay as good and comfortable as possible. -Location -Breakfast -Atmosphere Cons: -It costs to get quality :)
title: Perfect hotel as a base for experiencing Amsterdam

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We were booked into the DoubleTree by Scenic for a couple of extra days at the end of our river cruise. The room we were given was an odd shape and very small. Too small for two adults with large suitcases. Could hardly move in the room and no storage in the room to unpack. Another room was available but only with an additional 50 euro cost, but had Executive Club Lounge access. The Exec. Club Lounge was a joke with no food or drinks, other than tea and coffee and biscuits and lollies available all day or night. Fridge was locked during the day. Only drinks and food available was between 6-8pm when the place was packed with families and children who came to gt the free food and took servings that would cover their evening meal. Food and drink was over the floor and it was not a pleasant place to be in. Do not waste your money thinking you will get the usual Executive Club lounge facilities for your additional cost in the upgrade. The room you get with the upgrade is the same size as we received at other hotels during our tour as standard rooms. DoubleTree need to review their up-selling of rooms and the "Executive Club Lounge" access which is not executive at all. Take your own shower cap as there is none provided in the bathroom amenities. Although the location is great and centrally located ,we were totally disappointed with our stay at this hotel. Couldn't even get a smile from the check-in staff when we returned to check into our room as our room was not ready on arrival. Would look at another hotel if we were to travel to Amsterdam again as we would not stay here if we had our choice next time.
title: Size of Room and Executive Lounge a big dissappointment

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Modern hotel in great location with very good public transport links rooms are reasonable size. Staff and service were great , cleanliness and buffet breakfast too. The only slight disappointment was the size of the bed and the comfort.
title: Very central position with great public transport links

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The Doubletree Hilton Amsterdam Centraal Station is located right next to the main Amsterdam train station and is very convenient from the airport (by direct train in less than 30 min) and for taking the regional and international trains to other cities in the Netherlands or in Europe. There are also many trams and buses that depart from in front of the Central Station so getting around Amsterdam is easy from the hotel. The rooms are modern but on the small side but they are very efficiently and effectively set up with a small storage cabinet for some clothes and the in room safe, a work desk with a Mac computer that also serves as the TV, and a small coffee table with low chair for an additional seat. I have HHonors Gold and so enjoyed an upgrade to a King Deluxe room with a nice view of the city center and also had complimentary breakfast at the buffet restaurant. The buffet had a very good selection of food including some Asian options (vegetarian sushi, Chinese congee with Chinese fried doughnut). One can also order eggs and omelettes from the wait staff but I would probably skip that and just go stick with the buffet as the omelette I ordered was not very good and a bit dried out. The location does mean a bit of a longer walk to areas of interest such as the Dam Square. But the trams are plentiful and frequent and not expensive to take and pretty much everyone will pass by the Dam so one can ride instead of walk.
title: Great Location for airport and train transfers

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The DobuleTree Hilton has an incredibly service minded and friendly staff. The room are pleasantly furnished, clean and comfortable. The breakfast is lavish and one of the best we have encountered in Europe. The central location is an additionally plus. Highly recommendable hotel
title: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel fantastic hotel with central location

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: This hotel is great from selecting your own room to the check out. Breakfast was amazing with great service. Rooms were clean and Beds where comfortable. Very easy to get any where from this location especially the train station.
title: First time to Amsterdam

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The hotel was modern and had a wonderful location that was within walking distance to downtown. The rooms were not overly large (typical of Europe) but they were very nice. The staff was always very helpful. They helped us book a riverboat tour that was wonderful. Made many recommendations to wonderful restaurants in the area. The rooftop bar gets quite busy, but is a fun place to go at night with amazing views of the city. During the day, you can get lunch at the bar. We would definitely recommend staying here.
title: Beautiful hotel with wonderful views of Amsterdam!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: This hotel has two extremes!!! Excellent being the staff who were always attentive! The drinks and service at the bar! The food provided at the lounge! The location! Terrible being the design of the rooms, ours was a queen suite with so much wasted space and terrible sharp corners.! The Executive lounge which was like a cheap pub on a Friday night...too many people, no supervision,shocking food handling practices! We moved completely from the lounge for drinks into the bar where they provided good service, great drink variety and just shook there heads at the poor behavior in the lounge! Administration need to fix this problem!
title: Good but could have been great!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Location is ideal. 10 minute trainride from airport and also parking available. Large busy hotel but brandnew. Rooms are small but confortable. Skylounge is perfect with great view. Meeting rooms are very good too
title: Perfect located hotel

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: This hotel was a great place to stay. It is centrally located, close to trams, buses and trains and within walking distance of some attractions. The rooms are well appointed and the staff did all in their power to make our stay comfortable. They were helpful, friendly and attentive.
title: A great experience

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: This is a European modern styled hotel located on the island across from the Centrum of Amsterdam. 5-10 minute walk to train station, city trams, canal tours or across the bridge to Centrum. On our last visit to Amsterdam, we stayed right off Dam Square, but prefer this property/location. You could take the train from the airport to the main train station, and walk to this hotel quite easily. Hotel rooms are spartan, but offer all amenities usually offered. TV is an Apple iMac, which I liked. Internet is fast. Hotel is far enough from the Centrum that nighttime noise is rarely heard. Good nights sleep here. There's a refer in the room and bottled water is complimentary! Only real complaint is the carpet is relatively low nap direct glue down, and as a result is dirty in halls and rooms. If you can ignore that, you will have a pleasant stay. We had breakfast buffet at the restaurant and availed ourselves of the Starbucks on the main floor. Sky Lounge on the top floor has a great view and really expensive exotic drinks that are worth the price just to look at. We also rented bikes from the front desk to ride around and see the real Amsterdam. Would happily stay here again in the future.
title: Great location near to main train station and Centrum

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Even though we stayed in an executive room it was still a small room for the Hilton Gardens. In saying that the room was very clean and the staff were on the whole friendly. The location was very good and close to the main part of the city and the red light area. The executive lounge is only very small so if you want a comfortable breakfast get there early. The photo is view from a third floor room.
title: Only just Average

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Great location! Great staff! Great rooms and a Starbucks in the lobby The sky lounge is a must visit. Walking distance from city center. Definitely will come back and stay. Food options in the hotel too are well priced and was a great meal. A special thanks to the Brit! that went out of her way to accommodate our request!
title: One of the best in Amsterdam

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
