review: The right location, very nice hotel with big rooms and great service, the food is at best, very friendly with children, have plenty of spots to set and have drinks, close to everything, outstanding view from your rooms.
title: Awsome

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We stayed twice at this hotel recently and could not have been more satisfied with the rooms and the customer service. We enjoyed the executive lounge, the downstairs bar and the rooftop bar. The nighttime views are amazing and should be visited if you come to town. The rooms are well sized and each one has an IMAC that can be used as TV, music or computer. We had great views of the central city from both of our rooms. Will be back!!
title: Top Flight Hotel

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: I don't write reviews but I had to for this hotel because I was extremely disappointed.We are HHonors members. Checked in on 7/26/17 around 3:45pm for 2 nights. We paid a lot of money for a "King Executive Suite on High floor w/ river view" and mind you I had to pay in advance. We ended up with a room on 5th floor (out of 11 floors)....Room 501 with view of train tracks and buildings. One of which is an abandon building with graffiti on it...(see pics)...if this is what they called a room with a view, I can only imagine what a room with no views looks like.We spoke to the same agent at the HHonors desk who checked us in, about the room that was assigned to us. Instead of being apologetic, she automatically stated it was our fault. She stated we picked our exact room online when we checked in via the app...WRONG. When I checked in with the HILTON app, unlike other Hilton properties, this hotel DOESN'T provide you with the option to pick your room. Maybe she needed to be better trained on her customer service skills and knowledge of how her hotel app works.A few hours later, the manager called and gave us an option to move to another room in the morning, however it would be in a room with a smaller bed. Once AGAIN why would you offer me a room that is NOT what I had paid for in advance. Therefore we told her we don't want it as it's a smaller bed. No other solutions were given. We've stay at other hotels in Europe where they actually look at customer's reservations and have everything set up before you check-in....DoubleTree DID NOT do such. The sofa bed for my child to sleep on was not setup when we arrived, nor were there any extra bed sheets, pillows or blankets provided.Room had marks on wall, coffee table was all scratched up and stain on couch. A/C was not cold.With executive suite you get access to the executive lounge. We decided to have a snack and a drink before our dinner plans. Hors d'oeuvres starts around 6pm and we arrived around 6:10 and it was PACKED. You could not open the door as the line for food was long. My 12 year old even asked why would they setup food near the doorway?? It made no sense. We decided to go elsewhere.The next morning, we had a do not disturb on our door and the housekeeper still came in.....Double Tree please explain what's the point of the sign on the door????We were every excited to come to Amsterdam and enjoy our stay at DoubleTree. But turned out to be a disappointment. DoubleTree management, Below are some suggestions...1- hire front desk employees with customer service skills and who knows how to find solutions to problems and not blame customers!!!2- staff who handle reservations should coordinate/assign rooms accordingly3- housekeeping should NEVER enter a room if there was a do not disturb sign.4- don't place drinks or food near doorway as when it gets busy, people tend to line up near doorEither confirm your room a head a time or STAY at the Marriott! They have better customer service and takes good care of their reward members.
title: Real review was on DoubleTree- HUGE DISSAPOINTMENT

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Excellent hotel. Great family suites. Incredible breakfast with lots of food options, toys and coloring books for kids. Super friendly staff. Will come back, can't say enough great things! Was super impressed.
title: Excellent stay

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Stayed for a weekend break in Amsterdam. The hotel is just next door to the Central Station, really convenient for getting around and the airport.Rooms are spacious. We had a room on 10th floor, great views and no noise from the Skylounge, one storey above. Coffee (with refill) and cakes good value in SkyloungeBreakfast well stocked and we had no problems getting a table every day. Eastwoods restaurant did us proud for dinner and pulled the stops out decorating my sweet plate to celebrate my birthday.Overall an excellent hotel and will stay there again.
title: Excellent well positioned hotel.

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We had a company conference few years back at this Hilton Double Tree, this time was passing by and decided to stay overnight at the Hilton Double Tree Amsterdam Centre. Wow how the management has changed they are driven by "Text Book" service!!We ordered room service, as we do signed for the food which arrived quiet late, when we opened the tray the pizza was not what we ordered and naan bread missing with curry, called the room served immediately. The man was arrogant and abusive telling me we got the right food he will come and check and put it right, about 40 mins later called him again he was not going to do anything about it by now food had gone cold, so we told him we have left all the food outside the room take it off the bill.Next morning went to check out and the receptionist charged us for the room service which I challenged that we did not eat and have returned the food, she said we had signed for it therefore we have to pay for it, we should have complained last night and given the room service time to fix the issue. Hello listen to me i have just told you we waited 40 mins for the room service to come back. I spoke to another manager, she seemed a bit sympathetic, but that duty manager came out he was the same we will investigate the issue, hello I am paying €37 for something I did not have? He was lost bothered about customer service, simply gave a card to email to.I made it very clear to all the three assistants I am not short of €37 it's the matter of Principle and customer serviceI asked for a copy of the receipt paid in full and left.All there were least bothered about listening or making an effort to take the room service off the bill.Worst front desk personality and service ever received.
title: Avoid this Double Tree Hilton plenty of better choices

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We had a suite or club room facing the city which was superb. The staff were excellent and the choc chip cookie on arrival was a nice touch. The hotel is in a fantastic spot within easy walking to everything. My only criticism was that our toilet was unclean and obviously had not been touched when the room was cleaned from the previous resident. All in all a great stay.
title: Perfect position with excellent amenities

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We come for a weekend break every year and each time find the service to be friendly, the rooms clean and well equipped, the cookies given at reception delicious and warm, the checking in/out process easy, and a pleasure to stay. The location is perfect for going out at night, near the station (but you never hear any trains) and easy walking distance to everywhere. Always consistently good.
title: Another excellent stay!

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: We had a double executive room with a slight view over Amsterdam. The balcony had a great view but not really direct access from room... we checked in early and received a warm welcome biscuit each... nice touch... the Executive lounge is too small for the volume of people and afternoon drinks were an impossibility unless you wanted to fight for a place... the breakfast during the week was fine but crowds in the weekend...not like the executive lounge we've used in other Hilton hotels. Room clean and comfortable. Curtains able to block out the late night daylight in July...Close to train station and this was good for airport connection. Also close to other areas of interest.
title: A warm welcome and cookie to say welcome...

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The Hilton Doubletree is a few minutes walk to Central Station and the hub of Amsterdam. The hotel seems somewhat tired and the foyer is not grand either. Our room of course was not ready but we were offered an upgrade to an executive suite which included breakfast and the executive lounge privileges for an extra 100euro, which we opted to do and was well worth it. Entering our room on the 10th floor with great city and canal view we were a bit shocked at the blandness of the room and only a queen bed. All the usual amenities were provided. Free wifi too.Staff were very friendly and a fantastic buffet breakfast with exceptional waitress staff.Yes we would stay here again.
title: CENTRAL LOCATION - TIP: UPGRADE TO A CLUB ROOM

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: My favorite hotel in Amsterdam! Very convenient location next to the train station, perfect starting point for touring the city. Great hotel amenities, food etc but best of all, the staff. A little surprising for a big chain hotel, but the staff are genuinely friendly, very professional and will make your stay that much better. If you appreciate convenience, quality amenities and great service, this is the place for you.
title: Highly recommend this hotel

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: The rooftop lounge is sooo cool, plush and relaxing with great 360 degree views of Amsterdam you could spend the whole evening here, watching sunset, listening to the live DJ and enjoying nice Negroni's and other delights. The best place in Amsterdam for a drink with friends, no question.
title: Amzing Sky Lounge bar

hotelName: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Amsterdam Centraal Station
review: Nice property with an easy location for entering the city by train and exploring the town by public transportation. Had this place for my parents visiting town and it's always good to have Hilton reliability for travelers.
title: Hilton reliability close to Centraal station

review: The location is non descript but near to the station which was easy to get into Amsterdam Central. Über is great in Amsterdam also. The room was okay- bit of charm with decorations - but also strange shape. It was a little stuffy and I didn't sleep well. The front desk staff were friendly enough. The gym is useless don't bother unless you like to work out in a small basement. I paid around €120 without breakfast and would not consider it amazing value.
title: Business Stay, average.

review: Booked this hotel for a last minute trip in December and throughly enjoyed the stay, the staff were lovely, helpful and very accommodating. When we arrived i was disappointed to find that two twin beds were pushed together for my partner and i (i had specifically booked a double bed through Expedia) however i called down to reception and they were eager to help and we were moved to a different room. I really liked the design of this hotel, especially as we travelled around Christmas. It was very comforting to arrive to the fire after a cold walk. The bathrooms are lovely too with a fantastic shower!I would also like to add that i couldn't hear anyone in the surrounding rooms during our stay which made us feel at ease and more like home.
title: Warm and Welcoming

review: My husband and I stayed here along with both sets of our parents. We had a wonderful stay and found that the hotel was easy to find and walk to from the train station (Slorterdijk Station-where we could easily get to Amsterdam Centraal for the local sites, and it was a quick ride from the airport).Breakfast was included in our rooms-but my mother in law booked our reservation so confirm this when you book yourself :)-and it was delicious. The mini pancakes were my favorite, but cheese and cold cuts along with yogurt and granola were also available. Coffee, tea, and hot chocolate are available all the time from self serve machines.Dinner here is not included, but we highly recommend it! Our first server was extra friendly, and happy to make jokes and drink recommendations. We asked her "What should we do while in Amsterdam?" And she directed us to Die Hallen, a market/food area which was great fun and full of locals.The room was clean, the shower was a nice rain water style one, and the bed was comfortable. The staff are friendly, and my husband and I could easily step outside for a run. Overall our experience here was great, give the Urban Lodge a go!
title: Excellent Hotel

review: Booked wondering if cheap rate meant cheap service. Thankfully we were wrong. Large clean spacious rooms extremely helpful and friendly staff. 2 minutes walk from train station then 5 minutes to central station. Fabulous bar to relax in with great bar staff. Would highly recommend.
title: Excellent hotel

review: This was a nice place with good food and a friendly staff. The room was rather small for 4 of us, but it worked out okay. We loved how accessible it was to transportation that took us into town. We enjoyed our 3-night stay.
title: Nice hotel in an easy location

review: It's outside of the central. After the bus or train ride, still need to walk about 10-15 min to reach the hotel. Imagine after a full day of touring, still need to walk quite far.... It's also not wheelchair nor stroller accessible, makes it very difficult to travel with luggages.
title: Not worth it

review: I stayed here for four nights in July when I was there for business and then vacation. My friend joined on the 2nd night and we shared the two single bed room. The location in ok. It is a close walk (10 min?) to he train or bus but if you're headed to anywhere but central station you're around 30 min of travel away. We opted for Uber 2/3 of the time because of this. Room was clean. Pretty basic towels and bedding. Lots of ways to charge electronics. The one thing that was lacking was an iron. My friend needed to iron his shirt and was not able to do so. We called down and they were loaned out. He had to wear the same shirt from the day before. We came back that evening and they still didn't have one. Same situation the next morning even though we had asked to put one aside. One was finally returned an hour later so we were able to get one, but not ideal. In all it's decent value compared to rooms in the center but wouldn't say I'd stay here again.
title: Fine stay with a couple hiccups

review: Great hotel. Staff very helpful and pleasant. Rooms great. Very comfy bed. one side of hotel a little traffic noise if your window is open but no enough to disturb. Air con good. Breakfast good and the restaurant whilst limited choice was good as well. Drinks a little expensive in th bar but free coffee all day makes up for that.
title: Great hotel. Quiet location but good,links into the centre of Amsterdam in 6 mins on train.

review: Really enjoyed our stay here. It's a very clean hotel with great facilities. We brought our bicycles with us and used them to explore Amsterdam. It takes about 20 minutes or so, across a wonderful park, to get to the main part of the city. And there's a few convenient bars in the park should the need arise to take a break during the city commute!We found the staff to be helpful and friendly. And the constant free coffee in the lounge area is very welcoming.Also we were able to store our bikes in the underground garage for no extra charge. Car parking is free only if you book your reservation directly with the hotel.
title: Father and son trip with bikes. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

review: The room was great and the staff was more than helpful. They had recommendations for tours, places to eat and so much more. The hotel had an elevator. The breakfast was good and had both hot and cold choices. I would definitely use this hotel again.
title: Great quaint hotel in Amsterdam

review: My third time in Amsterdam and this was the best one I've stayed in. Within walking distance to the station and cafes and restaurants. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was a very high standard
title: One of the best hotels I've stayed in

review: We visited the hotel in Feb 2015 and again April 17. It's a great local small boutique style hotel. It is well located and a cute looking place.I see no reason not to visit. The staff were very good and even emailed prior to visit to assist with our specific requirement for a family reunion. Thanks!
title: Nice boutique gem, well located near central station

review: The location of this hotel, a few minutes walk from the station but also in between the shopping area and the red light district cannot be beaten. Canals everywhere, this is a very central hotel. Accomodation prices are high in Amsterdam, so this is not cheap but it is hard to find better value for money. Nice bar, good breakfast buffet, fine wifi service.This is our favorite place to stay in Amsterdam.
title: A great hotel for an Amsterdam stay

review: Hotel is not air conditioned. The weather cooperated during our mid-June visit - lucky. Room was large, clean, and everything worked as it should have. Great location for touring. Bed was comfortable.
title: A Pair of Tourists

review: the Hotel itself is good, what you would expect from a Mercure. But please beware if you are staying while the building work is going on beside the hotel, not there fault I know, but we are just back from a 4 night stay. The work seems to only be during the week, but it starts from 7am and the hotel actually shakes, there is no way you can sleep through this, so unless you want a very early start best to double check if the work is still going on before you book.
title: Building Work

review: Arrived after 22 hours traveling, first impression was ok, room small, bathroom clean, regular hotel room, slept for a few hours only to be woken up by bulldozers and moving cranes at 7.10am, finally I called reception and the lady was apologetic and said we could swap rooms in the afternoon, (we are here for 3 nights) so my son and I packed up our suitcases and spent the day in the city, we came back only to change rooms as we didn't want to leave it too late, the girl at the reception explained that unfortunately they wasn't any rooms left and although she could see on the computer I had called in the morning, she told us that she too thinks the construction site starts too early, but there was nothing she could do. This should have been explained when booking, if I had known I would definitely not have booked, it's so unfair, I paid a lot of money for a 4 star hotel, right now a hostel would be heaven. I suggest if you're thinking about this hotel ask before booking if you will be in the construction zone, if so avoid it at all costs.
title: Construction site, poor service.

hotelLocation: De Lairessestraat 5-7, 1071 NR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at this hotel in July 2017. The it's very clean but if you need a hard bed for your back these won't do as they are very soft. Breakfast is amazing. The hotel is about a 10 minute tram ride from the heart of the city but very easy to get there. It is in the heart of the museum district though so if you are coming to the museums this is a perfect place.
title: Good place if you want to me near the museums

hotelLocation: De Lairessestraat 5-7, 1071 NR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Close to the major museums, park (museum square), grocery store (Albert) many restaurants and transit. Easy to walk to many attractions from her also. Comfy beds nice bathroom and breakfast available if you want but we are not big eaters so $15E was too much. Very friendly staff!!
title: Great spot

hotelLocation: De Lairessestraat 5-7, 1071 NR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My husband and I enjoyed our one night stay at this conveniently located hotel. The rooms are spacious, beds are comfortable and the organic breakfast is delicious. Highly recommendable for a short stay in beautiful Amsterdam.
title: convenient and friendly

review: We had dinner at the Dutchess with a party of 8. This is one of the better restaurants in Amsterdam. Managed by the same owners as Momo, Yzakaya, etc. Great food and fantastic ambiance. Get the chocolate explosion which is the icing on the cake.
title: The Dutchess

review: I was a bit dubious coming here with a child as on the website it looked too cool for school, but when I arrived at 10 looking to leave in bags and deal somehow with tired children who had taken a 6am flight (yup, a mistake) and they allowed us to our room without paying more then I thought- this place has core values of hospitality covered. Children rested, we hired bikes (they had children's ones too!) and headed off.. much thanks to making the holiday good..
title: Kindness

review: Really loved my stay at the W Amsterdam. I stayed in the Bank Building and loved it's style - the rooms were designed for maximum efficiency in a smaller space and the modern look is a cool contrast to the old building. The location is perfect for seeing everything you need to see in the city and the concierge (wish I remembered his name) was SO helpful and managed to get us tickets to the Anne Frank house for that day, saving us hours of waiting in line. And the rooftop bar is a must see for the great view. Would definitely recommend and stay there again next time I'm in Amsterdam.
title: A great place to stay in Amsterdam.

review: 5 out of 5! What a beautiful hotel. My husband and I had a room in the exchange building. The staff were prompt and courteous. The room was user friendly and had everything we needed. The bed was very comfortable. The pool in the vault of the bank building was spectacular! Lovely hot and cool plunging pools, very nice sauna, and a stunning pool. Everything down to the shampoo and conditioner was on point. When I find myself back in Amsterdam I will for sure be staying at this property again. Thank you W Amsterdam for a perfect stay.
title: Perfect!

review: My wife and me stayed at the W hotel for the weekend. We've been to many hotels we haven't seen for a long time such a we'll designed hotel. Starting from the lobby reception the rooms the restaurants and even the spa and sweeming pool Amazing. The staff was very polite and helpful and the room was very comfortable The hotel is also located very close to the Dam. Don't miss the roof bar with the city spread all overIn short - this is the place for staying in Amsterdam
title: A fabulous hotel in Amsterdam

review: Absolutely excellent... book it, you won't regret it. I'll be back, I hope! Well trained knowledgable staff. Keen to make your stay perfect. Location excellent, in the heart of everything! Room was super cool. A real experience.
title: Visiting from Scotland to see U2 in concert

review: The W in Amsterdam is very well located near the Royal Palace and walking distance from a lot of the city. It's also close to the train station. We stayed on the Bank side (the hotel is split in two by a road) and it was wonderful. The room had high ceilings, lots of light and was very high tech with lots of outlets and USB ports. The Duchess is a fabulous restaurant just downstairs from the rooms which serves breakfast, lunch and dinner in a very elegant setting. The staff was gracious and helpful. Highly recommended!
title: Even better than the American version

review: Absolutely amazing from start to finish! Thanks so much to Daan Koenhein our W Insider who made our Stag even more awesomely W-onderful!!! From the moment we were greeted at the airport by our hotel chauffeur service to the check-in drink through to our room itself; we loved it! Regular visitors to other W hotels, this one definitely fits the brand style of trendy vibe and guest satisfaction above everything else. I was able to add Daan to WhatsApp and immediately we had our 'man on the ground' ensuring that our stay ran smoothly. Our friends had never stayed at a W before, but I think they'll be returning; in fact we all will! A big mention for Mr Porter too... the biggest tastiest steaks I've seen.Thank you once again to Daan, Frank, Leon and Igor for all working to ensure that our special weekend was extra special.Looking forward to the return.Until then, best wishesSteve and Rob
title: Amsterdam Stag Weekend

review: The location can't be beat, directly behind the Palace at Dam square! Made getting around Amsterdam very easy for first time visitors. The staff from front desk to concierge couldn't have been more helpful and went out of their way to explain the city to us.We stayed on the Bank side, not knowing the difference in their two buildings that make up the hotel. Next time we will try the Exchange as per the suggestion of several staff members. My wife and I like to experience new things, but the decor and style of the rooms were a little too modern for us. Shower in middle of room was unique, room was quite large considering we were in Europe.Didn't do much of anything in hotel, as we were constantly on the go, but would definitely recommend hotel for its' location and service.
title: Great location for first time visitors

review: My third stay at the W Amsterdam. Great location and wonderful staff. One of the bartenders on the rooftop, Cristiano (sp?) was extremely friendly and attentive during my first stay. I was traveling solo and it was nice to feel welcome. He even recalled my name and drink when I visited a second time. Food at Mr. Porter is excellent. Nice to have a grocery store in the building. I look forward to my forth visit.
title: Third stay..always excellent

review: The W in Amsterdam has two buildings across the street from each other. We stayed in the old hotel that used to be an old telephone exchange building. The rooms kept this theme - from the telephone booth shower with writing on the stall, telephone wire overhead lights, etc. Very cool. The bell hop, Kensy (sp?), went above and beyond. He stayed with us the whole check in process and answered any questions we had. During the walk to our room he asked our two girls what their favorite animals are. A few hours later he arrived at our door with a pillow for one with her name and favorite animal and the other got a teddy bear wearing a tshirt with her name and favorite animal!!! One of the our rooms was not cleaned properly when we arrived and the staff were so apologetic and even sent a bottle of champagne to our room. I didn't expect this amazing service from such a large/chain hotel. We would definitely stay here again!
title: Awesome Hotel!

review: We checked into this hotel at the last minute when we discovered that our other hotel didn't have a/c and that temperatures were quite warm in July, even in the evenings. My reasons for 4 stars and not five are the following: I called the hotel and reserved the room for an immediate check-in and I was told over the phone that an outside room was ready for our arrival at the bank building. However, when we arrived we had to wait 30 minutes for our room (we were jet-lagged so this seemed like a long time), when we got to the room it was an inside room! So, we went back and they promised us an outside room but said we'd have to wait another 30 minutes and gave us two drink tickets for the bar. The bar was fabulous but after 30 minutes, nothing, after 45 minutes, still nothing, so I went to check on it and was told to wait awhile longer. After 1 1/2 hours we were able to check into a gorgeous king room with a beautiful view - they had upgraded us because of the wait, which was very nice, but still it was a long wait. The room itself had a huge comfortable king bed, elegantly crisp and soft white sheets, motorized blinds, a large closet, a unique light fixture, a coffee machine, a large shower stall with excellent soaps and shampoos, and was quiet and extremely comfortable. After that the service was excellent. We loved the rooftop bar and pool as well. I would definitely stay here again.
title: Two gorgeous buildings in the heart of A'dam

review: What a great location! The front desk service was amazing and friendly. The room service menu was lacking. The concierge was busy doing her nails... irritating. The bartenders at the spa were a great source of information. Thank you! We were upgraded to a larger room and it was impressive with the automatic blind & light control, giant shower closet and huge bar. The bed was very comfortable and the room was very quiet. My only complaint was when we went up to Mr. Porter and sat at the bar, I got the impression they really wanted us to leave so they could give the seats away. The food was great, though.
title: First time but not last

review: The doormen are always the best part of the W Hotel experience. At the Amsterdam W, the doormen offered a friendly welcome on the street and quickly got us checked in and comfortably to our room. They also man the Concierge desk at street level and were great in assisting with suggestions on ideas of where to go in the city. The biggest issue we found at this hotel was the lack of housekeeping and maintenance attention. The blinds did not work in our room and two of the 5 ceiling lights were burned out. We were told on check-in that it would be resolved immediately. When we returned to the hotel four hours later at 10:30 PM, they had not. We were moved to a different room with similar maintenance problems. In the bathroom, the toilet brush was tangled with toilet paper from a previous guest stay and the holder was full of soiled water. We asked repeatedly at the desk to have it cleaned, and in our three day stay, it never was. Dirty glasses with the last sips of left over drinks that we brought up from the bar, were left by Housekeeping sitting on the desk and not removed in the daily room cleaning. You would expect more from a hotel of this caliber. I would revisit this hotel for the restaurants and rooftop bar, but would be reluctant to rebook a room here.
title: Usual W cool vibe - but staff seems to have trouble communicating

review: The W brand is very good at designing hype and trendy hotels. This hotel isn't an exception.There is such a cool vibe and I really loved the indoor pool/spa area. Unfortunately the rooftop pool was closed (due to maintenance, then to bad weather) both times we came..so we couldn't give it a try. The service is also very good, we went for breakfast a bit late (the buffet was closing) but the lovely waitress brought us ''a la carte pancakes'', fresh juice and hot chocolates and told us ''I'm only happy when my costumers are glad..and full''. What a nice touch! You really should ask a room with a city view (and not atrium view) as they are much much much nicer.
title: Wonderful design and incredible indoor pool/spa

review: Overall a great stay, although we did encounter some issues in the beginning of it, but i can only recommend to open your mouth and address your issues to staff and management. they did listen to us and our problems, and came with solutions and answers. the only thing i can hope now is that they use our feedback for their continuous improvement processes. Special warm thank you to Joost, at the breakfast at Mr Porter, his service is super top notch! a good example to all associates there! if all associates would tend that direction, i'm sure the hotel's staff attentiveness will land on the level the property merits! BTW; rooms are very nice! Breakfast super! i think it's at LEAST at same level of W Barcelona, if not even beyond, anyway it's great! Great selection of juices, and also bubbles in the morning! If you into heavier breakfast, try the one at mr porter, and have a minute steak in the morning! PS try the SPA as well, a divine place in the middle of Amsterdam! if there would be any point of attention towards visitors, than would it be the use of swimming gear in both spa as ont he wet deck (we've seen guests - in and externals - going with their underwear in the pools... maybe a stricter policy would be welcome there in order to maintain overall hygiene for the other guests)
title: super weekend at W Amsterdam

review: We stayed at the very well located W, an easy walk and as we found out, even easier tram ride from Central Station.Went to check in with the concierge but they don't do check in on the first (or zero) floor so up you go in a slow elevator to groovy 6. Why do you have to do this? Then a bunch of lovely young people made excuses for the room not being ready - we are OK with that. But finally after almost half an hour, we wanted to see the city and asked them to just store our bags, which is how we found out that the room was ready; nobody told us. Meanwhile we were given a free drink voucher. The bartender who was manning the bar must be the only person in Amsterdam who doesn't speak English. I asked for seltzer. Quizzical look. OK, agua frissante then? Oh, Sen-sir he replied and I thought he got "seltzer" but when I saw him reaching for the white wine I knew I'd be getting Sancere. And it was very good....so we surrendered to Fate. And the concierge service is so very dependent on who is behind the desk. Some were excellent, but our last one not so much. We asked about the tram, as we needed to catch the train to the airport and we were going to take the one in the back behind the hotel. No, take the one on the side. So we lost some time as we realized that our first instinct was right: EVERY tram from the back goes to Central Station, not so for the one the concierge recommended. But we got a great tip for a local rice table that was super good from one worker, and tickets and good information on the Rijksmuseum from another concierge - just still wondering why you couldn't just check in at arrival, why they split the desk responsibility. Still, it was clean, comfy beds, usual groovster eurotrash house music pumping (funny; one young man in the elevator as we were checking in commented on the "upbeat music" and the rest of us laughed as another young man said, "This must be your first time in a W!") Lots of reeking youngsters heading for the bar scene, all of that fine....it's just at this point I prefer better service over fashion forward. But that's just me. And the location is hard to beat.
title: Think I'm age -ing out of the W

review: My partner and I stayed at W for 3 nights and it was hands down one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. We felt both at home and immediately connected to the city and it's surrounding beauty thanks to W's wonderful facilities, services and staff.It's obvious W places an enormous emphasis on the small details; from their retro design influences, stylish decor, immaculate rooms and wide range of facilities; to their personal, friendly and very helpful staff. So much thought has been put into making this hotel stand out from the rest. All staff on the door, reception, providing room service and housekeeping's attention to detail were clearly as a result of a well organized team that communicate efficiently and effectively. There was even a fire alarm (thankfully no fire) on one evening and we were so impressed with how professional and stress free the evacuation procedure was dealt with by the MOD, security and all others involved. The spa facilities are equally unique and professionally run. Super friendly and genuinely interested staff, clean and relaxing environment and one of the best massages I've ever had! Thanks Michelle and team for the wonderful experience.This leads me to my final and equally special moment at W - the rooftop terrace restaurant and bar. Spectacular sunset view, delicious food (veg and meat lovers alike) and a really great atmosphere, once again thanks to W's top class family of staff. W has something kind of wonderful with kind and wonderful staff. We look forward to returning in the near future! Thanks again.
title: A something kind of wonderful place with kind and wonderful staff.

review: People really friendly, whatever, whenever works here fine, W Amsterdam pay you back your loyalty to the Starwood program.Rooftop is cosy , nice environment , breakfast is a bit small for a spoiled traveler in Asia , so Europe is different, therefore is good, Hotel is separated in two buildings what gives you an additional nice atmosphere, drinks a great wonderful view and all in all a stay in W Amsterdam is a remarkable stay.
title: W is always and almost everywhere the best,,,

review: I've stayed at the W Amsterdam perhaps 10 times or so, since it opened a couple of years ago. In truth, I've had very mixed experiences there - ranging from great to terrible. Most of the past negatives were the result of inadequate experience or training of hotel associates. However, during my last few stays, I have expressed some of my service concerns to the staff at the W, and I am pleased to report that I have noticed great improvements in service levels. There are still kinks to be worked out, but I'm happy to say that service levels are improving with time - particularly around consistency of service level between different associates. Kudos to the team at the W and I will certainly be staying again!I've stayed thousands of nights in hotels, and there are some very unique pro's about this property:- Try the rooftop pool. Long enough for short laps and incredible views. An amazing experience.- Spa in the Bank building is actually quite nice, but underutilized. You'll be the only ones there.- Great Centrum location - If you're runner, you can run down and around Vondelpark just to the south of the hotel. A solid run. If you're into shopping or eating, you'll be right in the middle of the action.- SPG Platinum breakfast at the Duchess is elegant and excellent.Special thanks to some memorable hotel associates: Charlie, Orlando, Yannick, and Andre! Look forward to seeing you all again soon.
title: Hotel associates make the difference!

review: I have previously stayed at the W Amsterdam and had a less than a stellar stay. I thoroughly thought about rebooking it when the time approached for our latest vacation, but I'm happy that I did as there have been MAJOR improvements since our last visit. Check in: There was a line at check in, however it moved quite quickly and there was a friendly staff member socializing and asking if anyone wanted water or anything in line. Excellent customer service. Upon arriving at the check in desk, we were delighted to find out that we had been upgraded. Our new room was not ready however, and the staff member let us know that they could text us when it was available. I was a little wary about this since we were not contacted during our last stay, but still provided our number. She also let us know of the new additions to the W (gym, etc) since our last visit. When our room was ready, the staff did promptly contact us and we were on our way. Room: We had a wonderful room with a gorgeous view of the city. As with usual W standards, the room was very modern and beautiful. It had the delicious smelling Bliss amenities and interesting reading material as well. Location: The W is very centrally located and it was easy to get to many places such as Anne Frank House or our canal cruise. Concierge: we had exceptional service when asking for recommendations on places to eat and which cruise to take. Concierge even went above and beyond to text us and let us know about the status of one of our dinner reservations. Overall, my second stay at the W Amsterdam really made up for my first one. I'm so happy I booked this hotel again and will be back on future vacations.
title: Great, hip hotel in a central location!

review: I generally love staying at W Hotels and my first stay last year at the W Amsterdam was truly special. Amazing room, welcome amenity, great service.For sure, the hotel has maintained its cool feel and general vibe. However, the personal touches seem to have fallen away. It's nice, just not as compelling as it once was.With that said, the rooms are very nice, modern and super clean. The staff is personable albeit not particularly attentive. The common areas are great -- the outside seating in the bar areas are among the very best in Europe, let alone Amsterdam.I'll be back for sure, just sorry that my last stay was not as special as my past experiences.
title: Good Stay, But Not as Special as Last Time

review: Hotel is very modern and in two different buildings across the street from each other. Our suite was in the Old Bank tower, the building where the Duchess Restaurant, gym and spa are located. Suite was large, modern and provides a nespresso coffee machine and large mini bar (not mini). Shower was kind of modern oval capsule, with great water pressure. Bed comfortable. wonderful light , lots of windows (there are black out curtains), Mr. Porter was my favorite restaurant, had breakfast there everyday and dinner twice. Great food and service. Duchess had good food, service not as good as at Mr. Porters. Roof top soaking pool fun and nice bar.Location of hotel is central, convenient to all tourist attractions . . . some longer walks away than others. This hotel is not too far from the train station, but we took a taxi into town from Schiphol Airport.
title: Modern, Hip in the City Center

review: After reading the mixed reviews on Trip Advisor, not sure what to expect. The location has to be the best in Amsterdam. Located just off Dam Square, walkable to everything in the heart of the city (restaurants, attractions, shopping, trams, train, etc). Staff is young and energetic, lots of staff always around to help. Both The Duchess and Mr Porter restaurants are upscale and well laid out. Restaurant staffs are efficient and pleasant. Full European breakfast is vast, fresh and well prepared. Rooms are nicely decorated and spacious. Only high praise for this W.
title: Location, Location, Location

review: Staying at this hotel was a blessing when you look at the location and service at the check in and check out but for the price you pay the room is small, the shower floor has big gaps between the tiles (a risk!) many tv channels did not work and a smile was hard to find... The building is beautiful but very noisy and the housekeeping is easy to hear in the hallways. The design is pretty but once again you are a modern and funky brand and I had better W experiences over the world. Room to improve!!!
title: Nice but could be better...

review: We have visited Amsterdam many times, but this is by far the best hotel we have visited. We will be staying here every time from now on! Rooms, services and bar and amazing! Perfect location, stay here!!
title: Best hotel in Amsterdam

review: Good hotel, nice room, located right in the center. The restaurant and bar on the top floor have great food and a stunning view. On a terrace is the smallest swimming pool I have ever seen, with a view over the royal palace.So if you go to Amsterdam and money is not to tight to mention for you this is the place to go
title: Great but a bit expensive

review: We stayed at the W Amsterdam Exchange hotel. There is another section of the hotel next door called the Bank (formerly a bank). The gym is in the bank and had all the equipment you will need for a solid workout: bench, free weights, bikes, treadmill and weight machines. You can eat breakfast at either the exchange or the bank. The breakfast had a buffet but also about 10 items that you can order as part of the breakfast (omlets, scrambled eggs etc.) Our room was a standard size but hip and was well laid out and we had a view of the busy Amsterdam streets. The location was in walking distance to everything. One of my favorite parts of the hotel was they offered a WhatsApp number for their whatever whenever customer service. If we had a question or needed something it was as easy as texting them via whatsapp and they were very prompt in replies as well as fulfilling our requests.
title: Hip hotel in a great location

review: I have stayed in several W hotels, so I had well-defined expectations. W hotels are (almost) uniformly outstanding properties with exceptionally attentive staff. The W Amsterdam is very well located. The property itself is magnificent. The architecture is stunning and clearly a great deal of thought and planning had gone into the design. The room I had was a fabulous room (upgraded) and didn't disappoint. Fantastic bed and bathroom, high ceilings and typically funky in a W hotel way.The problems started from the beginning. My room wasn't ready until almost 5pm. The check-in process was inattentive, being made to sign the same forms twice, as a minor irritation. I had to request that some of my bags be brought up. The mini-bar wasn't stocked at all, they forgot. The breakfast was very ordinary. An egg-white omelette I ordered was bathed in oil and inedible. The cold buffet was not properly stocked. A room service pizza arrived burned and when it was replaced, a side order was missed. At the same time, the chefs did seem to be having a very good time in the kitchen from what I could see and hear. After going out for a walk for a few hours, it was surprising that, despite a request to make up my room, it is 5.30pm at the time of writing this and it is still not made. This is despite complaining about it over an hour earlier. The staff do not talk to each other and share information. The manager was attentive to the feedback I gave but generally my perception was that the staff were (excessively) laid back and frankly lazy. I will come back because I am going to assume that my experience was not typical.
title: Surprising Disappointment

review: Very nice hotel. Design and comfort of the room was excellent. Breakfast was very good. Staff were exceptional. Check in and check out was very slow due to computer use issues. Great location and great views from the top floor.
title: Chic hotel

review: + Had probably the best massage ever, at the away spa today. Was welcomed by Jessica who was very friendly. She showed me where the locker room (which was extremely clean) was and a towel, bathrobe and slippers were provided by the W. Now the best; Csaba the masseur.. who gave an excellent deep tissue massage. I truly think the best I've ever had...- Only improvement I could think of, is that they probably should not mention the price of the massage on the confirmation emails they have sent to my email address. Since my girlfriend bought this for me as a gift and I should not have known that this is a really expensive massage
title: Amazing massage at the Away Spa

review: This hotel is exceptional, especially for the price. It's so stylish, comfortable, clean and fun. Everything in the hotel, especially the rooms, is designed to make a guest feel at ease. The decor is both modern and funny, with cork pinboards behind the bed, so that information is presented in an engaging way. The rooms are spotless, everything works perfectly and the beds are extremely comfortable, we slept like babies. Staff are helpful, explaining the hotel, area and tourist information expertly. We would definitely stay here again next time we're in Amsterdam.
title: Fantastic hotel

review: We loved this hotel. We chose it partly because of the secure garage as we needed somewhere to park our van full of bikes, which was great, but it was perfect in every way. Very friendly and helpful staff with lots of suggestions for Amsterdam newbies, spacious and comfortable rooms, a lovely breakfast and enough quirkiness and cool factor to satisfy our teenagers. A great location too - easy tram ride to the centre or rent bikes and ride through the lovely Vondel Park. Can't wait to go back.
title: Relaxed, friendly and very comfortable

review: Very modern and chic hotel.The rooms are detailed with a quirky bit and very confortable.The roof terrace offers a great view of Amsterdam and is very trendy.You can enjoy a spa at the other part of the hotel.The staff is very professional and nice.
title: Very modern and trendy hotel

review: I travel for business and pleasure internationally, frequently. I am a bit of a hotel snob. The W blew me away. Everything was perfect. Because this trip was a family trip, I had made a lot of special requests prior to arrival. The hotel not only met, but exceeded my expectations. I have been to Amsterdam many times. First stay at the W in Amsterdam. It is now my go to hotel. I stayed in the bank building It was fabulous.
title: Outstanding

review: Not normally something I do as I believe that people have off days but I just had to comment on my recent stay at W hotels as I found the following to be causes of concern.We checked into the hotel from another hotel in the city as we changed our flights and wanted something a bit more in keeping with what we’re used to and decided to book W.Arrived at the hotel at 2pm and went directly to the 6th floor for check in. We were advised that the room would be ready shortly and that they could take our bags and would be returned to us upon check-in to the room and that they would contact us directly by text to advise the room’s availability. It came to 3.30pm and we had still not been contacts so we went through to reception where they’d re-requested my payment card, even though I had already provided full payment.Asked for recommendations of lunch and was given a suggestion of the focaccia w/ dip and the spicy tomatoes. The tomatoes were lovely but the focaccia was burnt and disappointing.We then asked about the spa facilities in the hotel and were advised that they were indeed closed for the day due to unforeseen circumstances.Previously being a guest at Hotel De’Lerope in Amsterdam I decided to visit W as it was a more modern hotel and thought that it would have a younger and more up-to-date feel to it but this did not live up to the hype.After calling reception 3 times over the period of 2 hours we still did not have our luggage and was delayed in leaving the hotel to meet friends. On the third occasion of calling “whatever, whenever” they finally asked us what our bag numbers were because they could not find our luggage... We then had checked with “whatever, whenever” to see where the pillows we had ordered through the tv which boasted that it would be ‘delivered within 30 minutes’. I called reception at 10pm – 5 hours after initially requesting the pillow requirements –Only to be advised that the TV system sometimes doesn’t work and that they were unsure whether or not they had the “buckwheat pillows, neck roll and body pillow” and that all they had were soft and hard pillows. Confused I asked him why my order was confirmed online, he said that he would double-check and then call me. He didn’t. Instead, no explanation was given and a dental kit was left outside my room.W hotel really needs to focus on it’s attentiveness as currently its customer service is in the toilet and personally I do not feel that the hotel justifies charging €14 for a gin and tonic.If you’re looking for a classy hotel the choose Hotel De’lerope and steer clear of W.
title: Service is appaulling

review: Had a 2 night stay in an Exchange Fabulous room. Given the style of the W, it is not best suited for sharing with friends. Room was well appointed, good amenities, soundproofing (interior / exterior) and use of technology.The property is spread out over two buildings across from each other (Exchange and Bank). The Bank is more elegant with matching decor whilst the Exchange is more loud and bright colours. We had breakfast in day 1 at the Duchess (Bank) and day 2 at Mr. Porter (Exchange). The Duchess has a limited buffet offering with most items available à la carte, service somewhat poor. Mr. Porter has a wider buffet with a more Mediterranean touch to it and excellent service and views with windows allowing sunshine in and an outside terrace.You can rent a bike for EUR16/dayPS W Insider's restaurant recommendation was quite sub-par
title: Cool hotel in an excellent location

review: Stay at the W based on reviews on trip advisor and because we were using SPG points. It's not bad but was expecting better. For the first night we stayed in the Exchange side. The pros: great lobby views especially during sunset, cool glass elevators. We were "upgraded" to a handicap accessible room which felt like an eclectic box. The bathroom was a lacquered orange room that seems good for someone in a wheelchair but if you're not, there's no counter space and the towels aren't even in the bathroom. The worse was the constant bass that kept playing throughout the night, which we found out was a club in the building somewhere. We were not informed of this. At 3am we were moved to the bank side where the rooms are exactly as advertised on their website, however there's a more elegant feel to the building. It's quiet, just the way we liked. Exchange is the party side. Bank is the quiet, more reserved side. I believe there are canal views though we didn't get one.
title: Expected more

hotelLocation: Jan Luykenstraat 58, 1071 CS Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The rooms were clean, comfortable, and small but lovely. Excellent air conditioning. The breakfast was very good and varied. I did not visit the restaurant or bar. The staff was friendly and accommodating. There is an elevator. I was only there for one night but would stay again.
title: had a nice stay

hotelLocation: Jan Luykenstraat 58, 1071 CS Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is an average priced hotel as far as Amsterdam goes. It is very well situated near the Rijksmuseum in a quiet street and so a short/moderate walk to the city centre. The staff are courteous and willing to help. The first night we stayed there we had a superior room. This was quite small but at least we could get two suitcases in. Being a Saturday it was quite expensive (but similar to other comparable hotels) - the most we have ever paid for a hotel. When we returned two weeks later for 3 nights starting on a Sunday night, the rate was much less. We had booked a standard room by mistake. This turned out to be very small. We could only fit two suitcases in the room by putting the ottoman on the easy chair and one suitcase on top of that. Even then we had to be careful not to bump into things. Why such a small room needs a large easy chair and ottoman which no one will use, beats me. The bathroom was fairly small but adequate. The shower is in the bath which is standard in moderate hotels in Europe but the bath is quite high and is fraught with danger especially when getting out. The breakfast (17Eur pp) is adequate but not something to rave about. For example the jam is ordinary and not much choice.
title: Reasonable Hotel

hotelLocation: Jan Luykenstraat 58, 1071 CS Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I loved my 5 day stay at the Bilderberg Hotel Jan Luyken and highly recommend it! The staff was extremely friendly, courteous and helpful! There is not a better location for visiting the Amsterdam museums & to hop a tram to sites a bit more distant. My room was excellent; great bed and many extra amenities!!
title: GREAT boutique hotel in superb location!

hotelLocation: Jan Luykenstraat 58, 1071 CS Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Wonderful staff! They were always in a good mood and made our stay a delight. Good clean and spacious room and great location. On saturday night the street in front of our room got a little loud but nothing to unbearable. Would highly recommend this hotel.
title: Best staff!

hotelLocation: Jan Luykenstraat 58, 1071 CS Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is very quaint and on a beautiful, quiet, tree-lined street. Easily walkable to canals, Van Gogh museum, Rijksmuseum, Wondelpark and Anne Frank house. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were small (as expected) but clean and comfortable, A/C worked well! The breakfast was delicious - Eggs, bacon, cold smoked meats and cheeses, fruit, cereal, breads, etc The bartender was very friendly and wines by the glass reasonably priced.
title: Location was perfect for us!

hotelLocation: Jan Luykenstraat 58, 1071 CS Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Bilderberg Hotel Jan Luyken is located close walking distance to Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh museum. I took the bus from the airport and it dropped me about 1/2 block walking distance to hotel. It's very easy to get around from this location. I walked everywhere.The room was average; a good size and workable for me. I don't know if it's me but thought maybe the front desk people could be a bit "friendlier" or smile more. They weren't mean but just didn't feel as welcomed, a bit stoic.The hotel is located behind PC Hooftstraat, a the luxury shopping street and I could see the Prada store outside my hotel room window. Overall, had a decent stay.
title: Quaint boutique hotel off on a quiet street

review: We stayed one night before our cruise. Train from airport to Centraal Station then ten minute walk with our rolling luggage. Super location for walk around sight seeing. Canal boats nearby. Many nice restaurants and coffee houses. Very extensive breakfast buffet plus cooked to order selections. Easy fifteen minutes walk to cruise terminal. The hotel staff is accustomed to cruisers and are available to help get your cruise bag tags securely fastened to your bags. Very comfortable bedding and quiet rooms though right near everything.
title: Pre Cruise Perfect

review: Very good and clean hotel in the middle of the center. The reception is trendy and fancy decorated. The rooms are clean and quiet, what is important in the center of Amsterdam. there is also a water boiler in the room.
title: Good hotel in center

review: Nice hotel downtown of Amsterdam close to many places and nice museums. You really enjoy spend time in this nice hotelGreat service and beautiful rooms. Everything it's walking distance. Thanks Marriott.
title: Beautiful

review: The location of the property is pretty good as it is quiet but still located near bars and restaurants. We had an issue with check in. We booked club level rooms and arrived close to 9pm. Upon arrival our rooms were still not ready and we had to sit for 30 mins before having access to our room. By the time we dropped off our luggage and got out for dinner, most of the restaurants were closed. The free breakfast in the club is great, but beware that they are strict on not eating before 6:30 am, even if they have everything sitting out and ready to go. On the weekend, they only offer paid buffet, which is not even close to being worth the money and is not available until even later.
title: For business

review: Very good location for our first trip to Amsterdam ~ super easy to find your way to many attractions walking from here and just a quick walk to the main train / bus station (water taxis also here) for trips farther out. Note that the concierge has tickets on hand to seemingly all of the major tourist venues, which can save time and money. Fair amount of decent dining options nearby as well. Rooms are above average for Europe though you can hear some street noise. Very good lounge for rewards members.
title: Location is key

review: Hotel is nicely appointed and rooms are clean and modern, except for the most important detail of them all....our room has no air conditioning. We stopped in at the desk on three separate occasions to complain about how hot the room is and each time was told that it would be fixed, only to find out right before bedtime that our room is one of the rooms that actually does not have air conditioning!! Probably my miserable night in a very expensive hotel.....ever, drenched in sweat, and I travel a lot. No excuse for letting out a room in summer with no air conditioning. While it has a great location and pleasant staff, this detail alone makes me put it on the "never in summer months" list.
title: Nice but.....never in the summer

review: We stayed here as part of our pre cruise tour. Very centrally located to the tram and walking distance to the square. Rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast has a very good selection of items. The concierge was very helpful with providing tickets to the tram, museum, as well as great suggestions on what to see and do.
title: Great location

review: Although Amsterdam is easy to navigate by foot, this location was terrific. It is close to the train station and tram lines. The rooms are unique at least in the part where we stayed. It appears that they have bought and renovated old houses and they have done a terrific job. There are lots of restaurants very close. The staff were also terrific and helped us with directions, restaurant suggestions and tickets to museums.
title: Great location in Amsterdam

review: This hotel is located in the old kinda part of downtown Amsterdam. Great location. Near canal and train station. Walking distance to a lot of shopping. Restaurants are very close to hotel as well.We had breakfast included but dinner wasn't available at this hotel this month I guess or so. Rooms are clean but there is a lot of dust on the night stands. The price is a bit high. We had a room with 1 queen bed for 350 euro per night.Overall is good.
title: Not bad

review: The hotel is of a high standard, rooms are small but very comfortable and equipped to a very good standard. Excellent breakfast with high level service. The internet works well in all parts of the hotel, the hotel location is excellent and the surroundings are full of restaurants, shops and all the needs of the spoiled tourist ...
title: We enjoy!!

review: Great view of Ronde Lutherse Kerk just across the street from our 5th floor room. The hotel was perfectly fine. Nice-sized room with a comfortable bed. The A/C worked great. Expect plenty of tour groups and Americans. We were very pleased that we were able to check in early before 9am after a long overnight flight from the US. I suppose we were lucky that a room was available at that time, but it probably didn't hurt to check in on the mobile app as an elite gold Marriott member.
title: Delightful stay in central location

review: What a nice hotel, the beds and linens are top notch, the hotel itself, carpet and halls are a but dated but the staff makes up for this!! Every restaurant recommendation they gave us were perfect, Indian, Dutch, Italian!! We asked for directions to the museum and got roundtrip street car tickets right there as well as museum reservations as well! This btw saved us countless hours in line at the Van Gogh museum. Another thing!! They recommended a great bike rental company which we used and the great doorman of our hotel, as we rode by, let us know our bike seats were too low and he came across the street to adjust them for us!! I regret that I forget his name but we gave him credit for us looking like locals vs. all the other tourists riding around with their bike seats at the same level as their knees! Their personnel in the club level happy hour lounge are delightful, it's a bit warm in there though !! Breakfast is also pleasant. Thank you!!
title: Great hotel in great location!!

review: Fabulous location, great staff, wonderful restaurant and cafe. Best part was the location: Close to Canals, Old Amsterdam with good walking streets, shops and restaurants. Only complaint: Very old mattress and uncomfortable bed. Stayed three nights and didn't sleep well.
title: RENNAISANCE MARRIOTT AMSTERDAM

review: Location is very close to the train station, but far enough away, so....you don't feel like you're near a train station. Beds super comfortable, and the gym is like a spa - water, fresh fruit, towels, great equipment (and empty!). We asked for a quiet room which had a horrible view, but it was literally what we asked for... super quiet! WiFi is 10 euro/day in the rooms, free in the lobby. AC works excellent, we were sleeping in a fridge. Our only qualm was a super slow check-in, but we certainly weren't as upset as some of the people in line around us... you're on vacation people! Would definitely stay again.
title: Great location and gym!

review: Great service. Good room size. Good breakfast. Within walking distance of everything you'd want to see in Amsterdam. Check-in was smooth and concierge was efficient and courteous. Good restaurants nearby. I'd stay again.
title: Great hotel

review: Stayed here in June for a business meeting. I am weary of hotel rooms in Amsterdam; they are usually space constrained. But this, this was huge compared to the other hotels I have stayed in Amsterdam. Just avoid staying in rooms that are located on the high street, gets noisy at night.Breakfast buffet is the usual but well made. I had a couple of meals in room. Not particularly impressed (never been in Amsterdam anyway, albeit maybe my experience has been limited).Overall, a very good hotel. Much better than Double Tree which other colleagues stayed at and even has better rating on TripAdvisor.
title: Spacious....

review: This hotel is close to everything a traveler needs but be careful if you follow the direction by foot provided by hotel web from Central Station. The direction is designed for local people who is familiar with their surrounding but it’s not easy to follow as a foreigner. The service is very good, the concierges are very helpful. One block from the hotel is a tourist street, full of small restaurant and souvenir shops and the price are less than in the major shopping area. Two blocks from the hotel full of stores for local such as flower shop, super market. My friend and I stay in this hotel for two nights and we do appreciate the convenience of the location.
title: It is in a convenient location

review: Stayed here one night and was impressed with their service, the kind of service Marriott was always known for.....While we've been disappointed with other properties the last few years, this one stood out for its employees and the very pleasant room. Clearly they train their employees well. The location is very central, an easy walk to much of what the city has to offer. Had a problem with the bill when we checked out but it seems to have been handled quite seamlessly.
title: Well-run Marriott in a terrific location

review: We spent two nights at the Marriott Renaissance Amsterdam prior to a river cruise. The hotel was easy to find from the central train station (took a direct train from the airport). We arrived early morning and our room was not ready, but we hung out in the executive lounge which offered snacks, coffee and free internet. The hotel rooms are very nice - spacious and clean. The bed was super comfortable, and the shower was great. The front desk staff were very helpful & pleasant. We walked everywhere - The hotel is in a very central location. I highly recommend this hotel, and I would stay there again.
title: Close to the train station

review: Nice rooms, great location, wonderful breakfast. The staff is also quite friendly and helpful. I would absolutely stay there again. It is part of the Marriott family. It is an easy walk from Centraal Station (where you arrive by train from the airport).
title: Overall Excellent

review: We stayed at this hotel one n night before boarding a river cruise. We received a Platinum upgrade. The room was nice with a courtyard view. This hotel also was great in communicating with me as I had luggage shipped there pre arrival through Luggage Forward. I cannot fault the service.My only complaint is that it was hard to find a seat in the executive lounge and it was difficult to get food. There must have been a lot of Platinum members when we were there.
title: Good location but very crowded

review: We stayed in this hotel as part of a tour group. The rooms were large (about the same size as a US hotel room), clean, and well organized. Hotel is in a good location, only a brief walk from the main metro station that will take you most places within the city. Breakfast was amazing with a big variety and good quality. Concierge was also very helpful and willing to help. I would stay here again, no question. Only real downside was how busy the place was.
title: Very good place!

review: We stayed at the Renaissance as part of our post trip extension to a Viking cruise. The staff was very courteous and extremely helpful. The rooms were very nice and well-appointed; however, our room was at the front of the hotel on the second floor and we could hear everything happening in the street below us all night long - horns blowing, people talking, etc. The location is very convenient for site-seeing, but ask for a room in the back of the hotel. The scenery outside your window might not be the best, but at least you will get some sleep at night!
title: Nice Hotel Rooms

review: Nice clean hotel and good location. Room was clean and good amenities in the room. 15 - 20 minute walk from Amsterdam square. Plenty of bars and eateries near by to the hotel. only drawback on the room was the ceiling was quite low in our suite and if you're over 5ft 8" then you will bang your head on the wooden beams around the room.
title: Good Hotel & Service

review: Hotel located at a very convenient place down town. Old but refurbished building. Clean facilities with modern decoration in lobbies and restaurant. My personal opinion is that the hotel is overpriced comparing its level of services and image with similar hotels in big European cities.
title: Overpriced city hotel

review: As said- location is ideal. Hotel staff is very friendly. Check in was painless, check out was automatic. Room was clean. Had electric kettle and coffee/tea ( Note: they should have also provided- water and some creamer for the coffee, by the way). Room was small but adequate. Only thing was that i could hear the people in the room next to me and needed ear plugs. The walls seem to be quite thin. If you luck out and get loud people- you could be in trouble. Did not take breakfast as it was very pricey. Shower was actually a bathtub with a shower head- water pressure was on the weak side. No robe provided. Bed was comfortable. Price reasonable. A/C worked fine.
title: Very good location and clean hotel

review: The Renaissance in Amsterdam is incredibly well located and convenient for anything you might want to do in the city. I recently stayed there with my wife and daughters for two days. We were able to easily walk to all of the things we want to do and see. This included the Anne Frank House, the floating Flower Market, the Portuguese Synagogue and the Red Light District. We also were a very easy (5 minute) walk from the Pizza Canal Cruise that we took. The hotel is up to date, with top notch amenities. The main restaurant looks great, although we didn't eat there. We did enjoy drinks and snacks in the bar and the outdoor cafe. Our rooms were well appointed and fairly large. The beds were quite comfortable. The hotel staff was friendly, attentive and incredibly helpful with directions and restaurant reservations. Highly recommend this hotel.
title: City Center Luxury

review: We are Marriott people so for our first visit to Amsterdam it was going to be a Marriott hotel. We couldn't decide between the Marriott in the city center or the Renaissance. I read all the trip advisor reviews. Finally we chose the Renaissance,and I am so glad we did. The location is just great-- we walked to the Anne Frank house and to the canal boat ride. The management and staff were just top notch. We were celebrating a wedding anniversary and we were upgraded to a wonderful suite, the royal suite, I think it was room 802, ask for it. The club lounge was great, the restaurant for breakfast was great. Can't say enough about how we enjoyed this Marriott property.
title: couldn't have picked a better hotel-- great location and service

review: Very impressive entrance hall, all glamour and marble. Just a short walk from the Central Station.Very disappointing once you have traversed several dismal corridors to get to your room. Small and dark, poorly appointed. It was like something from a budget chain.Having said that, we only used the room to sleep, and Amsterdam being the place it is, we didn't do much of that.
title: Well located, but not 5 stars

review: Stayed here all the time on business in early 2000-2004. Loved the place and had several meetings here. Not sure what happened but the quality has slipped. Our room was average, very noisy hallway at night. The staff seems detached. Got double billed for breakfast charges which were in my room rate....later credited. Location is superb though and concierge were very helpful in directing us the the proper trams, etc. Will give another try but overall disappointing.
title: Not what it used to be

review: We stayed at this hotel for a short break in December and it was brilliant the room was perfect the beds were so comfortable and the hotel staff were so helpful. Couldn't ask for better service. We asked the concierge for a recommendation for Dinner, not only did they recommend a beautiful restaurant I wish I could remember the name of but they also called and got us a table. We knew we were in for a treat the minute we walked through the door, it was an italian restaurant just across the road from the Hotel on the main road. In whole a wonderful stay convenient for everywhere in Amsterdam
title: Excellent Hotel very convenient and helpful staff

review: Overall, a good experience. Location is great and the concierge was very helpful and recommended excellent restaurants. The first drawback was they put us in room 124 and it was very noisy. It was as if the window was wide open even thought it were closed. It was a very active party weekend in the city so there was no way to sleep with the noise. We requested another room which they provided with no question. I feel from their response that they know these are a noisy block of rooms and they anticipated the room change request. Also, we had drinks in the bar a few evenings and the services was slow. No refill requests from the waiter and we had to hunt him down to pay the bill. But generally a good hotel and we wold stay there again.
title: Good location but a few issues

review: I have stayed at this Hotel on 2 trips to Amsterdam and I love it. It is within an easy walk from Centraal. Also is in a quiet location, yet is easily accessible to a lot of the major tourist sights either by walking or tram. The concierge room was excellent. Also, the Hotel was very accommodating to get me into my room as fast as possible after my trans-Atlantic flight. I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here on my next trip to Amsterdam.
title: Perfect Trip

review: The hotel was really clean but never left enough towels, the turndown service was a hit or miss. The hotel staff was very friendly except the hotel bartender that would never visit our table to see if we wanted more drinks. The breakfast buffet was very tasty but for some reason we kept getting invited to the preferred lounge ( it was a very small buffet compared to the main buffet). The hotel is very centrally located, excellent spot. We would stay at this hotel on our next visit.
title: Our post river cruise stay

review: This is a fantastic high standard hotel located in one of the best prime locations in Amsterdam, which can be rare to find in city towns of Amsterdam. Very clean, rooms were great and good size. Local to many attractions at pretty much walking distance and located in an area you won't get bored of day or night. Staff are friendly and polite. Other stayers were also nice and polite, no hassle or trouble. Local area is also pretty much safe and quiet in the night. Can be a little expensive but if you look out for deals you can catch yourself a great value trip. No complaints, would ideally like to be always staying in a hotel like this for European destinations.
title: Great hotel in a prime location

review: I stayed here in July 2017 while in Amsterdam. The location of the hotel is great. It is within walking distance to almost everything. The staff was helpful and attentive. The room was clean. In my opinion, the finishes in the room were a little below what I would expect from a 5 star hotel (or a Renaissance hotel in the US), but it wasn't too big of a deal and the location/staff made up for it.The executive lounge was well maintained and served a good variety of food throughout the day.All in all a good stay.
title: Good hotel, Great location

review: Needed a hotel for a weekend in Amsterdam. The services had to include at least a wifi network good enough to work from. This was a good choice.The booking was made via the website, which is a little flashy but extremely efficient if you want to make a booking. It also helps if you are a member of the loyalty program.Finding the hotel, in walking distance of Central Station, was easy, and check-in was efficient. Our wish for a particular type of room was also granted, as we were very early to check in.The wifi was good enough to do one last conference-call over company-VPN as well, and that got work out of the way.Room and bed were excellent, Marriott quality as expected.We did not try breakfast but had ours a the Koepelcafe and at LPQNL, both just around the corner. The Koepelcafe is part of the hotel so you can even charge it to the room. On this rainy weekend, the hotel lounge with firepace also came in handy. The concierge desk was able to arrange a canal-cruise for us on Sunday (it rained, but those boats are covered...)Checkout was easy, and we could leave the luggage in store until our departure late-afternoon.All in all a Good hotel for a Weekend in Amsterdam.
title: Excellent for city trip or business.

review: The Renaissance Amsterdam does what it says it's gonna do:The hotel is super convenient.The design is very nice, modern, efficient. The rooms are clean but low water pressure in the shower and the sink extremely slow drainage.Breakfast was above average, nice selection.All of the staff very friendly, especially the concierge.It's a bit generic, but that's exactly what we expected.As a warning... it is heavily used by (American) tour groups so it can get quite chaotic in the lobby and at breakfast.
title: Exactly what it advertises

review: My wife and I were booked for five days at this hotel because it was the conference venue for an event at which I was speaking. We were also sponsors of this event. Well, our visit was a farce from start to finish, largely due to this incredibly inept hotel.First, we booked MONTHS in advance and were relegated to a tiny room on the outside of the sixth floor. As we were on the outside perimeter of the building, the walls were slanted, just under the roof. As such, it was very difficult for two people to move around in this small room - and we had to do this for five nights. Even worse, the bed was simply too small for two people. I measured it to under 140 cm. My wife and I were constantly pushing each other over the side during the night. We asked to be moved, but the hotel apparently had no other rooms. Curiously, a colleague booked a room (at a remarkably better rate) about a month before the conference and had a spacious room on the third floor with a big bed and TWO chairs.
