She arrived a day later than we did...I had to send some documents to the United States and needed a FedEx envelope. The reception said there was no business center, but I should talk to the concierge. The concierge referred me to the business center one flight down. The business center said the FedEx envelopes could be obtained from the concierge, one flight up. The concierge claimed no knowledge of this until another staff member intervened and explained that the envelopes were in the basement. The concierge I was speaking with asked “Do you need me to go and get one? I’m about to go on break…” Honestly! And all of these clowns are called “Navigators” despite the fact that they clearly do not know their way around.In the meantime, the conference swag we had delivered to the conference organizer was stolen, so we lost our promotional reason for being at the conference. The hotel was “kind enough” to reemburse the cost of the swag, but not the substantial sponsorship fee we had paid.The breakfast restaurant had perhaps the slowest service of ANY hotel I’ve been at in years – unless you opted for the pricey EUR 29 buffet.That said, the bar staff was lovely. Hats off to Leonidas, who was the only genuinely service-minded staff we came across.To top all of this off, when it came time to check out, the network was down so it was impossible to pay by credit card or get an invoice. We eventually straightened this out, but to be honest, I have never experienced such ineptitude from a so-called “five-star” hotel. In fact, I will do my best to avoid Marriott properties in the future. This experience was simply too stupid to be believed.Expensive room. Miserable room. Clueless staff. Not a good combination, if you ask me.
title: A comedy of errors from start to finish

review: This hotel typically caters to business travelers. Although I was on an extended family vacation, I wanted to try this property given its wonderful central location near the railroad station. (We had friends near Rotterdam, whom we visited using the speedy and comfortable trains available in the Netherlands.) Generally, the hotel fully met my expectations. The service was excellent, and the hotel had a special room for its elite travelers that served a full, delicious breakfast, as well as snacks later in the day. The room was somewhat problematic in one area -- we could not obtain a comfortably cool temperature during the first two days of our four day stay. (The temperature in Amsterdam was unseasonably warm and humid during our stay.) When I brought the problem to the attention of the hotel staff, their initial response was to give us a portable fan, which helped somewhat but did not give us the level of comfort that we were hoping for. Finally, on the third day, after insisting that the room was still too warm, we received a visit from a building engineer who fixed the problem, and we enjoyed the room (which had a very comfortable bed and an excellent shower) during the remainder of our stay. I would recommend this hotel, although I would also suggest strongly advocating for quick action if you find the temperature of your hotel room not to your liking.
title: Nearly everything was to my satisfaction

review: A bit of a wild duck. Definitely a tourist hotel, lots of retired Americans and people with kids. Floors are big, so the elevators bring loads of people through the halls. Just use ear plugs and put a towel under the gap of the door and you will be fine. Rooms are either smaller or a bit greater. Club is great, restaurant is bad, bar is awesome. Concierge and staff are wonderful. Location is amazing, price is good. I say go, but keep the things above in mind. I stayed there on business for more than 2 weeks.
title: Really great location and service - put towel under door to block noise from walking guests with noisy children

review: My wife and I stayed in July 2017 for 7 nights. The room was nice but not very clean, the coffee cups hadn't been cleaned since the last guests and the mini bar food was covered in dust. We had a picnic in Vondel park and requested a couple of forks and spoons from the staff but they would not help us and told us we had to go to the supermarket to get them. We also asked the front desk to mail out a postcard for us (already had postage, just needed to be dropped in the mailbox) and it was never sent.The biggest issue I had was with the way they handle "Do Not Disturb". We were out late and wanted to sleep in so we switched on the "Do Not Disturb" light (this was 3 days out of our 7 there). Instead of housekeeping just skipping our room, they had the front desk call us. We were trying to sleep, hence "DO NOT DISTURB", but they insisted on double checking that we didn't want to be disturbed. This is the opposite of what the phrase DO NOT DISTURB means.
title: Staff could be more accommodating

review: my wife and i stayed here last weekend just to get away for a couple nights.and wow Tara on the main desk is a legend. after the free upgrade to the honeymoon tower suite and complementary bubbly and chocolates all within the first moments of arriving.with the staff refusing to take tips and all making you feel very relaxed.great location with views of the vodel park main entrance and leidsplien,directly oppisite the main holland casino. just off the main hussle etc.of leidsplien centre.we will be using this hotel again in the future.
title: outstanding stay

review: My wife and I spent four nights at the Park Hotel and enjoyed the stay. The hotel is very clean, modern, and quite. It is a block from Vondelpark and very convenient to many other attractions and the trams are handy and easy to use for more distant attractions. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom was spotless and well stocked with towels and toiletries. Very diverse (only in Amsterdam) range of items for sale in the room (we didn't partake). Staff members were all very friendly and check-in and out was a breeze (we checked in early and left our bags until later). It did rain a bit while we were there, but hotel provided umbrellas for guests. Great place to relax and enjoy Amsterdam.
title: Great Experience

review: The hotel is on a main bus and tram route. The rooms are well appointed with a view over the city. The staff were most helpful and booking to all the museums was made so easy. Walking Amsterdam from this central hotel was a pleasure.
title: Its central position amongst all the museums made it so easy to get around.

review: Efficient pick up and check in. Front desk staff were helpful in directions and also made the effort to arrange a food box when i need to go on an early train trip before their breakfast starts. The room is really clean, well and newly designed and compact. Hotel breakfast was fantastic, enables a few choices of different savoury and sweet dishes.. Staff at hotel breakfast always so friendly early in the morning. Near to museums as well as tram stops which were really convenient when i go for my conference or walk around the city. Would definitely stay at this hotel again the next time i visit Amsterdam.
title: Pleasant and comfortable stay

review: Nice rooms and excellent location Can be a bit noisy if room is facing the Main Street Clean room friendly staffEasy access to majority of attractions and restaurants nearby Location is key so I highly recommend this hotel
title: Nice location

review: I stayed here in the 4th of July and was disappointed at the approach of the hotel. My colleague and I used the Hotel Tonight app to book the hotel. We paid USD 216 to book the hotel on the same morning (4th) which I though was a good deal considering the lovely location of the hotel: At the time of check in we had to pay an additional 40 euros to get 2 single beds instead of sharing a bed and were told that we were being upgraded: Room was small and not worth the additional money or upgrade. Check out time was noon and I had an evening flight the next day. I therefore wanted to request for a late check out. I asked if I could come back at 2 pm from my meeting and change in the room and leave the hotel at 3 pm. The receptionist said she would check with her superiors and call me back. Response was that they wanted an additional 10 euros for each extra hour. They seemed extremely opportunistic at every stage and not the sort of experience that leaves a good taste Bell boys were good
title: Extremely Opportunistic post booking from the Hotel Tonight app

review: The Paul Hotel is in a wonderful location - a short walk to the museum district, great restaurants, and nightlife. Our room faced one of the canals, which we loved. Canal cruises are offered right across the street and you can even buy tickets at the hotel at a discounted rate. Hotel staff super friendly and helpful - will definitely stay here again!
title: Would definitely stay here again!

review: The Park Hotel is located on a canal within a block of the Rijksmuseum, Van Gogh, Museum and the iconic "I Amsterdam". A street car/bus stop is within a block and Vondel Park and Leidseplein are both easy walking distance. The hotel itself is extremely well kept. We were in a room facing the street behind the hotel and accessed by an elevator past the lobby. The room was a little unusual but surprisingly modern with a really comfortable bed. It was very warm during the 2 weeks we in Amsterdam and the A/C worked very well. Hotel staff was excellent.
title: Location, service and value

review: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July and I would say this is decent place to stay, an excellent location for the Van Gogh and other attractions in that area. I could not fault the room, had air conditioning, decent television and beds were changed often.Things I was not too keen on were that the room was at the back next to a busy road and tramway. I would have loved to leave the window open, as I dislike air conditioning, but it was far too noisy. The mini bar was a total waste of time, over priced and useless - a fridge would have been better.A good hotel but expensive for a room only place. Nice restaurant next door (MOMO), may try that one day when I win the lottery.
title: Nice clean hotel with friendly staff.

review: This hotel is in the middle of the mix in Amsterdam. It is walking distance to most things but also a quick tram or bus ride to other areas. The hotel itself is modern with a cool, hip vibe. The room was on the small side but it had everything one would need. The staff here is great.
title: Modern Hotel in the Heart of Amsterdam!

review: The hotel is fully up to date. Room was large enough and nicely decorated. We looked out on the canal.Vondelpark is right next to the hotel, and the top musuems are a few blocks away. Close to Leidesplein which has many bars, restaurants, coffee shops, etc. Trams and bus transport are convenient. Good experience.
title: Clean comfortable room, great location.

review: Nice budget hotel, very comfy bed, good collection of tv stations. Limited breakfast.No complimentary water bottle in the room, not that it matters unless you don't like tap water.Really nice staff and great lobby to relax. It is very central so easy to go to many places and also next door to the shopping area and there is a park next door which I will highly recommend.All in all, I will recommend it
title: Good but no water bottle

review: We stayed here for a few nights a year ago we loved the location right near to the museum and the canal boat trip. Loved the local people they were so friendly and helpful. The hotel was quirky and the room was clean and big enough with a comfy bed. The breakfast was vast and so enjoyable in a great spacious restaurant. The town was beautiful with large squares and outdoor dinning with great restaurants and coffee shops. I love Holland!
title: Great Dutch Hotel

review: Be careful of not getting what you booked. I was given a room with 2 single beds when I booked a queen/double. Despite many rooms still being available on this night I was told it was my problem and I'd have to pay to upgrade if I wanted a queen/king bed - according to the front desk they had changed my room at some time between my booking and my arrival.
title: Disappointing Service

review: The service was rather aloof. The housekeeping is sloppy - on arrival there was a packet of half eaten sweets and no soap in the dispenser. For the price I expect better than that. The room decor is dark coloured and room rather small. Amsterdam is an expensive city, however this did feel overpriced. The location however is good - central but away from the crowds.
title: Over-rated

review: This was a totally positive experience, from early check-in ( no problem, store your bags ) to the sublime view across the city from floor 7, to the facilities in the room, especially bathroom ( get those dimmerlights for navigating in the dark ). But my admiration is especially warm for the breakfast team. Professional yet totally convincingly concerned for our every need, everyone looked genuinely happy to help, and welcoming.My contribution? Apparently I was first to request a strawberry jam styled pancake. I loved it so why not try it? And the chilled apples in a bowl on every landing? ThoughtfulThe Park will always be in my top 3. For local tips message the flying engishman ( budget air !)
title: i feel part of the crew

review: We chose the park hotel because of its proximity to the museum and antique district. We were not disappointed! A special thank you to the staff who were quite accommodating and friendly! It was quite helpful that they have a parking garage at the property. Also the breakfast was delightful!
title: Perfect location, lovely accommodations

review: Walking distance to major museums, a great park, and the canal cruise is right across the street. We stayed one night after our cruise. The room is spacious, we had a nice view of the canal, the coffee maker worked well, wifi is free but make sure to bring your own adaptor for switch. Otherwise there is no place to plug a USA charger. They did not have one at the reception. We could purchase one for $30.00 if we wishedThey stored our two suitcases for us for the night. The breakfast was not included and was expensive.
title: Great location

review: Spent a couple of days at this hotel last week with a friend for the weekend, though the only thing going for the hotel is the location. The service is poor to average or really non existent for the price you pay, which is not cheap Euro 250 a night. There is no porter to take your bags into the hotel, seemed short staffed. While checking in walked upto the reception the check in time in This hotel is 3 pm and I arrived at 9.30 am, so fair enough when I asked the receptionist for a early check in he explained the hotel was full so couldn't help with the same. I even offered To pay for a early check in and he politely refused as the hotel was full , but promised to call me if he could give the room earlier which he didn't. I basically was exhausted after a long flight from Asia and had to spend my time in a cafe and walk around the city. The room is pretty small for the price with a view of the buildings at the back, but covered all the amenities and services so that was great. At time off checking out requested for a late check out from 12 pm to 2 pm which is a fair and quite normal request in all the hotels we stayed at, I was quite surprised they said yes we could but a charge of euro 10 a hour so highly disappointing. I also got a call at at 12 pm in the room sharp asking us to check it which we were anyways. At the time checking out, we specifically told the receptionist that we would like to split the bill into two as we two friends travelling together and requested not to charge the amount on only one of the cards that was used at the time of check in. Few days later when I check my statement I was surprised to see that my card was charged for the full amount. All I can say that the location is great but overall I was let down....
title: Over priced and quite average

review: We really disappointed with service here especially the Night Manager was so Rude to us.As we arrived hotel too early by accidentally at 5a.m. But we have reservation on that day we already noticed that check in time at 3p.m. And we are pleased to pay for early check in unfortunately hotel is fully booked. I moved to sit at the lobby to seeking for other hotel for that night but the Night Manager not even allow us to have a sit in the night which is 17degree outside as we stayed this hotel before our luggage still in their storage room.(he said that he didnt know us I already informed my previous room no. coz he not even allow us to use toilet as well) Moreover he keep threaten us if we still sitting in the hotel he will call police and cancel our booking! :( After that a security guy came to us he was recommended us to go to the train station which is public area and everyone can have a sit there ! It's so funny right !? See how your staff treated us .
title: Very POOR service!!

review: The location is very good... but it was maybe the most expensive m2 (square meter) we've paid in a hotel. The room was super tinny is hardly didn't fit 2 people and 2 suitcases. The shower was probably 60cm x 60cm box. Honestly?!? Look for another hotel. For the same price you may find a better room.... although location is very good.
title: Super tiny room!!!! Bad surprise ....

review: Park Hotel is centrally located. It's close enough to walk to the red light district, approximately 20 minutes, or you can take the #5 Tram ($4.9 euros). The hotel is near the Van Gough museum and shopping. The rooms are very clean, the staff super friendly and helpful. I strongly recommend this hotel for its exceptional service, professional staff and reasonable price. You can take the 197 bus from the airport ($10 euros), it leaves you 2 blocks from the hotel (approximately 35 minute bus ride). A taxi from the airport will cost $40-$45 euros.
title: Amsterdam, Netherlands Vacation

review: Just spent 3 nights here with my teenage daughter. Great location and hotel staff in reception wonderful - the "Living Room " concept really works and a very pleasant place to sit and relax. The macaroons from The Jewellery Bar were delicious. Bike hire cheap and decent bikes. Thoroughly recommend this hotel.
title: Lovely hotwl

review: We had a wonderful stay in this hotel! I noticed that a lot of reviews mentioned the hotel room that has a small bathroom that is part of the room. Please read the room descriptions when booking your stay. We read the descriptions and realized we did not want the smaller bathroom. Therefore, we booked the slightly larger room at a slightly higher price. The cost of this room was still excellent, and our room was very comfortable! We overheard a couple in the lobby expressing concern about the smaller room, and the staff member was very nice and offered to change their room to the larger room for just the small cost difference. My sister and her husband stayed in the smaller room, and the size didn't bother them. The location of this hotel is perfect! We were so excited to see all the art museums. We could have walked everywhere we wanted to go, but I sprained my ankle the first day. We were so close to the tram stop that I did not miss out on any of the touring. Even with my injury, we didn't have to use any transportation one day. To sum up: the location is superb, the staff was friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable.
title: Superb location

review: We booked the Mercure Amsterdam Sloterdijk keeping three factors in mind:1. Cost-effective2. Four-star hospitality3. Proximity to the train stationWhile the hotel comes right on top on factors 1 and 3, the four-star hospitality that we expected was missing. Traveling to Europe for the first time with a 2.5 year old kid, we ensured that it was just the backpacks that we carry along with us with a pull-strolley as the only aberration in the luggage department. When booking a 4-star property, we expected a certain tier of hospitality and what greeted us was a clandestine structure when it came to hospitality.This hotel has no bell-boys to help you with the luggage. I am not sure if others have come across this situation but once the taxi drops you off by the kerb in the front of the hotel, it's up to you to haul your luggage to your room. The folks at the reception just pointed to the luggage carts and said that we can use them to take our luggage to our room. That was strange as this kind of a situation shone it the first time ever in our travels across different countries, cities and hotels. We did not face such a situation anywhere else across Europe, later on, as well.The hotel has a beautiful restaurant with a view of the industrial corridor but has a very limited menu.The rooms is small as compared in proportion to the huge bathroom, going by European standards. The window blinds restrict light very well and the rooms are pretty sound-proof.It's hardly a 5-minute walk to the train station and Amsterdam Central station is just a stop away.I have mixed feelings about the hotel and I am sure that it does not fit the four-star tag that it comes with.
title: Decent place, don't expect the frills

review: True Dutch hospitality. Clean rooms, good location, helpful staff, great breakfasts. I highly recommend this place. The stairs are steep. I was on the 4th floor and it was quite the workout. But I still recommend this
title: Great place

review: For me this is one of those hotels that was neither outstandingly good or bad.The room looked nice, with nice furniture and it was kept clean.The windows are fairly small which made the room hot (a good fan was supplied).The mattress needs to be replaced now, it's well past it's sell by date. There was one pillow and it wasn't comfortable, fortunately, I had brought my own.The bathroom could also do with a makeover but the shower was good.I usually stay at another 2 star hotel which is nicer and cheaper and not so far to walk from the center or a 4* hotel right in the center but both of these were fully booked.I would only return if the other options were limited as this is a 1 * hotel charging 2* prices.
title: Nice enough hotel

review: Very nice hotel in the central parts of Amsterdam. It's a hotel with personality and good atmosphere. You are welcomed by an armor in the reception, and there are some collections of other nice things to look at in the lounge. We had one of the rooms on top floor, so there was a few steps to climb I the steep and narrow stairs. But that is okay when you know it, and are in kondition to do it (no lifts available). The breakfast room is bathing in sunshine (if it's not cloudy of course), and there is a just what you need breakfast to choose from. As we say in sweden, "lagom". We are very happy to have found this hotel, and if we return to Amsterdam, we will stay at this hotel again.
title: Cute and just what you need (lagom).

review: We had a lovely stay at the Wiechmann Hotel. We loved the 'Old world charm' throughout this hotel. Our rooms were full of antique furniture which made you feel like you were really in historic Amsterdam. We booked canal view rooms and loved seeing the boats travelling the canals. Breakfast had an excellent selection to cater for all tastes. This is a family run establishment and the staff are so very helpful with everything. The hotel is an easy walk to the main tourist attractions.We loved our stay here & we would definitely stay here again.
title: Charming Hotel close to the city centre

review: First of all the location of this hotel is excellent. Right on the Prinsengracht within easy walking district of the Ann Frank House and the lovely canal rings. Cannot fault the location at all.We stayed in a family room, overlooking an internal courtyard and the kitchen. The room itself was clean and basic but dark, and with a very small bathroom. Small enough so it was hard to sit straight on the toilet without bumping your knees into the sink... The beds were a bit saggy too. Generally it is a very peaceful hotel though, and we got a pretty good night's sleep apart from the noise from the kitchen in the mornings.Breakfast is in a sunny room overlooking the canals. Unfortunately there was building work going on right outside the hotel when we stayed, which obscured some of the view, and there was also lots of rubbish dumped right outside the windows of the breakfast room. Breakfast was fine but nothing special - I don't remember there being anything hot on offer apart from drinks. But there was a good selection of meats, breads, cereal, cake and cheese.We didn't have much interaction with the hotel staff but they seemed to be very available if needed. Amsterdam is an expensive city but I felt that the hotel was way overpriced for the standard of the room we had, although I don't know of the standard of other hotels in the same price bracket. Perhaps it would make Amsterdam Wichmann a bargain. Regardless, I don't think we would return.
title: Fantastic location, but average rooms for the price

review: We stayed in the Weichmann Hotel for several nights with canal view on the second floor. The hotel and room were charming and comfortable. Everyone working at the front desk was friendly, and they helped with any questions we asked. The location is convenient for walking anywhere in central Amsterdam. There is a grocery store around the corner as well as many bars and restaurants nearby. The room was huge and had a beautiful We stayed in the Weichmann Hotel for several nights with canal view on the second floor. The hotel and room were charming and comfortable. Everyone working at the front desk was friendly, and they helped with any questions we asked. The location is convenient for walking anywhere in central Amsterdam. There is a grocery store around the corner as well as many bars and restaurants nearby. The room was huge and had a beautiful view through several windows of the streets and canals. Breakfast was included with the room, and it was convenient and of good quality. The decor was traditional and comfortable with a lived-in feel. I would definitely stay at the Weichmann if returning to Amsterdam, especially if I would be able to have a canal-view room again. The table in the room was a perfect place to sit with the windows open, relax in the evenings after a busy day of touring, and watch the people of Amsterdam pass by by bike and boat.view through several windows of the streets and canals. Breakfast was included with the room, and it was convenient and of good quality. The decor was traditional and comfortable with a lived-in feel. I would definitely stay at the Weichmann if returning to Amsterdam, especially if I would be able to have a canal-view room again. The table in the room was a perfect place to sit with the windows open, relax in the evenings after a busy day of touring, and watch the people of Amsterdam pass by by bike and boat.
title: Excellent hotel

review: The hotel is located at the opposite of SloterDijk Station. The location is very good as far as you have fast access to the center of the city by using tram 12 or bus 22 - the station is less than 5 min walking from the hotel. During the night it is very quiet. The rooms are large and clean. Staff is friendly.
title: Stay in Mercure Amsterdam

review: Good location beside train station that takes you directly to city center or airport. Very pleasant service that will do their best to make you feel welcomed and well served. Really good breakfast but on additional charge. Downside is that sound proofing is not so good and you hear crazy kids slamming the door all night and running through hallways. Receptionist did warn them twice but doesn't help longterm. Suggestion for hotel, separate business customers and excursions on different floors.
title: Nice but no sleep

review: Hotel is very new and modern. Only 3 mins walk from the sloterdijk station. If you want to go to downtown only 1 station from amsterdam central to sloterdijk. Almost every train to other city always pass this spot. Very good breakfast and it's a must that you need to try. Staffs are friendly attentive and caring. Only one thing we miss is to visit the rooftop bar. The gym is also good and 24 hours. Room is big and very comfortable. Maid is also nice , we stayed in 7fl. The dutch maid is kind and attentive, she cleans our room immediately when we asked her to do even it's too late to clean as we woke up so late. This is a compliment for her. If i have a chance to come back to Amsterdam again i will stay here again.
title: Perfect hotel for the trip

review: This hotel was simply perfect - I could not find a fault if I tried. Location was great - just a short walk to the station and one stop into Amsterdam Central. The hotel has been beautifully done up, and had a gorgeous seating area with fire in the reception where you can check in and print off your boarding passes with ease at no cost. The rooms were quiet, comfortable and had everything you needed including iron, hairdryer, toiletries. The staff were friendly, helpful and made you feel instantly welcome.
title: A beautiful, modern hotel with wonderful staff

review: Stayed here for a 4 nights. It's a good cheaper alternative than staying in the middle of Amsterdam. The hotel is very modern and clean. It's a 5 minute walk to the train station. Trains run every few minutes to the centraal station. It's in between the centraal station and the airport. It suited our needs but wouldn't recommend if you plan on partying past 1am in Amsterdam when the trains stop running as you will need to catch a taxi back.
title: Nice hotel

review: One of the best Mercure hotels I have stayed in. Spacious rooms Clean Hotel Close to the station Close to the central station Very easy to reach from the airport Friendly and considerate staff Nice breakfast spread Will be back!
title: Neat and Clean

review: Very nice and polite service, always with a smile. Were able to arrange gluten free bread for breakfast which was a big plus.comfy bed, great breakfast and quiet. Would definitley recommend, thanks for a great stay.
title: A great stay

review: Before arriving we had emailed the hotel to book a parking space in their parking lot. They never answered and we were lucky to get a space when we arrived. When we checked in they forgot to give us the welcoming drink as a gold member. We were given a room very close the elevator, which makes it impossible to sleep. They accepted to give us to another room, which was quiet and much bigger. Why didn't't they give it first.Globally the people at the reception desk are quite cold.We stayed there for five days, during which time the room was never hoovered. Housekeeping does not always renew the bathroom products. The parking lot is 15 Euros/night.It is a 5-min walk to the station that takes you to Amsterdam central in another 5 minutes.For breakfast, if you do not take it at the hotel there's a Starbucks in the station and some other possibilities there.The restaurant is very good.
title: well-situated, average welcoming.

review: i did not have one good nights sleep at this hotel, and I was there for 6 nights for a work course. The mattresses are tiny: I had two single mattresses put together to make a double bed. They caved in the middle meaning I could not sleep in a flat position. I made a complaint to reception and housekeeping told me that the mattresses had not been zipped up properly. I tried the newly zipped mattresses the next night and they still caved in the middle. I asked to change rooms and they told me they were full , despite there being clear room availability online. It was quite stressful because no-one seemed to want to help, and apparently is its a "known issue that people accept" !! So I just turned the mattresses 180 degrees so at least they wouldn't cave in the middle, but they were too short for the bed which brought its own issues. Given that a hotel should be geared up to ensuring its guests get good sleep I rate this as TERRIBLE. A couple of my colleagues had exactly the same issues as me and the hotel didn't resolve it for them either. No one checked in on me and when I mentioned it again on check out (my 3rd time by this point) the receptionist just said it was too late to doing anything. Unbelievable! Hence this review. I would hate anyone to have the same experience as me and I would never book a Mercure again.. The rooms are also quite small but I would like to share that the room service is great and there is a chocolate desert on there that is literally other worldly: divine.
title: Great location for airport and into City but TERRIBLE BEDS! TERRIBLE.

review: Fantastic hotel, great staff, location.Room had great sound proofing, black out curtains, and shower.The welcome you receive and the atmosphere of this hotel makes the trip.In my view the best hotel due to having the best staff.Rooms now really are excellent also and stylish.Very relaxing.
title: Great staff

review: Central to everything. Good location. Very basic Hotel. Majority of staff very friendly and helpful. Good buffet breakfast. House keeping service below standard. Beds not made properly, covers just pulled up, sheets not straightened or tucked in properly, very untidy. Floor not vacuumed. On the days we put the sign out on the beds for linen change it was ignored, so house keeping needed to be called to do which was met with a bad attitude from a housekeeping staff member. Think the housekeeping team need some retraining and leasons on how to make a bed and change linnen!
title: Good Location

review: stayed in swissotel amsterdam for 5 nights...perfect location to go around....rooms are clean and nice....front desk is friendly and accommodating....managed to get an early check in...would return again to the hotel!
title: hotel stay

review: My recent stay at Swissotel Amsterdam was made extra special by the Duty Manager, Albert Hammerseth, who went above and beyond to assist in making my stay both enjoyable and easy. Albert went out of his way and very kindly provided a room upgrade on arrival and also greatly assisted to ensure my laundry was arranged in a short timeframe. The hotel is also in a great location adjacent to Adam Square.
title: Outstanding Service

review: Fantastic Hotel, with great location .Staff were wonderful and room great. Wi- Fi was reliable.We arrived early and they gave us our room at 10.30 am and also was given a room upgrade.I also receive chocolates and a thank you for booking direct with the Hotel
title: Brilliant

review: My wife and I recently paid another visit to Amsterdam, staying at the Swissotel on the Damrak, right next to Dam Square. The hotel has recently had some renovations especially the restaurant which to me is modern Dutch and very nice. We stayed in a “select” room which was also recently renovated and had a terrific bathroom with a ‘rain’ shower which I loved, and like the rest of the room was kept spotless. The one downside was I found the room on the small side with hardly enough room for my wife and I to pass each other between the bed and the desk, but we soon got into a routine. Speaking about the bed, which was very huge and comfortable, but boy was it high I recon about 3.5 feet (105cm) there was even a menu for your pillows, also there was no need to close the curtains just press a button and it was done. We were there for an anniversary break and the hotel gave us a curtesy bottle of bubbly which was very much appreciated. I had to check in online for our return flights but for some reason I couldn’t complete this but the concierge called ‘Albert’ managed to do this for us saving time at the airport, another great service from the very helpful staff at this hotel.The hotel is in the perfect location for exploring the city, there are bars, restaurants, shops, ‘red light’ area all within walking distance and believe me it’s the way to see the city, not forgetting the canal boat trips. I would recommend this hotel and will stay there again.
title: Great Hotel & Location

review: We had a better room last visit, same price for this room. We had to keep the curtains closed all the time as the general public shopping at the H & M store next door looked straight in to our window as they left the store, approx. 2m away. Saying that the room was very well kept, serviced every day, no complaints there. The staff as always were very friendly, helpful and courteous no complaints there at all. The breakfast room was very well stocked with all types of food, small complaint with the "hot" food it was more often cold. All in all I still think it is a class hotel but have marked it down for the reasons noted above. I will still go back next year.
title: Holiday in Amsterdam Centrum

review: My wife and I selected the Swissotel Amsterdam primarily for it's location, in the heart of the City overlooking Dam Square. The hotel is only 10 minutes walk from Amsterdam Centraal station and due to flight times we arrived before the hotel 2 pm check in. This was no problem to the hotel and Reception staff in particular. We had a coffee and our room was ready within an hour. And what a room ! Our room window overlooked Dam square with the benefits that brings. Whilst travelling for work I have stayed in some wonderful hotels in numerous countries but could only describe our room facilities as tremendous; extra spacious room with flat screen TV, excellent, simple wifi connection, comfortable, modern furnishings with ample storage facilities, wonderfully comfortable, extra king size bed, spacious, luxurious bathroom with separate shower and bath, ample luxurious towels and complimentary toiletries. I must praise the reception staff, Rob in particular, who could not have been more helpful on numerous occasions. His assistance and knowledge were a great help. We made a great choice and had an excellent weekend break.
title: Weekend break

review: We needed to stay in Amsterdam for 1 night on the way from Belgium back home in Hong Kong. We chose Swissotel because of good experience with them in other countries and because of the location. We would definitely recommend this hotel!
title: Good hotel right in the city centre

review: Overall, this is a fine hotel - the rooms are comfortable, clean and attractive. The bathrooms, while not large, are nice (indeed, a GREAT shower) and easily accessible. The bed was large and quite comfortable. Only thing that keeps this from being a "10" is that while "helpful", staff attitudes always felt like they were doing you a favor by engaging you. I asked for help on a transportation issue at one point and got the distinct feeling that I was asking for something completely outrageous (which I wasn't); and, I really didn't need to be reminded four times that smoking was not allowed in guest rooms (I don't smoke - never have). To be perfectly fair, the concierge did give me a really great recommendation for a restaurant for dinner - perhaps, on balance, that makes it even.Only other comment I'd make on this is that if you book this hotel, please keep in mind that it is - quite literally - right on Dam Square and that means that once you walk out the door, you're in the middle of a massive flow of people, particularly during peak summer tourist season. Upside: you're a five minute walk from pretty much anywhere in Amsterdam - including Centraal Station.
title: Solid experience but pricey for value delivered

review: My work booked me here during a recent visit to Amsterdam on the basis it was a quality hotel close to Centrale Railway. And it certainly is. Rooms have recently been refurbished and are very comfortable although my room was not spacious. Just enough room to walk around the king size bed and open wardrobe door. Bathroom was small and lacked hooks to hang anything on but shower was fabulous. A Nespresso machine, bathrobe, slippers and ironing equipment all provided. Room was quiet with good black out blinds. Staff were pleasant and very helpful when I needed them to follow up a problem. Breakfast was great and the staff there were delightful.
title: Dependable hotel in great location

review: As I visit Amsterdam on a regular basis I always stay in the Swissotel. The hotel go above & beyond to cater for you. As a member of the Swissotel club the bookings are always quick. I just ring up give my name & my information comes up all the time. Transfer from the Airport can be arranged if needed. I'm always picked up by a nice driver waiting at the arrivals gate with your name on a card so your cannot get lost. The driver always has refreshments available in the car. When you arrive at the hotel staff always friendly & always ready to help. I stay in City View Suite which has a great view of Dam Square. Rooms are nice, big & airy with plenty of light coming in. The suite consists of a living room & a separate sleeping area, the glass bathroom is really really nice. Hotel always leaves little gifts that's always nice to see. Ever since I found this hotel 5yrs ago I've never stayed anywhere else & I visit Amsterdam 10 times a year. Overall I would 100% recommend the Swissotel to anyone perfect location perfect staff
title: I always stay In Swissotel

review: Very disappointing. Staff very good attentive and helpful.Clearly there is problem in the restaurant.The general feeling we had was that the hotel had been over and standard of the restaurant failed to impress now. Topmanagement is ignorant of essentials in this regard was the impression we got.
title: Expectations high

review: Good hotel in great location. Nice clean room and bathroom. We stayed on the second floor on the street side and it was noisy. So book a room higher up or away from the street. House keeping not as attentive with replenishing supplies. We had to ask the concierge for shampoo and body wash.
title: First time in Amsterdam

review: Customer service is amazing and location is perfect. This is the place I always stay in. Usiness or pleasure stays. I'd recommend it to any and all going to Amsterdam! The check in experience is made so great because when I walk into the hotel they know my name! Thank you Ruby!!!
title: Great place to stay!

review: Upon arrival we were upgraded to our surprise to a king suite room on the third floor. Staff helpful and friendly. Very clean and comfortable. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant as we chose to use some of the many cafes/restaurants nearby. Great location and walking distance to the river canals and other attractions. Overall we loved this hotel.
title: Great location

review: It should be 5 minutes walk from Amstel station, which is a transport hub with trams, buses, metro lines and overground Dutch trains all stopping there. Tram 12 takes you to the main museums and musical concert place in about 15 minutes. You could go from the airport one stop to Zuid and then 4 metro stops up to Amstel, a bit quicker than going via Central station. The hotel is modern and clean.
title: Quiet location near Amstel station

review: I travelled with friends for a short trip to Amsterdam, and we were delighted with Hotel Casa, the tastefully furnished lobby immediately conveying a relaxed, inviting atmosphere, with reliable wifi and helpful service, who were very patient with two bedraggled & exhausted international travellers who needed to have everything repeated twice to make sure they had it right :) Our room, albeit a shoebox, met our needs perfectly and the beds provided much-needed restorative sleep after our excursions. The in-house restaurant east57 was a godsend (if slightly expensive) and their breakfast buffet has something for everyone.
title: Comfort & value in a tasteful package

review: Room were clean and the hotel is easily accessible from the international airport. A ride would be around $50 Euro.Hotel check in staff are helpful and polite. Rooms were comfortable and meet basic needs.
title: Great hotel with a good price near city centre

review: Stayed 3 nights on business attending a conference at the hotel. The location is not really central, which in this instance was not a problem. The hotel has some nice design elements although cannot be deemed a design hotel strictly speaking. The rooms are rather standard, clean with recent furnishing: you will note that the website advertise the rooms as 'spacious' then mentions a surface of 23 sq m, so I guess it all depends on your own definition. Front desk was helpful both at check-in and check-out (when ordering a taxi). Overall, the hotel is good value and could be considered for leisure as well notwithstanding its location.
title: No Frills but some Character

review: A nice clean and friendly hotel, a little away from Centraal but a 5 min walk from the Amstel station /Metro/ Busstand and Tram. All metros pass by Amstel from Centraal.The staff was great and friendly, when we asked for help we got it, including a little early checkinThe rooms was quiet and comfortable and CLEAN.I would recommend it if you are visiting Amsterdam for a holiday and plan to move around.
title: A place to rest inbetween exploring Amsterdam

review: Loved this hotel. A simple room, but comfy, nice big windows, free wifi. The included breakfast was epic. Amazing coffee shop and restaurant too. Great price for 2 nights. Thanks to the friendly staff
title: Ideal for what we wanted...

review: I stayed with my boyfriend for 4 nights and it was a nightmare!The Staff: Staff members are friendly as long as you don't have complains. Location: location is good. Its 5 station away from central station and you can get into the city within 20 min. The hotel is located close to the station so its a very short walk. There's not much around the hotel area but you can just go to the city.Rooms: the room was nice and clean. However, no one came to clean are room for 3 nights out of 4. The shower was broken and it FLOODED the entire bathroom. We called every night to get it fixed and get someone to clean our room. The response was " thank you for letting us know, I'm busy atm with checkout (10pm) I'll let my college know". We would get extra towels and that would be it. No one came to fix the shower. This happened for three nights in a row. Obviously they didn't do anything to fix it or were apologetic about the problem. If you can avoid this hotel I recommend you do. It is an ok price for Amsterdam but sometimes it's just not worth the trouble!(Be aware that it might be 5% charge for city tax)
title: Avoid if possible!

review: This hotel had poor service and it has employees that don't apologise and instead say "thank you for bringing this to our attention". The location is okay, you can get to the city in 20-25 minutes.The bedroom was adequate but our shower would flood the bathroom (completely) and we had to use plenty of towels to stop this. I asked them about the shower and they said they would get someone to fix it and have extra towels brought up. We came back that evening and no one had serviced our room, the shower still flooded and we had no fresh towels. When I called they said that it was a busy day with check outs (no apology). They sent someone up 30 minutes later.The next day they also didn't service our room. I asked them about this and all they said was we will send my colleague with new towels for you. They came with new towels and for the first time I received an apology that no one had seen to our shower or serviced our room for 2 days.On our final day someone had fixed the shower and replaced towels, but it was too little too late.My recommendation - book a hotel closer to the city and avoid this place if you're planning on staying more than 1 night.
title: Disappointed, wouldn't recommend

review: The hotel is located at about 10-15 minutes on foot from the Amstelstation. The are is in reparations, so you will hate to detour a bit.The property itself is quite big, and houses an interesting mix of people: from business-people to young & restless students. :)Being it is such a big place, the cleanliness & up-keeping is not the best I've seen, but nothing dramatic either. No iron in the room. No room-service. No credit card registration at check-in, resulting in no on-the-room ordering possibilities.There are two restaurants in the hotel, East 57, where I had breakfasts & dinner, and Nest, a terrace nice for snacks, where they also grow herbs used in the kitchen. Both places were lovely, with great food, but a bit pricey. Service & stocking is a bit sloppy, but then again, remember the huge number of people roaming the premises.Very good Wi-Fi.All in all a pleasurable stay, but not necessarily the most quiet, convenient hotel for a business trip.
title: An Interesting Hotel

review: I love hotel casa! Reasonable pricing for overnight stays. Room was spacious, clean and had everything we needed. Lovely bathroom and shower. Beautiful architecture and lovely big windows in all the rooms. But what really made this place were the people. All of the staff were very welcoming and friendly, and the hotel has a reputation for being good for partying (which is perfect for me!) After a heavy night out, the staff were happy to order is a pizza that we ate in the lobby at 5am!! There is also a rooftop bar with stunning views across the dam. Overall, I would recommend!
title: Great hotel for friends, socialising and 5am pizza!

review: Great Hotel, very comfortable, ideally located for easy access into city centre and staff were very helpful. It is obviously a newer built Hotel and the quality/finish of fittings is evident and much appreciated, keep up the good work/service.
title: Amsterdam stay 2017

review: This is a very nice hotel just a little outside the city centre but you can easily reach the centre by train,tram or subway (only three stops !). The rooms are comfortable with great beds and a beautiful bathroom. And the staff is professional but very friendly and they make you feel really welcome. This hotel is an excellent choice whether you are staying for business or for pleasure
title: Excellent choice, whether you are staying for business or pleasure

review: Our family slept there 2 nights. 3 july and 12 july. Our teenagers got rooms close to us and they got single bed as requested. The beds was sooo good. Nice rooms, and a shower that really washed the mothers thick hair Other hotelrooms you can nearly see and feel the water. The breakfast was boring. And should have been included as in norwegian hotels Easy parkingspace.
title: A great stay

review: Very nice new hotel very nice reception and rooms are very clean .. i love the way your (Dont disturb sign is) :) . good location. i really recommend this hotel for anyone whos visiting Amsterdam . you can rent a bike from the reception employees are very kind and helpful
title: Hotel Casa Amsterdam

review: Stayed in Hotel Casa for 1 night for business. Very nice hotel, high quality at very competitive price. Excellent location, few minutes walk from the metro station. Great staff service at check-in and easy and quick "queue free" check-out (you drop your key in a box at reception if you already paid at check-in). Rooms are spacious and quite. WiFi works well in all common areas and rooms. Very good breakfast served in their nice restaurant which is also open until 1 am for drinks and snacks after dinner.Great terrace at the 8th floor to chill-out. Highly recommended.
title: Excellent stay

review: Located in a central area, travel really easy, trams etc really close, fantastic staff, modern rooms, fantastic terrace bar with great views of the city, worth a visit, food good, would stay here again.
title: Excellent hotel

review: The hotel is quite far away from the city centre, the room was basic but comfy and we had a nice sleep, the bathroom floor gets flooded when you take a shower. They give you a nice coffee supply but they also gave us a dirty glass. It was good considering the price. The outside river is very nice for a night walk. The overall experience was nice.
title: Good stay for the price we paid

review: 5-7min from Amstel station on foot, really good service (luggage storage, they even let us borrow a vacuum to suction our luggage compresser bags>amazingly soft bed i could stay in forever.Theres a nice lounge and restaurant there too!
title: Comfy room, great service, great location

review: Just back from 3 days in Amsterdam where we stayed at the Casa. The staff were welcoming and helpful, the room was clean and well appointed. Travel links are really good, as you would imagine, with regular connections to all the sights and the airport. We had dinner in the restaurant on two of the evenings which was very good and again, the service was great.
title: Good Value

review: Our stay at Casa was magnificent! Everyone that we dealt with from front desk, coffee bar, and East 57 restaurant were awesome. Room was clean and very comfortable. Beautiful location, close to central Amsterdam and public transportation. Look forward to a return stay!
title: Great stay!

review: The hotel was clean and modern and the price was reasonable. Location was great as there is amstel station less than 5 minute walk which takes you 1 stop into centraal station. The tram stop is also outside station which takes you to the museum square. The bar is ridiculously overpriced so I wouldn't bother, there is a bar nearby with drinks and breakfast at a fraction of the price. The bed was AWFUL, had some ridiculous mattress topper thing that slipped off the bed so then so did I!!! The staff where professional but unhelpful and somewhat cold. All in all it made for an average stay at a rather dull hotel.
title: It's just ok

review: This hotel is about a 200m walk from the Amstel metro station in Amsterdam, slightly southeast of the center. It is a very modern hotel, and its strongest point is its staff -- they are friendly, helpful, and seem to truly enjoy what they do.Our room was large and clean, with a refrigerator (we did not use--only stayed 1 night). The bathroom was large and very clean.We had two problems with water: the shower drain was apparently clogged, which produced a small flood. We called and this was promptly attended to and the bathroom re-cleaned. Also, the toilet started leaking and would not stop running at one point, but again, a call to the front desk and this was also taken care of, and the bathroom re-cleaned. We were also offered free breakfast because of our troubles.The restaurant, East 57, attached to the hotel, is excellent and the food plentiful.The breakfast was also excellent, and the staff helpful and friendly.We would definitely stay here again.
title: Modern Hotel in Amsterdam

review: Price considered, this was one of the most disappointing and poor value for money stays in a hotel I have experienced. Every staff member we spoke to during our stay lacked any sort of cheer and nobody seemingly wanted to be there. For example it took us three attempts of asking to have additional pillows for the room. The room itself was clean on arrival but by the end we weren't even getting new coffee and tea.The rooms themselves are very basic and seemed to be furnished with a 'that will do' attitude. For example the curtains don't reach the bottom of the window, so light will always get in. A quarter of our room was taken up by a desk, which had no chair. The shower had terrible drainage and almost no lip, meaning every shower the room would flood. There is no air conditioning unit in the room, instead we got a rickety old fan which seemed the type from a bargain bin at a hardware store. There is a thermostat thing, it didn't do anything. The hotel did offer extra services like breakfast and bike hire, but all at a ridiculous surcharge. Breakfast was €13.50 per person and bike hire was €18 plus a €100 deposit per bike. We were surprised the wifi was free. You could buy separate items for breakfast but they seemed to have gotten the price list from a budget airline.At a side note, avoid the East 57 restaurant at all cost (there is a review on my profile). The rooftop bar was quite nice though.The hotel is covered in strange marketing propaganda which even extended to the rooms themselves. The hotel seems to still market itself as a cool-hip student friendly place, which at the cost and unwelcoming and unfriendly service makes absolutely no sense. I truly believe better value could be found elsewhere.
title: Overpriced and underwhelming

review: If you want a quiet hotel that is convenient for the city then casa 400 is perfect. The room was spacious, and the shower was really strong. The towels were changed everyday and the beds remade. Staff were very friendly and helpful - we asked for an extra pillow one night to find out they didn't have any left, and were told to ask again in the morning. When we returned the following afternoon the maid had made up the beds with the extra pillow for us.The hotel is right by amstel station that stops at various points in the city and goes all the way to central. We never waited longer than 1 or 2 minutes for a train because they are so regular. Another plus is that you have to activate the lift with your keycard which stops any undesirables wandering about too. The room came with a full size hairdryer - not a useless wall mounted one like most hotels. Shampoo and shower gel were also provided, as well as tea and coffee making facilities. Overall we had a fantastic stay at this hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone travelling to Amsterdam.
title: Perfect for getting into the city

review: I really liked the environment and overall the atmosphere of the hotel. The receptionist who welcomed us was very helpful and courteous. One of the girls at the coffee shop was going her way to get my coffe right! :) I really appreciated her efforts. Unfortunately I did not have the chance to try the restaurant but it looked busy all the time and, again, the atmosphere was cosy and welcoming. The area is relatively easy to reach by transports and bike. I loved the design of the hotel which reminded me a bit of a community place :) I will surely recommend Casa Hotel. The room was a little small but clean and we had fresh towels every day. I loved the terrace and its view, with the organic/natural style bar.
title: Great Atmosphere and Cool Design Hotel

review: We stayed here in July 2017. We didn't know the hotel, but given that we paid 300€ for a night we expected something VERY different. This hotel is more of a hostal, and charging that kind of rates is outrageous!When asking the reception about this, all we got was a cocky remark and a patronizing smile. Never again. I cannot recommend this place.
title: Don't..!

review: Interior of the hotel is simple and modern, very attractive and spaceous. Big rooms with comfy beds. Friendly staff. Location of hotel is easy accessable, in quiet neighborhood, yet very close to the city center. We rented bikes at the hotel service and it is the best way to explore Amsterdam. Definitely staying here anytime I come back.
title: bingo

review: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights for a cheap getaway to Amsterdam. It's the cleanest hotel I've stayed at and is so easy to get from from central Amsterdam. Took us 5 minutes or less to walk from amstel station. The roof top bar is so lovely, drinks are abit pricey but the view makes up for it. Wi-Fi is also excellent & they arranged a taxi to the airport for us when leaving. Very good facilities, can't fault it!
title: Very good

review: I loved this hotel! I went for one week to Amsterdam for business and found the hotel amazing! It has everything you need, great service and the restaurant serves a very delicious food!I really felt like home as I could have a cup of awesome coffee at their coffee place and a great lunch/dinner there!Great rooftop bar with a nice city view!
title: Amazing!I felt exactly like the home: Home!

review: Had a great stay - the hotel itself had great decor, the staff were extremely helpful (and all fluent in English if that's a concern for you) and the metro was less than a 5 min walk with only a 10 min ride to the big sites/ city center. I also went running along the canal next to the hotel while there and there are lots of restaurant options nearby.
title: Awesome hotel!

review: Really cool hotel not far from center with nice bar on rooftop. Room was cozy, staff was friendly. Breakfast also was good. City center is couple of metro stations away. Also accessible by bike or even on foot if you don't mind long walks.
title: Cool nice hotel in Amsterdam

review: Located around 4-5 kms from the Centre, this Hotel is in a perfect location as it is not far from the Metro station (Amsterdam Centraal is just 3-4 Metro stations away), around 400 metres, and at the same time it avoids the crowd and commotion of the centre. I had a room in the 11th floor which faced the small canal in front, and I had a majestic view of the beautiful city through the wide glass, covering the entire length of the wall, of the room. I had a very comfortable stay during my 4 days at the hotel, and the complementary breakfast was very good. There is a restaurant and a bar on 8th floor terrace and on the ground and 1st floor. Service and food was really good. The place is a little open, so we get the breeze all the time. There is Albert Heijn (Dutch SuperMarket chain) at a distance of 700-800 metres. The neighbourhood itself is worth a walk. There are a few quirky little hostels down the road. Some old houses, decorated with flowers and big gardens along the same road. The small canal in front of the hotel is surrounded by Joggers path. So, one can walk and jog around like many of the locals in the area do.
title: Far from the madding crowd!

review: Excellent hotel and I can definitely recommend. I visited Amsterdam for four days (3 nights) with my daughter. I found the staff friendly and was impressed with the bedroom.Location is good, 5 minutes from Amstel Station. I unfortunately, had a leg injury so might have taken me longer! The restaurants looked very nice but probably too pricey for us. Good location.
title: Three nights at Hotel Casa

review: This is a good quality hotel offering good standards of service and accommodation at great rates.Situated just outside the city but only a few stops and a 10 minute Metro ride Hotel Casa is great for those wishing to avoid high city centre rates, but still enjoy ease of access to all the attractions and sights. It is remarkably easy to get quickly into the city centre, the nearest Metro station being only a very short walk away.Very good and efficient check in service was experienced from the reception staff and I was extremely happy to be welcomed, particularly as we arrived early after our flight and it was nice to be greeted warmly with such pleasant service and be able to check into our room early.Clean, modern and bright, the hotel has a nice vibrant feel. Our stay was only a short one and we did not have the opportunity to sample all of the facilities but the bar and coffee area looked great and the rooftop terrace was so nice, and a relaxing place to spend time after a day in the city.The room was a little on the small side, but all very functional and ideal for the shorter stay. The beds were particularly comfortable with really nice mattress toppers which made for a good nights sleep. My only small criticism was the very small supply of tea and coffee making products that were available in the room. I would have no hesitation in taking the chance to stay again at Hotel Casa in any future trip to Amsterdam.
title: Quality Budget Hotel at a great price!

review: Hotel is a very good value of quality to money, with very good location, near to center.very nice staff and good restaurant. Rooms are very clean and quiet with beautifull view. I would recommend for visiting Amsterdam.
title: very good place and location

review: Hotels.com found us a room here after another hotel cancelled our reservation.Staff here all very friendly, great beer selection roof top very cool and coffee shop very busy. Bed comfy room clean would use again.
title: Excellent Hotel

review: Walkable distance to everything but metro was 5 min walk away. Hotel was clean and good facilities. Bar had a cool vibe to it and cocktails were good. Bedroom was very comfortable. Only negatives were..... Towels were toooooooo small and there was no milk in the rooms for our morning brews.
title: Good Location, good facilities and staff very helpful

review: Had booked a 2 room apartment which turned out to be 1 small room with bathroom plus a living room with sofa bed and pantry. Not the best of accommodations and specially for the price we paid, not value for money at all. Otherwise stay was fine. Would recommend to check for other places first.
title: Can avoid the apartment

review: Was here for two nights. Good location not far from centre by walk service good. Rooms clean and comfy. If I will come back Amsterdam definitely will choose same hotel. Can definitely recommended! Great!
title: Great hotel!

review: Great hotel with friendly staff, a nice coffee shop and good breakfast with a good selection. Located very close to Amsterdam Amstel station so easy to get to central Amsterdam, attractions and the airport.
title: Great stay

review: The Casa Hotel is a really good Hotel in the south of Amsterdam City. The rooms are modern and the beds are comfortable. The staff in freindly and parking is affordable. If you wanna go to town you can take the tram or the metro which are both very close to the hotel. We would love to come back and spend a bit more than just one night at Casa.
title: A very nice place in Amsterdam

review: The rooms are very well designed and thought-through. Hotel Casa has everything you need, but keeps prices down by dispensing with everything you don't need. You have wifi and a large bed with nice linen- you don't have a bath with a bathrobe. You do have a desk the length of the room to work or put your suitcase, you don't have plastic wrapped slippers. You do have TV, a kettle for tea and a mini-bar and fridge, you don't have views of the city. There is a good restaurant and everything you want from a hotel breakfast - but you don't have room service. This is the perfect basecamp for people of all ages who are here to explore the city or work. Will definitely recommend it to my friends and colleagues. Francesca at the front desk is an angel!
title: Smart hotel in central Amsterdam

review: My friend and I arrived and both of us were greeted by two people on reception. They were extremely helpful and very positive. The room was spacious and comfortable. The shower was large and the bed was comfortable! The location was our favourite thing about this hotel as it was 5 minutes from Amstel Station and then a direct metro three stops to the centre. It was very easy and convenient. It was not right in the centre but close enough to it. We were two girls traveling alone and felt very safe walking around. We could not recommend this hotel more!
title: Excellent hotel

review: It was the second time i stayed there. The location is fantastic, a quiet neighbourhood away from the crowded Damsquare but still very easy to be reached by metro or train (Amstelstation). Very clean room ,friendly staff and a lovely restaurant serving all meals until late.
title: Best place to stay when in Amsterdam

review: Stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. Hotel is spotless. Location is nice and quiet and only a couple of minutes walk to the Metro station, where you can be in Amsterdam Station in less than 5 mins. Beds are real comfortable and the rooftop bar is beautiful. The food in the restaurant is very nice. Will be definitely be returning. Highly recommend Casa Hotel.
title: Beautiful Hotel. Ideal Location

review: I stayed here with a friend for 3 nights. And as the title of my review suggests, it was "just right". Good location, a couple of minutes walk from Amstel station where you could get the metro to Centraal or a tram into the museum district etc. The room was adequately sized, comfortable beds, good shower, clean and had a hair dryer. We didn't have much interaction with staff, but when we did they were polite and our room was cleaned daily. The coffee shop/restaurant was lovely. Slightly higher priced but nothing that wouldn't be expected of a hotel near the centre of Amsterdam. Food was tasty and the coffee was fabulous. We only ate here once as we mostly ate when we were out. Free wifi and a water foundation were both helpful. There wasn't really anything locally, but we spent all our time in the city so this made no difference to us. And to be fair, we didn't really explore the area. If you are looking for a comfortable, reasonably priced base when in Amsterdam with easy access to the main city, then this is "just right".
title: Just Right

review: Everything excellent about this hotel!!First and foremost, they provided me an early checkin at 8 in the morning.Very nice reception area. Big and clean rooms.Close to tram, train and metro station (Amstel station)Didnt see any supermarket closeby. We didn't had meals included but their restaurants very mostly busy implying that the food and service was also good in there.Only suggestion is to provide multiple key cards.
title: Great Hospitality!!

review: We stayed for two nights while visiting Amsterdam and felt the hotel was very good. Good size modern rooms and all very clean and efficient. The rooftop bar (weather permitting!) was lovely to relax in at the end of the day. The metro meant we could be in central Amsterdam in about 15 mins from leaving the hotel. While we didn't make use of the restaurant it looked well-used and had a good menu. If you want you use the fridge for fresh milk and breakfast things.We will certainly use this hotel again.
title: Very good place to stay

review: We were in Amsterdam for a few nights and ended up staying at the Hotel Casa. Location:It is about a 5-7 minute walk from the Amstelstation which is a decent hub. 3 or the 4 metro lines stop hear and it is only about 5 stops to Central Station and 3-4 stops for other city center locations. The Sprinter and Intercity trains also stop at this station. In addition there are Casa signs almost the whole way from the station to the hotel so you know which way to walk.Hotel:The hotel is clean with a big lobby. The lobby also has tables set up where you can sit with your laptop and work and many people were doing so. This hotel has a young vibe about it with what seemed to be a younger type crowd staying there. It also has a great coffee bar in the lobby as well as a breakfast buffet, wine bar and 8th floor rooftop terrace. However, these all close at around 11 PM and there is nothing really close by so if you want a late night, plan on being out in the city. At check in the staff was very friendly.Room:The view in our room was not great. We were overlooking the other side of the hotel so we basically looked at a building for 3 days. Also, if you're on the side, you can see into the rooms across the way so keep that in mind. Had I known this, I would have asked for a different view or paid a little more for the view. This was probably the biggest room we had while traveling in Europe and I feel it was comparable in size to US hotels rather than European Hotels. There was plenty of room to put our luggage and spread out a little bit. The shower was okay but as other people stated, it does leak onto the bathroom floor pretty substantially. This is a design flaw in the shower and door set-up. Our room was on the top floor right next to the elevator however, it was pretty quiet and we were never bothered by the elevator noise. Finally, this was also the best wifi we had in Europe. It worked well every time we needed it. Overall, I enjoyed our stay here and would stay again if we are ever in Amsterdam.
title: Not central but good location

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My family and I have recently just returned from a long weekend in Amsterdam. We booked the whole trip through Expedia which was easy and saved up money; a good bonus! Upon arrival to the hotel, we were greeted by a young hotel attendant. Although the check-in was 'self-service' he helped us every step of the way and made sure we understood the system. He continued to give us a piece of paper with transport information. He told us which line to use, the stop for the hotel and the final destination of the trams which was very useful. The rooms were a very good size, extremely comfy beds and very clean! I would recommend this hotel to anyone and will certainly return.
title: Highly recommended

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: A wonderful hotel with very high standards. I recommend it for families, business trips and usual sightseeing. Advantages:-very close to tram/train/metro-fantastic service and very helpful-absolutely amazing food -clean and comfortable
title: Perfect choice

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This was our. third stay in Amsterdam during a 3-week Euro cycling trip. We decided to stay outside the city center to avoid traffic, noise, and all of the tourists. Corendon is in Amsterdam West and is 3 miles from the city center. By bike it is about 20 minutes, but is nice to ride through Vondelpark. The hotel is clean, large, has a nice restaurant for dinner and breakfast. We had Mediterranean fare at Cor & Don's after a long day of cycling into the city. It was perfect. Our room was cozy and has air conditioning (cold) for the summer months. There is a smoking cabin outside and covered bike parking. The hotel also has a lot of Mac Bikes for rental. If you're looking to stay close to the city to walk, do not stay here. If you're ok to take the tram, aren't looking for nightlife just outside your doorsteps, and enjoy some quiet, Corendon is suitable for that.
title: Short Stay in Amsterdam West

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Only a short tram ride from Amsterdam City Centre this hotel provides everything you need. It is a good value, very clean, has super helpful staff, excellent breakfast and a great bar. We stayed for five days and it was great. The best hotel experience I have had for a long time. It is worth visiting. You won't regret. Thank you :)
title: All you need is in Corendon Vitality Hotel

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is new and well located - close to Metro and tram. The room and facilities were very spacious with nice decor. However , people in the reception and room cleaning were not really nice in terms of helping and being polite. The cleaning of the room was poorly done - the garbage and towels were not taken/changed.Parking was just beside the hotel, which was really handy.
title: Good facilities, bad service.

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Lovely hotel . It was about 15/20 minutes on the no2 tram into Amsterdam but it was nice to sit and see the whole city . Also it meant it was quiet at night . Rooms were lovely and the Spa downstairs was a lovely way to relax after walking all day . Get you second wind and go back into City. We had breakfast included and there was plenty of choice.
title: Mother and daughter city break

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I was there in 9th June for 1 night, it's an amazing hotel very quite, friendly stuff, helpful employees, the room size was good also all the hotel was very clean from inside & outside.The problem in it's location near from the airport but far from the city centre.
title: Comfortable stay

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Corendon Vitaliy hotel on Jacobslaan, Amsterdam is a fairly new hotel, with a good location, close to Amsterdams GVB tram and bus stations. We had a triple sharing room and it was quite spacious. The beds were comfortable but needed better cleaning / changing of bed linen and making of the beds. The shower door was wrongly attached so getting in and out of the shower area was a big task and they would be well advised to make changes to this. Our flight was at a later time and we had requested a slightly later check out time than normal checkout time of 12 noon. The request was denied but while seated at the reception we did hear the receptionist allowing some other guests an extended hour or 2 late check out and this made us mad. The hotel has a spa area and swimming pool and a well stocked shop at reception for daily articles and snacks. Guests have to pay for use of the swimming pool, which i thought was not ok. There are 2 big supermarkets in walking distance of the hotel, which was a plus point.
title: New hotel, good amenities

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is amazing, and when I return to Amsterdam I will be staying here again. First off let's talk price, this is a 4 star hotel and was 20 euros cheaper than any AirBNB I found and more affordable than hotels or hostels within the city center -- incredible deal. Staff is wonderful and friendly, and the rooms are great -- the beds are ridiculously comfy. My only gripe is the WiFi can be finicky, but, it always worked in the end. Last thing to note is the location, it is about a 15-20 minute tram ride into the city -- which truthfully never bothered me as I got to see some lovely parts of Amsterdam I had never seen before. I love this hotel and I'm quite sure you will too!
title: Why Stay Anywhere Else?

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed as a group in the hotel for 4 days to attend a tournament at Amsterdam Zuid. The metro was very close to the hall and to the city center. Very good price-performance ratio. The rooms were very clean and the air conditioning can be turn off. We had fresh air even we couldn't open any windows. The breakfast with 15EUR is high but was delicious.
title: Comfortable and close to Metro

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It is a bit far from the city but close to metro and tram stations. It will take you about 20-25 minutes by tram to get to the city. If you plan on doing day trips (recommend Delft if you have time by the way) it is two metro stations away from Zuid station and another one whose name I forget. Those are nicer stations than centraal to plan your day trips anyway. The hotel itself is clean and the staff is professional. Breakfast is good, though the same every day, which I say if it isn't broke, don't fix it. One very minor pet peeve with the place: queen sized bed actually comes with two twin sized blankets on top. So even with a queen bed, you'll have enough continuous blanket for as if you were sleeping on a twin.
title: Good location for day trips

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel was lovely, has a lovely snack bar downstairs with croissants and sandwiches. The cocktails at the bar are lovely and the rooms are peaceful, airy and comfortable. Food was also nice. 5 minute walk to the nearest tram stop which takes roughly 15-20 minutes to get to the main area. Great for a city break
title: Great hotel, short walk to a tram stop
