hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Clean and good hotel. We stayed for 1 night during the Pride. It was a good experience. Great service. We arrived very early (9.00 oçlock) and we left our luggage behind. At around midnight we picked it up and went to our room. Good clean room. Great view (big windows!). We slept perfect. The bathroom is a reasonable size. Good shower. The breakfast was more than sufficient. Different kinds of breads and pastry. Fresh fruit, yoghurt, fresh orange juice, fresh eggs prepared how you like it. We enjoyed our stay and would come back again!
title: Great touch of the Self Check In Desk

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is clean, the toilet is very clean, staff was very kind and helpful very professional the restaurant got good tasting food the sauna and pool facilities classy but come with extra 15 euro per head for the duration of your stay...25min away from central station using tram 2 or tram 17 them metro 50....then 5-10 min walk to the hotel!
title: The best hotel I been so far

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Thanks for your hospitability There are so many employees who know turkish. Also there are photographs from Turkey in the room and loby. Breakdast is also similar to Turkish breakfast You can go to center easily by tramvay and metro.
title: Turkish friendly hotel

hotelLocation: Aletta Jacobslaan 7, 1066 BP Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Generally the hotel is fine but: there are no bars, restaurants, nothing outside the hotel. To go to center you need to take a tram, often overloaded for 25 minutes, or a taxi , 25-30 euro. So, unless you want to suffer and be a commuter, be ready to add this amount on your room bill and finally it must turn out more convenient to stay nearer the center. Being an international hotek chain, they could offer a navette to center. But doing so, obviously they wouldnt share your money with taxis.Rooms was clean but if you forget to switch on the green light, no cleaning lady will come.If you do turn it green, the cleaning lady doesn't do anything else than roughly re-arrange your bedsheets. No one cared of dirty glasses on the shelves or to arrange the room and make it look cleaner.The bath is sad, Hospital-like.Bed is comfortable, and room is silent.No idea of breakfast,i thought it was included actually but it was not, and to add another 15 euros would have made it really out of price (considering the taxis).Spa is ok, but if you dont have your flip-flop, you need an extra 7,5 euro. And another 15 to access the Spa.Restaurant is good, fine service and good meat, no complains. So, generally, not comfortable due to the location and the lack of a navette. And 400 euro for 3 nights,no breakfast, don't make it a place where i want to return.
title: A hotel in the middle of a sad nowhere

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: The Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky was located in an excellent location. It was a short 10 minute walk from Central Station after getting off the airport train. About 9 short blocks. The front of the hotel faces the center of Dam Square. The Sandeman's free walking tours meet's out in front. Restaurants are all around and there is a (Dirk) supermarket half a block up. We had three adults for our premium triple room. Beds for very comfortable. double sink so multiple people can use. Staff was friendly and helpful. I only encounter two minor issues with my 6 night stay. The first was the concierge didn't know what the dutch museum pass was. I had reserved for the Anne Frank museum, but you would still need to have the dutch museum pass. I needed to know where the nearest museum was so I can buy it. I was redirected to use the IamAmsterdam pass which wouldn't work or try using the tours desk located outside. I had used my google map to locate the rembrandt museum which is about 10-14 minutes walk for my purchase.The second issue was the elevator was making a loud sound since it was having problems closing. I saw what appears to be the repairman working at it early in the morning, but it was never fixed. It went on all day. I brought it to the attention of the hotel and I was told no one had reported it.
title: Great Amsterdam hotel

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: I loved this hotel! Not only because I got an upgrade to a big suite! The hotel is in the perfect location an renovated! I loved the place where we have breakfast and the staff is amazing! Thank you so much NH! I truly recommend this hotel!
title: Excellent hotel!! Got an upgrade to a suite!

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This will be our first time going to this particular hotel. When we have visited Amsterdam before we stayed further out, however as it's our anniversary my husband suprised me with a 5* hotel in the middle of Dam. I was generally looking forward to the trip however when contacting the front desk, I had spoken to 3 different members of the management staff to confirm my reservations. They were very polite on the phone and via email. However the actual customer service for a 5* hotel was rather disappointing they were unable to confirm my reservation and made no further contact.I am due to visit in the next few days and hope the experience in person will exceed my expectations rather then the past communication I've had.
title: Poor customer services

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We loved the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky. The hotel stafff, from the concierge to the breakfas stafft and room cleaners were very friendly and could not do enough for us.The winter room, where breakfast was served was stunning and the choice and quality of food was excellent.The location was brilliant and only a short walk from central station.Our room was very stylish and good value for money, a bit on the small size and not much of a view. Which is what you expect from city hotels, unless you pay extra for a larger room with a view.I would thoroughly recommend this hotel.
title: Brilliant location

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Loved our stay in this hotel. Has a very 5 star feel to it, everything is clean and modern, and there's a doorman who welcomes you in and always hands you an umbrella if it's raining as you're leaving for the day. We asked for a modern room as we knew the hotel was being renovated, which we got. The rooms are spacious, with clean and large bathrooms. The bed is probably the biggest and comfiest bed I've ever slept it! We traveled as a young couple but didn't feel out of place even though it wasn't mostly business men who we bumped into during our stay. Breakfast was lovely, and til 10:30 so no worry to get out of bed early.
title: Comfortable and welcoming

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: i was highly satisfied with all over the setting, atmosphere and centrally location of the hotel too. i would come again. Service was good and hospitality, rooms clean and location of hotel is highly appreciated
title: excellent stay

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: The hotel is well located, updated, clean and well appointed. The only problem I had is when I was serviced by not one, but two trainees, seemingly unsupervised. The woman at check-in was ok, but was clearly just going through the motions without any sense of service (e.g. asked us to complete entire personal information sheet when we reserved online giving personal information, no assistance offered getting to elevator when it's not clear as to the location of their very separately situated 7 elevators).The 2nd trainee occurrence was at the Concierge desk, where he was not very helpful with restaurant suggestions, seemingly because he did not know of very many. I had more suggestions than he did, and thankfully a bellhop closeby came to his rescue.When spending close to 800 Euro per night, I expect more. Unfortunate as the rest was quite good.
title: Served by TWO trainees....unfortunate.

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Love this hotel, this is the second time i have stayed here now and will definitely be back again. Room was gorgeous, everything was spotless bed was so comfortable. Staff are really friendly. Cant wait to book again.
title: gorgeous

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We came to the hotel at 12:00 when check in is at 15:00. Wasn't told that there are any issues with our room so we went for lunch and came back at 15:00. Room wasn't ready on time. Was asked to come back at 16:30. "We are busy" was the explanation we got, nothing alse. We thought that it should be reasonable to have been compensated for that, but didn't ask for nothing. I think that when paying this much for a 5 star hotel, they have to do more to make your customers happy when you messed up. I'm sure that if I didn't check out on time I would be charged for it, and so, if my room wasn't ready on time, the same rules should apply.
title: Great location, half dissent service

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Stayed here last month with friends for a nice weekend in Amsterdam.Since I had night shift the previous day I asked in advance if it would be possible to check in at 0730 am. Once I came to the hotel my room was available and I could have some sleep already!Lisa escorted me to my room and in the nice chat we had I dropped that I would like to be awake around 13 o'clock, apparently I also told here I always turn of my alarm when I finished night shifts. Indeed I did.. at 1320 Lisa called to my room and asked how I slept and if I did turned of my alarm! Wauw thank you Lisa for waking me up!! As well she left a kind note with chocolates in my room :):))In the evening the girl from turn down came by and asked us if we need anything, no everything was fine and she gave us this cute amenities for some rest before going to sleep. Everyone in the hotel was very friendly, helpful and nothing was impossible. Would definitely stay here again!
title: Best wake up call ever

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: When we arrived at this impressive hotel we were thrilled when given an upgrade to a suite! Sadly the aircon didn't perform very well so our room was constantly very hot. We notified staff and although they initially came to check, obviously there was a fault. Breakfast which we had included was magic, served in the Winter Garden Room, we loved our start to the day and enjoyed the luxury. Our suite was massive so enjoyed the space. Great location as well.On the downside, we were evacuated late one night with warnings to leave immediately and do not use the lifts. Already in bed, threw some clothes over the top and only took long enough to grab passports. Many guests, some quite panicky, raced down the fire escape to the street where you would expect to see a staff member to direct us. NO! no one was there, we all gathered waiting for instructions, eventually we decided to go to the front of the hotel to seek help. The hotel seemed to be fine with other guests inside unaware. Obviously the wing we were staying in was the only area effected.When I queried staff as to when they were going to let us know we were safe to return to our rooms they informed us it was no big deal and all was ok. Not good enough- hotels should have an obligation to their guests and their safety.
title: Few issues

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: After using my trusted Travel Consultants to find an excellent Hotel in Amsterdam, I was excited when entering the NH Krasnapolsky Hotel Lobby. However my expectations came crashing down when met by the Hotel Staff who demanded a 200 Euro Deposit for the pleasure of using the mini bar and other facilities within the Hotel. It was more the manner in which this was demanded and the lack of flexibility until I challenged the Request, this was then adjusted to 100 Euro Miraculously! The room was average with no view. Not what I have come to expect when travelling around the World in some of the finest of Hotels. There were many negatives to this stay, I have not got the energy to go through all of them on this review. The communication with staff was poor. I completed all the paperwork for my Laundry the morning before my check out date, I tipped the Concierge to get this back for the morning after and was assured this would be no problem. The morning after I was due to check out, 12pm! No Laundry ? I was told on the phone it would be posted to my home address! This was not an option as I had Business Meeting in Malaga that day. Very disappointed overall with the stay.
title: Very Disappointing After Referred to Stay at the Krasnapolsky

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Besides my bar fridge not working for the entire stay, The Tailor bar has very friendly and efficient barmen. the service was excellent. Position is very central. will stay there again on my next stay
title: excellent

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Beautiful hotel close to everything. The hotel lobby is big and spacious. A good place to have coffee and a piece of cake . The only draw back was the elevator was rather small.The rooms were cleaned everyday and spacious.
title: Three day stay

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: The hotel is immpecable with a well equipped and stylish room. The staff are very pleasent and helpful, The breakfast was excellent with a massive selection of hot and cold foods and a variety of fruit drinks.The hotel is placed extremely well for access to central station, buses,trams and canals. Shopping, restaurants,bars and red light district all within a short walk away.This is one of the best hotels i have been in and will definatley be re-booking the next time we come to Amsterdam.
title: Perfect Hotel, Perfect Location

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: The hotel and our room were lovely, but we had an annoying noise coming from the bathroom. After the manager and maintenance personnel couldn't figure it out, Kaylie from Guest Relations was gracious enough to move us to another room. Because of the inconvenience, Kaylie found us a larger room that faced the Dam, and made it extra special for me an my husband, with rose petals and balloons in the room! She even arranged for our luggage to be moved while we were out touring the city. Excellent customer service - thanks Kaylie
title: Great Customer Service

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This was by 5th visit to Amsterdam over the past 10 years. I've stayed in the sister hotel Barbizon which is close to the station and has a good location as well as other high-end hotels. The Grand however is much better placed for those that want to be in the centre of the sites. The service is impeccable, a special thank you to Melanie who was very professional and checked me in before the usual 3PM time and answered all my questions. The Dam Square location s perfect for first time and well seasoned visitor to Amsterdam. Perfect for couples or large parties. I did not experience the restaurant over 3 nights but the prices looked on par for a 5 star hotel the bar staff were very friendly and attentive though. My Favourite hotel up until this point was Swissotel which is more intimate but much smaller. If you are looking for a superior hotel in the middle of Amsterdam with walking distance to Amsterdam Centraal Station within close proximity to all the attractions, then this Hotel is for you.
title: All Grand at the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Perfect location and perfect stay at the Krasnapolsky. We stayed for 5 nights in July 2017 and had a marvellous time, really easy to walk around the city and all the sight seeing as well as the shopping streets. From welcome to overall stay, breakfast and service it was all amazing!!Upon arrival we were escorted to our room finding out that we got upgraded and not only that, our room was decorated in a lovely romantic way for our anniversary. Thank you to all staff that were so attentive and friendly. Definitely recommended and would stay there again on our next trip to Amsterdam
title: Surprise Upgrade and Amazing welcome on our anniversary!!

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: location is great, but the lounge areas are dire and the focus of this property seems to be conferences. good enough if you spend most of the time out of the hotel. Only convivial space the bar and an outdoors smoking lounge
title: Great location, average hotel

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Was having hectic days and finally got my free day to chill with friends, was dont know where to go and decided to go to the bar and lounge in krasnapolsky Dam square Amsterdam. The bar was just open exact 5pm. Still dont know to decide what to have and the polite waiter Johem was approached us and gave recomendation of cocktail based by Gin... (forgot what the name of the cocktail) but it was really surprised and kind of him gave us reallY good cocktail witch is unique cocktail served with infused something with vodka parfum and purple colour..Johem just made our day with his cocktais....big thanks for him..definately will go back to chilling again and high recomended for this place to having day out
title: Cocktails day out

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: The location is very central to everything, the premises is modern and tasteful with nice rooms and good taste in its decorations. Not much interaction with the staff but seemed fairly pleasant and professional. Good breakfast served before a day out.
title: Good hotel with a fair price

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: The hotel is in a fantastic location with great amenities and friendly helpful staff. The room was large, clean and with a great bathroom. We used the restaurant and the bar both were great. We would definitely stay there again.
title: Great Hotel in Great Location

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We chose this hotel because it is perfectly located right in the dam square, next to the bijenkorf, palace, madame tussaud, and red light district. Shopping areas only minutes away and central station is also within walking distance. The hotel is super busy, so don't expect to get nice service upon check in. Both of receptionist who assisted us were not friendly at all. No excuse of being super busy, I think all guests should get a nice experience for staying there. Please note that check in time is 3pm. Despite of requesting room with high floor upon reservation, first room we got was located in the 1st floor facing the roof of the hotel, which was not nice at all. Room is pretty small and we spotted hairs on the bed when we just arrived. Not a nice feeling! We asked for different room and we got apartment side at the back of the hotel. We love the apartment better than the room but beware of lots of steep stairs to get to your room. But, again, it is a good experience to have the apartment with those stairs. The concierges are so helpful and they are super nice. Breakfast selection is ok, buffet close at 11am. Luxury Canal cruise service is available at 15 Euro/person for 1 hour. Nice experience.
title: Strategic location

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Leaving a review the day we depart because my partner and myself are both gutted to be leaving this fabulous hotel. As soon as we arrived on our first day we were greeted and told our reservation had been upgraded as we were their 'special guest of the day'. The start of our stay was made even greater when we saw the room and the size of the bed! My partner is pretty large but he was swallowed up in it, haha. I was sceptical of hotels in the centre of Amsterdam as I has been told they could be rather noisy, but we didn't hear a peep. Our view from the room wasn't spectacular but I'm not complaining, all you have to do is walk outside the hotel to see a beautiful view. The location is also fabulous, right next to restaurants, bars and shops. We found our favourite coffee shops right behind the hotel, the Bulldog coffee shops cater for all types of weed smoker, depending on which mood my partner and myself were in, there was a corresponding shop. All in all, the hotel is pretty amazing - OH I FORGOT THE BREAKFAST... BEAUTIFUL!- I would recommend anyone who is looking to feel papered and relaxed while staying in such a beautiful city. Thank you to the staff for making our first holiday away absolutely amazing.
title: This hotel is one of the BEST!

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This hotel is centrally located, although very expensive. Checking in was a bit long and laborious; further frustration was endured when collecting the keys when the room was ready, because we were registered incorrectly. Reception staff could be more welcoming; that being said, they did have a great deal of people to attend to and we did receive an apology from the very gracious manager for the inconvenience caused. The room was modern with good facilities, i.e. large bath, walk in shower and separate loo. Beds were unbelievably luxurious, with crisp white linen. Our room slept three and was spacious. We had a drink in the bar area, which was quiet on the inside and busier outside. Again bar staff could have been more welcoming and attentive. The champagne breakfast was exceptional, all the staff in the restaurant were brilliant, friendly, welcoming and attentive, which is what one would expect from this high class hotel. The food was phenomenal and the choice was over whelming in a good way. There were several areas of food, including smoothie bar, cereals, fruit, bread, cakes, hot food and omelettes freshly cooked to order (see pictures) to perfection. It was such a pleasure to have this experience whilst staying in Amsterdam.
title: Best Champagne Breakfast I have ever had!

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Can highly recommend this Hotel. Senem at front desk is such an asset to this pristine hotel: professional, helpful, friendly this is customer care at its best! Rooms fantastic. Restaurant thumbs up.!
title: Excellent Hotel

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Perfect place, center of the city. Rooms are very good. Clean. Internet is very good. Bathtoom is so good. Friendly personel. Everything is so good. We will prefer again to stay in this hotel. Near everywhere
title: Perfect

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: I really would like to thank mr frans ( the lobby cafe man ) for his professional service and his kindness with us. In general, the service is great and we had a great experience with NH Collection. Thank you
title: Excellent experience

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: I really likes this hotel, the rooms were confortable, the breakfast is unbelievable.There is something i really didn't appreciate, the lady at the check in counter wanted a deposit of 100€.The problem is that my card is expired and she wanted it in cash. I was on a duty trip for 24h, i paid the room 176€, and i mentionned that i will not use the mini bar, or any other service.I had only 120€ left for diner and taxis, but she absolutely wanted the deposit of 100€ (she clearly made me feel that i have to pay or get out)So i had no choice, i made the deposit and had 20€ left for 24h.It was a very bad experience and i think that this hotel should review its policy, because this deposit thing is a bit stupid.I defenetly won't go back to the hotels of NH Group.I se to stay at Hilton, Sheraton, Hyatt and they never require this deposit.
title: Excellent stay

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We arrived at 6 am, they had another room available for the us. Perfect! Flavored water in lobby and coffee too! Room was quiet and beds perfect. Lots of modern touches. Restaurant on site, which has really good food with an innovative touch, huge breakfast buffet in this grand room. Center of everything in the beautiful city of Amsterdam
title: Nice hotel

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: A wonderful experience staying at the Krasnapolsky on the Dam in Amsterdam. Close to shops, attractions, trams, trains, etc. Majority of staff are helpful although check in process could be more streamlined and quicker.
title: In the heart of Amsterdam

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We checked I on Monday and the room wasn't ready so we're asked to come back later when we would be upgraded to a premium room free of charge. The room we were given although nice was not a premium room(quite small)Hairdryer wasn't working and after an hour of contacting reception for a replacement had to go down personally to reception to get the issue sorted Housekeeping done at inappropriately times 5pm when you pop back to hotel for shower and change and a knock on door 8.15 in the morning asking to be in to make beds!This is not what I expected from a hotel of this standard
title: Disappointed

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We stayed here on a family trip to Amsterdam. The hotel is situated right in the center of town, 10 minutes walk from Central Station. The main sights, tour boats, many restaurants and shops are all close by, within easy walking distance.The hotel looks a bit old fashioned from the outside, but the lobby and our rooms were all very modern. Our rooms had large, comfortable beds, were well equipped, clean, with modern bathrooms with walk-in showers. We did not try the breakfast, but went to Starbucks nearby instead. Check-in was rather cumbersome and took a long time, we needed to fill in our address again (although they had it from our reservation) and they needed copies of passports for each room. The lady at reception was not particularly friendly, maybe she was just stressed, as she also had to help another less experienced staff.On the day of check-out in the morning the cleaning crew just went into each of our rooms, without knocking, while we were still in the room, in the shower, etc. We found this rather awkward. Surely they could communicate who has checked out and then clean the room?Lastly, the concierge service was very friendly and helpful.In summary, we had a great stay, right in the center of Amsterdam.
title: Great Stay, Some Things to Improve

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This is definitely not a 5star hotel!The only good thing about this hotel is the central location.The room definitely needs some restauration. Some things are just broken in the bathroom.I've stayed in 3star hotels that looked better.Disappointing...
title: Not a 5 star

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We stayed in July to celebrate our thirtieth wedding anniversary . This is our fifth stay and each time we have enjoyed the friendliness and helpfulness of all staff. The hotel is very centrally situated and everywhere we wanted to go was a silly walkable although we did make use of the hop on hop off bus and boat. Our rooms were in the Amsterdam wing where we hav stayed 3 times before and is one of my favourite parts of the hotel. The breakfast room is amazing and the breakfasts themselves are wonderful with an amazing variety of food available. At the end of a busy day, it is great to sit and have a coffee while watching the world go by in Dam Square. This is a really great hotel with great staff.
title: Another great stay at a great hotel

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This is an excellent hotel in the very centre of the city. The level of accommodation, facilities and service provided by the staff is always first class and I would thoroughly recommend staying here. The room I had was exceptionally comfortable with a great shower room and facilities. Everything was spotless and a very comfortable large bed.It is on Dam Square, so everything is close by or within easy walking distance. From the moment of checking in to checking out, nothing was ever too much trouble for the staff who are always so polite and helpful.
title: Excellent hotel with great staff

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: The layout of this hotel is a bit unique with a separate building which is where I stayed.The room that I was in was large/comfortable/ and had all the amenities you could want.Location was great for restaurants and exploring.
title: Comfortable and Modern

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This was a smashing hotel where we spent an enjoyable 3 night break in March. OK we were upgraded but I am sure the luxury level would have been the same. There is nothing to say that is negative, though we chose to take breakfast away from the hotel - there is plenty of choice nearby. Staff were extremely professional yet friendly and helpful. Thoroughly recommended.
title: A LOVELY HOTEL RIGHT IN THE CENTRE OF THE CITY

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: The bistro and white room within the hotel are good restaurants even though the service in the white room restaurant are a little robotic and not much of the human interface as we might expect. The hotel has been renovated and looks good but the business model is muddy. When you pay for a room almost double compared to market rates such as the Amstel Hotel and yet they do not have a business room to work or to print off any documents while there are many meeting rooms within the hotel complex that is a big miss. Furthermore, the current business model is to attract business people but also package deals for group tourism. When I am having breakfast and it comes across as being in a bazar then you wonder, why stay at this hotel at all. When the laundry is not carried out as requested and yet the only reply you get from the staff is; "Sorry for the inconvenience" then this comes across as a hollow statement instead of actually dealing with the issue. When you check out of the hotel, they do not drop the bill in advance in your room to review and sign off, instead, you are forged to stand in the queue between a group of tourists for about 45 min. The evening before check out I was requested to visit the reception because my credit coverage of the bill of Euro 2,743.55 was Euro 50 short. What on earth are these people thinking. My last "tango" at the Krasnapolsky, definitely overrated.
title: Not worth the price you have to pay

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We chose this hotel for its location, which is perfect for sightseeing and in an historic location. However, above and beyond its location is the overall package: excellent rooms, excellent service and the friendliest hotel staff in Amsterdam. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
title: Perfect Location

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We stayed here from 15/07/17 to 17/07/17. This my second trip to this hotel and I think it will be my last. We booked a family room but were offered an apartment instead. This is by no means a five star apartment, 3* at best. Long black hairs everywhere, worn covering on bedroom chairs , in need of a proper paint job , cups taken out of room and not replaced and to cap it off flea bites. I have stayed in the Park Plaza a few times and love that 4* hotel but couldn't get booked in so went to the grand as I won't go lower than 4*. It's an ok hotel but the only thing that is 5* is the price of breakfast. Park Plaza for me
title: Weekend break

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This hotel is so central, situated in dam square!!On arrival you are met by well dressed doorman, then extremely well mannered reception staff, check in was quick and easy, small issue with €200 being deducted from our credit card with no explanation, when we questioned this reception apologised for not informing is it was for any incidentals?!Rooms are located via numerous elevators, our room was located on the 4th floor via elevator 7. Lobby is dimly lit which possibly hides a multitude of issues one we noticed was carpet was quite worn and could cause someone an injury.The room itself has brown flooring and white cubed furniture, massive bed which was really comfortable however the pillows were way too softBathroom was a glass cube style with everything you required during your stay, toiletries were replenished every day, we are both in our late 40's but getting in and out of the shower was quite hazardous, bath tub is really high no hand rails for getting in and out, something the hotel should look at for elderly visitors We didn't eat in the hotel during our stay but had some drinks in the lobby bar it was well priced Overall we had a brilliant stay here and would most definitely go back if visiting Amsterdam again
title: First time in amsterl

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: You cant be more central than this - right on Dam Square. Very nice older hotel but all latest amenities you would expect. Our rooms were excellent - spacious and quiet. The staff here were amazing - when was the last time someone showed you to your room when you didn't ask for help? Concierge was also one of the best i have ever used - very helpful and went the extra mile. Breakfast was excellent in a very impressive room that is a listed building. Restaurant looked great but we didn't have the time to eat there. Overall an excellent value for money and a hotel with some real character.
title: Excellent hotel in a great location

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Very convenience locationEasy to get there from the airport and very convenience to travel to different sightseeing locations Staff very helpful and knows the landmarks very wellLots of good restaurants inside and around the hotel
title: Recommended Hotel

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Spent 2 nights with my wife and friends last week to celebrate 50th birthdays and had a great time. The hotel is beautiful and all employees from check in to bar staff are exceptional. Also a huge thank you for the complimentary upgrade which was a lovely touch. Superb.
title: Perfect

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We stayed one week and what we liked best was the courtesy, friendliness and unfailing helpfulness of all staff we encountered. Nice room with huge bed and an ample supply of all bathroom requirements .Room décor was a little dull - grey and brown. It was especially pleasing to find that as well as very efficient air conditioning (that could be turned off) there was a window that opened. Ahappy week's stay.
title: Cool efficiency with a smile

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: From the entrance, the doorman, the Front Desk, warm welcome from Danielle, she gave us a beautiful room 3003, we love it, clean and quiet and comfortable bed. The amazing staff when we have our buffet breakfast, Rosanna, Marilen, Aida, Hazel, Jocelyn, and Maureen, always smiling.They made sure we are taken care of. We stayed for three nights and always the same fabulous experience.
title: Our Third Time Stay and will always come back

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This hotel hotel in in a very good location right on dam square. The staff are always very helpful. I don't like to give the hotel a bad review as this is not the first time we have stayed there, but this time we were slightly disappointed. We decided to give the cafe/ restaurant a try and was surprised that for a five star hotel we were informed that there was no chicken on the menu you as they forgot to order and also no salad. Come on given that amsterdam has so many shops you would think that they could go and buy some salad, so did not try the restaurant. The room was very nice, however this time was in the new part and overlooked the street below, very noisy until the early hours.
title: Great location

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This hotel is a great starting point to discover all different options Amsterdam offers. Be it culture, exotic food, boots trip or a tour through the famous red light district.The reception area is typically busy and sounds like a main station. Personal can be nice, if they want to. Rooms big enough, breakfast is good.The right place if you do not want to relax but experience Amsterdam.
title: Location in the heart of Amsterdam

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: I spent 3 nights in the NH Krasnapolsky and I can definitely recommend this hotel. First and foremost the service was amazing, the staff were on top of things and very helpful.The Hotel location is right on the Dam square, so you are literally in the middle of Amsterdam, with a lot to do. For those of you who will come by train from the airport, it is a 10 minute walk at most from the train station.The decor was clean and well maintained, the hotel breakfast was wonderful as well with many choices to choose from. For those of you who are into hotel gyms, this hotel does NOT have a gym, they used to but after renovations they opted to remove the gym. What they have done to compensate is to allow guest to use the gym at other NH hotels - the closest one was a 5 minute walk.One of the nicest aspects of the NH (other than the location) was the bar as it was run very professionally and had a very large drinks menu, so definitely a must if you want a nice cocktail prior to an evening out on the town.The room I stayed in was a bit small, but being in the center of Amsterdam that was expected, the bed was very comfortable and it was very quiet at night, so one could get a great night's sleep.All in all, I would definitely recommend staying here, especially if you want to be in the center of the city, you will not regret it.
title: Great hotel, great service and amazing location!

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in July this year The hotel kindly upgraded us as it was a break to celebrate my 50th birthday. Hotel is great, excellent location in Dam square so easy walk to everywhere. Cocktails and service in the hotel's bar were excellent. Breakfast was full of choice in a beautiful room (picture attached). We took the train from the airport to the centre and it was a 10/15 min walk from the train station to the hotel.
title: Excellent!

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: + Hotel is located directly on the Dam square, + An easy 10 minutes walking to Amsterdam Central+ Rooms are very clean, spacious+ Breakfast garden was wonderful and choices are endless+ location location+ staff very co-operative
title: Fabulous

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We booked 2 rooms for 2 nights here, arriving exhausted at mid day after an overseas/overnight flight.We arrived at mid-day and found that the rooms were not ready (not unexpected). However, when we asked if someone could contact us (via text, email or a call) to advise us when we could check in we were told "Sorry the hotel is too busy", come back at 3 pm.When we asked at the concierge desk for restaurant recommendations, they again were useless. We ultimately found a great restaurant 3 minutes from the hotel using Trip Advisor!Not sure if the issues were due to inexperienced staffing, but we were very disappointed with the service received considering the cost of the rooms.The hotel is perfectly situated for visiting Amsterdam, so maybe at a quieter time of the year the service might be more personalized.
title: Nice but service not up to price

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: There is nothing negative to say. The rooms are very modern, clean, and well-appointed. We were lucky enough to get a free upgrade to a larger room that had a sofa bed in it, so kudos to the front staff. Free breakfast was exquisite--lots of variety, fresh, and tasty. And finally, this hotel is located near ALL the action. You cannot beat the location. Overall, recommended. Ideal for businesspeople, but suitable to families and couples as well.
title: Excellent location and property

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: This is a very nice hotel in the price epicenter of Amsterdam. We relocated here from another hotel so we could be in the center of the City. A relative value compared to other US style hotels at the same week we traveled. Only thing holding back 5/5 rating was internet app for booking simply did not work once on phone in Europe. Had we not physically walked into hotel we could not have booked. Once inside, people were very friendly, but check in desk was very disorganized. No clear lines lead to people cutting ahead of one another at busy check-in time. Not a huge issue, but something we did not expexect at a luxury hotel. Still highly recommend it.
title: Family Trip

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We stayed at the Hotel NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky, for 5 nights during August 2017. Received a room upgrade, as this was a birthday celebration mini-break. We're not too sure what we were being upgraded from, as our room seemed like a standard, run-of-the-mill double.The bed was large and comfortable with good quality linen. Bathroom was adequate, but with a small single sink with hardly any room around it for toiletries, so they had to stay in our wash bags.Our first night wasn't too bad. The outside temperature was around 10 degrees, so we didn't notice that the air conditioning, although blowing, wasn't working. We then realised that we both were being bitten by mosquitoes! We travel Africa extensively, and are only too familiar with this annoying creature. Despite our complaint to housekeeping, the issue wasn't resolved. The following nights, the outside temperature increased, the air conditioning still wasn't working and we again were bitten all through the night. Our suspicion is, that they are getting through the air-con system, and being blown into the room, as our window was kept closed for the duration. Amsterdam, does have a seasonal issue with mosquitoes, because of the canals & mild temperatures, so if you are thinking of a visit - bare that in mind!Hotel location was 1st class, being very central. Breakfast was also 1st class, with a Hugh selection.
title: Great location but in need of some TLC

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: We absolutely loved our stay at the NH collection! The hotel was beautiful, super clean, and in an incredible location. It was so easy to get anywhere in Amsterdam quickly. Each night, the hotel did turn down and left a little chocolate on our pillow. I know they can not guarantee this, but my husband and I arrived SUPER early from an overnight flight from the US, and they were able to get us a room as soon as we arrived which was such a great perk. They were so accommodating and professional. Highly Highly recommend this hotel!
title: Incredible hotel in the heart of Amsterdam!

hotelName: NH Collection Amsterdam Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky
review: I have to admit that i tried like crazy to cancel our reservation here at the last minute. We had a devastating health diagnosis, and the hotel , which was pre-paid refused to give us a refund. That said, we decided to go on our trip after all. I have never been more impressed with a hotel or it"s staff like I was with this one.The location was perfect and I will never forget the kindness the staff showed me when I became ill. I had an infected spider bite.The staff arranged for a Dr. to come to the hotel, they sent me a tray with fresh fruit, tea and a get well soon card. They even had housekeeping change my bed all within a 30 minute span of calling the front desk. I was so ill that the lady from house keeping was changing my pillows as I was crawling back into my bed. I remember her lifting my head and "fluffing them until they were perfect". They sent us dinner via room service at no charge. Never have I felt so pampered and taken care of. I am ever so thankful for the kindness they showed me. This is a perfect place to stay in the heart of Amsterdam! 5 stars all the way!
title: Wow. Just wow.

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great place specially the staff and the room size our room was over looking the river. The location was great as well handy to everything amsterdam got to offer. The room service was great as well i highly recommend it
title: Great place

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel was ok for our one night stay in Amsterdam. Quite expensive compared to others we have stayed in with better service, but still very pleasant. Room wasn't very disabled friendly, but we managed.
title: OK FOR OUR ONE NIGHT STAY

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great Service from Check in to check out. Hotel personnel were very friendly, professional and helpful. Excellent breakfast set us up for the day and late breakfast til 12 on Sunday with free late checkout (til 3pm think) on a Sunday were a real bonus on a short weekend break. Very convenient to Centraal Station and hassle free to get train from Schipol to Centaal Station and a short walk to hotel. Very close to all the sights. Many sights within short walking distance, and convenient to trams, boat tours and hop-on-hop-off boat (great way to get around). Selection of nice Restaurants and bars very nearby.We had a great weekend in a great city and the Brabizon Palace was an excellent base to enjoy the city from. Intend to stay again if (when!) we return to Amsterdam
title: Amsterdam Weekend

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: In cities like Amsterdam, its about location and to have a nice hotel in the center of it all. NH Collection Barbizon fits that bill. Pros- - Close to Amsterdam Centraal, and rental car areas (ie.. we did a day trip to Zaandam and Zaans Schans by just walking to the train station and taking a 7euro train instead of spending 110 euro on a tour) - near all the historic sites, and main squares and restaurants - laundromat right near by - plenty of restaurants for breakfast near by to not need hotel breakfast - great service and conciergeCons:- wifi didn't work with our macbook computers in our room on 2nd floor - noise at night...you are right in the center of party town with 3 am crowd hanging out right in front of your room if you are facing the canal side and have your window open.
title: Expensive, but paying for location....

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: very good hotel- very good location near to center. breakfast is expensive but very good. the room is nice.very close to the train station.the taxi service from the hotel is more expensuve its look like the take comissin
title: VERY GOOD

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is fab! I stayed here a few times before the renovation and also after. It was old and dated before but I still loved it. Location is perfect. Now that it's been renovated it is fantastic! Great customer service. Good value for money. A peaceful hotel with a wonderfully relaxing environment. I would recommend anyone to go. I've stayed in A few hotels in Amsterdam central and this one is my favourite.
title: Love it!

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very convenient location near the Central Train station with excellent connectivity with trams, buses and boats. Hotel was quite good with clean rooms and helpful staff. Breakfast was very good. Prices can be described as entry luxury level
title: Good Hotel

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Nice staff and lovely rooms, great breakfast, the reception staff Bart was very good, spacious room, little noise but only cuz of the parade and music which we loved, i would def go there againIt is a beautiful city
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very comfortable and well located. The view to central station from our room was amazing. We stayed 4 nights. The staff is friendly and efficient. The breakfast was very good, with special mention to Marco.
title: Best stay in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Lovely stay in Amsterdam at this hotel but did not know about the tax due at the end of our stay. About 35 euros per room. Hotel is in great location with interesting districts in walking distance. Staff are obliging, bit stingy on the complimentary tea/coffee
title: Beware the government tax

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel was a good choice for the price, great expansive breakfast buffet and central location. If you have a car it is definitely a nightmare to navigate the alley to arrive and depart each day. The room was large by EU standards. There is small quaint bar in the lobby but your are in Amsterdam where pubs and cafes are in abundance, I'd recommend venturing out. The location in proximity to the sights is top notch, less than 15 minutes to Dam Square, Redlight District and tons of shopping and dinning.
title: Clean Rooms and Convenient Location

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: king bed is large and comfortable as is the rest of the standard room. I especially like the Rain Shower head. There are hotel bikes for rent if you are confident in the confusing lanes and alleys of Amsterdam.
title: Luxury and Class next to St Nicholas Church across from the Centraal station

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here on business for a few nights. had requested a quiet room although this probably isnt too easy with this hotel. Dont expect a quiet room, there is noise throughout most the night from the surrounding streets. Agreed there isnt much that can be done about this other than better windows but it is possible.Otherwise the hotel was nice enough. Good sized room on 3rd floor. Very comfy bed, well equipped modern bathroom with a great shower.The gym is nothing special, 3 treadmills, 2 cross trainers, 2 bikes a couple of benches and a multi station machine, some good dumbell free weights.Breakfast was good, nice selection of everything you could want and you could make requests for the kitchen to cook something fresh.Checkout was a lengthy process mainly because somebody checking in was complaining about the building work which then left the reception un-manned for about 10 minutes while we waited for this issue to be resolved.All in all the location of the hotel was good while i was here on business it allowed me to explore Amsterdam when i wasnt working.I'd probably return.
title: Good location but extremely noisy

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Well appointed room and large bathroom with walk-in shower. Excellent location within walking distance of the major attractions. Breakfast buffet was included and outstanding. Staff were very accommodating and friendly. Room was very quiet at night
title: Two night stay.

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Polite, friendly and efficient reception staff. Complimentary fruit infused water drinks and fresh fruits in reception area was much appreciated in the warm weather.Spacious, quiet and extremely clean room 514. The bed and mattress was firm and very comfortable. We did not eat in so cant comment on the restaurants.Free Wifi and air con work well
title: Handy for the rail station

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel central to everything. very friendly staff and an huge breakfast buffet. Room was clean, neat and very well appointed. Can't wait to return once they have finished remodeling of the restaurant. Excellent service in the bar
title: Weekend Trip

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The premium room was a great upgrade. We faced the canal and was in the heart of it all. The king bed was clean and comfortable. The shower was either a rain or spray handle. Pressure was great. Towels were soft and luxuries. The hotel was quiet and inviting
title: Great Hotel in The Heart of it All

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Reasonably nice hotel but very expensive for what you get. Pretty nice rooms but very small (single occupancy rooms have a single bed). Parking and breakfast very expensive. Very good location if you want the centre of Amsterdam. If you want to escape the chaos and noise get a hotel a bit further out.
title: Just ok

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We really loved this hotel for all the right reasons. The location was excellent for walking to all the tourist attractions, the front desk was knowledgeable and friendly , the room was good size for two travelers with lots of luggage, and the morning buffet breakfast was outstanding with way too much food to sample everything. The fruit selection consisted of so many varieties that everyone should be able to find something they like. It was all so very healthy except for all the cold-cut processed meats which one did not have to take since there were so many other healthier choices. The staff were all very helpful when needed.The Vantage tour group concierge and guide was remarkable.
title: Great Amsterdam hotel

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is very close to the main train station in Amsterdam, very conveniently located, there is no parking but there are two very close, I recommend the center "Oosterdok" which is cheaper than the train station . Lovely hotel, very well decorated, very friendly and helpful staff. The room was very spacious and bright, the bedding was perfect and the bathroom very nice and clean. The Nespresso coffee machine available for free is a plus.The free WIFI connection works very well.The price is a bit high but in Amsterdam for a quality hotel be aware that you have to pay the price.
title: Nice hotel in the center of Amsterdam (near the train station)

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Fantastic stay as usual and the breakfast is just amazing. Perfect location, confortable beds etc. Do not miss the restaurant, the Vermeer, which is classified in the Michelin and really deserve 1 star at least.
title: Great !

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is in a good location close to the main Centraal Station and very convenient for traveling to and from Schiphol Airport or to other Europe countries. Although the rooms were well presented and a good size we were very disappointed with the old cigarrette smells that was present in the non-smoking room. The second disappointment was the noise factor that filtered into the rooms from the canal and adjacent street.Rooms facing the canal and street is to be avoided until NH Hotels install double glazed windows.There are many good restaurants and bars nearby. There are many sights within a short walking distance from the hotel including canal boat tours, hop-on-hop-off, museums and shopping.
title: Darryl and Vannice

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Recommend this hotel if you are using the rail system as it is right opposite the station. The rooms and hotel are wonderful and the staff are very obliging. Drinks in the lounge area were reasonable and all in all a great stay!!!
title: A night in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We and my fiancé recently stayed at this hotel for one night during a trip to Amsterdam .It's very central opposite central station in a ideal location to explore .The hotel has been recently refurbished to a lovely standard we stayed in a superior room on the first floor , lovely and cool as it was extremely warm whilst we were there , very comfy bed & lovely extras like slippers robes and toiletries .We would most definitely book this hotel when returning to Amsterdam in the future :)
title: Lovely room nicely refurbished

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Hotel check in was less than efficient - check in time was 1500 hrs our group of four arrived at 1530 and our room was not ready - it was as if we were not expected - however the room we eventually were allocated was fine. The hotel was centrally located and perfect for a visit to Amsterdam. I would definitely recommend this hotel - but do not purchase the breakfast which is way overpriced - we found a lovely cafe across the road at half the price.
title: First visit to Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Amazing hotel! I would definitely go there again! The price is not too bad and everything is really near by the hotel. The hotel has great facilities and the staff are all very friendly. They also gave us complimentary drinks on the house! Thanks! I would highly recommend this hotel
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I highly recommend this hotel. The place is spotlessly clean. Rooms are in good conditions. The bed was especially comfortable to sleep on, and the bed sheets were nice and cozy. Service was friendly and effective. Breakfast was really good. Location is convinient, just outside the main train station (Amsterdam Central). this makes it easy to get in from the airport (by train) and back. The hotel is right on the edge of the Red-Light District. I usually prefer to stay more south in the city, but there were many advantages to this location. We were a group of three couples who stayed at this hotel in late July. Checked in on a Thursday late morning. and Checked out on Sunday (check out time is 3pm by default, which is really nice because we had an evening flight out). The rooms were not ready when we checked in, but were made available as we got closer to 3pm. The suitcases were stored in the storage. This whole process was handled very nicely, even though we were not easy customers, repeatadly remembering that we've left things in the suitacses that we wanted to retrieve. We received two rooms on the 4'th floor: one facing the canal and the other facing the inner court. The room facing the canal had stairs in the room (which is a little strange). We also received a room on the 1'st floor.The room were very quiet and sleep quality was very good. There is quality tea and coffee in the room. The shower is wonderful. The towels are very nice. Two robes with slippers. There is a safe in the room. And the lighting is good.We had one incident where one of the couples had an issue with room cleaning, which was done rather late in the day, but they were compensated to their satisfaction in return for this problem. Serive at breakfast varied between excellant and good. The food was of the highest quality and variety all three mornings.
title: 3 nights over the weekend in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed there for three nights on a room only board. The room we got was a good size and overlooked one of the many canals. Right outside the window were bars and restaurants , but we really can't complain about the noise. Yes there are late night revellers but that will happen in any busy city. The room itself was very clean and well presented and a good sized walk in shower. Mini bar in the room with not the cheapest prices but well stocked. We didn't use any of the hotels facilities because we got up in the morning and got back at night. The staff were very friendly and helpful ( As were all the local people we spoke to) The hotel is a 5 star and not the cheapest but this was a "special" birthday so we splashed out a little more. The hotel is in a great location for bars, restaurants, cafe's etc, but probably even better is it's only a few minute walking from Central train station. If you want to see Amsterdam and treat yourself then this is the hotel for you. Would I go back. Yes.
title: Fantastic Location

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Perfect stay. Nice hotel, clean room, friendly staff and great buffet breakfast with healthy selections. Good location. 10 minutes walk to Central station. A lot of nearby restaurant choices in walking distance.
title: Great location, room and breakfast!

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I was staying at this nice hotel 5 nights, I can explain how's the location great. It is in the heart of Amsterdam you can get shops, bars, clubs, restaurants, cafes… etc. The hotel staff wonderful people welcoming and skilled with good communication. The room which I selected was superior it's really big and comfortable, the cleaning level is great. The negative things, the room dining services not available each time and don't have enough options. The lobby bar is dead and the breakfast not includes hot courses like omelet. I recommend to stay again at this hotel though
title: Grand location

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: NH hôtel is wonderful , location close to central station and the center of Amsterdam, friendly and professional people, the room are confortable and very pretty , i Will come back with great pleasure for sure
title: Perfect place to stzy

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Only great things to say about this place. Great location. Renovated hotel in the heart of the city. Rooms were excellent and very modern. Service was superb. Breakfast - WOW - best one in Europe on this adventure. Are room had a direct view of a busy canal.
title: Grand hotel - well located

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 59-72, 1012 AD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel was very clean and beautifully decorated. The breakfast buffet was the best I've had of any hotel stay. The location is close to everything in the city center, so it was easy to walk around and enjoy the local shops and restaurants.
title: Wonderful hotel

review: Excellent staff who made our stay very memorable. We received a very warm welcome. Everyone gave Help and assistance and we thought our room was lovely - actually all the common areas were gorgeous. Highly recommend this hotel for service and its location.
title: Excellent.

review: Second time that we have stayed here. Excellent service, individually decorated and extremely spacious rooms, very central and within close walking distance of museum quarter and Nine Streets. Staff couldn't be more helpful. Elderly parents had to take care with steep steps but certainly manageable. Thoroughly recommend.
title: perfect small hotel in Amsterdam

review: What a great hotel in a fab location. Lots of road works going on all around but that really can't be helped. We arrived to a free room upgrade to a junior suite, no idea why but it was a big clean spacious room so who were we to argue. The bed was huge as was the bathroom. The hotel is situated in a great location, a short walk to all the museums and not too far (25mins) walk to Anne Franks House, which was a pleasant walk along the canals. Hotel staff were really helpful and very informative... Would definitely stay here again
title: Brilliant location

review: It was our wedding anniversary so I asked for a room with a view and the Hotel delivered! I ordered flowers for the room and they were lovely too, however their house champagne was very expensive! Room itself was again lovely and very clean, could have been more tea bags in the refreshment pack - we had to ask for more from reception. Hotel staff were very polite, efficient andhelpful and I would definitely recommend this Hotel to travelling couples/business.
title: First Visit to Amsterdam

review: The reception were helpful but the room service didn't answer at all the house keeping stole our things when we said that to the reception they did nothing the breakfast was horrible unclean the lift alawys broke down
title: The staff were totally careless and unhelpful

review: Pros(1) Location is markable, it's near by everything i.e. restaurants, bars and transportation ... (2) front desk team are great , super easy processes for checking in and out (3) price valueCons (1) Main hotel Doors are closed at late night, you need to have short chat to come on (2) Bathroom was so small however it's practical for me since
title: Practical option at competitive price

review: This hotel has a great location, fantastic food in the hotel (breakfast was amazing!), and a super staff. Overlooking a canal, you just cant go wrong. When I return, this will be my first choice. It was a dream stay.
title: A dream hotel!

review: Stayed for two nights for my Fiancé's birthday. The hotel is absolutely beautiful. Staff were very helpful. We had breakfast booked for one morning which was delicious with unlimited sparkling wine - completely worth it, when booked in advance only £15 euro pp. We will definitely stay here again, recommend to anyone !!!
title: Won't stay anywhere else

review: We are staying along with eight other friends all of whom have far better rooms for the same price. We can barely swing the proverbial cat and overlook a very unexciting service area. To add insult to injury we hear the plumbing from above us as it whooshes past our bed. Not worth the money. Avoid room 106
title: Great location but room very disappointing and inconsistent for price

review: We chose this hotel because of location and price. We were completely pleased. Gorgeous hotel, beautiful fountain out front, great multi-lingual staff, and close to everything. Would definitely stay again.
title: Great spot in Amsterdam

review: In general the hotel was good, but there are two important things that any one will book Hampshire hotel must know which is First, the house keeping took my towel my personal towel it is not about my towel I can get new one but it is about the house keeping service they should not do that, if it was by mistake they should be careful very careful Second, the hotel does not have insulators at all so, sleeping in peace is Mission Impossible because of the noises that surrounding you I couldn't sleep I was in room number 203 second floor.
title: My experience at Hampshire hotel

review: This hotel was part of a package with plane fare. I actually figured that if we didn't like it that we would use it as a base to travel from. That ALL changed immediately! Excellent staff from the get go. Wonderful room overlooking canal AND super close to museum district.We loved having everything in walking distance. The café and restaurant were great.The most memorable parts were the people who make this hotel run. I can't say enough good things about them. (Hello to Mr. Rose in the Café!). Thank you ALL so much for a perfect week.
title: Perfect Location

review: We have travelled to many cities around the world and stayed in many hotels but this has the most comfortable beds and pillows ever!!! The staff were were so helpful, especially the blonde lady in the cocktail bar, my wife and l thought her customer service was second to none, a brillent stay. Ian & Tina.
title: Best beds

review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hampshire Hotel. The staff were friendly and all of our queries and requests for assistance were dealt with promptly and efficiently. We were disappointed on our first night to find ourselves in a room which overlooked a ventilation shaft. In addition, someone banged on our door in the middle of the night. When we told reception they moved us to a lovely room, overlooking a canal, and gave us a free complementary breakfast. The rest of our stay was perfect. The hotel is ideally situated for the city and transport to the airport. Everything is clean and well cared for. We would recommend the hotel as pleasant and good value for money (Amsterdam is not cheap!)
title: Great service, friendly staff

review: If you've read my reviews, you'll know that I like this hotel with it's up and down stairwells, good business center, close to everything and within the city center. Vondelpark is very close and museums and other fun is right outside your door. Get a balcony and enjoy the sounds of Leidseplein. The hotel has a great restaurant attached and is surrounded by plenty of others. Anything you need is close to this hotel. Rent a bike (I like "Mike's Bikes" on Kerkstraat) and extend your range.
title: Back again

review: This is my third visit to this lovely and peaceful hotel, where staff is looking to serve you in the most possible way they can, they advice on the most interesting spots you can spend time and where you can go for dining, Ken and Dave are 2 figures from the staff that I will value their help.
title: Third visit to this hotel and looking to repeat it.

review: Everything was perfect even for a guest like me who isn't exactly one of the regulars you would find in these kind of hotels. The service was excellent and the staff was friendly and professional. I wasn't impressed with the cleaning of my room, when I came back I found a used towel still on the floor, some bits of paper from the breakfast that morning and some other minor details that was unfortunately overlooked. Other than that everything was perfect and I certainly hope to come back again.
title: Quiet and luxurious hotel

review: Although this hotel is in the hub of the canabis smokers, it is so central to stay in Amsterdam! Fantastic breakfast! Nice room with a perfect bed! My room on the 5th floor was so quiet and curtains to block out light! One could get a good nights sleep! Service was very good!
title: Location location location

review: Excellent hotel in a good location, from there it's very easy to reach all the most important sites to visit. We had a nice room overlooking Leidseplein, with a very comfortable king size bed. A plentiful continental breakfast is decidedly good but not included. The personnel is kind and helpful.On the whole a very good impression, but definitely it's not inexpensive
title: A nice weekend in Amsterdam

review: We stayed at the Hampshire which is in the heart of the Leidseplein. The reception staff were very friendly and speak fluent English like most Dutch people. Our room was comfortable but not expansive however had everything we needed. Pillows can be requested to suit. The restaurant was beautiful and food very good. Prices were similar to 4 star hotels and would recommend!
title: Beautiful Art Deco Hotel

review: This is a nice hotel located close to rwstaurants and shops and some turist attractios. The streets in front the hotel are under construction what made it, what made it noisy, dirty and more difficult to get in ans out the hotel. The rooms are confortable. The service is just ok..not Worth the money. Our party had people with morw than 75 years old ans they had to carry their luggage upstairs... there was a doorman and he saia it was too much for him to carry.. and we had noticed few weeks before our arrival about our party and their age... when we left our transfer driver had to help with our luggage downstairs because the hotel didn't have staff to help although they had promissed the day before they would have enough staff to help us. I made a local call ans they chargwd me more than US $ 60,00!!!
title: Well located

review: Thank you Amsterdam American for another wonderful stay. If you want history and art deco architecture, this is the hotel for you. I'm sure that Amsterdam has many wonderful hotels, but we are devoted fans of the Amsterdam American. The staff is courteous and always helpful. The bartenders in Bar American are exceptional. Shout out to all of them, especially Sara. The location can't be beat. Walking distance to the major museums & Vondel Park. The 1,2,5,7 & 10 trams are right outside the front door. The 197 bus to the airport is steps away too & costs 5 euro.The only minor complaint, is that our room (room 116), is directly over the booth for the canal trip. A few times it got a bit noisy in the morning. However, the room is worth this minor inconvenience.I can't wait to go back to Amsterdam & we will be staying at the American again!
title: Another Perfect Stay

review: We spent 3 nights at the American Hotel in Amsterdam in late July. It is a very nice facility in an excellent location! It looks a bit out of the way on a map, but it takes only about 20 minutes to walk to Dam Square (assuming you don't stop in the shops along the way), about 5 to the museum district, canal boats are right there, and restaurants are plentiful near the hotel....even a Starbucks & Dunkin Donuts for those who must have American stuff! Our room was pleasant and no street noise. Felt safe to walk all around. Would definitely stay again! Staff very helpful!
title: Great location....Great stay!

review: I'd recommend this hotel to anyone, and the restaurant/bar is well worth the trip. The food is delicious, as are the cocktails. I would suggest trying the bulletproof cocktail. Room service was of high quality and the bed was so comfortable. A very central location, the hotel is situated within walking distance of just about all major attractions.
title: Excellent stay, very friendly staff.

review: I have stayed at this hotel for business two times now - and I keep coming back! The staff is very attentive - and if you have the good fortune to meet Carlos for the breakfast buffet, he will take VERY good care of you! In fact, that is one of the reasons I returned! Carlos made me feel right at home with his friendly and caring demeanor! The location is central to everything (and easy walking distance to everything) - but it can be quite loud (because the Bulldog is right across the street). They upgraded my room (for free) and it faced the canal. Very nice, but quite loud.
title: Great staff! Great Location!

review: Our first time in Amsterdam, so we had a bit of trouble finding this place after taking bus 197 in from Schipol. We found another Hampshire Hotel, who gave us directions. They assumed we were in a car, so the directions made us circle the block. Sidewalks and streets around this hotel were under construction, so access pulling luggage was a bit challenging, but we soon got used to it.Well situated, close to canal cruises (out front door) restaurants, shopping and transit. We were disappointed our room only had a view of an inner courtyard, until we realized this meant the room would be quiet. It was and with the comfortable bed, sleeps were good. Maid service was a bit slow on the first day, due to a large number of checkouts, but improved on the next two nights. Desk staff were friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. We would stay here again.
title: Quiet Comfortable Rooms

review: The Hotel Américain as it was once known is a Grand ol Dam! Beautifully appointed, our room had a balcony that overlooked a canal. Within easy walking distance of many restaurants and shops, not to mention the beautiful canals! Loved the attention to detail the staff provided. And the hotel bar is a wonderful surprise!!
title: Old World Elegance

review: Nice hotel...good service... comfortable beds. Very centrally located to many attractions in Amsterdam.Also within walking distance of many. We are seniors and it was a perfect spot for us. We recommend it and would stay there again.
title: good spot to see Amsterdam.

review: This hotel has been around for about 100 years. Art Deco design elements, bedroom deco reminiscent of that era too, but still comfortable. Clean, friendly helpful staff, right on a tram link to the main station, near a bus link to the airport, near the museum quarter and next to a canal with hop on hop off boats. Hotel recommended excellent local restaurants and we're very helpful about public transport options. It's a big hotel so could feel a little large and impersonal for some.
title: Art Deco dream

review: I have stayed at the Hampshire American Hotel many times and the hotel is always wonderful. This goes for the staff from the front desk to the bar. The room was very nice and clean . The location of the hotel is another plus.
title: Great Stay

review: Returned here in July after visiting last October. Love the hotel and the location is great to visit all the great local restaurants and bars. Loved sitting outside watching the world go by. Will definitely be going back
title: Wedding anniversary

review: Very nice hotel. Clean, quiet, great location. The room was great, the bed was incredibly comfortable. The service is top notch! The dining room and bar are beautiful. Breakfast buffet was very good. On canal, with beautiful fountain in the front.
title: Hampshire Hotel - Amsterdam American

review: Hotel is well maintained, trams stop in around the corner and can take you anywhere in the city. Museum quarter is walking distance. Plenty of restaurants around the hotel.Front Desk people are friendly and will help with any questions you may have.
title: Good hotel

review: I really enjoyed food quality provided in room, very delicious and well made. But the menu is short and you have few choices specially for vegetarians. Staff were friendly. One negative comment is that i have requested to remove mini bar in room multiple times but they don't response. Also, the room ground is made from wood and when you walk in room you hear some sound from wooden ground. The breakfast restaurant close early about 10:30 am and this let us miss breakfast. Left is small for child trolly. concierge Very friendly.
title: Good location and food

review: Amsterdam is such a wonderful city, and my stay at this hotel only added to the amazing experience I had while I was there. The hotel is centrally located (from walking-distance to the museum square), and yet in a quiet little street just by one of the canals. Comfortable room, and they offer free bikes! Perfect for Amsterdam!!
title: Great place to stay! Location, comfort, service all good. I fully recommend!
