review: i have been staying in HHonor chain for so long, but never come across such a poor hotel.- un-professional reception service- The entire hotel runs by 3 people- Breakfast very limited and has no varieties - no in room food service - Toilets door doesn't close( wrong design)- No early check in, as the cleaning service seems to be out sourced and only start at 12pm so even though the rooms were available when i arrived, they had no one to clean it.- if you are HHonor member don't ever think that you will get a special treatment. - i asked the reception lady if they count my 9 years old son as full person, she respond back saying " do you think he is an animal !!!!" and asked for 40 euro extra.- Rooms and toilets was not clean when I arrived and shower sink was blocked, after i  called the the room service they guy who works at the reception came up to the room and fixed it.- No fridge inside the room- GYM has four machines onlyAs an overall, stay away from this hotel.
title: Worst hotel ever ... Stay away from this hotel.. it has nothing to do with Hilton Quality

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam / Arena Boulevard
review: Myself and three friends took a weekend break to Amsterdam to see the sights and attend a festival. We have had a wonderful stay. The Hampton Hotel has been very accommodating and we were very impressed by their excellent customer service and their facilities. No request went amiss. We forgot to bring hair spray, so a member of the reception staff brought us up some. When one of my friends had a head ache they happily provided us with paracetamol. The cleanliness of the hotel was also faultless. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to return here in the near future.
title: Brilliant weekend stay

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam / Arena Boulevard
review: If staying near the arena this is perfect. If also travelling to the centre, the metro literally is next door.No complaints, internet could have been better in the room but that's not a big issue unless you're on business. They offer a premium service but didn't use it.Shower is good and powerful, aircon is great and beds are comfortable.
title: Clean with friendly staff and no issues.

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam / Arena Boulevard
review: The hotel is out of the centre of Amsterdam but right next to great transport links. The hotel is everything you need for a city tour - comfy and clean room and impressive breakfast. The staff were great.
title: Great hotel

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam / Arena Boulevard
review: Stayed here for 3 nights for my wife's birthday, the location could not be better for the airport & for Amsterdam centre itself.The staff were super friendly & polite, the room was very clean & spacious.Breakfast each day was amazing, such a variety of hot & cold food, ranging from self made waffles to cereal to bacon/sausages etc.The train station is literally on the doorstep yet you don't hear any noise from it. It's 13mins to the airport & 15mins to Amsterdam Centraal.I cannot fault this hotel at all & we will be staying there again!Thank you!
title: Surprise trip

review: This hotel is incredible. It's luxurious and clean, with easy access to the centre however I found the local area better!! Staying here again in July and cannot wait! Staff and rooms amazing, definitely recommend!
title: Top hotel in Dam

review: Loved the hotel! Beautiful room, updated everything. And yes, it's in a good area. However, even with a map - it is very, very difficult to walk around without getting lost! When the concierge tells you it's "right around the corner", have him highlight it on the map!! Here's a view from the room.
title: Beautiful Hotel!

review: Excellent location. Walkable to lots of restaurants and museums and away from the raunchy red light district. The room is adequately sized, but definitely not your typical stateside Marriott decor. The absence of a dresser complicates storage during unpacking. The shower is very good, but the lack of a fan turns the bathroom into a steam room after a shower. The breakfast in the executive lounge is much better than the stateside version. The front desk service is very good
title: Recommended base for Amsterdam

review: Hotel is located in a great area near central Amsterdam. Stayed here for a business trip. Hotel was recently updated. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Took a while to get checked in but the remainder of the stay was fine. Very pricy. Each night had a different rate which was interesting. Breakfast was not included in my rate so I purchased it separately at a discount.
title: Busy hotel but a good location

review: The quality of the staff, the qiality of the rooms and the rest of the hotel is far of other 5 star hotels we have been lived in the last 20 years. It was very old and outdated. We paid 550 Euro for 2 nigths and asked for high floor with view.
title: This is not a 5 star hotel

review: These premises are used by APT for travellers pre/post river cruises. Outside road works were being undertaken and this didn't help when approaching the property, but inside the premises were modern and well maintained. Staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were ample and housekeeping were on their game. We didn't get to use a lot of the amenities within the hotel but they were in keeping with the rest of the property.The property is close to cafes/restaurants/transport - including the hop-on/hop-off bus and canal boats. Trams are close and run straight down to The Old Town/Red Light District and if you're up for it you can walk to most places.Our biggest let down was the breakfast (provided in the cost of our room), while being ample, staff seemed to be stunned by the headlights with the large numbers, and continual turnover of patrons. While we coped with the frustrations it appeared that numerous patrons weren't able to. There was a lack experience/teamwork or maybe just interest. It was for this reason we weren't prepared to try the restaurant.Having said that - if we were coming back, we'd stay here.
title: Stuck on 3rd base

review: We used to stay here several times a year but they recently underwent the worst renovation we have ever experienced. Gone are the wall to wall carpet, the nice large couch and chairs, the nice large desk and lots of space to put our things. Now there is no room for anything! The floors are cold and bare and there is just a tiny round hard rug that doesn't really fit anywhere and is certainly not large enough to use as a stretch area after working out. The absolute worst thing is that they have stuck with their polyester sheets blend, which is suffocating. We always enjoyed staying there and as lifetime platinum elite members we enjoyed the Executive Lounge but Management said there was nothing they could do and they were unwilling to provide us with 100% sheets. It's kind of funny because the attached sheet was next to our bed, pretending to be all about the environment! After one sleepless night there we checked out and were able to check into the Sofitel Grand, which was absolutely wonderful with lots of room for everything and nice 100% cotton bedding. What a relief. We are done with this Marriott, sadly!
title: Used to be our home-away-from home but this property has gone down and we will never stay there again!

review: Stayed 5 nights for wedding anniversary. Perfect location in city. Right on major tram lines so you walk out your day and can head anywhere in town. You are right next to the museum district (Van Gogh and Riiks). Yet you are away from the some of the more crowded, noisier, seedier areas. You are also literally adjacent to the lovely Vondelpark. Beautiful for morning jog and midday stroll. Another street over has all the high end shopping. Hotel itself has excellent bar/lounge/restaurant overlooking the main intersection. Club lounge had outstanding breakfast and dinner, and staff was fantastic. However, gets a bit crowded. Hotel itself was fully modernized, especially rooms which were super clean and contemporary. Beware, beds are very very firm. Elevators a bit tricky with card readers not working so well but everyone managed. Very modern American/business type hotel, and I mean that as a sincere compliment. Will definitely stay here again when we return to Amsterdam.
title: Perfect Location - Typical Marriott Quality and Service

review: Reserved this hotel for parents visiting me from the US and it was a great property. They are accustomed to travelers landing early from international flights so early check in is usually possible for guests with status. Rooms had outlets for American appliances which was interesting and shows they understand their clientele. Will continue to send out of town visitors to this property.
title: Marriott reliability

review: Had a 3 night stay at this recently renovated hotel. Rooms look more modern and new beds ensured a great slumber!We had access to the business lounge where a good spread of foods were made available at breakfast and evening times and with refreshments aplenty throughout the day.Vondel Park is next to the hotel for a good morning run or evening strolls. There's a couple of ferry services that offer canal rides, in front of the hotel across the street. Enjoyed the 1.5 hr ferry ride that took us around the major canal routes.Staff were courteous and helpful especially with suggestions on what to do around the city with updates on most recent tourist highlights.Very clean hotel!There's a tram stop right infront of the hotel.It's a 5 minute walk to the main shopping thoroughfare in Amsterdam.We had walked ALOT in this charming city and each corner has little surprises in store...from the boat lined canals, charming cafes, quirky shops, cheese stores, weekend markets that offered some of the best local foods, major retail outlets and an international array of food outlets and restaurants plus the endless offerings of museum stops. There's always something to do, something to try, something to eat & drink and some scenes to capture in this picturesque city.Location of the hotel was ideal to explore the interesting spread of this city.
title: Good location and nicely renovated!

review: My wife and I stayed at the Marriott for 3 nights in mid-July.The Good----the hotel is excellently located, close to the museum district (10 minute walk) and within easy walking (5 minutes) to trams, restaurants, shopping and canal cruise stop.The Bad----we stayed in an executive junior suite which along with the rest of the hotel was extensively renovated in the past year. The suite was large, but about 20% of the space was wasted on the entrance foyer. The foyer was the only part of the room with good lighting, which was waste since there was nothing in the foyer. The foyer led directly to the bathroom, which had no entrance door. There was one sink. Space was tight. There was a door inside the bathroom, which led into the toilet and shower--also tight space. There was a large king size bed with a mattress that was saggy/sunken in. Opposite the bed was a huge flat screen tv which was great, but could only be seen from the bed and the occasional chairs next to it. There was a large sectional sofa against the wall opposite the bed, but it was pretty much useless because you couldn't see the tv and the lighting was so poor you couldn't read.With the exception of a few framed photos under the tv, there were no wall decorations. Essentially a stark, bare bones look.The Ugly----the club lounge, which used to be located on the top floor, was moved to an enlarged space on the ground floor. Picture a high school cafeteria. Lots of space, but shabbily furnished. Always crowded with at best a mediocre assortment of complimentary refreshments. Guests were not greeted, much less given an overview or seated by staff. You were on your own. Breakfast was a horror. If you could find a table, it was typically strewn with the dishes and food from the previous occupants. The minimal staff just couldn't keep up with the volume of guests. To make matters worse, they were constantly being taken away from their cleaning up duties to go back to the kitchen to deliver guest orders for cooked eggs/omelets. Of course the only way you discovered you could get an omelet was from other guests. The fresh fruit was good and there were 2 cappuccino makers (which most times worked)The evenings canapes if you could find any were mediocre. There was complimentary wine, one lower quality white and one lower quality red. The same every night. The only thing that didn't run out.The hotel was filled with Marriott Platinum and Gold elite members. There seemed general agreement among the ones we spoke with that this was about the worst club lounge in the chain.Lastly, despite being and elite Ritz Carlton member, not one person on staff during our entire stay, addressed us by name or even made an effort to know our names. Unheard of.
title: The Good, the bad and the ugly

review: I really like the Marriott brand and this hotel was up to its high standards. Service was attentive. Rooms well appointed. Self service laundry available, which was helpful. Concierge staff was helpful in finding sights and restaurants. Best part is the hotel is centrally located. Major sites all within 15-30 minutes walking distance. Right next to Vondelpark. The museums were about 10 minute walk. Although no airport shuttle, the 197 bus from the airport stops right in front of hotel. Very convenient. Only 5 euros. Would stay here again, if I returned to Amsterdam.
title: Nice Hotel, Great Central location

review: Great hotel with warmful staff the room for 4 was ok in spite we didn't have free wifi ( payed) ..... breakfast was ok but very crowded .... good location close to museums shops and trams a goof place to stay
title: Great place

review: Just finished a 6 day stay here earlier this month. The Amsterdam Marriott is situated in Leidesplein, a stones throw from the Rijks and the Van Gogh museums.And it is right next to Vondel Park. Perfect urban location.The rooms are well maintained but small according to American standards - however they are comparable to most European hotel rooms in size. After looking at a regular room I decided to stay in a suite on the 11th floor (the highest floor) which was very roomy with a balcony. This turned out to be a perfect choice as the room overlooked Leidesplein and afforded a view of the canals as well.The staff are extremely polite and pretty much handled everything with professionalism and courtesy. The hotel has two restaurants, Midtown Grill (steakhouse) and Sorels. We had dinner at the Grill one of the days and found the food to be excellent.There is an executive lounge for use by Marriott members and we had breakfast there most days. It was well stocked and the staff made sure that everything was replaced promptly. They also have made to order eggs for breakfast. We did not use the lounge for evening snacks but did notice that it got a little crowded in the peak hours of 6-7PM. The evening snacks seemed to be quite sumptuous as well.The service was excellent. The concierge booked all the tickets we needed and made the requisite dinner bookings and also had some great touristy suggestions as well. I highly recommend this hotel for a Amsterdam city stay.
title: Nice stay

review: This is beautiful hotel near the tram and within walking distance of the museum park. The first thing we noticed was how friendly and welcoming the staff was. We were given information and touring advice from who ever we asked including the gift store clerk who gave us some great ideas about what canal houses to visit.The room was comfortable and the. Executive lounge was great for breakfast and dinner.
title: Lovely hotel near tram and museums

review: Walkable distance to Heineken Experience, RijksMuseum , Van Gogh etc. Well connected by Trams to city center. I have to say it was a bit expensive. Good breakfast as well. Nothing average about this... But value for this high price tag ? Not really. Quite lot of food joints in Leidzeplein nearbyAmsterdam is an expensive city, especially if you want to stay in a good area.
title: Expensive, Nice Location

review: So, the lobby is gorgeous and the staff very nice and efficient but the rooms...a disappointment. It reminded me of a dorm room. There is no closet as such...a rod with some hangers. There's a built in tiny sitting area with a table that is small and uncomfortable. My deluxe room overlooked the roof and air conditioning. Ugh! If that was my view I guess the standard rooms overlook the dumpsters. The executive lounge is nice but not big enough. It seems every one can get it and there were kids running around everywhere! Awful! The person working in the evening doesn't have enough help so it takes forever for things to be refilled and she runs it like a military operation. When dinner is over and desserts come out, heaven help the person who goes up to get a piece of dessert! You'll be told to sit down and wait. Also, this is the first executive lounge that doesn't offer bottled water!!! I am a platinum rewards member so I stay in Marriott a lot and know. I just don't understand.The a/c wasn't working properly in our room one evening causing it to drip all night on the stone floor. It was a danger zone in the morning to not fall. With towels at a premium in this property it was tough. We reported it to the front desk at 8:00am and returned around 7:00 in the evening. We were instructed in the morning to check at the front desk before going to our room to see if they were able to repair it. When we went to the desk they had no idea if it had been repaired as there was no note of it at all! This hotel on the whole for the money is a disappointment and not worth it.
title: Nice but the rooms are like dorms

review: The hotel is based in a good location near some great local coffee shops, cafe's and food restaurants. A little bit of a travel from the main areas in Amsterdam but cabs aren't too expensive. The staff were a little poor to accommodate certain needs such as rooms together with extra bed etc as it was a group of 8 people. However, great hotel and rooms were nice. Clean!
title: Good hotel in nice location

review: This was my first trip to Amsterdam and i was super exited. The check in went smoothly and the rooms were quite spacious. There was some construction going on at the hotels higher floors which were a bit of a disturbance. Apart from that the overall stay was great. The rooms were clean, the bathrooms were well taken care of. Very easy access to all the attractions of the city.
title: Expensive but nice

review: We had a pleasant stay here. There are canal tours that depart 2 blocks from the hotel and there is a lively atmosphere near there with shops, restaurants and a casino. However, it is MUCH less hectic around the hotel than the Central station area (which is great after a long day). We received breakfast and lounge access (with nice afternoon snacks and desserts) being Marriot gold. The rooms were modern and recently redone. They are small, but we did not spend a whole lot of time in the rooms anyway. It was great to find a hotel with 2 double beds (difficult in Europe), which makes it an ideal place to stay with our 2 small kids. Would gladly stay here again.
title: Great experience

review: We arrived at 9am from an overnight flight from Dulles. We did not expect a room to be ready on arrival. However, our receptionist made sure that we were shown to the Executive Lounge (which we were qualified for due to our loyalty points), and while there eating breakfast, our room became available. Room was spacious and well appointed. Hallway was a little noisy with door closures. Location is great for walking to Old Town and the Red Light District, as well as canal tours, Heinenken, eating locations, and the museums. Price is at the high end, but worth the expenditure.
title: Nice Stay at Amsterdam Marriott

review: Just recently stayed at the Marriott Hotel in Amsterdam and had a great time. Very nice location, easy access to all the key attractions in the city.Would highly recommend staying there while in Amsterdam.
title: Great Location for Amsterdam Hotel

review: We have stayed a lot in this hotel. I wrote some (very) positive reviews in the past. We always had great stays here! We liked the location, being recognized as MRW Platinum members and as regular guests but none of it this time....Only Frans, the bellman/valet parking is the same, steady factor in this hotel and almost the only reason we like to come back to this hotel....It looks like that with the renovations completed the service in this hotel is gone...Rooms are very sober now...I like the Dutch touches, but there is not a proper closet anymore....no more colors...All grey and white, no warm feeling anymore....This time our stay was not a good one....We asked for extra towels in the evening, they never came, there was still water in the kettle from the guest before when I wanted to make a morning tea, there was no shampoo, airco did not funtion properly...I was either to cold or you had to switch it off which was not a good idea during hot days. When I wanted to write down my complaints I found out there was no notebook. We were not recognized as Platinum members. No upgrades whatsoever, it felt more like a downgrade, a room next to the elevator with all the noises that it brings being on that location...Normally we like to have a drink in their executive lounge....but this time t was hard to find a seat or a table...Way to busy...we wanted to have a little bite but everything was empty...Kitchen staff did their very best to refill everything but people seem to use their dinner here....They fill their plates till it doesn't fit anymore.....Positive point that they should do always, there was a man at the door in the morning who checked your roomumber so it was more quiet at breakfast than I had ever seen...So they should check more in the evenings as well, because I had the feeling that a lot of guests slipped in the lounge while they had no access......Complete family's showed up.... At check out I told the lady at the desk my points and what happened, I wanted to give her my note, but she paid a little attention...It was busy that morning, but at least she could have taken my note and paid attention to it and tell housekeeping later about the missing items etc...My husband had left the hotel very early already for business and when I told him in the evening about my experience and about the check in experience, he called the hotel and the manager on Duty, told him the GM came back on Sunday and would contact us immediately..A few days past, still no reaction. Then I made a little reaction on a comment on Facebook, not telling the details and the hotel contacted me...They had my contact-information details on file but it seemed difficult to contact me....Finally, after I sent my complaints by email, and I told them that I preferred to tell straight to them about my experiences so that I hadn't have to do it on social media or tripadvisor whatever, their response came.....with a lot of excuses and further nothing......"Is there anything that we can do to make you have a good feeling about your stay" was there reaction....No, thank you Marriott, this stay was definitive not a good one...we might come back when in the area to give it another chance (or to talk to Frans) but I rather go to Renaissance, close to Central Station and even better maybe the Sheraton at the airport, a short train ride away from the city......
title: Not worth staying anymore.....

review: After a river cruise, we had 2 days to explore Amsterdam. The concierge at the Marriott took charge. Providing a wealth of information and booking a private walking tour for us were extremely helpful. Also helpful were his 2 local restaurant recommendations. Purimas and Trattoria Toto were 5 minutes away and lived up to expectations. The executive lounge off the lobby was another plus for our experience- well stocked with efficient, friendly service.
title: Location with quality service

review: 6th floor room, 2 beds (2 adults, 2 kids), view was of other side of hotel, but did not matter to us since we just used it for a place to sleep and have breakfast. For the price of this hotel I was a little disappointed to find out that we had to pay upwards of $20 per day for WIFI access. I'm sure this was listed on the website somewhere, but my husband booked the room so I did not catch this before the booking. Either way for $400+ a night WIFI should be included at no additional charge. As for our overall stay we were very pleased with the staff, breakfast and special attention paid to my younger son's birthday - a plate of chocolates were left in the room for him on his birthday.
title: Great location, Wonderful Staff, WIFI costs extra

review: We stayed three nights at this Marriott property. We arrived from an overnight flight from West Coast. Our rooms were ready and we were checked in without delay. Checkout was equally easy and error free.The property is very clean. The rooms , bathrooms (both room and public), public areas, and restaurants were all clean and had no odor. The staff was uniformly polite and pleasant. We did find bar service to be often rather slow.The location is quite good. It is an easy walk to the Van Goh museum and Reijksmuseum. It is a twenty-five minute walk to old town which isn't too bad either. One of the big shopping streets is also nearby as well. In general, the hotel is in a quite excellent location.We ate breakfast here and some snacks. The food was quite solid and no complaints.This is a hotel I can easily recommend if you are looking for a a well located functional hotel. It has no particular culture related atmosphere or charm, just good solid functionality and location.I did not price shop, but my sense is that the room rates are reasonable and competitive for what you are getting.
title: Functional and utilitarian, a solid property

review: I have stayed at several places in AMS but this is my favorite. I am a Marriott platinum member, so I may get some perks others don't, but I think the location is what makes this place very good. The various attractions are all within 20-30 minutes walking - from the red light district to the historic areas.The hotel itself has a good bar, and the club lounge is typical of a Marriott. The rooms are modern and consistent. My only complaint would be some of the experiences I had with a few of the front desk staff - nothing too serious, but I didnt get the sense they were the most 'nurturing' people.But it wasn't a big deal - my overall experience was great and the overall quality of service excellent.
title: Great hotel in a perfect location

review: This is an upscale Marriott and a delight in most ways. The bellmen and lobby Concierge were personable, and very helpful. Sorry I can't remember their names but they were great to interact with. We checked in at 10 am, coming off a river cruise. Of course, a room wasn't ready, which was no problem, but when I asked to make sure we were on a high floor with a canal view it didn't look like it was going to happen. Nicole came to our rescue and worked the system to find us a room while we were exploring Amsterdam. We got an outstanding Executive level room on the ODD number side, which gives the best outside views. We had a very large, clean room, with a large bathroom and a walk-in shower. Thank you Nicole. When you check in work with the front desk people. Our friends traveling with us got an even number room which looked at a wall, and worst of all the bathroom was small with a pedestal sink and absolutely no counter space to place toiletries. And we paid the same price for the room. Our advantage was being a lifetime platinum, and I worked with Nicole. Thanks again for taking great care of a frequent stayer. Thanks to the Concierge who booked tours for us cheaper then I could get online in the States. Also, when they called a cab, they were there at the appointed minute. The hotel is in a perfect location to visit the Rembrandt and Van Goth museums. It's only a 10 minute walk to the museums. Watch out for the million bikes; they are crazy and feel like they always have the right of way. I recommend seeing the museums with the "Skip the Lines" with lunch and canal cruise tour that you can find at the hotel, Viatar and Trip Adviser. It's a wonderful way to see the museums, and more, and have an art knowledgeable guide take you to the important pieces in the museums. You'll see and learn a lot more with a guide. The downside of this location is it's a hard walk to the Old City area, Redlight District, etc. Unfortunately, my wife had a bad knee and couldn't walk any distance. Walking into the center would have been more of an adventure and we would have seen more, but she just couldn't do it. So we cabbed everywhere and the cabs are expensive. Plan on about 20 Euors +/- depending on the honesty and route of the taxi ride. This is more for Marriott mgt, but it was strange to have the Concierge Lounge on the lobby floor. No views from this lounge, but the food and beverages were good and appreciated. Another thing that was different was on more than one occasion the lounge was filled with kids, with their families. It wasn't the quiet resting place that most lounges are.The last comment to Marriott is that the room key reader in the elevators doesn't work very well. Every person going to a floor has to use the reader to be able to push the floor number. We found people on the elevator riding up and down because they couldn't get their floor button pushed. We learned that if it doesn't initially read the card, keep pushing it in and out until it does. Sometimes it too upwards of a dozen attempts. Pretty silly to have that problem in such a quality hotel.We love Marriott Hotels and this one was no exception.
title: Great location for museums, not so good for old town

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed in this hotel from Thursday to Sunday prior to setting off on a cruise. It is very convenient to the museums and is within easy walking distance of the Rijksmuseum and the Van Gogh. The tram stop ( 2 and 5) which takes you towards the centre and Central Station is about 7 minutes walk away. We had breakfast included which was tasty - fruit, cereal, cold meats, eggs and bacon as well as bread. Pancakes and other things available on request. The hotel is small and the bar and lobby area also small but comfortable. Dinner on the first evening was made by Thomas. Both he, Iris and Andre were all very friendly and helpful. We ate at restaurants on the other nights. Beds very comfortable. A good choice.
title: 3 day trip

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Small & quaint hotel. Very clean with soft comfy bed and pillows. Staff was super sweet and helpful. Centrally located near the museum district. Easy access to bus #197 which is a direct bus ride to the airport. High end shopping stores right around the corner. Plenty of cafes nearby. We definitely recommend and return to this hotel.
title: Museums everywhere

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I didn't realize how good we had it at JL No76 until we left this hotel to go to another and it sucked. All we talked about at our 2nd hotel stay was how good JL No76 was and how we needed to return. Check-in was easy. Our room wasn’t ready yet so they took our bags and assisted us with directions around the neighborhood. Walked around, came back, room was ready. It was clean, facing the street, beds were comfortable. The honesty bar came in handy. We had planned to eat breakfast elsewhere but always ended up at the downstairs restaurant. When the weather is nice, the courtyard in the back is open for you to sit and enjoy your meal. I wish I could remember the person’s name at the front desk. He was hilarious. Hotel is close to everything touristy. Was able to get up early and get a nice pic of the IAMSTERDAM sign – 5 min walk, if that. Multiple lines to Amsterdam Centraal and to everywhere really. Found a nice restaurant named Pompa nearby and there are lots of food options around. We didn’t eat dinner at the hotel ever so I cannot comment. You may be able to hear your neighbor’s television through the wall but other than that, it was very quiet every night. Did I mention that the beds were comfortable? LOL Just want to make sure I say that. If you are walking back to the hotel late, mind the numbers. I passed by the hotel twice the first day.
title: Great Stay

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Everything was fine once we got there. We didn't, however, appreciate the email 3 or 4 days before our arrival telling us that we were booked into a basement room in your hotel. Fortunately our travel agent fixed that problem for us.
title: Great once we got there

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great Location and very friendly staff in all areas, in reception and restaurant as well. Happy with the big room. Very Comfortable bed. Love the surroundings too with great shopping and Van Gogh Museum round the corner!
title: Highly Recommended!

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We really enjoyed our stay. The staff were very professional and friendly. The room was extremely comfortable and we would definitely stay there again. The location is great for visiting the museums. A great hotel
title: Great boutique hotel in a quiet location

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We loved this hotel so much the first time around, we booked again for our trip this past April. We had a different room on the top floor which was cute but a little smaller so we requested a new room and were given the same room we had last year on the main floor. This hotel is fantastic! It's boutique with a very cool eclectic style and is located near the Museums, Vondel Park, Casino and a some cool restaurants and coffee shops. You can walk into the action but far enough away to be quiet and comfortable. The service was great, the staff friendly and we just loved our room. We will definitely stay here again when we return to our favourite city! BTW if you can visit for King's Day at end of April, it's an absolute blast!!Thanks again for a wonderful stay!
title: 2nd visit to JL No 76

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel itself is wonderful. Large spacious rooms with many extras. Great location. Great AC. Helpful staff. Not much to complain about except that rooms were not available until very late in the day. We had 3 rooms. 2 became ready by 3 PM and one was not ready until 4 PM. Please try to turn the rooms around faster to avoid delays. Not a good luggage storage situation either (storage while rooms were being made up). Still an overall positive experience and I would use this hotel again.
title: Fantastic Hotel in Great Location

review: We stayed in a private room (with separate bathroom). The room was clean and cozy. The rooms came equipped with a refrigerator and coffee maker. The cabinets where crockery and cutlery are supposed to go were empty though. The staff at the hotel were very helpful and gave us ideas on sights to visit nearby. The hotel itself is less than a 5 minute walk from Sloterdijk station which in turn is another 5 minute by train from Amsterdam central. Trains runs every couple of minutes. If you don't plan on buying the daily travel pass to get around the city, and prefer to sight see on foot or on bikes, the travel to and from Amsterdam central is 5 euros per person.
title: Clean, comfortable and convenient

hotelLocation: Anna van den Vondelstraat 6, 1054 GZ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We booked Pillows for the location. It is near museums, (Rijksmuseum & Van Gogh) a tram stop (#1)restaurants, churches, and the Vondelpark. It has been remodeled so nearly everything is new, clean, and efficient. No "front desk". Check in/out is vía a hand held device. A 24 hour kitchen can cook up a meal in no time. Breakfast can be ordered or enjoy their continental breakfast. A small but cozy lounge. Wifi internet. Concierge service..... Why not a higher rating? Our room for two had a king size bed that took up most of the room. Not enough space for luggage, to spread/stretch out, or generally move around. Very tight quarters for one person, let alone two people. Staff tries hard to please their visitors and they do an excellent job. We will stay here again but in a larger room.
title: Nice clean conveniently located and efficient

review: I've had an awesome experience at Teleport Hotel. The staff is great, funny, serious. Rooms, location, everything good. I will be back soon!! I promise. Is was a magnific experience. Thanks for all!!!
title: Awesome place

review: The hotel is very close to Sloterdijk Station, you can go everywhere where you want from there. Hotel rooms are clean, beds are comfortable and also hotel stuffs are very friendly. Rooms has own kitchen it includes microwave owen, water heater. So you can cook in your room. Enjoy :) And another thing is breakfast, it is also perfect. It has a large menu :)
title: Good price, good hotel

review: We stayed here just last week and the hotel is clean and comfortable. We had an external private bathroom. Your key card unlocks both your room and your bathroom and they were just across the hallway so this didn't really bother us. The bed was comfy and it has a kitchenette with microwave, fridge and kettle. Hairdryer in the wardrobe is handy. Towels, shampoo, shower gel and soap supplied in the bathroom. Room comes with a bottle of water each and tea/coffee. To help the environment they offer to opt out of your room being cleaned any day you like and as a reward they give you a free beer of soft drink. There's no way our room needed cleaning everyday. We had it cleaned once in a 5 night stay and that was fine. The area is quiet but it is a 5 minute or less walk to the Sloderjik Train station and only 1 stop on the train to Amsterdam Centraal. So very well located to get around. We did not eat at the hotel at all. We went to a local Spa shop right outside the station and bought breakfast bits and kept in our rooms fridge to eat on a budget. A great shop which is in the Amsterdam Centraal train station is HEMA. They are cheaper than Spa and we shopped there alot. You have to try the Stroopwafels and the Waffles and the pancakes around Amsterdam! Delicious!
title: Great location!

review: Don't be fooled by the 'hostel' look. The rooms are very nice and clean with great amenities. Despite having the bathroom in a separate room is a bit strange, it is also very clean and I don't consider it as a drawback. We have not tried the breakfast. The location is great, you have direct connections to the Central station and city center in 5-7 minutes walking distance. As the prices for accommodation in Amsterdam are quite high, this hotel provides a great price/value ratio.
title: Better than expected

review: I had some doubts about this place as I read most of the reviews, but I booked it because of the location at the end. I have to say that my experience was better than expected. The hotel is clean, the staff is very friendly and helpful. You can reach the train station easily as it's located on 5 min from the hotel. We purchased a day rider ticket for E16 p/p which you can use on trains, trams, buses and metro. Be aware that Amsterdam is a big city, so having these tickets made our journey easy and well time consuming. The breakfast was great too. I paid it in advance. If you book the room online through their website you get a box of biscuits, which was great as a small souvenir. The bathroom is located next to the room and it's for all your use, no sharing with other people. The parking is free! I paid for a parking when I booked the room, but they gave me the money back, so ask for this one! You get discounts for the attractions from the reception! Will consider this place in future! Ignore the bad reviews, you get a bit more for what you pay and this is the best balance in customer service! Well done Teleport Hotel, keep the good work up!
title: Spot on!

review: Nice and clean rooms, near to a train station so very comfortable to travel even to the airport. The shower is spacious as so the toilet and the place has good security. The staff really nice, specially Claudia, she helped us a lot. I'd stay again in this hotel.
title: Hotel

review: Is the second time I stay at this hotel and I love it. Excellent price-quality ratio for Amsterdam. It,s not central, but in 1 minute you can reach the The Sloterdijk Station. From there in max 10 miutes the train leaves you in Amsterdam Central, wich is one station far.The room and the bathroom are big and very clean.The breakfast is basic.
title: Excellent price-quality ratio for Amsterdam

review: I chose this hotel for its location and convenient rates (plus IHG member discounts and benefits)- Location: Excellent. 10 minutes from/to both Schiphol Airport and Amsterdam Centraal. Slotedjik Station is located steps from the hotel. Note: To get to the hotel by train, Amsterdam Travel Card can be bought at AKO kiosks and NS tickets at Schiphol main hall (Unlike the GVB pass, this one includes trains, plus all other public transport) - Front desk/Lobby: are on the first floor. Elevators right in front of the main entrance. Stairs, to the left. Fuss-free Check In/Check Out with nice, professional staff. They had a room ready before noon, very convenient after a long red eye flight.- Room: I booked a standard room and got a 2nd floor good-sized one, street/train station view. Not noisy at all. Mattress/pillows were good. It had no safe, closet nor fridge but still comfortable for my short stay.- Bathroom: Very clean. Good water pressure/temperature. Shampoo/Shower gel dispenser. Wall mounted hairdryer. Plenty of towels.- Coffee/tea facilities: Electric kettle, coffee/tea/sugar. - Continental Breakfast: Complimentary, with good & fresh selection, served at a spacious and bright dining room. Again, nice and helpful staff- Wi-Fi: Ok.I would recommend this hotel and stay here again.
title: Just ten minutes from Airport / to Amsterdam Centraal.

review: The Hotel is in a superb location. It is one stop away from Amsterdam Central Station, which is the gateway to all the tourist attractions. There is also a tram running directly from the station adjacent to the Hotel, which is very convenient. For example, you can take a tram directly to the museum square from Sloterdijk Station.Breakfast is included but can be frustratingly crowded if you don't go early. Seats are at a minimum during peak hours, and so is the food... We found it difficult to find a table at any time with a family of four.The rooms are spacious and well air conditioned. Windows can be opened for some fresh air. Tea and Coffee is available in the rooms.The service at the front desk was not exceptional as it usually is for these hotels around the world. We had some cleaning issues with the room and general front desk service issues. Even during peak times, hotel volumes should be no excuse for bad service,All service issues aside, the location is great.
title: Great Location - Service Needs Attention

review: Booked for me and my partner in one room and my friend and partner in room which they put right next to each other.The stay was enjoyable, the room was clean, reception was amazing !!! So friendly and welcoming offered to look after our bags as we were to early to check in!It's a right bargain as it is right next to the station which is two stops until central station!Comfy stay, quiet, out of the city but close enough to get to, friendly staff that didn't mind me putting balloons and confetti in our room to surprise my partner on his birthday.Thank you for helping our holiday be enjoyable !We are returning soon but unfortunately could not afford this hotel to stay in as quiet expensive for students !However very pleasant and enjoyable and would defiantly recommend, if visiting again will book in advance,Thank you.
title: Great stay!!!

review: Although you can't expect plush and red carpets here as it's Express brand - nevertheless this hotel delivers 100%. Very friendly and customer service orientated staff, rooms although small - functional with all basics needed for a decent night stay. Located literally next to station from where you can get to Amsterdam Central in 5 minutes and airport in less than 15. Perfect fix for out of the center cheaper hotel with great connections to anywhere in the city.
title: Great budget option 5 min away by train from city centre

review: Good location, good breakfast which is included good wifi and tv, Pity they dont offer a buffet meal too. especially on sunday night when there is nothing worthwhile to eat in this area without getting back on public transport Only negative is no fridge .
title: 3 day stay

review: I spent almost one week at this hotel last April . when I was looking for hotel to stay during my holiday, I thought that this hotel will be far from downtown but I found many positive reviews regarding the transportation and the hotel services and utilities in general . I happy I did book there . My experience was great and and I would like to come back again . There are two stations near the hotel metro and tram ( small walking distance) . Also the supermarket is next on the corner where we found everything we needed to eat during our stay. The neighborhood is safe and there few nice shops too close to the hotel ( flower shop , bookstore, cafes, ...).The staff in the reception were very friendly and helped us a lot . The team who was working in the restaurant during the breakfast time was very nice and used to offer their services. In general the location is good for one who want to visit many places as it located on acceptance distance to Dam square/central station , the airport , Van Gogh , diamond and other museums.Why I didn't gave 5 is that because there is no small fridge which I think is important in summer . Also the restaurant only opens for breakfast.
title: You will Like this Hotel

review: Great Value hotel with big rooms for it's price. Good continental breakfast. The best thing about the hotel is the accessibility. It is beside Sloterdjik Station and it is 5 mins away from Amsterdam Central and 15 mins away from Schipol Airport. There is a supermarket in the hotel at the entrance. Great! Rooms are decent for a budget hotel. Spacious because we can still open two international long haul luggages on floor and we can still move around. No minibar or refrigerator though.Will definitely stay here again when I come back.
title: Great Value Hotel and beside a major train station next to it.

review: Motel is conveniently off autoban with transportation by bus or train. Bart the boatman offered tour through waterways.Breakfast was decadently nourishing with appetizing variety. Only issue is reflected with Bart's claim of the city's "tolerance," describing openness to moral and amoral [immoral], as well as Islam. TV reflects over 50% of channels devoted to instruction of Sharia, the Koran/Quran, sponsored by Islamic countries. No "melting pot" here. An increasing absence of Christianity's morals and influence also apparent.
title: Discovering the Netherlands with Bart the Boatman

review: Just had a 1 night stay this timeUsual great service at check inRecognised as IHG member with free drink and snacksLove the new carpets that are being layed on all floors So happy you chose to replace old ones Only thing i noticed this time was lack of attention at check out by the trainee on DutyBasic "thats it"Its always nice to maybe get asked if everything is ok with stay,but maybe i am just expecting too muchWill be back soon offcourse
title: Still the Best Affordable Hotel

review: Nice hotel, fair price, near Amsterdam Sloterdijk Station, kind staff. Good cleanig of the room. The wifi didnt work so well in the room, but there is a hotspot in the reception area. Ok breakfast, but the tables are small and the space is narrow.
title: Nice hotel.

review: This is my first time staying outside of Centraal so I was a little weary about it, but it was so so much easier than I imagined. We originally got a taxi to the airport once we landed, which was quite cheap between the 4 of us. But on the way back, once we had figured out the trains, and it was so easy. This hotel is literally 1 stop from Centraal and takes about 10 minutes, you can also get a pass for however long you're there to use.The hotel itself was so nice, although we were gutted we didn't get a fancy graffiti room it was really modern and clean. There was a modern kitchen, fridge, sitting area, TV and two double beds. I was confused when I knew our toilet wasn't in our room, but it was literally outside the door and so easy to use.This hotel is great value for money and I'd definitely stay there again.
title: Handy and nearby everything

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had a very good experience. The hotel is well located and all staff we met were extremely pleasant and helpful, with lots of ideas about things to do in Amsterdam. The room was a very good size, really clean and comfortable. We'll certainly recommend to friends and family.
title: Excellent location, lovely boutique hotel.

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Trendy boutique hotel. The staff is delightful. Rooms are clean and well appointed. Loved the nepresso coffeemaker. Bed is very comfy. They accommodated a slightly early arrival time. It is in a quiet neighborhood just a street over from the museums. VERY convenient to the parks, museums, a grocery shop, high end shopping and tram stops, all virtually less than a 10 minute walk. Shower had awesome hot water. Also, english tv stations.
title: Perfect

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: A lovely easy going clean hotel, very comfortable. We upgraded to an executive room and it was fabulous. Quiet and no noise at all. Did not get chance to use the lounge but it looked lovely. Easy to get to all parts of Amsterdam.
title: Perfect hotel for us

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at JL76 for the last few days of a European holiday with the kids. The hotel was perfectly situated for easy access to all the big sites, right behind the museums, and 2 blocks from the canal boat cruises. And yet it was quiet, very comfortable, and the staff made us feel totally at home. We would definitely return
title: Wonderful place to stay

review: Had an absolute amazing stay at the student hotel. It didn't disappoint and stayed true to its word. This was my second time this year that I stayed here and it was just as amazing time as the first time was
title: Amazing time

review: I enjoyed the stay and rooms were outstanding and artistic. The staff were helpful and explained everything really clearly. I would recommend anyone to stay here and it would be an ideal location for families.
title: Nice stay

review: All worked fine and the staff and room were perfect. The hotel is very clean, close to the subway station and the place is absolutely familiar. In our next trip to Amsterdam we would definitely stay at TSH.
title: Amazing Experience

review: The hotel is about 20 minutes out of Amsterdam, but it is located at a major transport hub so it is very easy to get both from the airport and to the city from...if you arrive by air, get a multi day transport ticket. There appeared to a be limited number of restaurants nearby.
title: Modern Accomadation

review: Knew what to expect from pictures and reviews, but can say we definitely enjoyed our stay - clean and comfortable, 11th floor room provided great city views, and right outside a main metro line stop. Decent price for a pricey city, and would stay here again if visiting Amsterdam.Must say the bed was extremely comfortable and the curtains were very 'black out' - great night's sleep was had.
title: Clean, comfortable, things going on and right outside a metro stop

review: We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights and were really pleased with the accommodation.It was easy to find - a short metro journey from Centraal station.The hotel was decorated really colourfully and is very cool; both in the lobby and our room. There is a 1960s retro black and white photo booth in the lobby too, and it's just €2 to use.Our room was clean and spacious. The TV included some English television. We had a kitchenette in our room too and a small coffee machine. There was no cutlery though - we had to get plastic spoons from the restaurant downstairs. The hairdryer was good - a properly sized one and not a travel one that you would normally find in a hotel!! The toilet paper was that cheaper, more tracing paper like stuff though.The room was a bit hot at times and we couldn't seem to adjust the thermostat. Also, we booked a city view room and had a view of another high rise block!There is a supermarket across the road - a good place to pick up some snacks!Overall, a really good stay and we would return.
title: Great stay!

review: Dreadful hotel. They tried to take 2000€ before we arrived. First I knew about it was when the fraud dept from my bank contacted me ! Then we had to leave 2days early due to my father being rushed into hospital on life support in U.K. Unlike KLM who refunded all our flights including airport taxes Hotel2Stay refused any refund . Disgusting at such an awful time for all the family . Especially after they tried to take a considerable amount of money before we even arrived . The floor was not clean in the room. Also you cannot open the windows as you are practically sitting on the train track and tram line and there is no aircon in the rooms. Do not stay at this hotel.
title: Dreadful

review: Hotel is new, spacious, well-lit and at a good location. Super fast wifi connection. Train, bus, tram and convenience store all nearby. Check-in was slow even though I did pre-checkin. Front desk staff attitudes and housekeeping needs improvement.
title: Great Hotel, Not So Great Staff

review: Staff were friendly and helpful.The room was very nice, had everything we needed and more.they have a gym and saunas which are both open for long hours which is great and also ideal. The location was brilliant, there was a bus station and also some trams which stops within steps on the hotel. Also the train station (amsterdam sloterdijk) was the other side of the bus station, which was no more then a 5 min walk. There is a spar a few minutes away from the hotel, also there is a quite a few small food places in between the hotel and train station and in the train station.
title: Excellent

review: We had a pleasant and quiet stay at Hotel2Stay in Amsterdam.The staff was helpful and the room was spacious, clean and functional.The center of Amsterdam is at 20 minutes by bus or tram that can be catched near the hotel.
title: My stay at Hotel2Stay in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed 2 nights at the Sir Albert. We found the service to be fantastic and the hotel quaint. When we checked in the staff was excellent booking tickets for museums and reservations. The hotel is small and the hallways dark. Our room was very small and dark, but fit our needs just fine. The location is a bit off the main areas, but has a more residential feel which we enjoyed. It was excellent walking to the museums. If you are walking, beware of all the bikers....Amsterdam is a place for bikers for sure! Also, be sure to have euros ready for many places do not take credit card.
title: Quaint Boutique Hotel

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The team have a serious communication. The service at the restaurant it's terrible. 1 night a random person enter our room at 1am, it was another guest that mistook the door , the explanation of the hotel was that an error in the system allowed for a few minutes any card access to any door. Other day, when i closed the room door a piece of roof (ventilation whole) felt down (thanks good i closed door from inside, otherwise it would break my head).Also when you have any issue that you want to report to the manager it's really dificultades to reach him (not serious for a 5 star hotel)
title: Does not meet the standara of a 5 star hotel

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Sir Albert was definitely by far one, if not, the finest hotels I have ever stayed in. The hotel decor itself in the reception, corridors, bedroom are very modern and chic with a touch of class. We were offered complementary prosecco on arrival. The staff were more than helpful when we were checking in. Another day we asked for directions to the Van Gogh Museum and the man at reception went out of his way to help and assist us with directions and offered umbrellas to each of us as it was a rather dreary day. The room itself was very edgy and modernly decorated and felt very personal and welcoming with complimentary messages on the mirror and my name on the TV to welcome me. It took maybe 20-25mins walk to get to Dam Square but there are lots of lovely bars, restaurants, shops and markets on the way which was nice to experience. There was also a tram about a 30sec walk away that can take you to Dam Square. I would recommend this hotel to every type of passenger and hope to return to it once again in the near future.
title: Fabulous Hotel!

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: this uniqe hotel is located at de pijp district which is less touristic and very trendy. definitely my favorite one.a real boutique hotel with a lot of character.a great restaurant, great service and very clean.
title: the best hotel in the best district

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I have mixed feelings about my stay, but I know that I won't go back. For this high price there's a lot of other 4-5* hotels in Amsterdam to choose from.Good points : friendly staff at reception and breakfast, very nice lobby, modern hotel decorationBad points : not super clean (hair in bath, dust on items), most tv channels didn't work, one remote for the lights didn't work (told reception at check-out),totally impossible to put your makeup on in the bathroom because of the light, breakfast has no dutch touch (and god knows they have amazing stuff!), just some poor thin slices of cheese.Their website states the deluxe room has view on the city, I had view on the inner square, so no view.Well... not bad but by far not matching the high price they ask !
title: Good but....

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great boutique hotel just a 10 minute cab journey from RAI and 10 minute stroll form the Rijksmuseum. Lovely staff. Very attentive. Decent breakfast. Room ok and bed very comfortable. Izakaya Asian Restaurant is fabulous.
title: Perfect for RAI and Culture

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had a very nice stay: great staff, very cosy and comfy room, good beds. The location is very central and one can rent a bike from the hotel to get around. Great restaurants and shopping around the hotel.
title: Very cosy and personal boutique hotel !

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We have just spent 3 nights at the Sir Albert and have to say it was much better than I expected. We were upgraded to a superior double as there was a problem with the plug but the room more than made up for the inconvenience. We didn't eat breakfast as it's quite expensive unless you like to eat lots in the morning then it's worth it. Location is superb, a little on the outskirts of the centre but a very cool, trendy area. We ate in the restaurant the first night, amazing food ( pricey) super trendy bar with some beautiful people ( and staff). I would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay again.
title: Perfect location

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is such a fantastic hotel! We stayed here for 2 nights in February, and it was super cool to stay in such a hip place. The decor was awesome, the room was clean and comfortable, and I REALLY wish I had just purchased some of the body-care amenities when I checked out, because I still kinda miss the scents! Even though it was in the middle of the winter, the Albert Cuyp Market was in full-swing right outside the hotel! I have such a great photo of snow-covered fruit at one of the booths. We walked everywhere for those few days- it was very easy to do. The locals would be riding their bikes through the snowfall, but I definitely saw a tourist take a pretty mean fall while trying to slow down going over a canal bridge. Winter biking is not for the faint of heart. The hotel was pretty easy to get to from the airport, getting off at Museumplein, and walking a couple blocks. We did choose to trudge through the deep snow with our giant wheeled suitcases (we were traveling for a month), and it was dumb, but do-able. A cab might be the more reasonable option, or perhaps not winter travel. No regrets.
title: Can't go wrong!

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Becky Simone from Beach Bum Vacations recommended and made the arrangements for me to stay at the Sir Albert Hotel. The hotel is centrally located and is charming inside with a fireplace in the lobby. The bed was superb in comfort!! The room was also very quiet with no outside noise. The staff are very helpful. There is also a place to eat across the street that has a must try salad.
title: Charming hotel

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed for 3 nights for a city break. Within walking distance of the Museumplein, and close to the number 24 tram which takes you to Centraal. Bed was extremely comfortable (it was difficult to get out of in the morning!). Friendly and helpful staff, free glass of prosecco on arrival. Good neighbourhood, plenty of restaurants/bars/cafes/bakeries nearby. We didn't opt for breakfast as we felt it was on the pricey side and there's a bakery very close. Only thing that I marked it down for was that the sound travels from the hallway into the room very easily!
title: Excellent location and very luxurious.

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Booked this months in advance, promised a 20m room - if you measured from the back of the shower room (which replaces the wardrobe in a 'normal' hotel) then I still couldn't reach 20m, then subtract the inclusion where the bathroom normally is (2*3m) and you have a VERY small room.Packed with a mini bar, food concession and no way a kitten could be in the room with you let alone swung round.Loud, busy bar/restaurant on the ground floor, very dark hall ways and rooms.Room was not cleaned on the 2nd days as hotel claimed we had the do not disturb sign on - they had no trouble barging in at 8:30am, you couldn't really tell is the sign was lite or not.Further away from the museums than you're led to believe - next time we'll stay outside the centre and catch the excellent trams into the centre saving money and getting much larger roomWe had a "city view" which was into the rear courtyard of adjacent properties.
title: Tiny room, high price

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: First I'd like to thank Becky Simone from Beach Bum Vacations for arranging this hotel for us. The location was great. It was an short walk to the museum district, the tram, the street market, the Heineken experience and many restaurants. Although the rooms are smaller than I am used to, it was clean and comfortable and quiet. We arrived before our room was ready, so they stored our luggage and gave us directions and maps so we could get around. We returned at the time they suggested and the room was just about ready, so they offered us some wine while we waited the last few minutes. There is a restaurant in the lobby area that was always busy, but we chose to eat in the area of the city which we were visiting for the day. The little restaurant/bar on the corner across the street was excellent, too. I'd gladly stay here when return to Amsterdam.
title: Excellent location, close to everything

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of our 2 week trip. The hotel was picked by Becky with Beach Bun Vacations and our entire group stayed here too. What a great choice!! Super location; only a 10 minute walk from the museums and a 5 minute walk to the Heineken Brewery and the tram stop. A ton of restaurants within waking distance as was the open air market. Staff was super helpful and friendly and the room was on the smaller side but very nice. Bed was comfortable, which was all that matters. Really neat decor throughout the hotel. We would definitely stay here when we come back which we need to do since there is so much to do in Amsterdam. Didn't eat at the restaurant, which is another reason to return! Super job by Becky picking the hotel!!
title: Great hotel with good service in a great location.

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: 2-3 days before we reached the hotel, we were emailed by them to let them know about things that we might specially need in our room. We stayed 4 nights. The rooms are updated but tiny. We walked into the hotel and were pleasantly happy to see a 'non hotel' look and feel. They have a bustling restaurant Izikaya on the ground floor. We were taken to the study where we were checked in by Marin/ Maureen. An extremely professional and friendly person. We were started off on some prosecco. The room felt fresh and well serviced. During those four days, I also had my birthday. The hotel left a beautiful card and balloons on the bed for me. I was rather hot in the duvet. On requesting them for an alternative, they didn't have any thinner duvets but they did leave some sheets for us. Responsive hotel, happy staff and charming environ. The red light area shares the same block. I had a walk towards that side too. Walkable to all city center attractions, I think I was all in all happy. We were driving but didn't park the car with them. It was mostly on the street. The hotel breakfast buffet is popular but we couldn't really try it. May be another time. I hope the next time around they have winter and summer bed linen. It is quite difficult sleeping in a 5 inch thick duvet in summers. Thank you guys!
title: Good hotel, tiny rooms & personable staff

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed two nights using the Hotel as home base. Very accommodating at check-in. By EU standards, descent size rooms. Very good amenities with rain shower heads and ILLY coffee, flat panel TV/sat service, WIFI. Rooms facing West on 4th floor get hot so avoid in Summer (needed to change our room). Otherwise, friendly service with professional attitudes. Nice am buffet at 23 EU.
title: Solid Boutique Entry on South Side

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We visit Amsterdam at least once a year. We had visited the restaurant in the hotel on a previous trip so selected the hotel as we felt we knew what to expect.On arrival our room wasn't ready, nor was it ready over an hour later when we'd been told it would be.We had paid for a Deluxe room, this is not the basic level at the hotel, on check in I was told that the room did have a city view even though it was on the first floor. On entering the room it became very clear that not only did the room not have a city view but it did have a very unattractive view of the bins and yards of the opposite apartments. I will attach a photo. The room lights did not respond to the remote controls and the room was very dark.When I raised this with reception I was told that if I wanted a city view I should have asked for one, even though it is part of the room description described on the hotel website. We were moved on our second night to a room of the standard we had booked, however that's hardly a good start to a vacation. The room we moved to was great, had lots of light and a view we expected. But no apology or recognition of the issue with our initial room.All in all we felt that we were not valued customers and that quality of service and ensuring that we had a good vacation was not of interest to the hotel. We ended up cancelling our planned dinner in their exceptional restaurant as they would not assure us that we would get a table seat (opposed to a bar seat). I truely do not understand why our custom is of no value to the staff of this hotel.
title: Would not return, there are plenty of other great hotels to spend your time at.

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Good size room, black dominates the decor, excellent check-in experience. Light switches seem to have a mind of their own. No handwashing available in the actual toilet facility. No towel racks. The inhouse restaurant is Japanese South American fusion. Food is good, but our service was indifferent. There is a great Dutch restaurant across the street. Easy walk to the Museums and the street markets.
title: Stylish experience

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: When we first entered the hotel there was a nice friendly welcome and we were looked after nicely, as expected. The suite we were in was decorated well, although the suites were smaller than expected! Although the room wasn't that big, the walk in shower and bath were ample sized. Unfortunately, the first night we were in a suite with no windows and the air conditioning wasn't working so we struggled to sleep even though the beds were comfortable. On the second night we were moved to another suite that was above the restaurant/bar area where the music was loud until 1 am on a Tuesday night. So make sure you aren't above there if you like a quiet nights sleep. The staff were on the whole friendly but not consistently offering great service like I would expect from this kind of hotel.The hotel itself is very smart, comfortable and quirky so it has all the right ingredients for a top hotel but this didn't follow through on our stay.Also the restaurant in the hotel is very nice and the food was pretty good but not worth the excessive prices in my opinion, especially the breakfast. Also be careful letting the waiter order a "menu designed just for you". Overall the place is clean, bright and modern, with a boutique twist - a few tweaks with the staff and food prices would make it to a fantastic place.
title: Great Potential

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My husband and I just stayed at the Sir Albert for four nights, and felt it was a pretty good (but not outstanding) experience. The staff were lovely, but the rooms felt a bit in need of refreshing.. or maybe just deep cleaning. The first room we were put in didn't have a working light in the shower and wasn't very clean - dust in a lot of places and scuff marks all over the walls, and stains on the curtains and coverlet. We were moved due to the light issue to a larger room on the lower level of the hotel, which was cleaner and better overall, but proved to be noisy at night due to poor soundproofing and the bustling restaurant down the hall. Given it was below grade I suppose it's understandable, but I wasn't thrilled to see a couple of silverfish during the course of our stay (including one in a water glass we left upturned overnight ). We were also unable to control the air system in the room and found it got uncomfortably warm at night. Having said this, it was still a good experience on the whole and the staff were very nice, and helped us to rent bikes one day and gave some great suggestions on where to go. The De Pijp neighbourhood was great, lots of excellent restaurants and close enough to the centre while still feeling quiet.
title: Great location, pretty good hotel

hotelLocation: Albert Cuypstraat 2-6, 1072 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We arrived at The Sir Albert greeted by a glass of Prosecco and warm and friendly welcome. I had booked this as a special birthday treat for my partner and had emailed ahead asking for a bottle of bubbly and a small birthday cake to be put in the room. The hotel topped this off with balloons and a birthday note. The room was lovely and spacious for Amsterdam and very high Tec. Lots of buttons for lights etc. but not too complicated for this technophobe. The hotel is just outside of the centre but with a very interesting market a stone's throw away. I have to mention the staff who went above and beyond to make our stay enjoyable. Any request was met with a positive and the breakfast here, both the service and food are definitely above standard. Every choice under the Sun including hot, cold and even eggs benedict should you fancy it. The Sir Albert also has it's own restaurant which, although we didn't try it, was packed every night and looked lovely. All in all a wonderful stay thank you and we will be back.
title: Nothing too much trouble

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Impressively compact and efficient, with lots of design flair, and an airport location.... just a little too small and intimate for more than one person. See-through toilet cubicle, and the same for the shower!!
title: Rooms would be perfect for one!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel charged me for credit card costs I did not approved or made. I did not paid with a credit card. In addition, the reimbursement of the breakfast expenses i did not consume, did not happen. To me this does not constitutes affordable luxury.
title: Poor and the CitizenM will charge you with costs you did not approved or made!!!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The key thing about this hotel is knowing you will have a toilet and shower IN your room. If you know this, and are ok with it, the hotel is awesome. Great staff, great location (tram out the door and easy walk from the train station/metro), excellent breakfast and bar. Spent 3 nights here and other than having no room to unpack our 2 over packed suitcases, we loved every minute. This hotel was the starting point for 2 women in our 40s on a much needed vacation from family. No romance on the docket, so the in room toilet/shower provided extra giggles. And, as advertised, the shower is strong, the bed is comfy and the towels are soft. Would stay again.
title: Girls' escape part M

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel chain is actually pretty good! I was unsure whether I'd like it due to its 'open plan' nature which I'll go on to in a second. Great points - huge comfy bed! Wall to wallGreat powerful shower Fluffy towels Great selection of free moviesNot so great - There were people running up and down the corridor outside our room at 2 in the morning which disturbed us a bit, ( not the hotels fault)The toilet 'pod' isn't to my taste at all! But that's just personal preference, having only frosted glass between you and your partner watching the tv while you're on the loo? No thanks! The atmosphere in the hotel is lovely, staff all really friendly and the bar offers a good variety of drinks. Great hotel, just make sure that whoever you're sharing your room with you're super comfortable with!
title: Cosy, cosy!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed in the Citizen M hotel at the Airport in Amsterdam too, thats why I choose this one in the centre for a proper visit to Amsterdam. Location wise, it is about 20 by tram to the centre. Tram 5 stops almost in front of the hotel, which is perfect. Amsterdam South is quite posh, which is nice. The rooms are very modern, everything (lights, tv, heating aircon) controlled by the ipad, so maybe if you are a bit older and don't know how to work an Ipad, that might be a problem. To share a room you must be comfortable with eachother as the door to the toilet is a little see through. The bed is one big one, and massive by all acounts, which I loved. Rooms are small, but perfect with clever storage under the bed.Would deffinately visits again. Love this concept of hotel!
title: Lovely hotel in good neighbourhood

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I loved the hotel, rooms are so funky, bed big and smart room iPad. Bar is 24 hours and check in and out was simple. Only downside for us was that it was a little to far out from the city centre, although really easy to get to from the airport.
title: Birthday trip away

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Citizen M at the airport is a great hotel in a superb location. Citizen M nearer the city is a nice hotel in a rubbish location.Nice friendly helpful staff, hotel is also nice, but for me the location is just so far out from the main attractions...Getting a taxi in / out costs from 15 - 25 euros...Breakfasts are good but on the basic side, not much changes day to day...If this hotel was placed in the city centre it would be great, but of course it's not...next time i will stay closer to the centre....
title: Sub standard compared to it's bigger brother!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I askes for a small surprise for our wedding anniversary, but instead we got surprised with ... a lot!Perfect would I say! And the people are friendly, warm welcome, nice to be there. See you next time!
title: Suprise

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Check in was a breeze and extremely helpful. The rooms were small, but quirky. Everything worked perfectly in the room. Would certainly stay again when visiting Amsterdam. Great drinks choice in the bar also!
title: Cool hotel

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Since we start chatting on WhatsApp with CitizenM about our booking that we realised that we were in good hands! All the crew works there with love! They really like to make part of that team! They are always ready to help with everything! The rooms are small but very comfortable; the iPad control everything from lights to tv to films to AC to blinds etc. You chose the mood you want on your room and just enjoy the space! The bar service is also very good and open 24 hours! They are always there for you! So simple!! And to go in the center, you can go by bicycle and in 10 minutes you will be there! We will be back!!Thank you!
