title: Best choice for a very nice stay in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Thank you to all the lovely and attenttive staff at Citizen M Amsterdam who made our experience relaxing and enjoyable. The bar. the bikes, the mood lighting, the crazy fitness and yoga channel, the nuts at the bar (not the singing and dancing staff!), the interesting library, the sweet day shower gel and the sultry night shower gel, the amusing Citizen mantra and the humourous noise the lift made....etc
title: Happy Citizens

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed here for a work trip, great location 10 mins on train from the airport and 2 mins walk from the station. I stayed here solo, not sure I would bring my other half here though. It's very compact perfect for 1, just frosted glass between the bed and the toilet and clear glass on the shower:) everything in the room is controlled by and iPad - very cool and there is a great selection of free movies on the TV. Breakfast was ok, continental. Would return but only if alone.
title: Work stay

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel's concept is pretty cool, but I was left pretty grossed out by a blood stain on the mattress that was simply covered by a white fitted sheet. Housekeeping put a second fitted sheet over the mattress when I said something, but there was still an "ick" factor that bothered me. Otherwise the hotel is ideally located if you need to get to or from the Schiphol airport (5 minute walk to Amsterdam Zuid train station, then 6 minutes on the train to the airport). Pretty far from the city center, but the tram seems convenient.
title: Cool hotel but stained mattress :/

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It's my second time at CitizenM, always enjoyable place, really relaxing place. Good position, going out on the left you find tram number 5 that bring you in center, on the right you find railway station and in 10 minutes you reach the airport.Only one thing that i noticed immediately in this visit is that shower not so clean as before, not shower walls, but down where the doors are sliding really dirty. So nice place that i really have some difficulty talking bad but cleaning is need to improved
title: Always pleasant but cleaning of shower and toilet need to be better

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Booked this fab hotel for a 2night stay was absolutely delighted with all aspectsPure luxury at an affordable price Very accessible by all transport links & very friendly helpful staffAll in all a really great hotelCan't wait to go back !!!Fabuloso!!!
title: Weekend away

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Just like the title says this hotel is incredible. I had one of the best and most painless holidays i've ever had. Stepped off the plane and got straight on the train to the station closest to the hotel (Amsterdam Zuid). Whole journey was about 10 minutes to get to the station and 5 minutes to walk to the hotel. As soon as we arrived we checked in on their touch screen system in minutes and made our way up to the room. Whole process was so easy and so simple. We found the room with little trouble and my god what a room. It really felt like a modern hotel when the lights in the ceiling are controlled by an iPad and can even change colour! My girlfriend and I definitely had fun with the iPad. You can watch tons of free movies (brand new releases too!!!) As well as watch TV from the news to Comedy Central. The iPad lets you play music from different radio stations or airplay from your android/iPhone.We would fall asleep to a movie and the iPad had a feature that powered down the TV after a certain amount of time so we weren't disturbing our sleep. The alarm was a gentle wake up, the blinds opening slowly and the lights coming up really tied it all together. Ready to start the day we navigated to the closest tram stop (2 minutes away) and got the number 5 tram straight to the centre. Cost us €2.90 for a single tram journey but get a 24 hour ticket! It's only €7.50 and can be used on all trams all across the city for the entire day. Journey only took about 20 minutes to get to and from the centre. Such a walkable city!One of my favourite things about the hotel is It's constant attempts to bring you to the social areas where you can meet other travellers, sit on the big comfy sofas (where I currently write this review), or get a drink at the bar. Being new to the hotel I was given a 2 free drinks voucher so naturally my girlfriend and I got one of their lavish cocktails. Tasted amazing and was presented beautifully by our incredibly friendly bartender. One of the perks of the hotel is that if you hang a sign up on the door that asks the cleaners not to replace your towels then you get €10 every day to spend at the bar! Brilliant! 2 disaronno and cokes later and the bill comes to just €9, free drinks!I can honestly say that before booking any hotel in any city I will always look for a citizenM hotel. Amazing decor, incredibly friendly staff, a huge king sized bed, amazing drinks at the bar, the ability to control your entire room with an iPad. I will definitely be back.
title: Best hotel I've ever stayed in

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: How different! What a novelty! We had read all the reviews before making our reservation on Booking.com, but the hotel is 10 years ahead of all other places we have stayed in around the world. Super cool, small but good price for what we received and very high tech.Stay here and get the feel for yourself!!!!!!!
title: Super hotel!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We are just back from a three night stay here. Having previously stayed at citizenM in Glasgow I booked here for our stay in Amsterdam as we already loved the hotel and the location was perfect.Check in was quick and easy. We were greeted by a friendly member of staff who talked us through how to use the self service check in.Our room was very similar to Glasgow with the only noticeable differences being the shower and toilet were in separate pods.The huge bed is incredibly comfortable. There is a great choice of channels and movies on the TV and I always love the mood lighting. Great shower too.Everything within the room, from the curtains to temperature, is controlled by an iPad.The rooms were quiet except for the last night when the construction work at the front of the hotel was noisy and woke us a few times.The staff are what makes a great experience an excellent one. All very friendly and helpful. We were able to buy our tram tickets at the hotel and staff told us about how to check in and out of the trams and talked through the map with us.The hotel provides bikes free of charge which is another nice little added extra. The hotel is next to a tram stop and is a 10 minute journey to Dam Square and closer to the Museum Quarter. It is a short walk to the train station and a short train journey from the airport.The location meant that we could enjoy breakfast in a quieter location and experience the laid back atmosphere as well as the hustle of the city centre.We didn't spend much time in the hotel other than to sleep but we did have a few drinks and there is TVs, computers and comfortable seating areas in the main foyer.We had another fantastic stay at citizenM and look forward to another stay in the future!
title: Perfect!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It's wonderful strange hotel. Staffs are realy realy nice and kind they would answer your questions how many you ask all kindley and theie welcoming is realy good too, The rooms are realy modern and they are smart room you can control everything with tablet there are movies musics and radio for you in rooms,You can reach to city center easily by tram and it takes about 15minuetes.I recommend this hotel to families and couples.
title: Perfect hotel

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Quite a good place to stay, nice architecture, high-tech rooms, creative notes in every corner, friendly and warm ambassadors who are energetic, well located near the tram line and also the canteenM sells the day ticket trams.
title: New and brilliant stay

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Citizen has clearly worked hard on defining its offer, which feels modern and differentiated. Great beds leave little space in the bedroom but the living rooms concept really delivered, allowing for collaborative work or individual time in shared spaces. Smartpad controls in room felt a bit of a gimmick but functioned well so no gripes there. Catering offer, whilst not extensive, flexes well for people on different circadian rhythms or time zones. Helpful staff, known as ambassadors, which they were. Location is out of town but very well connected: easty walk through Beatrix park to RIA conference centre, 30 mins on foot to museum quarter, strolling distance from Zuid station which connects with airport or number 5 tram on doorstep.
title: Well thought out offer, good transport links, handy for RIA conference centre

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I have to start by saying this was a genuinely great hotel. Every inch of the hotel has been thoroughly thought through, planned in great detail, and made as comfortable as possible.From the little branding details which give a light-hearted feel about the place, to the helpful staff, and a foyer/bar which has clearly been designed to give the sense of being in a big lounge-room that visitors can feel at home in.The rooms themselves are excellent and very space efficient - but by far the biggest bed I've ever seen in a hotel. For a single traveller it's fantastic - although you'd want to be VERY close with your partner to share a room, as the toilet and shower are part of the bedroom so there's no hiding any intimate details. One unexpectedly cool aspect is the "smart room" feature - where everything from the music, lighting and blinds is controlled from one single ipad - very convenient.Overall, a thoroughly enjoyable stay, and conveniently connected with train from the airport (7 minutes) and a tram going into the city.Looking forward to staying again.
title: A truly new concept - like no hotel room I've seen before

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I like the Citizen M Amsterdam, because of the happy atmosphere, very friendly staff and excellent modern rooms. The rooms are modern, simple and luxurious, with mood lights, a superb shower and a fantastic bed. In the room you are welcomed with your name on the tv and i-pad screens, a nice person touch. The breakfast is also very nice. The location is convenient near the tram and the WTC train station.
title: The modern way to stay in Amsterdam!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The staff was excellent. Robby was extremely kind, polite, and helpful. I would stay at this CitizenM again just because of him!The location is also excellent. It is away from the city center (and all the tourists), but next to a tram stop which can get you anywhere in the city.
title: Excellent hotel!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I liked the style of the hotel, modern and quirky. I loved the possibility to personalise the room (light intensity and colour of the light, curtains and blinds) from the iPad in the room, which also had a good choice of tv channels, radio station and recently released movies. The really big bed was also a plus! And the fact that there is food available 24/7 really made the difference as I arrived at 11pm and very hungry! I also liked the presence in the hall of a nice and quite area with Apple computers, wonderful addition for people like me who need a quiet corner to work. Not fully recommended if you're looking for a hotel near the centre of the city, or if you like spacious rooms.
title: Quirky style, located in the business area

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: If you go to a Citizen M you need to know that you need to expect relatively small rooms. The bed goes from one side of the room to the other. This gives it a very cool feel. The interior decorating and modern tablet control of the room makes it a very fun and comfortable place to stay. Personally, I find it perfect for a city hotel although my brother finds the rooms too small. The idea in the Citizen M Hotels is that your leasure area is in the lounge/bar area and the rooms are literally only to sleep and watch a movie in. The staff were great and very friendly.I love the ambience, the moderness and the overall idea and setup of Citizem M. To get into town it takes about 20mins by tram and the tram station is just around the corner. This makes it a bit far out for some people, but it is definitely doable although coming back in the early morning hours was a bit challenging and we ended up having to take an UBER. The train station is about a 5 min walk and this is probably your cheapest option to get to the hotel from the airport. Only a few Euros.
title: Excellent and typical Citizen M!!!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My partner and I stayed here for 3 days in August and we loved it. The hotel is very modern and the tablets in the rooms to control temperature, mood lighting, tv etc was a really cool touch. The staff were very welcoming and helpful from the moment we arrived until we left. The tram into the centre of Amsterdam is a few seconds walk from the hotel and runs really frequently. The breakfast at the hotel however didn't look very appetising. Also, the prices in the canteen were a bit extortionate for small nibbles and refreshments. Apart from this it was a really good hotel to stay in and would recommend.
title: Excellent hotel

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed here not too long ago for my birthday trip to Europe. I loved this place, I can't wait to go back. At first I was concerned about the distance from the center, but the train to the center is right in front of the hotel so we got 3 day train passes which made it easy for us. At the time I booked there was a race in town so this was my best option and I'm glad I chose this hotel. The shower is like nothing I ever saw before although it was really neat to watch the light colors change. We also pretty much controlled the TV, blinds, and lights via an Ipad. I was very pleased with my stay.
title: Great stay!

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel ,staff very helpful and friendly ,the bed is big clean and comfortable ,room very modern,you monitor every thing in the room with an iPad ,food is excellent ,and affordable ,5 minutes walk to airport station ,and if you want to go downtown the tram no 5 is next to the hotel ,I highly recommend it
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Clean and comfy with everything we needed for a two night stay. Good location for the arena and sightseeing.Rooms are quirky with good facilities but the pod toilet might put some off! Beds large and comfortable.Only small irritation was super slow bar man on Saturday which meant our free drinks had to be "necked" otherwise all staff helpful and friendly.
title: U2 in wet amsterdam

hotelLocation: Prinses Irenestraat 30, 1077 WX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel, every time I stay here I have nothing negative to say. The staff are friendly, efficient and helpful. The beds are so comfortable and room temperature easy to manage. It's also very clean and well furnished
title: Fantastic, comfortable

review: The hotel is really nice, it suits the guests who would like to enjoy a relatively big rooms compared to amsterdam other small room hotels.It is located 15 minutes away by train or bus from amsterdam downtown but exactly infront of a train station.
title: value for money

review: Nice clean hotel great staff/service.The rooms were very nice and clean.Hotels locality wasn't the best but just one tram away from Dam square which takes roughly 20 minutes to get there.Only two close by restaurant one Chinese and the other Lebanese we not enough options to go out to eat around the hotel.Overall good experience hotel food wasn't the best but was ok as we had breakfast while staying there.
title: Weekend Away Dam Experience 🎉🍻

review: Great hotel, cosy & nice rooms, good amenities, just opp tram stop & away from the city hustle, good facilities provided in the hotel. Breakfast was expansive and coffee was excellent!However, 3 things:They provided Nespresso machine & we were so looking forward to a great cup of coffee , however the machine did not work on most days, It used to swallow the capsules and didn't work for couple of days despite all our efforts.No refrigerator in the room and that's ok but the can dispensing machine also did not work. So had to order cans & stuff from room service.The most disappointing issue for us was that the housekeeping cleaning service was quite bad, food stains, hairs & soap scum in bathrooms remained as it is and was never cleaned. I had raised a complaint with the front desk and was shocked to see the same stains & hairs even on our return & it remained that way for all the 7 nites we stayed there. Such was the quality of housekeeping. Other than that this hotel is great value for money, lovely restaurant Called Cedars, just walking distance from hotel & food was excellent there. Overall a nice place to stay!
title: Great Hotel, Location and Breakfast BUT!!!

review: Very modern, clean, comfortable family hotel. Not very central but easy access to the tram 2, which will get u to the museums quickly. The stop is in front of the hotel. Ask the staff and get a pass right in the hotel lobby. Breakfast downstairs is € 15 with plenty of choices. Only wish it had a fridge in the room. Nearby market, Albert Heijn, has anything you need. One of my concerns was the noise from nearby highway but with closed windows you'll sleep soundly. Enjoy!
title: Amsterdam

review: The hotel staff was rude when asked for information pertaining to the coffee machine in the bedroom. They also ripped us off by billing us on the mini bar items which were not consumed as we never opened the mini bar. As we were in a hurry to catch our train to Brussels, we did not confront them and paid. The over all experience was bad for us.
title: Bad experience / cautious stance advised

review: The room was way beyond our expectation for the price we paid. The double room was comfortable and spacious, and very clean. Same goes with the bathroom. We really appreciated the staff who are so friendly (especially one guy who helped us with the safe in our room, who was still happy even after going up and down 3 times for us to help us out) and also speak perfect english. The facilities are great and functional. There's a tram stop right outside, free WiFi, complimentary coffee and tea in the rooms, great cleaning service, a couple of computers and a printer if you need it, a small gym and a games room. You will definitely be taken care of if you stay here. Thumbs up to the staff who made our stay very comfortable!
title: Beautiful clean rooms, gorgeous interior design, great staff!

review: The hotel is absolutely amazing, reasonable trek from city centre but travel cards made it a lot easier. The room was well decorated, cosy and well equipped. The bed was comfortable and the view was nice. The customer service from the majority of the staff was amazing. We only have one complaint. After my partners purse was stolen we went to the front desk when we got back to the hotel but the woman at the front desk didn't even acknowledge us until we cleared our throats. After asking her what we could do about it because we've never had that situation and wasn't sure she said to us 'I don't know, I guess you could tell your insurance or notify the police' and showed a complete lack of interest towards the situation. We left it until the morning and spoke to another member of staff and they couldn't have been more helpful, unfortunately there wasn't much they could do but they still made the effort and showed compassion towards our situation.
title: Great Hotel, Great Price, Great service... mostly

review: A very nice hotel. The rooms are cleaned every day. There are coffee and tea facilities in the room. Fresh fruit available at reception. There is a restaurant, which you can pay to eat in. The tram stops just outside the hotel and the ride into town is about 20 minutes.
title: Nice hotel

review: Stayed for 3 nights for our first visit to Amsterdam. Great location 20 mins on the tram from the centre. Tram stops right outside hotel and there are 2 supermarkets if u turn right from the car park. Comfortable rooms with a coffee machine. Down graded this 1 star as depending on which staff you ask you cannot get any tea or coffee to make in the machine. When other staff are on its no problem. Breakfast buffett was good with lots of fresh fruit. Good price for a modern hotel
title: Would recommend

review: We had got a corner room and the view was a amazing. It's close proximity to the tram station helps in better connectivity to the tourist places.I was pretty surprised that we were denied the free bottle of water on day 2. We were informed that it was the hotelsPolicy to only give the free bottle of water on the day of check-in.
title: Rooms are brilliant

review: This hotel has a very good tram line connection from the centre. It takes 20 mins to reach from the central station to delflandlan which is right in front of the hotel. Though you may find it quite far but not a problem at all as the trams run very frequently till midnight. Rooms are neat and clean and beds are very comfortable. Washroom is spacious too.Overall prices are reasonable and this hotel is recommended if travelling is not a problem for you .!
title: Comfortable and quiet!

review: No where during the booking process were we told or is there any information to let you know that this hotel has a no alcohol policy! There is a minibar in the room but it is empty and doesn't work!I wouldn't mind this if I had known before I booked so that I could have chosen to stay somewhere else! Very disappointing!
title: Bar and Minibar do not serve alcohol!

review: Hotels in Amsterdam can be pricey but we consider Best Western Couture to be among the best value for money in the city. The location was quite far from center but the tram in front of the hotel made it easy to visit the city. Quick easy self-checkin system, the staff was available to help if you encountered any problem. Bedroom is clean, spacious with comfortable bed, it was nice to return to this room after long day of walking and traveling. We loved the bathroom with its floor heater, the shower had good water pressure too. The only downside was that the minibar fridge wasn't working in our room but front desk staffs were nice enough to keep some food we had refrigated throughout the stay. We were late risers so decided not to take breakfast in the hotel, but the buffet seemed to be good value for 12,5€ (a price of one plate of poffertjes in some pancake houses). We stayed for 3 nights and next time we're coming back to Amsterdam we won't hesitate to stay at this hotel again!
title: Great value hotel in Amsterdam

review: my wife myself and 2 daughters visited this hotel in July for 3 nights rooms only basis hotel was immaculate very large rooms with modern decor ,coffee machines,terrific very large bathrooms with walk in showers ....the location is terrific the tram stops right outside the door to take you to all areas of Amsterdam...only downside is hotel doesnt have a bar to have a nightcap ...if getting train from airport get off at Lelylaan station its just a short stroll from there
title: Great hotel Great location

review: We arrived early and while waiting for a room we sat in the Lobby at the coffee shop area drinking coffee. We watched the whole thing on the hotel security video. Well dressed couple sat beside our table and stole our bag. The hotel did nothing about it. The manager was nice but we never saw a police or report as he stated he was calling it in.
title: Robbed at the Hotel

review: We had a lovely stay here. The staff were very helpful and all spoke English. The rooms were clean and up to date with very comfy beds.Delicious restaurant, generally quiet in the evenings with a nice variety of options.Would definitely stay again.
title: Would come again

review: This is a very good stay which is near to tram station . the hotel staff is friendly, the rooms are very large and also affordable but its very far from the city which is not an ideal location when you are for a short visit
title: Good hotel but far from city

review: Great room comfortable only issue our mini bar not working. Went down to complain and they said ring room service I wasn't going to call room service for a can of coke. Liked the coffee machine and housekeeping realised we were coffee lovers so left us extra pods.
title: Comfortable

review: A lovely boutique hotel in a great location. Great service and a nice lower ground bar with a terrace onto the canal. Unfortunately one can not take drinks onto the terrace.The room was small and up a steep traditional winding staircase but with very high end and modern fixtures and fittings.
title: A Little Gem

review: Probably the nicest room I've ever stayed in. The canal view was really quite impressive, but the high point is the breakfast. I've never had better. Incredible variety of choices, and every single one outstanding. The 'a la carte' options were prepared to highest standard.It seems inconceivable that a place like this misses the mark on mundane things like wifi (terrible, laggy, slow, and strangely setup... 10+ SSIDs, "choose the best one"?!?). A better connection was available at the Heineken experience!?! The air conditioner was broken, and so we kept our windows open which forced us to enjoy the second hand smoke from the people on the terrace below. For the canal view and the stellar breakfast, these quibbles can be overlooked. But with a little extra investment, the place could truly be outstanding.
title: Could be perfect...

review: The location of this hotel is perfect if you want to be in a neighborhood environment and away from the craziness of the city. It's only 20 minutes away from the cruise ship port and about 15 minutes into the heart of the city. Many cafe's within walking distance and super cute shops.
title: Great Value, quiet hotel

review: John Lennon was right.. Amsterdam Hilton is a great place to rest from the crowds of tourists and rest with a picteresque view on a canal (photo attached).Comfy bed. Quiet environment. Friendly staff.Would definitely come back if there is an opportunity.
title: Perfect hotel for stay in Amsterdam

review: We loved this hotel's location in a more residential area where we could walk to the tram or to the museums and other busier areas of Amsterdam. The lovely park right in front, the canal out back, the adjacent neighboring shops, restaurants, etc. are ideal. The hotel itself is wonderful and the staff were very professional and nice. This was a bit fancier than we were used to but they made us feel welcome and comfortable and we were grateful for that. The restaurant out back on the canal is great. We really enjoyed the Executive Breakfast dining on the rooftop, it is a lovely layout with all one could want and a cappuccino machine to boot! It was unfortunate that our bathtub did not drain properly. We reported it and hope the next people to stay in 912 will have a better experience.
title: Quiet location in a rowdy city

review: Visiting this hotel was a great experience from the receptionists to the rooms being clean and the bar team from the manager downwards were awesome and very friendly. 2nd time I stay here and definitely won't be the last
title: Great Hotel

review: This hotel was really beautiful and the staff was helpful for us to get around Its a little far from the center of the city but a short cab ride to all the attractions museum's and bars and restaurants.
title: Good Hotel

review: Lovely location on one of the canals......especially for some drinks and lunch, walking distance to public transport, loads of parking spaces, awesome service and wonderful staff. The Hotel also has a great gym and fitness facility.
title: Hilton Amsterdam

review: We stayed here a couple of nights before a cruise, and could not have been happier. The location is excellent with easy access to the tram system, and if you wish to walk it's not that far to the museum area (maybe 30 minutes). Hotel staff were superior; three I'd like to mention are: Annet and Kin at reception- friendly, efficient, wonderful front-line personnelLinde in the executive lounge- friendly, helpful, nice conversationalist.We plan on returning to Amsterdam soon and will definitely stay in this hotel. Highly recommended.
title: Excellent hotel in Amsterdam

review: Amazing service from bellman to check in to concierge to amazing breakfast crew and every other Hilton employee at this property. Everyone is passionately engaged in providing above and beyond service ! My wife and I both agreed we would never consider staying anywhere else in Amsterdam . A real well run Gem !
title: A++

review: Though not very near to the hotspots of Amsterdam,situated in quite surroundings on a bank of a canal ( actually whole of Amsterdam is ) Hilton on Apollolaan is a charming hotel with a very friendly and courteous staff . Made famous by John Lennon and yoko Ono bed in, seventies , this hotel is true to its name.
title: A charming hotel actually !!

review: Visited the Hilton Amsterdam to have some cocktails - we were lucky to visit when it was a beautiful sunny day and we were about to sit out on the chairs over looking the canal. Beautiful surrounding area, good service, views and drinks. The hotel is very luxurious and beautiful.
title: Beautiful hotel

review: Top quality hotel within walking distance or Uber of main sights, but in a pleasant, quiet, upscale neighborhood. Fantastic restaurants nearby, frequented by locals. Hotel has gorgeous city views and is perched on a canal. Beautiful, peaceful patio restaurant and bar right on the canal...you can take a vacation from your vacation. Perfect place to relax after being around the tourist hustle and bustle. Exec package provides full breakfast and city view lounge with open bar and canapés in evening. Perfect!
title: A vacation from your vacation

review: We stayed here for a weekend to celebrate our wedding anniversary. Amsterdam is one of the nicest places to visit for a weekend . The vibe of the city is so relaxed and so vibrant . Restaurant and bars are full of happy people and it's a joy to visit . The hotel was nice and we had a nice acknowledgment from the staff as we mentioned in the booking we are celebrating . We didn't stay too much in the hotel as we were our most of the time . Hotel is clean and the usual good standard . Thank you for the beautiful weekend .
title: Romantic weekend

review: Stayed here during Viking post-cruise excursion. Very clean, very helpful staff. The included breakfast was really good with a lot of choices. The restaurant provided excellent food but was a little pricey. A bit of a walk (for an older couple who had already covered 56 miles on an 8 day Viking cruise) to the museum area and the city center but the tram system is inexpensive and easy to use.
title: very comfortable

review: This is a very comfortable very well appointed hotel. It is conviently located in the Ou Zuid district, close to Vondelpark and walking distance to the busy museum district and the old part of town, but far enough away that it is quiet and easy to live in.
title: Great location

review: Overall a good Hilton hotel with archaic internet access. Otherwise it is a reasonable hotel once you get your router to help make the internet access work reliably. Does not appear to be central in location.
title: Poor internet access

review: Rooms are not grand, had an executive canal view room which was small. Bathroom tiny so had to shower in the bath. Other than that the lounge and location and staff made it a very pleasant stay. Will for sure be back.
title: Stable comfortable nice location but very expensive

review: Stayed for one night on a business trip. Managed to squeeze in a lunch on the canal which was lovely. Rooms are spacious and well equipped. Conference facilities are nice and service is very friendly and attentive. Recommend.
title: Attentive service, lovely neighbourhood. Canalside

review: Hotel location is 10 minutes away from city centre, but it's so much nicer being tucked away.Their rooms are spacious, nice bathroom, has kettle and international TV channels, but carpet and wardrobe a bit dated.Their Italian restaurant does good food
title: Peace and quiet

review: This hotel and all its services are excellent. Lovely high-end residential area in a very safe walkable location to museums, transportation, restaurants and tours. Easy access to anything you want to see in Amsterdam. This hotel went above and beyond in welcoming us. Thanks for making our stay so memorable.
title: Romantic wonderful experience

review: Me my wife really liked this hotel. From Europe standard huge rooms great interior and lovely location.Staff very helpful snd well trained.We stayed in a jounir suite which was delightful.Wish we could have stayed longer.
title: Great hotel

review: I am not sure if this is the Amsterdam Hilton where John and Yoko made love in their bed for a week. But they did really help me and I am most grateful.I was staying for just one night while attending a conference. I found the staff most helpful, the rooms clean and comfortable and the common facilities excellent.Hilton is a strange brand. Once it was very grand and then it confused everyone by getting into the lower end of the market. Well ,the Hilton Amsterdam restores the brand in my opinion. Here's what happened.I checked out and caught the train to the airport. I was on my way to Italy for a friends weekend Birthday party. Only when I reached the airport did I realise I left my tablets in the hotel bathroom. I called the hotel and a wonderful lady from housekeeping arranged to send a taxi with my tablets to meet me at the train station. I got the tablets and made my way to Italy. Thank you, thank you, thank you. Exceptional and caring service!
title: Saved my life. Well,sort of!

review: We stayed here 1 night before and 1 night after our Holland America Cruise. Both nights were very nice. The gentleman who accepted our luggage and the young lady at check-in remembered us on our 2nd night return after we had been on the cruise. The breakfast on Sunday morning was amazing!! Wish we had been able to take advantage of it on our return! The rooms were very nice and the staff very attentive.
title: Hilton Amsterdam Pre and Post Cruise Stay

review: I was in Amsterdam for just one night for business. The central, peaceful location overlooking a canal was excellent. And I was glad to be welcomed warmly and recognized as Hilton Gold member. And the rooftop executive club was truly 5 star and top-notch. The rooms were certainly good enough - nothing particularly stood out though. I'd recommend this property for a business stay.
title: Definitely recommended

review: This is the Hilton where John and Yoko staged their sleep-in. There is an iconic photo near the main floor coffee shop. We arrived on a red-eye from U.S. and no early check-in was available. We are Hilton Gold and received a canal view without paying extra for it plus access to free breakfast and cocktails on the 10th floor. Staff professional and courteous, room large and clean. Hotel is located in the south of town and a bit further away from main attractions such as Ann Frank's house and the museums but reasonably priced making up for the cab fares. (We tried an Uber but it didn't work out, since they were not allowed to enter the gated Hilton grounds – they gave us a cross street to meet on, but there were no street signs – we got fined 8 Euros by Uber for not being able to find an unmarked intersection near the Hilton – we tried – walked around and all over). The cabs are not outrageously priced and two of our three cab drivers were great city guides and raconteurs.
title: John & Yoko's Hilton Hotel in Amsterdam

review: This hotel looks almost out of place in an upscale, newer neighborhood of Amsterdam. It makes a good visual impression, with a nice lobby. The location is okay if you enjoy walking a fair distance to get to any of the usual tourist attractions. Nor is it very near to public transport. The room I had was a good size and definitely clean, but the electric lighting was poor, and one outlet in the bathroom (the only one with a US style socket) did not work. Water temperature was hard to control. The hotel provided instant coffee and tea in the room, which you need to use because a coffee at the lobby cafe was 5 Euros. The breakfast buffet was very good, and they would also get other items upon request.
title: Nice Neighborhood; but a hike from the action

review: We had a great stay at this hotel. The room was clean. We selected a room overlooking the canal. Breakfast was exceptional at Robertos. The complimentary internet was ok and there was trouble with tv service one night. Other than that, great experience!
title: Great stay

review: Hotels in Amsterdam were crazy expensive in late July and we found this Hilton, which at $328 was steep but reasonable compared to other properties. The hotel feels like a 90s cruise ship but there is more than meets the eye. The backyard has views of a lovely canal. The rooms were fresh and turndown service was offered. The breakfast buffet was ample and tasty as was the selection and view of the Executive Lounge. For visitors, the hotel is a quick bike ride or walk to the Museum Quarter and other tourist attractions and the trendy Foodhallen is nearby also. The hotel also has a nice, modern gym and you can run in the nearby streets. Nearby there's a Joe and the Juice, which is nice, as well as Wilhems and Carter, which are nice neighborhood places popular with locals.
title: Pleasant surprise

review: *A Wonderful Hotel in the hugh end South of Central Amsterdam Location!*Excellent club with great views and excellent food and service!*Charming area to walk!*Great Hotel Amenities and staff!5 Stars!
title: LOVELY in Every Way!

review: The rooms are beautiful and the staff is very friendly and helpful. We really felt the accommodations were excellent. Though not in the heart of Amsterdam, this location is within walking distance of most of the oldest and historic parts of town. Just north of the river, including many of the boat tour kiosks, and near the central train station, the location is satisfactory. However, many of the museums are far. Uber is alive and well in Amsterdam though!So, this is a very good hotel. You are not in the middle of Amsterdam but you are at the center of everything toward the north end of the city. If you are willing to travel a little, then this is a great hotel.
title: Nice place, good location

review: We will not stay here again. Room was nice, but the gift shop was open 4 hours a day and the coffee shop was closed. Bar prices were very high, freeze dried coffee in the rooms, not offered early check-in when we arrived. Staff seemed "stuffy" too.
title: Hotel Amsterdam Review

review: My family stayed in adjoining rooms in July for a 3 day stay in Amsterdam. We were excited by the central, peaceful location overlooking a canal. And glad to be welcomed warmly and recognized as Hilton Diamond members. And the rooftop executive club was truly 5 star and top-notch. But we stay in Hilton's for their rooms. And while the Amsterdam Hilton rooms were clean and beds comfortable, the decor was a bit dark and dated, the bathrooms average at best and a glitch with the the televisions had them turning on in the middle of the night disturbing sleep. The opportunity of this property is amazing, and a bit of investment would yield dividends I'm sure. Anyway, I would recommend it as a good, convenient, clean, safe stay. Just not what I expect of a great Hilton property until they make some investments.
title: Great location, friendly staff … but needs a refresh

review: Poor internet. Restaurants & lounge were all too expensive. Minibar auto charge. Tried to bill me for putting food & drinks in minibar!! Not labeled as auto charge. Front desk attitude bad. Located in a pleasant residential neighborhood, 15 min walk to Van Gogh museum.
title: Unpleasant stay

review: -Nice and free Whirlpools on the rooftop-Good Bar and Restaurant on the 0 and 7th floor-Clean and well designed rooms-Metro Station is directly in front of the door. 4 Stations until the Central Station.
title: Perfect!

review: Was not sure what to expect when we booked this directly from the quirky website but we were not disappointed! The reason to pick this hotel was part price, part location and part the unexpected. Hotels in Amsterdam unless you want to share facilities and sleeping areas are extremely expensive - in comparison to other hotels of a similar standard this place was great value. If you dont mind a short walk (to the trams) or using the metro which is just outside then this place is great, services are regular and cheap to use and get you to all the main hotspots across Amsterdam. The hotel itself is a glorious mix of the unusual, the strange, the unique and that is just the staff! The place clearly has an idea about the vibe they are trying to achieve and do it very successfully.
title: Crazy but excellent hotel

review: My two teenagedaughters and I are totally crazy about this funky and vibrant hotel located in a building, who once housed a dutch newspaper. The rooms are practical, clean and Ikea-kind-of-cool. Love the lounge-lobby at ground floor - and the restaurant at 7. floor. Bring swimmingclose for the ourdoor wooden hot tub at the rooftop. The neighborghood isnt the most lively, but the metro is nextdoor and take you downtown in seven minutes.
title: Cool and cozy

review: My partner and I stayed here for 2 nights. We had a great time and the hotel was excellent. This is my first review but thought it was important to support independent hotels such as this and give credit and recognise the great service they provide.Amsterdam is a city that will accommodate every need. If you want history, fine dining, easy relaxed weekend, art, music or a wild time - Amsterdam manages to deliver all.Volkshotel is exactly the same, it manages to address the needs of an eclectic mix of guests. When we arrived we were welcomed and efficiently checked in. The lady at the desk was informative and friendly. The mix of people in the hotel lobby and bar summed up Volkshotel. There were students, groups of young men/women, families, couples and older friends all enjoying the same space. This is the beauty of Volkshotel it manages to meet the needs of all.We had the Johnny Jukebox suite and it was brilliant. The sound system set up was great and the room was just perfect yet quirky. Food and service at the hotel is very good. On the Saturday evening we arrived after the chef had finished taking orders. However the chef still offered to cook us a main course and it was excellent. We had our meal and the restaurant then transformed into a club with some great disco/funk and house music.In terms of location it is right by a Metro and short walk to Tram 3 which takes you to the museum quarter.Volkshotel has captured what it means to be cool. That is be yourself, be inclusive, enjoy what you do and don't take yourself too seriously.Yes you can find hotels that are more luxurious and high end but if that is what you are after you are missing the point of the Volkshotel and indeed Amsterdam. I hope this review helps people really enjoy their stay in Amsterdam and Volkhotel continues to be a success as they work hard and deserve the recognition.
title: Captures the spirit of Amsterdam perfectly

review: Stayed there with my girlfriend in July for 3 nights. Rooms are modern, TV with channels in various languages.ground floor, where the reception is, the great place to spend time, have a drink. few good restaurant around - recommend "Dovers Dog" love their food.10min by metro to city centre. from airport need take either taxi (50 EUR) or train + metro around 8 EUR/person and takes around 30min.
title: Great service and atmosphere.

review: We stayed here for 1 night after hearing good things about the hotel. On arrival, the reception staff were really friendly and accommodating. The downstairs area was really large comprising of a cafe as well as lots of seating where you can charge your electronics or simply relax. We later found out there was a ping pong room. The hotel is also right next to the metro with quick links to the city centre (less than 10 minutes). There is also a massive supermarket 3 mins walk away. There are also a variety of activities in the hotel to attend such as yoga, parties on the roof and fitness classes. The hotel itself is huge with 8 floors. Our room was very quirky. Concrete ceiling, hanging tv, pod like beds. Only thing the room could have benefitted from was a mini fridge. The room was on the smaller side but still ok for 2 people. The shutter blinds also made the room dark which helped early on in the morning when we were trying to sleep! On the roof is a lovely restaurant and rooftop bar area with impressive views of the city. The breakfast the next day was fantastic - a great range. Everything from fried breakfast to fresh breads/cheese and ham. Only downsides would be 1) when I pulled the sheet up from my bed there were other guests hairs that had probably been there a long time (which wasn't pleasant to see). 2) the hot tub on the roof seemed to be dominated by groups of men and the tubs were really small. Possibly a system where people can book a slot to use them would be handy to avoid people dominating the tubs.However overall we enjoyed our stay and would return again!
title: Cool hip hotel

review: I arrived early due to taking a 6am flight and was overjoyed that reception managed to accommodate my earlier than the scheduled check in time. The hotel is about 30 minutes walk from central station and is close to a metro if you are not a walker. There is a good range of local amenities and the area is trendy and central. Rooms are clean with plenty of light, a good selection of tv channels and there is a good overall vibe to the hotel itself. The only thing I think needs improvement is the nightclub. The two nights I attended were a bit of a let down ie sparsely attended and I wasn’t a fan of the electronic style music but hey you cant have everything.
title: Cool hotel in nice location

review: I love this hotel !! it has everything that a person needs. the design is interesting and the rooftopbar offers nice foods, drinks, GREAT MUSIC, and a lovely view :) i would defeinitely recommend it to my friends! the hotel has a great location and it offers you an innovative room design. the only "bad" thing is that the walls a little bit thinner than usually but I personally dont have a problem with it.defintely a great hotel!! :))
title: a really nice hipster hotel :)!!!

review: Stayed here for 8 night during a recent vacation to Amsterdam. The hotel is located right next to the metro station and about 4-5 stations from the Grand Central Station. It's super convenient. The hotel is located in a very cool neighborhood with some some shops and restaurants, away from the chained stores that you see in the city center. Staff is exceptional friendly and I really like the communal working place on the grand floor, as well as the coffee shop/bar area. It's really has a great atmosphere and I had a great time staying here than a standard international hotel chain. I would highly recommend to stay here to enjoy and experience another side of Amsterdam, while it's still close to the Grand Central station.
title: Hip & Fun Hotel. Cool Staff and Spacious Rooms. Close to Metro Station!

review: My husband and I had a great time!. The hotel is right off the Metro station and is clean with friendly staff. We rented bikes for the day to explore the city and hung out in their downstairs bar for food and drinks after a long day of adventures! We would definitely come back next time we're visiting Amsterdam!
title: 2 Nights in Amsterdam

review: Didn't want to pay the ridiculously high rates for accommodation in Amsterdam central so looked Volkshotel which was reasonably priced and a 10min train ride away (there are 3 trains headed to central so literally a train arrives every few minutes). It was so close to main points of interest that you could easy ride there as well.At first glance there didn't seem to be too much else in the area but you'll be able to find several places to eat as well as the occasional coffee shop. All a short walk away.. or an even shorter bike ride away. Plus.. when I was there they just opened a supermarket almost next door.The rooms aren't massive but comfortable enough for 2 people. Modern styled and very clean. In a way though it's a 'budget' hotel of sorts, so don't expect the bells and whistles like a fridge, branded amenities or even an in room telephone. There is a tv with plenty of channels as well as a safe. The staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. They made the stay there that much better.The overall vibe of the hotel is very young, hip and happening with guests mainly on the younger side.I would recommend this place to a friend and I would definitely stay there again if I was in Amsterdam again.Especially if you are a couple looking to explore Amsterdam and are looking for a cost effective base to see the sights. Volkshotel is ideal.
title: Awesome option for couples looking for a cost effective base to explore the city from

review: We quite enjoyed this place. Good vibe. Great aesthetics from the funky art on the walls and hallways to the city map they give you that's worth framing. We enjoyed the first floor bar (or "zero" floor bar in Europe) and the roof-top breakfast buffet, which I thought was decent value. At night, the 7th floor had a great open air patio that looked out over the city but we were chased back indoors by all the smokers. Rooms clean. Staff nice. It's a few minute walk to the center of town but the Metro is close and efficient.
title: Cool hipster hotel from a repurposed former newspaper building

review: Stayed in the Edmund Hillary room. Had a good bath, shower, bed and projector. Fun decor albeit a little dark and certainly no view. It was disappointing that there were no tea or coffee making facilities.The downstairs bar / cafe was well priced, very relaxed and friendly.There is a restaurant on the top floor that we didn't use.Excellent position for public transport, nearest underground approx 50 metres.Parking available for 17.50 euros for 24 hours.On one of the days our room was not serviced by house keeping until 5.30pm, by which time I was in the bath!If you like friendly, different, relaxed then this maybe the place for you. If you want to be pampered in luxurious surroundings I would probably give it a miss.
title: Fun

review: Amsterdam is a relatively expensive city for hotel accommodation, especially during peak season when we visited recently. Volkshotel is certainly an unprepossessing building from the outside - its monolithic concrete and glass exterior resembling something from the Communist era - but the contrast with the interior couldn't be more stark. This is a very cool, colourful and characterful hotel offering very good quality accommodation for a reasonable price. We chose the petite room, but were pleasantly surprised by its size (it was considerably more spacious than many hotel rooms in which we have stayed in similar cities); in fact, the hotel as a whole feels spacious and benefits from high ceilings and generous proportions. The room was spotlessly clean, the shower was perfect, the bed comfortable, and the view from the room was better than expected thanks to the very large window and pleasant aspect (facing attractive period housing across the street, but also with views to the adjacent busy main street). We didn't try breakfast, but the 7th floor restaurant/ bar/ nightclub offers great views, as does the top floor roof terrace (next time I'll remember to bring my swimwear!). The only drawback is the fact that the hotel is not really centrally located, but it's a 20-30 minute walk to many key sights and just four stops on the metro to the Central Station (or about 35 minutes' walk). The immediate area seems safe and perfectly fine, and there are local eateries as an alternative to the city centre. Volkshotel is highly recommended for tourists on a budget who want something different, individual and funky.
title: Funky, convenient & good value

review: I stayed at Volkshotel for 4 nights a couple of weeks ago. This hotel has its own unique style of retro pop/rock feelings. I booked a Standard room but was upgraded to the Sir Standard room at the corner with two large windows of city view which was excellent. The room was cosy, functional, and fun. It makes staying at a hotel is not only about sleeping but has some positive feels to it. I especially love the large long desk by the window that I can eat, read and put everything on it. I did not use the hot tub on the rooftop but it seems fun. There are many spaces on the ground floor to meet and hang out. Overall, staying at Volkshotel gave me some new experience. It's not the most luxurious, nor the most inexpensive hotel, but it's definitely a fun, comfortable one. Oh, did I mention the Wibautstraat metro station is just outside the door of 2 minutes of walking, making the traffic super easy.
title: Chic, Funky, and Cosy

review: A very good hotel with a quirky and quite hipster feel to it , friendly staff and within a couple of hundred yards to the nearest metro which takes you to the city centre within a few minutes. Never tried the food in the hotel but had a drink at the bar which was ok. Hot tubs on the roof looked good but didn't go in as weather was a bit cold. Best part of the hotel for me was the chilled feel to it and our room although small was cosy and well worth the price. Would recommend to anyone staying in Amsterdam and would visit again.
title: Trendy , Cosy , Good location.

review: Stayed here for one night with my dad. The hotel is really quirky and fun. Since we stayed mon-tue there wasn't any noise from partying or anything. The club I the seventh floor was actually quite nice for a drink and enjoying the view. The location is not bad, four stops on the metro to the central station or a nice walk along the river. The beds are on a raised platform, so you sort of have to climb in. There was only one stool, and it was a twin room so there should have been two. My only real grievance is that the breakfast is far too expensive (€24/person). If you walk one block towards city centre you find "The breakfast club" which serves a great breakfast for a better price. After paying good money for your room it feels strange to pay more for the hotel breakfast than you would at a restaurant.
title: Not bad - travelling with dad

review: Volkshotel was such a quirky hotel! I must say I have never stayed in a hotel like volkshotel before and i was extremely pleased with it! I booked the petite room but it was more then enough for the two of us.Clean and super comfy bed. Shower had great pressure and even came with automatic window shutters!Breakfast was divine, assorted breads, salami, cereal, crossaints, cheese, salads, bacon, eggs, fruits. One day they even did freshly squeezed orange juice.Rented bikes with them with no problems, location was right next to the metro which was handy. Super friendly staff. Would definitely stay here againThanks Volkshotel for such an amazing stay.
title: Wow! Such a quirky fun hotel

review: Great premises,well decorated rooms in reasonable price away from the touristic, crowded city centre.Amazing staff ready to help you and make you feel comfortable.The underground station and the bikes you can rent at the hotel make your transportation very easy.The lounge and the panoramic exceptional bar-restaurant on the top floor serve delicious meals and drinks.There is always an event on.Don't miss it!!!
title: The best hotel in Amsterdam!

review: We stayed here for two nights as part of our honeymoon and thoroughly recommend Volkshotel. For any first time visitors to Amsterdam- Get on the train from the airport, it costs 5 euros each and brings you right into Amsterdam Centraal. From Centraal Station, you need to get on the Metro (That's the underground one, not the trams above ground) for four stops. You can buy a ticket from the machine outside or inside the station...I would advise getting a ticket that covers the amount of time you are in Dam for...Very good value!Conveniently the hotel is located before the lines all split off so it doesn't matter which you get on...You get off at Wilbautstraat. This means the metro is running every couple of minutes to the hotel rather than having to wait for a specific train...Handy! When coming into Centraal Station from the hotel, you need to cross the road and ensure you get on a train heading to Centraal Station...Again, because there are five lines all running that way, you never wait very long!When we checked into the hotel, we had a party bag waiting for us as a gift to the newlyweds which was a nice touch. A party hat, a couple of party horns and a pack of bubbles. Made us smile! The check in was swift and simple and the staff were friendly. We chucked our bags in the room and had a look round the hotel. There is a cafe on the top floor...We didn't eat there but everyone seemed friendly enough! We went up to the top floor to have a look at the hot tubs next. It wasn't quite what we were expecting but was very much in line with the theme of the hotel. The hot tubs were sort of large barrels with what looked like a log burner next to them pumping heat in through a pipe. No jacuzzi buttons or fancy lights but they looked like a nice place to relax in the right weather conditions. While we were there it was wet & windy so we didn't take the opportunity to take a dip!The room was more spacious than we expected (My missus had been trying to blag a Honeymoon upgrade so maybe we were in a bigger room than we had booked!) and the bathroom was nice with a good shower. The bed was comfy and there was plenty of room for us to both get ready for a trip into the centre. I noticed another review suggesting the area looked a bit dodgy but we didn't get that vibe at all. When we first arrived and came up out the metro near the hotel, a friendly local drug dealer saw our confusion at which way to go next and asked us where we were trying to get to...He pointed us in the right direction and told us he would be around there later if we needed anything...haha. If the drug dealers are that friendly in the area, it can't be bad! Walking back from the metro late at night, we never felt unsafe...I would say the previous reviewer had a one in a million experience!We had a great time in Amsterdam again and if we go back for a fourth time, I will certainly check in on price and availability at Volkshotel before booking anywhere else.
title: Nice hotel in a decent location

review: Stayed her for my Stag but luckily not your usual Stag place. Used to be old newspaper NQ and has media and art creative themes abound. Awesome roof terrace and bar, hot tubs and saunas in the roof also, all with great views. 2 great nightclubs and great cocktails bars, perfect for groups in super chilled and bohemian vibe
title: Oozes cool

review: This is the coolest hotel I have ever visited. Nice design all over the hotel, relaxed atmosphere, nice staff in the reception and the restaurant. The roof top baadplats with bathtubs with panoramic view is a great experiance!! Unique!
title: Fantastic

review: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights. We got upgraded, so we had quite a spacious room with two twin beds and a loft with a double bed. It's my second stay with Volkshotel and I will probably return next time I'm in Amsterdam. We rented bikes one day as this is the perfect way to get around the city. It takes about 10 minutes to cycle to the city centre. The hotel has a very cool bar with burgers and really nice Volks pils (beer) :-) They also have rooftop tubs and sauna. Everything is down to the details in this hotel and it's all done with humor ;-)
title: Cool, warm and welcoming hotel

review: We arrived to early for check in but were able to leave the luggage at the hotel. The room was small but clean and well equiped. The bed was fantastic.We had our breakast at the panoramic Canvas on the 7th floor and it was great and more than enough.See you soon Volkshotel!
title: The laidback friendly atmosphere, the amazing view frow the rooftop hottub

review: Visited here based on reviews and very happy we did.Location: not crash bang in the centre of the tourist hotspots, but certainly very conveniently located to get anywhere really by metro. A mere few stops and you're at Amsterdam Centraal and the metro stop is literally a 2 min walk from the front door. Thumbs up. Comfort: room perfectly comfortable. Decorated in a minimalist / brutalist kind of style. Unusual shower which you could look into from the bedroom. Fine for us as we are a couple but maybe take heed if you're not! Atmosphere: hip and friendly. Always greeted by friendly receptionists who would go to great lengths to help you out e.g. orienteering you around city, printing tickets etc. Also appreciated being fast tracked through to front of queue for lift (was a busy night in night club on roof and there was a queue for that). Food: only tried the brekky. At around €12 if I recall correctly, it was good value. Expansive selection of quality hot and cold items. Interestingly had one of the most tasty salads of recent memory from the breakfast bar. Value: it wasn't cheap as such, but I think it was because we visited when there was a big music festival on so it must have been a busy time. Nonetheless, think good value for money. I would definitely return.
title: Fun and convenient

review: The Volkshotel is one of the most unique hotels I've ever stayed in. It's in a quieter area outside of central Amsterdam just a quick metro ride away (4 or 5 stops). We had 4 people in our group so we reserved the Ms.Big room - it is a lofted style room with one big bed on the ground and two suspended bunk beds up top. My husband and I slept in the suspended beds (climb ladders up), which were actually very comfortable and gave us a little "hiding area" where we could eat snacks while watching the TV down below.The hotel is equipped with everything you need. There's a fancy restaurant called Canvas on the 7th floor with great views and a bar with drinks + snacks in the main lobby. Our last night in the hotel we enjoyed the rooftop hot tubs and sauna, enjoyed a small plate and cocktails at Canvas, then headed down to the bar for snacks, drinks, and a round of Scrabble. The music played through out the hotel is great and the vibe is young and inviting.I would gladly stay at the Volkshotel again if I am back in the region and would recommend staying here 100%.
title: Funky + Fantastic Hotel in East Amsterdam

review: The hotel is right outside a Metro station and about a block from a tram that takes you into the Museum precinct. They also offer small boat canal tours (8 ppl from memory) which are reasonably priced so you don't have to do it on one of those larger touristy boats. We went up the eastern channels around the zoo and ended up outside Amsterdam Centrale staion. Hotel is on the main road but as bikes are the main form of transport little road noise could be heard, and nor were sounds from neighboring rooms present.
title: Neat quirky hotel

review: We stayed at Volkshotel for two nights in a family room and totally loved the place. Great feeling, friendly staff, good rooms, lovely view, etc. The 3 pools and the sauna on the rooftop are awesome (no need to bring towels). Great food both in the restaurant and in the lobby. Loved the breakfast (don't go to any of the nearby breakfast places - the hotel is much better value for money). A/C worked great and the room was very quiet despite being on the 6th floor (below the bar/nightclub). The downsides are:- Really strong perfume smell in the room. Way too much. Probably from cleaning products. - Rather hard beds. Especially in the elevated area in the family rooms. Also note that if you're staying in a family room and have smaller kids, you probably won't like for them to sleep upstairs (steep staircase, not enough protection from falling down). Thanks for a great stay!
title: Great hotel

review: We were a family of four spending one night in Amsterdam before moving elsewhere. The hotel was perfect for our needs. When we arrived at around 12.30pm the hotel let us check in early which was most welcome as we had an early flight. The room was a total hit with us and the kids - comfortable , spacious , impeccably clean and different from your average hotel! We used the top floor hot tub twice and were surprised that there was no one else availing of the facility. The top floor has a fabulous vista over the city. The hotel is so convenient for the underground which is just outside the hotel door. There are reasonable places to eat close by. The only slight downside we had was the hotel food which was overpriced for the quality of food received. The continental breakfast was €48 for two adults and two kids for a fairly basic buffet breakfast.Similarly after coming back from a day's sight-seeing , the food offering is limited and expensive. That said I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for its location and amenities- Brilliant for a short stopover in the city- but eat elsewhere !
title: Great hotel - quirky, fun - do not hesitate to book

review: Where else on Earth could you book a hotel room in which a functioning vinyl record player is installed and connected to a surround sound system? Perhaps nowhere else but Volkshotel!If you couldn't tell, I stayed in the Johnny Jukebox room. I highly suggest everyone to check out the special rooms if you haven't done so already! They're considerably more expensive than the standard rooms but could change your whole time in Amsterdam.The Werkplaats dining, Badplaats hot tubs and almost the entire Johnny Jukebox room were excellent! The Canvas breakfast buffet was good although it was one-up'ed by the buffet at my Zandvoort hotel. Service was excellent too!The only major issue I had was a little trivial but the bed in the Johnny Jukebox room is surrounded by a sloped wooden frame structure, meaning you pretty much need to step on the sloped portion and then step onto the flat floor in order to get out of bed. Someone with a bad sense of balance might not handle that well!
title: A delightfully weird hotel for delightfully weird people!

review: Everything was perfect from the beginning, the place is awesome, the staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are really nice. If I have to say something negative it would be that it is a bit far from the centre, but there is public transport just opposite the hotel.
title: GREAT PLACE, NICE VIBES

review: Room was cute, cool (I stayed in the summer), clean and well serviced. I loved that I could open the window for fresh air. Well located, easy bike ride to the main tourist area. Hiring the bike was an added convenience. Breakfast upstairs was pretty good (but an added extra charge) and excellent views of Amsterdam. Service was good, staff seemed a little cool at first but I suspect that's just the Dutch way, they were actually warm and friendly once you asked or initiated contact, and I found them really helpful, friendly at the front desk. I loved the Werkplatz, full of people, activity and great music. I especially loved the pianist who played in the afternoons, and even jammed with the soundtrack after his own 'set'. I was nervous about club music but I was there when events were on and wasn't disturbed in the least. The only disappointing thing was no tea or coffee facilities in the room... pretty standard ask and makes a big difference if you're there for some days. Overall a very relaxed, relaxing, fun, funky and place to stay.
title: Good vibe, comfortable, relaxed, funky & close to centre.

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: I had a wonderful stay at the hotel! The staff was very friendly and professional. A big thank you to Esmee for her friendly assistance with my check-in and booking. She made me feel welcomed. My room was spacious, clean and spotless. This standard was maintained each day. I have stayed 7 days. The breakfast was delicious. The breakfast team could consider to provide different varieties each day. The WiFi worked excellent. The hotel is not in the inner city, but can be easily reached with tram 26. It's sometimes nice to get out of the busy crowd's. I will definitely recommend this hotel for your future stay in Amsterdam!
title: Wonderful stay!

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: The best front desk staff ever; trained to find a solution for EVERYTHING!!! Beds very comfortable, room extra clean, excellent breakfast. Great location (directly at the tram station - only 5 min to Central station/ City center in very safe area).
title: 150% satisfied!

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: Great Hotel but needed unlimited tram pass because was out of the city center and there was nothing to do where it was located. Great free breakfast though, great staff, and rooms and hotel was very clean.
title: Great Hotel, but location OK

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: My friend and I stayed at The Hampton, Amsterdam East for the first time and Rowie (Front Desk Agent) was fantastic, friendly and helpful during our stay! She greeted us with a smile daily and helped us plan our excursions. The location at the hotel is easy and the breakfast is really good. I will be back for sure!
title: Fantastic service!!

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: Newly done hotel, clean n contemporary looking, i loved the location more or the hotel I’m yet to decide...its Amsterdam out of Amsterdam....v nice evening snacks for your drinks, v courteous staff, he packed me some fruits and cookies for my lil one. v near to metro, calm, peaceful and lovely stay it was.
title: Crisp is the deal!!

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: The Hampton by Hilton is by all means fair value for money, especially for Amsterdam. The room was very clean, the breakfast was good and staff were professional. Compared to many city breaks and many other hotels I have stayed in Europe, this is a good hotel. However, the price is still a little on the pricey side and if you are an avid traveler like me. You actually do not spend so much time in the hotel! However, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would seriously recommending this hotel to others (dependent on their requirements). Thank you for looking after us! :)
title: Couple's short stay for city break

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: Hotel is located 3 stops from the Centraal Station on the 26 Tram. Using the 10 Tram to get to museums, etc. was also very easy. Buy a multi-day pass for the trams and buses. Trams stop at midnight, so get to know the bus schedule and drop offs if you plan to hit the clubs and bars. Room was nice (typical size for Amsterdam) and the breakfast was very good.
title: Excellent Stay

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: This hotel and its staff,rooms and breakfasts were wonderful. I would return tomorrow, if i could :-) The hotel is very near the tram with easy access to the Central Station, the staff are friendly and the hotel is managed nicely. The hotel is a new hotel and it is very nice. The free breakfast exceeded my expectations a lot! The staff were helpful and the room was nice. My husband didn't think the bed was very comfortable but I found no problems. There are only three channels in the room for the television, for English. I watched more National Geographic than I've ever watched before, I would have liked more channels as at night my husband and I iike to watch TV prior to going to bed. The hotel should have adapters for different countries to convert electricity without having to traipse around the city looking and buying conversion adapters. That said, I would return to this hotel anytime. I loved our stay!
title: This is an amazing hotel

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: Its a very nice Hotel very near Central station.just 3 stops away from central by tram 26 which one can just outside station.Very good staff and good breakfast...Hotel is in a quiet place and good neighbouhood.
title: Good hotel near central station

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: Highly recommended. Close enough to the downtown craziness without being in it. We hired bikes from the hotel and went on a tour of the local area which was great. Staff were friendly and answered all of our queries
title: Excellent stay. Hotel was clean, modern and friendly. It is 2 tram stops from central station but I actually liked this

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: Location, location, location. Modern, extremely clean, well built with an excellent staff. Safe, nice neighborhood, less than a 5-minute tram ride into city center. Tram stop is across the street with several great restaurants, coffee shops, a small shopping center on the water. Great property for a family at a reasonable rate. We were there with our ten years old. Wanted to be close enough to city center but not in the midst of it. If all Hampton Inn properties in the US is thoughtfully built as this one; there would be many more happy travelers.
title: Excellent convenient accommodation

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: New hotel according to Hampton standards created in a former institute building. Limited parking in the building plus overflow parking garage on the other side of the street which has to be manually opened by hotel staff. Cost of 25 euros for parking is a bit stiff.Room quite comfortable and low noise. Breakfast included and rather good with coffee from real beans. The young staff is friendly and can just about cope in the busy mornings.
title: Pleasant hotel, expensive parking

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: .Rooms are very clean.staff great.Breakfast great.price moderate.location great-ask staff about take tram 26 to central station (then go anywhere by bus,tram,cab or walking)Tram 10 loops the city
title: Vacation

hotelName: Hampton by Hilton Amsterdam Centre East
review: I had been stayed one night for leisure purpose. Take tram 26 from central station and only two stop takes this property. My confusion was from station. It was a bit difficult for me but a local gentleman who assisted me. He was really kind. Esmee who checked me in by friendly and cautious assurance. She was extremely pleasant and emotional engagement was there during checking in. Acknowledgement as Hilton hornors member was also there. I had been stayed total four hilton worldwide property in Amsterdam during this visit. I can say she was the best and role model as checking in process. Most impressing part was courtesy call.once I entered my room within 10 mins I received a call from her. Thanks for excellent first impression from esmee needless to say my entirely stay became excellent. Cleanliness in the room was also perfect. On top of that housekeeping staff ( gentleman) was also friendly. Breakfast was minimum item of food selected. Regarding cutting bread by self service was the best in any other hilton worldwide property in Amsterdam. Once again thank you very much for memorable and unforgettable stay.
title: Location and comfortable

review: We were a family of 2 adults, 2 kids and stayed here from 4/9 - 4/12/2017. This was a rare Amsterdam hotel that had a room for 4 people and was within our price range. We had a two bedroom suite with a bathroom. My sister and I were in the bigger front room and the kids stayed in the adjoining back bedroom. Front desk staff was perfect, very helpful. Our rooms were clean and housekeeping maintained a high level of cleanliness throughout our stay, The bus to the city center was a 5 minute walk from the hotel, The neighborhood was very quiet and near the bus stop were restaurants, supermarket, pharmacies and little shops. Would gladly stay here on my next trip to Amsterdam.
title: Great family hotel

review: We booked a 3 night stay for our wedding anniversary and picked this hotel as it is just outside the old town but within walking distance. The check in was efficient and we were upgraded to a room with a small balcony. The room was clean and the balcony had very comfortable wooden benches with cushions. The bed was very comfortable and large. Unfortunately I was unwell the day after our arrival so did not get to experience Amsterdam itself but what I did experience was the hotel staff at their best. I needed a Dr on our 2nd night and the night receptionist was able to advise my husband regarding this and also advised of the option to go to the walk in centre rather than the cost of calling a Dr. I was unable to leave my bed so the Dr was called, he was English speaking and very efficient, the receptionist then telephoned for a taxi to take my husband to an ATM and then the hospital pharmacy. All in all not the short break I had expected but the hotel was excellent and telephone twice the following day to see if they could do anything. I would be happy to book this hotel again and hopefully next time be able to enjoy it.
title: Excellent hotel and staff

review: This hotel is very comfortable and stylish. It's about 25 mins walk from the city centre but the public transport is brilliant. Taxis are a bit expensive though. The breakfast in the hotel is lovely but it's much cheaper to just get it when you're there rather than buying it as part of your room offer. You can build your own breakfast from a menu so you only pay for what you get. Staff are lovely and helpful and the hotel is very clean.
title: Great Hotel

review: This is a lovely hotel and room was ideal for 3 adults. The only down side is location. The number 22 bus stops about 4 minutes away from hotel but it's probably about 20 minutes on the bus into the centre. Staff were very helpful and friendly.
