title: Lovely hotel, location not ideal.

review: Stunning hotel, very friendly staff and really accommodating, had a standard room which was cleaned daily with fresh bedding and refill of coffee. Great location away from the busy centre but not to far to just jump a bus into central station. Amsterdam I have fell in love with, I will return and back to this beautiful hotel.
title: 4 night break

review: We booked a stay for 3 nights in the 4 star area. Beautfiul clean hotel and friendly staff. Modern rooms with comfy beds and a nespresso machine in the room. WiFi worked more or less allover. Large breakfast buffet with everything you need (cold and warm food/drinks) to start the day in a perfect way. Nice swimming area (didn't use).It's close to the city, you can either walk or take the bus nearby (approx. 5 minutes walk to the bus station and then a 10 minnutes drive to centraal station). The bus is running regulary and often.I can recommend this hotel and would go back anytime.
title: Excellent hotel to stay

review: We visited the hotel 10 days ago, when we arrived we were asked to authorise 516 euros . This was fine as this was a pretty standard request and allowed us to settle our bill as we left the hotel. When we left the hotel charged my card again instead of using the authorised amount. My bank explained it will take a long time for the funds to show in my account as available due to being in Europe. My bank recommended emailing the hotel and asking them to cancel the authorised payment. Which I did and received no response. I am still waiting for this money to be available in my account. Secondly when we arrived, I requested my friends room was near us. The manager immediately interrupted and said in a sarcastic/rude tone "You book with a Multi Million pound company and expect a personalised service, Booking.com take a huge amount of my profit. If you wanted a personalised service you should have booked with the hotel direct" We had just finished travelling and were feeling a little bit flustered as it was, and this was not the welcome we were expecting. For the remainder of the trip I felt uncomfortable being in the common areas if the Manager was there. The hotel is advertised as a art hotel, but most of the art covering the hotel is pretty ghastly, and gives the building a very confused feel. The swimming pools advertised to not belong to the hotel, these are public swimming bathes but are available to use if wanted. The hotel ran out of bikes for our second day which ruined things considerably as they did not give us any help to find alternative bikes, and the hotel is a long way from the centre. My advice would be to find a different hote.
title: Lovely hotel let down by incompetent staff, and rude Manager

review: Lovely hotel on the very outskirts of Amsterdam - 20 to 30min walk to town centre. Very comfy rooms with large soft beds (5stars) and modern clean bathrooms though ours had a large shower. Very good restaurant and bar area and a serious amount of art work on all the walls of the hotel. Quick check-in process and the counter has a lovely water dispenser flavoured with fresh fruit. Hotel has an outside pool for adults and a shallow area for children, I didn't use it so can't tell how warm the water is. On the whole a very nice hotel.
title: Weekend stay

review: We spent five nights with kids here. Everything was great we got very good service. The room was clean and quiet. Good connection to public transport and the bus comes very often ( Central Station just 12min )
title: Great staff.

review: My original review below was published prior to my issues with my final bill. In short, I was overcharged 110 euro on my bill, and the amount I agreed to pay in advance through booking.com (436) was not the amount the hotel charged me (456.58).It took several emails to the property to finally get it to admit the overcharge and refund my 110 euro. The additional 20.58 euro overcharge on my advance payment was explained as a “city tax”, although a 25.78 city tax was also applied directly to the bill. So double city tax then?I am no accountant but the various explanations to try and clear this up just left a sour taste in my mouth. At this point, I took the rightful 110 euro refund and have to walk away in frustration.It’s too bad because we enjoyed our stay at the property, but next time in Amsterdam the hassle of dealing with this bill issue will make it tough to justify staying here again.ORIGINAL REVIEWStayed in "4 star" area - not sure of the difference - but it was perfectly fine for a family of four. Nice hip vibe to the place.Impressive swimming area (didn't use), nice vibe in lounge (small food menu). Staff were pleasant and gave us umbrellas for the day it rained.It's a little "out of the way"; 5-10 min by bus to centraal plus 5 min walk to the bus stop from hotel. Only real issue was VERY poor air conditioning in our room. Like, nonexistent. My own fault for not saying anything, but we have encountered this in Europe before so maybe just a European thing?
title: Amended review: Great property, overcharged on bill

review: The room was clean and comfortable (3 beedroom). The staff is super friendly and very helpful. The hotel is close to Amsterdam Centraal (Bus 22 - about 10 minutes). We also appreciated the daily coffee capsules in the room for the Nespresso machine, lemon and ice water at the reception for free and a computer and a printer in the lobby.We had a really nice stay.
title: very nice

review: The room was quiet and in decent shape although not the cleanest but average. The front desk staff goes into quick mode when a few customers are waiting which is fine but unfortunately it does not make you the customer feel very welcome. Now when no one is waiting the two ladies running the front desk the day we arrived helped us out a lot. We got our city map along with a book of tours in the area and then sat down to decide on what to do. We decided on a tour and they helped us book the tour and get us our local city bus pass for 24 hours. The next day when we asked out the shuttle to the airport we found out we needed to pay for the service even though the website makes you believe it is part of the hotel service. We then asked our options and the gentleman behind the counter tried to steer us to a cab instead of the local hotel shuttle service and that goes between the area hotels and the airport. He also suggested the city bus over the shuttle and there was no way we would attempt the city bus with all of our luggage from out two week cruise. When we refused the cab and the city bus he seemed to be affronted to our decision to take the shuttle. We asked if the van service takes credit card and he said yes but the information was not completely accurate. He did make the call to get the shuttle to stop by but after that he was done with us. The hotel should have offered the tickets there at the front desk. Why could we book and pay for the tour and local city bus service the day before but not the shuttle? The shuttle driver could NOT accept credit cards, only their service desk at the airport could. The driver had to make two extra stops just for us so I could pay for the transport to the airport because the first desk we stopped at was having problems with their credit card machine. Overall not horrible but it is not a 4 star hotel as the entrance doors claim.
title: Good and Bad - i.e. average

review: My family and I visited the Netherlands early July starting with a 2 night stay in Amsterdam. We chose the WestCord Art Hotel as it was easy to reach from the main ferry terminal in Amsterdam and had onsite car parking. We were not disappointed The hotel was super stylish and the staff were very helpful. We ate in the hotel on one evening, the food was lovely however, there were only two staff on duty and the restaurant was very busy - we would of ordered a few more drinks with dinner if we had the opportunity - still the staff on duty did their best. The family room we stayed in was fantastic, main double room with an adjoining twin room for our children. Amsterdam city centre was only a 30 minute walk from the hotel, although we could of took a bus, we enjoyed exploring the streets by foot. I would definitely stay here again if given the opportunity.
title: Family break in Amsterdam

review: Lovely modern hotel. Lobby area is beautifully decorated. The rooms are great. Spacious, clean and modern. No complaints. Also the restaurant on the lobby is great. We ate breakfast and lunch there. Not included in price. 3 min walk to the a bus station, so transportation is easy although this hotel is away from the city center. 10min ride to central station by bus #22. All and all would stay at the hotel again, but may choose a different location closer to the city.
title: Great hotel

review: We stayed two nights in this hotel in a family room (2 adults / 2 kids). Two double beds in the room but there was still plenty of space and the room was very clean. It's only 10 minutes from Amsterdam Central on the 22 bus and the bus stop is a 3 minute walk away. Staff were all very friendly and helpful.
title: Clean, Friendly and Value for Money

review: We really enjoyed our stay at the hotel. It is all very modern and nicely decorated. The bathroom was nice and clean and had a huge shower. We even got a welcome card and complimentary water when we arrived. The staff was helpful and nice throghout. We would definitely recomend this hotel to everyone who likes to be close to the city centre but enjoys to have a quiet good night sleep.
title: Very nice modern hotel with good sized rooms and air-conditioning

review: Nice hotel. Cool art in the hallways and modern rooms with all the expected features. Staff are very friendly, helpful and overall Dutch (good!).Bit of a trek to the centre but there are bikes to hire and a local bus very near the home. Avoid the hotel bar and restaurant for although pleasant it'is a bit too expensive for what you get. There are plenty of cafes and bars in Amsterdam anyway.All in all a lovely place to stay for a long weekend away. The gorgeous receptionist also lent me an adapter which may make this review slightly biased ...
title: Clean, quirky and quiet

review: Room was very confortable but it usual due to the priceA bad point : service into the restaurant. Waitresses are very helpful but waiters do not know you are waiting for something...Position is good but do not buy hop on off tickets for bus trams. Buying one ticket into bus 22 is efficient
title: Good and disapointment

review: Returned home from Amsterdam early hours of this morning. Stayed at Westcord Art Hotel. 6 adults and 2 children. My first impressions of the hotel were that it needs a little tlc on the outside. The inside reception area was lovely and bright. The staff were friendly, polite and accommodating throughout our whole stay. I felt our family room was a little dated and the pull down bed that the children slept on was damaged (obviously not the hotels fault) but the beds were comfortable and clean. (Our other family members had more modern/funky renovated rooms) The pool at the back of the hotel (not owned by the hotel, but you can get free passes from reception) was a huge bonus and my youngest son went there every day of our holiday!!! There is a bus stop a small walk away and a bus that will take you to Centraal Station. Round the corner from the bus stop is a row of shops/takeaways/restaurants. There are children's parks and swings down nearly every street, which is a huge bonus when travelling with a energetic 7 year old. We didn't eat in the restaurant, but we often had coffee and drinks. It looked clean and it was well staffed. Would we stay here again? Yes without a doubt we would love to go back :))
title: Family getaway .......

review: This hotel is warming there is a bus stop outside takes you to the city centre.The rooms are very stylish and comfy beds. Very clean.Staff are so attentive and helpful.Food is brilliant.All round defo 4 star.
title: Brilliant

review: As the name suggests, art is the theme with many works by Dutch artist and musician Herman Brood. It certainly hits you when you enter. Don't be fooled by the 3 star and 4 star rating. It is one hotel with the main entrance in the big red building, not the grey one next door. Reception staff were helpful upon checking in though they had assigned us with a double room. We wanted a twin room but our booking was for either. This was quickly rectified and we were given another room.Whilst the original double room had a view of the street (not much to look at), the twin room my friend and I settled in had a view of the pool and surrounding green area which was better. There was a Nespresso machine in each room (a fancy coffee machine but very noisy).The room was clean though like most hotels though I wish the USB plug sockets were near the bed rather than near the TV, which worked well and had channels from all over Europe. The bathroom had a large and powerful shower. There is also an electronic safe.Easy to get into central Amsterdam by the 22 bus heading east. Also useful when getting the train from Sloterdijk station to wherever (22 bus heading west) as it is less crowded than Amserdam Centraal station and many trains pass through Sloterdijk.
title: A colourful hotel with the artwork

review: I spent the weekend here with 2 friends and we share a room for 3. We thought it would be a tiny room but were surprised with a very nice room with 2 queen size beds (made of 2 individual beds each) and a very clean bathroom which is always key for me.The hotel itself is very nice, as an art hotel it has a lot of paintings and artsy designs in display that you can take a look at. It is very well located, not too far away from the city (about 10-15 min by bus) and the bus stop is around 350 m from the hotel.Breakfast is included and it has great variety and taste great and the backyard has a wonderful pool.Great value for the price for sure!
title: Great location and amenities

review: Lovely bright spacious hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. Bus stop close by to the centre. But it is also a nice half hour walk. Rooms were clean and well equipped. Bed very comfortable. Lovely supply of coffee.
title: Weekend away

review: The hotel was about 4km out of the city centre but only a 3 min walk from a bus stop where buses ran every 10 minutes. Friendly staff, they couldn't do enough including sending up maintenance straight away when the room safe failed and setting aside an area for us to put up pictures and play a few games for the hen night.Lovely food and reasonable bar prices. fabulous.
title: Fantastic base for a hen weekend

review: WE had a wonderful stay, there was 3 of us and this hotel was roomy for European standards. There was a water park wit 2 large pools that belong to the adjacent hotel but we had use of. Within walking distance to center city. I t was a great stay and the staff was hospitable.
title: great stay with water park and within walking to everything

review: Stayed here for 2 nights. Beautifully clean hotel with everything you would need for a few nights. Out of town but bus route just up the road. We walked into town both days and took about 30 mins. Fantastic art throughout the hotel & fantastic staff!!!We didn't eat there so couldn't really comment on any of the meals. Nice outside seating area and very large swimming pool which although we didn't use was popular with other residents & very clean. Good children's pool also. Very pleasant stay & would recommend to friends. Excellent value considering the amenities of the room and the hotel.
title: Wow!!!

review: Rooms very comfortable and staff very helpful with getting around and services in the hotel. Food was great had steak on my last day. amenities are generally great am gutted i was there in the winter cause i loved the outdoor as well
title: i give them 5 star for services , food etc but the location was a little bit of a distance for me to the city

review: My husband and I stated here for two nights in this beautiful hotel.We stayed in a junior suite the room was very modern.Bar a very quiet relaxed atmosphere where a var menu was available with fantastic meals.However there was some construction works being carried out at the entrance but it didn't bother us
title: Modern hotel

review: İt was quite and peaceful area. Location is not bad. Tram, bus are go to city centre in 15-20 minutes. Rooms are good. Roof is excellent. I can stay again in your hotel. But ı wish roof was open till midnight.
title: GOOD

review: Excellent front line staff. Special mention must be made of Patrick as nothing was too much trouble for him. We were also most greatful of his suggestions of places to visit as well as his advices regarding transportation. Also appreciated how he quickly got hold of the doctor when one was required.
title: Great Satisfaction

review: This was our second time to Amsterdam and we decided to stay just outside central amsterdam because it would be cheaper! This trip was our honeymoon, we loved being here last time so came back! when we arrived the staff were very nice and our room was wonderful, the bed is really comfy and the little kitchen is great if you want to just stay in one night or have breakfast! The hotel is in a great location 5 minutes on the train to Amsterdam Central. I would highly recommend this place if you don't mind a small train ride in & out of Amsterdam and want a small little 'apartment' type of room!
title: perfect

review: One of the best things about Hotel2Stay is it's location. It is 2 stops from Schipol Airport on the train, and 1 stop before Amsterdam Central. It is a 2 minute walk from Sloterdijk train station so it's perfect for both getting from the airport and into town. It also has a tram stop at the station (number 12) that goes past Anne Frank House and up to the museums.The hotel itself is fairly new and it looks sleek and stylish. The rooms are light and comfortable, with a couple of chairs and a decent sized wardrobe. The fittings are nice, and there is a Senseo coffee machine in each room that beats the standard sachets of instant coffee! Housekeeping was regular, changing towels if required and squaring the room up. The room could have been a little cleaner, it just seemed a little grubby.The hotel has a sauna and a gym that we didn't use, and a nice roof terrace that we did. We sat out till closing time which is 11, but the staff were ok with us staying out a little longer to finish our drinks before they locked up. Staff were very accommodating of requests, and very helpful in general. For the price, this hotel was very good value.
title: Good location outside the city centre

review: Excellent location with Sloterdijk train station and tram terminal on the doorstep. Long stays can be booked at reduced rates and the facilities, washing machine roof terrace, gym and sauna help make business trips manageable. Friendly staff and studio facilities with clean equipment , fridge, hob and microwave. Just 20 minutes tram ride from central museum plein or 10 mins on the train to central station.
title: Convenient location, great for business trips, friendly staff

review: We had an issue with payment checking in and even though we had the money and sorted it, in the meantime staff were incredibly rude and laughing at us in Dutch, not knowing I'm a fluent speaker... no food facilities and area is barren other than a small Spar supermarket and Sloterdijk station.. hotel could have been cleaner but overall would recommend if it wasn't for the terrible customer service.
title: Rude and impatient staff..

review: Very clean and spacious.However the bathroom's drain was not very good. The hotel is extremely convenient to visit the Van Gogh museum and the museum area in general (tram 12). Centraal station is only two train stops or direct by bus.
title: excellent location

review: Hotel 2 Stay was well priced and is very convenient to transportation. Hotels are very expensive in Amsterdam and this hotel was the best value I found. It's very bare-boned but had what we needed. It was very clean, up-to-date and the staff was extremely helpful.
title: Good value and easy local transportation.

review: I had a great stay in hotel2stay; clean rooms, great bed, perfect facilitations in the room (full service kitchen) and in the hotel (gym, sauna), very friendly hosts. Used the fine parking spaces in the basement as well. Altogether I very much recommend this hotel to stay!
title: great stay!

review: One train station away from Amsterdam Central.Clean, nice, modern, looks new.Very good front desk always with a smile. Would come back here and recommend it to all my friends.You can't beat the price/value for this property.Thanks!!
title: Really really good!!

review: Pleased about our stay. Ideal location. New and modern. Looks exactly as it does on the website. Daily housekeeping needs to be improved. Microwave was never cleaned prior to our check in. Our room was never swept or mopped.
title: Pleasant

review: Really friendly welcome. Room was spacious, and well decorated with self catering facilities and a generous shower room. Massive bed and plenty of wardrobe space. The hotel had a small gym, but we never used it. We stayed for 3 nights, which was a perfect length of is to visit the city. Sloterdijk station is on the door step, with access to the city by bus, tram or train. Lovely helpful staff throughout the stay. Even borrowed an umberella on a rainy day. Couldn't recommend this place enough
title: Fantastic modern hotel in a fantastic location

review: Very helpful staff! Location is outside the city but very well connected to central through bus and tram. The rooftop is really cool! Staff is polite and knowledgeable. There is a kitchen available to make your own breakfast.
title: Comfortable Stay!

review: A fantastic hotel! You appreciate the price/quality ratio when you are in Amsterdam. The location was great, near a big transport hub. The rooms were light and spacious, with wonderful beds and very soft bedding. The kitchenette has everything we needed - and more. Shame we did not get to use the sauna or the gym. The Reception staff were remarkably helpful and friendly at all times. Will definitely be back!
title: A super hotel

review: Hotel was clean, large rooms, conveniently located close to public transportation. Although it is Amsterdam, I think it is expensive for what you get. Booked this hotel because there were no other options at the moment, but don't think it will be my choice for a new visit.
title: Good place but expensive for what it is

review: This hotel is perfectly located, just few steps from bus, tram and train station. Grocery SPAAR is very close, so we didn't need to pay for breakfast during our stay. After our arrival we were a bit afraid that there will be the noise from the street, but all we heard in the hotel was silence. Our apartment was beautiful, clean and we fell in love with our king size bed - we were unable to get up from there as it was really comfortable. Huge advantage is also big terrace on the roof of the hotel - unfortunately we were there just once during the last day of our stay. I recommend this hotel to everyone who doesn't have full pockets of money, but wants to have beautiful accommodation with great access to city center. We can't wait to be back :)
title: Perfect location with bed from heaven

review: Had a great big room for 1 night all for myself, room 227.Definitely possible to stay for 3-4 persons there.Room was not properly cleaned, saw long black hairs all around.The dishes are not cleaned by the cleaner, so I am suppose to take care of it myself, wtf?Luckily dishwasher there, I put it on the moment I left.Shower hardly had pressure.Wifi was fast(standard for NL)Breakfast in different building but limited variety, also service there was lacking and the place looked like pritty bad.Was able to keep my suitcase there, after checkout.Personell friendly.Location great, halfway in between airport&city centre.
title: 1night 1person

review: Arrived at Hotel at 3pm on Fri 7th July. Staff were nice and friendly and check in was quick. We were situated on 4th floor and the room was spacious, clean and had a brand new memory foam mattress so the sleep was comfy and great. Bathroom was all modern with a fab shower. Cannot fault the room at all. Its in the perfect location as was quiet and only 5 mins away from central Amsterdam by train. You can also get the trams from outside to the museums. There is a coffee machine and vending machine in reception if your thirsty/peckish but then the supermarket is literately 2 mins away and you can get a all day travel card from there for €7.50. Also there are hairdryers, kettle and a coffee machine provided in room. All in all a great stay and would stay here again when i return to Amsterdam.
title: Lovely Hotel

review: It suited us to be out of the city a little bit. The transport system in Amsterdam is brilliant & is on this hotels door step both bus & train. Very near a lovely park to walk in the evenings. Facilities in the room where fabulous, it was bright clean and very comfortable with everything you would need.
title: Location

review: Service great and helpful. Apartment clean, comfortable beds, well equipped kitchen .Very good location.Getting to the center by tram, bus and metro all 5 mins from the hotel. Hotel service nice, helpful
title: Opinion

review: The room is very big and comfortable.with a kitchen that we didn't use. Great to have cattle for hot water.we had No cleaning services for 4 nights stay. ( only trash ) we let the front desk know after 2 nights but they didn't take car of the issue.The room was to hot and humid !No air conditioner and to noisy to open a window.
title: Great room , no service

review: The staff here are fantastic, rooms have necessary amenities, close to trams and railway station. Cleaning staff are the nicest I've ever come across. My only criticism is loud music from nearby clubs
title: A nice hotel.

review: No faults at all staff we're amazing with great knowledge very helpful... rooms as immaculate and modern looks unreal!! Such a great stay also in a quiet location and so easy to travel around the dam with train and tram station outside the front door..Nothing serious but could be become? Possibly a may or something on the shower as they get very slippery
title: Awesome stay!!

review: We stayed at the Holiday Inn Express Amsterdam South for 4 nights. As soon as we arrived we were bowled over by the amazing customer service. Nothing was too much trouble, and they went out of their way to be helpful.The hotel was lovely and clean. It was also very quiet, due to location and that most people staying here were stay for business reasons. Breakfast was a continental buffet, which was fine for us. Do not expect to be able to get a 'full English', as you will be disappointed. The hotel were particularly attentive to dietary restrictions such as allergies or the need to eat Kosher. Unfortunately there is no restaurant on site but there are some local restaurants and a supermarket a few minutes walk away.From the hotel you can use the Metro 51, which is again a few minutes walk. This line can take you into the Centrum and Amsterdam Zuid station is approximately 3 stops along, where you can change to get a direct train to Schipol Airport (1 stop along). I would not hesitate to stay here again or to recommend the hotel to others.
title: Great customer service

review: The staff at Holiday Inn Express are exceptionally welcoming, warm and friendly and always helpful (Megan and Alejandra especially). The rooms are cleaned daily. The rooms and the hotel are designed simply, they are warm, comfy and welcoming. The lobby also has a wonderful area with couches. The beds in the rooms are comfortable. The location for people who eat Kosher is terrific, being a few minutes walk away from local stores and restaurants all Kosher, as well as Supermarkets with Kosher departments in them. The location of the hotel is great as well in the sense that there is a tram and metro that pass very close by and they can get you everywhere. (Most importantly, the city center and the central bus station). If you keep Kosher, the hotel gives a Kosher breakfast (notice that the Kosher area is opposite the non kosher area, so if you see a hog picture, you are not looking at the right foods for you :)). The kosher breakfast is sufficient, but not much more. It includes slices of bread, cut up cucumbers and tomatoes, a boiled egg, slices of yellow cheese, fruit and some spreads (honey, jams, butter etc.). Drinks include juices and coffee/tea. I think that's more or less all. (If you do not keep Kosher, there is a much wider variety of foods for you! I saw muffins of different sorts and all kinds of pastries. Looks good ;).)As this hotel is marked as an "Express" hotel, it is aimed for business people and not intended for long stays. Thus, you will not find any closets at all in any of the rooms!!!! (I received this explanation when we arrived and discovered no closets). As we stayed 8 days, it was quite uncomfortable in that aspect. If you come with children, naturally, you will have a lot of things you will need handy...it is hard to keep any order in a room with no closets...(We just kept most of our clothes in the suitcases :( ). There is only a shower in the room (no bath), and the hot water becomes cold every few minutes (only for a few seconds, but still), also the water pressure doesn't seem to stay the same. All this being said - since the staff is so welcoming and the feeling of the hotel so warm and friendly, we did have an excellent stay nevertheless.
title: All in all it was a good place to stay at.

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: As business trip, transportation is per-arranged for fully booked appointments outside the hotel. Overall experience is good. However, the hotel location is a bit far from the center without conveneient stores surrounding for personal trip.
title: GM

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Close enough to the city centre - wlaking time approx 20 mins or hop on the tram which is directly outside the hotel! Close enough to central Amsterdam but also far enough out to get some peace and quite and enjoy views of the river amsel Clean room with friendly and helpful staff
title: Central Location with Stunning View

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at the Movenpick hotel for an overnight stay prior to taking a two week river cruise from Amsterdam to Budapest. The cost for the stay was quite high.We had no trouble in checking in mid afternoon and left our luggage in our room before going out to explore the city. We returned to the hotel just after 20:30 and went to our room which was located near the lift shafts on level 8. It was then that we noticed the continuous noise coming from the lift shaft as the lifts went up and down. We contacted reception and requested a room change to a quieter part of the building but were informed that this was not possible due to the usual response that one gets at hotels "we are fully booked and there is nothing available".We were quite disappointed at the response. Unfortunately, we did not get a good nights sleep due to the rather incessant noise.We don't believe that we got value for money paid and find it hard to recommend this establishment based on our stay.We've chalked it down to experience and will carefully vet further stays in hotels.
title: Mr Peter Smith

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It was 19 May 2011 when we arrived into Schipol airport Amsterdam and it was lovely weather as we checked into Movenpick by the side of International Passenger Terminal used by Cruise ships. the hotel room overlooked the sea on one side and the Red Light district on the other and the Centraal Train station was also walking distance. The staff of Movenpick and our entire experience was just amazing.
title: Land of Tulips and Dykes

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The room was ready for our early check-in at 11 am.We found the room to be quiet, clean and superbly outfitted.Staff were friendly and the receptionist brought the towels and shower gels midnight upon the request as the room cleaning was not done on the 3rd day due to the reason that we were sleeping during the day when the cleaner tried to come to the room.Plenty and tastefull Breakfast with lot of options and hot food , never tried the dinner and the ice cream.Location was very near to the centraal station and the views are superb from the hotel.The only difficult thing experienced was that our room cards were expired after the first day but the receptionist was asking for the i.d. Before she gave us the new keys , luckily i had a passport copy in my e-mail and showed it to her.That is the the extra security measure from the hotel side but it would have been a trouble if there was no i.d. In my e-mail.
title: Central location and nice hospitality

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: excellent location, got early, tried to sell me on a suite for additional 300 euro for 2 nights. got the cheapest room, although paid for vip room, took 10 minutes to change to the right room. i don't understand why i didn't got my room to begin with.
title: visit to Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My family spent the night in a room for three and it worked out perfectly for us. It was close enough to the Railway station (1 tram stop) and also afforded us a lovely view of the harbor with the visiting ships arriving and departing.
title: Room with a view of the harbor

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very clean, quiet and wonderful view from upper half of hotel - get a city view. Right on the Ij River so you can watch all the boat action as well as beautiful night and day views if the Amsterdam. Staff was very helpful and friendly - even had a current converter they let us borrow to charge our phones. Room was also good size and bed very comfy. Small fridge included. Very handy to tram station to take you to Central Station where you can get to anywehre in the city!!
title: Confortable

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed for 2 nights in preparation for a river Rhine cruise.We were situated on the 20th floor facing the river and were able to watch all the river traffic pass by.The view was nothing short of amazing.The room size was good by European standards with all mod cons including minibar, cable TV with movies, tea/coffee facilities, etc.Bathroom was a good size with illuminated makeup mirror and hair dryer.I liked the fact there was an ironing board and iron in the room. It makes all the difference if you have been on the road a while.The reception and concierge staff were extremely polite and helpful.Restaurant and bar staff were cheerful and polite.There is a gym and massage facilities available.The tram stop to the city is 300m away and there is a hotel shuttle that you can use as well.Amsterdam is a bike friendly city so it is no surprise to find the hotels have bikes for hire.The hotel is close to the waterfront, central station, science and maritime museums and the city centre which is 3-4 tram stops away.I would highly recommend this hotel.
title: Great view great service

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel!Rooms are very comfortable, and clean!Great location, walk or courtesy shuttle to main train station.All staff is Fantastic, very helpful. If you feel like takeoff a bike, there's a rental shop right next door.
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Beautiful, spacious room with lovely views, convenient to city center. Great buffet breakfast, staff friendly and helpful. I would stay there again. It is right next to the dock for the popular river cruise ships and to Central Station. It's a 10 minute walk but the tram stops right outside if you want to connect to mass transit. Very convenient.
title: Pre-cruise stay for Viking River Cruise

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This location is wonderful. Close to the train station, cruise centre, airport and city. The dinners are very good and generous portions with a reasonable price. The breakfast is pricey though 25 Eruos per person, but it is a buffet and a large variety to choose from.
title: Nice central locaton but $$$

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Movenpick was a top hotel in a very convenient lkcation to end the long day of being a tourist in Amsterdam. Helpful staff and it was very close to where we finshed our cruise . Would highly recommend it.
title: Days end

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We've stayed at this hotel on previous occasions and it is always very nice and convenient. Staff is helpful with suggestions on places to visit. breakfast buffet was very nice. We stayed in the concierge rooms and the snacks, wine was very good.
title: Convenient location to cruise ships, rail station and attractions

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Movenpick hotel is wonderful. The room was clean, the staff helpful and was of a good standard. The hotel is a tower so any room offers a great view. It is a five minute walk from the central station and city centre. So you can go into the city centre have a great time and then come back to a quiet night sleep. The beds are comfortable and the breakfast is great. I will however advise that they invest in an omelette chef. What they were making was horrible. However I will always be booking the movenpick. I enjoyed it and recommend it.
title: Great hotel, Great staff and great breakfast.

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here in June before we boarded our Rhine River Cruise down the romantic Rhine River with Avalon Cruise Lines. It was an excellent experience for staying in Europe the first time. Everything was just perfect, especially the check in, breakfast, and concierge advice and service. It is very convenient to the city and tram service. We would absolutely recommend staying here the night before your cruise. We want to go back soon!
title: Excellent Choice

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Need to offer earlier check in, ensure pre-authorization charge is actually cleared from guest's credit card. Also, was not advised of where breakfast was (second floor) at check in. So when I checked out, I gave my room key back and then had to wait in the elevator lobby until another guest went upstairs (as the elevators are only activated by a room card swipe.)
title: Very nice hotel overall, but with room for improvment

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This was our second visit in so many years. We find the Movenpick not only a great hotel with a fabulous breakfast but it's location close to the central rail station makes it a good base of operations for visiting Amsterdam as well as other cities close by. It's close proximity to the Cruise Terminal is also a huge plus for cruise passengers.
title: Still a great place to center your visit.

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My travel agent recommended this hotel and I wasn't sure what to expect because it wasn't right in central Amsterdam. But I loved it. Clean, modern hotel with friendly, helpful staff. Room was very comfortable and had a fantastic view of the river/city. Only a short (15 min) walk to central city and close to Central Station. The breakfast buffet was out of this world. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
title: Great Find in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at the Movenpick for 4 nights. We received a friendly welcome. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Nothing was too hard. The rooms were clean and the view we had was amazing, seeing for miles. The distance to the city centre was a short walk, but the best way to get around was by tram. The no 26 dropped you at the door of the hotel. The food in the restaurant, at breakfast and in the ground floor bar was very nice and well presented. Would highly recommend this hotel.
title: What a great stay!!

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is within easy walking distance of downtown and Central Station. You can get anywhere from here easily. They also have a frequent shuttle to Central Station which is free. There are also quite a number of nice restaurants and bars really close.The hotel itself is very nice, clean and quiet. The people are great and will help with whatever you need. I recommend this hotel very highly. If I return to Amsterdam this is where I will stay.
title: Very nice and clean, great location

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We arrived in family to Amsterdam after a long trip. It was important a quicky and easy check-in and check-out, also an excelent breakfast the next day.Excellent location to walk to Downtown, NEMO and Navy Museum.
title: Great place

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed for 5 night on holidays in amsterdam. 2 Adults and 3 kids age 15, 13 and 10. It was perfect. Clean, nice staff and an 8 minute walk to central station. Interconnecting rooms super. Loved it.
title: Family city break.

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Nice city hotel with a very good location in the middle of the city.The rooms are spacious and the gym is well equipped.The lady who checked us in (Laura), was very welcoming and friendly and gave us a lot of information.Definitely would return
title: Lovely and good location

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: For cruisers this hotel is in the perfect location and views from bedrooms are great. Bedrooms are of good size and well appointed. Bathroom is good with very good shower. Breakfast is excellent with wide choice.
title: Cruise ship convenience.

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This was a 2 day stopover for us prior to our river cruise departing Amsterdam. We enjoyed a lovely stay made more enjoyable with a room upgrade that provided scenic views of the harbour. The room facilities were excellent & clean. The area was wonderfully quiet with easy access to the city & station. We would not hesitate to return here again.
title: Quiet & convenient

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The staff in this hotel were amazing. Every single one went out of their way to help you with anything you needed - especially the concierges. Everyone at the concierge desk were so so helpful, gave us advice on attractions to go to, how to get there, what transport to use etc. They saw us constantly getting bike taxis and came up to us to notify us about other cheaper transport we could get, which we did not know about, to get to places. The staff go above and beyond to make sure your stay is perfect and that you are satisfied, could not fault them at all. Me and my partner stayed in the Junior Suite and it was a perfect room - extremely clean, so spacious and the bed was so comfortable and the view was incredible. Only problem with the room was there were no plug sockets near the full length mirror which was quite annoying when getting ready, and maybe another mirror could have been added in the room as well, however these are the only faults I could pick from the whole stay at the hotel. Location wise the hotel is not bang in the centre however is just a five minute walk towards it which is nice as there is no loud noise coming from the centre when in the hotel. Overall, the staff really made mine and my partners stay at the Movenpick Hotel, in the Executive Lounge they made sure we were waited on hand and foot and that we were fully satisfied. One of the best hotels I have stayed in and would definitely come back!!
title: Amazing Service!!

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at the Movenpick for 2 nights before a Viking River Cruise. We arrived from our overseas flight at 8AM and to our surprise our rooms were ready! Staff was friendly and accommodating during our visit. Our room was spacious and lovely. Very efficient modern design. The restaurant in the hotel was excellent. Dinner our first night was wonderful. Excellent wait staff, beautiful view and delicious food. Breakfast buffet offerings were extensive and also delicious. The hotel is located within easy walking distance of the transportation center as well as the center of town and the river cruise docks. Also across the street from the trolley. Alert! Watch out for scary bike traffic! I would highly recommend this hotel.
title: Beautiful hotel in convenient location

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: spectacular view to the river und cruise ship from executive Room on 20th floor very friendly staff, very clean room with comfortable beds excellent breakfast buffet, only a few minutes walk to the central station and city center
title: Best Hotel in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I loved the hotel. I felt comfortable. I wish the price wasn't so high. It's just one night, I mean...I'm not staying forever. I liked the people at reception. They were efficient and nice. They really cared about what I needed. I paid cash and had to leave a 100 euro deposit which i didn't enjoy. I think it's too much. Unnecessary since I'm prepaying the room.
title: Beautiful but a bit pricey

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We was here last year and it was amazing, but this year we are shocked from the room services, its really bad, sheets not changed, cups not changed or cleaned, and we complained the first day but nothing happened, the second days we found everything the same, so we decided to move to another hotel.Other than this the hotel was good.
title: Not expected

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Beautiful hotel, great value, great location central to sites and Centraal Station in Amsterdam. The ice cream was a wonderful way to end each day. We loved the spa/workout area, too, and the breakfast was a great value. Will definitely visit this hotel again.
title: Movenpick Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed before picking up cruise and had a very nice stay. The hotel is very close to the centre of the city and the walk is very nice and easy. We stayed in an executive suite which was very comfortable clean and spacious and we had use of the lounge for drinks and breakfast. Breakfast selection was excellent and offered a superb choice of foods to suit all tastes, they also had a chef preparing fresh eggs of your choice. Very good check in and friendly staff.This hotel is very close to the cruise port which is a mere 2 minutes walk in fact you can see the ships from hotel.Would stay here again if returning to Amsterdam. Great hotel and staff.TipMy only tip is to ask about the voucher they offer for restaurants when booking online as we weren't given it.
title: Superb

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Only issue - NON-REFUND of 50 Euro Deposit Required at Check-In after being told when we Checked Out that the Deposit was Not Charged to our Credit Card.Overall we were very Happy with your Facility in regards to the quality of the room, food and service. We especially appreciated the proximity to the city and public transportation.
title: Stay in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Friendly, courteous, professional staff more than willing to aid a weary traveler. Excellent rooms with great views of the river and port. Recommend this for anyone who want a great stay and easy access to Amsterdam Central, trams, and board cruise ships.
title: Excellent hotel and restraurant

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Good quality hotel, which we chose mainly because of its location next to the cruise port. Room had a superb view of the harbour and the cruise ships in port. Only a short walk into the city centre for sight-seeing. Good sized room, friendly staff (especially the concierge who guided us on the best way to check in for our cruise). We did not have breakfast at the hotel as it was very expensive at €25 per person - may be okay for business travellers on expenses, but not for a family!
title: Good hotel with great location for cruise port

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: After disembarking from a Scenic River cruise, we were most pleased to find the hotel was an easy walk to the left of the pier, with all of our luggage, as it was right on the water. Although we were unable to access our room, the hotel was most willing to store all of our luggage, and give us a map and directions into the city. We purchased a 24 hour tram pass from the concierge, and the tram stop was out front and across the tracks. We learned to watch out for the bicycles and motorbikes! We did not eat at the hotel, but there is a bar fridge to store your small items. A very nice gift shop is also in the spacious lobby. As they were four of us traveling, and two rooms, with accompanying luggage, we booked a van to the airport, again with the concierge.
title: Post River Cruise

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel has an awesome view of the city. It is clean and safe. The location is only a 7 minute walk to the city centre. You should buy a I Amsterdam city card for transportation and discounts. Take the # 26 tram to Movenpick.
title: Excellent place to stay.

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is at a good location. Only 5 minutes walk from the train station. After a day in town it is quit to relax from the busy day. Rooms are very good an in the upper section with a great view. Nice bar and good service.
title: Nice place to stay

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very cordial reception, very good shuttle service to the Central Railway station, however, the restaurant could use more servers. Dinner took way too long, but check-out person adjusted bill. Located within walking distance of cruise ships and across from train/tram tracks
title: Great location, cordial staff

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The service started out bumpy but they sure made up for it!The hotel is right on the water, close to the trolley, and near the port for the river boats.The room is very clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom had a weird door but it was clean and stocked with toiletries. The breakfast was incredible and I was able to try all sorts of foods!I would stay here again!
title: Great Hotel!

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here at the end of our Viking River Cruise (Viking picked the hotel) and we were happy with the location, tram accessibility, and other amenities. Breakfast was buffet style with many great choices. Large lobby, great harbor view, knowledgeable help at the desk and and the concierge. I would stay here again.
title: Nice clean safe hotel

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel was booked by Viking Cruises as part of our package at the end of our Rhine River Cruise. Hotel was Ok but out of town and away from all the restaurants and attractions in Amsterdam. The hotel was clean but reservations were busy and it took a long time to check-in because of all the turnover at the same time. I would not stay here again and would prefer to be at a location in the city.
title: Hotel at the cruise terminal

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We booked this hotel at the last minute as our Airbnb was cancelled. We had two kids and needed a hotel that can accommodate two adults and two children. The Movenpick Hotel was within easy walking distance from Amsterdam Centraal train station. Our room turned out to be two connecting rooms. The kids loved their room. The view from our room was wonderful. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Amsterdam.
title: Nice rooms overlooking the canal

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We landed at the Amsterdam airport and took the train to Central Station which was just a 10-minute walk to the Movenpick Hotel. We selected this hotel because of its location, with the cruise terminal next door, we were set for boarding our ship the next morning. The team at reception were efficient and very helpful. We knew our room would not be ready, but the hotel has luggage storage and assured us the room should be ready by 3. We knew we wouldn't be back by three, as we had many things to see. Once we returned from exploring, we retrieved our bags and got to our room.The room was lovely, clean, spacious, great views. We were exhausted by this time and just wanted a light snack before bed, ate at the hotel restaurant. It was pricey for what you got, but the food was good. And saved us from trying to find somewhere to eat, when I doubt we could walk another step. :) It is a busy place mainly because of the location. So convenient. If you are planning a cruise and departing from Amsterdam terminal, this is a great place to start and end your holiday.
title: Wonderful Location for our needs

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel was lovely, couldn't have asked for anything else. located close to central station so we were able to just get off train from airport and walk to hotel easily , which was great because it allowed us to get checked in, drop off our bags and start exploring. though there are trams stopping just outside, because we had nice weather we decided to walk everywhere so I advise to bring a good pair of walking shoes, it was probably the best way to explore and see the city.
title: Bring a good pair of waking shoes

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My only request would be that to get to your room you have the option of using the stairwell. Lifts were very busy at times. For some reason stairwell could only be used in a emergency. We had a lovely stay here rooms very clean. Staff very helpful and friendly. Close to city centre. We would use this hotel again.
title: City break

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Others' recent reviews pretty much say it all. I'd add that it's not only next to the ocean-going cruise terminal, but adjacent to where the river cruise boats dock. The room had lots of convenient electric outlets for cpap machines, cell/laptop chargers, etc. The concierge spent quite a lot of friendly time with us pointing out sites on the central business district map and giving us tram advice.
title: Convenient, Clean, Efficient, and Friendly

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Comfortable rooms, we had a fantastic view that overlooked Central Station, the waterway and city. The bed was comfortable the washrooms clean. Was only a 15 minute walk to Central Station or the city centre.
title: Beautiful view and comfortable rooms

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed 3 nights after a 10 hour flight from Boston.The room was ready when we arrived. had a great view of the canal, no outside noise.Room size was excellent, had 115VAC and USB charging stations. Bathroom with tub/Shower was huge. Within site of the Central Train Station and Subway, Don't pass up on the Breakfast bar. Hot and cold, rotating cheeses and breads. Espresso to Decaf tea available. Go full European or All American, its there
title: An oasis in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: If your planning on a viking cruise, this is your hotel. You can walk to the boats. The service and staff are very friendly and the breakfast buffet is great. Free wifi and free shuttle to the trains.
title: Great Location

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The room was excellent and the view (12th floor, city side) was spectacular. Not too bad a walk to and from the train station, although I did take a nasty fall in one place where there was a surprising step down in the middle of the sidewalk. And look out for the bicyclists, who act as if they own the road! The hotel provides free shuttle service to and from the train station as well, but on a limited schedule that requires reserving in advance. Staff were very helpful and gracious.
title: Lovely hotel, good location, great views

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I enjoyed my stay at Movenpick Amsterdam, great room, friendly staff good transport links. Dam square is close by and trams are regular. There's a ship dock and a river nearby which adds to the view.I would definitely stay here again.
title: Great stay

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Movenpick Hotel was fantatic! We enjoyed our stay with the beautiful lobby welcome and quick check in. The staff were so helpful and thrilled to assist our every need. The room was great and clean. The restaurant was lovely and the food was brilliant. The waiting staff were obliging and happy to talk to.
title: Movenpick is an excellent pick!

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Wonderful hotel especially for cruise passengers as the terminal is right next door. Large, nicely appointed rooms. Great buffet breakfast with lots of choices and very fresh food. It was an easy walk to Central Station and downtown. Will stay here again.
title: Outstanding Hotel

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Excellent location. Large, clean rooms. Shuttle service to the Train Station.Helpful and friendly staff. Breakfast had a very wide selection of food which wasexcellent. Good snack lunch and pizza for dinner at the Silk Road bar.
title: Excellent location, large comfortable room, excellent dining

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Movenpick is the ideal place to stay when taking a cruise from Amsterdam cruise terminal.Great views - no complaints about this hotel. It's also near the train station, so easy to get into the city.
title: Great location

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Modern, neat hotel with a very good service. Close to the Central station (they also have a shuttle you can book in advance, but it is a 10 minutes walk). Good breakfast. We were 3 adults staying in one room and the accommodation was comfortable.
title: Very Good Stay

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: we stayed after our viking cruise for 2 and a half days . Very nice hotel , chocolate hour was good . Ice cream shop on site!!!!!!! bar area was nice with helpful staff hotel is close to down town. and transportation was always available.
title: Viking post cruise stay

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great choice, located next to cruise terminal, super convenient. Staff was very friendly and super helpful in providing tips on how to best navigate the city. The tram stop was literally right across the street and took us to city center in 5 minutes. When debarking for our cruise the concierge staff assisted with our luggage, and when my wife left behind her medicines they assisted in getting them delivered to our ship in a matter of minutes. Great customer service!
title: Cruising in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The most helpless front desk I have ever experienced! I booked the hotel at a flexible rate so you normally should expect that you can cancel but only the noon before the day ahead of arriving. I booked after noon the day before so why not showing during the booking that the rates are not flexible anymore? When I arrived four agents were at counter. 2 of them taking care of guests and 2 just sort paper or play Sodoku. No idea. But no attention to the line in front to check and call someone from the backoffice. Check-in time is 15.00 hrs. Normally in other good hotels they check if any room is available earlier. But here not. I am sure they have a screen saver showing say "Our check-in policy is 15.00 hrs - our check-in policy is 15.00 hrs". Other would try to check and make a call with the Housekeeping department but not here: "Our check-in policy is 15.00 hrs". For the credit card they asked for an authorisation: While plugging in and out the electric power of the credit card reader they tell you: "Sir: you were to slow when you entered the PIN and confirmed" and while they say it they pressed reset, pulling out the plug, etc. And if you ask if we can move to a different credit card reader: "No we cannot. It is working. You were too slow" (and while they are plugging and out). We should keep our bags with the concierge. So concierge available. So I asked at he front desk (10 m apart) to call concierge: The front desk could see that nobody was there and just make a phone call to a phone which is unattended. I asked them to take care of my parents (handicapped) who should sit there for 90 minutes and they should come to the front desk and ask from time to time to ask for a key. No willingness to help. No need to mention: no concierge helped with my bags. My parents need to carry the bags (incl. mine) all by themselves. I was unfortunately not there when the keys were released. Someone told my parents that we got an upgrade to Executive Rooms incl. Lounge access. But that was anyway the rooms and rate I booked. What kind of fake upgrade. I requested by eUpgrade (against payment) to Junior Suite. But none at the front desk that such a programme exists. So I payed what I ordered and the most helpless front desk (incl. supervisor) but a great hotel, incl. location, food, rooms and parking arrangements if you are willing to walk two blocks which is interesting for someone like me who need occassionally park + sleep + park arrangements. Only 10.00 EUR as hotel-guest who stayed the night before in the hotel. Just wondering why it is a Swiss hotel chain which normally should know how to run Swiss hospitality. Why are in Switzerland the best hotel schools but you cannot find the well trained guys in Swiss hotels?
title: A great hotel, great location, great rooms, great breakfast BUT...

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Nice hotel, clean & tidy and good location for walking to the centre. But check-in process was a nightmare. Waited in a queue for about 20 mins at 11:30am in the morning. Asked for rooms near each other numerous times but was allocated rooms on 11th & 5th floor. Also was told that twin/double rooms could not be guaranteed - even though I had booked this room type on Expedia. Was also allocated the wrong room types twice.
title: Nice hotel but wouldn't recommend for a family if you want rooms near each other

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is very good, the location is ok. ten minits walking from Centraal Station and comunicate with Tram and Shutel from Hotel.Breakfast is good quality, alittel bit crowded, but good atention.I didn't like that I arrived at 14:30 and I had to wait until 3:00 to have my bedroom ready
title: Good hotel. quite expensive

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: So, this is a good hotel. If you are cruising, the location cannot be beat.The cruise terminal is about 100 yards away from the hotel entrance. The rooms are clean, relatively modern. The hotel provided electric converters at no charge. Hotel restaurant is okay, over-priced for sure, but service is good. In fairness, everything in Amsterdam is grossly overpriced for the value.My biggest complaint (I know this is an American thing) the rooms cannot be cooled to a point that is comfortable. It would be nice if the hotel offered an oscillating fan to help move the air.Do not not believe signs outside of the hotel claiming it is a 6 minute walk to the Amsterdam Centraal Station - it is every bit of 15 minutes.Good hotel - stay there if cruising.
title: Nice Notel Especially for Cruises

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We are really glad we picked this hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the hotel was spotless and breakfast was a real treat.This hotel has thought of all the little extras - chocolate hour each day 4-5, you can sample some of Movenpick's chocolates. We also had executive access which aloud us complimentary soft drinks all day, biscuits & chocolate too. In the evening a mini buffet, wine and beer is served too which was a lovely extra.The staff were very helpful when it came to local knowledge and the free shuttle to and from the Central station was handy.
title: Nice hotel, lovely staff.

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: One of the best hotels i've stayed in to day. clean and friendly. good location . Lobby and business facilities were good. staff were super friendly but not in the annoying way. free shuttle service every 30 minutes. breakfast was also good.
title: Great stay

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Couldn't be closer and more convenient ! We loved the hotel ! Close to the public transportation and next door to the pier ! All the places we wanted to see were accessible by the tram, right in front of the hotel.
title: Location, location !

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had stayed at the Movenpick Hotel Amsterdam City Centre for a few days following a Viking River Cruise. Check in was fairly easy.The room was very large for a European hotel, and our room had a large couch, king bed, a desk and 2 closets. One of the 2 closets was taken by a safe and refrigerator, so that we did not have as much space to unpack as we may have liked. Our room overlooked the harbor and gave impressive views of ships passing through.The room had a flat screen tv with a huge variety of channels and the WiFi was very good and fast.The bathroom was large, withonly a shower, but the shower had good hot water and the water pressure was good.We did have problems with the air-conditioning in the room. We could never get the room as cool as we would have liked, and the lighting and heating/air-conditioning was activated by having a room key in the slot, so I think when we were out the room got warmed back up.We ate at the bar area the first night, service was very slow for the area not being busy. The servers in the bar area did not seem to have assigned tables, and when asked if we wanted an additional drink, we said yes and were forgotten about The bitterballn appetizer and the pizza we had for the main course were good, but expensive for what they were. The breakfast buffet was huge, but the immense selection made it a little chaotic. With so much to choose from, the buffets were typically crowded. That being said, the breakfast was outstanding and everything we had ate was fresh and flavorful.There is a Movenpick ice cream stand in the bar area that servers great ice cream and I highly recommend if you like sweets or ice cream.The location is a little on the outskirts of the city, but getting to city center is an easy 30 minute walk, or you can take the free hotel shuttle, which runs every 30 minutes to the tram station. The tram station is also a 15 minute walk from the hotel.There aren't many immediate eating options outside the hotel in walking distance. We spotted a coffee/sandwich shop, a subway sub shop and a bowling alley/bar on the harbor, but not much else. They also seemed to have limited hours on weekends.I think that if we were to visit Amsterdam again, we would consider the hotel for another stay, if there was nothing comparable price-wise with a location more in the city.
title: Nice hotel with impressive views

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We've had a wonderful two night stay prior to cruising. Clean and efficient hotel. We took taxi from airport for 85 euros. From hotel it's about 10 minute walk to City Center and we've taken the tram system to museums from there Note on public transportation - Americans should leave time to purchase tram tickets inside because you probably don't have a pin and chip card Back to hotel - fitness room was basic but nice, dinner in restaurant was excellent except for bar service was slow. We ate their basic breakfast of coffee, juice, and croissant (7.5euro). The ice cream was WORTH EVERY CALORIE Overall a little pricey but we would stay here again
title: Perfect location for cruise departures

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: They offer early check in on internet but once you are on site they don't have that. There was no AC in the room and the front desk told us they would fix it but we later learned that there is no AC at all in the rooms. It is just an air circulation system. The windows barely open so it was suffocating.
title: NO AC in this hotel.

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: it is a real four star hotel.location is very good.view is perfect.skilled staffs.clean.good service.nice breakfast.we stayed here for five nights in a junior suit.it was amazing with beautiful views.there was a bar for suits guests from 17 to 19.it was awesome.i would like to thank a very kind staff in this bar whose name is kienyip.he was so kind and helpful.totally it is a great hotel.
title: excellent hotel .

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: it is very nice modern hotel overlloking the cruise port, so you wake up and you see a huge cruiseship outside from your window. Large rooms, with very nice view to the city and the river, very close to main station. There is a bike rental shop just a few meters from the hotel.
title: excelent view and access to the center

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Wonderful, clean, conveniently located hotel to Amsterdam... crazy conveniently located to the cruise terminal (3 minute walk!)!!! Upon arriving in Amsterdam, we were picked up at Centraal Station by their free shuttle service that runs every half hour, and taken to this very lovely hotel, located right next to the cruise terminal. Our room, was very large in comparison to other European hotels, with a 'true' king size bed! Lots of storage space for clothes, as well as a nice long lounger that runs the length of the windows. You can embark/disembark on Tram #26, located just across the street, which is only one stop from Centraal Station, which is the start/end point for all of the other trams and buses, which made travel a breeze. Concierge desk sells 24, 48, and 72 hour travel passes, which is very convenient! We had a corner room, overlooking the water, which provided gorgeous views at night. Woke up the day we were sailing and our ship was right outside window.
title: Crazy convenient location to cruise terminal!

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location, great service, wonderful experience. The staff went out of their way to make us feel special and welcome. Our room was comfortable, quiet, and clean. The included breakfast was top notch. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
title: Excellent experience at Movenpick

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Celebrity chose a good property for us, the hotel was located right next to the cruise terminal very near to the train station and the central tourist area. The best part was the luggage service - they took our bags from our cabin and delivered them directly to our hotel room without us even seeing them in the terminal. The front desk assisted in acquiring taxi service to the airport - very nice service. The 2 meals dinner and Breakfast were very tasty and served with friendly waiters.
title: Hotel after Celebrity Cruise

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very good overall experience, clise to teain ststion, dhort wxlkvto tosn centre, easy access to all of Amsterddm's wonderful sights. Would happily recommend tge Movenpick to our friends and family, difficult to find fault.
title: Happy customer

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very good hotel in perfect location.The room was with a great view to the canal and perfectly clean and equipped.The relax zone was also great, both in the gym area and in the bar at the ground floor.
title: Great look!

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Located just outside the centre, this hotel is around 15-20mins walk away. It has shuttle service to trains station every 30 mins (booking at the concierge desk).The room is spacious and well maintained. However, the front check in counters staffs should smile more, no point working on the front counter with sulking faces. The concierge staffs however are beyond great!!! Overall, hotel need to constantly monitoring smoking weeds in the room. Some time the corridor is stunk with the odour. Hope management with take note.
title: My first choice

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: welcoming staff at reception very slow no eye contact. We have to approach and asked the staff for checkin. We were the only guest at that time. Should explain to the guests the facilities hotel offer while giving the room keys.
title: great location

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The central location, stunning views, pleasing breakfast and general comfort made our stay enjoyable. Front office staff were friendly and helpful. We appreciated being able to leave luggage at the hotel prior to booking in, and we would return again to this location in Amsterdam.
title: Well located and comfortable

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at the Movenpick prior to cruising, and came back to the location twice between and post other travels. Hotel was excellent, and the staff were excellent. We particularly liked the bar area, great food and drinks, but exceptional service. The staff remembered us from our first stay, and even helped us with our luggage when meeting friends back at the bar. Fantastic experience.
title: Highly recommended

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Located on the cruise pier, there is no better location in Amsterdam. The hotel prices keep rising, but it is still worth the price. The rooms are airy, well appointed and look out on the water. Always clean, quiet and well-served. The breakfast has many options. Try the three course dinner "special." The bar burgers are great.
title: Best place to stay before a cruise

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is a lovley hotel which is part of a wider chain. It is good value for money on a bed and breakfast package. The breakfast was very nice and well stocked. The bar during my stay was understaffed as I believe the bar staff were off or on a training course. The location is good, although expect a 15+ min walk to the centre or a short taxi ride. Very clean and comfortable place to stay
title: Lovley hotel, not quite city center

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at the Movenpick hotel in Amsterdam for one night and were very pleased. The hotel is very well decorated and designed, the rooms very comfortable and we loved the location. It's walking distance to the Central Station and City Center, only a 15 minute train ride from Schiphol airport. We booked a connecting room for our children and the two standard rooms were a perfect size for the four of us.
title: Great hotel at a great location!

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We were out from morning till after 3pm, room was not serviced, we were very tired, had the "do not disturb " sign out and napped. When we woke up, the sign was replaced that room service can be requested but have to be before 5pm. Today we went out 10:30am came back close to 4pm, room is still not cleaned. This time we called right away for service. 15 min later they came, told us room has to be emptied for them to clean. We said we would leave right away. Not even 2 min they left. Half an hour passed? We are still waiting. Breakfast is very good.Free shuttle to central station is always on time.
title: Housekeeping

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We requested a room with a view and received a free upgrade to the 20th floor. The breakfast was wonderful. We had dinner our last night at the restaurant with gorgeous view, fantastic service and an exquisite mea with delicious ice cream dessertl. We are hoping to visit Amsterdam again and will definitely look at staying at the Movenpick Hotel again.
title: What a wonderful stay

hotelLocation: Piet Heinkade 11, 1019 BR Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My friend and I went for a long weekend in Amsterdam, we stayed for 4 nights on a bed and breakfast package.The hotel itself was really easy to find from the Central Station, it was approx a 15 minute walk away. Check in was very smooth and reception staff very friendly.The room itself was spotless clean but a tad run down. It could do being refit with new furniture and a modernisation.My friend and I probably wouldn't stay here again but was fine for a cheapish hotel in the centre of Amsterdam.
title: Great Location and Friendly staff. Hotel is getting a bit run down.

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Although we were exhausted from the long flight, from the moment we entered this historic family owned hotel, we were welcomed and cared for. Rick gave us a handwritten map of the important sights, and we took a canal tour to further our orientation of this beautiful city.
