The hotel is in a lovely residential area, within five minute walk to Vondelpark, Van Gough and other beautiful museums center. The delicious breakfast is included and served in a beautiful room by warm welcoming staff. Highly recommend!
title: Fantastic location and cozy welcoming hotel

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We visited Amsterdam to celebrate our Wedding anniversary and stayed in this lovely hotel. We met a family member gamed Rory who told us about the history of the hotel.Rooms are spacious (we had a family room) breakfast was great in two stunning rooms, one with an amazing stained glass window and another darker room with an old fireplace and chandelier. Service was great. Little bar to relax and gave an evening drink before bed was nice.The best thing is the location and good value. Close to the Museums and park also team stops just round the corner. Get a ticket and just jump on and off all day. Walking distance of good selection of restaurants cafes and bars. Absolutely ideal.
title: Wonderful friendly family run hotel in fabulous location.

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Comfortable very well maintained hotel with old fashioned freindly service in a very convenient location. Rooms were tastefully decorated and bed was very comfortable. Room on top floor had double opening windows and wonderful views over the top of buildings across the street.
title: Lovely hotel in quiet street

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed for 3 nights following a Baltic cruise. Our first night was not pleasant, as the room was really too small for 2 people...should be a single room...and lacking air conditioning. My wife took ill on the second morning, partly due to the heat we think, too weak to tour or even vacate the room to allow the room to be cleaned. The staff could not have been more accommodating. We had requested a move to a larger room, and they let us occupy it as soon as it was prepared after the previous guests checked out. And it had air conditioning...a real godsend! Much larger and more comfortable. I had breakfast at the hotel the first morning, but we very much enjoyed a cafe ("Blushing") just around the corner the next 2 days. The hotel is in an absolutely ideal location, close to museums, restaurants, and parks, and on a quiet street. We would recommend Aalders Hotel highly.
title: Ideal Location and Great Staff

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The lady helped me checking in is very friendly and helpful during the staying!The manger is very responsible on making the staying comfortable.They may not 100% detailed, but they do correct issues very responsive and smoothly.
title: Lovely Hotel with heart warming staffs!

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location, just steps from several of the museums. Easy to walk everywhere. The street is gorgeous, the hotel well-maintained and very comfortable. We were a family of four and found it a perfect perch from which to explore Amsterdam.
title: Gem of a hotel

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Everything, from the staff to the facility, was first rate. Our room was clean, comfortable, nicely equipped. The location near the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum was wonderful. We enjoyed walking out each day from the leafy, quiet street of the hotel, into the city.
title: A lovely, comfortable refuge from the city's energy

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very nice and familiar hotel, we lived in a beautiful triple room with balcony towards the garden. The location nearby Museumplein is also very good, it's easy to either walk or take a tram to the center of town.
title: Summervacation 2017

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Delightful hotel in a wonderful location near Rijksmuseum, tram, restaurants galore, and express bus to the airport. Room rates seemed high, but were comparable to others in Amsterdam, which are always high, especially in July.My single room #18 was quite small with no view, but the friend I was traveling with had room 12, also a single but slightly bigger and brighter, with a picture-postcard-ooh-aah view of the homes across the street. so if you're booking a single ask for room 12! also lonely planet said something about complementary pastries in the morning, but we weren't offered any, were just told that there was a breakfast for 12.50€.But overall we were very happy with the hotel facilities, super friendly helpful staff, cleanliness and location. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, and highly recommend!
title: charming hotel in perfect location!

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: A clean and comfortable hotel in a really good location. Just round the corner from the major museums in the museum quarter. A quiet location which felt very safe. The staff of this hotel are so friendly and helpful - I could not recommend it more highly
title: Lovely hotel in an excellent location

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 13-15, 1071 CJ Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We were very happy with this hotel. You could not beat the location - right near the tram, restaurants, the park and museums. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. They were always able to give us directions and advice and we were even able to buy tram tickets and museum tickets directly through them. The room was nice and big and they were able to put the two rooms we had booked next to each other which was very nice. Only small complaint is that the room was pretty hot as there was no air conditioning.
title: Great hotel, wonderful location

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is clean and neat. However, the mural on the wall of the hotel is that of les miserables and it could be quite scary for some occupants as the face is very large and the mouth of the character is very near the pillows. I recommend that the hotel change the picture to cater to a wider audience. The mural is painted on a wooden panel which creaks for a long time after the lights are turned off.
title: Mural picture in the room is quite scary

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed on business on a few times. The rooms are spacious and the beds are huge and probably the most comfortable I have ever slept in! Never want to get up especially with the blackout blinds.Bar and restaurant great but can get very busy where there are event on at the stadium or concert venue.Breakfast really lets it down. Only thing hot is scrambles eggs. Bread, pastries, meats, cheese and some fruit. Nothing special and not enough choice. Very boring on a 4 night stay. Coffee is awful. Stayed several times and for 4 nights last time and on the last morning heard someone asking for fried eggs cooked to order. Didn't realise you could ask for eggs cooked to order. They don't tell you this when they take your room number as you come in. Not a patch on the breakfast at Hampton by Hilton!
title: Sort out the breakfast!

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Chose this hotel because my business meeting was in the same section of Amsterdam, and I like to walk whenever possible. When I told the taxi driver where I was going, I heard him mutter, "That's an unusual place to stay." When I arrived, I realized the hotel is perfect for concert or sporting event goers (it is next door to the city's stadium), but the area is desolate - except for an office building across the way - during the day. Yes, it is convenient to the Metro system, but I past some sketchy people loitering in the doorways. Also, it is actually difficult to walk anywhere from the hotel, due to the highways nearby. The hotel itself is very nice: clean, welcoming. But I probably wouldn't stay there again, unless I were going to an event at the stadium.
title: Nice hotel, sketchy location

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The room design is reduced to the max. If you like simple BAUHAUS style. The bath is dominated by orange - good fit for the Netherlands. Good burger bar downstairs. Perfect for visiting the stadium or companies like Informatica.
title: Styling, maybe a bit too simple

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed a night here as we had to layover for our connection, took a taxi from schiphol - should have taken the train instead as this is walking distance to the station. LOcation doesn't offer much but it's 15 mins from the central station. If you are not here for the convention maybe easier to book somewhere near the central area. Rooms are clean and spacious - very nicely decorated
title: Jaz amsterdam

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Jaz Amsterdam hotel was very nice and comfortable. A little gym, sauna and steam room, on the top floor, was a great addition.It's about 5 min walk to the metro station and about 15-20min to the center of the city.
title: Stayed in the hotel for 3 nights.

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Visited the Jaz for a works conference in June.It's a large music themed hotel that is adjacent to the Amsterdam Arena. Very close to both the overground and underground trains.Rooms were a good size, and the hotel was ultra modern with a great shower. Breakfast was a typical fayre of continental type which was ok.The hotel had a decent bar and on-site restaurant that had a great selection of beers which was a big plus point.
title: Cool Boutique Hotel

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I think the best hotel in the area. Much better than HolidayInn Express, which I've also stayed. Place is really good which has easy access to everything. Rooms are really clean and clear with a really good BF.
title: Really good

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is a very practical hotel for my needs, the location being a short walk to the business offices I was heading to. The hotel is easy to access from the airport and it is easy to get to the City centre.The standard rooms are well designed and spacious.The people who work here were mainly excellent. I enjoyed staying here.
title: Very good location

hotelLocation: De Passage 90, 1101 AX Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is a very good hotel and I had a lovely stay. It's a very easy 4 minutes walk from the metro stop to the hotel. Metro 54 will take you to/from Amsterdam central in 15mins. The hotel is directly opposite the Arena, where Ajax football club play. We got lost finding our way to the hotel initially but once we got it right, it was a breeze. The internal decor is really lovely, complimentary breakfast was however average. The bath and toilet was clean with a very easy to operate shower. We were checking out very early and I ordered for a to-go breakfast at about 10:15pm the previous night. The lady at the desk told me 10pm was the last time to request however she was able to speak to the kitchen and put in our request. The to-go breakfast was water, one banana, a bar of granola and two very tiny sandwiches.Please check your bill well when checking out as one of their staff included an extra night we didn't stay in our bill. It took the intervention of a more senior member to sort it out as it appeared he didn't understand us saying we stayed only 2 nights. All in all a lovely stay and won't hesitate to return. Travelled with my husband and 10y.o daughter and room cost €145 per night.
title: Very good stay

review: I always stay here when I travel to Amsterdam for work and student hotel has just the atmosphere I'm hoping for! Not too formal, all the facilities I need and the perfect location. Also the personnel is super friendly.
title: Great place to stay

review: Stayed in this hotel for a few nights for my boyfriends birthday in July and it was perfect. Rooms were really spacious and had one of the biggest and most comfortable beds I've ever had the pleasure of sleeping in! It is a little walk from the centre of Amsterdam, but there is an underground tube stop just outside the building (nothing like the British underground, everything there is so clean, cheap and on time) and it cost like €6 for unlimited travel for 24 hours, this included all the trams and stuff in town so was the perfect way to get around. Al hotel staff were friendly and inviting and rooms were spotlessly clean. Would definitely stay here again
title: Such a fun hotel!

review: I stayed here on the 16/7/17 with my partner. Really cool place and with an awesome atmosphere, however using the shower in the morning resulted in flooding of not only the entire bathroom, but majority of the bedroom as well. The lack of shower door, slanted floors, lack of proper drainage and bad sealing led to this problem and a lot of our clothes and my shoes got soaked. When we told the staff of this problem there was a "oh that's sucks" response which was obviously unsatisfactory considering the inconvenience it had caused to us with our belongings.While it is a cool hotel, there was an entirely frustrating response to a problem caused by them.
title: Shower flooded room & soaked our belongings

review: Excellent hotel for all ages. Close to metro and trams and places to eat. We got the transportation card which gave us quick and unlimited metro use and tram use for a specific number of days. Not until the end of our trip did we realize we could have gotten that at the hotel. It would be a good idea to specifically and individually (not with other information) give guests that information when checking in, and then telling guests where to find other provided information helpful for their stay.
title: Great Hotel

review: My boyfriend and I enjoyed our stay at a this hotel. Staff are very nice. Close to city centre. 15 minutes away in a tram. Rooms are basic but all we needed was air con, by, bed and a shower.Breakfast was nice. The gym looks good. Didn't use it. There was table tennis, snooker and football game in lounge.
title: Enjoyed our stay

review: The rooms were excellent! The beds were comfortable (and huge) and there are black out curtains which is perfect if you want a deep sleep. They also had a coffee machine in the room, the only negative was that our coffee pods were replaced one day with all decaf. The hotel is a little bit out of the city but with the Metro right at the door it is perfect if you want to go into the city. It takes around 30 mins to walk into the city but it really is a beautiful walk and would definitely recommend it!
title: Great rooms and convenient location!

review: Lovely hotel very cool and fun! Lots to do within the hotel which was lovely but on our last night we went to the restaurant called the pool...well safe to say that its put me off ever coming back which is a shame! We sat down in the restaurant and ordered drinks which they forgot and then had to wait 20 minutes for them to make a mint tea...wait it gets worse...they then told us that the food that was advertised on the menus and boards wasn't available, when we finally ordered our food it came out 30 minutes later!!!!! To which my friend ordered the cheese with bread and she received a tiny camembert with 4 very thinly sliced pieces of bread for €12...she asked for more bread and the staff walked off and didn't bother getting!(wait sorry they did bring out some pita bread 30 mins later...when the cheese had hardened) Ridiculously overpriced for what you get, RUDE staff! And food wasn't that great...hugely disappointed But the reception team were incredible!!! The girls are amazing! And the rooms are insanely clean and so comfortable!!
title: Nice hotel/ TERRIBLE RESTAURANT THE POOL

review: They didn't give me enough info when I checked in, so I didn't know that cleaning was once every two days so I had to go to the reception to get amenities since there's no phone in the room. No hair driers in the room. Couldn't stop the air conditioner and couldn't turn off the lights completely at night to I had to take out the room key from the pocket. I don't think this hotel was a good choice in terms of the cost effectiveness. Won't come back.
title: Won't come back.

review: This hotel is very easy to get to, with a metro stop practically outside the door. Inviting and comfortable with good amenities it is suitable for any low to medium budget traveler. The ground floor has comfortable social spaces to sit and talk with friends and an attached restaurant/bar. All the staff were friendly and helpful.
title: Great all round hotel

review: I'm 65 yrs old and this hotel was great, so not just for young people. The room was comfortable and very clean. Just 4 metrostops from Centraal Station it was easy to get to : lines 51, 53 and 54.I took the shuttle bus right outside the hotel to get to the airport. ( 17 euros)
title: great hotel for anyone

review: This is a great concept of hotel for young people that want to work and have fun at the same time. Good public areas to work with a laptop and chill. Staff is great and they really make you feel at home and free to be yourself. Excelent Wifi.
title: Great hotel and staff.

review: Would really recommend this hotel, the rooms are a good size, there is a bar restaurants and a gym as well as table tennis and pool. It's only a 10 minutes journey to the centre of Amsterdam. Also the room we stayed in had memory foam mattress and black out curtains which gave us a good night's sleep.
title: A great hotel

review: I was a little skeptical about booking The Student Hotel for my boyfriend and I's trip to Amsterdam as we're not really 'students' anymore, but I was very wrong! First, location is great - easily accessible by Metro (seriously, so simple and one of the best we've used in Europe), second the reception is inviting and the place itself is a trove of colourful areas to sit, lounge and enjoy. We loved the pool and ping-pong tables, as well as the Photo Booth in reception - fun ways to pass a little time or cap off a hard day of sightseeing and drinking. The staff were great. The room itself was really big and the bed very comfortable, as well as surprisingly big. We really enjoyed our stay at The Student hotel, including drinks at The Pool and all the many things to do in the surrounding area (Volkshotel has a rooftop restaurant/bar and behind the TSH is a long street with some great places to eat.) Overall would recommend and would definitely not hesitate to book again for a return back to Amsterdam.
title: Wonderful stay and great base to explore Amsterdam

review: Absolutely perfect place to stay, staff so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much. Room was a brilliant size and everything worked perfectly, and was cleaned almost every day with new towels. Hired the bikes from the hotel which I would definitely recommend as it is worth the money and helps you to get into the centre of Amsterdam really easily! The whole vibe of the place is perfect and I would definitely come here again!
title: Amazing place to stay!

review: possibly the best hotel I've ever been to, the counter staff were always lovely and helpful, the free waffle at check-in was a great perk, the puns on the furniture throughout the room and hotel were great
title: The hotel of puns

review: Every service is good. The position is near to the central station. Nice people and very good breakfast. Everything is perfect but the bicycle' seats are too hard and the sunlight at the moorning through the windows
title: Very good

review: This hotel was the perfect place to travel with friends. We were concerned it would be too party-like due to it being a student hotel, but all ages of guests stayed there. It was extremely clean and was convenient to the metro. We stayed on one of the lower floor rooms, while our friends stayed higher. If you have a choice, ask to be on floors 10-12- better view and more privacy.
title: Great Hotel

review: There is a happy and excellent hotel with very kind and helpful staff. Hotel has an excellent location and metro station is beside the hotel that you can reach the central of city in ten minutes and hotel`s free WIFI is great. But it would be better if they put the slippers in the room.
title: A happy hotel

review: I stayed at the Student Hotel because, for reasons I cannot explain, Expedia offered my 6-night stay for free after I booked the airfare...must've been a glitch on someone's part, but I jumped on it! Reviews were positive and I was very intrigued!The space is always bustling with life and there are more than just students that stay there...lounge areas in the lobby are cozy and active....(there was never a time while I was there that I did not see someone playing ping pong!) I was fortunate to meet a fellow traveler and we ended up touring the city together for the week!I stayed in room 1230...was a deluxe room, I believe, so perhaps it was larger than different rooms?? I can't be sure. On the 12th floor, it is on a corner--had two large windows that overlooked the street (a bit noisy sometimes, even from up there) and had a great view of the city. There is a large support column in the room that makes getting to the window a bit awkward (I know the building used to be a printing place), but that wasn't a big deal. Also, a couple of other room notes:* housekeeping comes every other day*one hand towel and one large towel in my room*shower has no curtain is open and will get the floor a little wet.*look for 3 outlets conveniently near the floor in the base of the bed so you may charge phones as you sleep.*walls are very thin--could hear my neighbor coughing in the next room.*bed was very comfortable.Location is good--4 stops on the Metro and a short walk to the hotel. also, about a 20 minute walk to the Van Gogh/Museum District. I was not feeling brave enough to cycle, but the hotel offers rentals.Breakfast is 14 Euro and I found this to be most disappointing for the price. Selection is adequate, but no hot foods, no eggs, just breads, cold cuts, cheeses, coffee, juice, and yogurt some cereals (didn't see bowls for them, though). Wish I would have tried the place for dinner, but that didn't happen. The bar is nice and casual. Was nice to go later at night for a glass of wine; kind of wish they were open later than midnight. Max was friendly and personable, as were all the staff I encountered! Btw, while waiting to check in, I was given a frozen treat to enjoy--was a very pleasant unexpected surprise!All in all, I was very pleased with my stay (did I mention that it didn't cost me anything!?!) and would certainly stay again in the future, regardless of price or not!
title: Great place with much character and energy!

review: The hotel was great - rooms were clean and well equipped, and though the location was a bit outside of the city center, proximity to the trains made it easy to get everywhere we needed. I would stat here again.
title: Great Stay!

review: Everything about our student hotel experience was excellent. Wish there was more of them around the world. Would highly recommend to anyone staying in Amsterdam to stay here. Easy to just jump on team or metro to get into centre in minutes.
title: One of the best hotels ever stayed in

review: I stayed in one of the suites, which was spacious, clean, and nicely decorated/outfitted. The nespresso machine was a nice touch, and the room even had a kitchenette. The common areas were nice, though I didn't really use them. And the gym was surprisingly large and well equipped (they even had a barbell rack).
title: Cool hotel / great value

review: Great location, only 15 minutes walking distance from centre of the town.Metro station is in front of the hotel. Reception staff are very friendly and ready to help with any question. Rooms are OK for few days stay, quite and clean.
title: Great place to stay in Amsterdam

review: This hotel was a great find! The location was priceless: walking distance to the metro station at which all trains stop. Coffee in the morning was perfect at the coffee place downstairs. The room was comfortable and spacious enough for 2 adults. Overall very clean and felt safe.
title: Great place

review: Fun and quirky hotel with lots of character. Suite rooms were great but single room was very basic. Good location. Nice bar/restaurant with delicious pizza. Rooms air con was not up to scratch and it would be nice if irons were available in the rooms. But overall very happy with our stay and would reccommend.
title: Great experience

review: We have stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. The location is very convenient, the Metro is in 2 minutes walk & 4 station to the central station  The breakfast is very good and we had also one dinner at the hotel. .The place has vital , we had a plesent stay.The rooms are quite comfy and the lobby areas are huge eith alot of sitting areas, ping pong and bilirad .tables I want to mention Jiska , she was so adorable and supportive in every request that we had.She also helped us with our rental car.My children enjoyed alot off ice cream on her behalf. Here are some pictures from the lobby , i forgot to take some from the room.
title: Recommendations for The Student Hotel

review: Really good location. Very helpful staff with great tips and advice. Definitely hire a bike from the hotel and ride around the city. Rooms are a good size and beds are comfortable. Pillows are a little lumpy though. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.
title: Great hotel and great facilities

review: We stay in this hotel three nights and almoust everything was small disapoint.Hotel looks nice in pictures, but in real life almoust everything is something else than nice. Walls is dirty, floors is dirty, our bed was old and cleaner need to do much better job to future. We had problem with keycard every day. And last day reception lady say reason to that "looks like your keycard activite only one day". We stay three nights there and every day we had some problem. First you go to upstears, walk long way to your room door and then you see that, your keycard dosen't work anymore. Then you go back to lobby and somebody activite your keycard again. And nobody from reception say next think "sorry about that" they just activite your keycard and you get feeling "maybe it was my fold" and it wasn't.We say three times our bad and old mattress to reception, in third time they try do something. First two times reception lady just wroute some post it paper and say "we fix it", but nobady newer fix it. After third time they give free breakfast voucher, thats nice, but we still have same problem than first time, bad and old mattress. And what we do breakfeast voucher, if there is only empty cups and almoust every food was finish? No coffee, no juice, no cups, no bread, no ham or cheese, no butter or no class. And worst thing was that, nobody refil these things. Quit difficult to get full feelinig from your breakfast.Next time we go some other hotel, we can get much better value to our money.
title: Only few good memories

review: Very friendly service from the staff. Very convenient location next to a Metro station. Rooms are basic, but clean and comfortable.Great hotel, but a little pricey. More powerful AC in the rooms would be nice, too!
title: Friendly service, great location, simple rooms

review: The Student Hotel is a very funky, quirky hotel! Different from the norm in a very good way! Rooms were very comfortable & quiet for a good night's sleep!! Breakfast was very good & not too expensive! Highly recommend this hotel!
title: Wonderful Amsterdam!

review: It is a really updated hotel, wich me and my friend loved. We were just in Amsterdam for one night and only stayed at the hotel for some hours to sleep, so we didnt get to see as much as we would like to. But we loved the big size of the room, the fact that there was a bath tub, and the room design was cool. We will book our next stay in Amsterdam here.
title: Cool hotel with a nice vibe

review: Skip the breakfast - was totally not worth it especially since you can easily travel out on metro to get nice amsterdam pancakes for breakfast. The suite rooms were large in size and comfortable. Love the new looking nepresso machine too.!
title: Good comfortable stay

review: When you walk in, the decorations and little quotes everywhere are very inviting and makes everyone feel welcome. The staff are always friendly and welcome questions. The free little treats the reception gives out is a treat as well. No complaints except for the hair dryer and iron.
title: One of the BEST hotels I've stayed at.

review: The Student Hotel Amsterdam was perfect for a short stay with me and my boyfriend. Beds were comfortable and there were fun decorations. However the hotel is not walking distance from the Centre but there is a metro station right outside which will take you there The only issue we had with the rooms is that the floor of the bathroom flooded when I had a shower, we asked for help with this and were told someone would come and fix it but no one did. Otherwise a great stay
title: Comfortable and fun

review: Nice hotel with a good location close to the Metro. Clean and big rooms. We asked for single beds in one of our two rooms but got double beds in both rooms. It said cityview but there are no views from the first floor and probably not from the 4th floor either. The cleaning is done very late and was not done when we got back late afternoon.It would be nice if the bill from the restaurant could be added to our hotel bill.Nice staff.
title: A hotel mostly for young people

review: We picked this hotel for its proximity to sloterdijk station (to attend a festival). Beware - it doesn't look much from the outside - but give it a chance and on the inside it's got a cool relaxed (admittedly very studenty) vibe. The decor is much like if Urban Outfitters decided to make a hotel. There's a restaurant/bar/pool table area/gym at your disposal, and everyone gets greeted with a glass of prosecco and a smile from very efficient staff. And of course one of the great things about going to a hotel used to young adults and students is that amenities are presented to you with a smile at any hint that you might need help -i.e. Bus/tram tickets are available to buy from the desk; maps, info and vouchers are laid out for you. The only reasons I gave this 4 stars was because putting the 'wet room' style shower on made the entire bathroom into a swimming pool - which became mildly annoying - and because the options for having breakfast in the morning were pretty poor (tiny muffins, the odd piece of fruit, or a yoghurt if you came very early). The rooms themselves are purely practicality-led. The double beds are huge and comfortable, and there's everything you could possibly need presented in a clean and pleasant environment. However, if you are people who like a luxurious hotel experience as part of your holiday - this isn't for you. Thanks chaps x
title: Brilliant!

review: Thank you for making our stay in Amsterdam extra special. The room was clean and tidy and had everything we needed. Location is also convenient and accessible. The staff were very helpful and friendly.
title: Fantastic stay

review: Very friendly Service, good location and clean room! Unfortunately there was no hairdryer at our room. There is a Metro Station nearby the hotel and de hotel also offers a bike rental Service, so you can get to the inner City in about ten minutes!
title: Everything was fine :)

review: The hotel isn't located too close to the center but every place is easy to reach with public transportation. We enjoyed the playing corner and the cozy lounges near the reception. The staff is very friendly and ready to help you with anything you need.
title: Good atmosphere

review: Great hotel, great location, inspiring decoration and corners.Having a coffee machine (with coffee!!!) and a tea machine (with tea!!!) just made us feel like home. And the Stroopwaffle at check-in was the cherry on top of the cake. You can see that everything has love and care in it.We loved staying there!
title: Great!

review: Such a warm and welcoming hotel! We stayed here for three nights and really loved it. Clean, fresh, youthful with a cool hostel-like atmosphere. Not just for students! The best ting was that it was so easy to rent bikes. We did that every day and found out that it was a great way to discover the city!
title: If you come here, be sure to rent bikes!

review: It is all about good staff, friendly and young. I love Amsterdam, it was my first visit and stay in this hotel. Clean rooms also and good food and drinks in The Pool rest. This hotel is close to everything, walking distance to center of the city and next to the metro station.
title: Nice and good staff

review: A very happening lobby which is fun, and very quiet rooms! Restaurant is really yummy. The Amstel River is a couple blocks away and there are great places to eat in the area. There is no hair dryer or hair conditioner or coffee/tea in the room, but other than that, it was just right.
title: great

review: The hotel is situated at the edge of the city and only 4 metro stops from the main train station. The front desk staff was always friendly and gave some great tips on where to eat and what to do. They also hooked me up with a hair dryer for the duration of my stay. The hotel itself is like a big college dorm with ping pong, pool tables, a TedEx listening pod, and lots of cozy hangout spots on the main floor. The rooms are rather large for Amsterdam (this is my 4th visit to the city and this is by far the biggest room I've had) and though there is A/C it is set to go no lower than 25C (77F). It was not so hot the week we were there so this wasn't a big problem, but sometimes you just need it a bit cooler! The other issue with the room was that there were VERY few electric outlets. There was one by the TV and one in the bathroom, but NONE by the bed - how can this be?! I wonder how students actually live there during the year with only 2 outlets! The bed was mediocre - kind of hard and not all that comfortable, but it was okay for a week. The bigger issue was that the blinds at the big, full wall window had a gap in them and since there was no curtain the sun would come in and blind me in bed early in the morning (which was great I guess since my phone was charging in the bathroom and I didn't always hear the alarm). Breakfast was an additional 19 euro per person so we opted out but I went down for (free) coffee every morning and the buffet looked nice (just not 19 euro pp nice). There is a great little cafe close by called Benji's that has great food and nice people working there. We tended to have breakfast/brunch there in the morning. Also a bakery down the street and a grocery store (now being remodeled) across the street.
title: Great location, interesting concept, but some weird issues.

review: Fantastic, stayed for 2 nights with my husband, there were a mix of ages from students to families to businessmen. Front desk staff were great, we received waffle cookies on check in and a city map. We were on the 12th floor and had great views. Room was a good size and equipped with everything we needed, shower room was also a good size with shower gel, shampoo and hand soap provided. The metro only takes about 7-8 mins to and from central station and a 2min walk from station to hotel, absolutely loved our stay here and would definitely stay again.
title: Great base for all ages

review: Despite the name, I had no idea this was student housing. Seems that it's mostly student housing during the year and mostly a hotel in the summer. That said there were many young people, which made us feel a bit out of place despite the excellent, friendly and English speaking front desk. Rooms are spacious enough and thoroughly modern. Wifi is excellent. Although on a metro line, this is mostly useful if coming from the train station or airport. Tram is much more useful. Figure 25-30 minutes to get to the hub. Not a big deal given the frequency of the trams. Some basic and fast food restaurants close by. We chose this hotel for financial reasons and it is great bang for the buck.
title: A bit weird for boomers but great hotel

review: I stayed here for 2 days in a double ensuite room. The room was big, good and everything was fine. Telly was also working fine. The Student Hotel have good facilities- silent reading room, table tennis, mini-gym, bar and restaurant and much more. Drawback - the bathroom do not have a cubicle, but a shower curtain with no hand shower.Overall experience was really good. I would surely recommend this hotel!
title: Amazing hotel at a great location

review: Great hotel that's very close to Metro links. The staff were very friendly and were happy to give helpful hints, recommendations and suggestions. Would recommend this hotel to any friends who wish to visit
title: Great short trip to Amsterdam

review: A very nice hotel with very helpful and accommodating staff. Close to the tube. Only 4 stops away from the city centre and central station. Good bartender who served good cocktails. The breakfast was fine, but not spectacular. I only tried the restaurant once, and the burger I had was well cooked and tasted good. The best thing for me, however, was the always smiling and nice people in the reception who did everything they could to make you feel welcome. That also extends to the staff in the bar and in the restaurant. A very special hello to Dirk, who I shared some drinks with on more than one occasion. Greetings from your shoe and foodobsessed guest �
title: Good hotel with very nice and helpful staff.

review: This is a very jovial place, but it caters for the young at heart of all ages. The interior design is playful and functional. There are study rooms, a nice gym and a listening center with comfortable armchairs that reinforces the youthful atmosphere.The hotel is situated a bit outside the absolute city center, but the metro stops just 100 m away from the entrance, and takes you downtown in a few minutes.Restaurant was OK, and breakfast great.Staff really did their best to make the check-in smooth and the stay pleasant.
title: Cool atmosphere

review: I had a transportation issue that stranded me in Togo, Africa for two days causing me to not be present to stay in the room I booked. ( I was in Africa as part of my studies assisting members of the Peace Corps). I booked through Booking.com and I did not choose the option to get a refund, I acknowledge this fact. I contacted the hotel to let them know the situation thinking that they might be customer service oriented and have compassion for a student's budget. I completely understand them charging me for two nights (of three because I was going to arrive there on the third day) but they gave zero leniency and basically told me that if I had booked through the hotel's website that they would've helped me and that I should contact Booking.com, which I did. Booking.Com's response was that they couldn't refund me but the hotel could if they saw fit to do so. When I finally arrived, they had deleted my reservation entirely, likely so that they could book out the room in my absence. I had to wait almost an hour to have my reservation reinstated in the computer system. The young lady that completed the reinstatement of my reservation was the only staff member that was in anyway helpful or kind. I have worked in the hospitality industry, including high-end resort hotels, and this experience in my opinion deserves a zero rating. This pretentious frat house that calls itself a hotel is the worst. I suggest to anyone to look elsewhere for accommodations in Amsterdam.
title: Terrible Customer Service

review: I really liked the hotel, its atmosphere and the facilities! The atmosphere was professional but still young and fresh. It has loads to offer - a gym, table tennis, a cool bar and a place where you can order and enjoy some food. And I received some icecream while checking in!The only disadvantage is the relatively high price. If I was privately going to Amsterdam I probably wouldn't be able / wouldn't want to pay as much per night. Yet, I still liked my visit very much and would recommend it to everyone!
title: Very cool hotel with a professional, yet still young and fresh atmosphere!

review: The Student Hotel at Amsterdam City was overall just what we needed at the end of our 2 week backpacking trip. We stayed 2 nights there after traveling with backpacking backpacks hoping between hostels shared with 6-8 people. So we really appreciated the privacy, cleanliness, and an actual quiet and comfy bed. However, I do have two criticisms that I believe can be easily fixed. Firstly, our room was never cleaned even though we put up the "please clean our room" sign. Not a big deal, but just letting you know. Secondly, when we rented bikes from the hotel and rode back after a really long day in the city, we accidentally biked all the way to the Student Hotel Amsterdam West. When we tried to return the bikes we weren't sure why our bikes didn't match the bikes there. I checked the room key and there was no indication as to which hotel we were staying at. My boyfriend and I did not remember anything else besides the brand name of the hotel. When I was about to check my email receipt my phone died. But we began to figure that we might be at a different hotel. We started to lock up our bikes to go ask reception for help when I saw that our bikes said Amsterdam City and the other Student Hotel bikes said Amsterdam West. This was the only indication that there were two locations and that we were in the wrong place. It turns out we were quite a ways from our hotel :(So my advice is to specify on the room keys which location guests are staying at. Or indicate in more than one place on the rental bikes which location they belong to :)
title: Restful stay in a tiny modern paradise

review: Right next to the metro. Welcome cookie was thoughtful and delicious. You also get a map of the city when you check-in. $12 a day for bike (worth it), $12 a day for breakfast (cheaper to eat at a local place). The rooms have energy savers so use key for lights and air. Spacious room, beautiful decor, no mini fridge, free waters. Use room key to open doors for safety. Restaurant attached good for a quick drink (Desperados is like Corona with tequila, it's sweet). I would definitely stay here if we come back to Amsterdam.
title: Beautiful hotel!

review: Stayed here for two nights for our wedding anniversary in July, we were a little apprehensive as with what to expect, due to the hotel name, but it was a fantastic stay, there were students, families and businessmen all staying here and we all blended seamlessly. Staff at the front desk we're young, enthusiastic and welcoming ( we even received danish cookies on arrival). We were on the 12th floor and had amazing views. Room was well appointed and shower room was a nice size too with good water pressure. We dined in the connecting restaurant "The Pool" on one night and it was great food and attentive staff and only for we stayed in Amsterdam central quite late on our second night we would have eaten in the Pool a second time.I really would love to stay here again and would recommend it to any and all ages.
title: Fantastic

review: I would definitley stay here again. The place was modern, clean and the staff were very friendly. There are many facilities in the hotel communal area such as table tennis and pool. The bar area was also very nice. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the pillows in the room but the mattresses were comfortable.
title: Clean & modern

review: Really enjoyed my stay at this hotel - great staff, good location and very good value. Would recommend this to friends and colleagues looking for a reasonably priced and interesting place to stay in Amsterdam - close to everything!
title: Amsterdam visit

review: Perfect stay for a City trip. The Hotel is just next to the Metro. Traveltime to city-center about 8min. Rooms are small but nice and clean. Bike-rental located in the Hotel! Nice and friendly staff. The only Thing we missed are some facilities in the room (no safe, hair-dryer, etc.)
title: City-trip hotel

review: I booked a single room. Very small and dark. No safe. Decent breakfast. Good location (main reason for stay).Good parking facilities and not too expensive for Amsterdam (second reason for stay).As the name implies good hotel for students and young people.Reception staff very pleasant!
title: (Reasonably) cheap accommodation in Amsterdam city

review: Over our expectation! Cool and playful environment, fresh and clean room and bathroom! The hotel works fine even if your not a student. Extremely close to the Metro. I would definitely recommend this hotel! The breakfast was good also.
title: Over our expectation

review: We stayed in the student hotel at wibaustraat. The location is very convenient with metro Station literally just outside the hotel so you have access to the whole city. So no worries location wise. The hotel is very clean and the staff is just awesome. The overall vibe is superb. There is pool and ping pong table at the ground floor so played that quite a bit. There is a vending machine in the lobby as well although overpriced but quite convenient late night when nothing is open in the neighbourhood. The room was quite comfortable for 2 people. Shower could have been better. Overall a superb stay and would recommend this to anyone visiting Amsterdam. Cheers
title: Clean hotel, nice location

review: The hotel was really easy to find. I got there very early in the morning and was allowed to check in right away. The first time I went to the city center, it was a very easy and beautiful walk. If I wanted to save time, the metro stop was right there. The rooms were good. Didn't spend too much time in it but to sleep, but the hotel bar/restaurant was a great place to hang out and meet others. We got a few good recommendations for our stay from staff and guests alike
title: Great few days just enough outside of the city

review: This hotel has unique decor with entertaining community areas (ping-pong, biallards, chess set with pieces that are at least a foot tall). There's a metro station right outside that makes getting around very easy.
title: Interesting place

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is fab! Spent the weekend here celebrating my husbands 30th & it was worth every penny! The staff were super friendly & fixed a leak in our room on the sat eve whilst we were out & the manager met us when we checked out to make sure we were ok & to apologise. The restaurant was exquisite and the cocktails were fantastic, both with great service. Would 100% recommend this hotel if you're looking for a treat
title: Beautiful Hotel, Great Location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed two nights in Kimpton De Witt, and it was just perfect. Clean, Comfortable, helpful staff. Conveniently located in the Centre. One of the best hotels I have been to. It could not have been better! Thanks to the management and Staff
title: Perfect Stay

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed here when it was a Crown Plaza and had a good experience. I love the new branding and renovations as a Dewitt Kimpton. Really great staff. Nice, modern, clean rooms. And did I say great staff! Highly recommend this for business or pleasure.
title: Love it!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is brand new and beautiful right near central station and damrak! Great place to be , beautiful rooms and very accommodating to our dog ! Truly recommend this hotel for anybody traveling to Amsterdam !!!
title: Excellent hotel !!! Pet friendly !!!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Would definitely stay at this hotel again. Staff could not do enough for us really friendly and helpful. Great bar and restaurant. Loved the room really clean and comfortable with free wifi.Great location too.
title: Great Hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Fantastic hotel! Staff were great and very helpful, surroundings and decor lovely, the room was great and comfortable Absolutely loved it at this hotel, highly recommended to anyone Has concierge too so your bags are taken care of, they are all polite
title: Birthday weekend break

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We have just spent two nights in possibly the gloomiest and certainly the noisiest hotel room I have ever experienced.Having booked a King Junior Suite for the weekend, we were then acknowledged at check-in as Platinum IHG Club members and 'upgraded'. Unfortunately as we were late arriving, our son and his girlfriend were already waiting in the restaurant. There was no time to take in any details of the room as we dropped our cases turned the AC to maximum cooling and went straight out.After a very nice meal in Wyers Restaurant, we returned late that night to be hit by the dreadful noise from trams and other traffic just yards from the windows. The room was still warm as the single small AC outlet was totally inadequate and there was almost no light available. The bathroom was tiny with no bath and only a shelf behind the toilet to balance soap bags etc on.Unfortunately our weekend schedule left us with no time to request and then move to a different room and I accept that the hotel may have done this if asked. That said, I cannot believe that they are unaware of the problems with room 235.We visit Amsterdam regularly, but nothing would tempt us back to the Kimpton De Witt.
title: Avoid room 235 at all costs

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for 5 days and loved every minute. Hotel is still brand new after a refurbishment so we were lucky to be some of the first to stay there! The staff were brilliant and helped us to hire bikes (which you can hire from reception) and booked a couple of tours for us too. You couldn't get a more central location too, right in centrum and about 2 minutes from centraal station. The room was absolutely brilliant, comfortable and also had a massive TV not that we spent much time watching!
title: Brilliant and brand new too!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Can't say enough about this place. The location is brilliant, the staff even better and the room was just delightful. We loved the moonlit views of Amsterdam from our dormer windows. Don't miss wine hour!
title: Highly Recommend

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: 1. Beautiful hotel/setting/ambience/location2. Front desk - not friendly3. Did not take care about any of the two requests I made while booking - infact on ckecking in - I was rudely asked to wait for another hour if I wanted the room as per my requests4.The room I was given - though not as per my choice was good- so no complaints on that5. They serve fruit infused water at the lobby - once there were no fresh glasses - I asked the guy at the front desk - he said it would take an hour - since the glasses had gone for dish washing - they weren't there even after an hour 6. I booked the room with breakfast - On the last day I had to check out at 7am - the breakfast starts at 6.30 - but the restaurant was so disorganized - that we had to leave midway - half the things were not ready Also the worst thing about breakfast is - its not a buffet- so yu have o call your server for everything - so much time wasted-a mixed happy/unhappy experience
title: Hiccupps since its still new

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Such a nice place, quite, and the stuff are friendly, recommended for the next travel. You could find all what you need in this hotel.I hope having time to come back again soon.Best of luck for all who gonna try this experience.
title: Just what you need for relaxing

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Wonderfully refurbished hotel in modern design featuring lounge, bar restaurant and library areas that are not only accessible to use but give you the impression you are surrounded by unique pieces and furnishings in an art gallery. The rooms offer a luxurious feel ( yes even the standard rooms) and the staff are simply delightful and accommodating in every way. This was our first visit and we didn't eat in the restaurant however we certainly look forward to doing so next visit. The bar is a lovely pre and post dinner spot and all of central Amsterdam is minutes away by foot! Highly recommend this glorious hotel.
title: Artistic Luxury plus location, location, location!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We love every part of this hotel! I love the design tooooo much! We stayed at the little house room which has 2 bedrooms. So it fit us perfectly.. the staffs were very nice and warm..make me feel so comfortable.. breakfast was good. Everything perfect
title: Perfect stylish and comfortable hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location near central train station! Staff were very helpful getting us train tickets when we were checking out. Luxury hotel with nice wine social hour in early evening. Thanks for a wonderful stay and also for sending a complimentary bottle of champagne and gourmet cookies for our wedding anniversary!
title: Awesome Hotel in Amsterdam!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I have been coming to this hotel for the past six years about twice a year, and is a spire elite ihg member. This was my first time since they hotel transformed from crownplaza to kimpton.The new look is lovely and hip, and it was great to see some of the old staff.However, I wasn't upgraded to the larger rooms with balcony but just to a street facing room (I guess I have been spoilt by the crowne plaza staff) as a spire number, but that wasn't a big issue as I hardly spend time in the room.However the front desk at check out was a disaster. 25 mins to check out, with only two staff then three working the desks. Big line, and simply not the same crownplaza efficiency. Hope they improve it soon...
title: Great new look but lost the touch of Crowne plaza

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is just stunning! From the impeccable reception and staff to the beautiful sheltered hidden 'outdoor' courtyard with suspended seats, I loved it all! Our room was on floor 5 with views of the city and was stylishly simple and luxurious. Top quality bedding and towels, and quirky ornaments! I loved the idea of the yoga mat and although I didn't use it, it's a really nice amenity. We enjoyed the most exquisite food in the bar, compliments to the chef.The staff in the hotel, from reception team to bar staff are just lovely, taking time to chat to us, yet very efficient and nothing was too much trouble.We will definitely stop at this hotel again and highly recommend it to all our friends and family when they visit Amsterdam.
title: Just fabulous!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotels that provide free water (still and sparkling in this case), coffee (Nespresso) and internet get my high vote. Plus very-very friendly service, attentive and comforting. Plus delicious breakfast. Plus free paper in the morning. Many pluses. Definitely a great place to stay.
title: Perfect location, great staff, clean and comfortable rooms

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Myself and teenage daughter stayed for 3 nights. I can honestly say it is the best hotel I have ever stayed in.... and I travel with work so have stayed in many across Europe. The staff were polite attentive and helpful with every concern, so much so that we were truly able to relax. My daughter has a life threatening allergy so the reassurances at the restaurant were invaluable.The food at Wyers was great and the breakfast was varied and perfectly cooked. There is a lovely wine reception in the evenings and an outside courtyard with relaxing swing chairs that we adored.The staff had advice for making the most of the holiday and able to supply tickets (Van Gogh Museum and GVB transport in our case) and they were genuinely interested in what you have enjoyed in Amsterdam. For example, we were advised to take care from pickpockets in the built up tourist areas. We were also given an umbrella on the one rainy day. Given it is a 5* hotel, most guests respected this. Both myself and my daughter were so sad to leave this wonderful home from home. We hope to return.
title: Brilliant stay, recommended

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed here for two nights. The entrance of the hotel looks quite small but once you step inside you enter a large space with a very modern design.  The rooms are decently sized and are very modern! It is very different from other hotels which makes it stand out. We had a few issues with our rooms such as a missing remote and a broken light but the staff were very apologetic and gave us fruit baskets and did not charge us for a late check out.  You can probably tell now that the staff are very very friendly and cater to all of your needs! The rooms are quite clean and are well maintained. The breakfast at the cafe had a wide variety of food to offer and they're all excellent!  I would definitely recommend someone to stay here! There are many shops and restaurants all around, but keep in mind the Red Light District is not very far from here.
title: Best place to stay in the heart of Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I used to go to this hotel since it was Crown Plaza, but now as Kimpton De Witt it became an excellent choice for my wife and myself. Excellent location, super clean rooms, and friendly staff I enjoyed my last stay and surely we will get back there
title: the best loved boutique hotel in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location, beautiful design and friendly staff makes we can definitely recommend Krimpton De Witt for a stay in Amsterdam. There are two downsides. The first: do not take breakfast. A 'continental' breakfast costs 21 euro and exists of only 1 croissant, some fruit and some yoghurt. There are a lot of breakfast spots nearby. Second downside: double rooms have very small beds. It is actually something in between a single and a double bed. Overall we really enjoyed our stay and we wouldn't mind choosing the same hotel next time in Amsterdam.
title: Cosy design hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The location is good, within 5 min walk to central station. Space and decoration of lobby give a good first impression. All the items of furniture in the room are nice and unique. You will have the local Amsterdam feeling, not just a chain hotel. The wine time is a pleasure, the only problem is it's only an hour per day. I got some treats for my anniversary, the service is great and sweet. Also, staff gave me a good recommendation for dinner, they know this city well and very helpful in giving a suggestion.
title: Great and unique experience in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I was here for two nights with my boyfriend. Our flight to Amsterdam was delayed with 5 hours, so you can imagine how bad our mood was. I thought that out city break will continue in the same way, but I was so wrong. This is by far the best place I've ever stayed. The staff at reception are amazing - friendly, chatty, really helpful. I did not check the name of the girl who checked us in, she was a really nice girl with curly hair. If you read this- million times thank you for the warm welcome and for making me feel so special. After we checked in we went into the center and after that we had surprise in the room - welcome card and some snacks. The second day we stayed was my birthday and I had reaaallly nice surprise in our room - champagne and sweets. You really made my day superb.Other than the fact that the staff are amazing, the hotel itself is gorgeous, clean, modern, perfect until the last detail. The rooms are cosy, with new furniture and nice bathrooms.The location is perfect for sightseeing, it's right in the center and it's a couple of minutes away from the central railway station. Thank you for making my birthday holiday perfect. We will be back for sure!
title: Absolutely amazing!!!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hubby and I stayed for two nights last week at this fabulous newly renovated hotel and we loved every single minute of it.I had called the hotel prior to our arrival as we were due to arrive early ahead of the official check-in time. I just wanted to check that there would be somewhere for hubby to change as he had a meeting scheduled for early that same afternoon.I dealt with a charming young lady who informed me that if there was an appropriate room available we would be able to check in, otherwise, provisions would be made available for my husband to change.The hotel is located just a few minutes' walk from Amsterdam Centraal station, and very easy to find. We were warmly greeted and hubby duly changed and went off to his meeting. Carlos, just one of the extremely helpful Reception staff, stored our bags so that we could retrieve them when we checked in later in the afternoon leaving me free to go shopping.Our room was perfectly charming with a wonderful bathroom featuring a rainfall shower, and our bed was so very comfortable. And this was in a standard room!My husband and I have been visiting Amsterdam for more than 20 years and have stayed at a variety of hotels and boats, as well as with relatives, but I can honestly say that this is one of the nicest hotels in the city that we have had the good fortune to stay in. Every single member of staff made it his or her business to greet all guests on sight, whether arriving, going out or returning or finally leaving their wonderful establishment.Another example: I returned to the hotel after a day in Haarlem and sat in one of their comfortable sofas to drink a cup of complimentary coffee - tea and coffee are available from sun up to sun down to all residents in the common areas. A charming team member then asked me if I'd also like to try a new pastry with chocolate sauce. I said that I would, and it was a delicious accompaniment to my coffee! She seemed genuinely delighted to discover that I had enjoyed it so much!I have no hesitation in recommending this hotel - if you can stay here, do it. You won't regret it!
title: Top spot to stay in Central Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This was my first stay at a Kimpton hotel, and it won't be the last. I shared a twin room with my teenage daughter and it was a very comfortable, exceptionally clean room. Very comfortable beds with excellent pillows, Nespresso coffee maker, complimentary water - still and sparkling, and lovely, warm bath robes.The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and as we had arrived after 6pm, we were presented with vouchers for complimentary glasses of wine as we had missed "Wine hour" (5pm until 6pm). Room service was prompt and not extortionate. The breakfasts are excellent, and next time we visit, we will try definitely try dinner in the restaurant.The hotel is only a 5 minute walk from the station, and most major attractions are easily reached on foot too. There are tram stops nearby if you wish to use public transport.Highly recommended
title: Superb hotel with excellent staff

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Everything about the hotel experience from the communication I had before leaving the States to our arrival, room choice, support from staff during our stay and our 5am check-out was flawless. The Managers and front line staff were all delightful and could not have been more dedicated to making our stay at the hotel and in Amsterdam a great adventure.The room had a lovely view of the area--which helped us determine the weather each morning, we used the hotel bikes to get around which was complimentary and easy to arrange, there is a Tram Stop across the street and you can walk to Central Station easily----it is also located in the middle of the city so you can walk to EVERY neighborhood and attraction--bring comfortable shoes!Overall, one of the best hotel experiences we've had---Kimpton culture and standards as well as Kimpton style are well represented in this property!You cannot go wrong with the DeWitt!
title: Best Boutique Hotel in Amsterdam! Kimpton NEVER disappoints!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Room was clean and quiet, and I especially appreciated the tall shower (an issue for me, at 6'6'', or 2 meters). The staff was super friendly and helpful, and the location is right in the heart of Amsterdam. Hard to imagine how it could be any better.
title: Great!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Previously knows as Crowne Plaza hotel became Kimpton De Witt only recently (May 2017). It has great potential, mostly because of its great location close to Central Station and modern-enough build style. However the owners should have spent more money on experienced staff and tweaking the rooms; for example air condition tends to be a bit moody, blowing either hot or cold the entire night, beds are sub-standard in size and too soft, windows don't open (really!), TV has its quirks... cleaning staff is very persistent to get into your room in the morning, but - hey - if you're in Amsterdam better spend your time outside. The rooms are not cheap: we paid $250 per night - granted, it is high season now. 3 out of 5.
title: Good location, work in progress

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I've stayed at many Kimptons in the states so was excited to see it made its way to Amsterdam. Its a great location - everything is in walking distance. The onsite restaurant and bar are top end all the way. The staff was friendly and the room quite cozy. I would easily stay here again!
title: Great Kimpton property in Europe

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed for 3 nights in the "old house" in the middle of the hotel. We were made to feel very welcome on arrival and the room was quiet and very comfortable. We dined in the adjoining restaurant on one evening and the food was very good.Would recommend this hotel!
title: Excellent

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I have stayed in many Kimpton hotels in the states and was so pleased to hear this hotel had opened in Amsterdam. I was not disappointed. The staff here go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and it almost felt like arriving home. The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are georgeously comfortable...especially the beds! I can't wait to go back for another stay. Well done Kimpton
title: Amazing hotel -truly exceptional staff and ultra luxurious accommodation

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location and very friendly and helpful staff. The rooms a very nice appointed with Nespresso coffee machine and giant tv with German and English channels. Free wine cocktail hour in the evening. The concierge was very helpful in advising us on everything. Same price museum tickets without having to commit to a special day. All a very good experience.
title: Great location

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We've gone to Amsterdam several times, and each time have stayed in a different hotel. However, now we will only stay at the Kimpton Hotel De Witt. We went to Hotel De Witt for a long weekend in July, and I must say it was fantastic. First the front desk staff is so warm and friendly; and, even though our room wasn't ready took our phone number and offered to call us when it was available. Next, the concierge was incredibly helpful, and offered advice on a great lunch spot plus arranged for us to take small and personalized canal tour (Cruise like a Local) -- it was so much nicer than the big tours. The room is well laid out, and the bed is so comfortable that the only reason you want to get up is to go out and enjoy Amsterdam. Finally, when we were leaving the bellman / luggage person was so helpful. We had 3 large bags and he helped us carry them to the Amsterdam station, plus showed us to the train and explained how to figure out where we were sitting (we still can't thank him enough for all his help). The entire stay was at the De Witt was terrific -- and it was the staff and the rooms that made the difference from other hotels. We plan to stay at the De Witt next time we’re in Amsterdam! Thank you for a great stay Hotel De Witt.
title: Terrific Hotel and VERY Helpful Staff

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Location is perfect: next to the train station and the rooms are very confortable. The staff is very welcoming and cheerful.Pepper shampoo is a bit strange but nothing impossible. At this time, the hostel is almost brand new and looks very modern and elegant.
title: Very good hotel for short trips

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: its very nice hotel for family ...and it in dam ...near of every thing in amsterdam ...i advice every on to book there ...the hotel is comfortabel ..the rooms is very beuteful......the hotel place is good to reach the tram ...or hopes....or many restorant ...
title: FAWZEIAH ...KUWAIT

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I often stay in Amsterdam for one night during layovers between long flights. It is a beautiful city and so easy to go from the airport to downtown by train to walk by the canals, eat great food and take in some culture for 24 hours. It has been hard to find a hotel very near the train station that is stylish, has the amenities a traveler on layover needs (quiet room, gym, great room service, proximity to lots of restaurants, etc) but this has it all. And the style of the rooms is somehow hip but warm, Dutch but universal, and so well thought out. Gym was terrific. Room service was prompt and food was great. I can say enough good things about the hotel and staff. I'll definitely be back.
title: Fantastic new hotel near Central station

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: As from June 2017 the hotel is fully renovated - the design of the lobby the new bar and the restaurant is excellent. What's more important it was given much thought to make the rooms comfortable in any detail. Perfect matress, pillows, linen, no carpet, handy sockets, make up mirror with a light next to it (much appreciated by my wife), huge tv, coffee and tea maker, normal hair drier, iron even a yoga matress (!!!). Above all the room was exceptionally clean and very quiet and the concierge extremely polite. Not to mention the excellent location close to the superb western canals, 400 m from the central station and right above the centre and dam square (you might have already read all about that), The renovated hotel is a new experience. Tip: don't miss the excellent breakfast served at the hotels restaurant (not a huge buffet where you can find nothing to eat) continental plus gourmet plates served at your table..
title: Spyros: Our stay at Kimpton De Witt, Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had an exceptional stay at the Kimpton De Witt! The staff in every department was absolutely incredible, the rooms were wonderful, and the location is excellent. We are huge fans of Kimpton hotels, and this first hotel in Europe is an outstanding addition to the brand. We will definitely be back!
title: Amazing hotel and incredible staff

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Easy trip from airport by train to centre. Hotel close by. Great hip tea station to enjoy upon arrival or during day. Love the drink & nibbles hour 5-6pm. Different sitting areas, cool bar & restaurant attached. Interior design of room is perfect with simple but new must haves-big water bottles still & sparkling but ever important Nespresso machine & kettle - perfect.
title: Amsterdam cool

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Really nice hotel. Great location. Hotel very clean, perfect. Staff so nice. Very helpful. Have visited amsterdam many times, this is best hotel so far. Nice restaurants nearby and very near station.
title: Nors

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The property is great- located very close to the train station. Very clean and modern inside. But what really made our stay was the stay- so friendly and helpful! Would absolutely come back because of them.
title: Great Stay- Amazing Staff

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Wow Kimpton! And here I thought I'd already stayed in the best Kimpton hotel! As an Inner Circle member, I love the Kimpton family and don't like to choose favorites. But....sigh....DeWitt has managed to break out in quite a sprint and is leading the pack (in my humble opinion:)! The place is beautiful, the location perfect, the food delicious, and the staff AMAZING!! Each room is different (I had 3 - one of each of my sons and one for myself) and each was beautiful and unique. I was fortunate enough to be upgraded to the Penthouse suite and my God was it amazing!!! No spoilers....go there and experience it!I took the time to read the not so stellar reviews left here and sure, there may have been a few kinks as is expected with any new establishment. Also, the IHG/Kimpton merger has created some reward program issues that I'm sure will require time to work through. But through my many many Kimpton stays over the past 2-3 years, I have never met a mediocre Kimpton employee. They all behave as though they have a personal investment in the Kimpton establishment. I find that both impressive and refreshing. DeWitt is indeed keeping with the Kimpton tradition and putting a bit of extra flare on top! Thank you so much for a wonderful stay! I shall return!!
title: Perfection!

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel goes above and beyond. You can walk from Amsterdam central, and there is a great hour of complimentary wine and socialising every evening from 5pm to 6 pm.Coupled with complimentary tea and coffee, and a dark, quiet room with a luxury bed, its superb value for money. Would not stay anywhere else in Amsterdam.
title: Great Hotel, Great location ,Even better service

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is bang in the centre of the city, only 400 yards from the train station. Rooms are quite small, but clean and very comfortable. The staff could not have been more helpful and courteous! And the cocktails in the cocktail bar were impressive. All in all I'd have no hesitation in recommending this as a good city hotel.Note: try to get a room at the front of the hotel so not overlooked.
title: Fantastic hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location, great staff, great service, great rooms, great beds. Everything was perfect during our stay at kimpton de witt. Hotel staff were extremely helpful with any issues. Friendly staff. extremely clean and luxurious hotel
title: Amazing all round experience

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is well situated if you are travelling into Amsterdam arriving at central station, it is literally 300 yards.The entrance area is very smart but the checking in process and also the checking out was very slow, patience is needed.The reception area lounge is actually quite a nice place to chill with free teas and other drinks available.The rooms are also nice and clean. We had the deluxe room with king size bed. The bed was very comfy with a choice of pillows. The room has a kettle, nespresso machine and water which are all complimentary. They also have very good umbrellas for the inevitable dam downpour. The Aircon works well, although for some strange reason if you turn it off the aircon unit makes a lot of noise, so you have to leave the aircon on all the time.Bathrooms were also well designed with large cosy bath towels and more than enough toiletries.You can tell the hotel has recently been refurbished as it all feels quite new.Staff are also very pleasant and happy to do anything for you, just ask.
title: Boutique chic

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Spend a night at your hotel together with my partner.A wonderful experience...Front office employees: Superb, super friendly and professional !!!Very nice room, nice bar/restaurant.Cool lounge area. Will come back for sure!Thumbs up guys!
title: Verblijf 22/7-23/7

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Nice Hotel, very central. Great Service. We come a qurter after closing breakfeast time. But they try everything to full fill our wishes. Because i have an IHG status, we get an very nice upgrade and gift
title: Nice Hotel, very central. Great Service.

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very pleasant hotel with charm and guest treated as top priority Newly renovated rooms and 5 minute walk from the station! Staff goes out of way to make your stay comfortable and relaxing. When we come back we will book again!
title: Very nice hotel close to all the sites

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Just returned from a fantastic weekend in Amsterdam staying at the recently refurbished Kimpton De Witt. Lovely Dutch designer touches,rooms modern,clean and comfortable.Breakfast in Wyers is excellent.
