Also had brunch and evening meal over the weekend.You must try the Chicken lollipops.House Bar is a bit of a hidden gem-a great place to wind down and relax after a hectic day in Amsterdam.
title: Amsterdam Weekend

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Amazing place to stay very accommodating coffee machine in the room with plenty of pods gym is super for a quick holiday sesh provides water and towels very convenient cocktail bar and restraunt in hotel
title: In the heart of it all

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: It normally has to be perfect to get five stars from me but this is the exception as I really enjoyed my stay. The down points were minor. I didn't like queuing to check in especially as there was someone else at the desk doing nothing (they were the concierge I was informed). There was no bath in my room but I would not have used it and the shower was great. The bathrooms were a bit small and the rooms had no view yet that is the end of my fault finding.The hotel was clean and modern. The beds were really comfortable. The staff were really helpful and I loved the idea of the free wine between 1700 and 1800 which brought everyone in the hotel down to the lobby and made it buzz a bit. The bar staff were fabulous and although we did not use the restaurant it did look quite good. Location-wise it was walking distance to the Riik museum and others in that location (about 25 minutes). Also easy access to the Amsterdam museum (about 10 minutes walk). If the red light district is your thing then that is not too far either.Really enjoyable stay
title: Loved this hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Kimpton is one of the best hotel I ever stayed with friendly staffs that gave good recommendation of restaurant, reception, the room is cool, close to shopping, good food, Van Gogh and security is good . . I left my iPad in the hotel and they sent back to me in a week time! (By the way I stays in Singapore) ❤️❤️❤️I will sure to stay there again if I visit Amsterdam!
title: Free and easy trip to Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed at the Kimpton De Witt for 2 nights and had a really enjoyable stay. I have stayed in in a range of hotels over the last 25 years, but this is easily the best hotel i have stayed in.The check-in process was a breeze and the staff were very polite and friendly.The Rooms are very modern and reasonably large with a great bathroom.The hotel has a restaurant/bar and then another bar, both are fantastic.The Hotel is well located and only a 10 min walk from the main train station.I will be booking again next year.
title: Outstanding Hotel

hotelLocation: Nieuwezijds Voorburgwal 5, 1012 RC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: My husband and I visited for the last night of our week trip to The Netherlands. It also happened to be our anniversary. We were greeted kindly and check in was smooth. I was impressed by the brand new remodel that the hotel just had finished. It was probably one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. It was fresh and modern. The room we stayed in was a little small, but I didn't mind. I absolutely loved the design and modern touches applied to the rooms. After arrival, we were provided a bottle of champagne with a nice note congratulating us on our anniversary- how thoughtful! The bed was absolutely superb- so cozy and comfortable. Robes were provided and they were very comfortable. One problem we had in general with staying in Amsterdam was the noise! We were so relived with this hotel as it was so so quiet! We slept so well, we almost missed our flight the next day. Room service was good, but I have had better meals. I really have no complaints, our stay was perfect and I would love to come back!
title: Wow

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel. Very up to date. The thing we liked mosted was the fact we had a kitchenette in the hotel room which was very handy as we cooked our own meals during the evening after a lovely day out. Would recomend this hotel to stay in to future guests. Staff are very polite and attentive. The only bad thing i can say is we dodnt get any toilet roll during iur stay as no one vsiited our room. We did ask for some and git some straight away. Overall really enjoyed our stay. Thank you to all at the element
title: Excellent stay

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The staff was very nice. The room corresponded to the description. Everything was super clean. The mattress was excellent! The breakfast buffet offers healthy options and even fresh lemon and ginger to add to your tea! The location is very good in top of that, with plenty of restaurants in the area. It's outside of the city center (which is what I wanted) but very easily accessible.
title: A very pleasant stay

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Element is very accessible by métro and tram (Ernststraat station). It's connected to a mall (clothing stores, shoe stores, a Japanese restaurant, a Vietnamese restaurant, a Japanese-Korean food store, a large grocery store, etc). The staff are more than helpful, courteous and professional. The breakfast was fine with 3 choices of yogurt, a variety of cereals, hard boiled eggs, bread, jams, croissants, coffee and tea. The room and bathroom are large. Very comfortable bed and pillows. The wifi was stable and good. There's even a kitchenette, plates, cooking utensils, cutleries, glasses, microwave and a dishwasher. There's a nespresso machine but I wasn't sure why the coffee pods were not replenished automatically every day. I had to ask room service for those pods. Also, I thought that by hanging the towels up, they would not be changed but they were changed anyway. Overall, it was a very pleasant experience but I wished that whoever was in charge of room service would be more attentive.
title: Very pleasant

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very nice room (we stayed on fourth floor). Hotel clean and staff very helpful.Also a good location with easy tram link to city centre. Got o Amsterdam Arena to see U2 very easily on public transport.If had one very small gripe (and I mean small, wouldn't put me off staying again); is that the breakfast options are too healthy! After a night out in Amsterdam some unhealthy fatty food is desirable!
title: Wife's Birthday Weekend

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel does not have its own parking garage but one can park safely in parking P1 of the shopping mall the hotel is part of. More cost effective is to park for free in the evenings in the streets surrounding the hotel. Not sure if there are many safety issues with that. The Gordal restaurant downstairs is rather upmarket Spanish, but there are also other dining opportunities in the neighbourhood. Breakfast is in a separate restaurant upstairs. Nice details are multi system power plugs and Nespresso coffee maker.
title: Stylish hotel, parking possible

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Element Amsterdam is a great place to stay. I stayed there for close to two weeks while on business. The hotel is clean, the staff is very friendly, and it is in a great location right next to the mall and many other shops/restaurants.
title: Great Place

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Element makes you at home straight away with friendly staff checking you in. The ambience, amenities, and people make the difference! The location adds to its appeal, which is ideal for a restful night - away from the noise and pollution of the city.
title: Homey hotel!

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Not downtown, but strategically located a ten minute train ride to the airport and right in the centre of the Buidenvedert shopping center. But just a short tram ride from downtown Amsterdam. Fairly big rooms with kitchenette. Reasonable pricing, friendly staff and bicycles for rent as well. Very quiet and safe neighborhood.
title: A great alternative

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We travelled to Amsterdam on the 18th of July and stayed in Element Hotel for a period of 3 nights. Our check in at the hotel was handled efficiently and overall the front desk staff were extremely professional and handled all my queries and requests extremely well. I had an issue with the AC which was also handled very well. The location of the hotel is a bit away from the city center and that's not a bad thing as it is located in a calm neighborhood. The rooms are quite comfortable and my 9 year old son loved the large TVs that were in there. Not much of a view from the rooms as this is a business district. The only area of improvement I would recommend is in the breakfast. It was very one-dimensional and boring. More fruits, cheeses, vegetables and a different additional flavor could help. Overall I would say it was an excellent decision to stay at this hotel and I would strongly recommend it.
title: Very Comfortable stay in a quiet neighbourhood

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Recommend hotel for short and long trips, little far from center but near airport and transportation. the breakfast is not great, hotel is clean, quite, friendly staff and great for business and family trips.
title: Excellent hotel

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Would take this hotel again without hesitation. Just outside town. City center easily accessible with tram. Very clean. Small kitchen with utensils. Our comfortable home for three days. Staff is outstanding.
title: Excellent hotel.

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here as a group of 8 in 4 apartments. Beautifully equipped rooms and very spacious. Lovely modern hotel. Friendly helpful staff. Restaurant very small with not a lot on offer. Ate out all the time.
title: Nice clean hotel with friendly staff

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The room is spacious, clean and overall very pleasant. Breakfast was very good. Basic kitchen in the room and a wonderful supermarket in the mall next door. Public transportation is good once you check in your suitcase. There is a walk from the closest tram to the hotel.
title: Pleasant stay

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Overall staff was wonderful and very accommodating. Area is a great if you want to just have some peace and quiet after hitting all the busy tourist spots. The Tram is just about 3 blocks away. Housekeeping was good. Only Delta would be the bed mattress is on the soft side.
title: Great stay at the Element

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Breakfast can be much better. Vegetables are missing. Food for children is missingThe room is big and very nice looking. The hotel is nice. If you stay zuid thats the best place to stay also for families
title: Hotel is great room great breakfast needs improvement

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Our stay at the Element Amsterdam was wonderful. Nicky, the front desk manager was very helpful. Before we even arrived, Nicky answered all of our questions and even offered so many helpful suggestions making our trip fabulous. The rest of the staff were also very friendly.We liked the location of the hotel. Even though the hotel was about 15 minutes away from downtown, there is a tram stop very close.
title: AMSTERDAM.... Loved it!!!

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: very good value. rooms are nice and clean. Staff is helpful. Breakfast is nice and with variety, they also have a bar. I'd definitely stay again in this hotel if we come back to Amsterdam! city center is 20 min away and it is a nice walk.
title: Excellent value for money

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I stayed here for 2 weeks for business and overall it was a perfectly comfortable stay. Located within a shopping complex very close to the business quarter where I was working this hotel is ideally located for a quiet stay within easy commute of the offices and indeed the city centre for tourists. The hotel is very well presented, clean and tidy in appearance however it's worth noting that there are no cooked breakfasts served which could be dissappointing if you were expecting to spoil yourself with the usual suspects i.e. eggs, bacon, sausages etc. and my room was also very dusty despite being very clean looking on the surface. Overall not a bad stay at all and I would recommend for the location but perhaps not for a long stay.
title: A little decieving..

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Our shampoo dispenser broke and was not repaired for 3 days. Our toilet paper was ruined with a spilled soda and was not replaced for 3 days. We didn't like the way rooms were cleaned. We killed a cocaroach in our room and left it there and it was not cleaned for 3 days, until we informed front desk. There is no concierge!!
title: Super comfortable beds, pillows and overall accommodations. We were not happy with the rooms cleanliness.

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: As a No Service hotel Element has cracked a formulae the hotel is great rooms are big and comfortable with a built in kitchenette .Its connected to the mall so there is a supermarket open till 10 pm on hand ... but all this is perfect for the business traveller whose work is in Zuid . If you are liking to spend two days in Amsterdam as a tourist this hotel is a bit far from all the madness while it's a 20 min tram ride from the city centre it's not a super huge inconvenience but for Amsterdam where everything is five mins away this does seem a bit of a shlepp since the tram station is is 8 min walk from the hotel. But besides this one small issue the hotel is great and the staff is very helpful . Do note the breakfast is super healthy and vegetarian
title: Great business hotel not for the average tourist

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Since It's very difficult to find a parking spot near the Canals which are extremely beautiful, the location of the hotel is good to drive to Zaanse Schans in the morning coz there are also limited parking lots.
title: A quiet place away from city center with easy parking & good kitchen facilities

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel has surprised me and excedeed my expectations by far -already from the booking moment and taxi from the airport reservation, the answers were quick and professional. We arrived at 1:30 am (kind of tired) and met the night concierge, a super friendly person, that engaged with us inmediately with his smile and personal way. This good and personal service continued in the morning with the check out and in the afternoon with the luggage pick up. Reception was constantly helpful and in an easy but professional way. I felt like home!Our room was super confortable and the hotel is also really good located - middle way between the airport and the city centre.And the breakfast was as it was prepared for me: healthy selection of products and good croissants :)We will be back for sure!
title: Looking so forward to come back

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great rooms with a kitchenette. Staff very friendly and helpful. Keta and Fatima did a great job providing us with coffee at breakfast and were very friendly. We left as friends. Hotel is part of a large shopping centre with a big supermarket. Doesn't take Visa or Mastercard. Has a laundry.
title: A great place to stay

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel was wonderful. It is in between the airport and downtown. The tram is right around the corner, 10 min walk and very easy to understand. A cab ride from downtown was also not too expensive either if you were there late at night. The rooms were very spacious, especially if you get a corner room! The breakfast in the morning was AMAZING. The granola/trailmix station was by far the best i have ever seen. The staff was very friendly and willing to answer all questions. Our bartender who worked at night was amazing. She was so cute. Also Nicky at the front desk was excellent before and during our stay. I highly recommend this hotel.
title: Comfortable, Affordable and Clean

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The property was great. I would have liked to have my status as a Lifetime Platinum respected. I got the same room as the 3 people traveling with me. None of them were even Platinum! i mention it to the checkin person but she said nothing.
title: New

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed for 3 days in this hotel. I am a SPG gold member.To start with, we reached the hotel at 13:00. And the check in was promised for 15:00 hrs. Left the luggage and went out to the nearby mall for lunch and came back at 15:00 - was told room is still not ready! 15:10 - Not ready, 15:30 not ready. After telling the receptionist that as an SPG loyalist I don't expect this from the hotel, she called the manager and finally we were given a suite which was an upgrade. I would have expected the upgrade without asking and without delay. But that's the only grievance we had, the manager called later on to apologise which was a nice gesture. The hotel is clean and green, room was great although room service did not replace the coffee capsules. It is located in a quite area 5 Kms from Dam square and adjacent to a mall. You can buy eatables and can even cook as the room had a kitchenette! The gym was functional and the equipments were of very good quality. Overall the hotel is good but I think the staff should be trained to be more forthcoming and also some knowledge on SPG points/ guidelines would help the hotel become preferred choice for the loyalists.
title: Nice hotel slow staff

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: 1st off. This hotel is beautiful done. From the lobby, to the dining area, to the room, to the gym & even the laundry room, it's very well done. The staff are extremely helpful and go over the top to make sure your accommodations are met. I would like to personally thank Wise(spellcheck) & Bart for their assistance, as well as everyone else on staff (house keeping, restaurant attendant who allowed me to use the tea strainer, & breakfast attendant who gave me a glass of apple juice when I was late to breakfast). Bottomline. Everyone makes you feel at home. The room itself was very spacious and clean. The location was perfect, with a supermarket 20 steps from the hotel.  I've been to Amsterdam many times. This place was my best stay yet.Grateful.Best Regards,Julian
title: Best Stay I've Had Yet in Holland!

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We flew into Amsterdam a few days early to have some additional time prior to our cruise. The travel instructions on the Element site were enough to get us on the right train to the nearest station. Not a terrible walk to the hotel. The room was easily large enough for our comfort, we didn't have to squeeze past each other constantly, and the bed was comfortable as well. We really appreciated the included breakfast, and the free wine in the late afternoon. We had worried about location but it was a short walk to the tram station that took us straight through the key part of the tourist area to the central station. Short walk to a very nice park and lastly, it is located at a mall with a couple of good bakeries, and...a couple of good chocolate shops! We would definitely stay at this hotel again.
title: Pre-cruise stay

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Super friendly checkin. Really appreciated the room was available in the morning. Rooms are modern and very clean. Great idea to have the bicycles available. This is a nice area to explore on bikes. Enjoyed the breakfast that was included. Will defiantly be back.
title: Wonderful

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel was a short tram ride to the city centre (25 minutes) the hotel was spotless, friendly and helpful staff. Free bike hire from reception.Breakfast was included in our 3 night stay which was self service, good selection of cereals, with a choice of yogurts, dried fruit, bread and cheese along with a selection of breads.This hotel focuses on healthy lifestyle which reflects the type of breakfast served. Our room came with a kitchenette which was more than adequate - even had a dishwasher. The hotel is attached to a small shopping mall, so if you want to prepare a simple meal or a picnic it's worth getting your groceries from one of the 3 supermarkets.The bed was enormous and so comfortable, slept really well after being out and about all day.
title: City break

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed there 7/30-8/2. Easy bus ride from airport to front of hotel. Newer clean and modern hotel in a beautiful shopping mall with three grocery stores and three restaurant.Continental breakfast and happy hour drinks with wine included ! Room was good size with good bedding and towels. Easy access to downtown with train or bus. Highly recoomended.
title: Newer Modern Hotel

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very nice hotel. A little off the beaten path, but not too far to walk to the tram that will take you to the center of things - about 10 mins. The staff really stood out for us. My mom was not well when we arrived early to check in. The hotel was full so our room was not ready as it was only 10am. the staff made sure my mom was comfortable in their lobby, which had lots of couches and private areas. The woman at the desk said they would prioritize cleaning our room (we requested 2 single beds and there were only 2 such rooms in the whole hotel). They went out of their way to accommodate us and we were able to get into our room by noon - 3 full hours before their posted check in time. The room was modern and bright with a full kitchen. the bathroom was HUGE by European standards. Would definitely return to Element Amsterdam if the opportunity arises!
title: Excellent service and staff

hotelLocation: A.J. Ernststraat 577, 1082 LD Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel with great staff. You can borrow a bicycle at the front desk free of charge! Location is a little out of the way if you're vacationing, but it in the middle of the business district if you're here for work.I had a minor crisis where I needed to place a phone call. The front desk staff was very helpful, understanding and patient and I was able to sort everything out
title: Awesome Hotel

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel had everything you need spa was great ! The rooms where nice with a lovely deep bath clean .!!!!! The food was excellent.A little bit away from centre but a tram ride is all you need Highly recommended I'm booking again for this year
title: Nice hotel & staff

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel was spot on,very nice area and easy to get into dam square (15 minutes on tram, 1 or 17)All hotel staff were very helpful,polite and attentive.Rooms were spotless with shower,bath and a separate toilet.We will return for sure.Thank you to all staff for all your kindness. Mr & Mrs Ritchie (304).
title: LOVELY SHORT BREAK

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Had a wonderful time at Westcord Fashion hotel, staff were so friendly and the hotel is lovely. Stayed only one night but wish we could have stayed longer! Safe parking onsite and access to the pool and gym. The decor is modern and trendy plus the outdoor terrace is perfect for a hot drink and relaxation. Tram stop is a short walk away so easy to get to city centre
title: One night stay in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Modern hotel well located with friendly staff comfy beds and spacious rooms. Only two stops from the airport and 4 tram stops to city centre makes this hotel an ideal base to explore Amsterdam. Nicely decorated rooms with separate bathroom and toilet. The room also has a kettle and a Nespresso machine for tea and coffee. For €45 extra you can upgrade your room to add slippers fluffy robes fresh fruit water chocolate and a late check out of 3pm on day of departure! Skkybar on the 10th floor has a great cocktail menu accompanied by barbites which are nice. Didn't eat in the restaurant except for breakfast which is well presented but at €19 each a little expensive. Really enjoyed staying at the hotel and would definitely return.
title: 5 star stay for 4 star price

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed for three nights as a family of four - with two grown-up children. The hotel was extremely accommodating - they put us close together and made sure the boys had a frosted glass door on their bathroom. We were able to check in early to one of the rooms - helping us feel a lot better.The hotel is quirky with great and unique design features - really fun! The rooms are really comfy - the beds reminded me of the Hypnos beds used by Premier inn - really comfy!! There was a choice of pillows and there's loads of plug sockets, mirrors and lighting. There's a Nespresso machine - and three free pods each day - as well as English blend tea bags, sweeteners, milk and sugar. However if we went back we might bring some of our own pods as we couldn't see any in the local shops. There's also a free spacious safe which gives you good security - really impressive! There are two supermarkets about a ten minute walk away - with a full range of goods to buy, and they're near the tram stop - which takes you into town. We bought a three day pass (about 17 euros each) which gives free travel on trams, buses and the metro. Get the number one to central or the 17 to Anne Franke's house.We ate out - breakfast at the De Vondel Tuin in Vondel Park (20 minute walk) is great and dinner at Beer Oslos was fabulous but I'll do a separate review on those. The pool was lovely and warm - for extra you could get robes and go for sauna and treatments. The Sky Bar was a nice place to have a nightcap - great views over the city. All in all it was a fabulous quirky hotel - we didn't do breakfast as we thought 20 euros each was expensive - our only thought was that the hairdryer lacked a bit of oomph. I didn't use it but if you have longer hair you may want to bring your own. We'll be back - thanks to everyone for a fabulous stay
title: Great base for a great city

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Just finished a week long stay at the Fashion Hotel and i was most impressed. The room was spotless on arrival and kept that way by housekeeping all week. The reception staff were excellent. Polite and perfect spoken english. Very welcoming and full of information which help us on out trip. The hotel facilities were also excellent. The gym and swimming pool were well maintained and very clean and again kept that way by the cleaning staff.  Access to the center of town was simple using the trams which stopped 5 minutes walf from the hotel. Hop a number 1 or 17 which take you straight to central station.(15 mins ride) Make sure you get an i Amsterdam card as this makes travel and visiting attractions really simple and cheap (look it up). The only negatives were the cost of the breakfast which was 18 euros if booked and 20 on the day. Nice but a bit steep really for what it was (continental/full english buffet) and the cost of drinks in the skybar, whick looked great but we avoided due to the costs. Also avoid getting a room near an ice machine! It makes a lot of noise when filling the metal ice bucket up at midnight! (Who needs ice at midnight!) Room could also do with fridge and not a vending machine like they have. Just a way of making more money im afraid. Despite the negatives they did not spoil our stay at the Fashion Hotel and i would be more than happy to stay again and would recommend others to do the same. Thanks to all the staff for making our staff really nice. Really lovely time had by us both.
title: Superb hotel

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We knew when we booked that we were a tram ride away from the centre of Amsterdam, but the hotel was easily accessible from Schiphol airport in the west of the city. This suited us for our few days stay, as we had a pleasant walk through the Vondelpark to the Museum quarter or could take the 1 or 17 tram, only 5 mins from the hotel, which ran frequently. A charming, quirky hotel (mannequins greet you in the foyer) and breakfast, which was included, was good and varied. Very happy with our choice of hotel, and a truly memorable stay.
title: Good hotel away from the town centre

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We are here as part of a Trafalgar European tour, so the hotel was booked as part of the booking package.What a lovely surprise this hotel is, and this is day one of our trip.I highly recommend anyone to consider this when going to Amsterdam.
title: Great hotel

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The position of the hotel is really good and well served. Rooms are nice and clean and the personnel is kind. Wellness center is ok, gym a bit old. They have parking lot inside and a nice breakfast area.
title: Nice hotel close to the heart of Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Myself and 6 friends had 3 rooms, all spacious, comfortable beds, and the front desk were great in sorting things out for us. We used the pool a lot which was great in the mornings to freshen up, we didn't use the Sky Bar but it's open late and has DJ's on apparently, you can rent bikes cheaply from the hotel but be sure to book in advance as when we tried they had all been booked already.
title: Good Value, Great Location

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great 2 night break with friends in their extra large triple room . Fab stylish room , super comfy beds and plenty of space , relaxing chairs. Great having a separate toilet and wonderful deep bath to soak in . We over looked the courtyard so lovely and quiet. Had fun operating the coffee machine ( They kindly sent us someone to show us ) but apart from that couldn't a thing!
title: stylish hotel

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Westcord fashion hotel was lovely. The staff were very helpful and approachable. The room was really comfortable and well appointed. The only downside of the hotel was the music from the 10th floor. I was travelling with my 11 year old daughter and we were put on the 9th floor. We arrived quite late on the Saturday night and the music was very loud from the Sky bar above. I did consider asking to move but as we were so tired we decided to stay. The music was much quieter on the Sunday and Monday evening. The only big downside was the shuttle bus transfer from and to the airport. The outward journey didn't turn up at all and we had to pay extra for a private taxi. The driver who picked us up for the return journey was very rude and reluctant to take us(even though we had confirmation information with us.
title: Lovely.

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I was a little worried about the location but once we got there, the staff made me feel at ease. We were able to buy a pass for the tram at the hotel's front desk. There is a grocery store with fresh produce a few blocks away, plus a beautiful park even closer!The rooms are very nice, as is the pool and bar.
title: Very helpful staff; great location, rooms and bar

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We loved this hotel - it's got a boutique feel and the location is very convenient for everything. You won't get this type of hotel with decent sized doubles and good 4 star facilities at this price in the centre. We like being away from all the crazy stag-do /red light area action, but it's easy to get to if you want it. Recommend the Happy Bull restaurant for gourmet burgers etc which is just a 15 minute stroll from the hotel. We enjoyed hiring bikes at the hotel and cycling around and through the Vondelpark to the Museum District. Overall, a very good location for a relaxing break for couples. Would definitively return.
title: Stylish hotel at a great price

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Majority of staff excellent, older manager was very moody and unhelpful, 1.6 miles from central station easy access via trams, excellent facilities and views! Would recommend to any couples or people who don't mind walking a little longer to city.
title: Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for 2 nights. Rooms clean, nice coffee machine, big TV and big bed. Hotel is more like 15 20 mins from the centre which put me off, so for that reason I wouldn't stay again. Didn't rate the sky bar either, cocktails wasn't very nice. Front desk staff were helpful.
title: 15 20 mins to centre via tram

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Spent 3 nights at the hotel and my stay was excellent The room was clean and had everything you need free coffee tea toiletries and wifi .Every member of staff was friendly and helpful.The hotel is not in the centre but about 15 - 20 tram ride out but there is a tram stop about 4 - 5 minutes away which has frequent trams into the centre. There is also a train station about 15 minutes walk which has trains to the airport.Swimming pool and changing area was also very clean and pool was warm.Didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the food.
title: Could not fault

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Very nice hotel a bit outside of town centerThe check in was easy and quick, the staff was very helpful.The room had a good size and it was clean.Parking is easy as you can park at the hotel for EUR 25,- pr. day.In regards to breakfast we only had breakfast at the hotel one morning out of the 3 we were staying there. The breakfast is very good and there is plenty of choice.The other two mornings we walked to nearby places to have our breakfast.Location is about 7 minute walk from the tram or metro station. All in all we had a very nice stay.
title: Very good hotel

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: For those who are looking for a full experience of Amsterdam, should NOT consider this hotel. It is a very nice hotel, friendly staff, yet located far from the action. Although the tram is 5 min walk from the hotel, the tram closes at 10pm, the other option to get to the hotel is by taxi which is quite expensive (30€ from the central).The rooms are none smoking, clean. And very smooth accommodation
title: visit to Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is my seventh or eight time staying at this hotel. I love the proximity to the airport, A10, the city, and the park. The staff is wonderful and the breakfast buffet is top notch. The room is very clean and the bed is huge. Short walk to the tram, number 17 and 1. I suggest the 1 for a shorter ride to Dam Square and Central Station.The fitness facility is good enough for a short visit. Elliptical, treadmill and free weights. The pool is sufficient for a short stay.This was the only stay that was someone difficult and it was not the hotel's fault. The A10 highway is shut down for 6 weeks, which means you will have to use side roads to get to the other highways during the week. Depending on where you are going, it can add 15 minutes or more to you commute. If you are taking the tram into the city, no impact.I will be back at this location again next year for my annual visit.
title: Seventh Time and still a Charm

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed for the second time within the year. Wonderful rooms and great swimming pool. Easy transport links to Central areas 15-20mins away on tram lines 1 or 17 and Airport one stop away on the train. Would recommend a stay here and I'll be back again soon.
title: Fantastic Hotel!

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Just back from our first visit to Amsterdam and the Westord fashion hotel,short taxi ride from airport and close to a tram stop for easy access to city centre.Had a nice room on 8th floor at the rear so very quiet large comfy bed with nice bathroom with large separate shower and hand basin and w.c was separate from bathroom which we liked.Coffee maker in room.Good breakfast with lots of variety tea and coffee. Used the restaurant which was nice and nice bar area alas never got round to using the sky bar.Very friendly and helpful staff and would use this hotel again and would recommend.Tram takes about 20 mins from hotel to central station depending on time of day and traffic,easy and cheap to use...all in all a nice city break in a really nice hotel just wished we had stayed longer.
title: First time in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for 3 nights for a hen doThe hotel was lovely The room was spacious and clean and had a great bathroom with separate toilet which was great as we were in a twin roomLittle toiletries were provided and bath towels There was also a coffee machine and facilities to make teaThe sky bar was great with a good selection of drinks and snacks The hotel was just a few mins from the tram stop that took you straight into the centre the hotel sold 1 ,2 and 3 day passes for the tram at a really reasonable price Would definitely recommend here for people to stay
title: Great hotel just outside the city

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: What really impressed me about this hotel was the wonderful staff. From the moment walking in the door they were friendly, attentive and helpful. As we were on our first anniversary which they noted and we later we found chocolates, flowers and a lovely happy anniversary card in our room. They even found us a list of restaurants and then made us a reservation in a local steak house for our anniversary dinner (look out for that review ). The staff do this hotel proud! The hotel it's self was up to standard, the decor was a bit weird but that made no difference. The rooms was lovely with a great shower and bath! Our safe broke, leaving our passports and money trapped inside but the staff were straight on it and it was fixed with a new one installed within hours. Most areas of the hotel are accessed by your room key/tab and this includes the lifts so don't do as my beloved did and forget yours or you may just get stuck in the lift as he did lol. The location of the hotel isn't close to the main square but it is quite easy to get to with a short tram ride but do make sure that you get a travel pass for a few days. The airport is super easy to get to, literally a few stops on the train and then like two stops on the tram. The whole journey took no more than about 30-45mins. We had a spa day within the hotel too and choose to have the couples massage. The atmosphere was as you would expect for a spa however we both had very different experiences of the massage. His was fantastic and mine wasn't bad but it wasn't great! That's just down to the individual therapist. The pool was small, they do a very good job with their online pictures. They also have a sauna, steam room and infra red room. I was greatly impressed, however these comes with an extra €10 cost but that includes robe and slippers if needed. Be warned it's a naked area . Now the sky bar was a great spot for a romantic drink or two but quite small especially if it's busy. This however was the only place within the hotel we thought the staff weren't up to scratch. Overall we would definitely return to this hotel, it met our expectations and exceeded them in some places.
title: Anniversary Getaway

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: First of all, the stay is breath taking. You want to relax - this is the best place to stay.Anne and Stephane are running this restaurant at their best. We came here on a few occasions. Me and my misses were really impressed with the service and the whole experience within the restaurant and bar. All small issues were sorted in a professional and nice manner.Thank you for all of the staff members who made our stay memorable. Regards,Deividas&Ruta
title: 5th time in the hotel and restaurant

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had a really easy check in despite the website saying 3pm, our room was ready as soon as we arrived at 1pm. Friendly staff member gave us maps and explained the tram system and sights to us. Other staff members answered our questions throughout the duration of the stay. The room was nice with a large bed and clean bathroom. Only complaint was quite noisy and you could hear noise from the corridors clearly. The only improvement I'd give would be to provide fridges so that guests can store there own food and drink. The hotel was in a great location. We bought the 3 day pass for both tram and train. The train from the airport was around 10 minutes. We then walked from the station to the hotel which was a 20 minute walk. On our way back we got the tram to the station which was less than 5 minutes. The nearest tram stop was a 5-7 minute walk. Trams were frequent, maximum wait time for us was 8 minutes. There was a few restaurants and supermarkets within 10 minute walks. All in all a great hotel. If I return to Amsterdam I would 100% book here again!
title: Friendly staff, nice rooms, great location.

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Excellent hotel and would thoroughly recommend. Clean spacious room with lovely bathroom and separate toilet.Food and drink very good although we ate out more in the city. Very few restaurants close to the hotel.Excellent sky bar which we used every evening on our return.Lovely spa area and swimming pool.
title: Great hotel positioned close to airport and city centre

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We had 4 nights here recently.It was clean and in a good location.The vibe just didn't work for me. I didn't like the constant runway show on at breakfast nor the music.The rooms were to me just standard normal hotel rooms but as others have said with lovely clean bathrooms.The evening meals were disappointing. The staff, setting and fresh bread were lovely, but the main meals on the 2 nights we ate there were quite ordinary. I couldn't eat my satay chicken and chips. It was really oily and unappetising.Breakfast was very nice though.
title: Pleasant clean hotel.

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I booked the Westcord fashion for my partner's 30th birthday and we weren't disappointed. When we first pulled up to the hotel I was a little concerned about the location being right by a main road and seemingly in the middle of no where, but it was absolutely fine.The hotel is tasteful and spotlessly clean. The staff all friendly and helpful but not intrusive at all. The terrace area is absolutely lovely, as is the Skyy bar at the top of the hotel. I have seen some reviews saying that it's a half an hour walk to anything but this isn't the case at all! The tram stop is about a 5min walk away, and as soon as you get to that there's cafes and restaurants around you. Tram into the centre take 10-20mins depending on where you want to go, which was absolutely fine for us because it's a nice way to see the city. Vondelpark is also an easy walk away.There are only three (relatively minor) bad things we could think of. Firstly, the bathroom door for the shower room is glass. this wasn't a problem for us at all since we're a couple, however I can imagine if you are travelling with friends or family it might be a little awkward! The cleaning staff also come into your room before you have answered, which also could prove a little awkward! The final thing was that we found a dirty pair of socks in our room on the second day, which we are sure were not there before! We just found this funny however it did make us wonder how on earth that could happen!!!The room was so big and bright and wonderfully clean (other than the mystery socks!). The bed was absolutely huge and it was so quiet we slept better than we had in ages. They also have a Nespresso machine to make your coffee which my boyfriend was thrilled with!All in all it's a lovely hotel that we would definitely stay at again :)
title: Lovely, modern hotel

hotelLocation: Hendrikje Stoffelsstraat 1, 1058 GC Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The west cord fashion hotel is fantastic. The rooms are modern and very spacious. The bed is very big and comfortable. Bathroom has a shower and a bath. The staff are lovely and accomodating. The pool area is really nice. The location is not too bad. It's a little out of the way of the main tourist part but it's in a nice area with coffee shops and parks near by. They main part of Amsterdam is easily reached by tram or bike. We walked and it was probably abit too long. My only complaint is that they didn't have enough bikes... we tried three days in a row to hire bikes and they were sold out each time. On our last day I called at 7.30 am and reception said they had 6 bikes. By the time I got down at 8 am they were all gone.
title: Fantastic, Modern, Luxery Hotel

review: This hotel is modern, ultra clean, trendy and has ten chanderliers in the lobby. What more could you ask for? Oh and not to mention the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. I absolutely recommend this hotel for stay in Amsterdam. I booked four rooms for a hen party and the location is fab. It is about a 4 minute walk to the station and for €12 you can get a 48 hour pass which you can use for trams, metro and buses. Grab Tram 4 to city centre, or Metro 51. No changes, just jump on! The hotel has a lovely breakfast too which I recommend is well worth doing, although there is a supermarket round the back of hotel. Italian Restaurant called Happy Italy is right next door for a nice meal too. the hotel staff are very friendly and helpful and everything was so clean and new. My friends also loved the hotel, especially the drinks menu in the bar which was so good for the money. Cocktails for €6 - yes please! the hotel was not in any way rowdy either. Just a lovely big hotel with all you need. I don't want to fault anything as there is no need, but just to let people know, there is not a kettle or tea in the room. The most amazing bed ever makes up for this and the bar in the lobby sells gorgeous coffee for €2.50 so you will be fine. If you are considering booking this hotel - click enter and do it. It is very good.
title: Fantastic hotel with no faults!

review: No wonder this hotel seems to be constantly sold out: it may have the best price-performance ratio in Amsterdam!The hotel is located in Amsterdam Zuid next to the RAI train and underground station, a tram stop (line no. 4) and a bus stop. The ride to the centre takes 15 minutes and trains go frequently. RAI station is only two stops from Schiphol Airport. Our comfort room was sufficiently spacious with two large floor-to-ceiling windows, very comfy bed and the usual Motel One bathroom (now featuring cosmetic tissues, magnifying mirrors will be introduced chain-wide until end of 2017). As always with Motel One there were no closets, just a few hangers and shelves, but that was ok for our three-night stay. The room (417) was very clean so far, but the windows and the upper part of the leather headboard weren't. A very annoying thing: the elevators have just a call button on upper floors, which means you can't indicate if you want to go up or down wthich leads to many unnecessary stops of the already crowded elevators.Breakfast was of high quality with many local Dutch items. As usual with Motel One it was served in the bar lounge area, meaning sitting pretty cramped, sometimes at low lounge table, sometimes on bar stools.That said, we nevertheless enjoyed the stay very much and will happily return as we can't think of a better (affordable) alternative.
title: Probably the best Price-Performance Ratio in Amsterdam

review: Location is not bad. 3 mins from Metro and tram is right outside. Bunch of restaurants behind the hotel which is nice. Hotel rooms were comfortable and quiet. Basic rooms without safe or any extra amenities so not bad but pricey. Based on hotel category rooms should be cheaper. Hotel has 4 star prices for 3 star accommodations
title: Good location, decent hotel, friendly staff. Quiet

review: This hotel is fantastic as it is situated a few metres from the main train station and you can catch the number 4 tram straight i to the city centre. Modern, clean and swanky rooms. The bar and facilities are superb. Will be back again.
title: Fantastic Hotel

review: For what I thought was a budget hotel, this was a very nice surprise. I dropped my bag off earlier in the day and I was immediately impressed. I was expecting an ibis type lobby but this was very plush considering.On arriving back to the hotel at 6am having been dragged to Club Smokey (live music and open until 6am!) by some clients, I was greeted by the lovely Birte and Bart on reception. I'm sure they were only delighted to chat to me for 15mins (I was in jovial form) and when I finally got to my room I was again very surprised. It was a very spacious room with a very comfortable bed (although considering it was 6am, I sure I would have found the ground comfortable) and the was exceptional laid out with absolutle no feel that this was a budget hotel. It also made the short walk to the RAI very easy the next morning considering I may have had a headache!I would highly recommend and I will definitely be back from my next trip to the RAI.
title: Excellent for RAI, super hotel and fantastic staff

review: Lovely hotel - we stayed for a stag weekend. The rooms are great with floor to ceiling windows, the decor in the public areas is really cool, staff were all friendly and the bar is really well stocked with really knowledgeable bartenders (especially Hollywood!). Public transport is really easy and there is a supermarket right next door. Breakfast was nice - fresh fruit and pastries. Best of all was the value - the lads on the stag couldn't believe I'd found them somewhere so nice to be hungover for the price.I'd happily stay here again if I return to the Dam. (Which I will...)
title: Great place to stay

review: Motel one is far from the city centre and top attractions. The central station is very far, top attractions and canals will take you around 15 minutes by the public transportation, staff were rude, no bath available (i.e. Just shower), no iron or British electricity adaptors were given, Rooms were too small, keep your passport and money in safe place as no deposit safe was there, it is simply a motel not 3-stars hotel. I misunderstood the motel facilities due to reviewers comments and I made a wrong decision. If I will be going to Amsterdam again I will go for another option.
title: Unexpected quality for highly rated hotel

review: Lovely room, lovely decorated hotel, even though it is not right in the city centre the public transport is really good there is a tram stop and train station across the road and you can even get a night bus/tram back late at night! The price of this hotel is so good in comparison to other hotels in Amsterdam. I have booked back here for September this year, as it is a weekend I was having a really hard time trying to find something reasonably priced and when I found out this hotel could fit me in I was so pleased, it's defiantly worth paying less and doing the 15 minute tram ride into the city and staying somewhere that's very clean and comfortable for the price! Also the staff are very helpful and helped with all the tram numbers we needed to get! Highly recommend!
title: Excellent!

review: This is a very stylish "motel" in Amsterdam south. The room was spacious and clean, the staff friendly and breakfast good. It does not have english breakfast, but for us it didn't matter. There was plenty of other options. Just 100 meter to metro, tram and train, and 10 minutes by train to the airport. 10 minutes by metro to the city. But note, if you want to stay in a cozy or lively street, this is not it. It is outside the main part of the city, by a main road, and only one restaurant in the area. We felt it was good value for the money, and would stay here again!
title: Motel? More like design hotel

review: Before I arrived I was not sure what to expect. When arrived it took a moment at the lobby to be served but then service was friendly. The rooms are simple andsd small but clean. Also there are plenty plugs and also at th righ place ( wheter you prefr to sit at teh table or on the bed to work on your labtop. This is something you often miss in much more fancy hotels.Breakfast was also good and much better than I was expecting; similar to 4 star hotels.The environment is comfortable and nice.The value for money is very good and for business trips this is a good place to stay, in particolar when you are planning to vitis the convention center.Restaurants are also plenty and good ones close by.Certainly a place that I would choose again for short trips.
title: Nice, clean and rypical Motel One style Hotel with good value for money

review: Two train stops from Schipol and a short walk (5 min) to the hotel.Our room was not huge, and only had one chair, but was clean and the bed was comfy. Great shower as well. There were limited spots to put your clothes, as there are no dressers, only shelves and only 6 clothes hangers. I imagine if you were staying for a longer time, this might become an issue. There is no phone or clock in the room. The clock was no biggie, but no phone seemed odd to us.The reception staff was more than helpful, giving us maps and tips on where to eat.We used the tram (about 20 mins) to get into Amsterdam, and bought a 3 day pass, that was good on the tram. bus and ferries.There are restaurants nearby, about a 10 minute walk, and a grocery store next door.We would stay here again.
title: Good Stay

review: What a lovely gem close to the RAI. Helpful staff, clean with some eclectic touches. Like the fake fireplace!!! Nice breakfast if somewhat steep at €9.50!!! But it was good and tasty. Lovely comfy sofas and chairs in the lobby. The room was compact but well appointed. Lovely bathroom with walk-in shower! Lovely shower but could be more powerful!! Great view from my window overlooking the road and highway but no sound intrusion from the full height, full width window!! Would definitely come back
title: Perfect for the RAI

review: This is the best accommodation we have ever experienced in our 20 years of travel. Location ✅staff friendliness and knowledge ✅cleanliness ✅bed comfort ✅bathroom facilities ✅furnishings ✅breakfast ✅. I can't speak more highly of this place. We had room 102 and a view overlooking the canal. Our room was stylish and very modern. Quite large and spacious and. The bathroom newly renovated with Ritual bath amenities. The staff are so helpful and friendly and we are a Tram or 5 min walk to Main Street. Ann Frank house is a Tram or 20min walk. Close to everything. I highly recommend staying here over. Any 5 star hotel.
title: The Best Ever

review: Our extended family recently stayed for 3 nights in 4 rooms at the 377 House. Everything about our experience was fantastic. The rooms were spacious, with great canal views and coffee, soft drinks and snacks included. The location was ideal, within walking distance of Vondel Park, the museum district and the Leidesplein neighborhood. The front desk staff (Garvey and Joanna) were exceedingly friendly and helpful with directions, reservations, bike rental, and helped direct an ill family member to nearby medical assistance. The breakfast was superb, consisting of eggs cooked to order, freshly made mini Dutch pancakes (poffertjes) and great coffee. We wholeheartedly recommend No. 377 House, and would stay here again without hesitation.
title: Spacious rooms, friendly staff, wonderful breakfast, great location!

review: The staff was friendly and very helpful. Our room was clean, elegantly decorated and we loved having a big window overlooking the street and canal. Getting free bikes the first day was lots of fun. We'd definitely come back!
title: Excellent!

review: I couldn't rate this hotel enough! i booked our visit as a little romantic trip for me and my husband, and I used a 3rd party online booking site to book our room. Pre-arrival contact was very courteous and helpful, as on initial booking, the site informed me that i would be getting a ground floor room. I contacted the hotel to request an room on an upper level with a balcony to get a bit of a view, and I had asked for a couple of extra little romantic decorations in the room and champagne to make arrival that little bit sweeter, and they certainly delivered.Travel from Schiphol Airport to Centraal Station was really easy on the train, this took about half hour, and we decided to walk to the hotel to get a bearing on the areas as we only had handluggage, this took half an hour, but there are buses and trams which will get you there faster. Centraal is busy and a little hectic, but as we got nearer to the hotel it quietened down alot. The hotel is situated in the Oud-West area, right on the outer canal ring and our room overlooked the street and waters edge through a little french balcony. Location wise, it was great. Though we were on a semi busy road, the area was tranquil and calm, and very pretty. Garvey checked us in and one other staff member out, both were really friendly and helpful. He hinted that we had got an upper floor room and our little requests, and when we walked it it was a lovely surprise. They had decorated the bed with rose petals and provided a little bottle of chilled prosecco with two glasses and chocolates. Not sure if this is for all guests, but our tea, coffee, and fridge contents in the room was complimentary for our stay, which was really generous.The room was clean, spacious, bright and luxurious, we were both very pleased with it. Bed was enormous and very comfortable. There was an aircon to make things a bit more comfortable on hot nights. Bathroom shower was spacious and pressure was spot on. Curtains totally blocked out the light for sleeping in.Travel into the main city was easy, the hotel is very well located for easy access to boat trips along the canal, trams, and buses from Leidseplein (literally a 10 min walk). Where you can find tons of restaurants, shops, and cafes. Its 10 mins from Vondelpark, and Oud-Zuid the museum district.Tips for places we enjoyed were the Carousel for breaky (waffles and pancakes), the canel cruise which you can book and board about 5 mins from the hotel. Pub Aran and Hardrock Cafe are just opposite the canal cruise booking office/port, if you are early go here for a quick beer or coffee, and overlook the waterway. Stop at the hundreds of cafe's by the canals to people watch and take in the city ambiance, we did at dozens and was extra fun in red light district. Visit a street foodies dream at the Foodhallen (like a posh Borough market), Artis Zoo for a never ending labyrinth of animals and gardens and the interactive Micropia exhibition, then go to the Amsterdam Borrl Kitchen just opposite for burger. Amsterdam tulip museum for gifts to bring back home (America friendly exports too). Make sure you see the city at night, go to Rijksmuseum at night for extra cool pictures of the IAmsterdam sign. There's tons of places to discover and explore, dont take the trams everywhere, walk if you can. get a travel card at Centraal for easy city travel, if your planning on seeing lots of museums and exhibitions and have the time and a plan, get the IAmsterdam card.
title: Everything was perfect!

review: Super hotel, super stay. Location was very central,(5 mins to the beautiful Vondelpark) and easy walking distance from most of the main attractions.Lovely room with balcony. Great breakfast and very large comfy bed.Staff were friendly and helpful.Free bicycle hire for one day was a great touch and enabled us to explore the city like locals.We then paid to keep the bikes for the rest of our stay.When we return to Amsterdam we'll definitely stay here again.This is a small boutique hotel so it doesn't have a lobby or a bar area. This wasn't a problem for us as there are loads of bars and restaurants close by but it could be an issue for some.
title: Super Hotel, great location, good breakfast

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The Art'otel is a great, comfortable, and well located hotel. We first stayed one year ago and came back again. The location works well for trains to the airport and most good restaurants are within walking or convenient tram connections. When we stayed in 2016 we had a minor problem at check-in and management resolved it immediately and gave us upgrades on our return visit. Thanks. Great hotel, staff and service. Breakfast is plentiful and well prepared. Loved it and we will be back in 2018.
title: Second Stay and we'll be back again

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great location, trendy hotel, spacious clean rooms, ... they have got it all.We had a room on the second floor facing the train station and the room was surprisingly dark and quiet during the night.Quality breakfast, nice bar, friendly staff, ...I've been searching for a remark, but, no, nothing. This is how it's done ! It was a great weekend.
title: Friendly pro's

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at the Artotel July 19 to 23 2017 From Reception to 5&33 to Housekeeping to Conceige to the Doorman - the team is helpful, friendly & efficient. They are Charlotte, Kitti, Cameron, Niam, Domenico, Thomas, Brian. Compliments to the Chef and team for the delicious breakfast and dinner we had at 5&33. Please convey our gratitude to the team for making our stay a very pleasant and comfortable one. YenSingapore
title: EXCELLENT TEAM

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Most comfortable by any means, very nice staff, young dynamic atmosphere, very modern design with great attention to details, high level of accessories and facilities. the location of walking distance from the central train station, even with suitcase, and walking distance from the Dam square and its surrounding is great.
title: Top location, Atmosphare & Design

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: If you value your privacy, make sure you ask for a room with a bathroom door. We asked for a quiet room. When we checked in, we were given an inside room which I’m sure would have been quiet but much to our surprise it had no door on the bathroom. It never occurred to me to ask for room that had a bathroom door. I can’t believe that anyone actually would want such a room. Staff was very nice and they agreed to move us to a room with a bathroom door. But that room overlooked the street which was very noisy. We were embarrassed to ask for another change in rooms. I’m sure the hotel is very nice and staff is certainly very nice but our experience with the bathroom door and noisy room clouded our whole experience.
title: door

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Fantastic Hotel! Good environmental. Fantastic team! Very good facilities. Perfect location in the city. The breakfast is fantastic and the quality of service is perfect! Fitness and spa area are very good as well. I would be back for sure!
title: Excellent option in Amsterdam

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Everything you need - Perfect Location, centre of city and near railway station. Friendly, Welcoming, Helpful Staff. Rooms - perfect temperature, all comforts - kitchette with proper coffee maker and refrigerator. The bathroom is stocked with hairdryer and most toiletries. There was also a large bottle of water with glasses provided upon arrival in room. And every night when the housekeepers turned down the beds they left little gifts of toiletries on bed.
title: Best First Stay. Happy to recommend to others.

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed for two nights, amazing hotel. Perfect location in the city centre, and the staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Rooms were well equipped and the free wifi worked really well. Breakfast was delicious with a variety of foods prepared to order, as well as a small buffet. The gym was adequate, and the pool was cold but nice! Only slight downside was the shower flooded the whole bathroom so you got wet feet every time you used the toilet!
title: Fantastic stau

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is hip and trendy -- definitely a quirky hotel for someone who enjoys having an experience that is a different from a regular, corporate, cookie-cutter hotel. From the moment you enter the hotel, you feel taken care of. Our check-in process went smoothly and since it was our wedding anniversary and we booked through Expedia with VIP+ privileges, they upgraded our room and sent up two glasses of champagne. The location is excellent if you're looking to hop on the train (across the street). You can also catch a direct train to the the airport. Just be careful to purchase the correct ticket (look for the yellow machines and be careful not click on bus ticket)The night manager, Ivar Croes, was especially helpful. One evening after exploring this beautiful city, he welcomed us back to the hotel and was kind enough to give us a personal tour of the hotel including the art exhibit. He took providing excellent customer service to another level!Needless to say, we will be back soon!!!
title: Excellent customer service

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great hotel! Great location! Great staff! Awesome vibe and the art is incredible all over!!The rooms are so comfy and unique and have all the touches you expect at a top quality hotel!!! Love the touches at the turn down service!!We had a great view and no noise!!!!Love that the glass between the bedroom and bathroom that can frost for privacy when you want it!!!Every finish and detail is unique! The breakfast in the mornings was delicious and elegant!The location of the hotel to central station and all the tram stops makes it absolutely perfect!!!There is a wonderful espresso machine in the room that I took full advantage of!!!We can't wait to come back to one of our favorite cities and stay here again!!
title: Fantastic!!

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Our stay at Art'Otel Amsterdam was very comfortable..cost was reasonable, rooms very spacious and the service excellent and the location of the hotel is ideal...will surly consider staying there again for our next trip.
title: Art'Otel

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stayed here for 2 nights before embarking on a river cruise and can highly recommend the hotel. Check in was smooth, room was great, free crisps and nuts but beware the fridge and don't move any of the bottles or you will be charged - they did leave a tiny space for your own goodies though. Thought the peekaboo lights in the bathroom were cute but would probably have appreciated them more 30 odd years ago. Right now we would have preferred a night light - if there was one in our room it wasn't working. We had a quiet room with a small window and a view over the sperm art installation. This was perfect, we had jet lag, we slept. Breakfast was superb, lots of choice and serves not too big though you could still eat as much as you wanted of course. No issues with any of the staff, they all performed as you would expect. My only complaint - very expensive!!
title: Perfect location, marvellous breakfast

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This is swanky, modern, trendy and has the best staff in Amsterdam!Really enjoyed a 4 night stay here and we were very well looked after. The reception staff were brilliant and set the tone of the whole hotel - friendly, efficient and fun!Try the restaurant as well which is very good. Outstanding staff!! Well done Miguel
title: What a great hotel in city centre!

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Stay here on a recent trip to Amsterdam to catch a gig at the Amsterdam ArenA. Hotel is right across the road from central station and close to any of the main attractions around. Staff are friendly from the reception, bar and restaurant who all made sure we had a great stay. Decor through out the hotel is modern and comfortable with lots of expensive furnishings and gallery work. Rooms are comfortable with all mod cons. Nice little touches such as pillow spray and wake up balm. We had breakfast included in our rate and both mornings we had an enjoyable breakfast which seemed to be pretty relaxed compared to a lot of hotels in the morning when it comes to the Buffett. Fitness area gym is good. The spa looks a bit of a mess and afterthought, certainly not anywhere near the standard of other 5 star hotels I have stayed at. Staff lying around reading books, with top off relaxing with dirty laundry piled up in the corner. It can get noisy at night with DJ's playing in the bars when you are trying to sleep. I didn't mind this but it's something to bare in mind if you are wanting a quieter hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here. Thanks Art'otel.
title: Great Hotel

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I can't find words to describe the Art'otel! The decor is sooo modern and funky. The staff are amazing, the location is right in the middle of town: facing the central station and without the noise! Their breakfast spread is very good and it has shops and restaurants/ bars all around. The sex museum and red light district are just a short walk away. There is a very long street with lots of shops just behind the hotel. I definitely recommend the hotel!
title: Outstanding Hotel

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We stayed at the Art'otel for four nights and it was one of the best hotel experiences.First it is right across from central station and the main tram interchange (5 minutes walk).The hotel is in an old bank building and the contrast between the classic 19C facade of the building and the modern interior makes for an amazing effect. There is something special about this hotel with the interior filled with wonderful pieces of modern art and sculpture. A word of warning, the rooms are purposely dark so the lighting is a key part of each room in itself having an expression. We loved it. The room was very comfortable and there was ample robe space for the two of us. Bathroom was also charming with the use of mirrors and light to create a feeling of space.The staff were unbelievably helpful and attentive. We received a complementary bottle of wine on two occasions when we dined in the hotel restaurant. This was a first for us!The food in restaurant at both breakfast and dinner was very tasty indeed. The dinner menu is a mix of small, medium and large plates to be shared. We had the zucchini fries and duck as a medium entree and shared the sirloin on one night and the lamb on the second night. Both were beautiful.This was one of the best hotels we have stayed in and have no hesitation to recommend it highly for design, location value and service.
title: Do Yourself A Favour And Stay Here

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: I've reviewed quite a lot of hotels..Artotel was in an amazing location but that was also why it was ruined. The hotel room we had was on the 4th floor in front of the main train station. The thuds from the track got in easily and the bells as well. Room service was excellent. The cleaning service hotel services check-in and check out were average.To summarize.. if you want to sleep and not pay with an arm and a foot go elsewhere. Rooms are small including the junior suite. Wouldn't recommend this or do it to myself again. Price is the defining factor as all the neighbouring hotels charge less or the same for a quieter experience..
title: Average hotel.. Average everything tbh..

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: This hotel is in a strategic location just across the main train station. The brilliant harmony between the interior redecoration and the theme of art sculptures is mind blowing. This is evident even in the finest detail such as the carpet design. The theme has to do with "the evolution of life" with its daunting lessons we all come to realize. Being able to achieve such a powerful design impact on the inside while preserving the exterior shell of the historic building is a fantastic work of art. This is on top of the friendly hospitality, fine dining and comfortable lavish rooms.
title: Art gallery hotel fusion

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Located directly across from Central Station we expected noise and chaos. While hectic our room was relatively quiet, comfortable, well designed with a nice bed. The staff proved to be super helpful and patient. They were excellent...The breakfast was excellent. Expresso drinks, cooked to order eggs, fresh squeezed juices, sumptuous baked goods, hearty cured meats. I would value it at 25 euros.We will return...
title: "Attentive Staff, excellent breakfast, well located, a positive experience..."

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Left here earlier today after 2 days in Amsterdam, the staff are some of the best we have ever come across, from the guys on reception to the morning waiters and the evening bar staff every single one of them deserves credit for their efforts in making me and my wife feel welcome, we will be back next summer and will only come to this hotel, the location is perfect aswell bang opposite the main station, 1 tip is we didn't need the cleaners coming 4 times a day to sort our room tho this is much appreciatedAwesome work
title: Excellent Friendly Staff

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Perfect location, very slick. Breakfast is wonderful and spa is a brilliant bonus (pool is open 24hrs!) Interiors all inspired by art.Functional and polished. Great for bunisess.My only super small gripe is that there's a chance of feeling a bit clinical
title: Great location. Cool interiors.

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: and for the location : convenient as, even I, couldn't get lost. But very unpleasant as it s a madhouse (my husband's word) : bunch of trams and buses and bikes, herds of tourists as soon as u step out the hotel.
title: not really a five stars

hotelLocation: Prins Hendrikkade 33, 1012 TM Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: The hotel is virtually right across from the main station, which is a plus. We found the hotel a walk for most things we wanted to do , but not a overly taxing distance. The staff was helpful, pleasant, knowledgeable and had very good recommendations on restaurants in the area. Not a terrific value, but not certainly not bad. Very clean and meticulously kept hotel. Certainly not a bad decision to stay. Seems many rooms lack much of a view.
title: Great location for train arrival, great staff, nice room, good breakfast.

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: We spent three nights in Amsterdam at this hotel it was wonderful , they gave us some extra courtesies for being on a honeymoon, the breakfast was wonderful. And the staff was very helpful. It was very clean and well-maintained
title: Pleasant small B and B

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Great team - very professional but at least this weekend with fun personalities and a quirky sense of humour! Location is perfect, very central, convenient for trams and buses but quiet, charming and an easy to walk to key sights, restaurants and bars. Rooms are nice, modern and not bad size, beds are comfy. The only negative was the wash basin outside the bathroom. Breakfast was fairly common for European hotels and not bad value after discounts, the honour bar and vibe in the small but cosy reception area is a nice plus!
title: Lovely small hotel with a cheeky quirky team!

hotelLocation: Jan Luijkenstraat 76, 1071 CT Amsterdam, The Netherlands
review: Hotel is in a great location and the food at the hotel is really yummy. The waiter is the chef, cook & dishwasher the 2 nights we stayed and did an awesome job. We felt the food prices were reasonable for a hotel. The lobby staff are friendly, but seemed new. My only complaint was we arrived a little early and were told we could leave our luggage in the lobby until our rooms were ready. But the luggage would not be secure. Then the desk person said if we paid $50 extra for the room, 1 room could be ready. We were tired so we agreed, then miraculously both our rooms were ready. Later that night I spoke to a manager about this and was told the fee was for early check in. Not happy about that. Rooms were spacious for Europe, and beds comfy. Towels had a dusty smell to them.
